column2: ['My overall experience at PPAS was interesting, to say the least. It is a performing arts school, so our art is the main focus. However, that comes at the price of education. Multiple times I have felt behind all my peers at other schools because of the lack of resources used for education and college readiness. The school environment and teachers are amazing, contrastingly, because of the fun space PPAS provides.', 'My experience at Professional Performing Arts school was absolutely amazing. The programs here have transformed me into an artist and student who is inspired everyday by my peers. The only aspect I would change would be the small selection of AP and elective classes offered.', 'I enjoyed going to school there I love my teachers and I’m in the Dance program where I want to be Ailey I want to dance in there company one day', 'PPAS is a great school for the performing arts only! Do not come here if you don’t want to pursue a career in the arts. Students here come from different backgrounds and cultures which is a plus; however the school lacks in providing resources  and college prep for students. They do not prepare students for the real world at all..', "This is school opens doors for many opportunities for students who added this school. The student's involvement in this school is incredible. It just sucks that there aren't any sports for students to participate in.", 'It’s easy to make friends and it’s a very liberal and safe environment for everyone. Students embrace being different.', 'What I liked about PPAS was that it was in the city. I got to experience something new at ayoung age where most high school students got to their disrect school. This is also an arts school, my major is dance and its assosiated with the Alvin Ailey dance school. Going there every day for four years and dancing for 3 hours was hard, but it taought me discipline, patience and to take advatage of the resorces given to me. i would trade my experience at this school for anything and i would recomend the dance program for any future students.', 'This school is a great stepping stone for anyone who would like to do anything in the performing arts. Not only will you be given the opportunity to grow you will also be able to network.', 'The Professional Performing Arts School is located in the heart of New York City.  The student body is diverse with students from all five boroughs of NYC of different races, ethnicity and socio-economic status.  Students are also in one of four majors: dance, drama, musical theater or vocal.  The student body is relatively small compared to some high schools but is huge in student engagement.  My high school is buzzing with enthusiastic students and teachers every day.', 'Professional Performing Arts School was the best experience for me. I loved every second of attending that school and I am so sad to be leaving. The teachers are all amazing people. Everyone knows everyone because it is a very small community which I appreciate. The people there are also amazing and they opened my eyes to what the world really was. I changed so much in that school, all for the better, and I couldn’t ask for anything more.', 'Academically speaking the school does not have a very good tract rate. The teachers and staff do care about the kids and do what they can. The parent coordinator is very approachable and is always eager to help parents and students.  My only problem with the school is the academics.', 'Professional performing arts school is great school for performing arts like dance ,drama ,musical theater,and vocal', 'I am currently a senior at PPAS. For me personally it’s a great environment with a lot of nice people always willing to lend a hand when needed and it is very easy for you to make friends. I would say that the school is very accepting, talented, and very supportive. We roll as a team and it’s small enough for students to actually be known by name. It’s a lot of hard work especially being in a school that is dedicated to the arts. I recommend incoming students to really figure out if performing is the right thing for them because PPAS is fully committed to making sure you have all the tools you need to shine on stage.', 'Professional Performing Arts School shapes kids who want to enter into the performance lifestyle. If this is not something you want for your child, do not have them go there. If you want them to pursue the arts, this is the place.', 'My experience at Professional Performing arts school was an experience I will never forget. I always knew I wanted to be an actress. This school has helped me a lot with my self confidence. I gained a lot of self respect for myself and for my peers.', 'I like that the school is very creative and allows the students a lot of freedom when it comes to projects, performing art collaboration projects, and just in general. I wish there was better communication between parents and the school as well as more cleanliness.', 'The performing arts classes were well taught by people who are active in the performance industry. The regular academics are not great but some of the teachers genuinely want you to learn the material. The newer teachers are better but the older ones know what to teach based on the tests.', "This school focuses on second rate performance and no academics whatsoever. There was an article in the NY Post August 2016 exposing this and applications to the school have dropped sharply ever since. I only wish I'd seen an article like that prior to my child attending. I've had to supplement their lack of curriculum with a ton of online and outside classes so that they will hopefully get accepted to a university I've heard of!", 'I love that the school cares about building a community whether it’s students with other students, teachers with with other teachers students and teachers. Although the school does need to work on listening to everyone’s issues and resolving them properly and efficiently.', 'As a current student at PPAS I would like to see a little more effort put into the well being of the school.']

column6: ["For any child who wishes to have a successful career in the performing arts, PPAS goes above and beyond in making sure that the childs' needs are met. Being a PPAS student for four years has given me not only professional training in my field, but also an endless amount of opportunities that have strengthened my performance skills and career readiness.", "My overall experience was ok.  Some ugly racial incidents have occurred over the past few years.  I've felt pretty safe and the security officers were nice.", 'For the past four years, I’ve been lucky enough to attend the Professional Perforning Arts School. Sure the school has its flaws (as does any school), but I’m so happy I chose to go here. As a vocal major, I get so many amazing opportunities to perform at venues like Lincoln Center and UNICEF. I’ve gained so many incredible experiences that I wouldn’t have gotten anywhere else. But the best part about going to PPAS is the diversity and the people. Although ppas is really small school, there are people from so many different backgrounds. No other school I know of can say that. I have a big appreciation for the fact that we’re all under one roof together however are very different.', "PPAS's programs are subpar if you plan to have a career in the entertainment world. If you plan on doing anything I wouldn't suggest coming here. But if you do find yourself here you can still take key components from your lessons to apply them to your everyday life such as patience and time management.", "good  experience for those who want to pursue a performing arts career. need more extra activities for people who don't want to pursue a performing arts career. communication between principal and kids is not too strong. He does not sympathize with student. Most teachers are very helpful and attend to the kids needs", 'I wish the environment would be more supportive. All of the students who were admitted to the school had to go through the audition process. Once you get in the teachers would always put all the kids down. Instead of giving constructive criticism and helping them figure out what the student can do to be better, the student is blamed and is yelled at by the teacher. I like the students in the school we all try to make it a better place. I liked all the teachers I have had throughout my four years. Some were tough but generally I did learn a lot academically.', 'PPAS is a school filled with creativity and art. People are nothing but supportive. I could not have asked for a better high school experiance.', "Attending the Professional Performing Arts School has allowed me to grow in my artistry and learn how to become a successful worker in my chosen field. As a singer, I believe this school has given me many opportunities that I know I wouldn't have been able to have without them. Such opportunities include singing at Lincoln Center and having select performances at the United Nations. Overall, I think that there is no other school that can compare to PPAS in terms of preparing young artists in the performing arts world.", 'I love the shows. I wish there was better communication between academic and performing art teachers.', 'I moved to New York when I was thirteen to attend a boarding school for dance near Lincoln Center. After being there for a year I was old enough to attend high school and decided to attend the Professional Performing Arts School in Midtown. After being with this school for four years I came to appreciate all of the diversity and culture that was brought together by students from all reaches of life. From Drama and Musical Theater students coming from Brooklyn and Queens to Dance and Orchestra students coming from the Bronx, Manhattan, and even as far as Japan, there was a lot to soak in. At first the feel of the school was a bit jarring but after adjusting to a different lifestyle I learned to love it and will always cherish my time with the Professional Performing Arts School.', 'I like how focused the school is with performing arts and preparing the students for a musical future.', "I have met some of the most amazing people I will ever meet in my life at this school. However, in terms of college preparation, more could be done to help students in their process. The faculty is amazing in terms of being there for students when they need them, and have unique ways of approaching the needs of each student. I'm thankful for the last 4 years of my life, and have PPAS to thank for the next steps in my future.", "I'm proud to go to PPAS! My academic teachers are (for the most part at least) very knowledgeable and understanding. I've always felt safe at school and very at home. The school gives high school students a unique chance to start developing their art, and gives its students a very high caliber performing arts experience that you really won't find at most other schools. Most students graduate and go on to either a conservatory, or they do work professionally. Also, I think in general what makes up any school is its students. One of the reasons I love PPAS is because of the people. Everyone is so nice, fun, and personable (not to mention very talented too). Of course you have people who are basically jerks, but you really can't escape that in high school. I really feel like I've found my people here, and that's something that's so important in high school.", 'Its truly a great school. Teachers will help and make sure you do your best, along with performing arts teachers who help you grow in the field you are hoping to pursue. A family environment.', "I love this school. I love the people and the faculty is amazing. I went here for middle school, so think about it, by the time I graduate I will have 7 years of intensive arts training. That's basically a masters degree.Also, we are LEAPS AND BOUNDS better than LaGuardia", "I love the school! Not only have I found myself artistically, but I've grown as a person mentally as well!", "Compared to other school there aren't many classes take except for the mandatory ones and a few extra classes", "There aren't many after school activities but the activities that we do have are pretty good", "The overall school is experience its good. No school is perfect so there are a few things that I don't necessarily agree with. But I'm satisfied with my high school decision making", "The teachers are pretty great. When someone is NEED of help the teachers do everything to help that student out whether it's at lunch or after school"]

column2: ['It was okay, could’ve been much better but you play the cards you’re dealt with. They could teach the faculty to be more mindful of how they deal with the students, and treat them like the maturing young adults they will soon become instead of treating them like babies.', "Certain classes have showed me what I am interested in studying in college and what I am not interested in. What I did not like was how Monmouth ran some of their classes. Each year I felt like about half of my classes was me teaching myself the information because the teacher had failed to teach it correctly or failed to help me when I was completely lost. They packed everything into our lunch time thus instead of eating I would have to cram in time for studying and learning or going to clubs. Monmouth's clubs were amazing. They did many fundraisers for people in need and for themselves and were always successful. The Sports teams do not have the coaches with the most knowledge but my teammates along with myself could always find  way to make the best of it even when we have never had a winning season. Monmouth may have been the best years and I have had some good times, but I cannot wait to graduate and move on to a higher level of education and a new style of learning.", "I think the teachers there care a lot about the kids. Their salaries aren't the best, but they choose to be there for the students who often happened to be from unfortunate living situations. In that sense, kids are forced to care more about their futures, and these teachers are able to suppor them in that way.", 'I’ve enjoyed my time at the school so far. Some teachers are ok but most are pretty good and involved. You get what you put into it and it’s a diverse group.', 'It was an okay school to attend. They have a lot of clubs and activities to get involved in and the teachers seem to really care about each students. They also offer the opportunity for students to go to vocational schools and work on other skills like cooking or auto mechanics.', 'I would to see the cockroach infestation removed, the drug epidemic resolved, the students more friendly. The teachers are very nice and lively.', 'There were good teachers, especially the AP teachers. They prepared me well with how to learn to manage time and homework. The school needs to improve on air conditioning. It gets hot in the upstair classrooms.', 'Teachers are the worst part about the school and only the science teachers are good. If you are not in honors classes freshmen year there is absolutely no chance of you getting into honors classes later on. The school is extremely dirty and the money that goes to the school gets put into terrible sports programs were the coaches treat there members terribly. The school needs to be torn down and completely replaced it’s absolutely the worst place to send your child. It’s understandable why the teachers are so bad because they are paid so low lowest paying high school for core parts of learning and it reflects greatly in the students.', 'Monmouth Regional is located in a safe community. For the most part, the teachers truly care about their students and want to see them move forward however there are some teachers who put their personal feelings above what is right. I had a guidance counselor who was a minority and being a minority myself it was great to see someone who looked like me and wanted me to do well in school.', "My experience at Monmouth Regional High School was different and life changing. Throughout high school I learned many things and developed as a person. The sport teams aren't that great besides baseball. Being on the wrestling team allowed me to develop my character and transformed me into the man I am today. The facility is ok and kind of outdated. It is not the best but not terrible compared to some other schools. Most of the teachers are nice and understanding if you give them respect. I feel that the education here has somewhat prepared me for college. I feel Monmouth Regional is a school that is only improving and on the rise in a positive direction.", 'My experience was fun there was never a dull day In the life of being a Monmouth regional students I would recommend that people send their children here the school has great opportunities and many councilors and case managers that care about the students and omg do not get me started on the teachers they are just fantastic more caring kind hearted people I have ever met in my life they care about you they make sure you succeed they truly live up to the no child left behind act. then there’s the principal and the vice principal they are the best staff of principals in the history of principal if you have a problem they will fix it if your in need amid assistance with eating lunch and you have no money they will help you because that’s just how much they really and truly care', 'My experience at Monmouth Regional was the most stereotypical TV highschool life ever. From the different groups of kids to the bad school lunches Monmouth Regional had me from the start', "My experience at Monmouth Regional helped me grow in lots of areas, however the education I received was a bit lackluster. There were many incidents with teachers throughout my four years, including a math teacher who taught us nothing for about four months. Overall the experience allowed me to mature greatly and I'll look back at these years as good ones.", 'My experience at Monmouth regional has been great. the school has a great lunch program, very pleasant and motivating teachers and a wonderful staff. teachers and faculty really care about your education and will look after you until the day you graduate.', 'i love how the teachers are always helping students. If you are sitting in class while doing classwork they come up to you and make sure you know what you are doing and will explain it to you. Most of the teachers show up to the sport events and bring their kids. The school building itself could use some work, but they are working on it. They are getting turf football,soccer and field hockey fields, lights for night games and more a/c. Last year we all got new lockers.', "I transferred to Monmouth Regional my Sophomore year. The school is great with helping and supporting the students. Fundraiser are always scheduled so student don't have to pay for events when families are having difficult time supporting the kids. the only thing i would change about the school is central air. During the summer the windows are open and i have very bad allergies,", 'I really liked the environment of the school and the experiences I gained from attending. The teachers are there to help when needed and are happy to do so. The counselors are able to assist in the college prep and make it less stressful.', 'As a senior at Monmouth Regional High School, I would say my experience has been very unique and interesting. I am a very involved student: In clubs, sports, and other school involved activities. Though Monmouth is not the most perfect high school it is definitely an above average public high school. The faculty at Monmouth put all of their effort in to making us a safer and better high school all around throughout each school year. Monmouth Regional definitely could improve cleanliness and organization wise.', 'My experience at Monmouth Regional High School was mediocre at best. A few teachers were phenomenal, and I will forever remember them for helping me pave a path into the future. However, Monmouth has caused a few great griefs for me, and I am happy to be graduating.', 'My experience at Monmouth Regional High School was overall a good experience. The school is very diverse.']

It is not the best but not terrible compared to some other schools. Most of the teachers are nice and understanding if you give them respect. I feel that the education here has somewhat prepared me for college. I feel Monmouth Regional is a school that is only improving and on the rise in a positive direction.", 'My experience was fun there was never a dull day In the life of being a Monmouth regional students I would recommend that people send their children here the school has great opportunities and many councilors and case managers that care about the students and omg do not get me started on the teachers they are just fantastic more caring kind hearted people I have ever met in my life they care about you they make sure you succeed they truly live up to the no child left behind act. then there’s the principal and the vice principal they are the best staff of principals in the history of principal if you have a problem they will fix it if your in need amid assistance with eating lunch and you have no money they will help you because that’s just how much they really and truly care', 'My experience at Monmouth Regional was the most stereotypical TV highschool life ever. From the different groups of kids to the bad school lunches Monmouth Regional had me from the start', "My experience at Monmouth Regional helped me grow in lots of areas, however the education I received was a bit lackluster. There were many incidents with teachers throughout my four years, including a math teacher who taught us nothing for about four months. Overall the experience allowed me to mature greatly and I'll look back at these years as good ones.", 'My experience at Monmouth regional has been great. the school has a great lunch program, very pleasant and motivating teachers and a wonderful staff. teachers and faculty really care about your education and will look after you until the day you graduate.', 'i love how the teachers are always helping students. If you are sitting in class while doing classwork they come up to you and make sure you know what you are doing and will explain it to you. Most of the teachers show up to the sport events and bring their kids. The school building itself could use some work, but they are working on it. They are getting turf football,soccer and field hockey fields, lights for night games and more a/c. Last year we all got new lockers.', "I transferred to Monmouth Regional my Sophomore year. The school is great with helping and supporting the students. Fundraiser are always scheduled so student don't have to pay for events when families are having difficult time supporting the kids. the only thing i would change about the school is central air. During the summer the windows are open and i have very bad allergies,", 'I really liked the environment of the school and the experiences I gained from attending. The teachers are there to help when needed and are happy to do so. The counselors are able to assist in the college prep and make it less stressful.', 'As a senior at Monmouth Regional High School, I would say my experience has been very unique and interesting. I am a very involved student: In clubs, sports, and other school involved activities. Though Monmouth is not the most perfect high school it is definitely an above average public high school. The faculty at Monmouth put all of their effort in to making us a safer and better high school all around throughout each school year. Monmouth Regional definitely could improve cleanliness and organization wise.', 'My experience at Monmouth Regional High School was mediocre at best. A few teachers were phenomenal, and I will forever remember them for helping me pave a path into the future. However, Monmouth has caused a few great griefs for me, and I am happy to be graduating.', 'My experience at Monmouth Regional High School was overall a good experience. The school is very diverse.']
column6: ['What i like about the school was the good teachers and faculty. If i can change anything maybe the safety there were always fights and maybe better lunches', 'There are many opportunities for one to excel, but I wish there was even MORE available. Many clubs and activities are available for people to explore what they enjoy as well as new things.', 'I transferred here in 2014. The academics are good but as for student body and life it is not. The students are mean to each other and one “teacher” is very overprotective and isn’t even apart of administration.', "Overall Monmouth Regional is a good school. It needs a really big facelift   though because it's a little broken down especially the bathrooms, they're very old and outdated. Having lights put up at the football field would be great so we could enjoy Friday night games at home like most of the other schools in our area. The food leaves a little too be desired. The teachers are good and helpful when they want to be. The office staff is very nice so that's a plus!", "There are some awesome teachers there who aren't a stickler but maintain order , which is in my opinion key to connecting with high school students. And so, students enjoy their class better, more awake, and more active inside classrooms.", 'The school was not very official. The teachers were mediocre. The one good thing about Monmouth Regional was the diversity of the school. Other than that it lacks the ability to prepare students for college.', 'I have liked Monmouth regional. If you get yourself involved in sports and the many clubs it keeps you busy. I was worried about the academics but I have taken honors and ap courses and find them challenging and for the most part meeting expectations.', "Monmouth Regional is a lot better than I expected going into the year. It has great diversity and student life especially the clubs that they offer. The safety of the school could be a little more only having one police officer but during fights it is always teachers getting in the middle to break it up. Also, they could possibly use classroom phones because the class intercom isn't the greatest and can't get help quickly. But the teachers and the academics are great, you just have to take the right classes like honors to get the better classes to exceed more in college and life.", 'Great and caring staff, they cared about all their students. Offered plenty of sports and clubs so every student would feel at home.', 'What I liked about Monmouth was that as long as you tried to succeed you would get places. There were many clubs and activities to choose from and anyone could join them. I would like to see the sports in Monmouth Regional get new gear and better playing fields.', 'I disliked high school very much.  curriculum seemed relatively challenging but the social aspect of the school was terrible.', 'Overall a quality public school. Lots of opportunities for scholastic and extra curricular advancement. Honors and AP programs are up to par.', 'Most teachers get complaints by the way they teach, but as students grades start dropping teachers stay with recommendations. As fights happen 1-5 times a month the video will be leaked on minuets. We have cockroaches form a new species of its kind due to a failed attempt of cross breeding them and they were released to multiply with no method to exterminate. The after school clubs are big and there are always ways to get involved after school.', 'Monmouth Regional High School is a generic, american high school. There\'s not much special about it, but it does have a few strong points. The amount of clubs to partake in as well as the large amount of students to connect with is very nice.However, the current administration seems to be strangely focused on our prestige as a "sport school", and as such, academics slides. It seems to me that our school could produce more students who are a bit more prepared for college and life if they focused on certain things that actually mattered.', 'Very diverse school with a ton of parent teacher involvement! Large variety of classes and class levels from general to honors to AP with the appropriate teachers. Great sense of community at this school!', "I like the school spirit!  I think its important for kids to encourage each other even if its an event you are not involved with.  I think the only thing I would change it the start time.  It's too early.", 'It is a very great school! I really enjoyed my four years overall. The quality of the school items where a little out dates but they have been slowly updating. The condition of the school was not the best but they have been modifying it! The student body is very diverse but also very clique infested. Our school spirit is like no other and our events are always a great success! Loved it!', "High school was some of the best years of my life but the school itself had some issues. There were teachers known for being easy and not really teaching their classes properly so students would take them for an easy pass. If you really wanted to get a proper education out of MRHS, you had to take the right classes. The teachers that really did want you to learn were great and made a difference in how educated I was as college was approaching. The school had tons of clubs and activities so it was not hard to find something to be a part of. The sports teams in general weren't the best but there were still fun games to go to. While I am aware that I did not attend an outstanding high school, I made the most out of it and I wouldn't trade my time there if I could.", 'I love Monmouth Regional! It has a bad reputation but over the years, I completely believe that it has overcome them. Monmouth Regional is a very diverse school and anyone who has step foot into it can agree. The teachers and staff are there to help the students and aid them on their journey of preparing for college. The overall atmosphere is energetic and I could not see myself attending any other high school.', 'At Monmouth Regional high school, i felt comfortable enough to explore the many wonders of learning. You see, i am one of those people who have a difficult time understanding certain things such as essay writing, and some math coarses, but at MRHS i received help and i was actually open to receiving the help i got.']

column2: ['I had a great experience. I have mad a lot of friends and met some of the coolest teachers ever. Even though there are some flaws I had for the most part a great time.', 'Going to this school was a major change in my life. It taught me so many things how to properly start my own business, how to get financially ready for college and how to stand up for myself if the world or people with authority are against you. I had a lot of fun these for years but I wished they would change the no using elevators rule because it is a major setback for any student ha being gym like boot camp then having to fly up to the 7th floor in 2 min before your late.', "It's a good school but they don't look into student perspective which leads them to not care much for us. For example, we have this gym teacher and he makes many of us feel so uncomfortable.", 'It is a pretty good school. I have learnt a lot in my 4 years of college. It is also a good school choice if you want to get a head start on learning about business', 'fat gym teture hihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihi⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀', 'My experience at economics and finance has been good. The teachers there are very helpful and if you need help they don’t mind going through the trouble of helping you out if they are not busy. The sports and clubs they have allow you to feel comforted and safe. There isn’t anything that I would change but rather I’d like to add more sports or clubs in the school to have more variety.', 'Great school if you want get into the business field.  Tons of paid/unpaid internship opportunities.', "The high school was geared towards getting us financially ready to bout in the real world. Not many schools teach you what you learn here, it's a benefit to students who want to work in a corporate environment later on.", 'This school is horrible ,no offense. I went here and I kind of regretted it. It was like a nightmare,however the teachers and some students were nice. If you want a good education, don’t recommend this school. The gym is in the basement and so small, so you can’t play sports....', 'Some Great resources if students choose to use them , but they rarely do. yes this is how i feel. yes indeed yes indeed yes indeed yes indeed yes indeed yes yes yes yes yes yes minimum 100 characters', 'The amount of opportunity that breeds from the school. There are so many partnerships with top name companies that students are able to engage in. Scheduling, availability of classes, and teacher selection for academics could be updated, but everyone goes out of their way to make sure all students have amazing opportunities that will enrich their resume.', "The gym is the main problem in Economics and Finance. Students want to have space to work out and feel cramped like lab brat. we don't feel like we have space to even breath. Most of the time we complain about the locker room because it's in the basement, and after class is over we don't have a lot of time to change and get to your class sometimes that means 9 floors. plus the locker room is not for student use,  we are not allowed to store our things till the rest of the day like a regular locker. in the other hand, the teacher works very hard to get every student active in class. Most of the time teachers stay after school to work with kids. these teacher dont get paid extra but they choose to do it becasue they care. The elevator are not for the student during the day but in the morning till 8 they let us take the elevator to class.", 'Many opportunities to network, internship, and brand yourself. Academics are not too demanding and are very reasonable. Could have better AP classes but it’s okay I guess. Teachers and staff are very friendly and professional. Many chances to succeed and go to college as long as you put in the work yourself.', 'I liked how interactive the staff was with the students at High School of Economics and Finance.  They were not only interactive academically, but personally.  The staff got to know the students on campus and off.', 'It was mediocre at best, but still a great choice for college readiness and a career in finance. I enjoyed my time in this school.', "I like the school overall because it has a lot of opportunities available for students. For instance, paid and unpaid internships, job shadowing, mentorships, accounting class, entrepreneurship, and etc. I liked how the school had a program every Wednesday called WISE, which was a program that allowed us professionals in real companies come to the school and talk to us students about what they do, about their experience, and etc. The one thing I wasn't a huge fan was that not every student appreciated the opportunites that was in front of them and then they would complain about it.", 'My school isn’t the best looking school, but it’s that kind of school that allows you to succeed when you really want it. Now tell me, what other school you know has a college office, where you are prepared by advisors that guide you through the stress of applications and financial aid? This school just prepares you for college.', 'The High School of Economics and Finance is a great school in that it offers many resources and connection to prepare a student for college. Being a school in the city, it is a school surrounded by opportunity. There are many great teachers who put time and effort into helping students grow. Some things that could change is the size of the gym.', 'This school is amazing for students who are interested in business and want to work in a business or create their own. The teachers help students understand the basic knowledge of a business and the set of skills needed. The school also teaches real-world experiences for the future, such as how to maintain a good credit score, how to be financially stable, how to be an entrepreneur,  etc. The school offers amazing programs and clubs to participate like chess club, ping pong club, book clubs, and there is even a travel abroad program to join! Students are also given the option to join advanced art or drama in their senior year. Juniors and Senior are able to go outside for lunch as well.', "Going to High School of Economics and Finance is beneficial for the students because of the programs it offers us like college prep programs, college trips, and providing us help to join internships. The guidance counselors are very involved with us to help us with everything to do with applying to a college, they basically hold our hand through the whole experience of applying so we always have help. Going to this school has helped give me many opportunities I'm sure I wouldn't have got in a different school."]

column6: ["High School of Economics and Finance is a great school with great teachers that may not be specialized like Stuyvesant or Brooklyn Tech, but the school overall has a good academic learning over my four years here. What I would like to see change is more upcoming First years having this school as their first choice because the school isn't as bad as it seems. The learning experience here is just as great as it is anywhere else.", "This is my senior year at this school, and it has changed alot, and not in a good way. Most students are not there to learn, just to hang out with friends, lots of them cut class.  The ones that do go to class just play on their phones.  Not a serious academic environment anymore.  Many of the teachers have left over the last couple years. I don't even know like half of their names because they come and go so much now. Never used to be like that.For 8th grade student deciding where to apply, depends what you want. If  you just want easy As and a good time with friends, i would still recommend this school. But if your serious about going to college, don't chose this HS.", 'I had a pretty good experience with my school overall. The school itself offers a lot to its students but can be competitive and a fist come first serve basis.', "The experience I had at the High School of Economics and Finance, wasn't the best. There aren't a lot  opportunities at this school for most student, some of the programs offered are limited. It a very small school with class rooms that have no windows. It hard to pay attention when students feel trapped, teachers at this school aren't the most respectful to students and their rights. I did feel safe and feel like I worked hard enough in this school or earn my Diploma.", 'The High School of Economics and Finance provides you with the opportunities to grow as an individual. They provide internships, leadership classes, business classes, and outside events that can help you develop new skills and or enhance your skills. Overall, the school provides a good education for the students who attend.', "It's a pretty small school but the staff and teachers are well rounded and want you to try your best. They're tough but it's because they want us to be successful. Being located by Wall Street means that there's lots of connections and opportunities waiting for you to apply for. The environment is great and it's amazing to be surrounded by people who have similar goals to yours.", "What I like about the high school of Economics and Finance is the way the teacher and staff care about your knowledge and want to see you succeed. The school's guidance counselor is friendly and gives you many resources for you to enroll in a college you like. The teachers are there if you need any help and they help you with what they can whether it's for recommendation letters or to explain a subject you don’t quite understand. I have been going to this school for three years and I will be a senior starting this year and I can say that this school is very good at teaching economics and finance. The classes will give you an understanding of our economic system and will explain how businesses handle their finances whether it's using checks or keeping track of their transactions. The high school of Economics and Finance is a good school with friendly teachers and staff that I would recommend to others.", 'I loved the support offered to me at this school. I was grateful to have had members of the administration that really looked after me, and were there for me when I needed them. This school has great resources and opportunities for their students and continues to search for more. I the end, I can look back with gratitude to have made it with the right people by my side.', 'The experience was not bad. The building does not have windows except on the 8th, 9th and 10th floor. There is no proper gym. In gym class the teacher makes you workout like boot camp. Some of the teachers are pretty good.', 'This school really helped and motivated me in preparing for college. I wish I started with them freshman year. They take academics extremely serious.', "I had a great experience overall. Even though there is no actual gym, windows, or lockers. I felt challenged academically. They offer a few programs and sports like soccer and student government. I've gain so many opportunities through this program like an young professional mentoring program and futures and options, which got me a paid internship at Morgan Stanley. Additionally, unlike most schools, this school offers businesses courses like accounting and entrepreneurship. The gym is very rigorous but in the long run, you'll get use to the workouts and feel better and in shape.", "I like that the school is very diverse.  The mix of every race in the school. I also like the fact that it's a challenging school, it pushes you to do better and put yourself in a position where you have to think to get the answer.  Some changes I would like to see is more sports. There aren't a lot of sports for the girls and boys, I feel like there should be a variety the amount of sports. Also more educational trips.", 'My experience in the High School Of Economics and Finance has been an amazing 4 years of my life. Creating a safe, fun learning environment has helped their students learn to the best of their ability, with the use of great teachers, wonderful resources, and great activities. The 4 years I have spent in the school has allowed me to connected with different resources that have allowed to become the person I am today.', 'What I Like about Niche is that it is easy to apply, and there are many chances to win a scholarship for all types of academic records.', 'High School of Economics and Finance (HSEF) is a growing school environment. They offer many great resources such as Pace Liberty Partnership (LPP) which helps student through the college process and become college ready, along with Academy of Finance (AOF) which helps students prepare for the workforce by providing job shadows and internships. They offer a wide range of courses which only includes about six AP courses. There are some teachers there with a passion to teach and help students grow, however there are a handful of teachers there just to say they came to work. HSEF provides many clubs and activities such as Chess, Basketball, Cross Country, Flag Football, a LGBTQ group, etc. I would change our gym course from being so rigorous and allow more access to the elevator because walking up and down different levels of a 10 floor building all day is very tedious. ', 'I enjoyed attending the High School of Economics & Finance. They have great connections with the business world. Juniors and seniors have opportunities to participate in many internships. Freshmen and sophomores have opportunities to attend job shadowing events. Academics are great. Gym is very hard for even the most athletic people. It is a great way to stay in shape though! Overall, HSEF is a great school.', 'I remember the day when I got my acceptance letter in middle school and it said I got accept the HS Economics & Finance, I cried. This was my back up school. Now as a graduate and look back I do not regret going there at all! I loved it. Living in New York City everything is all about the opportunities and this school provided you with a wide range of opportunities from paid internships to college readiness. I gained a paid internship the summer of Junior year. I have worked here until I graduate and the job hired me as a part-time employee as I am in college. Many school may have a better academic standing grade but they do not have the opportunities which this HS had. Take hold of as many opportunities as you can as you know how competitive the world is out there now!', 'Alot of different types of people', 'There should be more extra curricular activity funding going on and more sports.', "It isn't the best but also isn't the worst."]
column8: ['I had a great experience. I have mad a lot of friends and met some of the coolest teachers ever. Even though there are some flaws I had for the most part a great time.', 'Going to this school was a major change in my life. It taught me so many things how to properly start my own business, how to get financially ready for college and how to stand up for myself if the world or people with authority are against you. I had a lot of fun these for years but I wished they would change the no using elevators rule because it is a major setback for any student ha being gym like boot camp then having to fly up to the 7th floor in 2 min before your late.', "It's a good school but they don't look into student perspective which leads them to not care much for us. For example, we have this gym teacher and he makes many of us feel so uncomfortable.", 'It is a pretty good school. I have learnt a lot in my 4 years of college. It is also a good school choice if you want to get a head start on learning about business', 'fat gym teture hihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihihi⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀', 'My experience at economics and finance has been good. The teachers there are very helpful and if you need help they don’t mind going through the trouble of helping you out if they are not busy. The sports and clubs they have allow you to feel comforted and safe. There isn’t anything that I would change but rather I’d like to add more sports or clubs in the school to have more variety.', 'Great school if you want get into the business field.  Tons of paid/unpaid internship opportunities.', "The high school was geared towards getting us financially ready to bout in the real world. Not many schools teach you what you learn here, it's a benefit to students who want to work in a corporate environment later on.", 'This school is horrible ,no offense. I went here and I kind of regretted it. It was like a nightmare,however the teachers and some students were nice. If you want a good education, don’t recommend this school. The gym is in the basement and so small, so you can’t play sports....', 'Some Great resources if students choose to use them , but they rarely do. yes this is how i feel. yes indeed yes indeed yes indeed yes indeed yes indeed yes yes yes yes yes yes minimum 100 characters', 'The amount of opportunity that breeds from the school. There are so many partnerships with top name companies that students are able to engage in. Scheduling, availability of classes, and teacher selection for academics could be updated, but everyone goes out of their way to make sure all students have amazing opportunities that will enrich their resume.', "The gym is the main problem in Economics and Finance. Students want to have space to work out and feel cramped like lab brat. we don't feel like we have space to even breath. Most of the time we complain about the locker room because it's in the basement, and after class is over we don't have a lot of time to change and get to your class sometimes that means 9 floors. plus the locker room is not for student use,  we are not allowed to store our things till the rest of the day like a regular locker. in the other hand, the teacher works very hard to get every student active in class. Most of the time teachers stay after school to work with kids. these teacher dont get paid extra but they choose to do it becasue they care. The elevator are not for the student during the day but in the morning till 8 they let us take the elevator to class.", 'Many opportunities to network, internship, and brand yourself. Academics are not too demanding and are very reasonable. Could have better AP classes but it’s okay I guess. Teachers and staff are very friendly and professional. Many chances to succeed and go to college as long as you put in the work yourself.', 'I liked how interactive the staff was with the students at High School of Economics and Finance.  They were not only interactive academically, but personally.  The staff got to know the students on campus and off.', 'It was mediocre at best, but still a great choice for college readiness and a career in finance. I enjoyed my time in this school.', "I like the school overall because it has a lot of opportunities available for students. For instance, paid and unpaid internships, job shadowing, mentorships, accounting class, entrepreneurship, and etc. I liked how the school had a program every Wednesday called WISE, which was a program that allowed us professionals in real companies come to the school and talk to us students about what they do, about their experience, and etc. The one thing I wasn't a huge fan was that not every student appreciated the opportunites that was in front of them and then they would complain about it.", 'My school isn’t the best looking school, but it’s that kind of school that allows you to succeed when you really want it. Now tell me, what other school you know has a college office, where you are prepared by advisors that guide you through the stress of applications and financial aid? This school just prepares you for college.', 'The High School of Economics and Finance is a great school in that it offers many resources and connection to prepare a student for college. Being a school in the city, it is a school surrounded by opportunity. There are many great teachers who put time and effort into helping students grow. Some things that could change is the size of the gym.', 'This school is amazing for students who are interested in business and want to work in a business or create their own. The teachers help students understand the basic knowledge of a business and the set of skills needed. The school also teaches real-world experiences for the future, such as how to maintain a good credit score, how to be financially stable, how to be an entrepreneur,  etc. The school offers amazing programs and clubs to participate like chess club, ping pong club, book clubs, and there is even a travel abroad program to join! Students are also given the option to join advanced art or drama in their senior year. Juniors and Senior are able to go outside for lunch as well.', "Going to High School of Economics and Finance is beneficial for the students because of the programs it offers us like college prep programs, college trips, and providing us help to join internships. The guidance counselors are very involved with us to help us with everything to do with applying to a college, they basically hold our hand through the whole experience of applying so we always have help. Going to this school has helped give me many opportunities I'm sure I wouldn't have got in a different school."]

column2: ['I like how Pace High School is always preparing students for the future, no matter what and always thinking ahead. I like how we’re exposed to several different programs to help us and how we have the opportunity to take free college courses at PaceU.', "The staff at Pace was the best part of the school when I was there. I always had a teacher that I could talk to and they all supported us in our future plans. They worked hard to make sure that everyone was succeeding. Some of my favorite teachers have retired but they're still in contact with me and make sure that I am doing well!", 'Pace High School Is okay kinda . The school definitely needs to improve with its cleanliness and everything to be very honest . The teachers are nice and want to see you succeed . The sports program is also great .', 'It’s really nice to be at a school like pace. It is very diverse and has amazing students. The teachers are amazingly supportive off their students. Because this is a small school you recieve a lot of individual attention.', 'It’s a very good school. The teachers are friendly and the students and staff are welcoming too. I think that this school has a very welcoming environment too.', 'I’ve been in PACE for 3 years now and now I am a senior. PACE has been growing ever since I got here 3 years ago extremely. This school I would say is the best school to be ready for college and helps you get things done as long as you show interest.', "In PACE I experienced a lot of freedom and Academic opportunities due to it's connection to the University and it's location.", 'I love Pace High School. It is a small school community where we all know each other’s name. In my experience at Pace, I had extremely supportive teachers and staff who always had my back when I was going through a difficult time. I am so grateful for everyone in high school who helped me become a better me and pushed me to my fullest potential. One of the most important people there is my coach Nicholas Lee. He has been a father figure to me ever since I met him and I still keep in contact with him. Thank you for pushing me and showing me all the support every student should receive!', 'The PACE community is one of its own. Despite the school going through difficult times, everyone stayed together, and united as one. The school and its culture are evolving, but it is up to the students to make for what PACE makes PACEC. The people and staff were one of a kind!', 'I feel like PACE became my second family, surrounded by the loving peers, caring teachers and an open administration. This school gave me a great open space to push for the common interests of students like me, as well as a comfortable space to grow. It restored my faith in the idea that an individual can bring change through involvement. Its unique traditions like First Summer and Pacegiving bring back great memories that I will forever cherish.', 'I like that they help me graduate and earn my diploma. Pace has a great staff who’s purpose is to push you to be successful and receive the required knowledge needed to venture out into the real world.', 'It’s a pretty good school. it may have its ups and downs, but nonetheless, the community is great and everyone seems to get along at times.', 'Everything about the school is great. All the teachers are supportive and will help you with anything you need. I will forever love the close-knit environment. All the events that they do have made the different grades interact with each other more. Furthermore, to have a feeling of inclusiveness al the sports club accept people from a variety of different athletic levels because the potential is seen in everyone. The only thing I would like to change is the graduation requirements which make it mandatory for students to do 180 hours community service, 90% attendance, and a final group project.', "I like that Pace High School is small and comfortable. The teachers are somewhat laid back but aren't really involved. The school is clean, and the hallways are kept nice. The only thing I would say though, is the location, which is far from other schools but in a very diverse neighborhood.", 'At Pace High School, I felt like I was a part of another family. I was treated so well by my fellow peers and teachers throughout my four years attending. Although the work made me want to give up sometimes, it thought to keep working no matter what and to strive for greatness.', 'The teachers and staff are extremely supportive. However, I found the experience with friends a bit challenging.', 'The school has been pretty good. The students that go there allows anyone no matter your race, sexuality, or any other different social differences.', 'I have only attended Pace for my senior year, but I have been to 5 high schools in only 4 years and overall Pace is where I made most of my friends and this has been the hardest year I have ever worked towards my education and the most knowledge that has been taught to me in the 4 years of my high school career. The school is NOT strict, so students do not feel like they are in jail. Next year other additions will also be added making the family based school an even better one. Altogether Pace High School beats the other 4 High Schools that could never compare to this 5-star school.', 'I like the school alot. The school when I first arrived was fairly small but as of now it is currently expanding. The small population of the school allows me to have one on one help from teachers and staff and a personal relationship as well. In addition, the small population allows me to get to know a lot of the student or he familiar with the Paces communities faces making me feel more safe.', 'Pace has a lot of activities and is a school that is very active in sports. Teaches are supportive and caring and the community is little meaning every students get the attention they need.']
