column6: ["I like Pace's student traditions and the administration's willingness to listen to students when students believe something is unfair. Many staff members are visible and readily available, and when they aren't, they make sure to accommodate for students in need. Student culture includes sports and traditions such as PACEGiving, a schoolwide potluck before Thanksgiving break. When it comes to academics, teachers are always willing to assist students who request it, and there are even groups made to help students, such as Tutorials and Math Zone.", 'From my past four years of attending Pace High School, the atmosphere and culture of the building has definitely changed but has also influenced how I have grown into a young adult as well. During my freshman year, I was intimidated by the small number of classmates I had because I liked to hide in the crowd; I enjoyed being a good student who was invisible. However, through all the presentations and conversations I was forced to have with my peers, I have become more open to speaking and being more comfortable with having to be in a group of acquaintances instead of friends. The atmosphere of the school is also quite interesting where people can have a close relationship with their teachers where there can be open conversation with most and allows for there to be better communication with the students and teachers expectations and wants.', 'They are associated with PACE University so there are great opportunities.', 'There is a great diversity of students and teachers in the school.', 'The school has a great athletic department. The adults that are involved in it are really dedicated to the teams and players. They always wish for this best for the athletic especially for the ones that are committed', "I haven't met all the children parents but the one's i did meet are great. They are very friendly and very much engaged in the school.", 'I love the school. The teacher were extremely helps. They are like the teacher that would push you to get the fullest amount out of your education. Most of the teachers are always there after school if you need extra help.', "There isn't a lot of students in this school which is why it may be difficult to have a lot of different clubs. For the most part. the clubs are interesting.", 'Since it is a small school, everyone knows everyone. It helps people become more comfortable speaking out and we all grow to tolerate each other and our differences.', 'The teachers are very engaged and extremely supportive. I wish I could take them to college with me.', 'The teachers in this school are mostly made up of kind, hard-working people who care about their students. Some even give up their time (when they do not need to) to help struggling students and also give out extra credit is most cases. Most are strict, but in a way that the students know that they know best for them and they encourage some of their strict teaching tactics.', 'Security are fairly average, and the nurse is only really good for ice packs.', "While there, it felt like hell, but looking back, Pace was a school that served it's purpose. It was supposed to prepare students for college and it did just that.", 'The staff is small, and constantly in communication with one another, they are knowledgeable in their subjects, and arefunds approachable and friendly towards the students with a very few notable exceptions.', "One of the many unique things about Pace High School is that it is very family oriented considering the size of our school and the amount of people that attend. It is because of the size of the school that the staff does not seem to think clubs such as art are a necessity. Art is one of the many hobbies I enjoy doing outside of school; however, students in our school including myself have tried to create an art club and failed several times. Not only is there a lack of serious extra activities but the environment in which the school is located is unsanitary. Pace high school is located in Chinatown, lower east Manhattan and because of this the environment is always filled with trash and strong unpleasant Oder's. For the most part I am in a way glad we are located where we are because Chinatown allows me to adapt to a new culture, which means I can grasp onto the language and food the Chinese people speak and eat on a daily basis.", 'Its a very good school that helps many to go on successfully into college. However, because its very small it lacks extracurricular activities', "There were the usual high school fights and discrepancies but I never felt unsafe. The school nurse was awesome and I never felt like I couldn't go to her for any reason", 'Pretty usual cafeteria food- nothing awful at all. I usually brought my lunch to school because that was easier for me- but most of my friends bought lunch', "I haven't had much experience with it- but I don't think any punishments were too harsh. Mostly detentions- never physical punishment", 'I spent most time in the softball field or the gym for basketball but both facilities were well kept']
column8: ['All of the teachers I have had have helped cultivate my genuine love for knowledge. If I was interested in a topic, my teacher would lend me a book on the subject. They were interested in what I was doing in school and out of school.', 'I played basketball throughout my years and loved it. My coach was great. I also was a member of student organizations that allowed me to have leadership positions and plan events', 'The teachers were always hands on and truly cared about the students. I have kept in touch with many mentors over the years that still continue to inspire me throughout college and beyond.', 'The overall experience is excellent and I would recommend this school for all students', 'The food is excellent and healthy.', 'Students sometimes have detention in the school but they are aware of the consequences', 'Schools provide a variety of sports to play in', 'The teachers of Pace High School are very interested and engaged with working with their fellow students', 'Basketball, Flag Football, Soccer, Track and Field, Softball', 'Technology is available for all students at PACE during the morning and day.', 'The academics is a good level for all students attending.', 'PACE is a diverse school that does a great job at arranging events to have all students come together as one.', 'PACE is an extremely safe environment. All students partake positively and there is barely any issues.', "My overall experience at PACE has consisted of my positivity and thankfulness. The staff at PACE has truly gone above and beyond for me when needed and gives me that extra touch of motivation when I'm ready to collapse. The size of the school has provided me with the opportunity to have a second family, a family I deeply appreciate. I would definitely choose this school again because it has shaped me into the young adult I am today-- a driven individual.", 'The food services at this school are average. I myself do not eat in the cafeteria and eat outside lunch. When I bring my outside food inside, the lunchroom is always kept clean and a safe space for students.', 'The school administration and teachers are very effective at doing all that they can to keep policies in place. Before any trouble occurs, PACE is known for mediating situations. This is helpful in avoiding any conflict and keeping the school a safe and enjoyable environment for all teachers and students.', 'Although PACE High School lacks the funds for their athetic programs, students do not hesitate to involve themselves through sports ranging from soccer to softball. Being that it is such a small school, all students show their constant support by attending home games and making it clear they have pride in their school.', 'Being that PACE Highschool is a school of only about 400 students in total, the student to teacher ratio is low. This provides both the student and the teacher the opportunity to build a person relationship and have much more one on one time. Teachers devote their time to the benefit of the student before, during, and after school. They offer a wide amount of extra help and do all that they can to have students succeed in their classes.', 'PACE High school does an outstanding job at involving their students in the PACE community as best as they can. The school offers a variety of extracurricular activities, ranging from academic to athletic. Some extracurricular activities offer community service hours, a graduation requirement PACE High School has. This encourages students to actively participate and gain their required 180 community service hours all at once.', 'Everything is avilable in Pace. There is no problem with the resources in the school. Pace students gets chance to use Pace University library which is awesome.']

column2: ['Through out my four years of attending boonton high school I would could consider it as a special place. When you walk threw the hallways there so much diversity and culture.The students for the most part are friendly and work hard. But this though my perspective. Others say that boonton is a bad place but it’s what you make out of it. Every school has slackers and people that don’t care about their grades. If you associate with them than it’s your fault. Either way if you experience these people in high school or not your going to deal with them at some point. One must know themselves and try to stick to our path and associate yourself with people that have goals. I’ve been able to do that my four years at Boonton high school. I have friends that support me and have the same goals. I’m so grateful for them and my mentors. The high also has some great teachers that have taught me many life lessons. Overall I would recommend this school.', 'The teachers are very friendly and offer a well-rounded education. You feel almost at home in this school.', 'Boonton High School gives you an experience very different than other schools. It has the average sports teams and standard lunch food, but its academics really cater to many types of students depending on the class. There are various opportunities to gain college credit and immerse yourself in unique electives such as Music Theory. There is something for everyone here.', 'The school needs better administration. Hopefully with more rules and enforcement, the students will understand what is expected of them. The school culture is that the school inst very serious and kind of a bad school. Better teachers and program opportunities would help out the school culture.', 'I liked all of the events at Boonton High School and how they engaged students and inspired school spirit. They provide students with many tools, resources, and opportunities to become a better student, athlete, leader, and person. The school also takes steps to ensure the safety and wellbeing of their students.  This school has helped me to grow academically, take challenging classes, become a better speaker and leader, and make me proud to be a part of this school program.', 'The teachers at Boonton High school are very helpful and compassionate towards their students. The staff is very friendly. But the secretaries are rude when it comes to dealing with visitors and srudents.', 'I would like to see a cleaner school for both the students and teachers. School spirit should be increased because there is not much else to look forward to.', "Boonton is a great place to find a welcoming group of students. It's not very hard to make friends and since it's a small school, it's very easy to get to know everyone. Although it's not that great academically, it definitely has potential, and from the three years I've been here I know that they're trying hard to make a positive change in the school's environment. Hopefully Boonton High School will become even better in the future.", 'I was apart of the Gateway Academy in its beginning years. The concept of the program was great, the execution was not. There was a separation of students in the program from other students that can be paralleled to special education. I could go on about the negative influences of ability grouping, but I will just say that it was isolating and lonely. I will also say that the additional assignments that came with being apart of the program were more annoying than productive. I left the program to find that the general education at this school was also poor. The teachers do not care and as result neither do the students. The administration is poor and changing constantly with little to no improvement. The only positive aspect of my experience at Boonton High School was the extracurricular activities I was apart of. GSA (Group Sports Association) and Track and Field were my highlights.', 'It’s a great school for a community feel. The people are great but the school lacks motivation in teachers and students. Students are not being challenged enough to really show their potential. Classes are a bit short too adequately to get a lesson across. Overall average school.', 'I have enjoyed my experience at Boonton High School these past couple years due to the welcoming atmosphere of the staff and my great group of friends. Usually, kids dread waking up for school, but for me, I know that the day will go smoothly and I have a little less of a struggle getting out of bed.', 'The atmosphere is very safe and supportive. The teachers are always there for extra help and prepare you for college, with challenging topics. Boonton High School is very diverse and with the class sizes being small, everyone knows each other.', 'Boonton high school is the school that teaches how to live your life in school, in college, and even after it. Boonton High School makes you feel like, you have a second home, everyone is like a family.', 'Just like any other school, or place you go, it is all about what you make of it. I truly enjoyed my time and experience at Boonton and I would not change a thing!', "Boonton High school has come a long way from where it was 6 or 7 years ago but, I still would not say it's a top tier school.  It is a small group 1 with roughly 600 students in and in a small school like that I feel that sometimes they are behind in some newer technology and having nicer facilities.  Overall it's not a bad school but, sometimes it looks that way when you compare it to many of the other wealthy high schools in Morris County, NJ.", "As far as high school goes, this one isn't as bad as some schools. The food is decent at best but served by lovely people. The staff at Boonton is always working towards making the school better. There are meetings at least once a week for faculty discussing any important events and projects to improve the climate and overall environment. Every single teacher goes the extra mile to help their students pass and shows students that they genuinely care. All of the teachers put up with a lot just to give all of us the best education they can. One thing I would change is the organization. With a new principal this seems to be an area of improvement, but prior to hiring him we could barely keep up with current events and such because the organization was so poor. Teachers were never told important things ahead of time and now that is changing.", 'Although BHS is not the best academically, I think they do great considering the resources they are provided. They give every student a tablet, have smart boards in every classroom, and most of the teachers are helpful and willing to spend extra time to give extra help.', "My decision to attend Boonton High School has had such a monumental impact on me.  I am enrolled in the Gateway Academy, a program that promotes leadership and education inside and outside of the class room.  In this program, I was allowed to challenge myself in AP and honors classes since my freshman year of high school, which has helped me not only expand my mind, but to also be more prepared for college.  Boonton High School is a very diverse school, which has made me into a more cultured individual.  I have to say that I love everything about it, but it could use some slight improvements in it's cafeteria and facilities.  There should be a better variety of food in the cafeteria but that is my only complaint about it.  The facilities are often messy and equipment (stall dividers, sinks, etc.)  should be more durable because there has been times where they have broken.  Other than that, Boonton High School is a great place where learning thrives.", 'I love the opportunities given to students to expand their comfort zones. The Gateway Academy is a great resource for qualified students.', 'School is outdated but currently its undergoing renovations to improve the school. New administration memebers and a new principal are helping to change the school into something better. School is kind of dirty and can be cleaned up more. Good course selection but not the best or most qualified teachers are teaching here.']
column4: ['Through out my four years of attending boonton high school I would could consider it as a special place. When you walk threw the hallways there so much diversity and culture.The students for the most part are friendly and work hard. But this though my perspective. Others say that boonton is a bad place but it’s what you make out of it. Every school has slackers and people that don’t care about their grades. If you associate with them than it’s your fault. Either way if you experience these people in high school or not your going to deal with them at some point. One must know themselves and try to stick to our path and associate yourself with people that have goals. I’ve been able to do that my four years at Boonton high school. I have friends that support me and have the same goals. I’m so grateful for them and my mentors. The high also has some great teachers that have taught me many life lessons. Overall I would recommend this school.', 'The teachers are very friendly and offer a well-rounded education. You feel almost at home in this school.', 'Boonton High School gives you an experience very different than other schools. It has the average sports teams and standard lunch food, but its academics really cater to many types of students depending on the class. There are various opportunities to gain college credit and immerse yourself in unique electives such as Music Theory. There is something for everyone here.', 'The school needs better administration. Hopefully with more rules and enforcement, the students will understand what is expected of them. The school culture is that the school inst very serious and kind of a bad school. Better teachers and program opportunities would help out the school culture.', 'I liked all of the events at Boonton High School and how they engaged students and inspired school spirit. They provide students with many tools, resources, and opportunities to become a better student, athlete, leader, and person. The school also takes steps to ensure the safety and wellbeing of their students.  This school has helped me to grow academically, take challenging classes, become a better speaker and leader, and make me proud to be a part of this school program.', 'The teachers at Boonton High school are very helpful and compassionate towards their students. The staff is very friendly. But the secretaries are rude when it comes to dealing with visitors and srudents.', 'I would like to see a cleaner school for both the students and teachers. School spirit should be increased because there is not much else to look forward to.', "Boonton is a great place to find a welcoming group of students. It's not very hard to make friends and since it's a small school, it's very easy to get to know everyone. Although it's not that great academically, it definitely has potential, and from the three years I've been here I know that they're trying hard to make a positive change in the school's environment. Hopefully Boonton High School will become even better in the future.", 'I was apart of the Gateway Academy in its beginning years. The concept of the program was great, the execution was not. There was a separation of students in the program from other students that can be paralleled to special education. I could go on about the negative influences of ability grouping, but I will just say that it was isolating and lonely. I will also say that the additional assignments that came with being apart of the program were more annoying than productive. I left the program to find that the general education at this school was also poor. The teachers do not care and as result neither do the students. The administration is poor and changing constantly with little to no improvement. The only positive aspect of my experience at Boonton High School was the extracurricular activities I was apart of. GSA (Group Sports Association) and Track and Field were my highlights.', 'It’s a great school for a community feel. The people are great but the school lacks motivation in teachers and students. Students are not being challenged enough to really show their potential. Classes are a bit short too adequately to get a lesson across. Overall average school.', 'I have enjoyed my experience at Boonton High School these past couple years due to the welcoming atmosphere of the staff and my great group of friends. Usually, kids dread waking up for school, but for me, I know that the day will go smoothly and I have a little less of a struggle getting out of bed.', 'The atmosphere is very safe and supportive. The teachers are always there for extra help and prepare you for college, with challenging topics. Boonton High School is very diverse and with the class sizes being small, everyone knows each other.', 'Boonton high school is the school that teaches how to live your life in school, in college, and even after it. Boonton High School makes you feel like, you have a second home, everyone is like a family.', 'Just like any other school, or place you go, it is all about what you make of it. I truly enjoyed my time and experience at Boonton and I would not change a thing!', "Boonton High school has come a long way from where it was 6 or 7 years ago but, I still would not say it's a top tier school.  It is a small group 1 with roughly 600 students in and in a small school like that I feel that sometimes they are behind in some newer technology and having nicer facilities.  Overall it's not a bad school but, sometimes it looks that way when you compare it to many of the other wealthy high schools in Morris County, NJ.", "As far as high school goes, this one isn't as bad as some schools. The food is decent at best but served by lovely people. The staff at Boonton is always working towards making the school better. There are meetings at least once a week for faculty discussing any important events and projects to improve the climate and overall environment. Every single teacher goes the extra mile to help their students pass and shows students that they genuinely care. All of the teachers put up with a lot just to give all of us the best education they can. One thing I would change is the organization. With a new principal this seems to be an area of improvement, but prior to hiring him we could barely keep up with current events and such because the organization was so poor. Teachers were never told important things ahead of time and now that is changing.", 'Although BHS is not the best academically, I think they do great considering the resources they are provided. They give every student a tablet, have smart boards in every classroom, and most of the teachers are helpful and willing to spend extra time to give extra help.', "My decision to attend Boonton High School has had such a monumental impact on me.  I am enrolled in the Gateway Academy, a program that promotes leadership and education inside and outside of the class room.  In this program, I was allowed to challenge myself in AP and honors classes since my freshman year of high school, which has helped me not only expand my mind, but to also be more prepared for college.  Boonton High School is a very diverse school, which has made me into a more cultured individual.  I have to say that I love everything about it, but it could use some slight improvements in it's cafeteria and facilities.  There should be a better variety of food in the cafeteria but that is my only complaint about it.  The facilities are often messy and equipment (stall dividers, sinks, etc.)  should be more durable because there has been times where they have broken.  Other than that, Boonton High School is a great place where learning thrives.", 'I love the opportunities given to students to expand their comfort zones. The Gateway Academy is a great resource for qualified students.', 'School is outdated but currently its undergoing renovations to improve the school. New administration memebers and a new principal are helping to change the school into something better. School is kind of dirty and can be cleaned up more. Good course selection but not the best or most qualified teachers are teaching here.']
column6: ['Boonton High School is a place to be comfortable. They really make you feel safe and secure and are pretty helpful when it comes to transitioning from grade to grade and past graduation. They really are preparing me for my future this year.', 'Overall Boonton High School has been great to me. The staff is encouraging and friendly. The teachers definitely support students and help them grow into better people. Boonton, like any other schools, is not prefect, it does need to make a few adjustments but overall I can say I am a proud student of Boonton high school.', "I liked the close knit community in the school and how the teachers always had time to help students if they were struggling. What I don't like about the school is the loss of Pep. Pep was an extra period for upperclassmen after their lunch where we were able to catch up on homework, have our labs for science classes, and be able to get extra help from teachers. It's extremely hard now to make up missed tests if you were out now, find time to meet with teachers, and you lose half your lunch period if you have a lab.", 'Freshman year here things were super outdated. Throughout the next three years our school and its administration became more involved and started to discipline a ton more. We have to now wear our student ID cards, we cannot enter certain doors, and we have teacher watching doors and paying attention to the students actions a ton more. I genuinely can say I enjoyed my time attending this school for my whole career here.   ', "The teacher's were great and really cared about the students, however the technology in this school is far outdated. Air conditioning was always a problem, you could never be fully comfortable in class. Teachers cared a lot about getting their students ready for college, however they taught us more on how to take a test rather than learning anything.", 'I came in my junior year . The teachers were welcoming as well as challenging . They kept everybody on their own track for their level of education . The staff was always helpful .', 'Students dont really peer pressure at this school. Many encourage to join certain clubs or sports. everybody is actually very accepting in others decisions.', 'there are a wide variety of acedemics at this school. The teachers are wonderful and they explain everything and will provide extra credit and extra help after class.', 'Personally i feel safe in this school. I can go to school knowing nothing bad will happen to me and my peers.', 'there is a wide variety for most interests', 'There are superstars, but there are some just coasting', 'It has improved, and the new principal will help', "haven't been in contact with many parents except for sports and all thise parents are very supportive of me, which means a lot since i wear a headscarf. they all think im an amazing athlete. so they're pretty nice. but the kids themselves don't always follow suit", 'There are many types of clubs and they are very diverse. Everyone is eager to join and enjoys being a part of the clubs. Examples of the clubs include PLC,FBLA,Spanish Club,Math Club,NHS. All the administration are fully committed to their club.', "This school has many this you can do whether you're an athlete or a performer or none of the above. Everybody really comes together and supports each other. I would chose this school again because I have made many memories at many different school events and occasions.", 'The teachers are very approachable. If you have a question they will gladly help you and explain it very well. They will make time for extra help. All the teachers adequately lead and control the classroom. Also the teachers have respect for all the students.', 'overall, the security at my school needs some work.  We recently lost our principal and superintendent, so we currently have an interim principal and a new superintendent.  Over the past two years, we have experienced two shooting threats, and the threat from this year was handled very immaturely.', 'the extracurriculars that i am involved in have helped me make almost all of the friends i have today.  I love all the programs that i am a part of, and they have afforded me opportunities that I otherwise would not have had.', 'In all honesty, high school is what you make of it.  No one is going to go out of their way to make high school enjoyable for you.  Personally, I made sure I was involved in as many cubs as I could, and I truly enjoyed my high school experience.', 'At BHS, there is a wide range of teaching ability and quality.  Some of my teachers truly do care about my education as well as my life overall.  On the other hand, some teachers take out some of their negative feelings on the students.  Overall, my experience at BHS has been positive.']

We recently lost our principal and superintendent, so we currently have an interim principal and a new superintendent.  Over the past two years, we have experienced two shooting threats, and the threat from this year was handled very immaturely.', 'the extracurriculars that i am involved in have helped me make almost all of the friends i have today.  I love all the programs that i am a part of, and they have afforded me opportunities that I otherwise would not have had.', 'In all honesty, high school is what you make of it.  No one is going to go out of their way to make high school enjoyable for you.  Personally, I made sure I was involved in as many cubs as I could, and I truly enjoyed my high school experience.', 'At BHS, there is a wide range of teaching ability and quality.  Some of my teachers truly do care about my education as well as my life overall.  On the other hand, some teachers take out some of their negative feelings on the students.  Overall, my experience at BHS has been positive.']

column2: ["This school has  variety of clubs and sports available to students who are interested. Also, this school prepares students for various exams such as regents, and the sat's. This school helps students build communication skills, and organization skills.", "I've gone to this high school for four years and I can say it was really good since there were several ap classes offered and had many teachers that I really liked.", "I very much enjoyed my stay at this school. The teachers genuinely care about the well being of their students. Since the population of the school isn't as high as many other schools, each student can be treated and taken care of as individuals who can aspire to do many things in the future.", 'I had a lot of good memories attending at that school. known your crowd and your social life there is amazing. the teachers are very caring and helpful to all the students and go out of their way to help them succeed as much as they can. hardly ever any incidents and little to no distractions during classes. the students love their teachers and the teachers love their students. sometimes my class would throw birthday parties for their favorite teacher as a class.', 'Good resources and teachers and well kept school however recent changes really decreased my view of the school. If I had the chance to reapply I probably would choose another school.', 'I like the number of sports offered in this school. There is such a wide variety that you are bound to find something, such as fencing, track, bowling and more.  There is also lots of APs offered here, such as Psychology, Biology, Computer Science, Calculus and so much more. This school is rather small, so you would be able to get to know everyone and your guidance counselors will actually be able to help you. The counselors are so sweet, and they will help and guide you through highschool and into college.', 'Small student body so its ve y comfortable. Academics are good and have variety of classes that are potential forthe future.', 'Clubs, activities and tutoring after school makes me appreaciate this school. Not only does this school prepares to be proficient in my academics but teaches me to become successful', "I'm going to miss this school. Im graduating and this school helped me a lot. Not only did the teachers help but the activities and clubs gave me a passion to chase my dreams. Thank you jamica gateway to the sciences", 'This School is really good school. Theres clubs for anything. Teachers care about their students so much. Please come to this school you wont regret it', "Jamaica gateway has So many clubs. Any clubs you think about it It's already there. School is safe because theres no bullies and teachers will help their students anytime", 'Jamaica gateway is such a great school. Alot of programs, clubs, and sports. The teachers care about their students soooooo much and this is why I love this school. Jamaica gateway prepares you for college', 'We should have more opportunities like programs and free SAT prep ! This school has great teachers who are willing to help. The guidance counselor, Mr. Tai is very helpful and inspiring. He constantly checks up on you and builds a close relationship with each and every one of his students.', 'Honestly this school could use some work. They constantly make new rules and make students more confused about classwork than regualr. The teachers here seem to have their own perspective of the students attending the school. The teachers are know to have their own little groups making it harder for students to approach them regarding classwork.', "The skills I gained from this school are applicable to life. Be presentative, flexibility in any situations, determination are the most important things in life that my school teaches me. Since my school is more diverse it is amazing to get a chance to study globally.  Different people from different culture give us the different point of views and multiple ideas. We learn together from each others' mistake. The teachers are so cooperative to teach a student properly. Being in National Honors Society I get a chance to do teacher assistant, which let me have a bit of teacher's experience.", "Jamaica was a very small school, which meant you had one-on-one services with staff and weren't neglected", 'jamaica gateway is ok but beware of the music teacher. all he does is yell and scream at classes. he alkso is perverted and hangs and says and does things with girls that are disgusting. be careful. other teachers are ok, guidance ok. easy to pass classes if u do work. only an average school', 'Gateway is a small school, so there is a lot of one on one with students. Just focus and my best advice would be not to procrastinate and sometimes its good to have a small circle.', "To be honest the school is great overall. But the teachers have so much attitude and they give you classes you don't even need and force you to take AP just so the school can look good. But I mean I love it because my friends go there :)", 'I am going into my senior year and have liked the school so far. Ms. Rosen is great. She cares about her students and always makes time to speak to anyone when they are upset. She helps push you and encourages you to get involved. The teachers are nice and care for students. Make-up work is always taken but try not to fall too far behind. If you work hard, then you will get a lot out of this school with AP classes, honors classes, and good college results.']

column6: ["Jamaica Gateway to the Sciences is a decent school. The teachers are pretty good, there are a lot of clubs to join, and since it's a small school you will feel more comfortable. What I honestly don't like is how a number of classes in the school are limited, especially the ap classes.", "I'm a freshman going into my sophomore year and I have made many friends. The clubs here at the school make it very enjoyable and also make you feel more at home. I'd say the favorite teams that I have bonded with are the swim team and Law team from personal experience. You are given many opportunities throughout the school year and get to go on many trips. The teachers are very welcoming in fact, I don't think there isn't a teacher that I haven't met in some way or another. The school is a little so the teachers can focus on student individually if they require help. There are students that take their academics very seriously when it comes down to it. They have many different sports in this school as well such as the football, swimming, fencing, soccer, volleyball, and softball. The bonds developed with these teams are strong.", 'My experience at Jamaica Gateway was one of much learning and growing. The teachers and faculty always saw my potential and constantly pushed me in the right direction. I am very grateful to have been a part of such a nurturing and community based environment.', 'I am a student at this school, I fine that she school is rather unorganized in certain areas. Then their is the fact that the students have trust issues with some staff members(mainly the councillors), this is only because some of them have a track record for breaking agreements that are made verbally.', 'Jamaica Gateway is an okay school but it is definitely not an great school. (I am a freshman). The principal should be more aware and involved of what is occurring in the classrooms. She needs to ensure she is hiring well-educated and experienced teachers.  Mr. Birch-Wood Taylor also needs to ensure teachers are doing what they are supposed to be doing for the welfare of the students. I rarely saw her in my classrooms, I can only recall her coming to my classroom  one time.  That concerns me!', 'Exceptional teachers and wonderful people. Course loads are pretty good and prepare students vigorously for college readiness.', 'I attended Jamaica gateway for 4 years. I really love the school, teachers and students. The Academic level was great and they know how to treat students well. One thing I really enjoyed the most about the school are the resources they had for students and also the extracurricular activities  and the school culture. One thing I would love to see improve is the Diversity of the school.', 'Loved the fact that all teachers are kind and helpful. I would like to see a change in scheduling. Shorter days would be nice.', 'This school taught me to be kind to one another. The teachers and the peers are very welcoming. The principal is very kind and comes to check the classes once every two days. Since this school has very few students compared to other High Schools, the students are like family. Everyone is united and everyone knows one another. Also, the teachers and students have good relationships.', 'the student vibe was boring, good environment to stay focus. teaching quality is poor. a wide variety of sports to choose from.', "The school's campus itself is very beautiful, however the classrooms can change a bit. The school could be a little bit cleaner and prettier from the inside. The area the school is in can also be a little better. Its kind of dirty in the area where the school is in. I think most teachers are doing very good. They encourage you to always to good and makes sure we are on track. The guidance counselors constantly help the students. the students, I think most students there are very aware of there academics. Every school has good and bad and I really didn't see the worse of the bad. I never saw anyone getting bullied or harassed or people doing drugs, but then again I am just a freshmen. The security of the school is amazing, they make you go through metal detectors. The best thing about this school is that it offers a lot of diverse programs.Also this school goes with the generation, students have fun with extracurricular activities .", "as a student at the school i must work hard to receive good grades because of how good the teachers are since they're so hard. i learn a lot and i have matured. also, all the hard work is balanced with special (fun) activities we have.", 'My high school experience has been a roller coaster of emotions and challenges. But overall, I had an amazing experience with Jamaica Gateway to the Sciences. My teachers were always willing to help and I have close relationships with most of them. Students come from many parts of the world and are very involved by joining clubs and playing sports. My guidance counselors were always there to guide and keep me on the right track. One thing I would change if I started high school all over again is being more involved from since freshman year. My experience with Jamaica Gateway to the Sciences has been memorable because I made long term friends and have a closer relationship with most of my teachers and guidance counselors.', 'I like how the school is small, safe, and pushes students towards college readiness. There are lots of clubs, programs, and AP classes. ', 'A average variety of classes to choose from', 'Everyone has a chance to fit in and socialize', 'Not competitive and no scouts are available', 'If your not dedicated then you will not push yourself', 'There are only a few teachers that i find interested whether the student learns or not during my four years of high school', "Most of the teachers are helpful in their teaching. There are a few who are not as helpful and the students do not learn the proper material. Each classroom has a Smartboard in which teachers teach their lessons. There is a lot of group activity in certain classes such as English or History and students are to conduct socratic seminars where they discuss a book or a given topic. Teachers often go around and check students' work and some conduct notebook checks to keep students on track."]
column8: ["Jamaica Gateway to the Sciences is a decent school. The teachers are pretty good, there are a lot of clubs to join, and since it's a small school you will feel more comfortable. What I honestly don't like is how a number of classes in the school are limited, especially the ap classes.", "I'm a freshman going into my sophomore year and I have made many friends. The clubs here at the school make it very enjoyable and also make you feel more at home. I'd say the favorite teams that I have bonded with are the swim team and Law team from personal experience. You are given many opportunities throughout the school year and get to go on many trips. The teachers are very welcoming in fact, I don't think there isn't a teacher that I haven't met in some way or another. The school is a little so the teachers can focus on student individually if they require help. There are students that take their academics very seriously when it comes down to it. They have many different sports in this school as well such as the football, swimming, fencing, soccer, volleyball, and softball. The bonds developed with these teams are strong.", 'My experience at Jamaica Gateway was one of much learning and growing. The teachers and faculty always saw my potential and constantly pushed me in the right direction. I am very grateful to have been a part of such a nurturing and community based environment.', 'I am a student at this school, I fine that she school is rather unorganized in certain areas. Then their is the fact that the students have trust issues with some staff members(mainly the councillors), this is only because some of them have a track record for breaking agreements that are made verbally.', 'Jamaica Gateway is an okay school but it is definitely not an great school. (I am a freshman). The principal should be more aware and involved of what is occurring in the classrooms. She needs to ensure she is hiring well-educated and experienced teachers.  Mr. Birch-Wood Taylor also needs to ensure teachers are doing what they are supposed to be doing for the welfare of the students. I rarely saw her in my classrooms, I can only recall her coming to my classroom  one time.  That concerns me!', 'Exceptional teachers and wonderful people. Course loads are pretty good and prepare students vigorously for college readiness.', 'I attended Jamaica gateway for 4 years. I really love the school, teachers and students. The Academic level was great and they know how to treat students well. One thing I really enjoyed the most about the school are the resources they had for students and also the extracurricular activities  and the school culture. One thing I would love to see improve is the Diversity of the school.', 'Loved the fact that all teachers are kind and helpful. I would like to see a change in scheduling. Shorter days would be nice.', 'This school taught me to be kind to one another. The teachers and the peers are very welcoming. The principal is very kind and comes to check the classes once every two days. Since this school has very few students compared to other High Schools, the students are like family. Everyone is united and everyone knows one another. Also, the teachers and students have good relationships.', 'the student vibe was boring, good environment to stay focus. teaching quality is poor. a wide variety of sports to choose from.', "The school's campus itself is very beautiful, however the classrooms can change a bit. The school could be a little bit cleaner and prettier from the inside. The area the school is in can also be a little better. Its kind of dirty in the area where the school is in. I think most teachers are doing very good. They encourage you to always to good and makes sure we are on track. The guidance counselors constantly help the students. the students, I think most students there are very aware of there academics. Every school has good and bad and I really didn't see the worse of the bad. I never saw anyone getting bullied or harassed or people doing drugs, but then again I am just a freshmen. The security of the school is amazing, they make you go through metal detectors. The best thing about this school is that it offers a lot of diverse programs.Also this school goes with the generation, students have fun with extracurricular activities .", "as a student at the school i must work hard to receive good grades because of how good the teachers are since they're so hard. i learn a lot and i have matured. also, all the hard work is balanced with special (fun) activities we have.", 'My high school experience has been a roller coaster of emotions and challenges. But overall, I had an amazing experience with Jamaica Gateway to the Sciences. My teachers were always willing to help and I have close relationships with most of them. Students come from many parts of the world and are very involved by joining clubs and playing sports. My guidance counselors were always there to guide and keep me on the right track. One thing I would change if I started high school all over again is being more involved from since freshman year. My experience with Jamaica Gateway to the Sciences has been memorable because I made long term friends and have a closer relationship with most of my teachers and guidance counselors.', 'I like how the school is small, safe, and pushes students towards college readiness. There are lots of clubs, programs, and AP classes. ', 'A average variety of classes to choose from', 'Everyone has a chance to fit in and socialize', 'Not competitive and no scouts are available', 'If your not dedicated then you will not push yourself', 'There are only a few teachers that i find interested whether the student learns or not during my four years of high school', "Most of the teachers are helpful in their teaching. There are a few who are not as helpful and the students do not learn the proper material. Each classroom has a Smartboard in which teachers teach their lessons. There is a lot of group activity in certain classes such as English or History and students are to conduct socratic seminars where they discuss a book or a given topic. Teachers often go around and check students' work and some conduct notebook checks to keep students on track."]

column2: ['Overall, High School for Environmental Studies was an excellent school. It was a small school so everyone knew each other which I loved. I wanted to be in a school where each teacher knew me personally and that is exactly what I received in this school. The staff and faculty were amazing. They cared for all the students and made sure everyone was on the right path and if we ever needed something, they made sure they had an answer for us.', 'Joining high school for environmental studies was not a terrible choice for me. Of course there was the students which a lot of them seemed like they did not put a lot of effort ,but the administration tried their best to motivate them to learn and graduate.  Some of the students there are extremely motivated and well-behaved and, I am able to make flourishing relationship with them. The teachers I had while there showed that they cared for their students ,and the subject they were learning. Most of the teachers tried to connect to the students ,and make them encouraged to learn. The resources given to us is a little crummy as well as the amount of arts in the place; however , this is counteracted by the fact that the academics are quite good and all the sports clubs we have. So I have enjoyed my High school so far.', 'My experience at Environmental Studies was not bad, nor great.  We have a very good diversity of students and faculty.  While we have a diverse mix of students with different academic and intellectual abilities, the problem that we have at High School for Environmental studies, is that they mix all the students into their classes, without offering honors classes for most of the science courses.  This makes it challenging for our teachers, because they have to go at a pace that will not drown our weaker student.  Some of the students in our classes are so weak in their academic backgrounds that they struggle in these classes.  It forces our teachers to water down the rigor of the course material to the point that our intellectually gifted classmates are not being given the proper course rigor, to further challenge and develop their intellectual abilities.  This is the main problem with our school.  The rest is okay.', 'There is a culture where sports students get away with what they do. Also, just like every school there are fights that happen. School administration is actually starting to change, and I believe that there would be a change soon.', 'I love the community in this school between students, teachers, and staff. As soon as you walk into this school you are bound to always find someone you can talk to or someone you can ask for help. Although this school is some what small, you will always see a familiar face and know the classmates you’ll be spending a few years with. Something I would like to change or improve in this school would be the courses and the variety. However, I’m very glad to see that this upcoming year there has been some new classes added like AP Psychology and AP Chemistry, this means the school is slowly but surely integrating new courses that would actually interest their students.', 'This school has provided a rich experience in diversity and culture for me. There were many different activities and clubs to participate in which where made for students to feel included in the schools community. I believe the academics really helped prepared me for my future career and for attending university.', "This school has many opportunities like scholarships and teachers are attentive and help their students to prepare for college. There is rarely any fights and the teachers don't ignore people", 'This school is nice. I would love to see changes in academic work in a few clubs. This school has a great community and is not judgmental at all. I do not regret going to this school.', "The teachers make a very visible effort to teach and encourage the kids. We are also provided a wide variety of clubs, but I feel like the school could provide more for them. Many of our classes aren't environmentally focused like our school claims to be. There are also many misbehaving students at my school. However, I have and continue to enjoy my experience at the High School for Environmental Studies and it's easy to see that my school is taking strides forward.", "My experience at HSES was overall pretty good. I don't have any complaints about the core curriculum. Although some teachers at this school were careless about the class they were teaching, I really feel like the good teachers outweighed the bad. The majority of the students were not goal oriented and made it difficult for this school to be a safe environment. I would like to see a change in HSES's college advisory department and guidance counselor department. I find it impossible and simply unjust at the fact that there is only one guidance counselor per grade this would mean that each counselor was assigned 400 students. This was just outrageous and made it extremely difficult for students to receive proper and individual care. The college advisory office only had 1 counselor for the entire senior class! There was a lot of negligence when it came to students and their college application process. I would like to see some improvement in this.", "Good school if you know how to take advantage of the programs. High School for Environmental Studies is improving very well. Filled with students who want to improve and like all schools it has some students who don't", 'I graduated from High School For Environmental studies and as the years went by more sports activity clubs were put in. Such as cooking class , yoga. Its all about making the students do something different for them to enjoy.', "I had a great time there. there's a lot of things you can do to get involved and although when i first started at the school it was super bad, I've seen in morph into a great place for all students ( sporty, challenged, hardworking, sciencey, environmental, etc). what i would like to see happen is a better distribution of the funding or simply acquiring more funding because there are certain aspects of a students experience that would greatly improve if we had more, for instance, gym equipment, however, it's not the school's fault per-say. The High School for Environmental Studies is overall a good place for your child to go to.", 'I have been going to this highschool since sophmore year and it has been a good experience. There is a lot of hands on activities such as clubs and sports. Since its a environmental achool there is alot of recycling  and reusing of materials. Overall this high school has been a good experience so far and i would recommend it.', 'It’s ok I guess I mean some rooms have no windows but we have some decent students. I wouldn’t say it’s a terrible school.', 'I think High School of Environmental Studies (or HSES as we students call it) is a school truly built on community and educational pride. At least that is true of those like myself who are in the honors program. I am especially fond of the English teachers, although the other teachers in core and extracurricular subjects do superb jobs as well. But the English teachers really seem to take their job of not only teacher but also as mentors, advisors and supporters seriously and execute that with such professionalism and friendliness.', "My experience in HSES is good because I get academic help if needed, the teachers are dedicated to their work and to making sure students are on the right tracks, I'm always being challenged in class to do better, and they help with preparation for college.", "The people you choose to surround yourself with at this school does effect your high school experience. They tell you that the honors program doesn't matter, the kids who begin in honors classes freshman year are usually the ones offered AP classes in the long run.  If you're looking for a school with an inclusive community, you won't find that here. We have had the same college counselor for god knows how long and that lady needs to be coached on how to actually give students useful information about applying to college. And because it is the same person who has to write over 200 hundred recommendations for the senior class all on her own, they all come out mediocre. The worst part of this school is the system itself, it almost feels like your words are not heard at this school and despite student councilor efforts they never seem to be in favor of the students here.", "What I loved about HSES was the relationship that the students made with the faculty and staff. What I would like to see change is the types of colleges that we are made aware of. Although black students did not make up the majority, it would have been nice to be made aware of HBCU's.", 'I like how the teachers involve the parents and are always there to assist you. I would change the safety. I feel like there could be more police presence outside of the school']

column6: ["My high school soccer was really good. we were division champions in 2017. also, my school offers varieties of college courses, like AP and ESF college courses. what don't like about it is that it is very small and hall ways get pack and causes delays.", 'I loved the teacher at h.s.e.s they are every kind and are good teachers overall. The students were great here also, I made many friends freshmen and sophomore year and kept them throughout the years. What I don’t like is the crowded hallways, there is plenty of traffic that causes lateness.', 'This school has such a crappy environment where teachers give no thought to their work or their students.', "The good things that I liked the high school where I study is that they're aware of the students when it comes to college, students feel more connected to teachers, teachers always there to help us on what we're struggling and we support each other. However, they should work on administration system, not many of us is pleased at all especially with the dates, getting information, notifications sometimes, and how they deal with students when it comes to chaos. Such as fighting, begin disrespectful, etc. so they really need to put those students in place, including the parents too.", 'This school is great at making students feel welcomed. As well with giving students many opportunities with internships and other programs that work with the school. Enjoyed my four years at this school.', "The school was not a terrible school. It presented me with opportunities that were average and within the school's budget. I had to go beyond my school to obtain opportunites that are typically presented at wealthier schools.", "The teachers are always up to helping the student out, no matter what. Many of them even stay after school until the school closes up to make sure that the student understands and got the help they needed. Additionally, the school offers many clubs and sports and you can even start your own club if you don't like the ones already there. It is a great school with a lot of freedom!", 'Poor faculty, weak support system/contributions. Little to no guidance to life or college. Staff were unhappy and it did not cast a positive light on students. Improper disciplinary actions on misconduct.', 'I liked high school for environmental studies because it’s very diversed, Even though it has a lot of students i got to make great friends. The teachers are involved and care about your grades.', "My high school experience was pretty challenging. I was accepted into the honors school which allowed me to take challenging classes like AP courses, and SUNY ESF courses also. The school has many many psal sport teams for both female and male students. The school tries to do their best to be environmentally friendly by composting, and recycling. They offer physics and AP Physics 1 where most schools don't.", 'The school offered me a lot of opportunities in terms of knowledge and college future. The classes are diverse, however some of them lack quality. I would recommend it to people who are in search of their major or want to learn more about environment and people.', 'I would say that Environmental Studies is a really good school because we have teachers devoted to students and their education. We have plenty of classes to choose from and teachers are willing to spend their free time to make sure a student understands the topic and that doesn’t apply to all schools. The people care about each other and they won’t give up until everyone succeeds.', 'High School for Environmental Studies is a diverse school filled with many clubs and ways to be a part of the school community. This is a place where counselors care about fulfilling students needs and helping students prepare for the college process earlier. The classes are challenging with AP courses and Honor classes which helps students prepare for what college is going to be like.', "I was class of 2017 and let me tell you this school gave me the craziest years of my life to date. The laid back vibe allowed the feeling of being able to do anything. Even honors kids by junior and senior year were skipping class everyday and cutting school. It's a pretty bad school with some good things going for it in a cool part of the city.", "I like how there are a lot of clubs and many extra curricular activities available at the school. The school has a safe environment and everyone respects you no matter you skin color or sexual preference which is important to have in a school. Also, I like how it is diverse and you get to meet new people all the time. One thing I would change for the school is have more school spirit because the school doesn't always come together but that is something the students an staff can work on.", "I've had a good 4 years at HSES. This school does have its ups and downs. It's located near Columbus Circle, so commuting is very easy. The teachers are very friendly. There is no bullying whatsoever. The diversity is okay. It's mostly filled with Hispanic kids. But there are also Muslims, Asians, African American, and Polish students. However, the school has a population of about 1200 students so the hallways, especially on the second floor, get extremely crowded. When you walk the halls, you're sure to bump into someone. Another thing is the windows. The school used to be a Fox News Studio so it was never designed to be a high school. A lot of the classrooms on the second and third floor have no windows and get ridiculously hot in the summertime. There's only one door in each room, so it's a big safety hazard. Additionally,  a lot of the students there are very ghetto and unnecessarily loud. A couple of fights happen every year. I'm really gonna miss this school a little.", 'my high school experience was average because there were a lot of things lacking from the school curriculum, we have very good teachers at this school but the work can be boring and thus discouraging the student and taking away some of the excitement from learning.', "What i like about high school for environmental studies has many problem but we fix them where we want help student who don't have money or have problem getting to school late we system to help them so school always get better.", "There are many college level courses in this school which are challenging. The teachers know the material well and they care not only about the students' grades but also their health. There are many fun clubs and sports teams and students can propose ideas about new clubs and sports.", 'There are many challenging course within the school, including college credit classes and AP classes.  The food is the same as any other public NYC school.  The only issue is that parents are not very involved, despite weekly calls and PTA meeting that run at 6pm.']

A lot of the classrooms on the second and third floor have no windows and get ridiculously hot in the summertime. There's only one door in each room, so it's a big safety hazard. Additionally,  a lot of the students there are very ghetto and unnecessarily loud. A couple of fights happen every year. I'm really gonna miss this school a little.", 'my high school experience was average because there were a lot of things lacking from the school curriculum, we have very good teachers at this school but the work can be boring and thus discouraging the student and taking away some of the excitement from learning.', "What i like about high school for environmental studies has many problem but we fix them where we want help student who don't have money or have problem getting to school late we system to help them so school always get better.", "There are many college level courses in this school which are challenging. The teachers know the material well and they care not only about the students' grades but also their health. There are many fun clubs and sports teams and students can propose ideas about new clubs and sports.", 'There are many challenging course within the school, including college credit classes and AP classes.  The food is the same as any other public NYC school.  The only issue is that parents are not very involved, despite weekly calls and PTA meeting that run at 6pm.']

column2: ["Woodbridge High School offers a variety of classes and offered me all the classes that I needed/wanted. The teachers are very good at what they do as well as great with making connections with their students. The athletics here are amazing, as I am captain of our winning and nationally ranked track and cross country team. However, Woodbridge High School can improve on some things. Information can be delivered in a better form. I personally didn't have much trouble finding things out, as my guidance counselor was very helpful, but I hear from other students  that they're constantly misinformed about important things. There's not much that I would change about Woodbridge High School, as it's a very good school already.", 'The teachers are for higher level courses ( honors, Ap) are amazing. They teach very well, always offer extra help, and are very considerate towards their students. Sports and school spirit are also very good as we have 3 pep rally’s throughout the year and have several brand new turf fields on campus. There are many clubs ranging from Christian club to ASL club.  I would like to see some new course offerings, and more dual enrollment programs.', "With my experience at Woodbridge High School I have learned so much about myself. I realized how determined I was for my future and it pushed me to make choices to better my future. Throughout all the struggles I've been through the high school always adapted to what I faced and I had a great support system of teachers and peers. I wouldn't want to end my high school career anywhere else.", 'It was a good experience the educational structure has been revised and improved each year which overall became helpful to my learning.', 'Staff is excellent, very effective while also being friendly and personable. Guidance is very helpful. Offers many different classes and college level courses. Many clubs and sports available as well.', "As a senior this year at Woodbridge High School, I have absolutely loved my time spend these 4 years.I have been very blessed and treated with the up most  love and respect by my teachers and fellow students. If I wasn't for my teachers believing in me I wouldn't be the academic scholar that I am today. I am extremely thankful for all the times they have gone out of their way to help me understand a certain topic in a specific class. Also being a soccer player for my high school there wasn't one time where either Mr. Lottmann, Mrs Panko, or Mr. Perry weren't there supporting my teammates and I. I am forever grateful and thankful to Woodbridge High School for the best 4 years of my life.", "Coming into WHS as a freshman, I was nervous and I didn't know what to expect. But the administration, teachers, and staff, as well as the friends that I made, made my experience at Woodbridge amazing. I just started my senior year, and the school spirit and pride that I have seen this year does not even compare to the past 3 years. I love the class of 2020 and I am so excited for all of the fun events this year!", 'I enjoy going to Woodbridge High School. The teachers make sure that each student gets sufficient help in order for them to succeed. However, the Arts Programs are amazing but do not get enough attention. I would change that. Every AP class enables every kid to get a 5 on their exams. Overall, I would recommend WHS every time.', "For the most part, I had a pleasant experience at Woodbridge. Other than the more than occasional cockroach, WHS is a great place to attend aslong as you get involved and don't make trouble for yourself.", 'I like the public school experience being that I came from a charter school. I wish we could get better prepared for college.', "WHS isn't a terrible school. To me, the worst qualities of the school are the poor food and the bathrooms not being open during passing time. I really do enjoy the willingness of most teachers, except almost all of the gym teachers with the exception of a few, to help you achieve the highest possible grade. Another annoyance is the attendance officer. She's nasty to everyone and there are times that she doesnt excuse absences even with a note. Also beware of roaches.", 'Woodbridge high school keeps good relationships with their students. With a variety of clubs and sports offered to the students, it is hard to stay bored. The high school also offers many AP classes with great teachers that actually understand the material.', 'I like the diversity and how there was always a club or sports team having an event at school. I wish they would put more money into the art classes.', "Woodbridge High School was an experience that shaped me into the person I wanted to be in order to succeed in college. Teachers and Administrators emphasized how important it is to apply for college and taking the SAT's. Diversity was a huge impact in the school , you get to learn about different cultures. The sports team such as volleyball and football was always exciting to watch with the school spirit Woodbridge High School has. I believe the academics can be improved by pushing senior students to take college credit courses. It is imperative to exceed what it means to teach students how to be successful along with resources. As much as Woodbridge High School emphasized how important it is to go to college , resources was something I had to do outside of school. Overall Woodbridge High School was an average experience.", 'The teachers were pretty great except for some. They help as much as they can with anything. It’s easy to build healthy relationships with all of the staff.', "I love woodbridge high school. The administration is amazing and cares so much for the students. The teachers are always offering their help and extra time as well. You never feel like there is nobody for you to turn to and that there is nobody that is able to relate to you and help in any situation. There's nothing  I would change.", "I loved how the teachers are caring and how willing they are to take time out of their day to either come early to school or stay after school with students to help them with classwork they may not understand. I also love the work and effort certain clubs like the interact club put in for the community. For example, every year during the months of October and November they collect non perishable items to make over 55 full Thanksgiving baskets for families in the Woodbridge community and even for families right here in our school that don't have certain opportunities like others. The only concern I have is the building itself needs to be renovated, but other then that the school is great.", 'Woodbridge High School was able to provide a good high school experience for me. I was involved in the many activities they had to offer such as Cheerleading, a Mentors Program, and the National Honor Society. I was also able to find many friends and form solid friendships over the four years. Despite the great experience, one thing I would like to see change is the scheduling of the classes. I would like to have time for homeroom in the mornings to help the students adjust to the educational setting.', 'My daughter graduated from Woodbridge High School in 2018.  She did very well in school and is currently in college.  The teachers and principal are wonderful and she belonged to many clubs .  Great school.', 'Best school in Woodbridge. Teacher and staff are excellent. We have enjoyed being a part of this school. My child is  ready for college.']
