column6: ['Woodbridge High School has what it needs for a good high school. New chromebooks are going to be given to the students which will make learning much different than before with new opportunities.', 'It is such a great school full of diverse clubs and activities and also has an amazing staff of teachers', 'Teachers try their best to prepare you for college, and you meet amazing people. Clubs and sports are great as they teach you teamwork', 'Woodbridge High School is the school that you will never forget, even when you graduate. This school is filled with diversity and is rich with school spirit, great academics and of course.. great people! The staff and the administration makes this school live up to its name. Many teachers make sure that the students are working hard and have the potential needed to carry on in the future. The principal guides the school in the right way with many rules that are in place. Overall, Woodbridge high school is the best school in this state and within our township (Woodbridge). Once you enter the hallways of this school it will feel like home, “cause once your a Barron your always a Barron.”', 'Woodbridge High School is a very good school but it needs help on making students prepared for college by giving them needed and helpful resources.', 'WHS is a great school, but had there been a larger focus on academics and arts over sports it could be a great all-around school.  Academically, the jump from R track to Honors and AP courses felt too drastic, but the courses were still challenging - in a good way.', 'My time at Woodbridge High School was a good experience. I made many new friends and long-lasting bonds. Part of what made my experience enjoyable was that I participated in sports teams and different clubs. In doing that, it gave me the opportunity to meet many different people. I grew up being an introverted person, but my experience at this school allowed me to open up more. This high school is very diverse, so there is always somewhere you can fit in.', 'Woodbridge High is a great  school. The faculty and staff are very dedicated and great at what they do. The student body is very diverse and very involved in all school events and activities. Woodbridge High School is also a very safe learning environment and a great place to be.', 'No school is perfect and that is a fact, but although this school has its ups and downs I don’t regret attending here. The teachers are quite helpful and offer their own personal time to tutor students who may need extra help. Along with the assistance of teachers there is also the impeccable principal, Mr. Lottmann and the two Vice principals Mr. Chiera and Mr. Perry. I have had Mr. Lottmann as my principal for 6 years now and I could not ask for anyone better. This school shaped me into the student I am today and I could not be more proud to be a WHS Barron.', 'Teachers are good and teach well, school is a bit unclean. Good level of diversity in race and in courses you can take.', 'I enjoyed some of the teachers, particularly in the English department. I disliked the cleanliness of the school and how little some teachers cared about their job or their students.', 'The students are very apathetic but the teachers are willing to give 110% for those that want it!! If you surround yourself with the right people and environment, you will be okay. Classes are very good and some teachers are truly excellent.', "The school isn't really too engaging, and everyone seems apathetic. There are some academic rules in place that are kinda pointless as well. The school is old and there's an inside joke about the cockroaches. But the biggest problem I think is the lack of communication between the administration and the students and the lack of real college prep. I didn't even meet with my guidance counselor until October of senior year, while some kids at other schools have everything done before the summer of junior year. It made applying to top schools a lot more difficult since it involved cramming everything last-minute. On the bright side, the teachers are really engaging and want their students to succeed. The principal/VP is very friendly. There are lots of classes to choose from, even if they are restricted. The school is also improving too, adding technology and taking steps to cater to high achieving students (AP scholars program, Pre-AP coming in the future)", 'All the teachers really do try and set you up for achieving greatness. Great environment with a very fun experience.', "It's a nice place, can improve a lot of things but it is not a bad place to go to school at. The principal is friendly, the teachers are mostly friendly and helpful as well.", 'Woodbridge High School is becoming worse and worse by the years. More of a hostile environment then a learning environment. The displinary actions are also harsh for the students. How about instead of suspending kids for multiple days we make a after school program which the kids who got into an altercation face front to front with the kid they had problems with and talk it out and resolve the problem. Harsh punishments aren’t the way for kids futures.', 'Woodbridge High School is a diverse school. It has really good teachers that care about the students. It can improve in academics.', "I'm about to begin my senior year at Woodbridge High and overall my personal experience has been pretty good. The teachers are helpful and the principal is very friendly. The building is old and needs work but besides that I don't really have any complaints.", 'I am about to be a senior at Woodbridge High School and I have had an overall good experience. The teachers are excellent and the school environment is very friendly.Every morning when I walk to school the principle gives mostly everyone he sees a nice hello or good morning. There are also many different types of activities and clubs that students can be interested in like the art and drama club. There are many clubs that satisfies the many different interest in students.There are also many sports that a student can easily join.', 'A lot of the teachers, in my opinion, do not belong there. There were many stupid, irrelevant rules in place. I did, however, have some meaningful teachers and experiences.']

column2: ['My experience in woodlands was kind of mixed Beacuse of how diverse it was and how people interacted with each other but the teacher are good in the school but the food is not good at all and some of the administration could be bad sometimes over all my experience was great in the sense is that I was able to meet people that were very different and teacher that were very helpful and nice', 'The academics at the school could be improved. The physical environment needs major improvements as it is very outdated. Some of the technology can be improved or updated. The classroom materials are outdated and need to be replaced. There is a wide range of different types of teachers. There is a lot of diversity in the school.', "I generally liked my experience a lot. The clubs are fun and engaging, the teachers i've had all cared about me and other students, and there are great opportunities to explore possible career paths through programs like BOCES. The only real issue I have with the school is perhaps the hall monitors. They're all very nice and friendly, but it seems like that gets in the way of them actually doing their job.", "Compared to the schools around it Woodlands is a very small school, which many students like because you grow up and graduate with people you've known your entire life if you grew up in the district. Yet other students may dislike due to again, everyone knowing each other. Due to it being such a small school it is very easy to create strong bonds and good relationships with your guidance counselors and your teachers. They are always willing to help as long as you make sure to ask for the help. Students can easily start their own clubs, however the school lacks school spirit.", 'I\'am a Junior in  Woodlands and  this experience has been awful. There is a lot of fights and teachers are very rude. A lot of the teachers threaten kids and instead of helping them learn they make them feel worse about their selves. The school lunch is nasty and tends to be unhealthy at times, they serve awful pizza everyday and their meat can be over cooked or un cooked. The " monitors" speak to kids as if they\'re there age with lots of cursing, I have experienced a Spanish teachers talk about me and my peers in Spanish knowing we do not know the language and being called out by another by-racial student. I advise anyone and EVERYONE not to come to the school.', 'The school does a bad job at allocating our income, we have bought 4 televisions but somehow can still not fix the chipping paint or the holes in the wall, most teachers are not the best and we could do better, also the teachers/ monitors could improve their behavior towards students. The school lunch is served by a company named aramark, they also sever foods to correctional facilities, once there was a maggot outbreak in the food, there are also many fights at out school, you should not choose this school.', "Woodlands on the outside can seem like an ordinary public high school. What I think sets Woodlands apart from other schools is the close connection you build with the teachers and guidance counselors. Both, the teachers and guidance counselors, work hard to make sure that each student is getting the help that they need. However, they won't give you that help if you don't learn to ask for it. There are many different cultures among the students which produces an diverse and inclusive learning environment for everyone.", 'Woodlands is a pretty good school and I feel does an excellent job of preparing its students for the future. There are some poor aspects but I feel every student truly has a fair chance with each other.', 'I liked how everyone was so close because it was so small. The teachers were very involved with everyone.', 'Woodlands was a very diverse school with teacher that were willing to help you out one on one at any time.', 'Woodlands is a great place to learn. My mother and aunt went there, it is so cool to follow in their footsteps! The staff is great and you can tell they truly care of the wellness of the students. They’re very helpful and encourage us to reach our full potential. It isn’t a big school compared to others which is good because everyone knows of or knows each other. The food is not bad, they have an assortment of options. I have to admit they should have more vegetarian options for students/staff. Overall if I ever come back to Westchester I would definitely send my future kids there!', "Classes are great but as in every school, there will always be those students that are not the best behaved. Many courses to choose from. College English classes are made available by SUNY Westchester Community College and you can receive up to 3 college credits. Many people are there to help you. Small school but they seem to focus on you more since they don't have to worry about a thousand kids. Having a small population lets there be some clarity on the who needs what or who did what. Not enough funds to have plenty of sports like spring soccer or lacrosse.", "I transferred to Woodlands as a junior from Pleasantville High School. Because the school isn't very diverse, adjusting was difficult for me. Once I became familiar with the school and all the opportunities it has to offer, it was smooth sailing. The school allows for your creativity to blossom and I am able to express myself however I please. I will never be able to thank Woodlands enough for the opportunities I have received thus far and the friendships that I will cherish for a lifetime.", 'My high school is very diverse, we have many people from a lot of different cultural backgrounds that attend. Being that my high school is particularly smaller than other neighboring schools, we all know each other and are a close-knit community. Within our small environment, we have dozens of teachers that are committed to seeing all of their students succeed. Each marking period, the number of students on the honor roll sky rockets. At the end of every year, the staff is also very proud to see the increasing number of graduating students. What I like the most about my school is that we all push each other to do better and are always encouraging and open to helping other students. Something I would change however, would be the variety of opportunities. I feel that if we have a bit more variety, more students would want to become more involved in bettering their high school experience.', "The teachers are great, they are so caring for the students, they are involved in the students life, but the students don't seem to care about life after high school. Of course not all students are like this, there is like a handful of kids that care about where they go and their life after high school. I wish it wasn't like this because there are a lot of smart kids in this school..", 'Woodlands give its students quality education. High School students will have all that they need to be college ready. Numerous opportunities to succeed are offered in the classroom and outside of the classroom. There is a broad list of clubs/sports to choose from at Woodlands Senior High School. The administration and involved parents guide students in the right direction.', 'BOCES was nice course to have in my school schedule everyday as it prepared myself for what I may want to major in, in a college when searching for one.', 'Woodlands was a great school I enjoyed it very much. My school offered so many opportunities such as Boces which allowed me to get my cosmotology license straight out of highschool and clubs such as key club , great potential , national honors society , fencing , gardening club  and drama club whiched helped not only me but my friends really contribute our time in ways we can benefit our school and community while enjoying the experience. Working through all these clubs never felt like a chore it was always just enjoyable even if we are picking trash off the ground , working in the soup kitchen , or even spending our summers mentoring children with special needs.', 'This school needs major improvement. The building is in a terrible condition. There are windows that can\'t even close in some classrooms, paint chipping off the walls, and a permanent film of dust on the floors, no matter how many times a janitor is seen pushing a broom around. The food is somewhat edible, but over time you learn not to eat just about half of the stuff that is served. Faculty engagement with the students is OK, but some "monitors" take things a little too far.', 'Great Teachers make the experience better tolerable. The students are very ethnic and diverse tho some of them are irritating']
column4: ['My experience in woodlands was kind of mixed Beacuse of how diverse it was and how people interacted with each other but the teacher are good in the school but the food is not good at all and some of the administration could be bad sometimes over all my experience was great in the sense is that I was able to meet people that were very different and teacher that were very helpful and nice', 'The academics at the school could be improved. The physical environment needs major improvements as it is very outdated. Some of the technology can be improved or updated. The classroom materials are outdated and need to be replaced. There is a wide range of different types of teachers. There is a lot of diversity in the school.', "I generally liked my experience a lot. The clubs are fun and engaging, the teachers i've had all cared about me and other students, and there are great opportunities to explore possible career paths through programs like BOCES. The only real issue I have with the school is perhaps the hall monitors. They're all very nice and friendly, but it seems like that gets in the way of them actually doing their job.", "Compared to the schools around it Woodlands is a very small school, which many students like because you grow up and graduate with people you've known your entire life if you grew up in the district. Yet other students may dislike due to again, everyone knowing each other. Due to it being such a small school it is very easy to create strong bonds and good relationships with your guidance counselors and your teachers. They are always willing to help as long as you make sure to ask for the help. Students can easily start their own clubs, however the school lacks school spirit.", 'I\'am a Junior in  Woodlands and  this experience has been awful. There is a lot of fights and teachers are very rude. A lot of the teachers threaten kids and instead of helping them learn they make them feel worse about their selves. The school lunch is nasty and tends to be unhealthy at times, they serve awful pizza everyday and their meat can be over cooked or un cooked. The " monitors" speak to kids as if they\'re there age with lots of cursing, I have experienced a Spanish teachers talk about me and my peers in Spanish knowing we do not know the language and being called out by another by-racial student. I advise anyone and EVERYONE not to come to the school.', 'The school does a bad job at allocating our income, we have bought 4 televisions but somehow can still not fix the chipping paint or the holes in the wall, most teachers are not the best and we could do better, also the teachers/ monitors could improve their behavior towards students. The school lunch is served by a company named aramark, they also sever foods to correctional facilities, once there was a maggot outbreak in the food, there are also many fights at out school, you should not choose this school.', "Woodlands on the outside can seem like an ordinary public high school. What I think sets Woodlands apart from other schools is the close connection you build with the teachers and guidance counselors. Both, the teachers and guidance counselors, work hard to make sure that each student is getting the help that they need. However, they won't give you that help if you don't learn to ask for it. There are many different cultures among the students which produces an diverse and inclusive learning environment for everyone.", 'Woodlands is a pretty good school and I feel does an excellent job of preparing its students for the future. There are some poor aspects but I feel every student truly has a fair chance with each other.', 'I liked how everyone was so close because it was so small. The teachers were very involved with everyone.', 'Woodlands was a very diverse school with teacher that were willing to help you out one on one at any time.', 'Woodlands is a great place to learn. My mother and aunt went there, it is so cool to follow in their footsteps! The staff is great and you can tell they truly care of the wellness of the students. They’re very helpful and encourage us to reach our full potential. It isn’t a big school compared to others which is good because everyone knows of or knows each other. The food is not bad, they have an assortment of options. I have to admit they should have more vegetarian options for students/staff. Overall if I ever come back to Westchester I would definitely send my future kids there!', "Classes are great but as in every school, there will always be those students that are not the best behaved. Many courses to choose from. College English classes are made available by SUNY Westchester Community College and you can receive up to 3 college credits. Many people are there to help you. Small school but they seem to focus on you more since they don't have to worry about a thousand kids. Having a small population lets there be some clarity on the who needs what or who did what. Not enough funds to have plenty of sports like spring soccer or lacrosse.", "I transferred to Woodlands as a junior from Pleasantville High School. Because the school isn't very diverse, adjusting was difficult for me. Once I became familiar with the school and all the opportunities it has to offer, it was smooth sailing. The school allows for your creativity to blossom and I am able to express myself however I please. I will never be able to thank Woodlands enough for the opportunities I have received thus far and the friendships that I will cherish for a lifetime.", 'My high school is very diverse, we have many people from a lot of different cultural backgrounds that attend. Being that my high school is particularly smaller than other neighboring schools, we all know each other and are a close-knit community. Within our small environment, we have dozens of teachers that are committed to seeing all of their students succeed. Each marking period, the number of students on the honor roll sky rockets. At the end of every year, the staff is also very proud to see the increasing number of graduating students. What I like the most about my school is that we all push each other to do better and are always encouraging and open to helping other students. Something I would change however, would be the variety of opportunities. I feel that if we have a bit more variety, more students would want to become more involved in bettering their high school experience.', "The teachers are great, they are so caring for the students, they are involved in the students life, but the students don't seem to care about life after high school. Of course not all students are like this, there is like a handful of kids that care about where they go and their life after high school. I wish it wasn't like this because there are a lot of smart kids in this school..", 'Woodlands give its students quality education. High School students will have all that they need to be college ready. Numerous opportunities to succeed are offered in the classroom and outside of the classroom. There is a broad list of clubs/sports to choose from at Woodlands Senior High School. The administration and involved parents guide students in the right direction.', 'BOCES was nice course to have in my school schedule everyday as it prepared myself for what I may want to major in, in a college when searching for one.', 'Woodlands was a great school I enjoyed it very much. My school offered so many opportunities such as Boces which allowed me to get my cosmotology license straight out of highschool and clubs such as key club , great potential , national honors society , fencing , gardening club  and drama club whiched helped not only me but my friends really contribute our time in ways we can benefit our school and community while enjoying the experience. Working through all these clubs never felt like a chore it was always just enjoyable even if we are picking trash off the ground , working in the soup kitchen , or even spending our summers mentoring children with special needs.', 'This school needs major improvement. The building is in a terrible condition. There are windows that can\'t even close in some classrooms, paint chipping off the walls, and a permanent film of dust on the floors, no matter how many times a janitor is seen pushing a broom around. The food is somewhat edible, but over time you learn not to eat just about half of the stuff that is served. Faculty engagement with the students is OK, but some "monitors" take things a little too far.', 'Great Teachers make the experience better tolerable. The students are very ethnic and diverse tho some of them are irritating']
column6: ['I entered Woodlands Senior High School in the middle of Sophomore year. Being an introvert on top of a new student I expected to  feel uncomfortable the majority of the time. Surprisingly, I instantly felt as if I were in the school for years already, with everyone making an effort to make me feel comfortable. The students were far more outgoing than any other people previously made interactions with which build a strong foundation of trust and security. At Woodlands they have a wide range of classes and are very flexible when making schedules that are beneficial to the students needs and wants. I have been exposed to various opportunities, encountered the most authentic people, became knowledgeable on things that interest me, and I realize that I would have never been able to receive that elsewhere.', 'Senior year for me was the most exciting year at woodlands. Senior year was filled with fun activities and great memories. During my senior year my mom, who recently passed away, was sick. Begging and school was my escape I was surrounded my positive vibes and support that got me through the year.', 'Woodlands High School was a really "unique" experience. Well, if you looked up my school I graduated from, you might find a colorful history of shady backgrounds. I suppose it was above me and hardly affected me on a personal level. Therefore the school overall was kind of strange hard to describe about how students behaved as a result of this colorful history. However, I can most definitely vouch for a number of teachers who were absolutely excellent, honest, tenacious in educating, and with high regard for helping every student when needed. The teachers here are most definitely kind, and I will never forget the knowledge they have given me for college. Without there efforts, I wouldn\'t have been over prepared for college.', 'Woodlands High School is a very diverse community with the feel of a small tight knit community. Going here has and still is an experience, everyone is encouraged to develop their individuality. Teachers are very different which gives students a chance to learn and think differently.', 'I love how there are a lot of school events and that most teachers and students get along. They could raise some fundraisers for money for the school because they could use that money to hire enough teachers. They could also use the money for some new equipments for the science department, music&arts department, and etc.', 'The clubs offered are very diverse. They range from knitting club to robotics. There are various academic clubs and culture clubs to help the students become knowledgeable adults in the future.', 'The teachers here take the time to not only teach the students but to make sure each student understands the lesson.\r They offer after school help and coaching and additional projects and study aids to help the student excel.', 'My experience with this school and district as a whole has been wonderful.  I was warned years ago that the senior high school was dangerous and would not benefit my child. I highly disagree. I have found the senior school to be just as safe as any other school and the teachers to be nurturing.', 'Most teachers do the best they can to ensure that the student is retaining and comprehending the information that is being taught. Teacher set a time of availability for the students so that they can receive the extra help needed.', 'the building is safe, and in case of an emergency we always have procedures to follow to be careful such as lock-downs', 'The clubs in the school give access to fun and interesting trips.', 'The school helps you grow as a person due to the diversity within our community.', "Most teachers I've had are very caring and helpful, some I even consider friends which is nice.", "like any high school, there's gossip and rumors that you never knew about yourself", "Our school is small, so in terms of the student population and the experience of teachers, there aren't lot of AP courses as I would like available. (One of my AP teacher is completely new to AP, so uh, i might fail :)) We only have 10? to choose from, APWH I, APWH II, APES, AP Bio, AP Chem, AP English, AP Lan, AP Studio Art (drawing), AP Spanish, AP USH and Calculus AB. I'd like to have a AP Microeconomics, macroeconomics, Calculus BC, art history, psychology, Mandarin, Physics C, Latin and Comparative Gov. I'd take these Aps over any electives any day!", "The students aren't as involved in extracurriculars as they are sports, which include basketball, tennis, soccer, fencing, wrestling, cross country and track. There should be more, like badminton and archery, (we are in the middle of the woods after all!) And fencing is a great varsity sport that isn't available at most schools, a great excuse to play with swords! And tennis should be all genders like track, not separated into different seasons.\r Like the sports, there are clubs, but not as much as I would like. Granted, we aren't BxSci, so the student population is small. Rather than a mere gardening club, or Great Potential (does that even help???), it'd be great for a SNHS, NAHS, NEHS, Science Olympiad", 'Some of the teachers are great, where they\'ve hit the topics that would show up on the test, bullseye! Some tried to covered everything, and I mean EVERYTHING, including the topics that woulnd\'t show up on the test at all, (luckily, I didn\'t have him, but had noticed from the review sheets from regents prep, ugh.) And finally, there is the teacher who is new and just "winging it," so now watch us fail the AP exam. I just wish most of them had passion and would give actually good lectures, instead of the rambling and then suddenly throw piles of workload at us.', "I've rarely seen bullying, at least not more than being the mild case. There are no security guards, but there are the monitors, which are meh. The police have only visited on emergencies or when a student was severely misbehaving. The new school nurse is great! Last year's, (2014) was absolutely terrible, and rude at the very first minute you met her. The new school nurse is nice, although she lost my physical... Overall, the safety of us students was kept well on the few occasions we've could've been in danger,  showing the good measures the teachers and principal have made.", 'Most of the teachers I haven engaged with through my journey in Woodlands always helped me to be the best.  Many teachers often combined art and science in to classroom lessons. Allowing students to both be creative but learn through technology. The teachers create a safe space for students, allowing them to vent when in trouble.', "School security isn't the best, but monitors constantly patrol the halls and school perimeter. School nurse changes every year, but they are usually pretty reliable. I never felt endangered during my time at the school."]

column1: Robert H. Goddard High School of Communication Arts & Technology
column2: ["My experience with this school was very great. They offered a variety of classes, clubs, college advantages, and one on one relationship with the teachers and staff. The only thing I didn't like was the fact that I couldn't graduate early.", 'The school is well kept and clean. The teachers and students are very nice and supporting. However I would love to have more clubs, such as a music club, as well as more sports such as volley ball.', "At Robert H. Goddard High School, you never felt alone. That's the perk of going to a small school. You have all your teachers available for you academically and if ever need someone to talk to. Our principal was always there to greet us students in the morning and throughout the day in the halls.", 'My high school counselor helped me a lot with my college applications and she was involved with me throughout the whole process. As it’s a small high school, teachers know the student very well and helped the students throughout their school year with the areas they need help with. My Counselors and teachers prepared me for college and shaped me in a student that now I am today.', 'My experience being a student here is that it is a very small school, which plays a part in a good teacher to student relationship. Most of the teachers are very supportive and if you are having trouble with a subject they will help you. There is also a good selection of clubs and extracurriculars, but we could use some more. There are also a lot of ways to get involved at the school. Despite all the positives, I think in terms of academics/curriculum there is a lot of room to grow. Overall, I think that the staff and teachers try their best to help you succeed.', 'It is a very small school in which everyone is close enough to know each other. They have a very safe environment and a lot more programs than one would expect. They offer many AP courses and encourage students to take them and also help them be well prepared for college.', "I enjoy how small the school is which allows us to be close with one another and build bonds that you wouldn't have in a bigger school. Overall, the school is good and the faculty is very welcoming to students, parents and visitors.", "When applying to RGHS, many representatives made sure to inform me that the school was small, and when I applied their was only about 530 students enrolled. Nothing is more prominent to me, not only is the school small population wise, but the campus is a single floor, in the building of a middle school. The high school and the middle school also aren't always on the best terms so that also makes things difficult when it comes to navigating the school during certain times and planning events, since the campus is shared and they do not own any outdoor space. The small size may me better for some applicants though because the relationships between the students and teachers are much more comfortable and close.", 'Being a senior has made me realized how much of a family this school has been.  It is a tight-knit school because it is small and everyone knows each other.', 'Robert H. Goddard is a great high school, it has amazing teachers and it offers many AP classes. Goddard high school also gives the students opportunities to take college classes in school and also at Plaza College. The school also plans many events for the students such as our fall festival and multicultural event. There are many sports and clubs for students to participate in.', 'I like how the teachers connect with the students and their understanding of how the students are. However, AP Macro, a newly developed AP class at this school needs improvement.', 'At Robert H Goddard High School it has a lot of different classes. Teachers for the most part are supportive and know what they are doing.', 'My school is great. It provided many help for me to pass the year. The teachers are on top of everything. The teacher makes sure we are all on task and have everything done in time. My school provide many extra activities so we are connected.', 'This school is amazing. It has it all. It may not be considered as a real high school but it is safe.', 'Robert H. Goddard is a great school that offers so many opportunities. It is a place where one feels loved and safe.', 'During my high school years in Robert H. Goddard, I have had many wonderful experiences. The teachers who work there was always trying their best to help the students at any given time. The faculty members are constantly trying to improve conditions at the school to keep things new and refreshed. Students treat each other with respect and the school has a strict anti-bullying policy.', "Robert H Goddard High School is an above average high school. Throughout my time here, I believe that this school has a lot to offer for the type of school it is. This school is a good academic school, and offers many AP courses and allows students to challenge themselves if they please. Some people do not like schools with a large student count. This school only has 611 students enrolled between 9th and 12th grade. The hallways are usually filled but it clears up quickly. There is little acts of bullying or picking on certain students. Students here are friendly and the teachers are nice. The teachers are willing to help students improve overall as a student. The staff is great and keep the students in check. Overall, I believe this school is a good school if you don't want your child going to a highly populated school or if you want them close to home.", 'Robert H. Goddard High School is an overall great school because of the teachers and diversity of the students in my opinion. You will never feel like an outcast or be left out in lessons, the teachers are there to guide you and educate you to the best of their abilities. I enjoy coming to this school for what it is.', "Overall, Robert H Goddard is a decent school. The school feels safe and creates a friendly environment. The teachers are usually proficient at teaching and always offer extra help if needed. However, the school is very small (limited to one floor), and therefore lacks clubs, sports teams, elective classes, and AP classes. I have enjoyed my time at Goddard, but still wish it wasn't as small of a school.", 'This school does not have a lot to offer the students, we are college prepared but some of the teachers do not care too much. The lunch is terrible, and we do not have a lot of sports or space.']

column6: ['Since it is such a small school, certain things are missing from your typical high school experience but it’s still a pretty solid one. You are able to develop a close relationship with teachers and the rest of faculty but I wish some things could be different.', 'My experience at Goddard is amazing, and I am doing so well in this school. The school offers AP classes and lots of after school clubs and sports and the environment is really safe.', 'Robert H. Goddard has provided me with a safe and comfortable learning environment of which allowed me to be able to focus on a variety of studies. This school prepares you for college from the minute you enter the doors during your freshman year and encouragement is always provided.', 'Robert H Goddard High school is a small school that is so helpful through the process of college readiness. The faculty makes sure that all the students from day one of freshman year until the last day of senior year are prepared for college', "The school is really diverse. It is a small school however, the teachers care about each and every student's grades.", "My experience at Robert H Goaddrd has been great! I made so many different friends and have been around many different religions, cultures, ethnicity, etc. I've been apart of the sports team at my school and my average har remained at a 90 average. I wish that my school was bigger and more freedom.", "My experience at Robert H. Goddard has been amazing, to be very honest. The staff and overall community has taught me so much and the teachers allowed me to progress as a person for my benefit. I have been taught so much at this school and I don't want my high school experience to end. The community is really secure and I wouldn't have wanted to go anywhere else, other than this high school when I'm looking back on it.", "Robert Goddard High School is largely like a family. Because of the small population, students really get to know their teachers, and each individual is prioritized. The staff members, especially the guidance counselors, are always there to help and most student's even feel comfortable talking to the principal. It is a small school and it took some time to adjust to it, but besides the size, it's one of the best High Schools in Queens.", 'I have had a very positive experience at this school including the teachers, students and administration. The administration truly cares about each student and wants them to do well.', "In this high school you will learn maturity and different ways to overcome your obstacles. When I first started at this school I didn't get what I expected. First and foremost there were a lot of white kids, and Indian kids, and spanish. But there weren't many blacks. I was wondering how will I fit into this school. But the teachers welcomes you with open arms, and once you get to know the students you will realize it isn't such a bad school. Academically the school challenges you to do the best you can, however teachers makes plenty mistakes. Also the teachers have an attitude towards you when it isn't your fault. But there are teachers that you can trust and go to for support but for the most part you can't.", 'This school maybe a small school indeed, but has a lot of amazing classes with the best teachers anyone could imagine. And all these teachers really work hard along with the students to make sure the students are always on task and also makes sure that the student understands the topic that they are taught in class. One thing I would really love if the school really connected with other College Readiness programs like College Now, Upward Bound Programs, Educational Talent Search and many more. Because alot of students in the school get deprived of those wonderful advantages and to search on your own takes alot of ones time.', 'While Goddard has great teachers and curriculum, it definitely does not provide a true high school experience. The school utilizes one floor of a building combined with a middle school, thus limiting the size of the high school. However, it provides a tighter community within the students and the teachers care about the students.', "I've had a good experience here. The teachers are wonderful and the amount of work I've received will prepare me for college. Being here, my knowledge expanded. It is safe, has update technology resources and the faculty is caring. ", "It's a great school for only being one floor. Holds same possibilities as other schools but lacks in some places.", 'Most of them care greatly for the students and want the best for them even when they want to give up.', 'THEY ARE ALMOST ALL TERRIBLE.', "This school is really safety and I haven't seen anyone being bullied in my four years of this school.", 'The extracurricular opportunity at this school is really good because there are so many activities and clubs that you can participate and they are exciting and educative.', 'My experience at this school so far is great Because I got chances to get involved in good activities such volunteering in Laso, Cosa , etc..', 'Teacher in my school treat every student equal and respect their responses. They also help student when they are struggling in somethings.']
column8: ['Since it is such a small school, certain things are missing from your typical high school experience but it’s still a pretty solid one. You are able to develop a close relationship with teachers and the rest of faculty but I wish some things could be different.', 'My experience at Goddard is amazing, and I am doing so well in this school. The school offers AP classes and lots of after school clubs and sports and the environment is really safe.', 'Robert H. column1: Dwight Morrow High School/Academies at Englewood
column2: ["This school has potential, but it's ultimately wasted by the administration. The school has gone through so much administration and they still can't get it right. I feel like I'm constantly in danger due to the number of fights that happen at the school. The bathrooms cannot be used normally, the students do things in the bathroom that just don't make any sense. Most of the staff have no clue what they're doing, but there are some who are really great but are shadowed by the constant issues in the school. The diversity doesn't even matter because it has nothing to do the education. Overall, the school is pretty poor, only due to the administration, but it's not like the student body is any better.", "I'm a senior at the Academies at Englewood, and the main problems that we've been having are with the administration. This year is the 3rd new principal our school has had since I came here. Everything  is disorganized and it seems that nobody knows what is going on. For example, in September they told us senior internships would start in October. It is now the end of October and they're saying they will start in either December or January. This school is a mess.", "My experience at DMAE has been very good so far. As a junior currently, I can say that this school has helped me become a more accomplished student overall. The main source of my progression is a mix of friendly competition and personal motivation combined. Though, I would say that the school missed the 5-star mark because there are various inconveniences that occur due to disorganization. For example, I would be marked as a tardy truant despite having a doctor's note. Other than that, I would recommend the academy program to any student who is highly motivated to succeed academically and not fall under pressure.", "Dwight Morrow has a very entertaining marching band as well as a good band instructor. The administration here doesn't care about the students and seeing them succeed. There are very few courses preparing students for college. There is a lot of violence here as well as most things being disorganized. The students barely care or put in effort because the faculty doesn't.", "Dwight Morrow High School is not your average high school. Being that it is located in Englewood, NJ, you would have lots of thoughts on the school. It could either be bad or good, depending on which part of town you're familiar with. I grew up on the good side of Englewood so I only experienced the bad because of troubled students. The education varies, because there are some really good teachers and a lot of bad teachers. There is no school spirit what so ever and the sport teams are horrible. Dwight Morrow focuses and cares a lot for the football team and a bit of the boys soccer and no one else. Their music and arts field is okay. This is school is very diverse, ranging from students in and out of town. The food is terrible, but you can't really expect much from a high school I guess.", 'Dwight Morrow High School is such a strange experience. The fellow students in the school are second to none but the administration has been consistent in failing students and even teachers to meet reasonable expectation. There are many different possibilities available in the school but schedules are very restricting.', 'I believe the students are treated like children rather than young adults and discipline is necessary but can get too far', 'I like that Dwight Morrow is a very inclusive school that is very diverse. The campus is beautiful and spacious which gives students tons of mobility. Dwight Morrow presents its students with tons of resources and opportunities to express themselves creatively such as "Englewood Idol" and Diversity Day. What I dislike is how unorganized the school is ran and how things do not get done in a timely manner.', 'One thing I liked about Dwight morrow was that it was very diverse. There was no discrimination and there were people from all types of different countries. They had many clubs and activities for us to do and even had a “safe space” in which everyone is welcome. I also like that there were plenty of listening adults there so growing a bond with some teacher and weren’t a problem. Security even build bonds with the students and try to help the students stay out of trouble which a lot of school can’t relate to. I had a wonderful time at my high school for the most part and I’m glad I attended.', "Studying here was a one of a kind start to pursuing my passion for the medical field. As prestigious as this sounds, I noticed soon that quality of education and administration began to diminish. The school had no control over students and some teachers weren't dedicated to making sure the material was understood. The school went through three different principals in 4 years. I never really got to know any of them. I took a math class my sophomore year in which we were doing all work through the internet. The teacher seemed to be there just to help here and there. Then, she disappeared for months. I fell behind in math drastically. Also, there are multiple problematic teachers, some of them racist, that cannot be fired as they are hard to replace. The school looks great from the outside, but needs reform on the inside.", "Overall, the Englewood Academies is a wonderful high school with an enriching atmosphere, diverse student body, and groundbreaking curriculum. One of the best high school experiences in the world, this school offers an extraordinary variety of clubs, activities, courses, and opportunities for a successful future. The Academies bestow all of their students with the impeccable standards of excellence they possess, empowering them with the foundations needed for success in today's standards of life and living. Thriving in the Academies is both challenging but experiential, as it fosters a simulation of the workload, environment, and endeavor in college and beyond.", 'Great School. When I first got into this school I was really upset but as time went on I started participating in activities and had a lot of fun. Teachers are great. Homework is a lot but it is a Technical School so, you should ask for it and be ready.', 'What I liked about Dwight Morrow High school is that the teachers were very nice and made an effort to connect with students. What I would like to see change is the curriculum.', "Dwight Morrow High School/ Academies@Englewood has great programs to offer. They allow students to take AP courses, honors, or dual enrollment classes. At the Academies the students take core classes but they have a focus of either bio-med, pre-engineering, law and public safety, or finance. I transferred to this school two years ago and it was very easy for me to adjust. One things the school can work on getting things done faster. You practically have to beg them to get something done. Also, some of the teachers I've had did not teach me and just gave the class busy work. Overall the school is okay for a public school.", 'I really enjoyed going to Dwight Morrow. It was very diverse in many areas, from the classrooms to the students. I met so many different ethnicities that I learned so much about them I. Such a short period of time. The teachers did an excellent job of preparing students with college readiness, there were even a variety of sports,clubs and activities to reach all students. From the most popular to the nerdiest student, the loudest to the quietest.', 'Dwight Morrow High School has many great programs to partake in and gives access to many great AP and dual enrollment courses. The school is also very diverse.', 'Teachers, counselors, and other staff are very easy to form relationships with, and most of them are helpful and care enough to make sure you are doing well. The school is very helpful for college/career readiness as long as the student puts in effort as well.', "Bad teachers can't teach math or reading and tell students not to learn from their parents.  Predatory alienation to kids to keep them from being protected by their parents.  Bad school violent and 'tough' and they will go after you if your kids report bullying even sending corrupt New Jersey DCPP to drug and steal your kids!   Be aware and take your kids elsewhere.   Bergen County Judge recently ruled behavioral modification to kids and Dwight Morrow High School  with terrible psychotropic drugs and black box anti-depressants that can cause suicide and should never ever be given to children is not only a good practice but any parents complaining must be unstable and should lose their kids.  This has been documented and is the worst anywhere.", 'The atmosphere between the 2 programs on campus is really nice and the overall campus is so pretty and open. The teachers are hardworking and dedicated to help you learn, but the administration is quite bad at the moment and needs to be fixed.', "The classes were average not to difficult but not easy. There were a lot of clicks and groups and if you were not in one you didn't have many friends.  From an athletic side they only cared about football and basketball, even if a team had a good record it wasn't acknowledged."]

column6: ["I love how most of the teachers were so kind and they weren't always just teachers but they were people that I felt comfortable talking with. I love my teachers. Also the guidence counselors were the best ans they were there for me when i needed to talk. I wish the education we were getting was more up to par with what other schools are doing.", 'Cool activities like march madness and diversity day. Chemistry and math department lacking. Entire schedule format and many other things change yearly. The only place to print, or to go when no class is library, which is sometimes in use or full. Removed free periods school year of 2016, yet levels of work and amount of group projects (with students all over bergen county) remains the same. No mandatory clubs/many unknown clubs. Very few electives (<2).', 'Some amazing teachers and students, everyone gets screwed over by administration and the place is only going downhill. Wish communication and school spirit would improve', "Sometimes it felt like having the Englewood public school, Dwight Morrow, share the same campus with the Academies created competing cultures. Students from both buildings took classes in the other which muddled the point of having the different programs. The academies' students added greatly to the diversity that already exists in Englewood. The campus felt like a small-scale model of a global community!", "What i like about Dwight Morrow High school is the diversity. It's a diverse high school, but we are all friends. I would like Dwight Morrow to change the food, it's disgusting and we need to eat healthier.", 'The school has provided a pretty good overall experience . There have been many hardships in these 4 years but it has all been apart of the high school experience .', 'Dwight Morrow High School is one of the most diverse schools on the east coast. I learned so much just by being around so many different backgrounds.', 'Well my school is not the best school academically. I believe we were at the bottom in the ranks of all schools in Bergen county. We had three principals and new guidance counselors in the matter of two years. So the adjustment was very hard for students. What I would have liked to be changed is the administration. The administration was being changed a lot and they play a big part in the school.', 'The overall way the school is run is pretty bad. There is constant fighting and no action is taken against students who do not follow school rules. Anybody with authority at that school is either in denial about the students or are just there for there own careers. None of them care about the students. A lot of the adults there still act like they are in high school or baby the students. Most of the teachers either treat their students like they are beneath them or they are afraid of there students. The students themselves do not care and are not taught anything about being a decent person in life. Sometimes a few teachers will try or the school will make an effort, but it is usually ruined by the students, the people running the school, and anyone who can have an impact on Dwight Morrow.', 'Dwight Morrow was almost terrible in every aspect. The only pros for this school was the scenic campus and the school, the cons were everything else you could think of, from the education to the lunch. Do not send your child here.', 'I loved the diversity. I graduated in 2015 and felt like there was no other school I would have rather gone to. I attended the Academies@Englewood so I had to take all honors classes. I am now a biology major at Seton Hall University and felt like my high school classes prepared me (although this curriculum is extremely difficult). I liked a majority of my teachers and the campus is very nice. I played basketball all 4 years of high school and felt like this added to the experience.', 'I am an Academies student and am absolutely in love with the school. Students who put up bad reviews are probably:- could not handle the workload, not performing well, used to easy middle-school work- not involved with school activities and clubs- upset by what happened with the scandal in 2016-2017I chose AE over a high-ranked Regional School, and I would do the same anytime.Academics. All honors-courses with WIDE selection of AP courses. WAY MORE APs available than other "great" schools.Teachers. Our "hard teachers" genuinely care about their students and want them to learn and develop. Won\'t give easy A\'s, but will make you an A level student.Clubs & Activities. There are so many great clubs that students MUST take advantage of. Interestingly, the students that complained the most about the school are the ones that aren\'t involved in any of the clubs.Diversity. I don\'t think there is a school with more ethnicities and different income groups represented in the area.', 'Dwight Morrow High School/Academies at Englewood is a very unique school. Students around Bergen County are selected through an application process to get into the program called "Academies at Englewood." The "Academies" can be seen in both a positive and negative light, depending on how the students use their educational resources.The downside to this school is the lack of integration. There seems to be some kind of "wall" between students in Dwight Morrow High School, and in the "Academies." Therefore, there is an uncomfortable amount of tension between students and faculty members alike between these two "different" schools.', "As an alumni from the Academies @ Englewood my experience was lackluster. My initial expectations were very high as it seemed to be a very selective high school; however upon entering I saw that it there was a lot of improvement needed. Before the school was prestigious as it was created in order to compete with the very esteemed Bergen County Academies, but has fallen short of such expectations in very recent years.Even still the Academies @ Englewood does offer great diversity in all backgrounds and cultures for which I was very thankful for. I've made a great number of good friends with whom I still am very good friends with to this day, sharing all kinds of interests and fraternity. I hope Academies @ Englewood finds the strong leadership it once had and now lacks so that it can surge forward as one of the top high schools in the state of New Jersey once more.", 'The Academies and Dwight Morrow are in a very bad situation. In a failing district with abysmal test scores, the high school was placed under state investigation this year. The campus has behavioral issues, with near daily fights. This just scrapes at the surface of the problems this school faces. DMAE is troubled, with issues so complex it is often hard to understand how or why things go wrong. This frustration is felt most by the students, who are left feeling helpless and neglected. The reality of DMAE can be especially upsetting to Academy students, who are sold a stretched truth: that the Academies are a haven for bright students that will push them to reach their full potential. Despite its problems, the student experience here is not entirely negative. There are still a few teachers who strive to challenge their students despite it being a thankless job. Despite the demoralizing issues faced by  the students, some find positives of their experience if they really try.', "My overall experience at DMAE was ok in my book. I like how diverse and free everyone was allowed to be. The curriculum and academics were held to a high standard. Although everything else wasn't up to par, the academics and the teachers who taught them was what mostly counted. I am glad to have graduated with the credentials I needed and some more insight to what the real world has to offer.", "Dwight Morrow High School/ Academies @ Englewood is a unique high school unlike any other. The high school's campus itself is pretty large and is beautiful. Likewise the school's populous is very diverse, as there are people of almost all ethnicities all around. However, I would like to seek a stronger approach in education. The education seems average, but the Academies at Englewood students should receive more of a challenge as they are in a honors program that is supposed to be difficult.", "Does not offer the amount of college readiness , you'd wish to have and the food sucks most of the time.", 'Dwight Morrow High school is not what you will expect. Some of the teachers hired were not even qualified for teaching the subjects they were assigned. The school has pests that are not under control. The new guidance counselors do not even know what is going on with the different programs of the school.', 'My high school experience was a very unique one at Dwight Morrow. The school is very diverse and has a lot of activities for most students but does not have the challenging educational requirements of most high schools. There were few classes for practical careers in the future and most of them required them to be enrolled in the Academies at Englewood Program in order to enroll. Also, the school was lacking in information systems and had poor technology due to the age of the building and lack of funding. Though they often had many diversity celebrations and awareness assemblies, they did not offer many field trips that were specific to any real academic purpose. In fact, one of them was to a water treatment plant for environmental science, while another was to a salt mine, neither we were learning. If one was to attend the school, there are a specific set of classes that one should take in order to actually pursue their career rather than learn only liberal arts.']
column8: ["Dwight Morrow High School always had a horrible board of education. They are lazy, money hungry people. They sign a contract every year with a cheap horiible food distributor that states all students must either take the food from school or bring their own from home. This also limits food from outside, so students are forced to eat food that tastes absolutely fake. By signing with this contract they save lots of money and avoid students leaving campus. The reason why they are lazy is because they didn't want to fix their grading system. As the principal and multiple counselors complained about how broken it was, the board fired the old staff and just hired new ones. There had been an investigation going on for months and results for the investigation haven't been revealed yet.", 'They merge Academies students with Dwight Morrow students which results in mixed dedication to classes. Will teach well, but Science and Spanish departments fall short.', 'I liked the people, the teachers, and the environment and scenery outside. I disliked how unorganized the administration was and the superintendent.', 'Beautiful campus with great teachers.   Students are also veru caring and kind in both buildings.  Administration during my experience lacked organization and did not seem to care about the students.  Also there is major student separation between AE and DM. There should be more integration.  Overall, the school is ok. Not great and fun like other schools, as it lacks school spirit', 'Dwight Morrow was my SECOND High School of attendance; in comparison:  Hackensack High School was academically superior and I met my future husband there when I was 14 and he was 16....', 'I liked the diversity and the activities that were there. I strongly disliked the teachers and how they ran the school. There were often many problems for example with our transcripts. I would  not encourage anyone to attend here.', "Overall, I've met some truly amazing people here; however, the incessant controversy that surrounds the administration impedes on this school's ability to reach its fullest potential.", "My experience had been good. From freshman year to senior I have gotten a lot of help from staff. Teachers and other staff would talk to me and get me ready for the next level. You make a lot of friends here at Dwight Morrow. Joining sports teams and other clubs and school activities is something you wouldn't regret doing.", 'One thing people need to understand when applying to this High School is that it is ONE school. Dwight Morrow HIGH SCHOOL has the Academy Program in it. THERE IS NO SUCH THING AS ACADEMY @ ENGLEWOOD HIGH SCHOOL. Some students who are in the program tend to think so. Having this program develops many issues. Some tend to think "Academy Students" are smarter than "Dwight Morrow Students." One difference is that this program definitely challenges the students by requiring to take honors classes etc. However, Dwight Morrow students, are not required. But they can take them if they would like. This high school definitely has its ups & downs...', "always seems like the admin doesn't care about you and they don't listen to the students. but the people are okay and it does prepare you for college. be active", "My experience at the school was overall well. I particularly enjoyed the Biomedicine Academy of the Academies at Englewood. I didn't have major issues with teachers (some were phenomenal, others not so much). In terms of college preparation, I feel as though some classes could've aided more so in this direction.", 'I really like that the site matches you with colleges that have your majors of interest and there is information on those colleges given, about the requirements and tuition fees as well as their locations. ', ' Overall, I am very satisfied with the fact that I chose to attend the Academies @ Englewood over my town high school. The rigor of the courses I take keeps me challenged and always seeking academic improvement. All of the classes I take are at the honors level. Though the Academies program, I was able to major in Law and Public Safety, which peaked my interest in studying law in the future. I like that the Academies has unique aspects such as the the senior experience, which is an internship we attend on Thursdays and get graded on based on a weekly journal and attendance. We also have a wide range of electives to choose from each year. The campus is very diverse which taught me not only how to interact with people from different cultures, but to appreciate their lifestyles. Unfortunately, I do not like that our sports teams are not very good. ', "theres a lot of things to learn from, and if youre not happy with what you have is easily to change it in ur counselor's office.", 'this school has various different minds and races, peer pressure is not really that strong with students', 'its great, once you get used to it', 'the teachers are very caring', "There are a large variety of extracurricular opportunities at this school such as HOSA, Model UN, FBLA, the American Cancer Society Organization, etc. Clubs range on different levels. Some, for example, are competitive-based while others are based solely on fundraising money for an organization. There are also clubs that base their agenda on events going on in the world. Clubs such as the frisbee club or chess club are just for leisure time, so joining a club depends on your intentions-- whether you're looking to have fun, relax, make a difference, or win some titles.", 'One thing my school is heavily known for will be its diversity regarding the student body. I am blessed to be a part of a school where it not only consists of children from that district, but kids coming from different towns due to our academy program at the school. It is not a typical high school experience, but the different personalities makes this school a fun and exciting school to be a part of.', "Most teachers in my school show an adequate amount of knowledge and care for their class. When engaging conversation with them, I find them talking about random things pertaining to their specialty which is enlightening to me because it shows the passion they have for their career. I'm most confident in class setting where a teacher is very prideful of their job. Grading is very consistent so it is easy to tell where you are at an academic standpoint."]

column1: Robert F. Wagner Jr. Secondary School for Arts & Technology
column2: ["I believe that this school provides a comfortable and welcoming feeling. Ever since I've been in school, teachers are very supportive, make sure we have tutoring sessions, and even provides a diverse way of teaching. I believe that I will always remember this school as a family.", 'I have been in this school since 7th grade and I love the fact that each year they continue to improve and work on certain aspects where they can do better. This idea of a community is prominent here as well.', 'it was a great school with amazing teachers, really relaxed and helpful environment, small school with over all great support in college readiness, glad i went here', 'It is a good school with teachers that care about what you do. Although in the name it says art, we do not offer art that much and it is not that important in the school. Students eher are caring and help one another do better. The staff helps students with any way possible.', 'Very good school. Clean and kids are very nice. If you go to the high school, the school’s small classes allow everyone to know each other. You’ll definitely become friends with most of your grade. However, the one problem is that there are way more girls sports than there are boys.', "I'm starting my final year in this school and Imam not the only one who is mentally preparing themselves for graduation. The thought of leaving this school makes me think I'm leaving a family, it has given me relationships with teachers and friends that I will never forget and that I will never be able to find anywhere else. The community here is 10/5 stars. Amazing.", 'This is a great school full of diverse kids from all parts of the world. In my classes we have kids from Nepal, Korea, Japan, Lebanon, and all other places, some even mixed. My oreviouse school in Brooklyn was mostly one race. The academics in this school is alright but everyone’s behavior is on top. Even the “bad” kids respect the weaker kids and there is barely any bullying. The teachers are nice and hold many programs to help struggling kids. Sports is kind of an issue though. Although the school is very good at sports, there are way more female sports than male.', 'Overall the social life is very triumphant over all other aspects of the school because sometimes teachers have a hard time controlling the students so not a lot of learning happens. As for the college readiness, relatively few AP courses are offered and too much emphasis is placed on test prep rather than actual understanding and learning of the concepts. Granted the school is small and teachers and students meet and converse on a regular and concentrated basis but more emphasis should be placed on preparation to get into really good colleges. Some of the teachers teach really well and are capable of handling the most difficult of students but others not so much. Bad teachers are very hard to fire because of unions and that presents a problem here like in any other school. Sports are actually the top domain in which the school excels as the tennis, golf, and volleyball teams consistently make it to the championships and playoffs.', "I've been in this school for 3 years now, and overall I'm pretty happy with the school. We have many great teachers who are supportive and like to connect with us. The high school students are allowed to eat out for lunch which is pretty cool. Though I would like for the school to have more clubs.", "Everyone in this school is very friendly. Everyone is treated like family and teachers are called on first name basis. The school offers a lot of after school clubs, sport teams and AP classes. It is like a second home to me. Now as a sophomore here, I can tell you from experience that you'll have a lot of friends here and classmates and staff would really care about you. I've never been happier", 'Robert F Wagner, is a family orientated, small sized school. It promotes hard work, unity, and diversity. The teachers push students each day to overcome acadademic hardships as well as social skills.', 'I liked how we all seemed like a family. The older children would be friends with the younger ones and how older students would help/tutor the younger students.  I would like to see more choices for languages. There is only Spanish. I would like more since this school is diverse.', 'This school is very good compared to others. Teachers really connect to students and they always get down to any problems. They also teach well and assist students individually if they need it. The school is responsible and calls whenever a student is late, absent, or if they attempt to cut a class.', 'I joined theater and soccer and both were great!', 'I believe the academics is good, only problem is that the school is small therefore funding is low', 'They are always on top of you and your work', "For me, I haven't really found interest in most of the clubs. However, I do enjoy the clubs that I joined since I get to learn about different things besides school work, and I do the clubs with my friends so it is never boring.", "I've been in this school since 7th grade and there are some special things about this school. For example, teachers in this school are called by their first name so it feels like they are someone that is on the same level as you and can be someone that you can speak to. As I've progressed through the years I've met so many smart and fun friends that I'm still around with. We've experienced so many things such as field day and most especially our middle school trip frost valley, where we stayed in the Catskill Mountains near nature and had fun doing many activities. These unique experiences are some things that I would never forget about.", 'The teachers in this school work hard to give the students the best knowledge that we can possibly get and to exceed standards. Also, the teachers are very kind and make sure understand what they are teaching so that the lesson is effective.', "My school is pretty safe. There hasn't been any moment that has made me feel threatened in Wagner ever since I started going to school there since in 7th grade."]

There hasn't been any moment that has made me feel threatened in Wagner ever since I started going to school there since in 7th grade."]
column6: ["There are after school activities, yet Wagner doesn't do a great job in getting students to join with spreading the word. Even in a small school there are clubs that many students don't about but they're offered. The opportunities are endless though since you can create your own club if you get a couple of people and an teacher to be a supervisor after school for the activity you want.", 'Overall, Wagner has taught me more of a relationship idea with my teachers and students since this school has less than 600 students (including the middle school). It makes me feel as a student, that teachers are easy to talk to but some go out of their way to make sure you get the topic of the class.', 'The teaching is up to standards but some teachers go further and actually introduce students with a clearer knowledge of the topic by having a good teaching method.', 'Not enough Support or understanding from principal or assistant principal, they expect the best without giving you time to speak', 'Fitness not an important part of student life', 'Everything is the right size for activities', 'The staff try to keep you healthy', 'There are many teams one can join', 'The teachers are dedicated to their work and students', 'There are a bunch of opportunities one student can take in extracurricular activities.', 'The school staff all try to help the students and the parents. They get close to the students to connect with them in many ways.', 'Like most places, it is what you make it. You cannot talk about the lack of opportunity if you did not show any initiative on your behalf. Overall, it could be pretty lenient if you move beyond accomplishing the bare minimum and push your potential.', 'With the exception of a few teachers [two or three really; they know who they are - those who are consistently unpopular among the student body], most of the teachers are highly receptive to the amount of efforts students put into the classwork. The only issue lies in the effort made in part by the student. The teachers could have done so much more had the students shown initiative. Again, this is only based on my experience in the year 2012.', "Despite the limited square footage, the school does manage to have a soccer team, wrestling team, baseball, golf team, and basketball team [sports teams are either co-ed or gender segregated]. Student involvement is usually pretty decent. There always seems to be enough people pushing to join teams in the sense that teams can be formed - no lack of participants. Team performance is average. Between wins and losses, there have been a few trophies and medals. There is a consistent amount of fan support. In terms of school spirit: it is a passive topic for those that are not terribly involved. Athletic facilities: The school's small space is fully utilized. Outdoors seems to be the go-to option as weather allows. Fitness programs started the year I graduated, so I really couldn't give a reliable review other than the fact that the students attended and gave some effort.", 'There is food that can suit almost everyones appetite. Most people like to bring their own lunch, but for some, school lunch is just as good.', 'My school feels like home. Everyone is welcomed in my school which makes this school a very friendly school. Teachers, students, and Principles knows everyone by their name and who they are. This is one of the smallest schools in the city, but the clubs, sports, and interests are endless.', 'Teachers are concerned about the students education and will encourage students to do their best and apply to colleges to become successful in the future.', 'This high school unfortunately doesn\'t have AP classes or any challenging courses. The "most challenging course" I took would probably be a college class I took under the College Now Program, but nothing in the high school. Although people see this high school as non-challenging, it does have some activities that were unique. I was a part of a national activist group that the founder of this high school started, and I was able to travel to Los Angeles. I took advantage of Robert Wagner and made sure I absorbed everything I could. Now, my teachers congratulate me for my enrollment at Binghamton University.', "All the teachers are very well educated. They come from prestigious colleges, and they all say they love teaching at Wagner. Even though the curriculum isn't hard in this high school, the teachers will always tend to enhance the education and experience. The workload isn't so heavy, but it varies. This high school is associated with the College Now Program where students can take college classes and prepare for College.", 'The only rule I can think of that annoys students is the "No-Hat" rule. No one is allowed to wear a hat or any headgear of any kind. Other than that, Wagner is very laid back. The teachers all know you by your first and last name, and the students call the teachers by their first name. Throughout the years, the administration knows you so well that when it\'s time to leave, you feel like you\'re leaving your second home.']
