column2: ['I’ve been attending Achievement First since kindergarten. It’s honestly been quite a ride! Academically achievement first excels in preparing their students for middle school, high school, then onward to college. You’re child can receive all the help they need to be successful. However Achievement first tends to also prioritize things that may not be prioritized as we go onward as we go further with our education. For example behavior is heavily prioritized sometimes even over academics. Also achievement first tends to baby their students in a way that they won’t be babied in their future lives. Meaning that me being a student for 13 years now I have held my teachers hand for way too long forgetting that in life it will only be just me. There can be changes made to the AF system but overall they have pushed their scholars from day 1 to be the best scholars they can be.', 'This school has great academics and besides that we are known for our dance, music, art and especially sports skills as well. In this school, you know you will get accepted to a great college. I believe the merit and demerit system should change because that is the only thing that doesn’t prepare for college. Having that system doesn’t prepare us to be independent and make mistakes on our own time and learn from them. It just babies us. That’s is the only thing I believe needs to change.', 'This school has great teachers who truly want to see their students excell and succeed. The admistration works with the parents for the overall good of the students. School culture is amazing in this school. The principal knows the names of all students and greets them daily at the front door.', 'This school has a serious problem with bullying and they refuse to address the issue. The principal and staff turn a blind eye to incidents despite knowing multiple parents have reported this issue. A school should be a safe learning environment yet it is the opposite here.', 'This school is very focused on preparing minority students to face the challenges of college. Their main priorities are on academics which they work very hard to ensure all students are going above and beyond on the academic standards set in NY. The only thing that needs to be changed is countless rules that they have in place at the school.', 'Achievement First - Crown Heights have prepared me a lot for college. With my academics achievements throughout the years, Achievement First Have help  shape my character. Achievement First is a tough school, but it pushes you beyond what you expect from yourself. The staff members always want to see the best of your capabilities and more because they believe that you can achieve so much more.', 'As a senior in Achievement First, I can say that I enjoy the commitment the teachers put in to make into their lessons to help children who are people of color become successful, in a country that does not have the a lot of institutions and systems that are there to be of service to minorities in America. Achievement First is a college prepatory school that helps open students to opportunities. Students are open to Pre-College programs, that allow students to network and make connections with other people. At Achievement First, students have a better chance at being successful.', 'STUDENTS ARE INVOLVED IN GIRLS AND BOYS BASKETBALL, VOLLEYBALL, CHEERLEADING, AND DANCE RUN BY STAFF AND STUDENTS.', 'THEY WANT TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE KIDS', 'I HAVE NOT HEARD ABOUT BULLYING.\r MY KID DOES NOT FEEL UNSAFE.', "Teachers at my school will do anything like stay until 9o' clock just to make sure struggling students get the material in my school.", 'The support systems one builds within the school.', "You would care about the rules that been placed and so the teachers won't care either", 'We get in trouble for everything we do and it gets annoying at times. We do not feel like soon to be adults.', 'We share a school with two other schools, so there has been a lot of stealing between schools. It does not feel safe all the time and very over crowded.', 'The start of my high school it was great, but as the years went on it only got worse and I am just ready to leave.', 'The teachers are very supportive, however; when it comes to grades it can get annoying at times because they do not always update grades.', 'The kids are nice to each other. But the school year is very intense so it gets very hard to manage what is going on.', 'We are really big on the idea of basketball, so all other activities seem to come after that. However, they are starting to improve in other areas.', 'The school is very big on our basketball team, however;  we are becoming bigger on our Cheerleading team. We are also big on the culture of our school, so we have a lot of clubs based on culture and ethnicity.']

That’s is the only thing I believe needs to change.', 'This school has great teachers who truly want to see their students excell and succeed. The admistration works with the parents for the overall good of the students. School culture is amazing in this school. The principal knows the names of all students and greets them daily at the front door.', 'This school has a serious problem with bullying and they refuse to address the issue. The principal and staff turn a blind eye to incidents despite knowing multiple parents have reported this issue. A school should be a safe learning environment yet it is the opposite here.', 'This school is very focused on preparing minority students to face the challenges of college. Their main priorities are on academics which they work very hard to ensure all students are going above and beyond on the academic standards set in NY. The only thing that needs to be changed is countless rules that they have in place at the school.', 'Achievement First - Crown Heights have prepared me a lot for college. With my academics achievements throughout the years, Achievement First Have help  shape my character. Achievement First is a tough school, but it pushes you beyond what you expect from yourself. The staff members always want to see the best of your capabilities and more because they believe that you can achieve so much more.', 'As a senior in Achievement First, I can say that I enjoy the commitment the teachers put in to make into their lessons to help children who are people of color become successful, in a country that does not have the a lot of institutions and systems that are there to be of service to minorities in America. Achievement First is a college prepatory school that helps open students to opportunities. Students are open to Pre-College programs, that allow students to network and make connections with other people. At Achievement First, students have a better chance at being successful.', 'STUDENTS ARE INVOLVED IN GIRLS AND BOYS BASKETBALL, VOLLEYBALL, CHEERLEADING, AND DANCE RUN BY STAFF AND STUDENTS.', 'THEY WANT TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE KIDS', 'I HAVE NOT HEARD ABOUT BULLYING.\r MY KID DOES NOT FEEL UNSAFE.', "Teachers at my school will do anything like stay until 9o' clock just to make sure struggling students get the material in my school.", 'The support systems one builds within the school.', "You would care about the rules that been placed and so the teachers won't care either", 'We get in trouble for everything we do and it gets annoying at times. We do not feel like soon to be adults.', 'We share a school with two other schools, so there has been a lot of stealing between schools. It does not feel safe all the time and very over crowded.', 'The start of my high school it was great, but as the years went on it only got worse and I am just ready to leave.', 'The teachers are very supportive, however; when it comes to grades it can get annoying at times because they do not always update grades.', 'The kids are nice to each other. But the school year is very intense so it gets very hard to manage what is going on.', 'We are really big on the idea of basketball, so all other activities seem to come after that. However, they are starting to improve in other areas.', 'The school is very big on our basketball team, however;  we are becoming bigger on our Cheerleading team. We are also big on the culture of our school, so we have a lot of clubs based on culture and ethnicity.']

column1: KIPP STAR College Prep Charter School
column2: ['I really love my school. I like the high standards they have for us students. The teachers are awesome. I love that we’re all a team & family. Lots of sports & clubs. Diversity which is super important. Our own chef for meals.', 'Kipp Star is where it all begins. They really get you ready from college from the day you walk in in 5th grade all the way up until you graduate and even passed that. They offer numerous different honors and AP classes and have even embarked on a new journey offering dual enrollment classes. The teachers push you and make sure you’re on top of things and will do what ever it takes to make sure you not only pass but have a good understanding of what you’ve learned. The high school is located in a beautiful building in the south Bronx. We are served fresh food daily prepared by chefs. The cafe offers a vegetarian option as well for those with those needs. Overall the school, classes, staff and food are great.', 'KIPP Star is honestly a great school. KIPP prepares every student for college and beyond. From fifth grade to twelfth, KIPP provides resources and connections for KIPP students across the entire KIPP network to prepare them for life in college and after.', 'KIPP STAR College Prep help develop students individual character that would be able to transition them into high school. Character traits, Body posture, interviews, where all the amazing things that KIPP provided. Even in the High school; the teachers and deans would help the students to be able to feel confident and ready for the start of the real world.', 'The education is great but the students do make you question the quality of it. I love the school and it prepared me for highschool even though I was a little iffy about it in the beginning.', 'There is a very strong support system at KIPP STAR.', 'KIPP STAR has a very strong support system and works with the kids all the way to and through college.']

['This school is an all girl school.  It is a good learning environment with many opportunities.  This school is an amazing place to reach your full potential.', "Honestly this rating would change based on which day you ask. There are good and bad components to literally everything. To sum TYWLS up to a 5 point system is not only useless but it's also very difficult.  I believe that it's honestly what you make of it. In other words what you give is what you get.", "My experience at TYWLS has been great. The teachers are very involved and helpful. We are well prepared for college and going through the college application process. It isn't a very big school, but classes aren't overcrowded. However there is no auditorium or a full sized gym", 'I love how focused students at TYWLS of East Harlem are. All of my classmates are really focused on their grades and never slack. The environment motivates you to do your best.', 'I started attending TYWLS of East Harlem my freshman year in high school and my experience at TYWLS was great. The teachers and staff here at TYWLS really care that you succeed. TYWLS help prepare you for college and life after college.', 'They are a good school to challenge you academically but they don’t do anything fun such as a senior trip or school outings like many other schools do.', "Being a student at the Young Women's Leadership School of East Harlem allows young girls to understand what sisterhood really is. The academics are great, hence the school's high graduation rate. The administration heavily focuses on college readiness and a large number of alumni continue the rest of their education at highly ranked institutions. It is a safe environment, allowing students to feel comfortable.", 'Very nurturing and progressive environment for young girls. Overall great teachers and staff. Are truly supportive and invested in students. Great college bound network. Downfalls are in lack of AP courses, small cultivation of sports culture, and unity orgs/clubs. Generally just things like funding and resources could be better.', 'I have been in TYWLS of Astoria for over 7 years and can give an insight on the school. The Middle School is quite excellent and I recommend it as it lays a great foundation for these three "awkward" years that students often try to find themselves. However, the High School should be entirely steered away. This school portrays themselves to be "good" on the outside, but underneath the school has evident issues that affect the students that the school tries to cover up. Some include that teachers have clear bias towards students that they have common personal interests with(such as music) and the school has one of the lowest averages SAT scores. There is evident favoritism as the opportunities are essentially limited to the SAME few students while other students are deprived of any such opportunities. The school also does not care for the student\'s education at all. Over 15 teachers over the past 3 years have left.', 'I\'ve been at TYWLS since 10th grade (3 years now) and I absolutely love it! The school is amazing at college readiness and the teachers are amazing they care for you and are always there to help. The school has such an amazing bound where the students we always take leadership in things we care about and have that "sister" bound at school. One thing I\'d say is a drawback is that the gym is also the "auditorium" as the school is small (because it\'s in an office type building) but for big events, we either go to the huge auditorium hall down the street or the school next to us auditorium. Also, we don\'t have own sport team but we join the sports team called "East Harlem Pride" with the school next to us as they have a huge gym. Overall though, the school is amazing and so those two things you\'ll get used to it.', 'This school is very proficient with college readiness and truly cares about getting you college bound at the start of your education.', 'my overall experience was amazing!! all the teachers were like second mothers to me and best friends whom i could talk to about anything. The school forced you to strive to be better not only your peers, but to be better than yourself.', 'They could use more various activities for students.', "Many of the parents are supportive, and this is reflected in students' behavior.", 'Great, friendly, hard-working, and dedicated staff at this school.', 'The teachers are knowledgeable about the subjects in which they teach and they give a comprehensive understanding of material that goes above and beyond.', "At this school we don't go on many trips rewarding or educational. We just got sports but they haven't started ones where we need a lot of practice such as softball.", 'They are all different but they all do offer as much help as you are willing to take and more.', "My overall experience hasn't been a bad one. I feel because I'm one of the favorites at this school things come easy to me and I'm liked by most of my teachers. So, I sometimes get chosen to things a=outside of the school. But, students that are quite or not doing OUTSTANDING grade wise don't really get the opportunity to do certain things. So, if you are not liked in the school you wouldn't have an enjoyable time at TYWLS because you wouldn't be chosen to do certain experiences. Not everyone has an equal chance for things here.", "The teachers in this school are okay. But, they sometimes let students run the classroom then actually teaching. So, it's more we learn from our peer then our actual professor. I would like to be taught by my actual teacher since they are the ones making our test and quizzes. Students also sometimes don't know what they are talking about which makes other students confused. But, the teachers are most of the time are fair in situations."]

column6: ['The nurse is very kind and the first thing anyone sees when they enter the school is the security guard.', 'I wish there was better funding for extracurriculars.', "I don't think I would of had the same experience any where else.", 'Teachers acknowledge when a student needs more assistance and is always quick to give.', "I wish there was more AP classes available, that's what they're lacking.", 'They only offer a small amount of afterschool clubs and they large amount that they do offer, they give it to middle schoolers. Most of the clubs for highschoolers are boring.', "Out of my four years at TYWLS, almost all of my teachers were very intellectual and I learned a lot from them. Except for this one teacher who wasn't so great at math.", 'The security is great and disciplines are strict, but the nurse could be better.', 'I love how empowered this school has made me.', "I would choose this school once again if I was in the 6th grade, this is because this school has teach me how to appreciate what I have, it has made me a leader. I love this school because there's no guys so I don't get distracted by guys and I come to school to do what I have to do. My middle/high school has made me who I am, a young women who thinks about achieving my goals, and thinks about college.", 'This is an all girls middle and high school. It is great because many opportunities are presented to the students. As one gets older, the teachers challenge them and the students are able to learn a lot that applies to them in and out of school.', 'Overall, this school was great they taught girls to develop into young women and empowering there minds on how to be the future of our country. To stand up for what you believe in and not degrade to societies opinion on what the ideal stigma is of a women. The environment of the school is also great, the teachers are very welcoming and help you during any time of need. They always look for your best interest as well as pushing you to strive for your best.', 'It is a great school that offers a wide variety of things for students to do. We may not be known for our sports, but the teachers are very involved in student activities and a club can be made by students if they really want it.', 'TYWLS does not tolerate drinking and drug use on any occasion. The school is very safe since there is a school guard present at all times', 'The cafeteria in our school is smaller than average and this is an issue because the student body is so large.', 'There is an excellent college guidance counselor in our school. The only reprimanding a student might get is if she is out of uniform but there is no detention, so a students privileges for going out for lunch is taken away for that day.', 'While there are athletic clubs, there is not much hype around sports. The school spirit, however, is very good since many students support the PSAL basketball games.', 'The teachers are all hands on with their approach to teaching. They give a lot of real world examples to keep the student engaged in the topic.', 'TYWLS has a variety of clubs for both middle schoolers and high schoolers such as volleyball, debate team, math club, and so on. There are also high anticipated teacher vs. student Basketball games where the whole school comes to watch.', 'The food at this school is excellent. There are many different options available. There is also a salad bar that is always available. The cafeteria is very clean and spacious.']
column8: ["Uniform is very important at this school. In order to receive one of their fundings there is a rule that all students must be in full uniform. There are consequences if you are found out of uniform. Students may lose privileges, or receive phone calls home. There is extra uniform in the main office that students have to use if they are missing any part of the uniform. The school administration is very strict, phone calls home are usually the punishment for many things. I've never heard of anything too bad happen for a suspension to occur but I know that is definitely one of the disciplinary actions that will be used if necessary. The principal, Laura Mitchell, makes sure to have school meetings once a year that discusses what should and should not be going on at school, consequences of actions, and this meeting also advises students to give suggestions of how to feel more comfortable and make the school a better environment for all.", "There are many athletics and fitness opportunities at the Young Women's Leadership School. Many students enjoy cheering on their friends and school teams. There are a few school spirit weeks that include a day just to wear school sports team attire and colors. Everyone enjoys this, you see all students in the hallways taking pictures and having fun. The school sports teams all get along great, that is a big part of success with the team, which is why if there are ever any problems the issue is addressed and students are even forced to attend peer counseling. There is only one gym at the school being that it is a small school but teams find a way to make it work. Many parks and other facilities near the school are also available for use.", "The teachers at the Young Women's Leadership school are amazing. This school works hard to find amazing teachers that will fit in with the energy at the school. They come from great educations and most teachers are even continuing their education while teaching. They all strive for the best. The teaching styles are encouraged to be the same, which is teaching until you understand the material. Teachers are forced to provide extra help to any students who do not completely understand the material after or before class. Although they are forced by school rules you can tell that the teachers want to be there. You can see the enjoyment of seeing students understanding the material after being taught over again. These extra help classes are usually in small groups or made by appointment which is great because it make students more focused and ready to learn. The grading policy at this school is very fair. On all assignments you either get a Not Yet, Meeting Standards, or Exceeding Standards. This method specifically tells you where you are. You can see which rating you get for each and every assignment you get.", "I was apart of the second graduating class in my high school. Being that it was a new school there were not many funds available for extracurriculars. Although there was not much money available, the teaching staff knew the importance of extracurriculars for students. Clubs and sports help keep many students focused and also gives them some time to relax and have fun. At the Young Women's Leadership school many teachers volunteered to stay after or before school for extracurricular activities without or for pay. Some of these programs include the: debate team, math4you club, Muslim support group, LGBT community club, volleyball team, rugby team, basketball team, and many more. There is also always opportunity to form your own extracurricular activities at this amazing school.", 'I felt very prepared for what many of my previous teachers called "the real world" after graduating high school. Being that I had began attending the Young Women\'s Leadership School since 6th grade this transition into the real world began since then, six years ago. Since on the first day of school I was constantly told all the basics to surviving life after high school. On the first day of school there I had to sign a form that stated I would stay in the school from middle to high school no matter my circumstances. This taught me the value of commitment. It was a very "grown-up" thing to do at that age, a decision that would affect the next six years of my life. After high school I began an internship at an accounting office where I had to sign a contract that made me agree to the facilities rules and regulations for the next year. Most post-graduates would see this contract as something to think about, or a big commitment. For me I knew that I had commitments for the company since the day I applied for the internship and was completely ready to sign anything that would prove it. Commitment is a big part of the real world. You have to commit to work, school, and even time for family and friends. The Young Women\'s Leadership School of Astoria definitely prepared me for this "real world" I am currently living in and enjoying.', "There is a uniform code at this school. The principal, assistant principal, teachers, office staff and counselors make sure to remind parents that the students should be following the code. The office staff call home whenever a student is out of uniform to inform the parents. Attendance is handled the same. If a student is late or absent the parents are given a call to be updated on their daughter's.", 'There is a variety of extracurricular activities from volleyball to multicultural club, and the drama club. The commitment to these activities is very strong. From the beginning there is a limit of the number of people in each club. The students enjoy working together and taking leadership positions such as President, or Treasurer of the Multicultural Club, or Captain of the basketball team. The club members make sure to engage students to attend their plays, games, and event.', 'This school has a supportive staff family.', 'There are no sports except running club.', 'The school is pretty safe, the students always have to be in the room with an adult supervising. But like other things like the school nurse, she is sometimes busy handling one student. Sometimes, you have to hope she is available.', 'The teachers have office hours where students can go and ask any questions or problems they are dealing with in their class. Since my school is small, we have more one on one conversations about anything that is related to school which is awesome. The only problem is that they are not always available because they have other responsibilities like after school programs. For example, my AP spanish teacher is the coach of our running club. Other than that, the teachers make sure they have time for students to ask for help.', "The resources of our school are fairly typical. Our school building is five floors, all of which are somewhat small. Our school at point was a Catholic school so there is still a chapel on the fourth floor, which we use for storage. The guidance counselors are invisible, I was not aware we even had one until I took my PSAT. The college prep here is excellent, especially our college bound counseler, who works extremely hard for every girl to be happy with where she goes. The tutoring here is decent, but only if you are in middle school or in the first two years of high school (and this is only peer tutoring). Once you get into your Junior and Senior year, there really aren't any tutoring options. Although, the teachers are always available to help you when needed. Parent involvement here is a joke, the PTA believes they run the school, and sadly they do. If there were no PTA, our school would be much better off. Nothing can get done because they waste the schools money on ridiculous things that do not even pan out in the end. The busing is fine since I live only 20 minutes away. However, NYC is huge and it could take you a while to get here, especially if there are train delays.", 'If you are interested in sports, please do not come here. Although they may say we have an abundance of sports, we simply do not. We have a few sports teams, but you never here of any competitions or games. We usually do not even play other teams. Our sports teams are basically nonexistent. We have one gym, which is not even attached to our school, it is across the street. Also, we have no locker rooms, no actual workout rooms. Our school does not even own the gym. The sports and fitness here are very poor.', "The food at our school is decent, although I tend not to get it. Our school has the option to leave campus for your lunch period once you go into high school. This is a great option since we have many places around our school to go to. High schooler's tend to just go out for lunch and therefore it is usually only the middle schooler's that get school lunch. I, personally, haven't gotten school lunch in a couple years.", "The only reason I have good things to say about my school, is because of the teachers I have had. Over my almost 7 years in this school, I have only had one bad teacher, who was simply too nice to teach high school. The teachers here have helped me in every way they possibly could. They respond to my emails on weekends, on week days, and usually extremely late at night as well. If you aren't happy with your grade, they are more than happy to help you to bring your grade up. They are accommodating and beyond caring, and empathetic. They want you to succeed, and help you do it.", 'This school is in a nice area, although the security guard is never at her desk. On top of that all, just about anyone can walk in and out of the school. Also, the "guidance counselor"\'s husband walks in and out of the school whenever he feels the urge to. This is a large down fall for the safety of our girls since it is an all girls school. The faculty also tends to leave doors open around the school, so that anyone off the street could easily walk in. There is also some bullying apparent in the middle school, because of all of the diverse background. Overall, this school is decently safe, although for a school in New York City should have more safety measures in place.', 'We arent a big school, so yes there is limited space but we still manage to achieve our goal at hand when it gomes to athletics and that is recognition of what we can do without all of the space.', 'I enjoy the uniform because it takes away from bullying and the administration is alright i like the new principal she really wants to do things with the building and get more involvement with parents as well as students.', 'There is access to a computer in the CBI office or during class when a teacher request the cart. It is not easy to just gind a computer but they are expanding and modernizing the technology being used', 'There are over 30 clubs this school, as a witness i saw lists overflowing with names it was an awesome thing to see in the hallway']

column2: ['Overall, this school is very good. It is a very safe community but lacks diversity. Teachers are very friendly and look out for the students. However, it lacks school spirit and there are no high school activities such as homecoming, pep, rally, etc.', 'I have lived in Nutley since I was two years old, and always thought about finally going to high school. It blows my mind that I am soon going to be graduating high school, after all of those years of dreaming about going. I truly believe that this high school was not what I was expecting. I always thought that the high school would be more stereotypical, but surprisingly it is not. Everyone throughout the school is extremely open and nice to each other, no matter what race or gender. Another thing I did not expect was how supportive all the teachers are. My sophomore year in the school, I went through a lot and it caused my grades to drop drastically. However, with all of the support from the teachers and staff I am finally getting back on track. Not only do the teachers and staff help, but even , my coaches. I play sports all year round (volleyball, winter track, and spring track), and having a bond with my teammates and coaches helps me as well.', 'I attended this school for the last two years of my high school journey. I was able to higher my gpa here and learn so much. The teachers care about their students and want to see them succeed in their academics as well as music, art, and sports.', "Nutley High School has a culture only Nutley High School students would understand. Why the school for me isn't a 5/5 is because a lot of time it felt like the administration was less for the students and more for themselves (Aka PARCC testing). I'm glad to have been the last class to really experience the declaration and what Nutley High School was before the administration became overactive in safety precautions. If you have the opportunity to take higher-level classes (such as honors and AP) take it! The education in those classes is way better than a regular class because the teachers are more involved and communicate better with students. Try to make the most of it!", 'Nutley High School is a fine high school for arts and music. But the teachers can’t teach that well when it comes to AP classes in the sciences. The math department could do better it explaining math when it comes to higher levels. The high school has many of the students that actually don’t want to the work which doesn’t the high school rankings.', 'Though my experience at Nutley High School has largely been influenced by the people I encountered rather than the school itself, I must admit that it is a very good school and a good platform for success, should the student be willing to obtain the opportunities offered.', "My 4 years at Nutley High School have been a real rollercoaster. The building itself is good, the teachers are mostly very helpful and friendly, the administration could be better, and the food is average but there are many food joints around the area. I've had to deal with the administration of the school on many occasions being Treasurer of Student Council and I won't lie they are not the brightest bunch. The academics at the school are good and if you have time management and a good understanding of things you can easily have a good GPA.", "Nutley, like any other school, has its ups and downs. It has an amazing, award-winning music program, decent food (and lots of restaurants nearby), and a lots of class options. The guidance program is decent, but could check in with the students more often. The school should also provide more information about college applications. Overall, it's a pretty good school and doesn't have too many faults.", 'Nutley  highschool was okay, it gave me some of the tools to succeed and was fun at some moments. From an educational standpoint it was very subpar and did not give students any motivation or curiosity to learn. I felt like a number in a system and that was all. Most people did not even talk to each other only because of what they heard. Many prejudices would stop someone from talking to a new person, which is not an ideal place to express yourself. Overall, not that bad of a school, but definitely cold do better', 'Nutley High School gave me a great education to get me ready for college. I found my teachers helpful and encouraging during the years. They would stay after or before school to help anyone. They have many clubs to join and the new block schedule makes them easy to attend. My guidance counselor is really nice and patient when it comes to helping me create a schedule or resume. I feel safe and respected by the other students and faculty. So far my experience with Nutley High School is positive and fun.', 'Diversity is a growing concept in Nutley High which is great. People are being more vocal about themselves and other important issues in society. The typical high school drama floats around but the school itself is not the worst.', 'Nutley High School has good aspects and bad aspects,  thus making it overall average.  The school does offer a lot of options for students in their choices for classes.  Unfortunately some classes are not really taken because the teacher makes it difficult to learn or enjoy.', 'Nutley High School is a great school with great people and a superb educational value.  The academics here compete with other schools in surrounding areas.  The sports teams, although not the best, still have a huge fan base which shows that NHS has a lot of school spirit.  Only downside of NHS would be the cafe food they serve.  The food quality isnt the best and is very mediocore.', 'The school system is excellent but by the time the students are in 12 grade they are exhausted. Usually you can have close to 500 students being honor and high honor. The music department teachers are excellent.The majority of the teachers are good with the exception of some young one that are mean to the students.', 'Nutley High was an alright school. I thought it was annoying how teachers would play favorites but I guess that’s seen at every school. Nutley is very Italian so there isn’t much diversity or activities that are diverse, just night of nations. It really depends on what teacher you get because if I’m being totally honest some teachers are bad while others are great.', 'I liked that there were a decent amount of AP classes offered at Nutley High School, but I would like to see more priority placed on academics than on athletics.', "I think Nutley High School is a very good school considering it's a public school in a small town. There is a good environment with very supportive and good teachers, as well as various types of clubs and activities. Also, many students in the school are involved in sports teams. However, I am a little disappointed that the school is lacking in participation relating to certain types of major school programs and competitions. For example, there is no Olympiad team in the school, even though that is a reputable competition that spans across schools all over the nation! There also isn't much of a competitive environment among the students, but that's fine since it's a public school.", 'Loved the theater department.  My son got so much out of it that he is going to college for theater in the back stage.', 'The part that I really enjoyed about Nutley High School were my teachers.  They made the high school experience enjoyable and helped me become who I am now.  They many tips when it came to studying helps me even now while I am in college.  I am eternally grateful to them.  Also the music department was another favorite of mine.  I sang during my years in Nutley High School and now because of them I enjoy singing more than ever.  I have decided to continue training my voice as well.  The athletic department brought back the archery club in Nutley High School and I was proud to have been the president and lead the my school to place third in states.  Nutley High School is a great school to attend and I am happy to be a graduate/alum of that school.', 'The school is overall good but more classes and activities should be established. The sports are very average but the clubs are very plentiful and amazing. Sometimes I feel like education is so amazing and other classes make me doubt whether our school can improve in certain courses.']
column4: ['Overall, this school is very good. It is a very safe community but lacks diversity. Teachers are very friendly and look out for the students. However, it lacks school spirit and there are no high school activities such as homecoming, pep, rally, etc.', 'I have lived in Nutley since I was two years old, and always thought about finally going to high school. It blows my mind that I am soon going to be graduating high school, after all of those years of dreaming about going. I truly believe that this high school was not what I was expecting. I always thought that the high school would be more stereotypical, but surprisingly it is not. Everyone throughout the school is extremely open and nice to each other, no matter what race or gender. Another thing I did not expect was how supportive all the teachers are. My sophomore year in the school, I went through a lot and it caused my grades to drop drastically. However, with all of the support from the teachers and staff I am finally getting back on track. Not only do the teachers and staff help, but even , my coaches. I play sports all year round (volleyball, winter track, and spring track), and having a bond with my teammates and coaches helps me as well.', 'I attended this school for the last two years of my high school journey. I was able to higher my gpa here and learn so much. The teachers care about their students and want to see them succeed in their academics as well as music, art, and sports.', "Nutley High School has a culture only Nutley High School students would understand. Why the school for me isn't a 5/5 is because a lot of time it felt like the administration was less for the students and more for themselves (Aka PARCC testing). I'm glad to have been the last class to really experience the declaration and what Nutley High School was before the administration became overactive in safety precautions. If you have the opportunity to take higher-level classes (such as honors and AP) take it! The education in those classes is way better than a regular class because the teachers are more involved and communicate better with students. Try to make the most of it!", 'Nutley High School is a fine high school for arts and music. But the teachers can’t teach that well when it comes to AP classes in the sciences. The math department could do better it explaining math when it comes to higher levels. The high school has many of the students that actually don’t want to the work which doesn’t the high school rankings.', 'Though my experience at Nutley High School has largely been influenced by the people I encountered rather than the school itself, I must admit that it is a very good school and a good platform for success, should the student be willing to obtain the opportunities offered.', "My 4 years at Nutley High School have been a real rollercoaster. The building itself is good, the teachers are mostly very helpful and friendly, the administration could be better, and the food is average but there are many food joints around the area. I've had to deal with the administration of the school on many occasions being Treasurer of Student Council and I won't lie they are not the brightest bunch. The academics at the school are good and if you have time management and a good understanding of things you can easily have a good GPA.", "Nutley, like any other school, has its ups and downs. It has an amazing, award-winning music program, decent food (and lots of restaurants nearby), and a lots of class options. The guidance program is decent, but could check in with the students more often. The school should also provide more information about college applications. Overall, it's a pretty good school and doesn't have too many faults.", 'Nutley  highschool was okay, it gave me some of the tools to succeed and was fun at some moments. From an educational standpoint it was very subpar and did not give students any motivation or curiosity to learn. I felt like a number in a system and that was all. Most people did not even talk to each other only because of what they heard. Many prejudices would stop someone from talking to a new person, which is not an ideal place to express yourself. Overall, not that bad of a school, but definitely cold do better', 'Nutley High School gave me a great education to get me ready for college. I found my teachers helpful and encouraging during the years. They would stay after or before school to help anyone. They have many clubs to join and the new block schedule makes them easy to attend. My guidance counselor is really nice and patient when it comes to helping me create a schedule or resume. I feel safe and respected by the other students and faculty. So far my experience with Nutley High School is positive and fun.', 'Diversity is a growing concept in Nutley High which is great. People are being more vocal about themselves and other important issues in society. The typical high school drama floats around but the school itself is not the worst.', 'Nutley High School has good aspects and bad aspects,  thus making it overall average.  The school does offer a lot of options for students in their choices for classes.  Unfortunately some classes are not really taken because the teacher makes it difficult to learn or enjoy.', 'Nutley High School is a great school with great people and a superb educational value.  The academics here compete with other schools in surrounding areas.  The sports teams, although not the best, still have a huge fan base which shows that NHS has a lot of school spirit.  Only downside of NHS would be the cafe food they serve.  The food quality isnt the best and is very mediocore.', 'The school system is excellent but by the time the students are in 12 grade they are exhausted. Usually you can have close to 500 students being honor and high honor. The music department teachers are excellent.The majority of the teachers are good with the exception of some young one that are mean to the students.', 'Nutley High was an alright school. I thought it was annoying how teachers would play favorites but I guess that’s seen at every school. Nutley is very Italian so there isn’t much diversity or activities that are diverse, just night of nations. It really depends on what teacher you get because if I’m being totally honest some teachers are bad while others are great.', 'I liked that there were a decent amount of AP classes offered at Nutley High School, but I would like to see more priority placed on academics than on athletics.', "I think Nutley High School is a very good school considering it's a public school in a small town. There is a good environment with very supportive and good teachers, as well as various types of clubs and activities. Also, many students in the school are involved in sports teams. However, I am a little disappointed that the school is lacking in participation relating to certain types of major school programs and competitions. For example, there is no Olympiad team in the school, even though that is a reputable competition that spans across schools all over the nation! There also isn't much of a competitive environment among the students, but that's fine since it's a public school.", 'Loved the theater department.  My son got so much out of it that he is going to college for theater in the back stage.', 'The part that I really enjoyed about Nutley High School were my teachers.  They made the high school experience enjoyable and helped me become who I am now.  They many tips when it came to studying helps me even now while I am in college.  I am eternally grateful to them.  Also the music department was another favorite of mine.  I sang during my years in Nutley High School and now because of them I enjoy singing more than ever.  I have decided to continue training my voice as well.  The athletic department brought back the archery club in Nutley High School and I was proud to have been the president and lead the my school to place third in states.  Nutley High School is a great school to attend and I am happy to be a graduate/alum of that school.', 'The school is overall good but more classes and activities should be established. The sports are very average but the clubs are very plentiful and amazing. Sometimes I feel like education is so amazing and other classes make me doubt whether our school can improve in certain courses.']
column6: ['average high school, public. mostly focused on academics and sports. Everyone is friendly and are allowed to express themselves as whatever they want. open minded school', "I loved growing up in Nutley and being with many of the same people through all my years in school. The smaller class sizes are great, but where I believe that Nutley really struggles is with college and career preparedness. Although I learned the normal subjects that high school typically brings, there was almost zero exposure to the world outside of it. When I went to college, I realized that I was one of the few in my business school that didn't know how to write a proper resume or how to dress and act for interviews. I feel like some real-world skills being brought into the classroom would really help Nutley High School students and bring a more memorable and productive experience.", "Nutley High School was a roller coaster. It is the best way to describe my experience. The teachers were very well educated to give amazing lessons. Here and there, there were maybe two or three teachers who were young and new that made me struggle a bit. However, the extra help that was offered resulted in my outstanding improvement. Otherwise, the teachers found a way to create a strict yet fun learning environment. Other than the teachers, the whole faculty, when it came to the guidance counselors or the office workers, were very sweet and knowledgeable. All questions were asked at ease. Now, students' behavior cannot be controlled by the school. There were struggles when it came to finding true friends and getting rid of the negative people. But, I was able to push through and become positive and happier. Nutley High School will always have a special place in my heart.", 'I had a overall Good experience i Moved to that school freshmen year from another town. It was very different but better then my old school. The education and teacher were so much better then i expected. but only think i would have wished was there was more of a diversity and that we would speak on it at school.', "Yikes.  That's all I can say.  This place needs a makeover architecturally, culinarily, and a massive makeover with it's attitude.  Respect 30% of the school has is completely drowned out by the other 70%.  It's bad.  Like very bad, and the school is too cheap to change financially and mentally.", 'The school had very good, dedicated teachers but they did not really prepare students for college work--they like to think they do. Not much diversity between the students and the school policy on dress codes and things like that were a little ridiculous for a public school.  Also, each year they got stricter, ruining events like the annual Decathlon and making those events less enjoyable. They should focus on getting students more ready for college and less on standardized tests because that was the biggest waste of time and i learned nothing from it. Overall, good school though I enjoyed my four years there.', 'Moving to this high school my sophomore year, I was more than nervous to attend it especially because I moved to the town for the betterment of the education.  Although I was filled with anxiety, the warm welcoming culture Nutley High School had was truly amazing.  The teachers are always willing to stay after school no matter the time just to help, and they truly want to see you succeed.  Overall, Nutley High School has left its mark on me.', "Gave up honors classes for AP and no block scheduling so that's not good", "The school isn't very diverse.  My friends came from all over though", 'I never had a problem or heard of one really', "Some teachers are very engaging and go out of their way.  I took 14 honors and 6 ap classes so my experience wasn't the average", 'all depends upon the teacher.  some are great and some are awful', 'The overall teaching is decent.  But if your field of study after high school involves math or you struggle in a math classroom BEWARE. This schools math department is a joke.', 'i am not involved in a lot of these activities but my children are having positive feedback on Extracurricular activities.', 'some teachers are very knowledgeable and helpful,others are not.overall teachers are ok', 'the school is fairly clean healthy environment and safe', 'i am overall satisfied with the school and the performance of my kids,although the only thing that was annoying is the soccer coach racist picking of players.', 'The students are not as diverse as most schools, yet have a mix of different cultures. The teachers are engaging and help the students understand lessons in positive and fun manner, The teaching styles vary as some are more engaging than others.', 'visitors must sign in and wait in the office', 'coming into high school, it was hard to find clubs']

column2: ["It used to have a rotating drop schedule but they switched it to an 8-period schedule and it has not improved anybody academically. It's caused an overwhelming amount of stress and mental health issues to many AP students especially.", 'I had a great experience.  I was involved in sports and clubs.  I made some of my best friends at Lenape and always felt supported by moat of my teachers.', 'Lenape Valley has a variety different courses to choose from, and each teacher had different styles that have an impact on a variety different students.  Through the last four years, the school has upgraded their security.   The school also requires 21 century learning to prep students for real world responsibilities.', 'At Lenape Valley, I enjoyed the variety of classes that they offered such as Supreme Court, Forensics, Anatomy, Dramatics, etc. However, the way that sports are valued over other activities is not acceptable. Other activities have to fight for recognition and money while sports and sports related items in the school get majority of the budget.', "I enjoy going to Lenape Valley. It seems that there isn't too much hate or bullying that occurs here, and the teachers I've had are always doing their best to help their students succeed. There are a plethora of clubs and sports students can get involved in, and students have the opportunity to create their own club with a teacher's authorization!", 'It’s like any other high school really. We have a rotating drop schedule which helps getting homework done a lot because we don’t have the same classes everyday. It’s also nice that we get a break from certain classes.', 'I did not enjoy my experience at Lenape Valley Regional High School. Throughout my four year, I witnessed countless numbers of fights, most of which got physical. My teachers were extremely average and did not help me in any way to form a want to continue my education after high school. All in all, I felt underappreciated, belittled, and unsafe at school.', 'The school offers classes for individuals at all ends of the spectrum whether it be AP and Honors or CP classes.  Guidance counselors are very helpful with scheduling and finding a mix of classes that best suits each student.', 'I liked the environment a lot, the teachers, the students, and everything were very exceptional. The administration really cares about students. Small classrooms 25 students on average, for focused one on one teacher learning if needed. Parking is good for students. A turf field for multisports.', 'Over the past couple of years, Lenape has taken a turn for the worse. Our math department is terrible, and the administration hasn’t seen to have done anything to fix it. The guidance department is also useless and care more for the students who don’t care about high school than the ones that are actively trying to do well. Very students of ours get into top universities simply because they don’t have enough guidance as to how to. However, we overall have a good school atmosphere with some great traditions.', "I enjoyed my time at LVHS, some of my fondest memories occurring within the oddly colored walls, but I felt as if they didn't prepare me as much for college. I feel as if there should have been more structure and a better curriculum that would benefit scholars.", "I honestly think I was able to get through this high school if not for my friends. The faculty seems to have been working here for a very long time, but there was no updated information about the next steps into college. Brochures in the guidance office are explaining how to fill out paper forms, and do not relate to the college process currently. As I am eager to fill out anything for scholarships, I tried to ask the guidance office as a sophomore and junior. I was told to wait until I am a senior and was not given any additional resources to find any other scholarships. There was not an attempt to get to know the student's interest in any particular scholarship subject. This guidance office and school, in general, is for people with past experience with preparing for college. As high school should have provided the resources for college, I found that there was not much help especially from the guidance office in preparing to apply to college and the next financial aid for college.", 'Lenape Valley Regional Highschool is a school like no other. It is consisted of three main towns, which is what it makes it so unique. Adding on to that it is a choice school, makes it so that there are kids from several different towns. These aspects of Lenape are on of the reasons it is great. It’s due to the fact that it is so diverse and you get to meet new people once you enetered high school. I really enjoyed getting to know kids from different towns and learning what it was like in their middle school. Then the sports helped us get closer and it was very easy to make friendes that way. Another great thing about Lenape is that everyone cares about one another. The teachers and faculty care about all the students and the students care about one another. All the Lenape is great one thing they could change is classes. All my four years we have had the same electives. It would be nice if they switched them up and even added new classes.', "Lenape Valley Regional High School was a good school to have spent my last four years getting ready for college at, but it could have been better.  I felt like I have connected with many of the teachers at my school throughout that years that I have studied there, but some of them lacked in the academic sense of it.  There were a lot of times where the teachers were confused on the subject or or just didn't really teach at all during the class and expected us to know everything about the subject, which wasn't very helpful.  The administration didn't really care to punish the kids who needed to be disciplined.  They would call the students down to the office and just give them a warning and let them go.  Also, some of the classrooms, bathrooms, and locker rooms were not up to date and were not in the best shaped.  Although, the school may not be the best I could have attended, it got me to where I needed to be, and for that I could not be more thankful.", "The school doesn't care about its students whatsoever. They only want funding so they will do anything to get it. They especially hate their seniors and enjoy taking away traditions and creating new ones and considering them traditions.", "I live in the town of Hopatcong, so I had to apply to the choice program at Lenape in order to attend. I couldn't be more happy that I did! Even though I was coming from a different town than the other kids, I was able to make so many friends with absolutely no problem. There are countless clubs and sports to get involved in which provide you with awesome, fun experiences where you get to try new things and make new friends. The sports coaches are great and I couldn't have had a better experience. Academically, Lenape offers numerous AP classes and CP classes, which are still challenging. There are plenty of electives to choose from. My favorite part of Lenape, though, is our school spirit. We were voted best fans in all of Sussex and Morris counties, and our football games are an absolute blast. The school spirit creates an incredible sense of community throughout our school, one that only a Lenape Valley Patriot can experience.", 'Being enrolled in Lenape Valley Regional High School was a great experience. Not only do they have a wide selection of academics, electives, and extra curricular activities which helped me find my passions and gave me countless opportunities and memories, the school felt like a home and we were all filled with pride. I got to see my best friends every day, whether I met them in Lenape or grew up with them, we all lived within ten minutes of each other and you could find everyone  bundled up, rain or shine,cheering and screaming at every Friday night football game. Lenape was truly a close family, where I always felt like I belonged. Whatever you like or whoever you are, Lenape has a place for you.', "Lenape is more than a school it's a community and family.  Everyone is so friendly, caring and devoted.  Teachers are always willing to help with school or clubs and most students take their work seriously. The school challenges students and provides competitive and rigorous courses.  I feel that I am 100% ready for college.", 'Lenape Valley was a great high school as the teachers were very supportive of each and every student. The school was not very large so teachers were able to spend extra time with students to help them understand class material better. The school had various different extracurricular activities for students to participate in after school.', "As a senior soon graduating from Lenape, I think it's safe to say I can give a fair review based upon my experience the past 4 years. The sports program at Lenape is what the culture revolves around. Especially, the football team where almost all the students and many faculty are known to come out and support the team. Clubs are present but have lost numbers and their place in the Lenape culture in the past years. Many students care deeply about their academics here. I never once felt unsafe at any time in the school or at any school event. The teachers genuinely care about you and AP classes are there for the highly motivated student, which there are a considerable amount of. I've enjoyed all my classes at Lenape and I can honestly say that I really learned in all of them, class lessons and life lessons alike. Overall, my experience at Lenape was one I will treasure and would recommend to any parents looking for a future school for their children."]
