The administration didn't really care to punish the kids who needed to be disciplined.  They would call the students down to the office and just give them a warning and let them go.  Also, some of the classrooms, bathrooms, and locker rooms were not up to date and were not in the best shaped.  Although, the school may not be the best I could have attended, it got me to where I needed to be, and for that I could not be more thankful.", "The school doesn't care about its students whatsoever. They only want funding so they will do anything to get it. They especially hate their seniors and enjoy taking away traditions and creating new ones and considering them traditions.", "I live in the town of Hopatcong, so I had to apply to the choice program at Lenape in order to attend. I couldn't be more happy that I did! Even though I was coming from a different town than the other kids, I was able to make so many friends with absolutely no problem. There are countless clubs and sports to get involved in which provide you with awesome, fun experiences where you get to try new things and make new friends. The sports coaches are great and I couldn't have had a better experience. Academically, Lenape offers numerous AP classes and CP classes, which are still challenging. There are plenty of electives to choose from. My favorite part of Lenape, though, is our school spirit. We were voted best fans in all of Sussex and Morris counties, and our football games are an absolute blast. The school spirit creates an incredible sense of community throughout our school, one that only a Lenape Valley Patriot can experience.", 'Being enrolled in Lenape Valley Regional High School was a great experience. Not only do they have a wide selection of academics, electives, and extra curricular activities which helped me find my passions and gave me countless opportunities and memories, the school felt like a home and we were all filled with pride. I got to see my best friends every day, whether I met them in Lenape or grew up with them, we all lived within ten minutes of each other and you could find everyone  bundled up, rain or shine,cheering and screaming at every Friday night football game. Lenape was truly a close family, where I always felt like I belonged. Whatever you like or whoever you are, Lenape has a place for you.', "Lenape is more than a school it's a community and family.  Everyone is so friendly, caring and devoted.  Teachers are always willing to help with school or clubs and most students take their work seriously. The school challenges students and provides competitive and rigorous courses.  I feel that I am 100% ready for college.", 'Lenape Valley was a great high school as the teachers were very supportive of each and every student. The school was not very large so teachers were able to spend extra time with students to help them understand class material better. The school had various different extracurricular activities for students to participate in after school.', "As a senior soon graduating from Lenape, I think it's safe to say I can give a fair review based upon my experience the past 4 years. The sports program at Lenape is what the culture revolves around. Especially, the football team where almost all the students and many faculty are known to come out and support the team. Clubs are present but have lost numbers and their place in the Lenape culture in the past years. Many students care deeply about their academics here. I never once felt unsafe at any time in the school or at any school event. The teachers genuinely care about you and AP classes are there for the highly motivated student, which there are a considerable amount of. I've enjoyed all my classes at Lenape and I can honestly say that I really learned in all of them, class lessons and life lessons alike. Overall, my experience at Lenape was one I will treasure and would recommend to any parents looking for a future school for their children."]
column6: ['The teachers at Lenape Valley Regional High School are wonderful to work with, easy to talk to, and know exactly how to teach each child so that they get the best benefits. The small family like environment is great and it really helps that each teacher creates a special bond with each student. Some changes that need could be done would be reducing the amounts of tests and exams we have recently been forced to do such as quarterlies.', 'The administration is corrupt. DiRupo was both the superintendent and principal at one point. School is literally falling apart. Roofs always leaking or missing ceiling tiles in classrooms. Many of my classrooms had trash cans and trash bags hanging from the ceiling scattered to try to collect the water from leakage even if it was not raining. Mold in the walls. Some good teachers that know what they are doing. Others are just there for the salary. Good amount of fights in the student body.', 'It taught me to get my work done, and be on time. How to adapt to new situations, and be ready for the outside world. Overall i love this school, and thank them for my amazing experience we are Lenape!', 'To be honest Lenape Valley is an amazing school. They always try to help you but you have to put in the effort', "All of the teachers are very kind and willing to help. I like the grading scale, there are no 'D's so it motivates students to do better.", 'Lenape Valley Regional offered me many opportunities that I am aware that other schools may have not been able to and a safe environment for me to grow as an individual.  However, there are some aspects in which the school falls short, particularly in mathematics and sciences.  While the teachers are spectacular and full of energy, the funding for these programs is nearly minuscule and the teachers are not given the necessary resources. The school shamefully invests excessive amounts of money in athletics but lets its STEM academic areas suffer.', 'Some classes were tough, others were so easy, and some were such a joke. The administration made so many abrupt and silly changes every year that it was so hard to get used to anything academically. Anger at our academics was what usually got us through the year. For Sports, everything went to football. Also the bathrooms are gross.', 'I loved all of my teachers and classes were usually fun. They have a great educational system however, my graduating class was not well-disiplined and the administration did not know how to properly deal with us as a group. I have learned a lot however, they could not find an appropriate teacher for my AP chemistry class and settled for a teacher that did not create an AP environment. Instead I felt like I was in middle school and did not receive adequate education in this one particular class. My anatomy class and teacher was outstanding and the program/curriculum for this class is the best it can be.', "My experience as a theatre-loving student at Lenape has been amazing, but I wish that the theatre and arts department had more recognition and funding. The school does not fund the theatre department in any way, and it is up to the director of the production to manage finances and earnings from the previous year's ticket sales. Although the school very much values sports over the arts, we still manage to put on productions that captivate audiences every year. The academic atmosphere is rigorous, and most teachers care deeply about the education of their students. Grading is fair, and I personally haven't had many issues regarding grading and teachers. Lenape also offers a wide variety of sports, community service, environmental, business, and cultural clubs. Each student has a chance to develop themselves as well-rounded individuals through academics and the countless opportunities to get involved within the school and community.", 'For the most part, the teachers are very good and truly care about the students. There are many options for extracurricular activities and if one sees that an activity is not represented, new clubs can be made fairly easily. The administration tries its best for the students though may have a few lapses when it comes to understanding how the students will feel about  changes or may not fully explain the benefits or reasons for changes. Most of the students try and are good, but the experience can be tainted by the students who do not care and have generally bad attitudes about everything. ', 'The academics are just average.  Not a lot of electives offered when I was there, had a lot to learn when I got to college.', 'There is barely any diversity here.  Mostly all white people from the same middle class, it is a small school with mostly everyone being related to each other.', 'I felt safe at school because you had to buzz in and state your name and business before they let you into the school.  Then you went right into the office and had to show your ID and sign in before you could go anywhere else.  There are also security cameras and a security guard at the school at all times.', 'There are actually quite a few extracurricular at Lenape Valley and that is what I liked most about the school.  My favorite was a community service driven one called Interact because we got to go on trips and participate in making a difference.  I also liked Peer to Peer because it was a group of friendly students willing to help anyone.  Student Council was also fun because you got to participate in a lot of decision making for the school.', 'I made sure to get involved so that I had a really good time and joined sports and clubs so I could meet people with the same interests as me.', 'The teachers at the school are very approachable and kind for the most part but are not too worried about the quality of education they are providing.  Lots of busy work that does not necessarily pertain to what we are suppose to be learning about.', 'I feel very safe in my school and I can go to school everyday and not feel threatened', 'the clubs are a great thing in any school but I do wish there were more options of the different clubs you can choose from.', 'I am not really sure about the parental involvement at the school but when it comes to athletic games, especially football, A LOT of parents come out and support our athletic teams and it is such a great thing!', "The teachers that I have had the past 4 years varied. The majority of the teachers I had were very outgoing and so helpful. I could go to those teachers anytime outside of class and they would be there, eager to help me. Some teachers made learning fun and making their class enjoyable while I did have a few teachers that I didn't really like their teaching style, but every teacher teaches differently. But in all I loved majority of my teachers and I have learned so much!"]
column8: ["There aren't a whole lotta extra safety policies, but its not really necessary\r pretty safe school", "Of the sports I've participated in, soccer, football, and wrestling, the coaches were fun and very good. Very competitive", "Outside of sports, I'm not really familar with how are parents contribute to the schooling environment", "Most teachers I have are pretty good. There are a few I've had throughout my 4 years that are terrible and really should not be teaching, but generally the teachers are friendly and knowledgable.", 'The school nurse is one of the most miserable human beings most people will ever meet, and students will often call their parents to pick them up from school rather than have to deal with getting yelled at or judged by the school nurse.', "As like everything else in the school, extracurricular's are okay. You can get involved to have another club on your resume, but you truly aren't doing much to have fun or give back to the community. Even students who try to be involved don't get much from Lenape's extracurricular's.", "My favorite experiences throughout my time at this school have included Friday night football games, wrestling matches and being involved in the school's theater program. This school is not very unique because it is very focused on athletics and it seems as if none of the students look forward to going to class everyday. I would not chose this school to attend to again because the teachers don't put enough effort into their students and their work, the school has a lot of cliques, and there is not much motivation from teachers or guidance counselors to achieve your future goals and dreams.", 'Only a handful of teachers genuinely enjoy their job and excel at properly teaching and helping their students. Most teachers rush through lessons and put pressure on students to get good grades without any offered extra help during their free periods or before/after school.', 'Teachers donttry to stop fights so kids get beat up', 'They care more about standardized tests then actually teaching .', 'The teachers are not very helpful with children who learn differently. If your child has ADHD you can be sure they will fail.', 'The school has a lot of clubs and sports to join.', 'The football team is great.', 'Some parents need to let their kids grow up on their own instead of running to high school administrators when their kids gets offended by someone.', 'Teachers are approachable and involved in many aspects of school life in and outside of the classroom.', 'Coming from a city school, I feel very safe at Lenape. There has never been a time where I have felt unsafe.', "There are tons of extracurriculars to get involved in. Most clubs have meetings during lunch making it easier to fit into a student's busy schedule. There is a variety of sports to get involved in. They provide varsity and junior varsity. There is a lot of school spirit.", 'Teachers go out of their way to spend lunches and after school time for their students. They answer questions to the best of their ability.', "We're a safe school but not all of our safety percussion are updated.", "I don't think other schools around us have as many participants in their school events.  We get involved with everything from sports to plays to chorus and band."]

column2: ['As a senior I really enjoyed the academic level and rigor of the school. it has great classes for college readiness like college now and Advance Placements. the only flaw is the students. They are loud and slow which creates traffic at hallways. Other than that the teacher and the curriculum is great.', "Something I really liked about this is school is that is small, I personally don't like when theres a large amount people attending to the school. But it really needs to improve at getting teachers that would worry for the students future.", 'I have been in this school since sophomore year and now I’m a senior at the school. I love it. The students, teachers and staff in general are amazing. The parent involvement had been always as its highest. I was afraid that I wouldn’t fit in at the beginning but everyone just welcomed me with open arms. I have grown so much and all because of the opportunities that the school has given me.', 'The teachers are great and the environment feels great compared to other inner city public high schools. The faulty make sure to help each individual student in every way they can.', 'I loved it, after transferring from my previous school which was terrible I really wanted my new school to be great and it was the kids are friendly and it’s a small school so it’s easy to fit in', 'What I liked about veritas acdemy was the fact that it was a small school so everyone knows one another I also liked the programs that they have there but I do think they should add more and really help to get your perpared for college and make sure you have all your community service', 'Veritas Academy is a new public high school, has been around for four years. In this high school you can feel safe at all times, and with it being a small institution it makes the connection between student and teacher even more reachable. Being comfortable with speaking to your teacher, asking questions, or comments really improves your way of learning. In Veritas you can know the majority of the students, as well as they can know you. Veritas Academy will encourage you to follow your dreams and set your way in order to  follow them. You are always supported and welcome at Veritas.', 'Veritas is a good school overall and they are making strides in adding more extracurriculars and clubs.', 'Veritas Academy is a great high school, my 4 years in veritas was great. Even though there were many times I got in trouble, that school showed me right from wrong. Senior year in veritas is great, I have class with people I love to be around. The teachers know me since my first year there. They nicknamed me “Trouble” because I was in trouble everyday in my freshman year.', 'The major reason why I like Veritas Academy is that everyone is very welcoming. Everyone is extremely nice to one another. Teachers are determined to push students to the best of their abilities.', 'Veritas Academy has a lot of diversity which is important for young teenagers to be exposed to. Veritas Academy is also a small school which means teachers develop a strong bond with all the students so that every student has an adult they can speak to.', "Believe 2018 is Veritas Academy's 5th year. I love how the teachers and students are close. It is a small school, so you would know everyone in your grade and beyond. From what I see, the school is introducing more advanced classes each year. I hope that soon, they will have a veriaty of AP courses.", 'What I liked about Veritas academy was the great attention each student gets from the teachers. Teachers are willing to help you academically and socially in any way, they prepare you for the outside world and college. Everyone is friendly and they will always have their doors open for anyone whose willing to have a great future.', 'Veritas has small class sizes which help with my learning process. Most New York Public schools are so over crowded that you do not have enough teacher/student interaction. But at Veritas Academy we have much more teacher/student involvement.', 'The teachers are very involved with the students and their learning. The school is located in a mildly dense populated area and easy to travel to.', 'I love that it is a small school! The teachers are great! I would highly recommend this school.  I have had a great first year. I have made friends. I have also grown as a person.', 'My experience at Veritas Academy has been one of fun.  I have met people that gave me joy, kindness, and became my second family. It may not have all the resources that most high schools have but due to its smaller student body compared to other schools. Students create lasting bonds with each other and their teachers who are seen as older siblings/parents in a sense.', "If you want a good safe school veritas is the place to go. It is a good environment to be in and the teachers and faculty are there too help you whenever I wouldn't change a thing about the school it's that good"]

['The level of diversity in New World High School is super captivating. There is a very safe environment for students. Teachers love to keep in touch with their students and give a hand with anything they need help with.', 'New World High School is one of the most diverse schools in New York City. It is one of the most modern schools with wonderful education staff.', 'I liked everything about this school. The teachers were nice and were very willing to help me understand the topics of every class.', 'Love the school, they truly care about the students. Seeing the  diversity in the hallways was heart warming.', 'The school is very diverse and they celebrate the diversity by having a multicultural show every year.  They also prepare students for college by providing them with college now; the students get the college experience and an in-look of how the classes will be like.', 'New World High school is a school filled up with many different cultures. The diversity within the school makes everything beautiful and perfect. Interacting with other students from other countries gives you more knowledge about the world which I really appreciate. The school has different school activities which will get you engaged in. Sports, after school clubs, College readiness are few activities which makes the school more entertaining. The school is amazing,  everyone including the staff members and the students treat each other as  family and with respect.', 'This high school has a lot of potential and has lots to offer. They provide a great environment for students to learn, especially to those who English is their second language. They also offer great school clubs and activities for students who want to branch out into searching or applying their hobbies!', 'New World High School is a great diversity school with students coming around the world. The teachers really nice and help their students to improve in the subjects needed.', 'I love this school. I have had a great experience with the support of all the teachers and counselor. Thry have helped me a lot , they also have great programs that can help you progress and also many after school activity including community services where I learned how to appreciate the little things we have in life because others may not have the same thing. I have a great experience im this school.', 'The teachers know what they are doing and are always willing to help you out when you need it.', 'The access to technology is pretty easy. Counselors are very helpful and care about the students.', 'There should be sports such as Football and Swimming in our school. For the existing sports in our school, we should have more experienced coaches', 'The problem with my school is that policies are not properly enforced. Such include the school uniform policy. Many kids in my school no longer wear uniform because they receive to punishment. They only call their parents whom seem to not much care about it.', 'The food in my school is fine. However, it seems as if it has been stored in for quite a while and the milk is sometimes a day away from expiring', 'Helpful to students, extracurricular activities, multicultural shows.', 'Different events, shows, holiday celebrations are available.', 'This school is very good at extracurricular activities.', 'This school is a good school. This school gives student lots of opportunities.', 'I think this school be more creative with the cafeteria menu and offer healthier food', 'The school staff is very helpful for first year student, they really guide them through the right path']

column1: Urban Assembly Gateway School for Technology
column2: ['Gateway is a school thats trying, and while most students seem to not care gateway is really good in making sure that their students do something after high school.', "It's a very good learning and shared community spacendnsbshsnsnshshsndjdhsnsjjsndjjdndndndndndjenhdhdjdbdnfhfhfnfj", "My first year here at this school has been amazing so far i enjoy every aspect of it the grading system lets you see the impact so you have a chance to improve Your grades The teachers are AMAZING they're all super sweet and nice every teacher is unique in their own way they'll most likely become your best friends I've honestly never really been friends of teachers I've only ever liked two teachers but the teachers here are so friendly you'll definitely want to be friends btw living environment is one of my favorite", "It's good but many work. It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.It's good but many work.", 'The school is very talented when it come to support and giving you what you need to be successful and finding who you are. They have wonderful teachers which are understanding and give you all the help you can need. The school have opportunities for students to get help after school and get internships and jobs at the school. They are a safe campus and everyone is treated the same.', 'I recently graduated from UAG, and I can honestly say I had an amazing time there. I realized how much I missed the place after I left it. The teachers there, will be your best friends, and I can say that from the bottom of my heart. They genuinely care about how you\'re doing, what your future plans are, and they truly want to see you succeed and do great. They are all a great support system, and just amazing people. Best staff and faculty ever! Also the courses and the resources the school provides for you, are amazing. You appreciate the hard classes and the "annoying" resource emails, but you appreciate it when it starts to pay off. Great school!', 'The Urban Assembly Gateway School for Technology is all that a motivated student will want. Technology based, the school incorporates many aspects of technology within their activities, assemblies, and more. The teachers and staff actually care about the students, and go out of their way to aid a student in need. There are many social services available to students, ensuring that they are not only educationally on level, but also emotionally on level. The college advisor is there to make sure all students know what their plans are regarding college and post graduation holistically. The three pathways of the school are Digital Design and Animation, IT, and Software Engineering. These pathways act as majors and students will have to choose which pathway they are entering at the end of freshman year.', 'This school has been a great experience for my sons. The Principal and staff are very caring, and are always available to speak with parents.', 'My experience at UAG has been some of the best & worst days of my life. Their are days where everyone is annoying and their are days where you love everybody. The 2018 class is the type of class who don’t all talk to eachother all the time due to being in separate  but put us in a room all together and we would all be able to talk. Amazing opportunities here only if you take them though', 'The Urban Assembly produces a lot of of opportunities that other high schools don’t. It was a very life changing 4 Years for me.', "The school itself is really good at helping you figure out what you want to be.. even if it's not technology related. The people, not so great", "The majority of the teachers genuinely care for their students. The food is ...okay. It's very diverse and a bit quirky/nerdy. My only real problem is the fact that I was a senior taking a full stack of classes despite having all my credits and regents exams required.", "I enjoyed school here for the most part. There are a lot of opportunities available for students. I loved the staff and Principle McKoy is an amazing human being. My only issue was when majority of my teachers left at the end of junior year. Also, an ineffective uniform policy that is terribly enforced. They aren't the best in terms of college readiness yet because there have only been 2 graduating classes but they are on the right track. If you're looking for a tech school with opportunity, this is the place to be", 'The thing I like about this school is they make it hard for you fail. They make it so they give you as much help as possible to insure that you succeed.', "Perfect for students wanting to be certified in technology and digital design, the school offers many opportunities and classes to become certified in the field of technology. Urban Assembly Gateway School for Technology has an amazing staff that cares about their students education, wanting to create enjoyment for each subject. This High School offers many internships with Microsoft, Google, and Goldman Sachs. From attending Urban Assembly Gateway School for Technology,  I've learned how to build and fix computers to building my very own network, I recommend  this school to any student that is fascinated with technology.", "Overall, the school is great with lots of resources to get you where you want to go. Even if you choose to not do technology for the rest of your life, they will try their best to help you go down your track. The coordinators there are also good at providing and promoting different programs that you might be interested in or looks good on your resume. The teachers there are pretty young, so they're laid back and definitely cooler than others.", "This school is unlike any other school that I know of. Coming into high school I was afraid that I would be distant from everyone and the staff and I would just go and learn and go home.  However, In UAG Tech, you get well acquainted with staff, and you feel like you as an individual have impact in the school. UAG Tech is a uniform school, but they have a wide variety of clothing you can wear, but you are only required to wear a shirt. I've changed a lot because I went to this school, and I would recommend it if you would like to pursue a career in technology in the future, or if you just enjoy a well knit community.", "Teachers are dedicated to help students graduate and learn real life skills due the fact they actually care. It's at a point where they will call you out if they are missing something. Since they have lots of students there is a huge work load in which they hire student to help with their work to finish faster with a sense of not try to rush the grading process. Many students understand what is happening and will try to keep upgraded.", "It really surprises me that it doesn't really matter where you come from but just who you really are as a person. Other schools you can tell one ethnicity from another due to the fact who they hangout with. In UAG everyone is with everyone no one will ever outcast you just for being a different culture ethnicity or believe in something they don't believe in. No one will tell you what to do and they will support you.", 'The security is okay since there seem to be time to time students from other school getting in with a few drug substance inside the school. No real violent actions has occur in the school and they seem to be everywhere so incase of trouble at least an officer will be there to stop it. They do seem unfit but they are effective and usually communicate and know the students around the building.']

The Principal and staff are very caring, and are always available to speak with parents.', 'My experience at UAG has been some of the best & worst days of my life. Their are days where everyone is annoying and their are days where you love everybody. The 2018 class is the type of class who don’t all talk to eachother all the time due to being in separate  but put us in a room all together and we would all be able to talk. Amazing opportunities here only if you take them though', 'The Urban Assembly produces a lot of of opportunities that other high schools don’t. It was a very life changing 4 Years for me.', "The school itself is really good at helping you figure out what you want to be.. even if it's not technology related. The people, not so great", "The majority of the teachers genuinely care for their students. The food is ...okay. It's very diverse and a bit quirky/nerdy. My only real problem is the fact that I was a senior taking a full stack of classes despite having all my credits and regents exams required.", "I enjoyed school here for the most part. There are a lot of opportunities available for students. I loved the staff and Principle McKoy is an amazing human being. My only issue was when majority of my teachers left at the end of junior year. Also, an ineffective uniform policy that is terribly enforced. They aren't the best in terms of college readiness yet because there have only been 2 graduating classes but they are on the right track. If you're looking for a tech school with opportunity, this is the place to be", 'The thing I like about this school is they make it hard for you fail. They make it so they give you as much help as possible to insure that you succeed.', "Perfect for students wanting to be certified in technology and digital design, the school offers many opportunities and classes to become certified in the field of technology. Urban Assembly Gateway School for Technology has an amazing staff that cares about their students education, wanting to create enjoyment for each subject. This High School offers many internships with Microsoft, Google, and Goldman Sachs. From attending Urban Assembly Gateway School for Technology,  I've learned how to build and fix computers to building my very own network, I recommend  this school to any student that is fascinated with technology.", "Overall, the school is great with lots of resources to get you where you want to go. Even if you choose to not do technology for the rest of your life, they will try their best to help you go down your track. The coordinators there are also good at providing and promoting different programs that you might be interested in or looks good on your resume. The teachers there are pretty young, so they're laid back and definitely cooler than others.", "This school is unlike any other school that I know of. Coming into high school I was afraid that I would be distant from everyone and the staff and I would just go and learn and go home.  However, In UAG Tech, you get well acquainted with staff, and you feel like you as an individual have impact in the school. UAG Tech is a uniform school, but they have a wide variety of clothing you can wear, but you are only required to wear a shirt. I've changed a lot because I went to this school, and I would recommend it if you would like to pursue a career in technology in the future, or if you just enjoy a well knit community.", "Teachers are dedicated to help students graduate and learn real life skills due the fact they actually care. It's at a point where they will call you out if they are missing something. Since they have lots of students there is a huge work load in which they hire student to help with their work to finish faster with a sense of not try to rush the grading process. Many students understand what is happening and will try to keep upgraded.", "It really surprises me that it doesn't really matter where you come from but just who you really are as a person. Other schools you can tell one ethnicity from another due to the fact who they hangout with. In UAG everyone is with everyone no one will ever outcast you just for being a different culture ethnicity or believe in something they don't believe in. No one will tell you what to do and they will support you.", 'The security is okay since there seem to be time to time students from other school getting in with a few drug substance inside the school. No real violent actions has occur in the school and they seem to be everywhere so incase of trouble at least an officer will be there to stop it. They do seem unfit but they are effective and usually communicate and know the students around the building.']

column2: ["Some people criticize this school because of how small it is and how little it offers due to lack of funding, but I highly respect the staff members for making the most out of what is has. The staff members are friendly, passionate people with plenty of personality. It's been a pleasure learning at this school.", 'I really enjoyed this school . Small amounts of students which have the opportunity for each student to get the attention that is needed to progress In high school', "It's a great school. There are alots of excellent teachers. The school is quite small so communication between teacher and student is easier.", "Civic Leadership Academy is a small school with a very diverse population. The teachers are very helpful and the school's policies encourage students to graduate. The school is safe and has a fair number of clubs.", 'Civic Leadership Academy(CLA) is a very good school with staff that really care for the students. It’s a really small school only consisting of one floor. In total the campus has about 4 schools in one building.', 'This is honestly a good school. College Readiness is highly enhanced. Teachers are very cool with its students. School should definitely add more extracurriculars and clubs', "My experience at this school was overall good due to the resources that helped me apply to college. Even though there could've been more sports and activities on school grounds, I understand that the building was too small to hold any of these activities for students.", "Civic Leadership Academy is a small school which means that students receive substantial support from teachers. One major strength of the school is its focus of college readiness and college applications. They provide the right guidance and support that facilitate students' entry to great colleges. They offer SAT preparation classes, mentorship and college application help as soon as junior year.  Along with that, the school provides strong academics that prepare students for college including college now and AP classes. The teachers, counselor and administrators are truly invested in making sure that students get into outstanding colleges. Most of my peers attended competitive colleges and are not benefiting from the High School's push for college readiness and attendance.", 'Teachers go above and beyond to make sure you pass.They start to to prepare you for college from your freshman year.Only problem i would say is the lack of sports and clubs', 'I am very satisfied with civic leadership academy. Teachers are always willing to help me . I feel very safe', 'This is a horrible school. Certain kids do whatever they want and talk back to the teachers. They use their phones in class and break the rules and nothing happens to them. The principal usually misses 2-3 days a week. She doesn’t know the students and they curse her out a lot. No one likes or repects her. Would not recommend to students, parents or teachers.', 'A solid foundation of creativity,enthusiast, beautiful Scholar education. Lead to multiple opportunities to grow in experience.', 'The teachers and staff provided me with excellent resources that impacted my college readiness, immensely. I met so many amazing people, friends that I will  never forget. My favorite part of the school were the after school activities.  Growing up, I was a rather shy kid, and my school offered clubs that I could join without feeling too uncomfortable. Art club definitely helped me get out of my shell, and branch out and meet many other people. Lastly, teachers did everything possible for the students to attain the best education. The teachers were able to offer morning tutoring sessions, as well as after school tutoring sessions. The academy also had it’s annual Shakespeare faire, celebrating the writing of Shakespeare through live reenacted performances, monologues and original scenes from the book. My experience at Civic Leadership Academy was one that I will never forget. I had an amazing time.', 'This is my fourth and last year here at CLA, it almost felt too short. I thought I wouldn’t like it at first since I came from a large middle school but it completely changed me. I was able to interact with the school and my teachers more closely. I know everybody in school so there’s always greeting in the hallway. My last four years I saw the school improving as time went on. They introduced more ap classes and clubs. The school always try to get students and parents involved. I know there’s always a teacher I can talk to. There’s also the guidance counselor, (who is amazing btw) who you can talk to if there’s an academic problem, you’re looking for a jon/ an internship or just any concern in general. Even if I go back to 4 years ago 10 more times, I would still gladly choose Civic. If you’re a student or parent looking at this, please know you/ your kid will have an amazing time here.', 'I started high school when I was 14 years old in the year of 2013. In my second semester of my freshman year I was placed in honors classes that in the future led me to Advanced placement courses. They at the time only had three advanced placement courses but it was something. The diversity in the school was breathtaking in the sense that you learned about countries you have not even heard of, all the beautiful cultures were well presented in multi culture fairs and dances. The school is rather small being only two floors, and the teachers are all friendly and know you by more than a name. Civic leadership academy is defiantly a school for someone who wants to join a small family with big memories .', "The school offered a decent variety in extra-curricular activities that you can participate in. However, they could work on their college readiness when it comes to academics. The teachers, if used wisely and respectfully, are extremely helpful. It's a safe school for the most part, no major fighting-outbreaks. They can also increase their parent involvement in the school events. Their school concerts were always a big highlight of their events, as well as their barbecue.", 'i love the fact that they have activities that can bring students together, I would choose this school again if i was to go back to high school because since it is such a small school the attention we get from the staff and teachers really makes you comfortable and shows they care', "teachers are very caring, if you're having trouble they are always there to listen whether its personal or if it has to do with school.", "Recently, the OST declined in participants. There isn't sufficient clubs or activities to join.", "From the previous year's the PA have been very generous of taking matters into their own hands when it comes to funding."]

column6: ['The teachers are kind, friendly, and very intuitive. They want the best from their students and will do whatever to engage into learning the content for our regents and common core.', 'There are not many clubs and organizations available here (at least when compared to other schools), but the clubs and organizations offered seem really fun and easy to get into. There are many after-school activities and they also seem fun and easy to get into as well. A lot of students in Civic Leadership Academy love to participate in these activities. They also make these activities a priority in their lives. Some options that I know of are rugby, cooking club, fencing, DJ-club (a newer one), and table-tennis.', "Before I came to this school, I went to Long Island City High School. Civic Leadership Academy's staff pays much more attention to its students than in LICHS. They are on top of your every move (well most of your moves). There are many academic opportunities available, like college now, that I really enjoyed/ appreciate and that I don't think I would have been an option if I stayed in my other school. I am not a social butterfly so I do not speak to many people, but nonetheless the students and the teachers are very friendly in CLA. One thing I dislike about this school, though, is how small it is. I also dislike the amount of clubs/organizations and sports available. But, I would still choose this school because of how unique it is from the traditional idea of high school. Also, because of how friendly some students are and how much attention the staff pays to me.", "The teachers at Civic Leadership Academy always find a way to make their students interested in what they're teaching, whether that's through their teaching style or actual content. I am very familiar with how my teachers grade, so I always know what to expect. About half of my teachers seem to be genuinely interested in the students' lives. For most teachers, I do not know about their knowledge outside the classroom but inside, they are very intelligent for the most part.", 'The favorite experience is the amount of activities it offers.', "Most teacher offers office hours but some don't give out a lot of help to students. The scheduling process can be difficult because some people don't like the schedule they offers and some students take all different courses. Some teacher offer homework and classwork every day. There are sometime known as homework help which is like study group.", 'There are a variety of clubs for students to choose from like culinary and student government. Most students are really committed to one activities and take on leadership. There are a lot of options and most people enjoy.', 'The cafeteria can get dirty at time and the food does not taste as god.', 'Most students form friends with who they know and sometime people can be influenced easily by one another. Some students are not really involved with extracurricular activities.', 'There is not many competition or many sports going on.', 'I was seriously impacted by everyone in the school it has helped me grow as a person and has shaped the person I am today', "Like all schools there isn't much the nurse can do for you but she tries to help you as much as you can.", 'All the teachers make it their priority to help you succeed if you are willing to put in the effort', 'Our extracurricular activities are managed and form by the demand of the students.', "Like all schools the food isn't so good most of the times but there are times where the food is okay.", "There's no such thing as  athletic facilities . I do know this school will eventually expand and eventually succeed  in all the area they need help in.  I believe it's yet too small for sports  teams etc ", "The condition of the building couldn't be any better. It's bright and clean.  Always very clean, no vandalism, and security at entrance of building at all times.", 'I must say I find it impressive how in between class changes there are teachers in hallways loudly reminding kids to clear the halls and go to class. It seems to be a big family environment amongst the teachers.', "This is the real one area where being that the school is fairly new it's really weak in this department. ", "Security at the school is very good.  Considering the area it's in it's a pretty safe environment. "]

column2: ['Fund the art and music department more. Many students want to pursue an art career and if we expand that department it will help them in the future. The food is good not many complaints are made from students.', "At PV, I feel like I'm at home. We are truly a family. I have had teachers that have genuinely made me rethink what I previously thought was possible for myself. Although we may not have the resources other schools do, we make the best of our situations with pride. My horizons are completely open, and I can thank Passaic Valley for that.", "Going to Passaic Valley Regional High School for 3 years and being on my 4th, I am glad to say that I can call it a second home. I've always enjoyed going to school everyday and meeting my friends and striving for good grades. I am also involved in activities after schools such as the Future Medical Professionals Club and Computer Club, and I run Track and Cross Country.", "When I moved to New Jersey, I didn't know anyone. Every teacher and faculty member was so kind to me. I moved my sophomore and we weren't allowed phones or laptops and moving from a school where both is used every day it was quite strange. However, my junior year was the first year they allowed BYOD, so laptops for classes. Now for my senior year phones are allowed during homeroom and lunch. The only thing that I wish was better was other kids treating others better but there's not much the school can do about it.", 'I graduated from Passaic Valley High School this year. Academically, the classes are all up to standard. The safety was not the greatest, although we had one officer in the cafeteria. The staff and faculty were helpful, some we’re not very friendly and fair to students. Diverse school divided from three towns. The school lunch was good. The sanitation of the school was below average.', 'High school is what you make of it. Passaic Valley definitely can help you but you have to be willing to put in the work. The resources you need to succeed are not handed to you. Taking initiative helps you succeed.', "Passaic Valley High School has a great environment for students who want to learn. My teachers since freshman year have motivated me every day to continue working hard. I believe that PV has courses for everyone's interest. All the honors and AP classes that I have taken and really challenged me and have prepared me for college.", 'I have had a very good experience at Passaic Valley Regional High School.  I take challenging course loads with teachers that have helped me grow over the years.  I am involved in both sports and various clubs.  I have been a part of the peer mentor program, which allows me to help incoming freshmen have an overall good experience just as I have.', 'The school provides a good education, this is coming from a student who attended both Catholic Elementary School and High School Freshman year. There is a handful of great teachers that will impact you for life.', 'I liked the tight-knit community it created for me. I always felt welcomed in every club or activity. I just wish the school would change its focus on athletics to a more academic focus. Other schools are massively academically superior to Passaic Valley High School. It needs to put focus on programs like national honors society and the academic team.', 'The teaching staff at Passaic Valley is the best part of the school. The district has many faults, one being the administration has gotten too comfortable in their positions and have stopped trying to better the school in the way the school needs it. Many teachers have become too comfortable because of their tenure and I believe that needs to change. Overall I do think I learned a lot in my past four years.', "It was nice. Made a long lasting friend there and one of my art teachers helped me get into college so I'll always be thankful for that. The academics they offered were good, as well.", 'I liked a lot of the teachers there. Very friendly and kind, whereas others were there for a paycheck. I felt as if the discipline was too harsh, we were often threatened to not be able to walk on graduation if we even tried to have a senior prank. The girls were often a topic of conversation when they wore "skimpy" clothing whereas boys were rarely reprimanded for muscle tees in gym etc...', 'Girls Show at PV is the best! The highlight of the year! This show is what brings the hornets together,', 'I expected this high school to be worse, but it’s actually ok. The teachers teach and the students are overall pretty nice.', 'At Passaic Valley Regional High School, their are close to 1,000, about 300 per grade level, students attending from three towns, Little Falls, Woodland Park, and Totowa, giving students the chance to experience a very diverse student body with multiple ways of meeting new people. Academically this school provides the necessary needs for preparing for college.', 'If I can give them zero stars I would. My guidance  counselor  encouraged me to drop out and didn’t help at all so much for go hornets and some teachers just really don’t care if u pass at all I mean if your a teacher and you care for your students you would do everything in your power to make sure your student stays in school and graduates Class of nothing better off getting your GED then going to this school J.O.K.E', 'let me start off by saying the guidance teachers are very respectful and actually care about their job at least mrs vigilante does sorry if i butchered her name. With any school there could be some improvement, but overall there is a rich sense of diversity which adds to the feeling of the school. The teachers for the most part are really helpful and offer extra help if needed, the clubs and activities are endless which is a great opportunity to be involved and and the sports are okay here.', "The best thing about Passaic Valley is that there are so many academic, athletic, and extracurricular options for students. PV has anything for anyone, and I think that's great because there's a very broad assortment of students that come. Personally, I get lots of help from the staff there, too! My guidance counselor, teachers, etc. are making life at this school great! With all this, PV has its flaws. Due to lack of funding, certain commodities that are available in nearby schools are limited to us. This includes toilet papers, recycling, and up-to-date water fountains. PV bought these things called YONDR Pouches. Their sole purpose is to lock a student's phones up until the end of a period. Teacher's don't enforce their use, so it's a waste of money. Overall, though, PV is a great public school.", "An okay experience while I was here, nothing too remarkable. My stay here was plagued with so-so academics, however we took great pride in our athletics. And as I leave this year for college, we are only becoming stronger in our athletics departments. The new AD is really helping change the culture of the school. The academics are improving as well as PV continues to add more meaningful and college preparedness classes. All in all it's your typical high school, however in a few years I'm sure it'll be a remarkable place to study at."]

column6: ['Passaic Valley High School has taught me a lot within these 4 short years. With any school there could be some improvement, but overall there is a rich sense of diversity which adds to the feeling of the school.', 'It was a good school, compared to surrounding high schools, but there were not enough resources like late buses and funds for art programs. Overall, very average.', 'It’s a school that has both the academic programs and athletic programs. There are so many clubs you can join and so many sports. The teachers are good (for the most part).', 'My experience in Passaic Valley Regional High School has been really good all my 3 years here. The teachers for the most part are really helpful and offer extra help if needed, the clubs and activities are endless which is a great opportunity to be involved and and the sports are okay here, still great to be involved in though.', 'Passaic Valley is a very diverse and welcoming school. The teachers are amazing and very supportive. They care about their student.', "It was a great experience. The teachers, Especially those in honors and AP, push you to your limits and want you to succeed and realize your potentials. I have never been more prepared for college. The events and students are nice sometimes cliques form when you don't want them to but you know....teenagers.", 'it was a great school. Many clubs and activities were offered outside of actual classes. The teachers are great (most of them) and very helpful. Although I enjoyed my time at Passaic Valley Regional High School, they needed new computers and text books. They also could use a new football coach and more funding for the Arts and Sciences.', 'Besides the people I met, and the amazing teachers, Passaic Valley is on a steady route downhill. The administrations acts tyrannically, with no care for anything except their budget goals and making sure that everything appears calm to the outside. They stifled student organized events, including protests about gun control, in the name of maintaining safety, when in actuality they just made it a more toxic environment with their disregard for students and staff alike. If anything is to change, they must first change the administration so that they do not run on a system based on fear-mongering and dictatorial methods for governing their students and teachers.', 'Passaic Valley Regional High School has many options available for those interested in taking advanced academic courses, including many AP and Honors courses, both in STEM and Humanities. However, the school lacks the resources to fully achieve the potential of the advanced academic courses offered as part of the curriculum. The teachers of the advances courses are excellent and the curriculum and courses are present, however, the school lacks the means to fully provide for these courses. Textbooks are often times over ten years old and falling apart, and the lab equipment for the chemistry courses are dated and aging. Despite this, the classes offered are well taught and the material is presented well.', "PV isn't a bad school at all, and I've had excellent teachers and value my time there. As with any school, there are teachers that aren't great and some of the administration needs a total overhaul. It isn't very diverse, as most of the student body is white, but that wasn't a problem for me. I took mostly honors classes and enjoyed my time spent, especially in certain AP courses.", 'My experience at PV was a good one. It is all about how you make it. Some people make it bad for themselves, but getting involved made me love the fours years I spent there. I would not change a thing about it. Every school has its different ways of doing things.', 'I liked the tight knit sense of community at this school. Also Personally I learned how to challenge myself and handle heavy work loads and honors classes. This school has shaped me into the person I am today.', "I've created a lot of great memories as a Passaic Valley High School student. Although budget cuts have been made, eliminating various clubs, there are still many activities to be involved in and expand your social life. As someone who has taken both advanced classes and regular courses, it is evident that there is a huge difference in motivation and commitment among the students. There is no in-between, at least from what I've seen. From my experience, taking advantage of the resources PV has to offer involves putting yourself outside of your comfort zone, whether it be joining clubs, sports, or taking those harder classes.", "I think Passaic Valley Regional High School is a very unique school. It has intelligent students, caring faculty and a nice atmosphere. I wouldn't change anything about that school.", "I like many of my teachers, particularly in the history and English departments. PVRHS provides proficient instruction in most subjects. Also, the school body is very diverse, although the staff is not. Clubs and activities are fun and worthwhile, although many were cut in the past few years for budget purposes. I enjoy school sports, although they can be all-consuming, and some coaches treat their athletes as if they're not full-time students and don't have responsibilities outside of athletics.", 'My experience at PVHS has been great. I feel ready and prepared for college and feel that I have been offered so much over the past 4 years.  My teachers and especially guidance counselor have been amazing and so helpful to me.', 'PVHS is what you make of it. If you are in the top ten percent, then that means you are utilizing the opportunities that the school provides to their potential. I am in the top three percent of my school, and from my view, it looks like 75% of the students in this school do not car about their grades or activities as much as I do. This difference only came as a hinder with guidance and in my regular classes, not my honors or AP courses. Regarding guidance, the department spends more time focusing on the "bad" kids than the "good" kids. I felt like my guidance counselor never had time for me. In my regular English class I had a teacher who clearly did not want to be there everyday, a teacher who was walk all over by immature students, a teacher who was ignorant, and a teacher played more movies of res than taught.There is ABSOLUTELY no school spirt what so ever and 90% of students are embarrassed to say they go to PV.', "I love my high school, but this only applies to the classes I take (which are primarily honors and advanced placement). I've taken a few normal classes and either succeeded with no challenge whatsoever or dropped it to level up to AP. The honors program is rigorous and rewarding, but the normal classes aren't. There needs to be more of a balance, which is why I rate my school 3/5.", 'Passaic Valley High School is generally a good school filled with a lot of different people. I love the diversity in this school, with not only students, but teachers and other staff members as well. Most teachers are very helpful and caring towards their students. I wish to see the school spirit get better in the next couple years in this high school. It has a lot of potential, it just needs the students to want it.', "Passaic Valley High School brings three small towns together and provides us all one big home that we're proud to be apart of. The teachers really made the 4 years of high school bearable. I'm glad I got the chance to be involved and take advantage of the opportunities this school gave me. Something I would like to see change in the future is the bathrooms being renovated."]

column2: ['Absolute worst school. Teachers play favorites, kids get bullied and nothing is done. I would stay far away from the school', "I really do love this school, but it really is difficult. Stay professional! You get what you put into it. Every school has a teacher you cannot stand or a teacher you will love and adore. I love all of my teachers dearly, and they have been the reason I strive for my goals and why I set the. If it wasn't for this school, I do not know where I would be or what I would go to college for.", "Attending the OCVTS Performing Arts Academy was honestly the best decision I have ever made. My four years of high school at this school molded me into the dedicated student I am today. Without the Performing Arts Academy, I would not be the writer I am. Prior to college, I believed my writing was okay because I simply did not enjoy writing. But, after receiving multiple A's on my papers during my first semester of college, I looked back at my high school years and thought of all the writing assignments I had to complete because of my diligent teachers. I have never been surrounded by so many teachers who truly loved their jobs and expressed it every day. If I didn't have the enthusiastic and passionate teachers I had at the Performing Arts Academy, I wouldn't have been inspired to choose Education as my major in college. To conclude, the OCVTS Performing Arts Academy helped me grow as a person and as a student.", 'I loved the teachers there. Particularly Rolston, Quidt and Ciccotelli! Going to PAA really set me up for getting good grades in college and understand the fundamentals of being a hard working adult.', 'I have met some amazing people at this school. This experience has been one I will never forget. I would not change anything about this experience', 'Having the opportunity to attend the OCVTS Performing Arts Academy has prepared me in ways I never thought it would. When I first applied to PAA, I was excited to have the chance to sing for a class period everyday, but I had no idea that I would become so prepared for my future career beyond high school. Attending PAA has been a dream and a half. I have been given the opportunity to not only pursue a passion of singing everyday, but also prepare myself for a future outside of the Performing Arts field. Attending an OCVTS school was one of the best decisions of my life, and I believe that it has bettered me and prepared my fully for my transition into college and into the adult world. Thank you, OCVTS.', 'One of the best things about going to the Performing Arts Academy (PAA) is knowing that you are reacy for college. The teachers do an incredible job at teaching and making sure students are ready. One thing I would like to see change is the amount of educational opportunities at PAA. Entering the school, I realized that PAa had some excellent programs, but there were not as many as I had hoped. Other than this issue, PAA gives endless opportunities to it;s students and ensures that they are ready for college once they leave.', 'I loved how wonderful the programs were for each major. The school is so diverse yet small and tight knit and everyone is so accepting and nice. The academics are exceptional. Although i do wish the school offered more AP level courses rather than just a few depending on what grade level you are in.', 'As an alumni of PAA, I would not give up my four years  for ANYTHING. I went there as a shy little kid and came out knowing more about leadership than I ever thought I would. Although I am not going into performing, the performance techniques you learn at this school put you higher than most people. Also, while scores may be low for things like athletics, we are a performing arts school, honestly what do you expect. We also work similar to a vo-tech so all of your athletics can be done at your towns high school. Aside from that, the teachers here really care about your well being and getting you prepared for college but also becoming a friend to you. The people you meet here are extremely nice and not afraid to be themselves and there are things at this school that you could never find or experience at any other school. Best four years of my life.', 'It overall was an okay experience.  The expectation going in was somewhat different than what I experienced.   I think there needs to be stricter guidelines for both teachers and students.  Because this is a somewhat relaxed atmosphere a lot slips through the cracks for both new incoming students and tenured students.   The dance program is good and opportunities present itself that you would not normally find at a public school.', 'OCVTS PAA is a nurturing environment unlike any other high school. My experience here has been great, but of course, there are definitely areas in which the school can improve.', 'Over all very satisfied with PAA. I like that the teachers are available for extra help everyday. Would like to see a few more opportunities associated with the arts.', 'I graduated in 2015, and I wish I could go back. My entire experience was amazing. The work was stressful at times however it definitely prepared me for college', 'PAA was the best yet the worst 4 years of my life. Even though it gave me many opportunities, and opened many doors as a performer, by the time I was a junior at PAA I was bored with my major and wanted to begin a new career search.', 'Good experience alternate high school, campus was on a military base so after school activities limited but allowed to participate in home school so good overall good high school experience', 'I enjoyed the experiences I had with my fellow students. The school also sent us on a good amount of trips to see many productions including broadway.', 'I flourished here and learned a lot more about the craft of singing. I just wish that the teachers and administration would allow the students to voice their concerns more instead of cutting them down.', 'PAA is a smaller school with fewer people. Everyone knows everybody. You never see an unfamiliar face. And my time at PAA has grown my love of dance as a dance major and has me set to take off to whatever college journey is ahead.', 'I liked the small knit community of the school. The teachers are incredible, along with the student body and offer amazing performance opportunities.', "As a current PAA student, I can say my experience has been excellent! My school is open minded, welcoming and supportive. As a small school, you get to know everyone in your class and become close with them. I've found so many friends through PAA and a huge support system. The teachers always encourage creativity and I have been given so many opportunities as a performer that I wouldn't get at a normal high school."]

The teachers always encourage creativity and I have been given so many opportunities as a performer that I wouldn't get at a normal high school."]
column6: ["Overall it was a good experience like any highschool it has it's ups and downs, but it's better then most public schools.", 'As a current senior acting major at PAA, I can say with honesty that the past four years have been filled with everlasting friendships, inspiration, passion, and a stellar arts education. Through my four years here, not only have I learned aspects of my major such as acting for theatre, film, directing, playwriting and improvisation, I have also been able to take classes in vocal, dance and audio technology, something that not every high school offers to students and am so grateful for experiencing. I feel completely comfortable walking down the hallways of PAA because the school is so diverse, creative, and free of judgement Being that PAA is a small school, I have grown close with everyone in my class We have frequent events that I love participating in such as the fall drama, spring musical, International Thespian Society, One Act Festival, Techfest, black box players shows, and my favorite, open mic lunch cafes.', 'After spending my whole time in high school here I cannot imagine going anywhere else.  All of the teacher and students are so supportive and have your back.', 'This school gave me a lot of opportunities for college because I am going into musical theatre for college, but it’s very cliquey and the teachers and directors 100% play favorites and it gets pretty irritating. It could be a great school, it just needs some serious changes.', "PAA is a crazy school with so many fun things to participate in. One of my favorite experiences was out Winter and Spring showcases. They not only enhanced our performing abilities, it was also a time to bond with our classmates and cast-mates. Even if you don't want to pursue music or theater once you graduate, these shows are a fun experience of something you may never get to do again.", 'The performing arts academy had many flaws. The teaching staff, excluding the few who I enjoyed, were unhelpful, childish, and immature. I enjoyed the dance class but was often put down during it. The school judged me on things they assumed and that were not true. I was often blamed and in trouble for things I did not do. This school was unfair and showed favoritism to many students.', 'I enjoy the mix of students, kids from many different towns, it allows us to branch out and make new friends, try new things and grow.', "The Performing Arts Academy is a unique school for anyone dedicated to the performing arts. Students have the ability to dance, act, sing and learn audio recording skills to strengthen their performance qualities. Although they don't offer many AP classes, have limited electives and no sports, the staff all have an appreciation and dedication to the arts, which is not always found at other schools. They also prepare their students for college, as the classes are extremely challenging and the teachers expect a lot from the students.", 'My daughter received a thorough overall arts education from this high school. She was given every opportunity to excel as an overall student and leader.', 'I loved my experience at the Performing Arts Academy. I loved everything about it but the actual school building. It was falling apart and not the most clean place. It is not an ideal structure to have a school in. But the amount of connections I made, the opportunities I was given, were astounding. I learned so much and was encouraged by such wonderful teachers.', "This school is absolutely fantastic. The faculty and staff are all so understanding and everybody there is so helpful. I don't think I'd be the person I am today without the help of my teachers and peers. The environment is so welcoming and all of the people there are great. PAA is such an amazing place and I'm actually really sad to leave it.", 'For what it offered, the Performing Arts Academy was a fine school. I was always provided with the best information, resources, and tools in my major class. The teachers at the OCVTS Performing Arts Academy truly cared about the students and their academic success. I never felt like my education was at the expense of poor teaching. One of my biggest complaints is that Technical Theatre is not a major offered at PAA. It is a very important part of the industry; without the people running the show, there would not be show at all. Granted, we were required to take a Technical Theatre class, but I felt like it barely scratched the surface of what it truly has to offer.', "Everything is done by popular sovereignty. If you're well liked in the school, you're able to avoid certain rules and get away with things, if you're unpopular, you are not able to get away with the same thing. The rules in general in the school are absolutely ridiculous and there should be a set system that applies to every student. The academics are extremely rigorous and help in the long run, but the support system is in this school is awful and demoralizing.", "The Performing Arts Academy is a wonderful school that provides real world experience through guest speakers and internships. The teachers are engaging and motivational. I've never loved school more.", 'As a senior at the Performing Arts Academy, I can truthfully say that I am extremely ready for college. Throughout my four years of high school, I have had the greatest teachers who really do love their job. They make me excited to learn every day.', 'The nurse is amazing, but more can be done to those who have bullied. One time a boy threw a punch and broke OCC property, but he remained in school with little repercussions. If that happened at a regular high school he would have been suspended.', 'There are a lot of after school activities to choose from. Whether it be yearbook or the musicals or tech club. There is always a club to join and get involved in.', 'I have been given an opportunity to truly find myself and become an amazing performer and student. The school is constantly challenging me to go above and beyond and it has effected me for the better. There are a few students and staff who ruin the atmosphere but the friends I have made cancel out their negative energy.', 'The teachers are very excited too come to work. They feel like friends and are able to motivate the students beyond what the students feel they could do. They are constantly challenging us with new ideas as well as adapting to a new technologically advanced lessons. The teachers are great, but some of them are not which is why they will not be receiving an "its the best" mark.', 'There are some people here who are horrible, but there are far more people who want to be your friend and will help you through tough parts that those mean people are irrelevant.']
column8: ["Overall it was a good experience like any highschool it has it's ups and downs, but it's better then most public schools.", 'As a current senior acting major at PAA, I can say with honesty that the past four years have been filled with everlasting friendships, inspiration, passion, and a stellar arts education.
