It could be a great school, it just needs some serious changes.', "PAA is a crazy school with so many fun things to participate in. One of my favorite experiences was out Winter and Spring showcases. They not only enhanced our performing abilities, it was also a time to bond with our classmates and cast-mates. Even if you don't want to pursue music or theater once you graduate, these shows are a fun experience of something you may never get to do again.", 'The performing arts academy had many flaws. The teaching staff, excluding the few who I enjoyed, were unhelpful, childish, and immature. I enjoyed the dance class but was often put down during it. The school judged me on things they assumed and that were not true. I was often blamed and in trouble for things I did not do. This school was unfair and showed favoritism to many students.', 'I enjoy the mix of students, kids from many different towns, it allows us to branch out and make new friends, try new things and grow.', "The Performing Arts Academy is a unique school for anyone dedicated to the performing arts. Students have the ability to dance, act, sing and learn audio recording skills to strengthen their performance qualities. Although they don't offer many AP classes, have limited electives and no sports, the staff all have an appreciation and dedication to the arts, which is not always found at other schools. They also prepare their students for college, as the classes are extremely challenging and the teachers expect a lot from the students.", 'My daughter received a thorough overall arts education from this high school. She was given every opportunity to excel as an overall student and leader.', 'I loved my experience at the Performing Arts Academy. I loved everything about it but the actual school building. It was falling apart and not the most clean place. It is not an ideal structure to have a school in. But the amount of connections I made, the opportunities I was given, were astounding. I learned so much and was encouraged by such wonderful teachers.', "This school is absolutely fantastic. The faculty and staff are all so understanding and everybody there is so helpful. I don't think I'd be the person I am today without the help of my teachers and peers. The environment is so welcoming and all of the people there are great. PAA is such an amazing place and I'm actually really sad to leave it.", 'For what it offered, the Performing Arts Academy was a fine school. I was always provided with the best information, resources, and tools in my major class. The teachers at the OCVTS Performing Arts Academy truly cared about the students and their academic success. I never felt like my education was at the expense of poor teaching. One of my biggest complaints is that Technical Theatre is not a major offered at PAA. It is a very important part of the industry; without the people running the show, there would not be show at all. Granted, we were required to take a Technical Theatre class, but I felt like it barely scratched the surface of what it truly has to offer.', "Everything is done by popular sovereignty. If you're well liked in the school, you're able to avoid certain rules and get away with things, if you're unpopular, you are not able to get away with the same thing. The rules in general in the school are absolutely ridiculous and there should be a set system that applies to every student. The academics are extremely rigorous and help in the long run, but the support system is in this school is awful and demoralizing.", "The Performing Arts Academy is a wonderful school that provides real world experience through guest speakers and internships. The teachers are engaging and motivational. I've never loved school more.", 'As a senior at the Performing Arts Academy, I can truthfully say that I am extremely ready for college. Throughout my four years of high school, I have had the greatest teachers who really do love their job. They make me excited to learn every day.', 'The nurse is amazing, but more can be done to those who have bullied. One time a boy threw a punch and broke OCC property, but he remained in school with little repercussions. If that happened at a regular high school he would have been suspended.', 'There are a lot of after school activities to choose from. Whether it be yearbook or the musicals or tech club. There is always a club to join and get involved in.', 'I have been given an opportunity to truly find myself and become an amazing performer and student. The school is constantly challenging me to go above and beyond and it has effected me for the better. There are a few students and staff who ruin the atmosphere but the friends I have made cancel out their negative energy.', 'The teachers are very excited too come to work. They feel like friends and are able to motivate the students beyond what the students feel they could do. They are constantly challenging us with new ideas as well as adapting to a new technologically advanced lessons. The teachers are great, but some of them are not which is why they will not be receiving an "its the best" mark.', 'There are some people here who are horrible, but there are far more people who want to be your friend and will help you through tough parts that those mean people are irrelevant.']

column1: Dr. Richard Izquierdo Health & Science Charter School
column2: ['I believe that this school is a fantastic school, the teachers and staff members drive students to be successful and to take more value in what they may pursuit in the future.', 'Being in this school since 6th grade has not only gave me connects in becoming an EMT but has exposed me in a career field that I\'ve always dreamed of that my father told me its not a secured career which is being an actress. This school has given me the chance to do a musical show called "Guys and Dolls" which I was General Cartwright. Being apart of a show like this has not only delighted my heart but gave me experience in acting.', 'When I first came to the US, I did not know English and this school has helped to learn the language. It has encouraged many kids to learn and have confidence with the language. This school has great teachers who show support everyday, and give great lessons. The school has also helped me to learn and achieve great things.', "Dr. Richard Izquierdo Health and Science Charter School is a marvelous school. It's a school that allows you to challenge yourself, in any way possible. The school provides various resources like college trips, internships, jobs, etc. The school grants AP classes to students, in which students can benefit. The teachers in the school are devoted to the students. They make sure you are in the right mindset; you are not behind in class; putting the student's limits to the test. Honestly, speaking, I wouldn't change anything. Students complain of the challenges classes present, but at the end of the year, they know it was for their own benefit.", 'My daughter goes to this school and its a very good school the pros are that this school focuses alot on there attendence i Like  the fact that if they are late in the week they get detention becuase it teaches the students to make it on time to help them prepare for a job or interview and to be on time i also like that the teachers point out what the kids need help with and offer them more after school attention on certain days and give them an opportunity to do activties on certain days i feel like its better if they do math 3 times a week and then an activity 2 times a week and sometimes on the weekends they have practice and games the only cons i have is i feel lile the school does not get soo much intouch with the parents as needed when it comes to if they are failing or going to the next grade i did not get any call that my daughter was passing grade i had to ask my self other then that if theres an incident they contact the parents right away', 'My favorite part about my school is the diversity. You see many students from different backgrounds. And we will still come together as a family and enjoy each other presence.', 'It was an average experience. A regular school. Nothing special would not recommend. Its good for the bronx.', 'Been a student there for 7 years and I feel like it improved for the better over the years and will continue to. The staff is real nice and build relationships with the students.', 'What I like about Dr. Richard Izquierdo Health & Science Charter School is that all teachers and staff are always there to assist you. Also I like how there´s many clubs to join in to get your college credits.', 'school has teachers that prepare high school students to start thinking about what kind of career they want to have and what university they want to attend.However,the school should have more space for more activities that students are interested.On the other hand,I’m glad that I have the advantage of able to have the education although there are other kids around the world who want to have education but there is a barrier that prevents them from able to have that education.', 'This school was amazing. I attended from the 6th grade and graduated 12th grade in June 2018. I left with the greatest experience. The staff is great and everyone will know your name, you will not be a ghost there.', 'I like how they focus on the students and their education. When students enter high school, the teachers and counselors inform the students on everything they should know about the application process, requirements, and college life. When I entered my freshmen year, every Wednesday we had College Wednesday where they give us new information on the application process, information on several colleges, and how we should be preparing throughout the rest of our high school career. We continue to have College Wednesday even now entering my senior year.', 'I like the many opportunities that this school offers.When I transferred to this school, I saw a huge change in myself and I was more involved into my education.This school also makes sure that they can assist you the best way possible to make sure that you are successful in school and out.', 'A great school with a wide variety of activities and many opportunities of college readiness. A good high school for doctors and nurses', "I'm a graduate and it's horrible.They care more about  discipline then your education.You get in trouble for having a empty Pepsi bottle in your hand.Hated my high school experience.", 'This school has left me with many great experiences. I had the opportunity to start Dr. Richard Izquierdo Health and Science Charter School when it first opened. I feel as that the other students and I were not as prepared as we should be. But over the years, the school grew and developed and became what it is today with its first graduating class being accepted to all of their schools/universities.', 'Overall I like the school due to the diversity we have and how we all get along with the teachers and the deans although I am shy I do fit in.  But one thing I would love it to change is us getting our own building, and I do think many others also wishes the same thing.( Since we have to share with two other schools).', 'My experience in this school has been excellent. I do not want tat they change anything about our learning program.', "Dr. Richard Izquierdo Health and Science Charter School is still a new school. It just recently had its first batch of graduates! As a new school, it has reached great heights. The community in this school is very united, a student can get help at any point if they just ask! It's small so everyone knows each other,  and it is pretty hard to feel socially out-casted. Within recent years, there has been a plethora of new classes added to the school, such as APs and Honors. Every class has 2 teachers, to be able to pay the students more attention. This school has even been called one of the best Charter schools in the Bronx, and in some cases, New York! On downfall of this school is the crowdedness. As the school grows, it gets more and more crowded in the halls. Another is the lack of AP classes, but this is steadily increasing!", 'Dr Richard Izquierdo Health & Science charter school is the best school i have ever been to they take good care of there kid and make sure that everyone is save.']

column1: Expeditionary Learning School for Community Leaders
column2: ['The teachers at this school are amazing and have gone to ivy league colleges but they do not follow a standardized system making the classes very slow. Many of the math and science skip many core ideas causing many of the students to fall behind in college. The students are not pushed in this school so they do not put any effort into their work causing their overall academics so fall behind. The college advisors and many of the faculty push their students to do many extracurriculars and help them with college outside of school.', 'Leaders High School is a very small, but diverse community. There are 200+ students being educated in one floor. The lessons are not very challenging and if the student wants to be an A+ student, he/she can freely do so. The school has deadlines for the work and projects, however, all of them can (most likely will) extend it if needed.', 'It’s good that you don’t have to take any regents in this school besides the English regents your junior year. The way you pass a certain class is based on the academic work you do over the course and your leadership grade that’s 30% of your grade. You also have to do a PBAT for every class that you have as well.', 'I like that leaders has a good program for kids to focus on there work. I would like to see change in the technology.', 'The learning environment is great- teachers are supportive and students respect each other- but the pace is beyond slow and not challenging at all.', 'It’s my senior year in Leaders High School. When I entered this school I was an immigrant and I knew a little English. Teachers inspired me to learn the language amd their support system was great. Also different sports teams such as volleyball and cheerleading helped as well. Some changes I would like to see in my school would be to open more clubs about adult life. Seniors who are graduating are learning a lot in school but we are not really prepared for real life experience, so it would be nice if we had a club like that.', 'This school provided me with a lot of support and warm-hearted community, that welcome everyone to its community.', "I had a wonderful experience at Leaders High School. All throughout the four years of high school, I had the opportunity to call my school and friends, my home and family instead. One of the many features of this school was Crew. Crew is similar to what school would like to say homeroom but, it takes the next step further. Crew is a bunch of students and one Crew teacher that stays together for the four years of school. We bond with each other, learn about college together, have potluck and act as a family. This is also all possible because of the teachers. These teachers show that they care for us and always pushes us to do the extra mile. They want us to do good and most of all, they support us. The teachers helped my friends and I to create the Anime/Comic Book club, helped find internships based on the career I want(film), stayed back after school to help me with work I didn't understand and my peers and friends were right there, by my side, to keep moving forward.", 'I like this school because I learned a lot of new things in this school.Teacher as well as the students are supportive and helpful to each other.', 'The academics are ok but could be better. I like that students only have to take the english regents. The PBAT system is better in my opinion than regents but still needs to be improved.', 'This school cares a lot for their students, and the staff tries really hard so they can see everyone succeed at life. Even after graduation they will still help and care for you. Going to this school gave me a second family that I can live with for the rest of my life, and I am attending a very good college because of Leaders. I will forever be grateful.', 'This schools way of learning is unique because it is an outward bound school which allows me and other schools to learn in a new and unique way.', "Leaders High school is a below average school with poor academic focus and lack of academic opportunities.  Students are not pushed to pursue more in terms of reaching their full potential. However, with that being said the teachers are friendly and does put focus on students' personal life with all intention of helping them.", 'My school is very different from all the rests. Instead of taking tests we learn by doing hands-on projects and all of the writing papers similar to what would be expected of me to do in college in order to pass. The teachers are closed with their students and the students trust the teachers enough to tell them about their personal lives/struggles. The teachers are always willing to help you out with anything. Every year we have our own day to celebrate LGBTQ pride at my school. And for freshman orientation, we go on a camping trip with all the freshmen.  "we are crew, not passengers" this means that we should always have each other\'s backs and help each other out when needed.', 'Teachers dont have much control over the students.However, teachers are extremely supportive through your years.The school is extremely small, but there are many after school programs available.', 'I am a senior student and I am here since freshman year. I changed several school but when I came to leaders high school in my opinion this is the best school in the world. The reason behind this is that all the teachers have very unique way of teaching. The lectures are never boring. We learn by getting entertain in this school for example the activities teachers provide, the field trips, Socratic seminars, games, jeopardy, and round tables. I always recommend this school to my neighbors who are in 8th grade and are looking for a best high school. This school is best for finding a good college. This is a small school with lots of opportunities and have taught me of how to get out of my comfort zone. The thing I would want to change is to have our own building instead of sharing with other school but I want the same amount of students and same type of education standards.', 'I really like this school because everyone are friendly and are like a family. Everybody helps each other out when they needed. We have a class called crew which we works as a crew. We support each other when we needed. The teachers and adults are nice and they helps us in a lots of ways. The things that I would like to change is uniform and they are doing it arleady.', 'My school is a College driven school where after our first year of high school we start focusing more and more on colleges by visiting colleges sophomore year and starting our CUNY and SUNY list our junior year along with internships and taking the SAT our junior  and senior year. We are a one floor school and there are about 22-25 students in each class but there is usually two teachers in each class so that all student can ask fro help. All students are assigned to a crew which is an advisory group that helps us academically through our 4 years', 'they think they over run everyone else\r they overuse theirpower', 'every school wide activity always has students excited']

column2: ['I graduated in 2008 and it was a pretty ok school. It had some really great teachers when I went there. The school had a pretty small population when I went there but it was definitely to the students benefit. The smaller class sizes gave teachers more time with each individual student. Hamilton as had a lot of great after school clubs and activities which were fantastic. The only area where the school needed a lot of improvement was in sports. I had played basketball up until I went to this high school simply because there was no team or coach for girls basketball. Others had the same issue with girls soccer. The few spots this school had were track, boys basketball, and swimming and not much else.', 'I am an alumni and the small population and diversity of students at this school provided me the best middle school and high school experience and education I could have received. The teachers go the extra mile to not only make sure the students succeed in school, but even after once they graduate with connections they have among their own friends. Never have I heard other students in college talk about their relationships with their high school, versus Hamilton makes sure even after once you graduate they are still an ally for you to rely on .', "The teachers and staff are very supportive of all the students' endeavors and help push them to their maximum learning capacity. There are many extracurriculars and sports available to partake in Hamilton, and the art programs are thriving.", 'I couldn’t recommend Hamilton more. All of the teachers are cooperative and understanding, and are more concerned about the process of learning more than a simple grade. It’s a small community, so everyone knows everyone, and everyone is super friendly. I’ve never had a trike bad experience, and I’ve been in the school since 7th grade. When I talk to my friends who go to larger schools in the area, they’re all extremely jealous of how lucky I got with Hamilton. Yes, the school may not have the best reviews, but as someone who wasn’t even supposed to go to the school because of those reviews, I couldn’t speak more highly of it.', 'Alexander Hamilton is a very good school to go to. The school is very diverse and is full of teachers willing to help you be a better student. Sports are plenty in the school and there are also a great coaching staff. There is also plenty of clubs and activities to do after school.', 'Athletics wise I would like to see the school have its own football team instead of having to merge with briarcliff.', "Overall a very nice high school/middle school. It's small so you develop close relationships with teachers who are always very involved and the community, in general, is very tight-knit.", 'One of the things I liked most about my school is how small it is: you get to see the same people every day and not have to worry about seeing a new face, unless there is a new student of course. We may not be the biggest school, but I feel like we are the most united as we all try to make the community a better place through volunteering especially. I think we need to work on improving our  food for lunch and adding more clubs and sports for people to participate in.', "Going on 6 weeks since we enrolled our child in AHHS, maybe it was our expectations since it is such a small school but they (the teachers ) lack at their jobs. Poor response to emails if none at all, uploading of grades barely, random changing of dates for exams & hw, my child is still awaiting after over a week to find out his test results. Double period in library where they get to surf risky content online with no problems nor teacher caring as to what they do, read, or watch online. This is where our tax dollars go ...We don't exactly feel the core classes are building enough stability needed to conquer the regents exams ..When compared to what others are learning in other schools it seems AHHS is just giving easy work/ bare minimum instead of helping kids be prepared for the regents. We are trying to keep an open mind as it's still early in the school year but so far very disappointed..", 'The school is small enough that all faces are familiar. What like about this schools is that its small that every teacher knows everyone and are able to help each student individuality according to their needs. Overall, this high school has the right environment for learning in which our graduation percent is high. The activities offered in this school are helpful for the students to achieve the seven highly effective habits: Sharpen the saw , begin with the end in mind,  be proactive, put first things first, think win-win, seek first to understand, then to be understood, and synergize. What I do not like about this school is that they do not give out opportunities for outside activities as other schools may offer. Any student attending this school goes out and finds their own opportunities. In a way, it shows students responsibility but going out to find opportunities for most students is difficult. Lastly, Alexander Hamilton has given me a great experience.', 'I enjoyed my time here and from what my younger sister has said, things seem to be even better than when I attended. The food is great! The teachers are spectacular!', 'Alexander Hamilton is a very diverse and academically  acclaimed high school with friendly teachers, great sport programs and awesome after school activities.', "Not a great school, many teachers don't truly care about advancing the students; they simply collect their paycheck. That attitude translates to the students, and in return they don't care about their own future. As a former student  here I can attest that the environment does not help one learn. I would like to see more programs to stimulate the interest of the students, maybe some classes or programs that can better prepare a student for college and the real world. ", "It's a very close knit community: everyone knows everyone.", 'Should have more programs for students to get involved in. Especially academic clubs.', 'Teachers are very kind and willing to go beyond traditional responsibilities.', 'The teachers care deeply about their students.  They inspire them to do their best and often find ways to reach students with all sorts of challenges.  They communicate with parents and students always know where they stand.  Teachers look for unique opportunities to challenge our students and encourage academic growth, from Princeton Model Congress to slam poetry contests, to all sorts of inter-district competitions.', "The school may seem small for others, but I like it. You develop a close bond with teachers as if they are your best friend and aren't a teacher.", 'I really enjoy this school.', 'There are many groups and clubs to join at Hamilton. More than half the school participates in sports/clubs.']
column4: ['I graduated in 2008 and it was a pretty ok school. It had some really great teachers when I went there. The school had a pretty small population when I went there but it was definitely to the students benefit. The smaller class sizes gave teachers more time with each individual student. Hamilton as had a lot of great after school clubs and activities which were fantastic. The only area where the school needed a lot of improvement was in sports. I had played basketball up until I went to this high school simply because there was no team or coach for girls basketball. Others had the same issue with girls soccer. The few spots this school had were track, boys basketball, and swimming and not much else.', 'I am an alumni and the small population and diversity of students at this school provided me the best middle school and high school experience and education I could have received. The teachers go the extra mile to not only make sure the students succeed in school, but even after once they graduate with connections they have among their own friends. Never have I heard other students in college talk about their relationships with their high school, versus Hamilton makes sure even after once you graduate they are still an ally for you to rely on .', "The teachers and staff are very supportive of all the students' endeavors and help push them to their maximum learning capacity. There are many extracurriculars and sports available to partake in Hamilton, and the art programs are thriving.", 'I couldn’t recommend Hamilton more. All of the teachers are cooperative and understanding, and are more concerned about the process of learning more than a simple grade. It’s a small community, so everyone knows everyone, and everyone is super friendly. I’ve never had a trike bad experience, and I’ve been in the school since 7th grade. When I talk to my friends who go to larger schools in the area, they’re all extremely jealous of how lucky I got with Hamilton. Yes, the school may not have the best reviews, but as someone who wasn’t even supposed to go to the school because of those reviews, I couldn’t speak more highly of it.', 'Alexander Hamilton is a very good school to go to. The school is very diverse and is full of teachers willing to help you be a better student. Sports are plenty in the school and there are also a great coaching staff. There is also plenty of clubs and activities to do after school.', 'Athletics wise I would like to see the school have its own football team instead of having to merge with briarcliff.', "Overall a very nice high school/middle school. It's small so you develop close relationships with teachers who are always very involved and the community, in general, is very tight-knit.", 'One of the things I liked most about my school is how small it is: you get to see the same people every day and not have to worry about seeing a new face, unless there is a new student of course. We may not be the biggest school, but I feel like we are the most united as we all try to make the community a better place through volunteering especially. I think we need to work on improving our  food for lunch and adding more clubs and sports for people to participate in.', "Going on 6 weeks since we enrolled our child in AHHS, maybe it was our expectations since it is such a small school but they (the teachers ) lack at their jobs. Poor response to emails if none at all, uploading of grades barely, random changing of dates for exams & hw, my child is still awaiting after over a week to find out his test results. Double period in library where they get to surf risky content online with no problems nor teacher caring as to what they do, read, or watch online. This is where our tax dollars go ...We don't exactly feel the core classes are building enough stability needed to conquer the regents exams ..When compared to what others are learning in other schools it seems AHHS is just giving easy work/ bare minimum instead of helping kids be prepared for the regents. We are trying to keep an open mind as it's still early in the school year but so far very disappointed..", 'The school is small enough that all faces are familiar. What like about this schools is that its small that every teacher knows everyone and are able to help each student individuality according to their needs. Overall, this high school has the right environment for learning in which our graduation percent is high. The activities offered in this school are helpful for the students to achieve the seven highly effective habits: Sharpen the saw , begin with the end in mind,  be proactive, put first things first, think win-win, seek first to understand, then to be understood, and synergize. What I do not like about this school is that they do not give out opportunities for outside activities as other schools may offer. Any student attending this school goes out and finds their own opportunities. In a way, it shows students responsibility but going out to find opportunities for most students is difficult. Lastly, Alexander Hamilton has given me a great experience.', 'I enjoyed my time here and from what my younger sister has said, things seem to be even better than when I attended. The food is great! The teachers are spectacular!', 'Alexander Hamilton is a very diverse and academically  acclaimed high school with friendly teachers, great sport programs and awesome after school activities.', "Not a great school, many teachers don't truly care about advancing the students; they simply collect their paycheck. That attitude translates to the students, and in return they don't care about their own future. As a former student  here I can attest that the environment does not help one learn. I would like to see more programs to stimulate the interest of the students, maybe some classes or programs that can better prepare a student for college and the real world. ", "It's a very close knit community: everyone knows everyone.", 'Should have more programs for students to get involved in. Especially academic clubs.', 'Teachers are very kind and willing to go beyond traditional responsibilities.', 'The teachers care deeply about their students.  They inspire them to do their best and often find ways to reach students with all sorts of challenges.  They communicate with parents and students always know where they stand.  Teachers look for unique opportunities to challenge our students and encourage academic growth, from Princeton Model Congress to slam poetry contests, to all sorts of inter-district competitions.', "The school may seem small for others, but I like it. You develop a close bond with teachers as if they are your best friend and aren't a teacher.", 'I really enjoy this school.', 'There are many groups and clubs to join at Hamilton. More than half the school participates in sports/clubs.']
column6: ['The teachers at Hamilton are so nurturing and care about the students and help each student succeed in life.', 'The school administratives are always so caring and do their best to help students.', 'The students love to play sports. They are always ready for any game and persevere through the game.', 'There are not a variety of courses at this school. The work is not challenging or stimulating. The teachers mostly do the bare minimum and do not go above and beyond for their students.', 'There are not that many athletic facilities at this school, but that is due to its small size. There is not a variety of sports and there is no school spirit. Some teams to really well and others have losing streaks.', 'There have been many new cameras installed in my school. The main doors are now locked and can only be opened by an access card or you have to be buzzed in. Bullying is very prominent in my school, but there is an anti-bullying club.', 'My experience at this school has been okay. It is very small and everyone knows each other, which is what makes it unique. Being that it is so small, the variety of courses, sports, and clubs is limited. Although I often want to go to a bigger school with more opportunities, I cherish the experiences I have had here and the friendships I have made. The teachers are really nice for the most part.', "The food services are okay. They have gotten better over the years, although they have gotten expensive. I don't think there are enough healthy food options besides the salads. They also don't cater that much to students with special dietary needs or preferences.", "At this school, there isn't that much diversity of the students. Due to this factor, if someone of a different background arrives at the school, people are skeptical of them and often not accepting.", 'Eh, there is not much to say, we try.', 'We have the bear minimum. ', 'Recent changes to the school administration has proven beneficial. ', 'Personally I love my school, flaws and all. It is a classic case if what you put in, you get out. You must work hard to see results otherwise, you will fall in to the depths of mediocrity. ', 'some of the teachers have been around for a long time ( some of them used to teach my mother!) others are relatively new. ', 'bullying is not an issue at this school\rwe have security guards and police officers\rthe nurse is ok for band-aids and cramps but anything more and you get sent home ', "what i like most about this school is that it's small ,so everyone has some kind of connection to each other. this is also good for  the teachers less students mean more one on one time if you need the extra help. Surprisingly bullying is not a problem at this school ", 'Track and Basketball are the most important sports in my school. many of the students in school are involved in a sport. the girls varsity basketball has done an amazing job during the season. i just wish we had an actual track to practice on', 'we have the basic classes but students can choose from a variety of electives depending on what interests you. The teachers are very involved with the students. classroom size is average with about 20 students in each class', 'recently the hallways were repainted to our school colors (red,white and black). our auditorium was also redone. we have a new stage! guidance counselors are always available and extremely helpful. Buses are also provided for everyone', "some days the food is good, others it's questionable. However there's always a salad bar."]

column2: ['Throughout my four years at Bayonne High School, I would say I mostly enjoyed myself. The big campus showed me a lot of diversity and abled me to meet many people. Although, the classrooms and materials like lockers etc, need to be upgraded.', 'The entire environment is toxic, staff is not helpful for college, sports are good, no students are told about opportunities for college, no help with SAT prep, guidance counselors are terrible, and students are bullies to others.', 'Bayonne High School can be considered a good school, I like how diverse the school is and how some teachers can be helpful to the students. There are friendly people at school, but there is also very rude people who don’t care about the school. The boys bathroom is the dirtest place to go in the school, because the boys bathroom was not renewed, like the girls was. I would like the safety at my school to change, for students in the future. The food should also change because there is not as much food to pick from, and it’s unfair for people who are vegetarian.', 'Great, bright students yearning for a bright future. Most teachers are fantastic, clearly in love with their job. Others, not so much.', 'Overall Bayonne High School is a good school. Like most schools it needs some improvement. For example, Black History Month for a very diverse school they don’t teach anything on History of African Americans. Yet, they have an African American History class to make up for that.', 'Bayonne High School is an educational institution where the concept of "whatever you put in, you get out" resonates with many. Yes, there are great opportunities to join gangs, take drugs, and get pregnant. However, if you are a studious individual there are many opportunities for you. We have so many great teachers here that genuinely care about their students. Of course there are some bad apples, but most of my teachers were great. If you take advanced courses we get LOTS of homework. There are many opportunities to join certain student organizations ranging from the Female Empowerment Association to Varsity Football. Everyone can find a place for themselves here. However, we do have a prominent "fighting" culture, and our hallways are constantly packed by students, which is an enormous safety hazard. Otherwise, Bayonne High School is a great educational institution.', 'Bayonne High School has amazing faculty and very kind students. The school also has many interesting learning opportunities such as the Biodome, a place where the school houses animals of all sorts. However, the school could be kept in a cleaner condition.', "I like that there is a diverse culture there. Though, I do wish it wasn't so congested. I recently joined Student Council and I am greatly shocked that I got in. The clubs are very unique and enjoyable which is always great.", "It's cool.  The classes are good.  Took a star off because theres always people smoking in the bathrooms.", "I think Bayonne High school was interesting. It wasn't terrible but it wasn't the best but it is what you make it. My only regret in school was never joining a club I was passionate about.", 'Very good school for those looking to take education seriously. The best parts of the school are what you realize it is after you understand that school takes some hard work rather than just hoping for a good grade whilst doing nothing. Many good students graduate from here and do great things while still supporting the school', 'I like the fact that Bayonne High School is such a diverse school. It’s a great way to meet new people and experience new things.', 'teachers are great, food is not too bad, need better security and smaller classrooms so kids can learn more.i think is over populated too many people, teachers need to be more formal with students', "I loved how the teachers dedicated themselves to their students and wanted to see them pass.  I felt like that motivation really helped me succeed as well as I had during my high school career.  Although it was a very big school you'd see the same students around a lot and that also helps people find new friends and keep old ones.", "Bayonne High School was a well rounded school. The teachers care about your academics, very friendly environment for the most part. Of course theres some drama, but it's high school. It would be impossible if any high school didn't have drama", 'I really liked some of the teachers who got me involved in their clubs and activities like Ms. Schaeffer & Mr. Hart.  Ms. Schaeffer was my accounting teacher and introduced me to the world of business and I became Vice president of the Junior Chamber of Commerce Club FBLA. Mr. Hart helped me exhibit my photographs at our local museum and BOTH teachers showed an interest in my success.  I loved the teachers at this school.', 'Bayonne High School is great!!!  I am so proud to say that I attend this institution.. The teachers are great. There are so many diverse students here. the graduating classes are like a college graduating class. I am never worried about my safety.', '2/3rds of their teachers are rude, mean, cruel and nasty to students. The talk down to them, intentionally start a fight and don’t care to be good people overall.', 'I like the wide variety of classes that appeal to almost every potential career choice. I would definitely increase time in between classes and promote better attitudes with the teachers.', 'Bayonne High School has a strong academic program. However, students aren’t as involved with activities and the school spirit. I’d like to see it become a cleaner school with no rats.']

column6: ['Bayonne High school is a great school. They have lots of academic challenges. The course studies are challenging and will prepare any student for college.', 'I liked how the school is organized and I would like to see changes in the construction of the High school.', 'Bayonne High School is a safe environment with amazing teachers. The diversity of the students are great as there are people from various nationalities. I would recommend this school to anybody.', 'What I like about Bayonne high school is its amazing diversity and community that works together and is very united. I would like to see more things improving in the arts department facilities.', 'Bayonne High School is like every High School it delivers your education and basic needs. But the food needs to get better and they have to clean it better. Yes it is an old school but that means it just needs extra care.', 'The teachers at Bayonne High School are wonderful. They genuinely care for the students and help us when we need anything. The VPs are great leaders and do a great job in keeping us all safe.', 'There are a lot of new security measures that are truly extraneous. They will prosecute the good students who abide by the rules but will leave the constant troublemakers because it is too much paperwork.', 'BHS is a wonderful place to study and offers many opportunities. It has many clubs such as OSSA and Science Olympiad which allow members to conduct research projects and win national awards. I have done multiple research projects in the field of microbiology, and have won awards. The laboratory offers microscopes, a variety of animal life, and other scientific tools. These projects have forced me to learn beyond what my curriculum entails.  The curriculum is very challenging and encourages students to understand the material. Although the student population may not be the most friendly, there are plenty of students who would be willing to assist. In my first day attending, I was not able to find the classes on my schedule. Plenty of teachers were present to point me in the right direction. Overall, the atmosphere is generally safe, and allow students to reach out and seek help when needed.', 'I been lucky to have had some really wonderful teachers who really care about their students. This has really made a difference in my high school experience', 'I had a pretty good, not great, experience with Bayonne High School. I feel like the academics of the school improved greatly when the AFA program was added to it and I would love to see it brought back into the school. I think the major issue with this school is funding. We need funding to improve the facilities in our schools, offer better and healthier lunch options to students, and to improve upon the clubs and activities that we do in school.', 'I have been going to BHS for 4 years now and my experience has been overall quite amazing.  I have had (for the most part) great teachers and have made quality friends.  My only critique would be that some teachers have been disappointing specifically in the science department.  The sports teams are also wonderful.', "I like it a lot and everyone is quite nice. I would like to have the arts academy back becuase I came here for that and now it's gone.", 'Overall, Bayonne High School is swarming with diversity in every corner, allowing you to meet tons of different people from all backgrounds. I would love to see the change in engaging students more with each other and having more days full of school spirit.', 'The sports and variety of academic subject are reallly an advatage. I would like it if there was a much nicer and responsible administration on top and the school admiinistration would not judge on the type of academic programs you take.', 'Bayonne High School was good in regards to the Honors education but with commuting between classes within 4 minutes and thousands of people, it was quite difficult especially in the summer time.', "Bayonne has a lot of classes to offer that previous schools I had attended didn't have such as an ice skating class, basketball class, volleyball class,physcology,invogue etc.The teachers are wonderful and know what they're doing unlike others.", 'At Bayonne High School you can try so many new courses.  This school is all about growth and excelling academically. My child is an honors student and doing very well. He has been accepted into NYU, as well as Princeton. We are very happy here.', 'Overall, my experience at Bayonne High School has been a good one. The one problem that I did face in this high school was the fact that I had been a part of the Academy of Fine Arts and Academics, but my senior year this academy no longer existed, and academy students had been merged with the regular high school students.', 'I like Bayonne High School because it’s a place where I feel safe and that most people get along. This school is somewhere I can try new things such a sports or clubs and be an active participant in many things. I would like to change the fact of putting the Academy back into the school for future students due to the fact that I felt it academically helped me grow as a student.', 'I enjoy the amount of AP courses offered, however we have had issues with funding therefore some of our great teachers were lost. I have had to be careful who I surround myself with, as not all high school students are into the greatest things, which is common everywhere. Overall, I have done my best to take good classes and surround myself with good people and have given myself a good experience.']

I have had (for the most part) great teachers and have made quality friends.  My only critique would be that some teachers have been disappointing specifically in the science department.  The sports teams are also wonderful.', "I like it a lot and everyone is quite nice. I would like to have the arts academy back becuase I came here for that and now it's gone.", 'Overall, Bayonne High School is swarming with diversity in every corner, allowing you to meet tons of different people from all backgrounds. I would love to see the change in engaging students more with each other and having more days full of school spirit.', 'The sports and variety of academic subject are reallly an advatage. I would like it if there was a much nicer and responsible administration on top and the school admiinistration would not judge on the type of academic programs you take.', 'Bayonne High School was good in regards to the Honors education but with commuting between classes within 4 minutes and thousands of people, it was quite difficult especially in the summer time.', "Bayonne has a lot of classes to offer that previous schools I had attended didn't have such as an ice skating class, basketball class, volleyball class,physcology,invogue etc.The teachers are wonderful and know what they're doing unlike others.", 'At Bayonne High School you can try so many new courses.  This school is all about growth and excelling academically. My child is an honors student and doing very well. He has been accepted into NYU, as well as Princeton. We are very happy here.', 'Overall, my experience at Bayonne High School has been a good one. The one problem that I did face in this high school was the fact that I had been a part of the Academy of Fine Arts and Academics, but my senior year this academy no longer existed, and academy students had been merged with the regular high school students.', 'I like Bayonne High School because it’s a place where I feel safe and that most people get along. This school is somewhere I can try new things such a sports or clubs and be an active participant in many things. I would like to change the fact of putting the Academy back into the school for future students due to the fact that I felt it academically helped me grow as a student.', 'I enjoy the amount of AP courses offered, however we have had issues with funding therefore some of our great teachers were lost. I have had to be careful who I surround myself with, as not all high school students are into the greatest things, which is common everywhere. Overall, I have done my best to take good classes and surround myself with good people and have given myself a good experience.']

column2: ['I liked the open space and the wide range of subjects offered to us. However I wished that some teachers were more excited to teach and actually taught instead of giving us work to do on our own.', "I am a senior now so I feel I can give an accurate depiction of this school. SWMHS is located in a smallish town, pretty diverse student body. The school has recently installed and required metal detectors upon entrance along with a swipe of your student ID card. While this stirred up trouble with the students, surely it did promote more safety due to the many and recent school shootings through out the country. The teachers are good for the most part, most of them genuinely care for their students. Sports are fun, sometimes the football is good sometimes it isn't really just luck of the draw.. Would this be my first pick for my children to attend? No. Does it beat other schools? Yes. SWHMS is slightly above average.", 'Sayreville HS is a very diverse school with unique individuals. It has its ups and downs like many schools do', "One thing that can be agreed on is the prominent diversity at SWMHS and countless extracurriculars that are open to students to encourage school involvement.  The environment is pretty comfortable; almost everyone is very accepting and open, so it's fairly easy to make friends. There are some issues with staffing and money distribution though, so I think that the school should prioritize making students' learning as efficient as possible, given that it's a bit understaffed, and a bit too much money goes to the football team.  Otherwise, it's a decent school to go to, though for people moving to the area, there are definitely much better high schools around here.", 'Sayreville War Memorial has a lot to offer for kids looking to try new things. There is something for everyone there and it is a welcoming environment.', 'sayreville, i wouldnt say its a fun school, there are no fun events such as pink outs,  etc. I would say what would make our school a better school would be things such as senior parking spaces (painting) and more fun school events such as pink outs, etc, so everyone can be involved. A better school spirit week would be nice. our education isnt bad.', 'As a parent I would like to see that the kids are preparing the students for college. There are a few staff that do not teach well.  Administration and staff should be more involved with their students.', 'I liked that Sayreville War Memorial offers a lot of clubs and interests for students. They also offer many scholar opportunities and guidance for their students. Student safety is their top priority. The teachers are very helpful and want to see their students succeed.', 'I would say my high school experience is average. There’s nothing that stood out except for Friday night lights on the football field.', 'The school had many rigorous classes and various different clubs to participate in. I enjoyed all of the amenities offered and loved its advanced way of teaching.', 'Prioritizes sports over academics. Can afford to spend thousands for the football team but cannot even afford AC.', 'My experience attending my high school was a relatively good experience due to my broad groups of friends and my teacher that made my courses interesting with their many assignments and fun teaching styles. I joined choir and theatre productions all throughout high school. I made and maintained friendships with people that share similar interests to me. I even built positive relationships with my teachers over the years. The staff was always very helpful during stressful periods and never ignored any problems that may have circulated the school. While being educated, I began to look at a career in education as an option. I will always look back, fondly, on my time Sayreville War Memorial High School because it shaped me into the intelligent and open-minded person that I am today.', 'I enjoyed being able to see everyone who I grew up with graduate with me. We all progressed from Elementary school to high school in a succinct manner. As well, Sayreville War Memorial did its best to give its students a well-rounded experience within high school, with the various sports teams, after-school activities, and community builders to engage with the people of the town.', 'It is a great school. More than 85% of the student body are active in aports and/or clubs. Kids are respectful and polite!', 'I would like for the school to offer additional languages other than Spanish and French.  My parents family is from Italy and it would have been nice to learn Italian as my foreign language.  When we talk about Diversity, we should be able to not just learn about other cultures, but be able to learn the languages of these cultures as well.  I do hope that Rowan University offers Italian, but if not, I would love to sample other languages.  In my field of study, Paleontology, I will need to speak and read other languages, so i feel that if it had started in High School, I would have had a better advantage.', 'Although this school has drugs, this was my first time coming to public school, this school is a good school. It barely has any bullying, but there are physical fights. The people in this school are really nice. No one judges you for what you wear. I came from a privet Islamic school and i wear long stuff and no one makes fun of me like other schools would do. the principal is so nice and he is trying to stop the drugs in this school.', "This school needs a lot of improvement. When it comes to events or anything academics, this school can be extremely  unorganized. Some of the teachers take forever to put grades but most of them are efficient The lockers, bathrooms, and gym locker rooms are outdated. You are required to pay class due which add to $50 for all 4 years. Besides the negative, There are some good things. The guidance office is very helpful when come to college and personal issues, The food they serve at lunch is pretty decent and we do offer many clubs. The rules here are not really that strict but if they are broken over and over again will have some serious consequences.  In a whole i do wish i attended a better school but it wasn't the worst school experience I've ever had. There are some really great teachers in this school that will help in every step of the way Academically and personally.", 'Would like lunch food to be better & better rules. I like how some teachers actually care about making you succeed. Just wish senior could go out for lunch. etc.', 'When I entered the high school I wasn’t in the dark because the freshman class was given an orientation. It was easy to become involved in clubs/sports and the team I participated on has won counties multiple times. However, I do wish that scheduling was explained better along with having a safer atmosphere. It is too easy to get accesss to the doors and let people in.', "Sayreville high-school is known for it's share of scandals, including the politically motivated 'walk-out' scandal and the football scandal (both easily Googlable). There have been multiple cases of inappropriate teacher behavior with students over the past 4 years of my high-school career, including a current scandal involving our woodshop teacher. Everyone knows everyone, and teens use drugs and partying as a way to cope with boredom and the fear of never leaving the down, as most of our parents haven't. Nevertheless, most of us will stay here because that's all Sayreville War Memorial has prepared us for."]

column6: ["My experience at Sayreville War Memorial High School was average, in my opinion. The faculty are dedicated to the students, and want all enrolled there to succeed. If you don't plan on getting any further education, the only electives offered that give real world experience for any jobs are auto and woodshop. If you do plan to go to college for a specific degree, there are other electives such as Street law, Computer Science, Physics, and Music Tech.", 'i love all the activites and club available and as an active person in the school i enjoy being with people and i especially love the teachers. a majority are very friendly and nice.', "I liked the variety of clubs and sports. The students are welcoming and there's a lot of fun activities.", 'the school works hard to keep everyone involved and proud to be a bomber. the academics are not as challenging as other schools and i feel unprepared to continue after high school but all of the staff is welcoming and very helpful. sports are a big part of the school and personally, as an athlete, i’m proud to play for sayreville. I play soccer and we were able to win our division last season. Everyone is also very proud of our football program and baseball is good too.', 'The resources and facilities are limited and not available to most students. The teachers are somewhat biased and give extra credit based on noneducational topics such as cartoon character names.', 'I like that this school has a lot of diversity, but it lacks in a lot of other aspects. We are severely underfunded, and have to use old textbooks and our facilities are in poor shape. Most of the attention and bias is towards athletes, and academics tends to come second. But for the limited resources we have, this school definitely prepares you for the future, no matter where you wish to attend: 4 year college, trade school, county college, etc.', 'Sayreville War Memorial High School is a good school that prepares  students for college and beyond.', "Sayreville high school is a great place.From the numourous variety of classes to the diverse extracurricular activities,Sayreville has a place for all students to find a passion within themselves.Sayreville offers ap courses and honors classes to challenge their students.The teachers at the school really care about their student's education and their understanding of certain school topics.My favorite thing about high school at Sayreville, is being apart of the performing arts program.The band,theater,choir,and etc.,are every welcoming and fun for students especially freshman.The friendships made and experiences I had within these activities will last me a lifetime.I also grew fond of the school activities such as pep rally's and football games.Something that I would change at Sayreville is the school lunch,and the difficulty of the physics course.In the end,Sayreville High school is a great school and it is very welcoming to all students returning and new.", 'SWMHS in Sayreville, New Jersey is a populous high school with a diverse set of students and faculties with all kinds of different backgrounds. The administration in the school work very hard to make sure the school is kept safe and that the students feel protected and have 0 tolerance against matters such as bullying. With that being said, the academics in my school is lacking heavily and I feel like people care more about whether or not the football team won a game rather than if a teacher is actually capable of teaching a class. I believe many teachers at the school are too inexperienced and incapable of teaching high school students. All in all, the school is a safe school in a nice area with a diverse population and hard working administrators and vicious sports teams but lacks in academics and capable teachers.', 'Most of the teachers in this school are very chill. Their classes are fun and sometimes they would teach you the life skills that you need outside of their course materials. One thing that I would probably change is to provide better yet healthier food for the students.', 'High school was such a fun and loving experience. Throughout high school I’ve had ups and downs but so has every student. I used to be very insecure because of other students but I realized so much about myself in four years. I knew how much I was worth and did everything I could possibly do. As in different activities, clubs, and sports. As well as doing well in my academic aspect, going for extra help or helping my friends out with help. If I could start high school all over again, I would.', 'I moved to Sayreville, New Jersey from the Philippines in December 2015 which was a struggle for my family and I. I began studying in SWMHS in January 2016 and to say that I was not afraid would be a lie. The only knowledge I have about American high schools came from movies that showcase all sorts of American high school archetypes. As I walked the halls of SWMHS, I saw the incredible diversity in just a single hallway. People of all races of all sorts of backgrounds interact with each other, which made me feel not-so-different. In the eyes of everyone else, I was just "the new kid." I easily made friends as the people there are very welcoming. My teachers made transition from the Philippines to America easy as they gave me everything that I needed to excel. My peers challenge me around them to do my best, creating a healthy and bettering environment. Though the facilities and the resources could be better, the teachers and the students make up for what the school physically lacks.', 'The facilities, teachers, and administration need to be improved. However, I did like the diversity and the friends I made there.', 'A lot of things could be better: the food, the staff; the air conditioning...it could be more welcoming.', 'I love to say that Sayreville War Memorial High School is a great school, but there are some down falls. Sport wise, we are kind of good and competitive. When it comes to academics there are some smart people but there are some people that do not care school. Those people drag the school down. But in general Sayreville War Memorial High School is not a bad school.', 'My four years at Sayreville War Memorial High School was a really good experience for me. At the school I played football and was captain my senior year. I went out to play where I am now which is at Wesley College. Mr. Brown was a great principle he was always fair and I could not name a person who loves Sayreville as much as he did. Mrs. Woolf and Mr. Inverno were 2 teachers I had who I will never forget everything they helped me with. The student body was very active as well. They always came out to support the football team, basketball team baseball team, you name it and the psycho squad was there.', 'Some of the teachers care about their jobs and put genuine effort to teach their students. The rest just give out worksheets and play youtube videos to "teach". There is also a lack of variety in AP courses. Additionally, the schools is packed with students.', 'Mix bag when it comes to t archers but it is not rare to come across someone who believes in you. Many different clubs and sports like badminton club, poetry club, tennis and bowling as official sports. The school has a lot of diversity in race and in pldifferent people. Where I go to college I am missing a variety in thought processes and also in race too. Sometimes resources could REALLY use some more work. Sports is really getting too much money from the district. Overseeing the budget needs help. Safety is good but taken tooo seriously sometimes. Hard for me to feel like I found my place.', 'In my high school I loved the Arts programs included. I took a Music Recording and Entertainment class, Choir, Theatre, Television Production and tons more. I stayed involved with all these classes throughout my college years as well. My TV Production class is why I chose to become a Television Production major at my current college. Sayreville War Memorial High School is very well rounded, diverse and extremely helpful in building your career.', 'Sayreville War Memorial High School created the person I am today. The faculty inspired me to work hard and be myself. I met my amazing best friends in high school that I will never forget. My graduating class matured from the time we entered through up until we throw our caps up goodbye. I would never trade any other school than the high school I attended and will never forget.']

column1: Science, Technology & Research High School at Erasmus
column2: ['As a parent, this school has done wonders for my Child. He has become more involved in his academics. They offer great programs, and I enjoy the fact that they allow students to take college credits. The staff is very welcoming.', "I think what needs to change about this school is the faculty. Once Dr.Miller left our school, the school spirit, and everything else fell with her leaving. The faculty suppresses the student government's ideas, they stress importance of uniform more than the resources we need and many more problems. The greatest thing to come out of this school is the fact that you can take college classes for free.", 'Science, Technology & Research High School (STAR) is an early college school and its main obligation is to get ther students college ready. STAR also has classes that all students can be apart of at Brooklyn College and STEM. STAR is  a school put pushes their students to excel with the rigorous coursework and the school activities that they also provide.', "I'm incredibly glad that I did I stayed at STAR. The teachers support you intellectually and personally with a few exceptions. The technology aspect of the school recently gained more ground. I was apart of a coding team that won an engineering competition this past school year at NYU's Tandon school of engineering. It was a fantastic experience, and our project leader and head of science and tech is an great person with a vested interest in seeing students succeed.As a primarily dual credit school, we take many classes at Brooklyn College. In fact, most seniors are so accelerated that we're only taking classes at the college this fall. The resources are there if you know where to look, so this school has definitely instilled resourcefulness in it's students. All in all, this definitely a school to look into if you're considering STEM for college. There are many, many positives I didn't mention, so either reach out or do more research on your own.Go Dutchmen!", 'The teachers here really care about the students and work hard so their students all understand the material. The guidance counselor was amazing. She tried to make sure the students knew what they were going to do after high school. College credits were a huge plus. We got to take classes at Brooklyn college both with our peers and college students.', 'I appreciate that the school takes you to the next level in terms of education. They really do push academic excellence and prepares us for college all while still finishing high school.', 'Science, Technology & Research High School at Erasmus is an excellent school to attend. I have been attending the school since middle school and I did regents early; so that when I reach to high school, I can earn college credits in ninth grade until I graduate. I am a senior with 30+ college credits and already have my high school credits to graduate. There are many activities such as after school programs and a house system where students compete.', 'This school was much less glamorous than I thought it was going to be, there are little to no clubs or activities outside of sports. There is little involvement between higher up faculty and students to the point where they are alien to each other. Still, the school gives many opportunities to get ahead with different various classes and the early college is stellar.', 'Good do better on bullying prevention. Better help on college application as well as scholarship help. Overall help is there, teachers are excellent.', "its a good school for the most part. when you reach 12th grade most of your classes will be held at Brooklyn College. this has both pros and cons. you don't get to see your friends as much if you are always on a college campus taking different classes. this can make the senior year boring when you don't get to see your friends half of the time. however, the college credits are a big advantage, unlike most schools.", 'STAR is a combined middle and high school that gives students a leg up on college. Junior and seniors take courses for free at Brooklyn College with many earning at least a years worth of college credits before graduation. The school has a pleasant environment, accelerated academics and a program in electrical engineering that all students participate in beginning in 8th grade.', 'Science, Technology and Research Early College High School at Erasmus is phenomenal school with a very rigorous curriculum. Most students finish their high school graduation requirements by the end of their sophomore and junior years in high school.  Afterwards, the students are immersed in the culture of the Brooklyn College.  The invaluable connection of Science, Technology and Research Early College High School at Erasmus With Brooklyn college provides sits students access to the resources of the Brooklyn College and the opportunity to be exposed to college-level classes in a collegiate setting.  Students in their late junior year and senior year are able to take college classes at Brooklyn College and are taught by Brooklyn College professors free of charge.  As a college freshman, I can testify that the experience that I had at Science, Technology and Research Early College High School at Erasmus has made me more prepared for the rigor of college.', 'the school is a great one. especially for students looking to get plenty of high school credits and college credits in high school, through their program with brooklyn college.', 'I love it here at my school. All of the staff are supportive and helpful, along with the teachers. Although, this school is very competitive many students uplift each other when their falling and encourage them. One thing I would change about my school is that it should have more classes based on technology hence the name.', 'Being a early college school and being able to take college classes and get credits is amazing. Everyone knows one another. Teachers always try to reach out to their students if they need help.', 'This is a great school I would tell any parent that is looking for a high school to look into this school.', 'Star Early College @Erasmus is one of the better schools on campus. The have a great staff and heavily enforce academic integrity among their students. This is a school of great opportunity seeing as how you start to acquire college credits come junior year, and it is overall a school that I would recommend to anyone considering a transfer or someone who is entering their first year of high school.', 'Uh, some of the teachers were nice and really involved and dedicated to helping students. The work environment was alright I guess.', 'I liked the teachers. The teachers are down to earth and really want to see you succeed and will help you do it.', 'I liked that there was so much to do there such as clubs and sports. The teachers always look out for the students and want to see them succeed. The only con is that the uniform policy has become unreasonably strict which is causing many upperclassmen to rebel.']
column4: ['As a parent, this school has done wonders for my Child. He has become more involved in his academics. They offer great programs, and I enjoy the fact that they allow students to take college credits. The staff is very welcoming.', "I think what needs to change about this school is the faculty. Once Dr.Miller left our school, the school spirit, and everything else fell with her leaving. The faculty suppresses the student government's ideas, they stress importance of uniform more than the resources we need and many more problems. The greatest thing to come out of this school is the fact that you can take college classes for free.", 'Science, Technology & Research High School (STAR) is an early college school and its main obligation is to get ther students college ready. STAR also has classes that all students can be apart of at Brooklyn College and STEM. STAR is  a school put pushes their students to excel with the rigorous coursework and the school activities that they also provide.', "I'm incredibly glad that I did I stayed at STAR. The teachers support you intellectually and personally with a few exceptions. The technology aspect of the school recently gained more ground. I was apart of a coding team that won an engineering competition this past school year at NYU's Tandon school of engineering. It was a fantastic experience, and our project leader and head of science and tech is an great person with a vested interest in seeing students succeed.As a primarily dual credit school, we take many classes at Brooklyn College. In fact, most seniors are so accelerated that we're only taking classes at the college this fall. The resources are there if you know where to look, so this school has definitely instilled resourcefulness in it's students. All in all, this definitely a school to look into if you're considering STEM for college. There are many, many positives I didn't mention, so either reach out or do more research on your own.Go Dutchmen!", 'The teachers here really care about the students and work hard so their students all understand the material. The guidance counselor was amazing. She tried to make sure the students knew what they were going to do after high school. College credits were a huge plus. We got to take classes at Brooklyn college both with our peers and college students.', 'I appreciate that the school takes you to the next level in terms of education. They really do push academic excellence and prepares us for college all while still finishing high school.', 'Science, Technology & Research High School at Erasmus is an excellent school to attend.
