column6: ["Going to STAR Early College was probably the greatest decision I've made in my life, and my life just started. The class sizes are so small, so you feel like a family. Kids know each other and get to know each other way better than schools with over 1000 kids. The staff is really friendly, but at the same time challenging. The course work is rigorous, but rewarding in the long run. Competition between students is one of the most encouraging things of the school. The stiff competition really pushes every student to do their best. Extra-curricular activities are abundant,  and encouraged by faculty. The greatest experience is the ability to actually go and attend college courses at Brooklyn College as early as 15 years old. This really pushes for college readiness and gives the students a huge advantage. This is an amazing school not only for its educational opportunities , but for it's family-feel.", 'My school begins to prepare us for college in the 9th grade. The teachers actually care about what and how they teach pupils.', "STAR is an early college school. The work can be challenging at times but there is always someone to help lighten the burden. The school has a majority of blacks and West Indies and a few hispanics. Since it is housed on a campus with 4 other schools there is a wide variety of sports to choose from. the teachers are good for the most part at teaching, and preparing the students for tests but the administration is horrible, most of the administration now is fairly new and they have not yet warmed up to STAR but they don't know how to talk to students sometimes and are annoying. Some of the teachers/ administration is overworked whit an overwhelming amount of work that is obvious to the students. Over all the school is a good school that advanced students by giving them the opportunity to experience college life and attain early college credits, but the administration can use some work.", 'I like that it is an early college high school so as students we get to earn up to 2 years of college credit. Also the connections we form with the certain teachers is great.', 'This school is really good but the only aspect where I saw a flaw was the lack of fairness in the way teachers grade their students.', "My experience at Science Technology and Research Early College High School has been satisfactory. At this school, I have been able to experience having college class at Brooklyn College, all while managing my own high school classes. I can say that I have been well prepared for college, although I'm prepared in limited manner. As for the school atmosphere, it has a calm atmosphere at times, but begins to feel tense when exams role around. All in all, I can say that this school as contributed to my growth as a person, as well as a student.", 'What I found most interesting at STAR is the early college readiness. The college classes we take while contributing to our High school transcript really gives us a head start to the real world.', 'The school is very nice. I love it, the staff is very friendly and helpful. The teachers try their best to help you even if it takes longer than expected. They want you to succeed in every way possible.', 'It was a great experience, that has gotten me to the highest peak of being an independent, and hardworking student', 'Science, Technology and Research Early College School at Erasmus (STAR) is an excellent early college high school. It really prepared me going to college. Beginning around sophomore year, I start taking college classes and it did give me a good sense of how college will be for me in the future. I was able to earn college credits and Im glad I can transfer those credits to other schools. STAR has a variety of sports and clubs that students can participate in. The activites done by the facility, aside from school work, are well done and its a great way to bring together students together and get along. The environment is safe and since its a small school almost everyone can get along with anyone. All the teachers here are friendly and treat the students with care as long as you respect them. I learned many valuable life lessons and the value of hard work and dedication. I had an enjoyable time being a student here at STAR. It is truly a remarkable experience.', 'Erasmus was not a great school when I attended due to violence that used to take place on a daily basis. The administration trained to keep it safe but there was nothing that could be done.  I would like for the school to be more safe and education should be the priority. ', ' I like how diverse my school is . I like how  the kids and staff  Help  each other to do better. I like how they have opportunities for us to get college credit Starting in the 11th grade .', 'the teachers make sure use their time efficiently', "Star is a great school I'm really glad that I attended. I get to take college classes and etc which I am very happy about", 'The teachers are okay, they try to keep the students engaged in the topics', "There are a variety of clubs in this school, however, most of them do not last because of the lack of students' participation.", 'I would come to this school again because it offers free college credits and the atmosphere in this school environment is very welcoming.', 'The teachers at my school are very engaged with the students at our school.', 'I love the atmosphere of my school building.', 'Teachers at my school really are hands on with us.']
column8: ["Every student has to been scanned before entering the school. There are certain items students can't bring into the school. If it is found the item is confiscated and the student may be reprimanded.", 'As Dutchment, Erasmus students take a lot of pride in their athletics', "I don't really see the parents around. However I do hear of some parents who are very active when it comes to PTA  meetings.", "The teachers in my school are pretty reliable. Sometimes they give us free SAT Prep. Overall, it's a somewhat friendly envrionment", "The health and safety is not the best but it's okay.", 'I do not really like the extracurricular activites', 'This school is the greatest', 'The partnership with Brooklyn College is very helpful. Take advantage of the college credits and also the CTE/Brooklyn Navy program that is about to open up. Overall its a pretty good school its just surrounded by idiots and entering through scanning everyday can be annoying', "Overall, it's a decent school.", 'A vast majority of the teachers are interested in helping their students succeed and provide various sources of assistance such as reviews, additional assignments, extra credit,etc.', 'Our teams were the best but people mostly come for academics', 'It would be better, as time progresses', 'Most teachers dont care even though they know your trying your best and do all your work but still fail you.', 'Its just the feeling of not being their. Its a computer school yet I never had a computer class I had it once but it was for language subject and got kicked out for it being to full. ', 'Opportunities this school has is having college classes if you have less classes ', 'Not much academics you want that you might pursue as a career ', 'The school food is good at times when I am really hungry ', "Students are very involved. There are a variety of sports opportunities for you to be a part of. Even if you're not the world's greatest athelte, they'll work with you and help you get better. The teams are pretty competitive andhave won many times in football, softball, volleyball, track, swimming, and the list goes on.", "One must remember that this is in the New York City, one of the most diverse places in the world so at this school there will be lots of different people with different personalities. However, you are guaranteed to find at least 2 people who will gravitate to the same things as you do. With all those activities, friends aren't that hard to make.", "The college classes you take in this school does prepare you for college after graduation. Most, if not all, graduates have applied to and will be starting college or some career program. As you start attending the school, it is already apparent that you will be going to college after so that's good."]

column2: ['Our school had a lot of spirit and students seemed most happy when the band marched through the halls on a game day.  We had four mascots and and student announcements. Also, we were able to create and join clubs.', 'Going to South is the best decision I have ever made. South has made me the person I am today. I walked into that school with no goals, just to go to community college and get a degree. Now, almost leaving high school, I want to exceed, exceed more in life. The spirit of Toms River High School South will always be with me after high school.', 'Nestled in a small downtown area-HSS is VERY geared to loyalty, family structure, sports, SPIRIT!!!!', 'My high school experience was one I will never forget. The staff was so accommodating, smart, and truly made my four years there unforgettable. I went through the two hardest years of my life dying my high school years due to my brothers passing, and then me then being in a deep depression. Not once did they turn away from me. They were accommodating to everything. The teachers pushed me forward and helped me maintain a positive way of thinking. I am eternally grateful.', "The culture of this school is very traditional and that's what holds everyone together. I would love to see more aim towards college readiness and the facilities have improved a lot since I have graduated. I think it is such a great school to send your kids too because of the inclusiveness.", 'The spirit is number one. The teachers explain to us the rich history south has. Very traditional customs are done throughout the year from games to student run events.', "My overall experience at High school South was magnificent, exceptional , and worthy. There was good times and bad times, but my teachers never failed to make sure I was always on track. During my time at High School South it was a phenomenal experience and always a good vibe from staff and students. The only thing i would change at south would be the academic material. Sometimes we did not have all the resources to complete or learn more about a certain topic ,but we managed. I wouldn't want to go to any other high school. This school made me who i am academically and socially.", 'My time at Toms River High School South has not been the best. I find that there is a lot of systematic racism in the school that is overlooked by administrators, I have never seen any positive changes made.', 'There is a strong sense of family and a diverse student body. Like every school, you have a handful of bad teachers and students, but the good definitely outweighs the bad at South. I love this school with my heart and soul.', 'Toms River South was a great school and experience to be a part of for 4 years. The friends that I made and the experiences that I had there are ones that I will remember for the rest of my life.', 'This school is most known for its amazing school spirit. The faculty was wonderful and truly made going to school and enjoyable experience.', 'It was an experience full of spirit, laughs, and countless good memories. I just wish it could be a bit more classy at times.', 'There is nothing like our school spirit!  The hallways and classrooms are always alive with maroon and white. We support each other academically and emotionally.  There is a great variety of classes.  The Guidance staff is amazing and supportive.', 'Toms River South is not only the best out of the three Toms River high schools, but also the most welcoming. School spirit roam not only in the halls, but also in the students and staff. The teachers are friendly and are determined to teach students. Everyone pretty much gets along with each other for the most part. South is not the cliche movie screens high school, where there are cliques and bullies. My favorite thing about South is the diversity, there are so many ethnic backgrounds and everyone is different yet, we all seem to work together. South makes going to school at 7 in the morning more bearable.', 'Toms River South prides itself with school spirit.  Our school has many sports, clubs and activities that the students can participate in.  Offers a range of academies and classes to prepare for college.', 'I loved the school and everything about it, if I could go back I would. The only thing I would change is maybe some renovating throughout the school since it’s so old.', 'The school itself is very very old and is very run down. It does not have air conditioning and gets extremely hot. The teachers are average, some are better than others. The sports teams are typically pretty good with the exception of the football team. The school is somewhat diverse and has an ample amount of resources but the district as a whole seems poor. Buses for sports teams often get cancelled for no reason and budgets for sports are basically whatever the team can fund. It seems like some teachers are actually trying to prepare students for college whereas others are just trying to get through the day by doing as little work as possible.', 'Overall, I like the environment that we surrounded ourselves in during football games, pep rallys, etc. When it comes to school spirit, being an Indian is amazing. Some things I would like to see change would be the teachers development to actually teach their students. Majority of the students at South constantly complain that they don’t understand certain topics/subjects because their teacher hasn’t taken the correct amount of time to teach them.', "TR South is a school where you'll get out what you put in. Academics are very standard with little variety. But there are no standard teachers - they're either terrible or excellent. The arts programs are great, but always seem to be the first to suffer from budget cuts.All in all, I left this school with a high GPA, fully prepared for the academics I would face in college.", 'South is full of friendly and cheerful students and staff. All the staff wants you to push yourself to the best of your abilities and achieve great things out of life. One thing I would change about High School South though the level of cleanliness. It is clean but not the cleanest in the school district but it is also the oldest.']

column6: ['High school south has been a great experience. The teachers here are always there to help you if you need anything as well as the guidance counselors. Many friends that I have made with people that I’d never thought I’d be friends with if I didn’t meet them from being at this school. I have been taught a bunch of discipline from playing sports and working hard during the sports I played. They hire great coaches that help you succeed and teach you other things than just the sport. They teach you a sport is more than just the game it’s about family,determination, and how well you can work together. I have many memorable memories that I will never forget at high school south', 'What I really love about my school is how many things there are to be involved in. There’s many clubs and after school activities for students to participate in. Although our sports are a little competitive, it is amazing how many talented kids we have. I also love our music program, which I am invloved in. Currently I am in concert choir at my school. Most teachers are also very easy to talk to and i really enjoy my classes. Something I would love to improve would be our sanity situation at our school.', 'Once an Indian, always an Indian. I could not even have imagined a more spirited, social, exciting, unforgettable high school experience than the one I had at Toms River High School South.', 'I find the teacher I met great but the actual structure of the school is in bad shape. It’s really dirty in some areas of the school and things are constantly breaking. It’s a good school to go to, just not an efficiency one.', 'My school has a lot of school spirit. The teachers there make the me feel like I am at home and that I should never be afraid to ask someone for help or some guidance. It is a school full of diversity and everyone likes and gets along with each other.', 'I like the fact that most of the students from South that go on to become teachers all want to come back to South to teach. That shows you what a great school it is. They enjoy their experience as students there and want to come back and give back.', 'There is no other school like Toms River South. This school has spirit and pride beyond compare. The staff and administration are respectful of students and are invested in their students. The faculty overall works to help students succeed and excel both in and out of the classroom. Students are prepared for the future academically and socially. There are countless clubs and activities to be involved in and everyone is able to find where they belong. I have loved being able to attend Toms River South the past four years and feel that I am well prepared for the future. The only change that this school needs is the addition of air conditioning.', 'I love everything about Toms River High School South! The spirit that pours out of that school and everyone who attends it is incredibly admirable.', 'I love attending this high school. The spirit is like no other school around. The teachers are very qualified and help student one on one when needed. There are a wide variety of clubs and activities after school for every type of student.', "THE HOME OF THE HITTING INDIANS! I loved everything about my high school. Being a four year varsity cheerleader I helped achieve the ultimate school spirit. Getting everyone involved at pep rally's, crowd participation at games, and my favorite SPIRIT DAY every Friday! Standing at the corner of D wing, chanting with the mascots before homeroom starts, getting everyone pumped for the big game. The academics themselves were good but I do not feel I was as ready as I should have been for college.", 'This is a fun school. It is a majority Caucasian school. They have lots of school spirit that is my favorite part. There is rarely ever a fight here. We also get to leave for lunch which is pretty cool.', 'As a freshman going into Toms River High School South, you hear of many different stories, good and bad, about the school. You hear of how much school spirit there is, and how much fun it is being a student there. Now being a senior, I realize how much all of that is true. Sporting events, theater productions, you name it, you have the whole school there ready to support you. Whether you win, lose, do a great job or do a poor job, the school is in support of you. The students and teachers are a family, and I am proud to have been able to spend my last 4 years and be a graduate from Toms River High School South.', 'Not a world class education, but the people you meet here will teach you life lessons just about everyday. The teachers care about you as a person.', "My four years at Toms River South have been amazing! We have a history of being the most spirited high school in the area, and it's easy to see with our student sections at the sports games. We have a variety of clubs/activities that are great for meeting new people and making new friends. The teachers are wonderful and are very helpful in making sure you understand the material. I feel safe because there is always a police officer walking the halls. The food in the cafeteria isn't the best, but we have the advantage of being able to go out for lunch. There are a ton of different restaurants that you can walk to from the school that only cost $5 for food and a drink. If I could change anything about my school, I would improve the cafeteria food and build more parking lots for upperclassmen. Other than that, I have enjoyed my time at South and I will really miss it when I head to college in the fall.", 'Toms River High School South has the most spirit in the state of New Jersey. Majority of the staff and students attend the sports events.  It is the original Toms River High School with 127 graduating classes this year. The downside to that is that there is no air conditioning and no affordable way of adding it. The school offers all types of classes, making it helpful to prepare for college.', 'Toms River Highschool South, while rustic in appearance, is a wonderful school. It has an amazing history and really makes you feel like part of a giant family. From the afterschool activites to the utilization of downtown during lunches, the school has made my life incredible.', 'There is something for everyone college prep, honors classes and Ap classes so that', 'Most students are accepting one another openly', 'We can participate in many activities', 'Unique features of school include various club and extra curricular activities and every Friday is Maroon and white day our schools colors']
column8: ['High school south has been a great experience. The teachers here are always there to help you if you need anything as well as the guidance counselors. Many friends that I have made with people that I’d never thought I’d be friends with if I didn’t meet them from being at this school. I have been taught a bunch of discipline from playing sports and working hard during the sports I played. They hire great coaches that help you succeed and teach you other things than just the sport. They teach you a sport is more than just the game it’s about family,determination, and how well you can work together. I have many memorable memories that I will never forget at high school south', 'What I really love about my school is how many things there are to be involved in. There’s many clubs and after school activities for students to participate in. Although our sports are a little competitive, it is amazing how many talented kids we have. I also love our music program, which I am invloved in. Currently I am in concert choir at my school. Most teachers are also very easy to talk to and i really enjoy my classes. Something I would love to improve would be our sanity situation at our school.', 'Once an Indian, always an Indian. I could not even have imagined a more spirited, social, exciting, unforgettable high school experience than the one I had at Toms River High School South.', 'I find the teacher I met great but the actual structure of the school is in bad shape. It’s really dirty in some areas of the school and things are constantly breaking. It’s a good school to go to, just not an efficiency one.', 'My school has a lot of school spirit. The teachers there make the me feel like I am at home and that I should never be afraid to ask someone for help or some guidance. It is a school full of diversity and everyone likes and gets along with each other.', 'I like the fact that most of the students from South that go on to become teachers all want to come back to South to teach. That shows you what a great school it is. They enjoy their experience as students there and want to come back and give back.', 'There is no other school like Toms River South. This school has spirit and pride beyond compare. The staff and administration are respectful of students and are invested in their students. The faculty overall works to help students succeed and excel both in and out of the classroom. Students are prepared for the future academically and socially. There are countless clubs and activities to be involved in and everyone is able to find where they belong. I have loved being able to attend Toms River South the past four years and feel that I am well prepared for the future. The only change that this school needs is the addition of air conditioning.', 'I love everything about Toms River High School South! The spirit that pours out of that school and everyone who attends it is incredibly admirable.', 'I love attending this high school. The spirit is like no other school around. The teachers are very qualified and help student one on one when needed. There are a wide variety of clubs and activities after school for every type of student.', "THE HOME OF THE HITTING INDIANS! I loved everything about my high school. Being a four year varsity cheerleader I helped achieve the ultimate school spirit. Getting everyone involved at pep rally's, crowd participation at games, and my favorite SPIRIT DAY every Friday! Standing at the corner of D wing, chanting with the mascots before homeroom starts, getting everyone pumped for the big game. The academics themselves were good but I do not feel I was as ready as I should have been for college.", 'This is a fun school. It is a majority Caucasian school. They have lots of school spirit that is my favorite part. There is rarely ever a fight here. We also get to leave for lunch which is pretty cool.', 'As a freshman going into Toms River High School South, you hear of many different stories, good and bad, about the school. You hear of how much school spirit there is, and how much fun it is being a student there. Now being a senior, I realize how much all of that is true. Sporting events, theater productions, you name it, you have the whole school there ready to support you. Whether you win, lose, do a great job or do a poor job, the school is in support of you. The students and teachers are a family, and I am proud to have been able to spend my last 4 years and be a graduate from Toms River High School South.', 'Not a world class education, but the people you meet here will teach you life lessons just about everyday. The teachers care about you as a person.', "My four years at Toms River South have been amazing! We have a history of being the most spirited high school in the area, and it's easy to see with our student sections at the sports games. We have a variety of clubs/activities that are great for meeting new people and making new friends. The teachers are wonderful and are very helpful in making sure you understand the material. I feel safe because there is always a police officer walking the halls. The food in the cafeteria isn't the best, but we have the advantage of being able to go out for lunch. There are a ton of different restaurants that you can walk to from the school that only cost $5 for food and a drink. If I could change anything about my school, I would improve the cafeteria food and build more parking lots for upperclassmen. Other than that, I have enjoyed my time at South and I will really miss it when I head to college in the fall.", 'Toms River High School South has the most spirit in the state of New Jersey. Majority of the staff and students attend the sports events.  It is the original Toms River High School with 127 graduating classes this year. The downside to that is that there is no air conditioning and no affordable way of adding it. The school offers all types of classes, making it helpful to prepare for college.', 'Toms River Highschool South, while rustic in appearance, is a wonderful school. It has an amazing history and really makes you feel like part of a giant family. From the afterschool activites to the utilization of downtown during lunches, the school has made my life incredible.', 'There is something for everyone college prep, honors classes and Ap classes so that', 'Most students are accepting one another openly', 'We can participate in many activities', 'Unique features of school include various club and extra curricular activities and every Friday is Maroon and white day our schools colors']

column2: ['The teachers are selfish and only care about themselves. The kids are alll mean teachers dont dicipline and take control of the kids. The sports teams are terrible because of terrible coaches. Principle is terrible. Teachers are clearly blind. On the day of service trip I was getting garbage shoved in my face by my classmates and they dont even punish or discipline the kids and act like they dont see it when they really do.', 'Gaynor Mccown High School is an amazing school with many different opportunities that have a great hands-on learning experience. The school is made up of approximately  500 students, which allows teachers to get to know the students. There are also many opportunities for students to get one on one time with teachers to further help them in their education. Also since this school is an expeditionary learning school, they go on many fields works to learn about a case study they are working on. During breaks, such as winter break or spring break, the school goes on overseas trips to experience different cultures,(this is optional for the student). the school has visited many parts of Europe and this year they went to Japan. Overall Gaynor Mccown Expeditionary learning school is a unique experience and I would recommend it to students who are willing to try new things and like to work in a smaller working environment.', 'Gaynor Mccown was a great school when I used to attend it. All students from all sorts of backgrounds were welcomed and respected. There were a wide range of school activities that I personally enjoyed taking part in.', "My life would not be the same if I did not attend this school. Some may disagree, but it's really what you make of it. The small population of this school gives you the opportunity to really get to know everyone-- I mean everyone. The teachers are seriously beyond wonderful. As long as you do your homework and are respectful, they seriously become more like your close friends. As an alum, I still keep in touch and even sometimes get lunch with old teachers. McCown is a safe environment where diversity is constantly celebrated; everyone is accepted. I cannot rave enough about this place. I miss it constantly. Thanks for the best 4 years of my life.", 'From my four years attending Gaynor McCown, I’ve learned to step more out of my comfort zone. Participating in “crew”, and intensives week gave me a better insight into the school community, as well as bringing me closer to various peers. The small class sizes allows the teacher to be more connected with each student, as they put the effort in to guarantee their students will succeed. Most of the teachers create this environment to challenge us, in order to expand our range of thinking, without “spoon-feeding” us answers. Although we do lack extracurricular activities, if one is willing to commit to the offered clubs/sports, then it will benefit them in the future. Due to the small class sizes, it leads to a lack of variety in AP classes, but the ones offered are beneficial to students who may want to pursue a career in that possible field.', 'I am currently a senior at this school and I have appreciated the ways of teaching her. It is a smaller school which I feel is much better since there is a better relationship with the staff and more time placed on students. Instead of getting lost in a big crowd of students you know what is going on in the school community. However it does lack extra curricular activites, there are some but it could be better.', "It's a small school that allowed me to grow into the young adult I am today. I have lasting friendships with women of different ethnicities.", "Attending Gaynor Mccown will ensure you an interesting High School experience. Being an Expeditionary Learning School the curriculum and student engagement differs from most public schools as students have more opportunity to collaborate with one another. The school's size allows for relationships to flourish between student and teacher leading to a more friendly and comfortable atmosphere. With several opportunities for students to leave the classroom and explore Staten Island or go out of the country, Gaynor Mccown provides a unique  High School experience. However facilities around the building are a bit lacking along with the food. The school also did a lot of fundraising to get activities done, meaning not every event was able to be done due to a lack of funding in some instances.", 'This school was excellent because you get all the help you need, and you are able to roam the school without being bullied. The teachers are really friendly, and its a fun experience for many students that have applied here.', 'Overall gaynor mccown is a very good school and prepares you very well for college. The teachers and staff are always willing to help you out with anything at anytime.', 'The teachers and students are extremely respectful to each other, and always help each other out. Whenever you need any kind of help there is always people you can talk to in the building.', 'I like how small the school is and how friendly everyone is. I would like to see better school programs and clubs.', 'environment Gaynor was a small school which made it very easy to  connect with teachers staff and students, great staff, good education and friendly environment.', 'I am currently an alumnus at G.M.E.L.S. I was a part of the very first four graduating classes. Class of 2015. One thing that I liked about G.M.E.L.S was the student to teacher ratio. The classroom sizes are extremely small which gave you a lot of one on one time with the teachers any time you needed help. My graduating class was 123 students. As well as the diversity. My favorite thing about the school was even though we went to a uniformed school, we got to wear our uniform the way we wanted to. We could put our own individuality, style, and flare into the way we wore it. One thing that I can say I would like to change about that school while attending was there was not much extracurricular activities, clubs, or different organizations offered. There were very little options when it came to doing things outside of school work. All in all, the school was extremely sanitary and I indeed felt safe.', 'In my four years at Mccown, I have created the best memories. I have had the best teachers to help push me towards my academic goals.', "I love how my school has intensives week where we don't need to do classwork and just have fun for a week. This is a deserved respite in the middle or end of March when there is usually no breaks. For example, this year, my senior year, I had the burger intensive where I go to go to multiple burger places to try their burgers and understand how these burger places made their burgers. Such as how they mixed their patties and all the other condiments that they put inside. I also enjoy how my school is very big on community service and we have many service projects that contribute to a worthy cause. For instance, my school hosts an annual John's Pasta Party that raises money for survivors of cancer to a college education. Overall, I loved my four years at Gaynor McCown ELS even though it was not my first choice of high school. I do not regret my choice in staying at McCown and I hope others will feel the same way. McCown has given me many memories that I would not trade for anything.", "After attending this school for 4 years, I have mostly negatives to say unfortunately. first, since this is a government public school,  don't expect much. This school offers us too muchleeway and doesn't allow to suffer consequences if we make bad decisions. In general, this school isn't preparing us for life. With this howl system, the school is rewarding us or punishing us by daily things that should be expected of students at our age. HOWL system judges our ability to come in to class on time, take our notebook and make sure we are actively participating in class. This should already be expected of us and the school shouldn't pat our backs when we do this. This is one of the many things that hinder this schools performance and ability of preparing for the real world.", 'Small school experience with good teachers. Does not offer a variety of classes or extracurriculars.', "It's a uniform school, where it has limited academic learning classes. You have one classs that is mandatory (Crew) where we make the fours year of high school with those set of people, to become your friend and family. The school is small so pretty much would know everyone.", 'Gaynor McCown has prepared me physically and mentally to attend college. The administrations helps all of the students reach their goals and even allows the students to incorporate the outside world into the classroom.']

column6: ["Most of my professors were great. I've had a few that made my college experience living hell. These teachers made me want to quit during the semester.", 'My personal safety in this school has been threatened on several occasions. Out of all these incidents, my parents only received one notification. That incident was when a student brought a knife to school and attacked a security guard. This was not handled well by security or the administration. In this incident, my parents contacted the school with questions but never received an answer. In other case, I was injured from a fight that broke out between two other students but my parents were never notified by the administration. Concerning responses to incidents.', "Definitely not the school for anyone interested in extracurricular activities. Lacks variety in club. Low quality sports teams that don't stand a chance against competition from other schools. No football team because the field was not built the regulation distance from the fence (complete waste of money and potential).", 'Like any high school, there are teachers here who go above and beyond to ensure their students are understanding the material, especially the AP teachers, and there are teachers who simply give the material and cannot be bothered to work with students until they understand.', 'School security is average. Security is always visible at the main entrance. All doors are locked during school hours. The school nurse is always available.', "I was on the track team freshman through junior year, I left because my coach went to a different school. I enjoyed running but didn't really feel like it was a competitive sport. I mainly did it because It felt Good to be part of a team but didn't take winning to seriously. As far as clubs I'm not sure if many offered. I think there is a music and art club however these do not interest me.", 'This school is different from other high schools. At this school students learning is more hands on, in the field, the students are responsible for the way they learn, different strategies are used for learning. The class sizes are smaller and the student body is smaller. All the teachers and staff know the students well. This school should be more focused on getting academic numbers and classes up, it should be more challenging and student programs should prepare for college.', "I would give the teachers of this school an average grade, most are very approachable and willing to listen and help however I don't feel they challenge the students. Most lessons are not hard and font prepare us for college level work. Most teachers are very likeable  but could be a little to easy going.", "Not many opportunities for extracurricular activities, and the students aren't very involved in most clubs.", 'Most teachers try and provide engaging lessons. Key word: try.', 'I have never felt threatened at mccown. the school safety agents are friendly and caring.', 'Extracurriculars could be better. There are a lot of clubs at the school but a lot of them are more creative and artsy kinds of clubs. There are two community service organizations as well and of course sports. What is missing from extracurriculars are funds to become bigger and better.', "McCown was a wonderful high school experience, but its not for everyone. For the student who's an athlete, McCown might be a huge disappointment since the school has a very limited number of sports, does not have football or any titles. For the creative student or the students who want to be leaders, McCown is it. The small community allows students to be free and work closely with others, which will help develop the skills necessary to be successful in either area.", 'Every single teacher at Gaynor Mccown, from my experience, was helpful and caring. Teachers at Gaynor McCown will do everything they can in order to see students succeed. Even administrative staff know students well enough to make them feel comfortable. Its a great environment.', 'I love this school. I am very involved with all of the school activities and like the individual attention I get from attending this small school.', "the school doesn't really focus on academic success", 'I am glad I decided to go to this school.', 'I mostly bring my lunch.', 'The principal and assistant principal want to keep their students safe.  The guidance counselors are always available and they are very knowledge about the college process.', 'I believe that I receive a good education at this school.  The principle, assistant principle, counselors, teachers, and staff are all committed the students.']

column2: ["There is only about 96 students in my graduating class, which could be a  good and bad thing. It's bad because we are not always the best at sports and won't have as many opportunities as the larger schools would have. It can be good because the inter-class competitions are fun and brings together a class and the tradition of it hasn't broke yet because of how invested every single student is in it. The air conditioning/heat situation sucks. When it's the beginning of the year and end of the year, everyone is always hot because not everywhere has air conditioning. When it's the winter everyone is freezing and they're in two sweatshirts because the heat just sucks. Administration also really sucks, the principle does not care for the students or even the faculty and anyone would agree with that. He has no social skills and never makes an effort to be liked.", "East Rockaway Junior-Senior High School is placed in a small town where everyone knows everyone. The teachers in the school are very nice and supportive. You will always see parents of kids of the school participating in activities, volunteering, or even working at the school. Teachers and students have great communication while there is many extra help times to attend and teacher's emails are always open. The school provides textbooks, books, computers, etc for the students.", 'A lot of drama but the staff works hard to keep everything peaceful. Some staff are overbearing whereas others are very understanding and kind. The counselors are very interactive with the students and are helpful with guidance through the school year. Busy school days but always time for a student in need. Sports are fun and build a great community. Friendships are hard to make and only a few last through the year. But everyone is cordial and keeps a good control over their feelings.', 'My overall experience with East Rockaway Junior/Senior High School is a positive one. The teachers are knowledgeable in their subject areas, and provide classrooms that are conducive to learning. The teachers provide extra help service if needed. The fine arts department is wonderful, both performance arts and visual arts. The teachers are experienced and motivate students to do their best.', 'it was a pretty good school, i loved my guidance councilor and i had a lot of support due to my disablities.', "East Rockaway High School is what you make of it. It's a very small school, which is good and bad. Good, because you stand out and will inevitably make a mark if you are involved in at least a handful of things. Bad, because when you get to college, it's not that easy. You need to work a lot harder to make yourself known and actually do something. As a result of being a small school district, sometimes making schedules is difficult, but a good variety of classes are offered by the school. Teachers are great if you know who's good.", 'I really liked how much the teachers care about the students as people and do not just treat each student like they are a number. However, when I came to college I did not feel prepared at all. Especially, because there is a much higher workload in college than there was at ERHS. I would change how well the teachers prepare students for college and assign more college-level work. I also think that in the English classes more about how to cite research resources needs to be taught. I felt very in the dark about how to cite resources when I first came to college which was problematic due to the high volume of papers I have to write.', "Other than sports and rock rivalry, there really isn't that much.", "It's high school, you just take the classes you need to graduate.", "There really is none other than locking the doors, but we really don't need any security or cops.", 'I came here as a junior, and made some great friends here.', 'Most teachers are great and really care about students and their jobs.', "The school nurse retired after I graduated but she was great; the school is safe in my opinion but there aren't very many informative programs", 'Some have more funding and recognition than others, but overall I had a good time in the clubs I was part of', 'I had a very good experience, but I know of many who did not. I believe most of my success here came from a personal drive, not necessarily because of the teachers. Overall, the student body is friendly.', 'It is hard to generalize the entire teacher population...there are some who go above and beyond, and others that I question how they still have a job. I had some great experiences and teachers I truly respect, while also having some bad experiences.', 'The school is fairly safe, and adequate measures are taken to protect students from potential intruders.', 'Most extracurricular opportunities have great programs, however there is not enough of a variety for most students.', 'I\'ve overall had an average experience at this school.  The arts department has been my favorite part of my time in school, and do an exceptional job of making the school day "fun" and leaving me with something to look forward to each day.', 'Most do an adequate job of teaching their subject, and there are a few teachers, very few that stick out as doing an exceptional job of engaging students and ensuring each student understands the topic at hand.']
column4: ["There is only about 96 students in my graduating class, which could be a  good and bad thing. It's bad because we are not always the best at sports and won't have as many opportunities as the larger schools would have. It can be good because the inter-class competitions are fun and brings together a class and the tradition of it hasn't broke yet because of how invested every single student is in it. The air conditioning/heat situation sucks. When it's the beginning of the year and end of the year, everyone is always hot because not everywhere has air conditioning. When it's the winter everyone is freezing and they're in two sweatshirts because the heat just sucks. Administration also really sucks, the principle does not care for the students or even the faculty and anyone would agree with that. He has no social skills and never makes an effort to be liked.", "East Rockaway Junior-Senior High School is placed in a small town where everyone knows everyone. The teachers in the school are very nice and supportive. You will always see parents of kids of the school participating in activities, volunteering, or even working at the school. Teachers and students have great communication while there is many extra help times to attend and teacher's emails are always open. The school provides textbooks, books, computers, etc for the students.", 'A lot of drama but the staff works hard to keep everything peaceful. Some staff are overbearing whereas others are very understanding and kind. The counselors are very interactive with the students and are helpful with guidance through the school year. Busy school days but always time for a student in need. Sports are fun and build a great community. Friendships are hard to make and only a few last through the year. But everyone is cordial and keeps a good control over their feelings.', 'My overall experience with East Rockaway Junior/Senior High School is a positive one. The teachers are knowledgeable in their subject areas, and provide classrooms that are conducive to learning. The teachers provide extra help service if needed. The fine arts department is wonderful, both performance arts and visual arts. The teachers are experienced and motivate students to do their best.', 'it was a pretty good school, i loved my guidance councilor and i had a lot of support due to my disablities.', "East Rockaway High School is what you make of it. column6: ["We are a small school which really gives a close feel, like we're a family. A better performing arts program would be appreciated and definitely welcome. More electives and college readiness would be beneficial.", "This school is unique because it's a small school, so everyone knows each other and the students are able to get to know the teachers better.", "I can not image going to a different high school. I am so grateful for all the friends I made at East Rockaway High School. Rock Rivalry was one of the best memories I made at East Rockaway. I will always remember the amazing performances and all the work my grade put into it. I truly have to thank East Rockaway High School because without the staff and students I wouldn't be the person I am today.", 'I think that East Rockaway High School is a very safe school. I have gotten bullied in the past but thanks to the great staff at my school they put a end to it.', 'I am a senior so I am able to go out to lunch, but when I was younger I always enjoyed my spicy chicken wrap with a side of salad!', 'East Rockaway High School has fair rules for all students. It is very important to follow the rules, if a student does not follow the rules there will be consequences.', 'Students get involved in athletics and the teams are great.', 'The teachers are always there to help you.', 'All of the students and staff get involved.', 'its amazing if you take advantage of the ap classes, if not classes are mediocre at best.', 'our school has a very small budget, but most administrators do all they can.', "if i had a chance to transfer to a private school i'd do it in a heartbeat, but i can deal with it. take advantage of ap classes and sports. just wish cliques weren't such a big problem.", "the nurse is okay, just annoying. she'll let you call a parent if you need to. i almost always feel safe, many fights though. cops at the school a couple times this year. alcohol and drug use is very prevalent at our school, most students being drinking in 8th/9th grade, drink every weekend until graduation.", 'eating cold lunch/going out/brining lunch is always the best option. occasionally the hot lunch is appetizing.', 'when they catch you you mostly just get ISS. most people get away with things like cell phones though', 'our school is very athletic, most students play on at least on sport team before graduation. its basically the only thing our school excels in', "either the teachers are fully devoted and care about everyone, or they don't care at all. no in between.", 'not many activities to chose from, mostly sports', 'The teachers at the school are good for the most part. The administration makes sure that they hire teachers who care about the students are know how to lesson plan.', 'There really is a club for everyone. Sports for the athletic, quiz bowl for the academically inclined, robotics for the tech freaks, key club for the philanthropists, etc. The great part about this small school is that anyone can join virtually any club they want to.']
column8: ['The quality of my teachers was pretty good for the most part. It really depended on whether or not their teaching style fits with your learning style and their attitude. There are some teachers that I liked as people but, not as teachers.', "After graduation I made the choice to go to college which was a great one. However, I wasn't completely adequately prepared for the work-load and we didn't really write any research papers which has turned out to be a huge set-back. All of my friends from different high schools have a lot more prior experience in writing papers than I do. I would definitely recommend taking Senior Seminar, it's a great opportunity; you get a taste for the real world and what it's like to work a real job. I also learned interview skills which have helped me tremendously.", "We have something called a life-skills program for students with severe disabilities. In this program, the students education is focused on learning life-skills in order to be able to get a job after graduation and one on one aides are provided as well. For students with learning disabilities, accommodations like extended time on tests are provided or taking a test in a seperate location. There is also something called resource room which gives students with learning disabilities more time to complete their work with additional support. However, I feel that more of an effort can be made in order to make the kids in life-skills feel like they aren't excluded from everyone else.", 'MOST the teachers are great', 'The administrators pick on the wrong things', 'The after school activities are great', 'Great variety pf classes, great teachers', 'Rock Rivalry was worth it, the racism? Not so much', 'Great clubs with highly educated advisors and great skills.', "The principal is fairly new and doesn't seem to be taking much action in reforming or improving the school. The assistant principal takes care of disciplinary action, which has been slowly becoming more strict. Skipping classes is never tolerated and always results in warnings and usually detentions. Bullying is not tolerated. Dress code however, is poorly enforced. The in-school suspension room is used.", 'There are a good amount of teachers who offer extra help before or after school on certain days of the week. They are usually willing to help students with the current materials. The condition of the school building is pretty good, mostly everything is kept clean and fairly new. We have a Mac lab and a recording studio, and equipment for morning announcements on the Smartboards, which are in every classroom. The refurnished auditorium is small, but updated and clean with a  brand new stage. Guidance counselors are friendly and always willing to help. College prep meetings are good, and definitely improving with better guidance staff. Tutoring is not a popular thing, only a few students. Parent involvement  is not extremely good, and it is usually complaints, not boosting the community. Some do contribute wholeheartedly. There is only busing for special education students. There is very limited parking space for juniors and seniors who must drive to school.', 'The overall quality of the school lunches is not very good. Many students eat off campus. The snacks available are not healthy options.', 'The health and safety policies are just adequate at this school. Bullying is never a real issue, there are teachers who are willing to step in if necessary. There are no metal detectors or armed school security, but that has never raised issues. Very safe environment. The school nurse is not always around, nor very helpful. Health program is decent, including brand new apparatuses for teaching CPR.', "The guidance counselor a try to be helpful. Though my school claims bullying isn't tolerated nothing is ever done about any situations involving bullying. The dress code policy is definitely fair. The attendance policy is strict, if you get caught cutting you automatically receive detention.", 'The school nurse is muse but is not ideal to take care of most situations in my opinion. We have a buzzer system to be let into the building as a security measure. We have occasional lockdown drills and fire drills to practice safety as well.', 'There are a lot of sports! The musical program is great even though you have to audition. We have a Key Club who does a lot of community service projects. We also have a Quiz Bowl that meets every Friday morning. We also have a national junior and senior honor society. Academic extra help is mostly offered in the morning before school.', 'Our academics are ok! I would say our science department is lacking the most in chemistry teachers. The library is a great place to go to study and find resources (and be alone in a quiet place). We do offer quite a bit of AP courses for college credit which gives students who take them an advantage and a challenging curriculum. Senior Seminar is a course everyone should take! You learn about real-world experience and the business world. You learn how to write resumes, interview tactics, and you have the option to leave the school during periods 7-9 to do an internship of your choice!', "A lot of students get involved with school spirit but, I don't really care much about it! Football is the most popular sport in our school, but our football team wasn't very good this year. We have a large variety of sports for such a small school. We are hopefully getting a swim team next year!", 'the school administration does everything they can for the students to excel in their given course', 'Our school is very safe. We participate in fire drills and lock down drills throughout the year. All the teachers and staff are there for our protection and all the students know that.']

column2: ['The school provided many opportunities you wont be able to find at other schools like the variety of internships. I think that if you are not having a good high school experience and would like to work towards graduating early and being more involved in real world things then this could potentially be a good place for you.', 'Love the Casual Atmosphere  given at this school it makes high school more realistic in real world applications', 'City as is an alternative learning school, which means students come together from all 5 boroughs and are taught in a way that gets the student involved not only in school but life! Two days a week I go to an internship, MADACADEMY. Mad is a group of staff and students who are passionate about art, whether is be singing, film, producing or design. It stands for Music, Art, Design. In this internship we create a website to document our growth throughout the semester and show our work. Links to songs, trailers for films, social media’s. It’s a way to brand yourself as an artist. This internship has gotten me out of my shell and has pushed me to improve my musicianship. It motivates me to show up to school and learn rather than just show up to pass. Besides the internship, this school allows the student to pick their classes based on what credits they need to pass instead of being put into random classes just to prove to the state that students are in school.', 'City-As-School changed my life. They gave me hope to finally graduate high school. The teachers and staff really care about your success and do all hey can to help you. What I would like to see change about City as is to have more people invested into making the school known to help other young adults finish high school with a school that gives so much support.', "I honestly enjoyed my time at City-As school. I was a transfer student, and when I got an enormous amount of support and was able to graduate high school in three and a half years. The reason why I did not give the school a Five start because while I was there, I didn't learn much compared to another high school or the curriculum is not as challenging. But I did have a lot of support in the college Application process and that was a requirement before graduation.", "Absolute 5 stars. I don't know why I didn't hear about this school earlier. I went to a traditional high school in New York City and it was just too boring for my brain. I didn't struggle with the work, in fact when I did go to school, I would be one of the top in class. I ended up dropping out and thats when I found City-As-Schools. They have a completely different way for students to learn- experiential learning, meaning you learn by doing internships in the real world that can set you up for your career. I was lucky enough to obtain an internship at a very big record label which eventually turned into an ongoing job. I recommend this school to all students who feel like the traditional education system is too systematic for them or just plain boring. You will succeed in this school with the right effort.", "It's a school that people come to for many different reasons, but for the majority of people their previous high school experience was a bad one. CAS offers a completely different environment, being a credit/no credit school, and being an alternative school that focuses on experiential learning. A year ago, I was sure that I was going to have to become a super senior, and I wasn't sure I'd be able to go to college. I didn't see a future for myself. Now, I'm on the path to graduation and am encouraged to pursue my passions. The most important thing, to me, has been the kindness of all staff and how they take an interest in the students. Where in many schools, you may feel like the teacher only sees you as your number grade, in City-As students are made to feel like people.", 'Some teachers were great, some were just annoying and one somebody tazored her for being  (expletives were said) useless and cruel. They had internships 2/5 days a week and most of the internships were great! Yet some of the coordinators took attitudes with me for being learning disabled and were prejudice.', 'City-As is an amazing school for people who want to start over. They have internships and you can choose what you want to do when you get older, it’s a good experience. The teachers and guidance counselors are the nicest people ever, they make sure that you get everything you need, make sure that you’re in great shape.', "I like the program that this school offer of internships. It's giving a great experience and i get to learn alot of things.", "City-as-School is amazing. I came from a school where academics were valued over student health and outreach, and it took a huge toll on my mental health. When I transferred to City-As, my whole worldview changed. I went from thinking I'd never graduate to thinking about where I want to go to college. The teachers and aren't authoritative, they all care about the students and genuinely want to see us grow and succeed. The student outreach is phenomenal and communication doesn't feel intimidating. Classes are small and the work is specifically geared towards what you need to graduate. The lack of tests doesn't mean there's a lot of downtime, but it's definitely more relaxed. There's no busy work at City-As, and teachers don't waste your time. Everyone around you is friendly and open and the overall environment is incredibly inclusive and respectful of all students. I love here and it's a place that genuinely changed my life. If you feel stuck at your school, City-AS is for you.", 'Innovative High School education run by compassion and dedication. Internships and intriguing courses come together to help struggling students. This alternative High School is second chance for most students, and a fantastic one at that.', "It's a great school for thoses indeed of help. Great environment, teachers, staff , college advisors are the best when needed.", 'There are may aspects of City as that I enjoyed as a high school student. They were a wonderful experience because they had split weeks between internships and school, giving everyone a chance to see what it is like in the real working world. Also the teachers (most) were superb and really had an interest in the kids. If I could change anything it would be that kids failed if they did not come to class. it would motivate more kids to show up and learn.', 'City-As-School High School is an innovative establishment that helped me escape depression and excel as a student. The staff is compassionate and brilliant, the administration is benevolent and sharp. Best school I have ever been apart of.', 'This High School offers amazing opportunities. When I transferred here the opportunities started flooding me. This school is based out of classes and internships. I interned at West Chelsea Veterinary Hospital where I started as a intern when I was 16 and was hired to work there too. I observed surgeries, learned how X-rays are completed, post- and pre-surgical procedures. Teachers are really helpful and engaged to the topics. Staff members are incredibly helpful and friendly. This high school is my second home. I was president of the Student Government, this was fascinating since I also met with staff members on how to make  the school enhance more than what it already is. Moreover, when I still need help, I seek help from the teachers and the principal. This High School has helped me in my academic career, seeking internships, and how to empower myself mentally. Foremost, City-As-School, was the bridge to my future goal.', 'Ability to learn in an internship environment and take college classes. I was able to go on an expense paid trip to Denmark and learn at The New School for Social Research. Students do need to be self motivated to make this learning environment work.', 'Great school for kids who need outside jobs as help and motivation! I learned how to make pottery at an internship from the school and I loved everything about it', 'I love city as school . The people there make you feel great, they help you with everything.  They push you to be the best. The only thing I would change is having more clubs in the school.', 'My school is a very unique school and I love every thing about it . It gives us all a chance to recover from anything that we may have messed up in our previous schools and it gives us the option to pick and choose what we want to do. The internships are my favorite , they not only give us experience in the job force but it helps us advance and prepare for college and  what we want to do as a career after we graduate from city as.']

column6: ["I love City As so much. Every teacher cares so much about the students, there's always someone there to help you and they treat you like an actual adult. You have so much freedom from choosingyour own classes to choosing your internships.", "I just recently started city as high school and so far I am liking the high school because it's meant for students who are behind on credits and allow you to get your credits are very fast and get out of high school and I appreciate that because it's a kind of an in-and-out kind of situation and that's what I was looking for but one thing I really don't like about the school it's like a lot of freedom and it doesn't motivate the kids if you want to you do it and if you don't no one tells you too so that could be a lot for a lot of kids and it will never get done so a lot of kids end up staying there for more than the high school required time.", 'My name\'s Amanda im 18 years old, and have a 7 month old son named Leo. We both take the train to school together and he stays in the lyfe center while I go to class, and my internship. If I wasn\'t going to City-As I wouldn\'t have the support I\'ve need to graduate as a young mom. I have taken an internship in the college and career office and I have learned so much. I always said I didn\'t want to go to college but now that I actually understand the concept my mind has changed. City-As is very different. It took me a whole cycle to understand the culture of the school. Every student has an advisor, guidance consular, and a college advisor. Something I like is that classes aren\'t textbook reading. For example my U.S history class is called "GUNS" and its all about gun control and mass shootings in the United States. The way they approach learning is different and actually keeps students interested. Overall it\'s a dream school, and it\'s my dream job. ', 'I Like My School Because Everyone There Is Very Friendly Even The Safety Guards. All The Teachers Are There To Help Each And Every Student Do What They Have To Do To Graduate And Go To College.', 'I think this school is great because it allows us to express our ideas and feelings, and because the staff makes us all feel unique and like we are capable of anything.', 'I love my teachers they are all very caring to students. they are very helpful with not only classroom work but also with future planning. i genuinely think my teachers care about me and want me to do well.', 'teachers are knowledgable and care about the students learning', 'my only safety concern is the constant renovations going on.. i worry about how safe it is physically when there is serious work being done in the school during the days', 'city as a great school for the non traditional student or struggling student. not everyone is or can follow the average track and city as is a great place for those who have a different educational need', 'we have internships instead of in school clubs earning school credit', 'city as was a great school to attend, its a very very independent student ruled school', "teachers at city-as have been possibly the only teachers ive ever witnessed to give their entire life's purpose into helping students graduate with life skills to live on their own in this day and age's society", 'Simply can not put into words how amazing my experience has been at city as.', 'They made me love learning again, every single one of them is wonderful. City as has been my savior!', 'It prepares you a great amount for college life and it helps you become independent educationally. It also helps you get real life experience in job fields of every kind.', 'The only club that I remeber was the art "clubs" which was really a class that would change its theme. For example it was changed to halloween class during that time and everyone got to make costumes.', 'Everyone was open minded and if there was ever a problem any of the teachers would intervene immediately', 'The school is on top of their students health they want all of their children to be healthy, which I believe is great.', 'What makes this school the best is the love that the staff in the school put unto their students, I would do it all over again because when I attended the school everyone was willing to help me and never complained. Teachers actually care about students and about their success. I think that is what should count the most.', 'This school is on top of everything, the teachers and staff genuinely care about their students education and safety. this school is overall great.']
column8: ["I love City As so much. Every teacher cares so much about the students, there's always someone there to help you and they treat you like an actual adult. You have so much freedom from choosingyour own classes to choosing your internships.", "I just recently started city as high school and so far I am liking the high school because it's meant for students who are behind on credits and allow you to get your credits are very fast and get out of high school and I appreciate that because it's a kind of an in-and-out kind of situation and that's what I was looking for but one thing I really don't like about the school it's like a lot of freedom and it doesn't motivate the kids if you want to you do it and if you don't no one tells you too so that could be a lot for a lot of kids and it will never get done so a lot of kids end up staying there for more than the high school required time.", 'My name\'s Amanda im 18 years old, and have a 7 month old son named Leo. We both take the train to school together and he stays in the lyfe center while I go to class, and my internship. If I wasn\'t going to City-As I wouldn\'t have the support I\'ve need to graduate as a young mom. I have taken an internship in the college and career office and I have learned so much. I always said I didn\'t want to go to college but now that I actually understand the concept my mind has changed. City-As is very different. It took me a whole cycle to understand the culture of the school. Every student has an advisor, guidance consular, and a college advisor. Something I like is that classes aren\'t textbook reading. For example my U.S history class is called "GUNS" and its all about gun control and mass shootings in the United States. The way they approach learning is different and actually keeps students interested. Overall it\'s a dream school, and it\'s my dream job. ', 'I Like My School Because Everyone There Is Very Friendly Even The Safety Guards. Teachers actually care about students and about their success. I think that is what should count the most.', 'This school is on top of everything, the teachers and staff genuinely care about their students education and safety. this school is overall great.']

column1: Queens Gateway to Health Sciences Secondary School
column2: ["Gateway was an okay school. It's not as concentrated on health sciences as it used to be but in the last two years that I attended, they've tried their best to incorporate more health science classes into our schedule. The staff, more specifically the high school teachers, want us to do well inside and outside of the classroom. I thank Gateway's teachers for their help with college readiness because I think my teachers have done a great job at prepping us in our last two years of high school.", 'I wish we had more clubs and had a schedule that had everything we needed to graduate from the first day of school', 'Queens gateway is an okay school.Its not above average like everyone make it seems.We have very little clubs and most clubs are taken by the same kids over and over without other kids being able to have a chance.', 'I have been a student at Queens Gateway since 6th grade. My middle school experience was great, but for high school Queens Gateway lacks extracurricular activities. However, the teachers rigorously prepare you for the next steps in the future, including college.', 'Queens Gateway was an alright school. The teachers are alright. It is just the management of the school. Its really poor. They are always messing up schedules and never doing anything right. They also are very limited when it comes to trips and any school activities.', 'The school overall was good, the teachers were nice and fun. However, I did not like the way the school was managed. We did not get our final schedules until the fourth week of school. There is only one guidance counselor for grades 9-12. She tries her best but has a lot to do. I need a social studies class and was given one but on the third day they made the class a physics elective when I already took physics and passed the regents.', 'When I first attended in 2010 I was a 7th Grader, throughout the years the schools character/ mission has diminished. This school was the level under a specialized school. As bad as this sounds the school was not as diverse as most would like, but I loved it. Many students looked like me, although we were all minorities we were all so different in other ways. This school used to be great in all areas but with new administration it is falling into shambles.', 'Queens Gateway is good for making friends and knowing everybody, however in terms of activities and academics we are severely under developed. We have no clubs, very few trips and our schedules are constantly messed up.', "Great school for academics, very competitive! I've been attending for the last four years and the diversity and education is significantly increasing. There's low student activity involvement but theres great potential.", "In the school, there is hardly any clubs or any extracurricular activities thus making school life incredibly boring.  In terms of school lunch, it's usually disgusting  and even though there is a school store it is usually sold out or never open.", 'The school can use more clubs but due to lack of funding, we don’t have much choices. Academic wise, it is very challenging and time consuming. Teachers are nice for the most part and want to see their students succeed. School doesn’t have many AP class choices so it is very restricted.', 'Needs more extracurriculars and trips; and for the extracurriculars available, they need to given much better funding. Literally the only thing that kept me alive were the teachers and my classmates, guidance could also need a little more work such as telling students the opportunities available to them and  helping with college readiness.', 'Gateway has a reputation around the "brown" comunity as a very good school. The school building looks amazaing and so are the interiors. However, this school could make tremendous amounts of improvement. The students in class score very well however class grades and regents grade are not on the same scale. There are a handful of teachers who are excellent but there are some who do not teach as well or can not maintain the class. The adminstration is very shady, they require the teachers to provide their own materials to teach such as copy paper and claim there is no funding for the various activities students come up with. There are little to no extracirrular activites, only recently there were formations of extra ciricular activites. The school only has ap classes.', 'It was a good school before but under the new administration it’s more strict and you don’t get the feeling of joy being in school. Overall the teachers and staff are very nice and the school is clean and in A good location.', 'Queens Gateway is a school that provides and offers a great education along with most teachers being friendly and actually caring about our education and well being but has lackluster administrators and rude security officers.', 'The teachers are very concerned about the welfare of the students.  The school need more sports and events for students to participate in to develop leadership skills.', 'Super fun and interactive school only when the student body is willing to participate. Many opportunities ad support.', 'Queens Gateway to Health Sciences Secondary School is great with academics, but they don’t encourage you to be a part of be school community through the means of clubs and trips. They teach us things about the real world, but won’t let us use it when the time comes. The one thing I want to see change is the school being less passive and less restrictive.', "Queens Gateway to the Health Sciences Secondary School, despite its very minor flaws in comparison to other high schools, has made me into the man I am today. If it weren't for this school, I would probably be very ignorant to the reality of the world around me. Without the experiences that I have encountered, I would've never withdrawn such a vast amount of impacting and meaningful life lessons in which I have shared with the people that I surround myself with. If it weren't for this school I honestly don't believe that I would be ready to take that next step as a college student. So, even though we might not have the biggest school or the best in the state for that matter, I am proud to have spent my entire middle and high school experience at Gateway.", 'Overall, this school has been a struggle. While the classes are often rigorous, the school is slightly disorganized which can effect the productivity of the student body. I would like to see a change in the organization of scheduling.']
