column6: ['My experience and the general experience of my peers can be considered good. The school is great academically, the faculty all do their best to make sure students are comfortable and on task. The school is very clean and the security is reliable. The food is like any typical school lunch, but the cafeteria is nice. A relatively new building; the worst part about the school is the administration as they can be shady.', 'What i did like about this school was that it was academically focused, but i did not like that there was a poor diversity of extracurricular activities. little was done to build up school spirit, something that i feel is very beneficial for any school.', "The attribute I found most intriguing about my school is that they equip us for college at an early stage. We begin taking advanced placement classes in the ninth grade which is continued throughout highschool ultimately preparing us for college. Being that we undertake these courses, we will know what's coming our way when we commence in college. One aspect I would add to my school is further extra curricular activities. Extra curricular activities plays a large role in the student life and must be incorporated in school.", 'Initially, Gateway was held in high esteem within the community. Following recent administrative changes, that previous prestige has declined tremendously. A school that once prided itself in its academic excellence concerning its minority students has unfortunately morphed into the stereotypical "I\'m getting paid regardless" attitudes of other urban schools.', "This school was enjoyable because of the connections I acquired... Other than that, the school needs to up it's performing arts standards as well as their staff. The STEM subject teachers can be a bit more professional.", 'I liked what they offered at first, gave many promising but did not follow through. Only some staff members actually care about the students, no money coming into the school, and staff members have favorites. If I could change anything it would be to replace certain staff members and principal.', 'Queens Gateway is a very excellent school. The teachers are very friendly, and are willing to give students the help they need to understand the material taught in the courses. The administration strongly encouraged students to take AP courses and CUNY College now courses. This school is great for college readiness.', 'I like the teachers at Queens Gateway, and they have some good programs such as college now, and internship at Queens Hospital. However, there is a lot of bullying in this school and nothing is really being done to prevent it. Also, there are not a lot of clubs.', 'The atmosphere is very dense. The people chosen to the school are not students who have met the requirements based on grade. The teachers try their best to help us but the students do not want to put in the work.', 'This school is a great school because it provides a great environment for the students to learn. I love it so much and i have been in this school for over 6+ years. The education is very high class and focuses on each individual to learn and improve. There is a great amount of pressure applied by each student toward each other which creates a sense of competition among them. This creates a great learning environment.', "I'd like to see teachers that are actually qualified to teach, whom are held responsible if they do not put effort into teaching students. I'd also like to see administration that actually care about the students they are meant to helping. If there are any kind of administrative errors, and a student tries to civically solve the problem with administration, administration ignores the students.  The only times  I've witnessed active administration under the reign of Judy Henry was when parents threatened to make complaints to the DOE about administrative behavior. This school often fails to replace staff/administration that either quit or are fired. We do not have a college counselor. Last year it  took over three months for the school to give us am AP biology teacher.", "There's diversity in the school and the education is advance, however, there should be more clubs and activities for the students to do rather than studying for a test at the end of each school's year.", "The faculty at Queens Gateway is beyond impressive. They truly treat you like family and have your best interest at heart whether you're a student or adminstration. Everybody pushes you to do your best at all times. The environment is phenomenal and the atmosphere is just joyous.", 'Queens Gateway is a school I have learned to enjoy. It is a school that has the friendliest teachers and staff members. The teachers that work there are always interested in helping you no matter what. I have met friends that will last a lifetime. The classes that you take and the lessons you learn will be extremely helpful in the future.', 'Attending Queens Gateway was a roller coaster. There was always a class in each of my high school careers, where I had to teach myself the whole curriculum because my teacher failed to do so. It was also very common for an important STEM teacher to leave in the middle of the year, stranding the students to an important test they looked forward to in the end of the year. Nonetheless, the student life was great. However, there were no clubs to showcase the great talents we all had to offer.', "Gateway is a great school for academics and it is very safe for students but it doesn't give much opportunity for students to explore talents outside of academics.", "My experience and journey at Gateway is one to remember, even though it was full of many bumps. I’m most appreciative of the students and teachers. The community in the school is very genial. Students in the school are all like-minded and are brilliant, giving the school its title/rank. As for the teachers, most put every inch of effort to meet the students' needs. There are a few who don't try as hard to teach and make the lives of their students a living hell, but they are decreasing. As for all the hardships students  face in Gateway, almost everyone is linked to the school administration. Wanted courses are not offered or are refused, schedules are always problematic, there are no extracurricular activities besides athletics teams, your concerns are not heard by the staff, and school has minimum supplies and insufficient funding. There are changes being made this year, such as a Hospital Program that used to be a part of the school before the current principal. ", "I like some of the teachers but most have a tendency to leave because of administrative issues; this doesn't give me much confidence about the leadership of our school. Academics is fine, but schedules don't follow student interests. The school doesn't provide a diverse list of clubs to participate in.", 'I liked the comfort of the school. Bullying and violence rarely took place their and the students all worked and helped each other.', 'There are not many options being provided to the student body and as a result, not all students are accommodated for their talents.']

column2: ['i like the atmosphere. there are good people there, its a very large crowd, all different types of people. the teachers care if your on track. the sports are very cared for as well.', 'The teacher were very nice and each honors class prepared us for college and career readiness. We have a really good nursing program, IB, and IBCP Program. We also have other specialized programs such as NJROTC etc. We have a #1 un deafeated swimming team and the only local high school with a pool. We have lots of clubs and oppportunities to get inloved in. Students recieve lots of support from the school suich as tutoring, free glasses, jobs, educational programs, etc. We have good bathrooms however the school lunch is bad.', 'I like the diverse atmosphere at Curtis and the kindness that is generated towards students at Curtis High School. The school is trying to become an IB school as we were just recognized as one in 2019, this is beneficial and can prepares students for college.', "Curtis High is a good school with really good programs. It is very diverse there are many students from different countries. Curtis High School has an IB program which is good. However, there are some teachers are not great at all. I have amazing teachers but for major classes like chemistry or high-level math teachers just don't teach the way that I am used to it. There are many activities that you could do after school and many clubs.", 'I like the diverse community and the welcoming environment, however, I feel like the school is overcrowded and there are too many students to handle.', "I love being a part of the LPN division of the nursing program at Curtis high school. I get to come out of high school with an education that can allow me to obtain my LPN license directly out of high school. Curtis high school also offers a very wide range of extracurricular activities from sports to clubs to community service, etc. Some times there can be some problems with Curtis and the kids that don't really care about school cause trouble with things like fights. Rarely do I not feel safe at or around curtis high school.", 'Probably one of the best schools in the island with good programs. Not only does it have a good amount of programs it has a bunch of sports you can try out for, even with no experience. Curtis High School also has a lot of clubs that students can join in too.', "During my time in High school, I was a very active member of my learning community. I participated in many clubs that sparked and held my interest, and I was also enrolled in a vigorous program that allowed me to obtain my professional license in practical nursing. Overall my rating was 4 stars because I feel that there is always something that every school can improve in. However, I do have to admit that my four years in high school were beneficial for putting me on the course that I am journeying now. In simple terms I wouldn't be in the position I am in now if I hadn't gone to Curtis High School.", 'Curtis may have its flaws but you will meet the most real people there and get a better understanding about yourself with the staff there', 'the ib program has treated me very well. i really enjoy the atmosphere here, and i have met some of the nicest people and some of the best teachers as well. curtis has some of the best sports teams in the city. the band and the curtis players also put on great shows, and they are some of my favorite parts of curtis. all in all, i have had a great time so far at curtis high school.', 'My experience at Curtis High School was overall fun with many hardships. I appreciate the various programs available to students to join but there is too much bullying within the school.', 'robust extracurricular activities with caring and helpful teachers. As well as various tutoring opportunities. The school provides health center services to all students, it allows students to get appropriate treatment while on campus and is one of the plethoras of things Curtis provides to help every student succeed in their high school career.', 'Curtis has it pros and vons. I like some programs there but it was a discriminating school with bunch of racist staffs', "I love the experience I had there but overall I disliked the school. The teachers weren't that good, the food there wasn't good. I did meet a couple of dope people there. I loved the school counselor that was there at the time. Other than that, I disliked the school overall.", 'I found my experience at Curtis High School to be very valuable to me. Because of my program I’m able to receive opportunities that I would not have at any other schools. Along with the help of my grade advisors I have access to other sources to guide me through the college process. They are able to give me the pros and cons of any schools I am interested in and give me their own opinion on what they think will suit me the best. Due to this support of the faculty, I have found myself thriving in my academics and feeling confident that I will be college ready by the time of June 2021.  Along with the academic help, I’ve found myself finding diversity in my school through sports and clubs. This has also allowed me to come out of my shell and branch out to other groups of people I never thought I would befriend. Curtis High School has been able to support me not only academically but has helped me with my social anxiety and etc.', 'Diverse community near the ferry. Lots of transportation options. Lots of activities clubs and sports teams to join, college now and sub programs within the school.', 'Curtis has been a great experience.  Coming from a small Catholic School prior to attending Curtis, I was a little nervous attending such a large school.  I was welcomed right away and felt comfortable right away.  There is so much to do at Curtis - sports, academic programs, clubs, theater, community service, etc.I loved attending Curtis.', "Curtis High School is an amazing school to attend. The school makes each individual feel welcome no matter the background. The faculty is  caring and always has the students' best interest in mind. The school offers a variety of extracurricular activities from football, basketball, track, baseball, and many other activities as well. Curtis also offers a variety of opportunities in educational disciplines such as nursing, business, and journalism. Curtis also offers the prestigious International Baccalaureate Honors Program which I am currently a part of. Being a part of this program has given me the opportunity to grow as a student, a thinker, and a considerate, open-minded citizen. The program and school staff encourages hard work, academic rigor, community service, leadership, and creative thinking in all aspects of student life. I am proud to be a part of Curtis and the International Baccalaureate Honors Program, and I would highly recommend this school.", 'I didn’t like the school at all. I couldn’t wait to go home. Students brought weapons to school, smoked, sneaked in and out, also fought every other day. It was very distracting and easy to tempt you to fall off track.', 'Curtis High School is a great school to attend. To be more specific, Curtis High School is the only high school on Staten Island that has the International Baccalaureate Program. I am part of this program and it is incredibly rigorous but I do not regret it. Through this program I was able to meet people from all different backgrounds and we were able to work together to better our education. The IB program increases communication between the students because we are constantly presenting our creative ideas to each other. We do this in both presentations and peer critiques in many classes. The IB program at Curtis high school also helps prepare each IB student for college because of how challenging the work is. Curtis High School and the IB program has made me into who I am today and I will always be grateful to my peers and my teachers for making each day more exciting than the last.']
column4: ['i like the atmosphere. there are good people there, its a very large crowd, all different types of people. the teachers care if your on track. the sports are very cared for as well.', 'The teacher were very nice and each honors class prepared us for college and career readiness. We have a really good nursing program, IB, and IBCP Program. We also have other specialized programs such as NJROTC etc. We have a #1 un deafeated swimming team and the only local high school with a pool. We have lots of clubs and oppportunities to get inloved in. Students recieve lots of support from the school suich as tutoring, free glasses, jobs, educational programs, etc. We have good bathrooms however the school lunch is bad.', 'I like the diverse atmosphere at Curtis and the kindness that is generated towards students at Curtis High School. The school is trying to become an IB school as we were just recognized as one in 2019, this is beneficial and can prepares students for college.', "Curtis High is a good school with really good programs. It is very diverse there are many students from different countries. Curtis High School has an IB program which is good. However, there are some teachers are not great at all. I have amazing teachers but for major classes like chemistry or high-level math teachers just don't teach the way that I am used to it. There are many activities that you could do after school and many clubs.", 'I like the diverse community and the welcoming environment, however, I feel like the school is overcrowded and there are too many students to handle.', "I love being a part of the LPN division of the nursing program at Curtis high school. I get to come out of high school with an education that can allow me to obtain my LPN license directly out of high school. Curtis high school also offers a very wide range of extracurricular activities from sports to clubs to community service, etc. Some times there can be some problems with Curtis and the kids that don't really care about school cause trouble with things like fights. Rarely do I not feel safe at or around curtis high school.", 'Probably one of the best schools in the island with good programs. Not only does it have a good amount of programs it has a bunch of sports you can try out for, even with no experience. Curtis High School also has a lot of clubs that students can join in too.', "During my time in High school, I was a very active member of my learning community. I participated in many clubs that sparked and held my interest, and I was also enrolled in a vigorous program that allowed me to obtain my professional license in practical nursing. column6: ['The school has a variety of classes and extracurriculars. There are several houses in which students can focus on different areas such as performing arts or journalism. There is also the IB program and ROTC.', 'As much as I may say that I hate school and the IB Programme, I actually like it all. The school is very diverse and offers many extra curricular run by the great staff. Along with 500 other students, we enrolled at the time of numerous changes. First off, we welcomed our new principal after Dr. Curtis’s retirement. He is well involved with the school’s well being. Then, came our new building which turned out to be the IB building. It was beautiful in theory but there seems to be more traffic getting to class now and sometimes the staircase to it floods. It also traps the IB students and stops us from interacting with the rest of the school, segregating is further (who knew that was possible?). Other than that, my experience was pretty good.', 'Curtis has very good nursing program with amazing teachers who are very knowledgeable. This program is a gate to bigger opportunities for those who want to advance in the medical/nursing field.', 'I like how diverse Curtis High School is. My teachers really take their time to teach me and make sure that I understand what is being taught to me. I am greatly involved in a club at Curtis High School. I am also very connected to some of the staff, I am able to go to them once in a while if something is troubling me or when i just want to talk something out with them, they show a kind caring attitude. As I am preparing for college there are many resources to help me plan at Curtis High School.', 'Our school is the oldest school on Staten Island , opened in 1903 . Most teachers are very open and welcoming, they try to build relationships with the students. The honors programs are good and so courses as well as college now courses are available. We are known as one of the best spirited high schools and excel extremely well in sports. The school does a lot to make sure kids have all the resources and opportunities available to them. I have been to an internship through the school and applied for another program as well. There is a free health center which offers many medical services to students for free and we have our own college office as well which specializes in all things college. It is very convenient during the college application process. The only thing I’d say is that the school is fairly overcrowded and it would be nice to just walk to class without clashing into other students', 'Curtis high school is like a big melting pot. All sorts of people around that you would never feel a bit of uncomfort. The houses in curtis helps prepare us to go out into the real wrold and pursue a healthy lifestyle. Our sports teams are always striving and we work very hard to get to the top. They offer a lot of clubs for almost anything and makes sure there is something eachother student is interested in.', 'The facilities are terrible but I love the diversity. We need more help with college readiness as well.', "As a current student at Curtis, I have seen the progress of changes made over the years. My freshman and sophomore year, they were building a new building with a new co-ed gym and two floors of classrooms, however, it's quite a walk and traffic from fellow classmates to get there. Part of the original building is under construction because they are turning the old gyms into new classrooms and building a bridge from the original to the new building. Other than traffic, the school is fairly above average. They have a variety of clubs, community service, and sports to join so there is always something to do. As a majority, the staff is very helpful and understanding. They do their best to help you do what you need to do in order to graduate and have many resources at your disposal.", "My experience so far at this school has been good. My experience was less fun and interesting than i thought it would be but iv'e  still made the best out of it by being on the basketball team. I think my school does not have a enough events to get the students engaged in their school, so if your not in a club or sport team there is  not a lot of other extracurricular activities to be a part of. The school is very diverse and there is a lot of different cultures, and that is what makes school different from others in the city. As i finish off my fourth year at Curtis high school i have seen some changes in the way things are done from my freshman year so i hope it keeps getting better from here.", "I had a good experience at Curtis High School. The teachers I had were very nice and encouraging. I've made life-long friends there. Through the IB program, I was able to get a full 4-year tuition scholarship for college.", "My experience was great and I met so many different fun people that Ill never forget. Of course who could forget those bomb threats made to the school and the one time a gun was brought to the school but our wonderful safety administration took care of the incident. And the school's back-to-back football and JV basketball championships were to contend with. All I can really say is: CDub!!!", 'This school is great. With variety of great programs such as the IB Program and Nursing. They aren’t given the credit that they deserve. This school is not as bad as everyone thinks it is. Also they have really good sports teams. A well rounded school', 'I like that Curtis High School is really a community. The friends you make and the teacher’s you meet will really become your second family. Curtis is really good for preparing you for college and there are so many different programs and clubs that everyone can find their niche.', 'Curtis was a great learning environment, I loved that the teachers really cared about my understanding of the course material. The only thing I would suggest to change is the scheduling because it is hard for seniors to work and take full time classes.', 'Lots of clubs to join. Teachers are very helpful if you ask for help. probably the only school in Staten Island that offers the IB Diploma Programme.', 'It has an overall good diverse student. A lot of schools spirit and has a great honors program that has benefit e throughout my school years.', 'I disliked Curtis mainly because of the students. The school is fine, but as a student in IB at this school, many of my peers were racist. It especially came from many kids who I least expected it from. I would like to see that change in the students and staff.', 'The main thing I liked about Curtis High School was the availability of different programs. I was part of two honors programs at Curtis, SIS and IB. I prefer IB because it almost fully prepares you for the events you will have to experience in college such as writing thesis papers and balancing school work with extra curricular activities. It was a struggle at first, but if you stick with it, you will bound to be successful.', "My experience at Curtis was something that I won't forget because it was my high school years the beginning of my prime years before college. Curtis gave me the chance to find myself and express myself in different ways. There were so many events for students and activities for the students to join to always keep us busy. The teachers were invested in the program that I was in and it really added to my overall experience.", 'Curtis is a great school everyone in the building cares for you but most importantly wants you to succeed.']

column1: Brooklyn International High School at Waters Edge
column2: ["It was a very safe, non-judgemental and supportive space for recent immigrants. All the staff were very clearly trained to deal with all types of situations. I've never encounter a more patient group of individuals than the teachers I had at this school.", 'Brooklyn International High School is an institution where students are from over 32 different parts of the world. Of course academics is important in a institution however, without collaborations and communication the growth of a student unstable. At my school we focus on collaboration and communicating with each other and our community. In the future every jobs or career will have these two technique and our school does a great job and with great effort install them inside us so that we will be a step advanced towards our career.', "I graduated in 2013 and went to SYRACUSE UNIVERSITY. I never regret going to BIHS. Teachers and staffs here were so nice and provided resources as many as possible that you need, and they also have connections with different school, programs, and organizations. They also helped you to APPLY FOR COLLEGE and FINANCIAL AID which will NEVER HAPPENS IN OTHER SCHOOLS. It was extremely helpful for an immigrant who doesn't have a family, connections, experiences in U.S. Class size is small so you can have enough attention from teachers and really focus on your learning. School activities were very fun as well. Overall, you get all the resources you need.If you study hard, have good GPA, and attended activities, it will not be a problem to go to Top 60 universities.", 'I like how the school is very diverse and how the teachers care about the students and their success. I would like to see more activities and programs in the school.', "I have never thought that I would ever fit in a school in the United States when I left my country. Yet, as soon as I set foot in Brooklyn International High School, I felt like I was back to Senegal. It's a country known for welcoming everyone with warmth and that's exactly what I felt. At Brooklyn International, there are students from all over the world, speaking multiple languages. Everyday I learn about countries that I never thought of, I try to learn languages that I never knew existed. The teachers are thoughtful and patient with the students because they understand that we are english learners. I love everything about my school but if I could, I would only separate the 9th grade and 10th grade because the 10th graders learn basically the same things two years in a row. Besides that, Brooklyn International is beautiful and diverse community where religion, race or origin doesn't exist.", "It's a really really good school for the immigrants students and the special thing they have is portfolio presentation instead of Regents.", "Bihs has not only been a school but a gift for me. It taught me so much and made me learn who I am as a person. Coming to a new country isn't easy but this school has made it a little bit easier. They take you with open arms. I never felt scared to speak my broken English my first year because their were other students like me who wanted to learn and improve their English. The staff and teachers are amazing. They treat you like their own child. If you have problems or need advice, they are there for you! They prepared me for college and are very involve to make sure you won't be alone in that process. They look colleges with you and scholarships that are available so that you will be ready once you graduate. Thank you BIHS family!", 'Every student attending at the school is an international student. What makes this school so unique is thanks to its diversity. Students are encouraged to participate in social events such as fund raising for a specific cause, raise awareness about world peace by marching from the school to the Brooklyn Bridge with posters and songs, and much more. Seniors at the high school participated in a story telling to kindergarten students by creating an original story and read it to the kids. All of the school events are related to diversity, integrity and support for one another. Since every student knows their native language only, they are encouraged and supported to speak English to communicate with other students. The only problem from this school is how to get there. Is kind troublesome to walk to the school because of the streets placed around the school. Overall the school is definitely a one time life experience to be at.', 'They didnt always had metal detectors but they did it sometimes without us knowing', 'They have a lot of clubs some that are conducted by staff others are outsiders. For example: imentor, tagai, taxi to the future, these club were to engaded us to the outside worls, meet people, college student and make our own connetions. Other clubs like art club, music, dance, advanced math etc were conducted by teachers to help in school us or for fun. They are great with after school programs and clubs .', 'What make this school unique is their teachers and all the amazing clubs they have. The teachers are very helpful, they make the class interesting, they do a lot of group work so that we get to meet everyone close and learn english daster and better. All the clubs they have in and out of the school that you can attend, community service honor programs advance math music club different type of game like pim pom etc.', 'They are really caring, they want you to suceed and they help you throught so that we can achieve our goals.', "All the class's use technology", 'in this school teachers quality really great and i really like all most all teachers', 'In this school have lot of types of club like bangle club, african club, Aqurbi club.', 'In this school all teacher are good and they are nice to students. All teacher are helpful.', 'this school have lot of opportunities for students.', 'food services good and everyday give health good, vegetable food, milk.', 'This school nurse really nice with student and nurse take care them', 'All the facilities for sports.']

Everyday I learn about countries that I never thought of, I try to learn languages that I never knew existed. The teachers are thoughtful and patient with the students because they understand that we are english learners. I love everything about my school but if I could, I would only separate the 9th grade and 10th grade because the 10th graders learn basically the same things two years in a row. Besides that, Brooklyn International is beautiful and diverse community where religion, race or origin doesn't exist.", "It's a really really good school for the immigrants students and the special thing they have is portfolio presentation instead of Regents.", "Bihs has not only been a school but a gift for me. It taught me so much and made me learn who I am as a person. Coming to a new country isn't easy but this school has made it a little bit easier. They take you with open arms. I never felt scared to speak my broken English my first year because their were other students like me who wanted to learn and improve their English. The staff and teachers are amazing. They treat you like their own child. If you have problems or need advice, they are there for you! They prepared me for college and are very involve to make sure you won't be alone in that process. They look colleges with you and scholarships that are available so that you will be ready once you graduate. Thank you BIHS family!", 'Every student attending at the school is an international student. What makes this school so unique is thanks to its diversity. Students are encouraged to participate in social events such as fund raising for a specific cause, raise awareness about world peace by marching from the school to the Brooklyn Bridge with posters and songs, and much more. Seniors at the high school participated in a story telling to kindergarten students by creating an original story and read it to the kids. All of the school events are related to diversity, integrity and support for one another. Since every student knows their native language only, they are encouraged and supported to speak English to communicate with other students. The only problem from this school is how to get there. Is kind troublesome to walk to the school because of the streets placed around the school. Overall the school is definitely a one time life experience to be at.', 'They didnt always had metal detectors but they did it sometimes without us knowing', 'They have a lot of clubs some that are conducted by staff others are outsiders. For example: imentor, tagai, taxi to the future, these club were to engaded us to the outside worls, meet people, college student and make our own connetions. Other clubs like art club, music, dance, advanced math etc were conducted by teachers to help in school us or for fun. They are great with after school programs and clubs .', 'What make this school unique is their teachers and all the amazing clubs they have. The teachers are very helpful, they make the class interesting, they do a lot of group work so that we get to meet everyone close and learn english daster and better. All the clubs they have in and out of the school that you can attend, community service honor programs advance math music club different type of game like pim pom etc.', 'They are really caring, they want you to suceed and they help you throught so that we can achieve our goals.', "All the class's use technology", 'in this school teachers quality really great and i really like all most all teachers', 'In this school have lot of types of club like bangle club, african club, Aqurbi club.', 'In this school all teacher are good and they are nice to students. All teacher are helpful.', 'this school have lot of opportunities for students.', 'food services good and everyday give health good, vegetable food, milk.', 'This school nurse really nice with student and nurse take care them', 'All the facilities for sports.']
column6: ['We have good connection with apple company so we have lots of new ipad and mac computers at our school. We use computer almost all the classes. We use different websites like prezi, Animoto, googledoc, glogster and etc t make our presentations. We also use Makerbot to make 3D stuffs and make presentations. We always learn new things and able to do my ourself next time.', "I love my school.  This school is great and very friendly. When you enter the door of Brooklyn International you will feel like family. My school is very diverse school because every student is from different countries who have been only less than two years in United State. All the teacher and staff and also students are very respectful and always help each other. All the staffs and teachers know everyone's name. When you start join this school without any English, by second year you will be able to be with other people who know better. This is my school and I love my school.", 'There are many Extracurriculum opportunities at Brooklyn International. For example there different cultural clubs like Tibetan, Bangladesh, African and Latino etc. Anyone can join to these clubs. We have boys and girls blowing and soccer team which they play again with other big school like Brooklyn Tech and FDR. There are also dance club, Peer training which is one of group who speak up for bully, discrimination and etc. Also there are book club, wrestling. Our school is well connected to some college so we get opportunities like Saturday class.', "The sports and Fitness at Brooklyn International Hight school is very versatile. Our school have the best wresting club, who every year make it to national where students compete against best of the best wrester in the regional. Moreover, we have girl and boy bowling who play off against specialized high school such as Brooklyn Tech and other high school such as Franklin D. Roosevelt, Fort Hamilton and other. Moreover, if there is a specific sport that you love to have but the school doesn't have then you can make a team and create it!", 'Brooklyn international high school brings diverse cultures, and races together as a whole family. My school contain  more than 46 different languages and around 33 different country. Brooklyn International High School truly symbolized the colorful and remarkable world we live in because of its diverse students and religions! My school is the best place to expend once networking and students are very benevolent and respectful toward each other!']

column2: ["Need to hire better teachers, not clean, very dirty, teachers barely do anything. Campus is bland. There is a lot of school spirit. Pep rally's are great. A lot of after school activities. They offer a lot of sports. The school counselor system is messed up. The house offices are a mess.", 'Over the past few years, Norwalk High School has on-boarded a number of pathways for our kids.  There is now a culinary arts program, ability to take college courses as electives and has a partnership with IBM.  The P-TECH program allows for a student to not only leave Norwalk High with a high school diploma but also with an all expense paid associates degree in a number of computer science fields.', "Norwalk high school is very good school and very diverse but there's this one problem is the bathrooms and bad food", 'Norwalk High School includes a very diverse culture. Alongside, it has a society of hard-working students and provides necessary resources and materials to guide the students to the next level.', 'The teachers aren’t the best and neither are the students, security doesn’t really seem to care much either.', 'I liked how we only had 4, 90 minute classes per day instead of 7, 45 minute classes. I would like to see some teacher changes, not all of them care enough to actually teach.', 'Honestly, the name doesn’t define the school, the people do. The school is just like any other. It depends on what you do and what one wants to be involved in the school. Overall it’s a okay school than others.', "What I liked the most about Norwalk High is how involved the staff is with trying to make the school seem brighter. They try to invoke school spirit within the kids and try to make Norwalk High's name bigger than it already is.", 'Norwalk High is a great school for sports and academics because there is diverse. There could be changes in the food and fights. There are new fights almost every month because of the lack of consequences.', 'The teachers here are lazy and can also be unfair sometimes and the environment is not safe, there are people constantly smoking in the bathroom and even in class. There is constant bullying and no one is doing anything. The education here is subpar because in my class I’m bored cause I already know the material. Overall, I don’t like this school one bit cause I’m constantly worried that my safety is at risk and the administration barely do anything to protect the students as well as the education being terrible really sets the school at a low point. They can say whatever they wish but if you want to get a real education, don’t go to this school and go to another with a really good education and a safe environment or you can study yourself by using Khan Academy (again they say that they use Khan Academy but not once have I seen it being used by any teacher let alone being mentioned).', 'Norwalk High School is not a bad place, but seems to give more opportunities to the same kids over and over again and does not seem to recognize a lot of the kids that should be recognized and are just thrown into the background of the school.', 'My experience at Norwalk High School was great thanks to the teachers. Most of the teachers are funny, easy to talk to, and are passionate in their topic. The music program is fantastic as well. The only downsides are the buildings age (mold, smelly) and some snobby kids. Students are very diverse and are for the most part friendly, espically starting junior year. Norwalk High is one of the better schools in fairfield county.', "Not a bad place to jump start your education. I was in the neca program so I'm happy I got free college tbh", 'Norwalk High School is an overall diverse school. Very friendly teachers and my high school experience was overall excellent!', 'What I like about Norwalk High School is the diversity. When I walk from class to class I get to see so many different faces. Everyone is treated equally and not looked down upon because they might be different. We seem to forget that and look past it to see who they are as a person. What needs to change is violence. Sometimes fights happen. From fights in the bathroom to fights in the cafeteria it needs to stop. Violence is never the answer especially not in school. Although school staff can only separate the two fighting they can’t help out with the issue because it is between the two who are fighting. Talking things through with the other person will make everything better in the end while fighting will only make it worse.', 'Love it at Norwalk High, definitely more than what people make it out to be. They have so many great resources that are offered to all of the students here, it’s their choice whether or not they want to use them but Norwalk High is full of great opportunities, even opportunities to go abroad!', 'norwalk high school is a very good public school. there are numerous opportunities to excel and go above and beyond. the staff is incredible and very helpful', 'Some teachers are  amazing and they really focus on making sure you understand the material which others could care less about your education which is a bummer when a student like me who wants to learn is put down by my own teacher. The school is a mess and needs server fixing up. The bathrooms need to be fixed and repainted because they are gross. Overall, my experience was not too bad because I found a group of teachers who really focused on my future and made sure that I had all the materials I needed to succeed in life even when others were putting me down.', 'There’s some great classes but cafeterias are overcrowded  and bathrooms are always locked. The student body for the most part seems tired with the school. I loved my art classes but had only a few because of scheduling issues. Concerning college preparedness, they just gave us a packet and talked about it for a period, it’s not very individualized', 'Sure some of the students are dumb and some of the teachers just can’t teach, you get what you put in. Most kids go into all high schools with the same idea, that this is the worst place. That’s with any high school, most kids hate it, but if you try to enjoy yourself you’ll be fine. NHS is far from perfect, but out of all the teachers i’ve had only 2 were terrible.']

column6: ['It was a great experience for me, the teachers were amazing and a lot of people from Norwalk High will always stay in my heart.', "Okay so Norwalk High School, has a bunch of good resources and outlets to be used at your time there. NHS can make you feel wanted and accepted in all the activities provided to you down to sports, the fabulous music dept, writing clubs, lgbtq+ clubs, and more. Everyone can get connected and meet new people. A lot of the teachers are nice and friendly once you get to know them and they will help you if needed. Consuelors are relaibe  and will help with anything even if they aren't yours. They prepare you well for college and beyond. Espeically Toni Kelly, Kate Moffett, Kyle Heaslip, Glenn Couture, Donna Ellett, and Rob Karl.", "Well...  NHS has a lot of well prepared teachers, but in many cases that is not just enough for the teen's education. In some areas such as ESL department there are not enough teachers for the amount of students that need it. And because of that, ESL classes are huge, which causes a big difficulty on the kids learning. Besides of the language department, I would like to se more teachers that actually care for their students and what they are teaching them. In many classes teachers are not demanding for more  effort to the students, which is crazy because this makes the students lose their interest on what they are supposed to learn.", 'I liked the diversity of Norwalk High there are so many ways to meet new people and make friends however I feel that the school spirit is declining.', 'A diverse and in depth learning environment. Some amazing educators. Several opportunities to expand interests beyond the classroom.', "I liked how no matter who you are, you can always connect to another student. You won't be shunned away. Also, the teachers are there for you and will help you in any way they can if you ask for it. I have two teachers there that I trust to talk to about anything and I know they care how I do in life, now and in the future.", "Life is an adventure and it is about discovering new things to gain more life experiences. When I first started at Norwalk high Shcool,  I was excited but at the same time I was also scared because I didn’t know anyone at that time. On my first day of school, I got lost so many times. Eventually when I could finally find my classes. I didn't know what to expect, but it turns out to be one of the best school in the area. As a senior graduating in June, I can say that it I'm happy that this school played a role in my High school experience. Teachers are good and make sure that we understand everything before moving on. Everyone is nice and always ready to help. Overall, this school is doing a great job with all the students who take school seriously. And I receive a lot of help getting ready for college. Thank you!", "They don't do anything special in terms of getting you ready for anything, they basically just push everyone through.", 'My experience as a freshman in Norwalk High has been exciting and it has been the most productive school year I have ever had.  All of the teachers I had were fantastic, and their classes are interesting and engaging.  The school spirit is enforced, especially during sporting events.   What I love most about Norwalk High School  is the various amounts of opportunities one can experience during the school year.  There are multiple clubs and sports one can take advantage of during the year.  For example, in the fall, I had experienced being in multiple clubs such as the Astronomy Club and the 3-D printing club, while my sister joined the field hockey team.  In the winter, my sister and I both joined the winter track team, and now we are on the softball team this spring.  My experience with Norwalk High has been far from disappointing, and has exceeded my expectations of how much fun high school can be.', 'The system is okay, teachers are resourceful, students are annoying, many opportunities, eventful calender, and LOTS of college trips. The NECA program is widely known now and the NECA program is great.', "What you put into Norwalk High School is what you get out. There is nobody there who is going to help you out or push you towards your college goals except yourself. The teachers range from absolutely terrible to great, with most teachers falling in the middle to bottom half of that scale. The student body isn't very tightly knit, but it's not difficult to find a friend group that suits you. Overall, Norwalk High School is average, not shining bright in too many areas, but not coming up short too often either.", 'I really loved how hands on the teachers are. The teacher I have had truly care about your education and make sure you have a good understanding of what is going on. I wish that they were given more credit for all of the hard work they put into us. One thing I wish would change to improve our school would be the cleanliness of our school, other than that I have loved my high school experience at Norwalk High.', 'I have really enjoyed all the programs they have to offer. I would like better communication with the staff.', 'I am pleased with the fact that Norwalk High presents honor students with the ability to indulge in various AP classes as well as seek extra help after school when needed. Although the classroom basis is poor at times, those who seek guidance outside of school hours such as extra help are significantly more prepared as they are the ones reaching out and getting results. I would love to see more school spirit as a whole for this school. Football, soccer, and field hockey games are always packed with spirit, though when it comes to Pep Rallies, the spirit lacks significantly.', 'My experience is great, the school it self is very great. They have a great program called NECA that offers a great learning experience.', 'A good high school where most teachers are willing to help students get ready for college. Teachers are highly educated in their field and classes are run smoothly. There are many clubs and sports that allow every student to feel included in the high school life. This school also has great diversity and students and staff are respectful.', 'It was an alright school with okay people. Some teachers seemed to care for their students while others were there to just get their pay and leave. The classes were not that hard, if you needed help, the right teacher would be able to tutor you. Lunch was alright, the food could have been better. Security was always good at keeping fights to a minimum. Should probably help more with college readiness.', "Honestly I hate this school. I feel like my high school experience would have been ten times better if I wasn't at this school. It is diverse, which is nice. But the school itself and it's facilities are not very nice. They also barely helped me prepare for college, I felt very rushed and confused when the time came to send in applications. 2 stars, maybe 3 sometimes", 'Not fun, never get any help, library closes early, forced to make the wrong choices, needs TO BE CLEANED DESPERATLY', "Overall experience was very well. The teachers were intelligent and the staff was hardworking. Some rules I believe do not correlate with preparation for college. Norwalk high doesn't teach time management, which is a very important skill to have acquired before college."]

column2: ["FDR is a fun school. During the freshman orientation, there's a party for us outside. I still remember the time when people are fighting for food. Also, FDR has sports teams like Ping Pong and Badminton.", 'As a current student in FDR, I liked that the school helps everyone no matter what level of education you are in.They help us to perform our best work. Although, i wished that the school could  of inform the students about AP classes earlier in our high school years.', 'The school is remarkable！One thing that i like this school is the way of the teachers treat their students. They are been very patient to explain to the class and help students to completely understand the class.', 'Our school provides a lot of activities and sports to join. there are a lot of people you can trust if somethings wrong. the guidance counselors make sure you take all required classes.', "Franklin D. Roosevelt is such a good school. Though I was worried when I was thinking to transfer here in my second week of horrible freshman year at my old highschool, I think transferring here was the best decision I ever made. The teachers are really kind and help you through everything you struggle with. This school has a variety of clubs to join and awesome staff. I can't wait for all the opportunities I will get later on on this school!", 'Franklin D Roosevelt offers a wide variety of programs and clubs designed to help students progress as they continue their educational journey such as CollegeNow, and peer tutoring.', 'It is unlike the rumors going on about the school. FDR high school is a pretty nice place to study in.', 'Depends on who you hang out with. There are good and bad students and teachers alike, sometimes you cant tell the difference between them.', 'Franklin D Roosevelt is a school which is ranked as one of the worst schools in Brooklyn, but that\'s not what matters. What matters is the process of getting to college and the people you meet there. The staff and teachers are very welcoming, always open to hear your ideas. Sports in my opinion is good as you learn how to work as a team. One quote from my counselor that changed how I looked at FDR "It doesn\'t matter where you are now, its where you end up.', 'FDR is a multicultural representation of New York City. I liked the familiar atmosphere that round all the students and staff there. Also, is a sport center with a tremendous amount of sports. FDR is a secure place to bring your child. The majority teachers are so involved and engaged with their students.', 'FDR has an extremely diverse student body. The math department is the best in my opinion. There are many great teachers but not every teacher is good.', 'Overall the academics and extracurricular safe great but some of the teachers are not the best. It is a very diverse school so there are a lot of fights and disagreements. However that is why they have peer mediation which encourages students to help resolve their peers problems.', 'This school is very diverse. It has a mix of different student from different backgrounds and cultures. Most of the teachers are nice and they want you to do your best in anything that you are doing.', "I went to FDR during the years in which a principal got changed, so a lot of things I am sure changed since I graduated back in June.  It's a really good high school with great AP classes and some great teachers. While I was there the main thing that bothered me was that there was no school spirit and no one really tried to add school spirit. I'd say out of the 4,000 kids in the school maybe a good 100 were actually involved in clubs or went to the yearly musicals/concerts.", "A high functioning school, with great teachers and staff. I believe it's a great school , tidy and clean ,in a nice neighborhood with close transport and stores nearby. The teachers and advisors are attentive. The school also offers great extracurricular courses like theater and band.", "I studied here from 2014 to 2018. Now I'm attending City College of New York. The guidance counselors are great and the teachers are very helpful. I never had a hard time at FDR. If you are a student who cares about yourself this school will do it's best to get you were you want to go.", "My experiences at Franklin D. Roosevelt High School was amazing. It taught me so much about myself, and it helped me grow into the person I am today. The teachers help so much in developing my skills as a student and pushed me so hard to get my work done. I loved it so much I joined the wrestling team, student council, and met some of my best friends at the school. It's very welcoming and so much to do that you could never get bored. I would recommend this school to any parents in the local area looking for a school for the child.", 'FDR is a very diverse school with people from all ethnicities. Most teachers are really nice and are happy to help you in whatever you might need, they are really understanding especially the math department.', 'I had an average experience attending school here.  The staf members were helpful and knowledgeable in their areas.', 'I’ve learned a lot. Lots of subjects to choose from in a high school! The teachers are nice. Never got denied when asked for help. They’re always willing to help the students. There’s always some after school activities including tutoring.']
column4: ["FDR is a fun school. During the freshman orientation, there's a party for us outside. I still remember the time when people are fighting for food. Also, FDR has sports teams like Ping Pong and Badminton.", 'As a current student in FDR, I liked that the school helps everyone no matter what level of education you are in.They help us to perform our best work. Although, i wished that the school could  of inform the students about AP classes earlier in our high school years.', 'The school is remarkable！One thing that i like this school is the way of the teachers treat their students. They are been very patient to explain to the class and help students to completely understand the class.', 'Our school provides a lot of activities and sports to join. there are a lot of people you can trust if somethings wrong. the guidance counselors make sure you take all required classes.', "Franklin D. Roosevelt is such a good school. Though I was worried when I was thinking to transfer here in my second week of horrible freshman year at my old highschool, I think transferring here was the best decision I ever made. The teachers are really kind and help you through everything you struggle with. This school has a variety of clubs to join and awesome staff. I can't wait for all the opportunities I will get later on on this school!", 'Franklin D Roosevelt offers a wide variety of programs and clubs designed to help students progress as they continue their educational journey such as CollegeNow, and peer tutoring.', 'It is unlike the rumors going on about the school. FDR high school is a pretty nice place to study in.', 'Depends on who you hang out with. There are good and bad students and teachers alike, sometimes you cant tell the difference between them.', 'Franklin D Roosevelt is a school which is ranked as one of the worst schools in Brooklyn, but that\'s not what matters. What matters is the process of getting to college and the people you meet there. The staff and teachers are very welcoming, always open to hear your ideas. Sports in my opinion is good as you learn how to work as a team. One quote from my counselor that changed how I looked at FDR "It doesn\'t matter where you are now, its where you end up.', 'FDR is a multicultural representation of New York City. I liked the familiar atmosphere that round all the students and staff there. Also, is a sport center with a tremendous amount of sports. FDR is a secure place to bring your child. The majority teachers are so involved and engaged with their students.', 'FDR has an extremely diverse student body. The math department is the best in my opinion. There are many great teachers but not every teacher is good.', 'Overall the academics and extracurricular safe great but some of the teachers are not the best. It is a very diverse school so there are a lot of fights and disagreements. However that is why they have peer mediation which encourages students to help resolve their peers problems.', 'This school is very diverse. They’re always willing to help the students. There’s always some after school activities including tutoring.']
column6: ["I went to FDR and graduated in 2015. I have no complaints. The teachers were awesome, and there were a wide variety of clubs. The food isn't too bad, but I would just bring my own lunch. The staff is nice. I would say FDR is an amazing school and I am glad that I went there.", 'throughout my experience in Franklin D. Roosevelt high school overall was amazing. For sure at first entering this high school, I was for sure scare and thought about transferring.  But after the first year in FDR. HS I start to fall in love with this school. I use to think that FDR is a bad school, many fight, no real friends, mean teacher, and so much more. But after my first experience in FDR.HS I totally change the thought about it. Yes maybe there are fight in general, but the school is definitely save. Teachers and Facilities are very nice and they will help you gain the best knowledge for life. Many clubs and sports you can gain. Best part of FRANKLIN D ROOSEVELT high school it like a family. Lastly I have to think FDR for giving me my best high school experience. Thanks.', 'Franklin D Roosevelt is a very diverse school. I enjoyed my 4 years here I met a lot of good people which includes students and teachers. There are people that actually care bout you.', 'Fdr high school is a very diverse school where all kids feel welcomed and safe.  No one feels left out because students are encouraged to participate in school activities such as plays, trips, charity work, etc. All students are also encouraged to take ap classes and challenge themselves. The teachers are very involved with the students making sure each and everyone isn’t struggling and also to provide support when needed. Counselors are very helpful when it comes to applying for college and giving advice. Wouldn’t have picked any other high school.', 'School is very diverse, i learned about many different cultures and have met many different people from all over he world. the teachers are amazing, they help out with just about anything even if they aren’t your teacher. The staff in the school would sacrifice their time to help students.', 'The school is really diverse and provides a lot of extracurricular activities for the students. Most of the staff members are sweet and helpful. However, the school should focus on helping all the students improve academically instead of focusing all on the students who already excel at it. The school should also provide more rigorous courses and encourage students to focus on their education.', 'My teachers are very nice and caring for their students. They try their best to help those in need and make classes very interesting. Exceptional AP U.S. History class!The students in our school are very diverse because most of them are immigrants and speak another language besides English. It could be a good side for students who want to learn different cultures yet it is also disappointing sometimes because many of them like to stay in their culture zone. The food in our school is average, however, the breakfast in the cafeteria is not bad.', 'I like the policy of students getting to leave about 7 minutes earlier for each period than the actual time of the bell on Monday, and we sometimes had rapid dismissal. I like how the school is preparing us for college, and some of the teachers are convenient at teaching.', 'I liked that there are AP classes offered in FDR. Although there should be more awareness about it to let people strive for the classes', 'Franklin D. Roosevelt High School was an amazing time in my life. There are amazing teachers and faculty that truly care about your future, along with a diverse student body that can make you feel welcomed no matter what your background. I felt loved and excepted throughout my entire experience, and better yet, I felt very challenged. The teachers that they have there are truly remarkable; highly ranked professionals that would be making millions of dollars if they worked in the private sector, but for some reason chose to share their knowledge with a bunch of adolescents.', 'The school is pretty large, there have many students from different countries, and there also have very nice teachers.', 'Very bad kids and teachers do not care about the children behavior and leave them running around cursing and leaving the classroom without permission.', 'Students are usually lazy, do not want to do work, and do not care about their grades. Many teachers can not control their classes.', "I like being in FDR but my counselor  sometimes don't guide me right. And i would also like to see change in the type of students in a class they put all the esl students from same country in same classes which makes them speak their own language the whole time and not to focus on improving english.", "I liked the teachers at FDR high school because they're always there to encourage you to do better on whatever subjects it may be. They also have understandings of where you're from and the challenges of learning a new different language. i love the school mainly because it's very diverse.", "As an immigrant, I needed the type of school that would welcome me. FDR High School surely did with its own diversed environment. This school didn't let me remind myself that I am a new comer in this country. But I think they should add halal food catagory for lunch. And not all the AP classes are provided in FDR. It will be really kind if the school department can include those AP classes.", "This school was alright. When I it was time to choose high schools in middle school everyone was saying that FDR HS was bad. This school also had a bad reputation but somehow it's doing good now. Graduation rate are increasing and it's not like before. This school is alright, not bad.+ Very diverse community", 'The school is very good, but some of the teachers are biased on certain students. There are great teachers who help us and inspire us to do what we can now, for our future. The school is really nice and all the staff are really nice. Teachers contribute to festivals and clubs.', 'I transferred here as a sophomore and it was easy to blend in because I knew people. The teachers were cool, but serious when it came to learning. I graduated in 2016 and now that I look back, it was a great experience. Principal changed my senior year, but everyone knew each other and everyone participated in activities. It was fun.', 'Attending Franklin D. Roosevelt is something I always look for in the mornings that I wake up, with its huge diversity I easily get lost, and with the friendly teachers all I want to do is study and learn.']

column1: Union Square Academy for Health Sciences
column2: ['Union Square academy is the school divided between pharmacy and dental where students have the opportunity to decide what they want to study on .Pharmacy students get to learn how pharmacies works,  how to make prescriptions  and how to prepare  medications while Dentist students learn how to work at a dental office  offering students a view from both sides.  at the end of the academic year senior students take a certification exam which if the past will allow them to work at a dental office or as  A certified pharmacy technician in all states of United States.', 'The teachers are very helpful in this school. The dentistry and pharmacy program offers a unique education that any normal school could not have.', "My school is a young and small public high school in 14 st Union Square. It's a CTE school that offers student internship opportunity and pharmacy and dental technician certification test. My experience with this are pretty good overall aside from a sharing campus with other school. My school's college counselor spends tremendous amount of time in helping us with college and financial aid application.", "I've made and kept great friends and have learned a lot from teachers that actually care and want to see you succeed. Even though students there get out of hand fairly quickly, other aspects of the school are pretty good.", 'Although there are fights from time to time, this school provides me with multiple opportunities. First of all, this school is small which means hat the community is tight knit giving you the ability to build better relationships with teachers and other students. Take advantage of how lenient the grading policy is, the clubs, and the NHS and NTHS. I was in the pharmacy program and this gave us a chance to really get hands on with the field. This school also has a partnership with Cleary Gottlieb so I suggest you attend the mock trials and book club, so that you have it in your resume and hopefully try to get an internship there. In my four years there I’ve learned that you don’t need to follow the crowd and you shouldn’t because that’s where all the drama is.', 'My experience with Unuion Square Academy has been very good.The teachers are very dedicated to their students success. I feel like my son is safe while he is in school I like how involved the administration is', 'I like how the staff pushes us to do our best and they provide the resources that we need to be successful. I wish that we can get more clubs like Track and swimming and a room just for art.', 'Overall this school is a well driven school. If your looking for more of a serious vibe for high school this school is the one. The students are competitive and mind there business. There isn’t a lot of drama than the average amount. Everyone pretty much stays to themselves.', 'Some things that I liked about this school was there was many different personalities you would never run into the same faces. It was lots of diversity. Also I wish they would have more activities and sports available because this high school is in a shared building with 5 other high schools and they all shared the sport team so u wasnt competing against just your school for spot on the team. Overall i think this school was best choice for me it showed and helped me grow into the young adult I am today.', 'What I like about USA is that it is very diverse and we are able to embrace other cultures, religion,or race without prejudice. What I would like to see change is  the amount of resources we need to continue putting children in college.', "Teachers are amazing, the real stars are the teachers because they're so young and more polite and more engage with the students. The teachers in this school are really encouraging more engaged and overall doing a great job", "Student diversity, everyone is kind and accepting of who you are. Small school so you'll know everybody. Teachers are good, sure some are boring but that's every school. They all make sure you have a good understanding of the subject and do their best to help and understand", 'I am currently a Senior at this High school and the staff are really amazing. They help you a lot the teachers help you with your homework and we have a college counselor. He gives us a lot of support to be successful in college and in the future.', 'At first I didnt think I would like this school but meeting my new friends and nice teachers has made me actually look forward to going to school!', 'USAHS is an average school overall, but there has been numerous scandals involving teachers no student will ever be able to confirm to be true. A great deal of teachers quit each year, which makes it very hard for students to develop a relationship with their teacher in order to gain letters of recommendation their senior year. Many students also sell drugs, participate in sexual activities while on school grounds, and are involved in gang activity.', 'Union Square Academy of Health Sciences is a very rigorous school with a curriculum meant to challenge you and bring out your best work.', 'This school is very good school they teach you how to be independent and they have a 93% graduation rate', "Overall, I feel that my school in and of itself is fantastic! In addition to my own personal preserverance that my family instilled in me, the teachers push you to excell as long as you are determined and willing to learn and pushing yourself in the process. I would just like to see more rewards given to students like myself who earn the top and highest marks and GPA's. This way the hardest workers are complemented on their achievements and the other students become more driven to match up with their peers.", 'I transferred to this high school in my sophomore year, it was a life changing experience. I met new people and became close friend with many. I found my passion here which is becoming a dentist. Overall, this school lacks in certain things, I see USA expanding and becoming a better high school.', 'They have great safety, drills and protocols are done to help students prepare for anything that could happen']
