column2: ['My experience in Lyndhurst High School was pretty good. It has its mix of good and bad teachers, but that is something everyone has to go through.', 'The academics are good when it comes to AP classes and Honors courses. However, the administration should focus on the fine arts programs more then the athletics. There are a lot of things to get involved in during the day. You can grow to learn your passions and branch out to try new things.', 'it was the most amazing experience I have ever had. staff and everyone was so nice and respectful.Nice envirnmoent, fun clubs.', 'this school would be so amazing if only they put air conditioning in the rooms cause I don’t even feel like working when it gets to hot so I can’t even listen to my teachers because all I think about is getting it of my class an trying to cool down so if they put sum kind of air conditioning this school would be amazing great teachers. They help out students that are struggling an really want to pass their classes an put effort in. Great school', 'I really like my Italian teacher Mr. Raguseo he has taught me all I know about the language. The school needs to have some air condition installed because it gets very hot in the summer time. Sometimes we cannot even be in the classroom because it is too hot. Otherwise the school is not that bad.', 'The pep-rally’s is off the hook. Some teachers are good others not so much. Overall the changes I want to see is counselors talking to us more about our college reach out to us in private.', 'My experience at Lyndhurst High School has allowed me to grow into the woman I am. As a senior in high school, college is a major focus of mine, and I feel that all of my teachers have dedicated their time to helping me find my path. The teachers are understanding and comforting but remain rigorous to ensure we do not become lazy or slack. If I could change one thing about our school it would be an increase in diversity. I am a very open-minded person with a love for other cultures and learning about the lives of others. LHS has a predominately white population and I feel that with more diversity, the school would become even more influential and inviting for future generations.', 'I enjoyed my experience at Lyndhurst High School, but I wish more opportunities were offered to me.  I feel like the school did not help me enough with college deadlines, preparations, and support.  Our school offers a good amount of advanced classes which is nice, but they do not offer many clubs at all.  My teachers have always been very good no matter their resources, and I feel lmthag I’ve leaves a lot.', "Small district.  Schools are eliminating the important subjects and extra curricular activities kids need.  Rotation schedules and days are confusing and don't work with certain class needs and requirements.", "The school is alright as a whole.  The education level is decent, but the teachers don't really help struggling students.", "My name is Ashley Garcia and I have attended lyndhurst public schools my entire life. Since the start of High School I have changes so much because I have experienced many things in Lyndhurst. They have so many programs, clubs, organizations, and sports one can join. The high school has taught me to be very independent. The teachers, helpers, and coaches were amazing because they never gave up on a student and always encouraged them. They have changed my life dramatically and now I know I want a successful career and future. I wouldn't change anything about the High School.", 'Attending schools within the Lyndhurst district since I was in kindergarten, my experiences within this town have mainly been very positive. The academics are not exceptional, but very good. What is most potent about Lyndhurst High School is the spirit and pride that the students, teachers, and residents have. While there are some technicalities within the education system that the school still needs to address, I am glad to have received my education as well as many opportunities from Lyndhurst High School.', 'Lyndhurst High School is an average school in NJ.  I am an Alum of this school and have both a senior and a sophomore currently attending.  I feel Lyndhurst has a long way to go to provide an adequate education for college readiness.  The facilities need to be upgraded as well.  I hope in future years, they can bring the education level up several notches to be in competition with other good high schools in NJ.', "Lyndhurst High School is a really nice school in which the teachers value education and create great relationships between them and students. This is where I've met great people and learned that the teachers push us hard for our benefit. The classes can be challenging, but again, it is for our benefit. Lyndhurst High School has amazing extra curricular activities including sports and clubs. This way, everyone can be active. The only flaw is the uniform policy. It is  unnecessary because the students do not follow the policy and the faculty do not enforce it properly. Other than this small flaw, Lyndhurst High is a great school for making new relationships, working hard, and being involved in extracurricular activities.", 'I would like to see the school put air conditioning in all the classrooms. The teachers are very nice and helpful. They are always willing to provide you with extra help if needed.', 'I loved my years at LHS. The teachers were the best part. They were always helpful and really great at teaching us. I was in mostly honors and AP classes and thus felt really well-challenged with regard to school work and well-prepared for college.', 'My 4 years at Lyndhurst High School has been very rewarding for both academics  and sports. This senior year has been thus far my best year ever. For Football i rushed for over 1,000 yards and I am looking forward to spring for when the track season begins so I can break some records.', 'Lyndhurst High School and the Elementary Schools in this district have great teachers and staff that make sure each student feel safe and in aloving environment . Some of the staff members are also coaches for the recreational program in that town. I enjoyed all the years I went to school.', 'Lyndhurst High School has a lot of well qualified teachers and interesting classes available to students.', "The honors and AP teachers are great with their students and teaching the intended material. They assure students are prepared for what they will need. I have not been in many CP level classes but I feel like because the students aren't as interested in learning the teachers are not as good with those classes. They aren't as engaged as the teachers who teach at an honors or AP level. I do feel as if the majority of the teachers are approachable though. I struggle a little bit in math classes and I found that all of my math teachers were willing to work with me."]
column4: ['My experience in Lyndhurst High School was pretty good. It has its mix of good and bad teachers, but that is something everyone has to go through.', 'The academics are good when it comes to AP classes and Honors courses. However, the administration should focus on the fine arts programs more then the athletics. There are a lot of things to get involved in during the day. You can grow to learn your passions and branch out to try new things.', 'it was the most amazing experience I have ever had. staff and everyone was so nice and respectful.Nice envirnmoent, fun clubs.', 'this school would be so amazing if only they put air conditioning in the rooms cause I don’t even feel like working when it gets to hot so I can’t even listen to my teachers because all I think about is getting it of my class an trying to cool down so if they put sum kind of air conditioning this school would be amazing great teachers. They help out students that are struggling an really want to pass their classes an put effort in. Great school', 'I really like my Italian teacher Mr. Raguseo he has taught me all I know about the language. The school needs to have some air condition installed because it gets very hot in the summer time. Sometimes we cannot even be in the classroom because it is too hot. Otherwise the school is not that bad.', 'The pep-rally’s is off the hook. Some teachers are good others not so much. Overall the changes I want to see is counselors talking to us more about our college reach out to us in private.', 'My experience at Lyndhurst High School has allowed me to grow into the woman I am. As a senior in high school, college is a major focus of mine, and I feel that all of my teachers have dedicated their time to helping me find my path. The teachers are understanding and comforting but remain rigorous to ensure we do not become lazy or slack. If I could change one thing about our school it would be an increase in diversity. I am a very open-minded person with a love for other cultures and learning about the lives of others. LHS has a predominately white population and I feel that with more diversity, the school would become even more influential and inviting for future generations.', 'I enjoyed my experience at Lyndhurst High School, but I wish more opportunities were offered to me.  I feel like the school did not help me enough with college deadlines, preparations, and support.  Our school offers a good amount of advanced classes which is nice, but they do not offer many clubs at all.  My teachers have always been very good no matter their resources, and I feel lmthag I’ve leaves a lot.', "Small district.  Schools are eliminating the important subjects and extra curricular activities kids need.  Rotation schedules and days are confusing and don't work with certain class needs and requirements.", "The school is alright as a whole.  The education level is decent, but the teachers don't really help struggling students.", "My name is Ashley Garcia and I have attended lyndhurst public schools my entire life. Since the start of High School I have changes so much because I have experienced many things in Lyndhurst. They have so many programs, clubs, organizations, and sports one can join. The high school has taught me to be very independent. The teachers, helpers, and coaches were amazing because they never gave up on a student and always encouraged them. They have changed my life dramatically and now I know I want a successful career and future. I wouldn't change anything about the High School.", 'Attending schools within the Lyndhurst district since I was in kindergarten, my experiences within this town have mainly been very positive. Some of the staff members are also coaches for the recreational program in that town. I enjoyed all the years I went to school.', 'Lyndhurst High School has a lot of well qualified teachers and interesting classes available to students.', "The honors and AP teachers are great with their students and teaching the intended material. They assure students are prepared for what they will need. I have not been in many CP level classes but I feel like because the students aren't as interested in learning the teachers are not as good with those classes. They aren't as engaged as the teachers who teach at an honors or AP level. I do feel as if the majority of the teachers are approachable though. I struggle a little bit in math classes and I found that all of my math teachers were willing to work with me."]
column6: ['The teachers are kind and genuinely care for the kids. The lessons are engaging and the teachers have a good teaching style and effectively try to help the kids.', 'The school has a lot of diverse activities that the students can be involved in. There is something for everyone to do.', 'Since the school was small many students were friends with each other creating a fun experience', 'Teachers at this school were amazing and always ready to lend a helping hand when needed.', 'Throughout my four years at this school I have been able to meet great friends and learn life lessons that I shall treasure for the rest of my life.', 'Although some of the teachers at this school are very knowledgeable, their teaching methods fail to effectively engage their students, especially in regards to AP classes.', 'lyndhurst doesnt really have much and the clubs they have are a joke', 'it wasnt horrible but i certainly did not get the whole highschool experience', 'the teachers arent consistent wiht inputing grades into the system and they talk too much about their personal lives', "All teachers care for their students and are willing to stay for extra help and guidance. Although, many teachers are afraid of the kids. They don't discipline them and instead run to the principal. Classrooms are not strict enough and kids have no respect for the teachers because they let them walk all over them.", 'Police have an office in the building. They are always walking in and out.', "I am a member of many clubs. It's easy to make friends because everyone already knows each other. Students do not judge each other for the activities they participate in. We support each other.", 'There are no aspects I would change, this was my own personal memorable high school experience.', 'Overall, the teachers here are great, open and share personal experiences with their students. A few are not so approachable.', 'The health and safety of this school is pretty good. Any problems that pertain to student safety is taken cared of', "Most extracurricular activities are well put together every there aren't many to chose from", 'This school has very limited resources specifically when wanting to join clubs and supplies for many classrooms. The science department needs to be updates.', 'The only problem is teachers applying real world situations to the subject at hand', 'I have never had a time where i felt unsafe in the school', 'There are many choices, you never feel like there are clubs or activities']

column2: ["This was a great school that offered many connections. I just believed that they showed a lot of favoritism and it mainly depended on if you were the best of the best in arts. I was sadly in the middle so I didn't receive as many opportunities as many other students received. Also, there were many other things that the school left out when it came to college.", 'The school offers many opportunities for those who are interested in design fields. The give offers to art clubs, events and internships to set you up for college and your career in the arts field.', "The friends I've made here have been amazing, the atmosphere is great, and the teachers really care about us.", 'Art and Design High School is an amazing art school where all students are different, and unique in their own way. Everybody has their unique style of art that makes our school so diverse in ideas. Our school has 8 different art art majors, challanging courses like AP classes, clubs, teams, etc. Everybody is so welcoming here that it makes me feel like at home.', 'id like to see more organized events that each student can have an opportunity in having fun. also more communication between staff', 'Art and Design High School is one of the most diverse communities and teachers are always willing to help students achieve their best. Majors allow students to prepare for art careers with internships and college level training.', 'MY experience at Art and Design High School has been incredibly enriching both academically and artistically.', 'I’m in the fashion major and they offer trips to see other fashion work. For me only one period is not enough for me to finish doing what I want. The period always end too quickly. They also have CTE programs but I would like them to change the limits to 10th grade. They promised us that when you got to 10th grade they said you have to be the 11th grade to join. I even got my working paper ready but the schools told me I have to be the 11th grade. But the teachers for me teach very easy and fast. I’m able to get the most out of my class. Also the teachers are always there so you can earn more points. I have a better experience in high school than middle school. In an art high school you’re always practicing your skills as an artist. It’s not that as art student we have bad grades. The truth is that we get a lot of work in major so it takes up our time to do homework. But for me I don’t have difficulty completing homework.', 'It has very varied art majors and programs and allows students to present their works in galleries and compete in state-wide competitions.', 'Everything about Art and Design is great, there were some stuff that needed to be change as the lockers, bathrooms, but everything after that as the teachers, the students, the staff members they were all great. You can always count and see Art and Design as a home place.', 'Its an okay school and an okay enviroment. Has everything you need if you are looking for drama, study and everything in a school. Its also has a good area to wander and explore.Great school for studying arts. Lots of stairs as well.', 'Great high school for learning and understanding industry standard for students that really want to pursue a career in the arts. The school holds academics to a high standard while still supporting the creative bone in every student.  A perfect balance.', 'When you enter the school you are placed into Design Foundation (alongside academic classes) which gives projects that helps you the student decide where you want to be for the next 3 years. Personally my favorite major is cartooning because it is all imagination based. You will see this is either cartooning classroom. Best tip is enjoy yourself and go with whatever major you feel best with.', 'I love the diversity and the different artistic style of each student. This school offers many art majors such as Illustration and Graphic Design.', 'I had a great experience at Art and Design HS.. I was given the instruction and direction to pursue my interest in Fashion Design.  I will be attending Parsons’s School of Design this fall , and credit my teachers.', 'I used to love going to school but Art and Design has a way of draining you. The teachers and support system you have in this school are absolutely amazing, as well as the art program for different majors. The students at this school however are too rowdy and immature, and in dire need of common sense. The work load can be a bit draining (depending on your classes) and some methods the teachers use for required classes and inconvenient. Other than that Art and Design is a true learning experience, I grew up a lot here.', "I'm grateful that we took the PS exam and get paid internships. DO NOT come here with any expectations for above average academics. There are a few caring, knowledgeable teachers but it's not a guarantee, and even they sometimes seem to suffer working with cryptic communication and rigid, predetermined lessons. Usually it's just work to keep our hands occupied and their duty seems to be to keep the class quiet. Real harmful behavior with students AND faculty is buried in paperwork or flat out ignored. Students get suspended & punished for small things. The bathrooms (and lockers) are gender separated but the 2 bathrooms in the nurse's office double as gender neutral bathrooms. Some teachers and administrators try to enforce the racist + sexist dress code, eg. demand people remove durags, and cover bra straps. There are no metal detectors. There are school cops. There are 11 floors in this school and you might have to walk 5 flights in a row. There are elevators but you need a pass.", "Your time at A&D will be short once you look back on it. The school is absolutely amazing at providing students with resources and material, if only the students took advantage of the opportunities. In general, the school's academics are alright.  However, there are some excellent teachers at the school, that go beyond just teaching in the classroom. All the art teachers are brilliant, and will teach you much about your major. Many of them either work in the field, taught the course at a college level, or both. I would say the clubs are limited, and the sports isn't a big aspect. There are both good and bad kids in this school, like any other. It's become a bit more diverse in recent years, and have been preparing kids for college better. Really, the only downside is how the administration deals with the bathroom situation in the school.", "It's a very great school if you want to pursue art as a career, and has a lot of job opportunities and connections. The staff can use some work, though.", 'The way the school works is very beneficial o the students attending and helps students stay on track/keep them on track. The school is always making sure that every student has many opportunities to graduate. This school is a school that always tries to make learning fun for the students.']

column6: ['School offers many opportunities to gain industry experience. Mainly focuses on art and not so much academics. Very diverse.', 'Attending Art & Design is not like most high schools, even for NYC. It is certainly memorable. Most academic teachers are okay, with some mediocre ones and some exceptional ones too. The art teachers are for the most part great, and depending on your major will really help you become a better artist since they all are required to have worked in industry. This is not the case the the school administration—who are a joke. The admins do not have any art background, resulting a rift between them and students. Also, the facilities such as bathrooms and locker rooms are filthy due to neglect by students and janitorial staff.', "The school is is very clean and the staff is always willing to help when needed.  The teachers are pleasant and communicate via text or in person by appointment.  The principal has an open door policy.  When you walk into the school there's an art gallery to greet you.   The school is surrounded by students beautiful work of art.  The students are always happy and feel safe.", 'very interesting school for people with art majors. it is the right place to go to and study art and design.', "I love this school. I've truly came out of my shell thanks to this school. Everyone is so different and yet so accepting. Especially the faculty. I truly had a great experience in Art and Design.", 'Art and Design is a wonderful, quirky, and loving school. The teachers have all had experience and they are as funny as the students. This school is very accepting and open to all types of people no matter race, gender, or sexuality, and it offers excellent opportunities for people to go to conventions and sell their art such as mocca fest and comic con. Though the principal can be strict on implementing DOK and accountable talk as well as people who can teach in this type of manner, most teachers are good at what they do and help you get the resources you need in order to be successful.', 'the school is a great school, although core classes such as english maths and sciences are not much more focused than the art classes.', 'Art & Design isn\'t exactly known for consistency. There\'s a clear lack of communication between staff and it shows through our academic classes. Some teachers here (mostly the art teachers) are really amazing and genuinely love their job, but most of the academic teachers seem lost most of the time. I have a particular teacher for "Creative Writing" who didn\'t know she was teaching a creative writing elective until the second week of school. Even though our art teachers are great, unlike the website claimed when I applied your major doesn\'t seem to help you build your college portfolio at all.  If you\'ve been in disorganized high schools and don\'t mind them, go right ahead. However, know you\'re not getting anything exceptional outside of some resources from the art program. The counselors (especially for seniors) aren\'t really helpful with communicating with students or getting them to their goal credits for their ideal college. So, pick your poison really.', 'Excellent resources for those interested in various forms of the arts. Lots of AP classes to. Wish they had more to select from. Inspirational settings since it is located in a new building. Located in the heart of New York City Design Center. Some teachers go above and beyond to make the learning experience exceptional.  Wish they had more sports teams to join. Awesome internship positions available due to the various connections the school has.', 'Attending this school help me navigate what I want to do for my future. I came into the school wanting to pursue photography, while still having an interest for fashion. However a teacher from the fashion department saw something in me that I didn’t see within myself and it lead me to pursing fashion on a high level.', "We were given a head start in the world of careers within tech and/or design. The environment was entirely  inclusive and diverse which allowed exposure to all sorts of people and cultures, this has benefited me socially now that I'm older.", 'A&D has good programs for the arts. I just wish that we could integrate projects between majors more.', 'This school offers a unique combination of the arts, academics and real world experience. Students have opportunities to engage in a variety of fields when choosing an art major to pursue for three years. Such fields include, but are not limited to, fashion, graphic design, architecture and/or film. Through internships, competitions, and use of guest speakers, Art and Design enables its students to forge a connection between their work and its application to the real world. Recently, our school has strengthened its emphasis on academics by implementing a more accessible AP classes program. This gives students an easier opportunity to challenge themselves and gain a higher education. However, this school would not receive a perfect rating from me as it tends to be disorganized at times which makes things difficult for students and staff.', 'This school has provided me with 4 years worth of experience, friendship and excellence. I learned so much about the art industry, and that it is easy if you love what you do. I learned to not sell myself short and to be nice to everyone I meet, as well as learning the necessary skills to make me a competitive worker in the field when I go off on my own in the real world.', 'People there are nice, friendly and accepting. Most of the staff is very helpful but others are not. The school is disorganized but also confusing at the same time.', 'Calvin Klein graduated here and inspires many others. This school allows you to choose a major and expand your knowledge and options for that major. While art and design is an arts school they also take pride in their educational courses. They have language programs as well as AP classes. Art and design makes sure students know the value of the arts and learn about how art can be not only used as beauty but as a movement. Students will learn everything a regular high school can give you along with extra class AND teach students art and its value.', "Art and Design is one of the best art schools in NYC. The school doesn't discriminate against any kids. The school has a friendly atmosphere.", 'When I started in this school in 2014 it was really good and fun. Now I cannot wait to leave. The teachers are cool but the administration is trash. The only good thing about this school is the Art and creativity and diversity.', "I like my school because all people are very kind, respectful. It's a great atmosphere and I really do not regret being in that school, on the contrary I feel lucky.", 'Art and Design high school has a wide variety of majors which is one of the best features of this school. All of these majors are related to art in some way such as Photography, Illustration, Animation, and so on.']

The students are always happy and feel safe.", 'very interesting school for people with art majors. it is the right place to go to and study art and design.', "I love this school. I've truly came out of my shell thanks to this school. Everyone is so different and yet so accepting. Especially the faculty. I truly had a great experience in Art and Design.", 'Art and Design is a wonderful, quirky, and loving school. The teachers have all had experience and they are as funny as the students. This school is very accepting and open to all types of people no matter race, gender, or sexuality, and it offers excellent opportunities for people to go to conventions and sell their art such as mocca fest and comic con. Though the principal can be strict on implementing DOK and accountable talk as well as people who can teach in this type of manner, most teachers are good at what they do and help you get the resources you need in order to be successful.', 'the school is a great school, although core classes such as english maths and sciences are not much more focused than the art classes.', 'Art & Design isn\'t exactly known for consistency. There\'s a clear lack of communication between staff and it shows through our academic classes. Some teachers here (mostly the art teachers) are really amazing and genuinely love their job, but most of the academic teachers seem lost most of the time. I have a particular teacher for "Creative Writing" who didn\'t know she was teaching a creative writing elective until the second week of school. Even though our art teachers are great, unlike the website claimed when I applied your major doesn\'t seem to help you build your college portfolio at all.  If you\'ve been in disorganized high schools and don\'t mind them, go right ahead. However, know you\'re not getting anything exceptional outside of some resources from the art program. The counselors (especially for seniors) aren\'t really helpful with communicating with students or getting them to their goal credits for their ideal college. So, pick your poison really.', 'Excellent resources for those interested in various forms of the arts. Lots of AP classes to. Wish they had more to select from. Inspirational settings since it is located in a new building. Located in the heart of New York City Design Center. Some teachers go above and beyond to make the learning experience exceptional.  Wish they had more sports teams to join. Awesome internship positions available due to the various connections the school has.', 'Attending this school help me navigate what I want to do for my future. I came into the school wanting to pursue photography, while still having an interest for fashion. However a teacher from the fashion department saw something in me that I didn’t see within myself and it lead me to pursing fashion on a high level.', "We were given a head start in the world of careers within tech and/or design. The environment was entirely  inclusive and diverse which allowed exposure to all sorts of people and cultures, this has benefited me socially now that I'm older.", 'A&D has good programs for the arts. I just wish that we could integrate projects between majors more.', 'This school offers a unique combination of the arts, academics and real world experience. Students have opportunities to engage in a variety of fields when choosing an art major to pursue for three years. Such fields include, but are not limited to, fashion, graphic design, architecture and/or film. Through internships, competitions, and use of guest speakers, Art and Design enables its students to forge a connection between their work and its application to the real world. Recently, our school has strengthened its emphasis on academics by implementing a more accessible AP classes program. This gives students an easier opportunity to challenge themselves and gain a higher education. However, this school would not receive a perfect rating from me as it tends to be disorganized at times which makes things difficult for students and staff.', 'This school has provided me with 4 years worth of experience, friendship and excellence. I learned so much about the art industry, and that it is easy if you love what you do. I learned to not sell myself short and to be nice to everyone I meet, as well as learning the necessary skills to make me a competitive worker in the field when I go off on my own in the real world.', 'People there are nice, friendly and accepting. Most of the staff is very helpful but others are not. The school is disorganized but also confusing at the same time.', 'Calvin Klein graduated here and inspires many others. This school allows you to choose a major and expand your knowledge and options for that major. While art and design is an arts school they also take pride in their educational courses. They have language programs as well as AP classes. Art and design makes sure students know the value of the arts and learn about how art can be not only used as beauty but as a movement. Students will learn everything a regular high school can give you along with extra class AND teach students art and its value.', "Art and Design is one of the best art schools in NYC. The school doesn't discriminate against any kids. The school has a friendly atmosphere.", 'When I started in this school in 2014 it was really good and fun. Now I cannot wait to leave. The teachers are cool but the administration is trash. The only good thing about this school is the Art and creativity and diversity.', "I like my school because all people are very kind, respectful. It's a great atmosphere and I really do not regret being in that school, on the contrary I feel lucky.", 'Art and Design high school has a wide variety of majors which is one of the best features of this school. All of these majors are related to art in some way such as Photography, Illustration, Animation, and so on.']

column2: ['Achievement First Endeavor was a good school, I gt a great education, but also i learned more about real world interactions like having self-control and the appropriate way to react to certain situations. I learned these skills in Endeavor and I am glad that I was taught this in middle school because knowing the appropriate way to react is really important.', 'My favorite experience was the talent shows.', 'The teachers take their time teaching the students.']

column1: New Visions Charter High School for Advanced Math and Science 2
column2: ["New Visions Charter High School for Advanced Math and Science 2, has got to be the best 4 years of my life. I came to this country when I was 7 and from elementary school to middle school, I didn't fit in and wasn't really accepted by my community. AMS2 was a different and amazing experience from that for me. The moment school started, I found myself surrounded by people with like minds. It doesn't matter where you're from, your culture would be celebrated. The staff go out of their way to make sure this is happening. The students bring in different ideas to celebrate their individuality and the administration's support it. From the annually talent show, to hispanic heritage show, to african heritage show, community, diversity, and individuality is celebrated.", "Great school . I recommend going here because they'll make you feel like you're apart of something. A lot of activities to keep you focused. everything ties into preparing yourself for later in years.", 'In new visions the staffs provide students with support  and help when needed .There was never a moment when I can’t say that that my teachers didn’t help me.Senior year hit me hard because I got sick and started missing a lot a work and I was the point of failing not knowing if I was gonna make it across that stage on June 28  but all my supported staff had a meeting with me and  arrange a way for me to catch up in order to pass and graduate .Im proud to that I actually did it thanks to them', 'Being that this is my forth year at New Visions Charter High school for Advanced Math & Science ll ,I could honestly say that my experience here was very good . The teachers are really helpful . The academics is challenging , but still interesting at the same time . What I love the most about my school is the support system that we have.  Teachers try their best to make your day brighter. I also enjoy the college readiness in this school. One thing I was probably change about the school would be more diversity and the food that is being served.', 'Being a senior at AMS 2 has opened doors for me that no other school. The amount of clubs and support in the school is excellent.  They strive for success no matter how rude or nice you are to them. One of the best schools i attended.', 'The school is kept very clean but the main issues are staffing most of the staff leave within 2 years of being in the school. Also, they failed to keep an 11th-grade Chemistry teacher last year.', 'There isn’t a lot of sports, it’s not as diverse. There is a lot of good school wise subjects, there is a lot of teachers who rarely cares about students, they just care about the school’s looks. There isn’t a lot of good and fun after school programs that students wants to attend to. Guidance counselors help with students to get into good programs sometimes even jobs. The bathroom for the students sometimes are clean. The school should get smaller classrooms with lesser students in it. We should be able to leave earlier, have more subjects that students would want as an elective in the school. The school should be more diverse. They’re entry should be more later because there might be less latenesses.', 'When I was a Freshman In AMS2 I thought that high school was going to be a bad place that I did not want to be but my mom told me that she wanted me to be in a different place and I said that like I was not okay with the fact that I was leaving all of my other friends, but then I found some new friends and we are still friends till this year and I like that because I have different people to talk to too', 'As a junior I can tell you many things about this school. At this school we are a family and we, staff and student, help each other out. The help you get from the staff for preparing for college is great.', 'As a sophomore, it is really good. Fun activities, the students and teachers try really hard, to prepare the students for college, and certain careers, they want to go to. Many different clubs to go to and great teacher ratio.', 'When I attended New Visions Charter High School it was a new school. I was part of the first graduating class and I must say the opportunities and resources offered were not common in other schools. We were given college prep classes, financial aid workshops, help with college essays and applying to schools starting junior year, college now classes, affiliations with programs such as Upward Bound, and much more. The teachers were extremely dedicated to the success of each student offering their time during their lunch breaks and after school to help those that needed it. They pushed for each to student to do the best they could in class and on regents exams.', 'New Visions Advanced Math and Science 2 is a great school. The teachers are always on your back to make sure you are doing what you need to do. The staff makes sure all seniors are college ready and there is even a class for it.', 'It a really good school, I recommend everyone should apply. Especially the clubs that we have in our school, including soccer, games and student government.', 'I love the fact that every staff member, whether is the dean or teacher everyone works together for every students success and advancement. All of the staff wants the best for us. The teachers are really understanding and always available when a students needs extra help, they make sure we have other opportunities to boost our grades', "So I'm a senior at AMS II and throughout these four years it's been great. They've helped me grow in a plethora of aspect in my life. The teachers are great and they know what they're doing, and to me that is essential to the learning of the student. One thing I would like to see change in the school is the amount of parent involvement we have as a whole. That part is slightly week, and we should pick it up.", "In this school, there is teachers that really care about the students. There are some teachers who also is disrespectful. The new principle is always yelling at kids if they are caught in the halways. The school is in front of the projects. One day, going to school, there was man covered in blood and walking down the street with a big cut on his face. The school is also next door to an all men's shelter. Everyday, students have to walk past that. Other than that, the school prepares the students for work and college and they make sure we are ready to leave with a little knowledge of the outside world.", 'New Visions is a good school because it teaches us students that no matter where you come from you can be somebody.', 'I liked that there was a lot of diversity in the student body. I would change the school hours and how strict the rules are.', "I really like how niche gives students opportunities to apply for scholarships. these scholarships aren't complicated in any way. it gives students a chance to actually win scholarships to help us with our college tuition. ", 'There an actual doctors office in the building which is very helpful in an emergency. safety could be better but its okay']

column2: ['I was about to start my freshman here. Tell you what, I’ve been here for the middle school as well. And I love it. I’ve met many friends and the teachers took care of you if you have any questions on you. I haven’t know what high school feels like but I can’t wait to finish my high school year and move on to college. Though I love east west cuz I’m going to stay for a total of 7 years in this small school. All my memories are here.', 'In terms of academics and college readiness, this school excels and offers many opportunities to learn and grow. There are lots of clubs and the school is small but that means the community is more united. Some aspects like sports seem a little underdeveloped, but I don’t play them so I can’t judge too harshly. My only gripes are that in some cases classmates are extremely disruptive and some teachers have trouble controlling them or just won’t, and like many schools in NY there does seem to be Liberal bias. But overall, this school does what it needs to provide a good and fulfilling education.', "I have been at East West School of International Studies since middle school because it is a middle and high school. Considering there is a lack of school spirit and sports games the school itself is average. In addition, the school's academics is the main focus but there is no student activities that get people involved in the school itself.", 'the people are nice there! when I first come to east-west, I was not familiar with English so I refuse to communicate. the teacher gives me personal help, and encourage me a lot. the peers are willing to answer any question from you, too.', 'East West is a small school that consists of students from grades 6-12 and is shared with another middle school. This school prioritizes safety and makes sure that students are safe. The majority of people that go here are Asian, but it is pretty diverse. East West prepares students for college through the AP courses and SAT prep classes that are offered. Overall, the teachers are very knowledgeable and make sure that students get the help they need in class.', 'Compared to my first high school, East-West is unique in its extremely small school population, with about 100 students per grade. While some may argue a low population is bad, I believe it helps students build stronger bonds. In addition, the teachers are quite friendly and offer a variety of extra help such as tutoring. However, I would like to see more AP classes offered at the school and more sports teams. Overall, East-West is a friendly and safe environment that emphasizes academic success.', 'I’m a new 9th grader and overall the school is alright. Here are a few things to note if you’re thinking about enrolling:• The lunch food is BAD. REALLY BAD.• If you get Judo, ask to change the course. Unless you’ve already done it in some capacity, the material is pretty advanced, and several students (including myself) who are inexperienced have gotten injured several times. • Quite a few of the 9th graders who went there for middle school operate in cliques and are straight up unfriendly people who look down upon the new freshmen. Most are very nice, though • PupilPath will either be your best friend or worst enemy. I’ve done all of my global assignments and have gotten high scores on assignments and quizzes but I have a 65. I don’t know if it’s an error but this is just so you know.• Clubs can be competitive to join. For example, we had to audition for Kpop club.', 'The school is small so it helped me realize that i dont like small schools. The fact that the school was small hindered me from triving socially, thus making my experience moderate. my experience got better since the people i know there are generally nice and welcoming. However, academically, the school is extremely good!', 'I feel like ever since I came into East-West my grades has just been going up and never is coming down. East-West is always prepared for everyone to go to the college they all dreamed of. Our college counselor will go far and beyond for us seniors to graduate and go to college. No one is ever left out here.', 'What I like about east- west is that the school give a lot of opportunity. Open many after school program for students to improve there grade. Study three Asian country. Respect all religious holiday and also celebrate that holiday.', 'As a graduation senior of this school, I generally enjoyed my four years at this High school because it was a fun filled, riveting adventure that I got to spend with friends and teachers and truly find myself. I personally changed over the years I stayed at East-West and I feel as though why I enjoy this school quite a lot. I like the idea of helping and seeing other grow which is why I commonly suggest people come here. Only things that I would like to see improved is the cafeteria food because... eww and also I would love to see more school activities.', 'East-West School of international Studies is a school that offers challenging courses and prepares its students for college. The school prioritizes safety and academics. This school treats all students fairly and the teachers are engaged with their students. There is a wide range of clubs but something that can be improved is the variety and amount of advanced placement classes offered.', "I like how our school's teachers are really friendly and are close to students. We have student body volunteered to help other students in need such as student run tutor sections.", 'What I liked about East West is the energy that teachers gives the students each day. No matter whether the weather and the day of the week, the teachers are always open for you.', "Throughout my experiences at East-West I could say that it's not a good or bad school. However, there are many things that you should know before sending your child to this school. East-West is a small school mixed with a number of middle school and high school students. They offer a variety of programs related to Japanese, Korean, or Chinese culture. With all the academic programs being offered at this school, classrooms are full of students who do not participate in class hindering them from learning the lessons. In terms of community, students typically divide themselves by sitting at tables where their friends sit in and talk about their own interests. Those who sit alone in their own tables are ignored by others whom are busy with talking to their friends. Overall, this school is great for those who prefer to have their child learn about a variety of cultures while possibly be able to make friends who share common interests.", "East West is a small 2-floor school with a lot of people you get to know well, since it's a small school you're able to interact with the teachers in a regular basis. School with many events, passionate about the asian culture, making sure every student in this school leaves with its most best grades ever.", 'you can ask for extra help from the teachers and can also sign up for extracurricular activities. guidance is very helpful and helps students through tough times through your high school life', 'East West is a small school so it is very easy to make friends. You know everyone and everyone know you. The teachers are very supportive and are always willing to help each students. We have a variety of programs and clubs so there is never nothing to do.', 'im a student at east west and i dont reccomend this school at all. there are barely any clubs after school activities. the teachers are ALSO disrespectful. some teachers generally cant teach. students are students, bullying DOES exist. the food is same like any other public school. students are exposed to dangerous activities like gangs around the area, many fights occur and of course drugs. not to mention there was ALMOST a school shooting. there is uniform which basically all of my friends dont like, sadly i didnt know until after, i did not do full research. the locker situation is unfair, not everyone gets one. there are like around 70 to 100 students each grade which isnt good, teens should be able to be around more people. they only teach asian languages which shows it isnt international.', 'Fun and very open minded, little to no known violence within the campus. The only school in Flushing that teaches Japanese, Korean and Chinese all in one school. Be ready to walk insane amounts of stairs each day. Teachers are very kind hearted.']

We have a variety of programs and clubs so there is never nothing to do.', 'im a student at east west and i dont reccomend this school at all. there are barely any clubs after school activities. the teachers are ALSO disrespectful. some teachers generally cant teach. students are students, bullying DOES exist. the food is same like any other public school. students are exposed to dangerous activities like gangs around the area, many fights occur and of course drugs. not to mention there was ALMOST a school shooting. there is uniform which basically all of my friends dont like, sadly i didnt know until after, i did not do full research. the locker situation is unfair, not everyone gets one. there are like around 70 to 100 students each grade which isnt good, teens should be able to be around more people. they only teach asian languages which shows it isnt international.', 'Fun and very open minded, little to no known violence within the campus. The only school in Flushing that teaches Japanese, Korean and Chinese all in one school. Be ready to walk insane amounts of stairs each day. Teachers are very kind hearted.']
column6: ['East-West in a small community with a lot of people coming from different backgrounds with a strong focus on East-Asian Studies with the main foreign languages being Chinese, Japanese and Korean. The offer students in high school the opportunity to travel abroad and visit the 3 countries. A wonderful school with great staff and friendly teachers.', "East West School Of International Studies is very diverse. Despite being in an asian neighborhood, the school has accepted students from different races. The school is also very safe. Their top priority is the student's safety. There is a student-teacher bond that is unbelievable. The staff is always there for the students and makes sure they enjoy their time at East West.", 'East-West is a small school so you will be able to have some sort of bond with your teachers. It is based on the fourth floor of Rachel Carson though so it is cramp.', 'East West is a small school with great staff members. The teachers will be able to connect with you at a large scale and there are many different activities that East West provides. The sports program is developing as there is a girls volleyball team and a basketball team playing in division tournaments.', 'It was okay. When it comes to diversity, it was mostly Asians but you won’t expect much since flushing is pretty much the 2nd China town. Academic? Some teacher are good some are average. You’ll see. Sports? Compared to other HS, not really. But there is a basketball team. It’s on top of a middle school so you won’t expect much and won’t really experience the high school life.', 'I like that it was a small school. Everyone got to know each other. It was easy to talk to one another and reach help for help.', 'I like how the school is small, so the faculty members know all of our faces. However, I would also like the building to be a little bigger.', 'The students here are supportive. It is easy to make friends and get social support. Teachers are excellent. They are amazing at teaching and for what they do. We have an amazing college counselor. Consider entering. There are events that encourage all grades to work together or compete. There are various clubs and some clubs are based on China, Japan and Korea. These are also the foreign languages taught in this school. It is a combination of middle and high school kids, so students are interactive. This is a diverse school and community.', 'Used to be a good school with the original principal. The new principal has ruined the school environment and students are less motivated with the harsh new policies he has implemented. Note that this principal has formerly lead another high school that was shut down because of him.', "Throughout my full 4 years at East West, I have experienced a lot of things that were different.  East West has a lot of extracurricular activities and also community involvement that other public schools in NYC don't have. Some such as Color Wars was an awesome event that led more competition and students were able to come along and get along with eachother.", 'East-west is a very great school and their language classes are the best. The variety of clubs they have is great.', 'I liked the school environment and the close relationship between faculty and students. All the students and teachers were all connected and the teachers cared really much about you. The teachers there try their best in order to help you succeed and prepare you for college. They understand when you are struggling and willing to give up their time to help you and help you understand the topics.', 'Honestly, the school was pretty okay the first two years I was there but as the teachers are leaving and the staffing is changing slowly everything has changed for the worse.', 'The reacher sat EWSIS are terrific and caring. They support the students but push when necessary. The guidance and college counseling is first rate.', "A lot is already changing about this school. From uniforms, to altering grading policies, to different school activities. It's a bit much sometimes to deal with all the changes, but it is to better the future generations that come in.", "I think East-west overall is a really great and welcoming school. I guarantee that you'll find at least one teacher or staff member that you'll become close with and keep in touch with after East-West. Also, joining clubs and other activities really makes the East-West experience more enjoyable, and you'll have the potential to win a scholarships if you are really involved in clubs and academics.", 'I like everything about this school.Diversity of the school. School culture is amazing. Academically every student is improving. Teachers are very helpful.', "If you enjoy small schools which gives students false perceptions of what high school is like this school is centainly for you! The staff is always looking out for the students like they're children and are always willing to hold your hand in any situation like a mother would do for their infant. This school is beyond great for people who enjoy a day care like setting, with students ranging from 10 years of age to 19 years of age. This school offers an extremely small student to teacher ratio and with one floor to hold all those students on east west really does give you that truly warm cozy motherly  day care feel. So if your child or anyone you know can appreciate what east west has to offer by all means this is definitely the school for you!!", "East West School of International Studies is one of the greatest public school on NYC. Teachers and students are very respectable to the cultures of each other. This international school also has collaborations with one high school on shanghai, Chine and one high school in Nagoya, Japan. That is why our school has a lot of culture clubs to spread own culture more to everyone.  Since this school is a small school, the relationship between teachers and students are close! Also, the student government are always working to improve this school and students' school lives!", "I've been in east west for 7 years and have grown to love it here. It has prepared me to be the person I am today and go into the world with confidence. They build you on the idea of having a timeless community that will never fail you, they build you on setting goals and aspirations, they build you on trusting those near you, and most importantly they build on you making the best version of you. East west is a unique community with muster that brings us all together to the different clubs that cater to every individual. I'm proud to become an alumni to a school whose faculty members and student body makes me proud of staying here. When applying for high school I didn't think I would stay but I'm so happy I did and if there was an east west college I would proud stay for that aswell."]

column2: ["Stamford High is an average school. The variation of classes is very fair. They offer IB, ECE, AP, honors, and CP. there are about 2000 people who go there. There are many murals all around school. It takes a while to understand the floor and hall system, but once you get it down, it's easier to navigate. Stamford High is very diverse which is a great positive.", 'what I liked about stamford high is that the teachers were eager to teach and I always learned something new. Some things that can change is the preparedness for college and providing us with resources to help with the college process.', 'This is a large school.  Students come from all walks of life and the diversity is great.  There are some wonderful teachers who care about kids, but many seem to just be trying to get through the day, not really bothering to teach - too many worksheets and subs who let everyone play on their phones.', 'there many students from different cultures and countries. Some teachers would really push their students to reach success. You make friendships that can last a long time.', "You get what you put in. If you work hard and challenge yourself with tough classes and other activities you will do well. If you decide to coast through classes and not work hard you won't succeed. If you do work hard you will thrive and get into good colleges.", 'My time at shs was good. Overall i had good teachers and administrators. The school’s athletics could use some better coaching and financial support. There are also some safety issues with fights at games which deterred people from going.', 'Stamford High School is a good high school to go get your education. It has a lot of programs that help you get ready for college such as IB and Upward Bound. It also help kids to find jobs, scholarships and driving schools. The teachers and staffs are very helpful and kind.', 'It’s a great school, the teachers actually care about the success of the kids. Well most of them do.', 'Personally so far I’ve enjoyed my time at SHS... I think the teachers a great and really do care about us as long as we care about our education. The best thing you can do there or any school is take advantage of the resources like AVID and SAT classes we provide. Join clubs, be active, do what you love, and have school spirit.', 'I have had a splendid time at stamford high school. i have been attending the school ever since I was a freshman and I really enjoy it. Teachers are all great at stamford high and i love it a lot. The language department is not the greatest but it makes up for it with other great teachers and other great academics. I loved my time there. For a public school, it is very good and i recommend going there very much.', 'One thing I really loved about Stamford High School was they allowed dual credit classes. This was really helpful because it allowed not only me but many other students get ahead in college and also prepared.', "Stamford high school is five star for the range of classes and devoted Teachers. There are many Opportunities for clubs and ways to be involved. The students are diverse and come from several middle schools  which allows for new friendships. The classes are challenging and the goal includes preparing students for after high school and what's next for us.", 'Stamford High School is a good school, however, a lot of teachers presented some signs of disinterest, which may affect the students’ learning.', 'Over the last four years, I have has great teachers and staff that have helped guide me to be ready for college. They have taught me life long lessons, such as how to make connections with people, use my resources and communicating. One thing that I would fix is the way that the classrooms are set up, I wish they were move of a "comfortable" environment so it would be an easier place for students to learn.', 'My school is very focused on sports so if you didn’t play one the guidance wasn’t really interested in helping you and the teacher wasn’t for teaching more for getting the day over with. One teacher was very  bias she would pick me out infront of the class and say things as New York children never know how to act etc and   It’s really hard to learn there because come from New York I was learning basically on the higher level than most kids so when I first came being the only freshman or senior classes it really took a toll on me and especially for science my first year  in New York it was taking something called living environment and when I came CT they didn’t have a living room a class or course so I had to switch my whole new science course in the middle of the year', "Stamford high is probably the best high school in Stamford. Maybe not the best high school in general but we have spirit and not only that but we have a good athletic program. Our academics are average, because I wont lie our teachers aren't the best. Student life at Shs is alright because we get a lot of freedom but it also effects our attendance. If you're moving to Stamford I recommend this school for your teens.", 'Stamford High School is a huge high school.  There are great teachers as well as bad teachers.  There are great students as well as terrible students.  Overall, it is about the student, not the school.  If you want to excel, you can.  If you want to fail, you can.  It is all about you...', 'Stamford high offers their students many opportunities to get to experience what high school can offer you. There are so many clubs you can join and sports you can participate in. Teachers are willing to help you to succeed.', 'Stamford high provides a variety of clubs and sports you can join throughout the year. In addition Stamford high provides a lot of college readiness classes/programs such as Avid Which has helped me throughout my college process and understanding what is the best fit for me.  As well as our school has many E.C.E classes to earn college credit.', 'I have met wonderful teachers ,students , and guidance counselors. The Stamford High environment has truly been one an individual has to experience for themselves. And I can truly say that I am proud to say that I am a Black Knight.']

column6: ['I have a good experience that teacher are really here to help you but sometimes the surrounding can be troubling. It requires some adaptation because It can get to you sometimes', "very diverse. i transferred into the school. we had a lot of school spirit. wasn't cliquey and the academics were average. i was fortunate to have great teachers. who loved their job. many others did not", 'I liked my options for classes at Stamford High, we had a variety of classes to choose from. Although, some teachers were not the best. We had classes where teachers only taught one specific way whether it suited current students or not, they were not willing to adapt to the current environment of students.', "I would like to see the social environment change. The upperclassmen should have a little bit of leniency and freedom to participate in more on-campus/off-campus events. I liked the school's diversity within the student population and the amount of passion and dedication some of the teacher's portrayed to their students, ensuring that did well in their class and also ensuring they graduate in the future.", "It was incredibly diverse at least within the student body, I met more people in my four years of high school than I met in my entire life before.  The clubs/sports were incredibly fun, as I enjoyed four years of Basketball and Lacrosse.  However, I would say it was a bit too low of a academic challenge as I easily got A's in a majority of my classes while doing the bare minimum.  In connection to this, is the simple fact that I was not in any way ready for college post-graduation.  Up until college I had never studied, never spent more than an hour or so doing homework, and never failed a test.", 'I would like to see the environment at this school change. The bathrooms are terrible and the school is infested with ants please fix', 'I like that I came to school and learn something different everyday, I like how I first got my best friends and new friends and I had a lot of good experience.', "I loved the pep rallies & football games. It makes everyone come together and have a good time. Something I'd like to see change is probably the cleanliness .", 'I love how diverse Stamford high school is. The school is full of so many different cultures that you never get bored there. The teachers are okay, they are the worst but some are beyond average. Some teachers really do help there students success and at least try to. Most of the people there are nice, the food is somewhat below average. There is a pizza place near the school so people usually go there even though we’re not allow to.', "SH would not have been my first choice school, if I even had a choice. I don't feel many teachers and faculties care enough about the students. I don't feel they encourage you are push you on to greatness. And instead of encouraging a student that they can succeed they don't give them work that will challenge them but instead give them baby work because they feel that is what they are capable of doing and so you the student are not prepared totally for college.", "Goin in to Stamford High I was scared like nay other freshman but it's honestly a great school. High school is all about what you make of it, Stamford High has great opportunities for students and is defiantly better than WestHill.", 'The school is located in a convient area of town and is filled with many friends students and faculty. They offer a wide selection of courses, have many sports teams and clubs available for students, and and very interactive with students.', "Every nice and every welcoming to new comers. The learning is great and many people are around to help when you'll need it. The school is a close campus making it safer for the whole community", 'I have worked at Stanford high school. The students and faculty are excellent. I highly recommend this school.', 'Being at Stamford High was the best 4 years of my life. Lots of school spirit, diversity, and fun in the classrooms. The teachers genuinely care for their students and overall it is a loving community.', 'This school is so great! My favorite part about SHS is when the rats run away and play tag in the hallways, or when squirrels get stuck in the ceiling.', 'The academics were fine and the staff was subpar.  Parents and administration continued to promote school initiatives rather than fixing immediate issues.', 'I’m a junior at shs and i recently moved to Stamford. I wished on my first day that i was given a person to help me. Navigating the buildings  is very confusing. I’ve been told that they don’t do trips and dances and i wish they would.', "I hated my experience there and don't feel the teachers or staff truly care about their students . Don't have a very positive attitude and they don't encourage you only tell you the negative about what you are doing wrong instead of building your confidence.", "Stamford High School brings a lot of diversity among the student body. I enjoy this because not one person is the same. The one thing I do not like, is that the school is weak in it's mathematical department."]

The students and faculty are excellent. I highly recommend this school.', 'Being at Stamford High was the best 4 years of my life. Lots of school spirit, diversity, and fun in the classrooms.
