My favorite part about SHS is when the rats run away and play tag in the hallways, or when squirrels get stuck in the ceiling.', 'The academics were fine and the staff was subpar.  Parents and administration continued to promote school initiatives rather than fixing immediate issues.', 'I’m a junior at shs and i recently moved to Stamford. I wished on my first day that i was given a person to help me. Navigating the buildings  is very confusing. I’ve been told that they don’t do trips and dances and i wish they would.', "I hated my experience there and don't feel the teachers or staff truly care about their students . Don't have a very positive attitude and they don't encourage you only tell you the negative about what you are doing wrong instead of building your confidence.", "Stamford High School brings a lot of diversity among the student body. I enjoy this because not one person is the same. The one thing I do not like, is that the school is weak in it's mathematical department."]

column2: ['I hated the Michael J. Petrides experience from top to bottom. The school is small, dirty and they close the restroom facilities for inadequate reasons. The education programs were mediocre and they only have basic electives like drama & art. But I would say those are filler classes and we BARLEY partake in any activity of the sort. Their sport programs and coaches were below average. The kids from lower grades are poorly managed, They are rude and the adults act like they didn\'t see anything when asked about their rudeness. Kids get away with smoking and other activities. And keep in mind, it\'s a small school WITH CHILDREN so it is easy to catch these kids in their "activities". The AP classes gave me stress and anxeity attacks, but luckily I made it through in the end. It was NOT worth it though.', 'This is a K-12 school and is like family. You grow up with your friends fromKindergarten through graduation. Friendships that last forever. Teachers are like an extended family.', 'I have attended Petrides for nine years . The teachers do not have the students best interest at. The teacher often do not assist in solving student issues, the guidance consular is not professional at all, she often plays favorites amongst the students.  The students are a mixed of different people, there are many different personalities within them. There is a lack of involvement and inclusion, students of color don’t have clubs or events that celebrates them.', 'My school is very unique since it offers a PreK-12 education. Petrides has been my second home and has exposed me to a variety of experiences that have shaped me into the student athlete that I am today.', 'Petrides was a fun school open to many changes that enhanced student learning but, the school itself lacked aspects such as job placement for upperclassmen and proper student support.', "I've been a student at Petrides since Kindergarten, and I'm happy to say that being a part of Petrides all these years was the best decision for me. Petrides has given me so many opportunities that I will forever be grateful for. Getting involved at Petrides is the best part because it's honestly quite easy to gain leadership positions for activities and things that you are ambitious about. I've gained such great friendships and memories at Petrides, that I will cherish all my life. The only thing about Petrides that I dislike is the academics. Academics are not rigorous and most AP teachers don't care if you pass their AP exam or not! With the new PROSE program, sure OAT is fun and all, but high school at Petrides has literally become a joke for many students. Overall though, I definitely love Petrides, and if you're a hard-working kid who wants to have fun, Petrides is the place for you!", 'I have been at the Michael J. Petrides School since I was 6 years old and it has been a wonderful experience. Majority of the teachers at Petrides really take the time to understand and connect with the students. Our principal has recently implemented the PROSE project on high school students so that we get the college experience. I have to say, Petrides cares a lot about the future of every student because our college adviser goes through all the steps into college and career searching. Our school lacks respect in regards to facilities and peers sometimes. I think that the high school aspect of Petrides can improve, there should be consequences for bad actions and suspending a kid is not always the answer to a problem that occurs many times. Overall, Petrides is a school that has positive feelings to it, the campus is beautiful and welcoming, especially during the spring. Sports are highly encouraged here and it is a place to have fun while you are learning.', 'There are advantages and disadvantages to this school being a K-12 school. The advantage is that once you get in, you have not worried about having to switch schools going from Elementary-Middle, or Middle-High School. Being a K-12 school is also a disadvantage, because the older kids are usually mixing with the little ones in hallways. Something Petrides should do is designate certain buildings, or certain floors for each grade so that they do not run into others older or younger than them. Lastly, Petrides needs to stop accepting in kids that were expelled/suspended from other schools. That adds a terrible reputation to the school.', 'Teachers a great when it comes to teaching. They listen to your problems if you have any. The students are sometimes nice but they need to work on being respectful to teachers and workers in the school. Other than that it is a good school.', 'I have attended the Michael J. Petrides School for  13 memorable years. Sticking along the same group of peers for over 10 years creates a safe comfortable environment in the school. As years have progressed the school makes a great effort to intertwine the older students with the young to set a definitive standard to aspire to once they become of age. With the constant flow of fresh faces in the high school the era of role models for the younger students has been overshadowed through a few characters the school could very well improve on their disciplining tactics.Rather than awarded those who have done wrong with numerous second chances due to their good nature the school could very well have a more no nonsense ideology in certain cases in which help the overall wellbeing of students in their entirety.', 'For the 4 years going to this school, I’ve always felt at home. All the teachers and staff are very welcoming and care very much about you. Principal is very professional and fair. The deans and assistant principals can be quick to correct kids who are misbehaving or loitering in the hallways. I’m conclusion they are making petrides great again.', 'The Michael J. Petrides school is a very organized complex . The school provides students with strong education and support. The faculty and teachers are well rounded with extra help and are always going out of there way to be there for students about anything . The school has an excellent programs for students who need extra help in any subject . The school has become more popular on the island , of accepting different students into the building . In many students opinion, the school is a safe and organized environment for everyone to be there selves and make friends.', 'Petrides was not just a "school" for me, it was more of a place that I like to call home. I have spent 13 of my years attending Petrides, and have made a family, in addition to my actual family. Petrides has taught me everything I know and I would do anything to go back again and experience all 13 of my years again. Each year I have attended Petrides, my principal (Ms. Buckheit) has done her very best to make the school more amazing each year, and she still continues to do so. I hope that as the years go on, the students take advantage of everything this school has to offer, because Petrides shapes the person you become in the following years.', "My experience at the Michael J. Petrides School first started in 5th grade. It was different for me because I was adapting to a new life. New school, new home, new friends. I knew if I kept my grades up and continued to do great I will be graduating on time with my official class, class of 2017. I knew as I moved up each grade it was only going to get harder but I prepared myself for the worst. Honestly my focus wasn't there into school at first. I was more into fitting in with other people and really slacking on my grades. I didn't really do a lot of clubs because I danced outside of school and I worked. So I had barely little time. I wish I could've changed that. Senior year finally came around and I'm stronger than ever. I have reached a 90+ average in my grades. I Passed all my regents and all classes. i appreciate all my teachers who had my back since day one.", 'This High school has everything. so many sports to choose from and so many subjects. This school works hard to give you the education you want so that you can be successful in anything you want to do. Petrides instantly begins your practice for college readiness in high school. Besides work, its such a fun school to be a part of. I love it.', "My first experience at The Michael J. Petrides School was entering 5th grade. I received good grades and awards for my grades and other recognitions. Was awarded a moving up certificate meaning I was ready for junior High School. Things began to get a little tougher. It required a lot of focus and studying since big test were coming up in order for me to move to high school.Graduation day approaches and I now Enter the lively hood as a young adult. Freshman year was a tough year for me, but I had a lot of support systems around me. Sophomore year I also receive awards as well. Junior year my mind had been in a different universe. There has been 2 tragic deaths in my family. I just wanted to be alone. My grades were a little on the poor side. Senior year approaches and my average is in the 90's. Another death has occurred.Now, having all my test and class credits and walk accross the stage and Persue my career which is to be a FBI.", 'Deciding to come to Petrides for high school was probably the best decision of my life.  Petrides houses the best parts of a small school and of a big school, including a welcoming atmosphere as well as a large support system and a diverse set of sports and clubs. Almost every teacher is dedicated to connecting with you on a personal level and is genuinely interested in your education.', "I like the my school is very diverse and intimate. I have been going to school with some of the same students since elementary school. Teachers are more adapt to teaching these students due to their prior knowledge of how students learn. The only downside to this fact is that students aren't introduced to new students very often.", "My overall experience so far in this school has had it's ups and down. Some teachers in the school will motivate you so you can succeed.", "Our school is very diverse as well as the teachers. However they're some teachers that can care less if you pass or fail, you have to motive yourself if you plan on attending this school and try to be friendly with all your teachers."]

column8: ['There is nothing besides soccer for elementary school', 'Bullying is not taken seriously. Kids are often given pizza parties and rewarded for bad behavior', 'Ensures parent involment with students and their education', 'Its a little bit better then great but not excellent', 'Petrides is a little better than average but good', 'Michael J. petrides offers a wide variety of sports that many students enjoy.', "The school administration is alright as well as the policies. Dress code exists but not always followed. Students who get in trouble dont suffer much consequence. Usually get pizza and a talk in the principal's office.", 'The extracarricular activities are great. There are many to join.', 'The teachers are alright. There are a few of great ones you will meet along the way.', 'The library is a good resource facility.', 'The security in the school is okay', 'The athletic opportunities in this school are endless. There are many opportunities for everyone. All students are welcome to join.', "You'll have fun, join with a few friends and it's not bad at all.", "It's okay, but if I could go back and choose another high school I definitely would have.", 'No one gets in trouble for anything, this school is practically a playground.', "The student athletic teams at my school are fairly good. Many students are or have been involved in a sport throughout their high school career. Some may even go onto playing two or three sorts in the different seasons. Since my school is pretty small, there are not that many people who get denied to play a varsity sport. More competitive teams such as basketball have tryouts to either get in or not. But as for all the other sports, as long as you show up and maintain good grades, you are allowed to play on any sport you commit yourself to. For those students who do not participate in sports, they get involved in other things around the school. Many even go out and support the teams at their home games. It's a little less likely for students to travel to other schools that the teams are playing in, but yet, come people do show up and give their support.", 'There are many extracurricular activities for students to get involved in at my school. Many students are involved in various sports and clubs. Since my school is a fairly small school, it gives everyone a fair chance to get involved in anything they please. With help from coaches and staff, students are able to get involved and have a great leader to lead them along the way. Many students are involved in more than one activity and tend to stay actively involved in all of them.', 'There are many things that I do not like about my school but its my last year so I will deal with it.', 'It is all depends on the teacher teaching you and their teaching methods.', 'They do try to accommodate as much has they can for a small high school.']

column2: ['The only thing that was good about this school was that the teachers were nice and the school was close to the subway station.', 'I liked that I felt very close to my teachers and the staff there, that they weren’t just teachers but people who could guide me to me my best self. I wasn’t too keen on going to the school before my freshman year but I am so glad that I made the choice to go to Utrecht.', 'New Utrecht high school made me feel welcome and comfortable. The staff is friendly and the classes are engaging. There are a lot of clubs and teams to help you have even more fun after school. I have made a lot of friends in New Utrecht and I will always look back at the memories I made in the last 4 years.', 'The teachers are good. The students are ok. The classrooms are decently cleaned. Overall the whole school isn’t the best but definitely not the worst.', 'I really enjoy being in my New Utrecht HS. I have learned a lot since freshman year.  All my teachers are great and are always help full when I need it. I am in the Medical Program, which with that I am doing a Internship at Maimonides Hospital in Brooklyn. Also I am in Arista program with is for students with an average of a 90 and above. You have to keep your grades up and so volunteer work. I played Baseball with the school also I am on the Bowling team since freshman year.  I have been taking AP class, I have learned so much from my teachers in those classes. I would change much in my school cause I feel it has taught me so much.', 'The schoolis not that bad as others said. Teachers are very friendlyand nice to help. Students are very active and passionate. There is lots of activities after school and there are lots of clubs and shows like New Year shows, International Talent show. The school sport teams are pretty good. This school also has some special programs like Computer Science programs, medical programs, law programs and so on.', 'The teachers take the time to tutor and assist students in any subject. They take a personal interest in the students and respond very quickly to both phone calls and emails.', 'I like that there is someone to always turn to if you need someone to talk to and listen to you. There are many opportunities available to the students in terms of tutoring, jobs, clubs, sports, etc.', "It was an alright school. Made a lot of friends and got to meet some of my most favorite teachers of all time. Diversity is okay, not many black people. A lot of Asians and white people and a moderate amount of Hispanic people. It's not the best school but it's not the worse", 'The environment is pretty friendly. The teachers are nice and you actually learn. There is also a wide range of sports teams.', 'In my 4 years of being enrolled at New Utrecht High School, I had a very good experience. I loved the clubs and after school activities that they had to offer. I made a lot of friends and I’ve learned so many stuff that’ll actually be beneficial in the real world. I loved the administration and their friendliness. I was enrolled in many AP classes and i was satisfied with all of the experience i got out of it.', 'New Utrecht High School is a good school to study in. Teachers are very nice who are willing to help us if we are facing difficulties. They also help us to find lots of scholarship opportunities so that we can be more capable of the money needed for colleges.', 'I enjoy the school’s diversity. I would like the school to teach freshman’s about the importance of clubs,gpa, and their various options of AP classes.', 'I graduated from here two years ago and there have been its fair share of ups and downs: from a student bringing a gun, to the mass amounts of students vaping. It was mediocre at best', 'All the teachers that I had were very nice and friendly. The environment inside and outside of school was pretty safe and lifely.', 'It has been four years to study this high school. The things I like this school is diversity and more school activities to involve. There are many great teachers to teach students and can help me to learn more knowledge. There are many opportunities to provide in this high school. This school offers many new things for us to focus around and stay on track of what I do. It also helps me to become an independent person to be responsible for everything that I do and learn to plan on time.  When I was freshman year, I am not an independent person and rely on someone to help me to do something.  As time goes by, I think I have grown up and experienced many things throughout my school years and even the outside society. There are many things that I actually never experience before and sometimes feel surprised about what I overcome. Most experiences are under stress. For example, sometimes, I have obstacles to deal with relationships and schoolwork.', 'New Utrecht High School has given me many opportunities to get involved in many activities such as; clubs, sports, volunteer opportunities, internships, and educational programs. It has also given me a great experience during my high school year. I have met wonderful friends and teachers that have helped me get by. In addition, the school makes sure students are  college ready.', 'New Utrecht High school has a diverse environment with many students from different parts of the world. I am encouraged to take on challenging classes and take part of activities such as clubs and sports. Overall, I am enjoying my time in this school with amazing people.', 'it’s not a safe environment, so many fights go on and i heard around at least 20 threats a day, this is not okay. i heard from many of the students that attend this school that students bring guns or knives.', 'I’m a recent graduate at New Utrecht High School. Throughout my four years it has been wonderful. I was able to have a chance to develop long lasting relationships, with both my peers and teachers. It’s unfortunate that I have to leave because I actually did find out who I am while attending this school.']
column4: ['The only thing that was good about this school was that the teachers were nice and the school was close to the subway station.', 'I liked that I felt very close to my teachers and the staff there, that they weren’t just teachers but people who could guide me to me my best self. I wasn’t too keen on going to the school before my freshman year but I am so glad that I made the choice to go to Utrecht.', 'New Utrecht high school made me feel welcome and comfortable. The staff is friendly and the classes are engaging. There are a lot of clubs and teams to help you have even more fun after school. column8: ['I love the diversity, there is Asian, African-American and Latino. All the teachers have good experiences and teaching skills, it is easy to learn. In addition, there is many club and activities, for example, International Show and Chinese New Year Show, I like all the performances. However, there is always a fight between student, and I am a little scared even though the dean solve the problems.', 'I personally love how Utrecht got better throughout my 4 years. I appreciate everything the staff and students did to make Utrecht a more enjoyable place to WANT to attend.❤', 'When I was first time went to the New Utrecht High School, this school was very clean and made me feel comfortable .The teachers are very nice so that I really enjoy the lives in this high school . In addition, this school has many clubs and activities. I made many friends in the school and I feel happy in the school.', "I realized how great my Calculus BC (Mr.E!) and Physics (Laporta) teachers were after I went through my freshman year in college. In college, you don't always have the opportunity to ask professors for help which you could in high school. I can say that my Calculus and Physics teachers explain things more deep and conceptually than my professors if they are teaching the same chapter. One recommendation to those kids with passion in learning: Spend your precious time in subject that you think you will major in as well as any other classes that is related to that subject. I regretted for wasting my precious time in high school not contributing anything. Those 4 years are your golden period to shine. PLEASE learn from your high school teachers, especially the ones with PhD. they know MUCH MUCH MORE than you think. Thank you for reading this comment. I hope you can strive to become the #1 student in the school, or at least in the class that you like :)", 'Is good because they always their for me when I need to ask them something and they have good teachers', 'New Utrecht High School have a lot of great teachers. They always teach us how to study and find a way to let us understand the new topic easily. My school have very good safety, you don’t need to worried about your safety because you can see the secures everywhere.', 'One of my teachers, especially in the Art Academy, helped me with applications to colleges, internships, business card, and many other oppertunities.', 'It’s a great school that offers variety of AP classes. The teachers that I had were super awesome, nice and helpful! Although the students there are... let’s say they are not my cup of tea, but overall, the school itself is academically excellent!', 'This high school has been the far 4 best years in my life, I love going to this school because there so diverse in activities also classes , and the staff, teachers are so welcoming and helpful.', 'The  teachers are very nice and understanding and are there for you.  they make sure you really understand the material before moving on. They work with you and really want to see you succeed. Their college readiness is impeccable, they really set you up for success.', 'I like the fact that the teachers help you with a subject that you are struggling with and most of them are nice.', 'The thing that makes New Utrecht stand out, is it’s diversity. We are the most diverse school in the most diverse city. As for academics, you get what you put in.', "The school's overall not bad. Most teachers are very dedicated to teaching and would do their best to help you succeed. Although there may be some rowdy students who slack off and don't seem to care about their education, many of the students are hard-working. Just hang in the right crowd and join some of the many extracurricular activites that this school provides.", 'In New Utrecht High School there is a diversity full of people. Many people from different backgrounds and heritages come together at this school. Close friendships are built and teachers are very trustworthy and respectful towards students and coolleagues.', 'I loved how there are no fights that are intense and I love how teachers make their way to get the students to pass>They offer their time so you can succeed as well as being their not only as a Teacher but as someone you can come too for help.', "the hallways smelled like paint and I don't know why and the bathrooms are always broken something they should really change", 'New Utrecht high school It is a very good high school. In this high school, teachers will be very patient to teach students. Will answer due diligence to solve all student problems and give help.', 'Building out from a narrow, concrete focus. You’ll see a similar structure in many of the essays. The author starts with a very detailed story of an event or description of a person or place. After this sense-heavy imagery, the essay expands out to make a broader point about the author, and connects this very memorable experience to the author’s present situation, state of mind, newfound understanding, or maturityat first sentences are punchy.', "New Utrecht High School is a great place for pretty much anyone, if you care about your classes, they offer many advanced classes with tons of great teachers that can not only teach you but guide you towards what you want to do in the future. If you're not interested in academics, college or if you just want to get out of high school, New Utrecht can also be a good place for you because just as the classes can be challenging they can also be very easy as long as you at least try. most students complain about their high school experience but once they leave, they'll want to come back.", 'New Utrecht High School has a very comfortable environment, and the faculty/staff are easy to get along with. I liked that most of my teachers always put their effort into lesson plans, test reviews, and were enthusiastic to teach their students on a daily basis. However, I believe that the selection of clubs or extracurricular activities should be expanded; There are a number of clubs that are not very alluring, and it would benefit many students if more clubs were created. Whenever I am curious about a certain matter, I can feel free to ask either my fellow peers, the college office, my teachers, or etc. The college office is occasionally reminding students to prep for either the P-SAT, SAT, college essays, college visits, and much more. I have definitely benefited from the advice given to me by either the college office, or my teachers.']

column2: ["While the school offers a good load of honors and AP courses, I'd like to see a change in the way teachers teach these rigorous courses. What I mean by that is that teachers are starting to teach the class in terms of test prep rather than covering the actual content of the course. If that were to change, these hard courses would become more enjoyable despite their difficulty.", "I love Bellport high school because there's so many opportunities to be involved. There's something for everyone.   The are also so many great electives.", "I love Bellport High School because of the tradition it holds. It's a smaller high school compared to a lot of Long Island schools but that creates more opportunities to get one on one time with your teachers. Theres always ways you can get help with school work and even getting yourself involved with clubs and sports. The district is very diverse and i've had amazing teachers all throughout my school years even my teachers from when i was young kid that even influenced me to pursue teaching.", "I attended Bellport HS for 4 years just like both my parents did. When you take 5-6 AP classes, you are challenged but with the same 20 students in every class. There are only a handful of good teachers, but I need to say - the good ones really are great and inspiring. Majority of teachers I had, were not good. You aren't in a hard-working college-focused environment. Although athletics were great", 'In Bellport high school there was always something to do from our beautiful performing arts programs to our competitive sports programs. I enjoyed the amount of care and support my teachers have given me throughout the years to do my best and complete my work. I also am grateful that my school gives us the chance to extend our education through the many BOCES programs throughout Long Island. Our sports have also taught us the valuable lesson of being kind to competitors, our teammates, and others around us. They have also taught us we are student athletes and our education is the first step to success. One thing I would change is our starting time for classes. BHS starts school at 7:15 in the morning, and for the 4 years I have went there I believe starting at 7:30 or even 7:45 would make a difference in education. I would also change the school lunch portion size, because sometimes I am left feeling hungry or not able to finish. Overall I loved my experience at BHS.', "The support that student's have academically is as good as it can be for students who are serious about their education. But I feel as though the emotional support is lacking. There are basic discussions about bullying, generic lessons on mental health in health class and that's it. Like many public schools it seems to forget that, as young adults, we need to better understand the emotional toll of sex, societal values that play a roll in all that we do, how death is a very real thing as a result of bullying, what that looks like, that people who instigate these issues of shame and sadness will receive actual punishment.", 'Great community and school spirit. Structured classes and involved faculty. Loved the diversity and all the school had to offer.', 'Bellport was a great experience. I loved all my teachers and friends that I have at Bellport. The environment is great to be around and always filled with spirit. I will defiantly miss Bellport when I graduate.', 'Students and Parents of Honor society should be really upset ..They have this thing called Center of excellence ..that basically rewards average grades for students..They treat them so much better than the honor society students..Fancy Dinners , field trips ,etc..they have politicians coming and giving praise to these students..And honor society students aren’t allowed in it! Those students work so hard to have that average every quarter and they are NOT getting the recognition they deserve! They do nothing for the honor society students!', 'I liked that the school was small and that basically everyone knew each other I’ve gotten really close with a lot of people from my sophomore year to season year by playing football and wrestling I met some guys that I could call my brothers forever because we would hang all together no matter how young you were if you were on varsity you got treated the same. Things I didn’t like about the school was it was outdated we didn’t have as much as other schools we didn’t have the newest technology and I feel we should have more.', 'the academics are very good depending on which classes you take and who else is taking those classes, and the teachers are all mostly nice and are willing to help a lot. overall, with all the aspects of the school, it is average.', 'Bellport High School  is a very unique place. Due to the position of the school, a lot of diverse students are able to attend this school. This has enabled the school to become a very heterogeneous place. One of the best things about the school is the great school lunch. The lunch at Bellport is unlike the lunch offered at most schools as it is nor bland nor does it lack  taste.', 'After experiencing many different schooling environments over my life, its easy to say that Bellport HS is defiantly unique. With being in mostly Honors and AP classes I was able to steer clear and avoid the craziness in the halls and classrooms. Most teachers are lovely and willing to travle the extra mile for every student if asked.', 'I have attended Bellport Senior High School for all four years of my high school experience. I do not have many complaints to the school as a whole. I was consistently supplied with assistance from my own teachers, and even teachers whom I did not particularly have, but were always willing to help if I ever needed anything. The learning environment was always exactly how I specifically preferred it to be, friendly, yet serious when times were needed. I was never left behind when i had trouble with a topic, whether it was teachers or friends, I always had someone there to help me. I am now graduating as a National Honor Society Officer, ranking in the top 10% of my class with above a 3.8 GPA, and I would not have been able to achieve any of this without the solid foundation that my school supplied for me.', 'I have greatly enjoyed my experience at bellport. There is a huge art and music program. Excellent sports and great teachers and academics. One of bellport greatest strengths is its diversity. Here there are people from all sorts of backgrounds and walk of life and we greatly enhance one another.', "What I loved bout Bellport High School was that no matter what you are into, you will always find a way to express yourself. From the strong music program to the decorated sports program, there is nothing that you can't do at Bellport High School. The only thing I would change is the correction and legitimacy of some teachers due to some teachers being less helpful than others.", 'I went to Bellport all 4 years of hs and I wouldn’t want to go anywhere else! Sure it’s not as clean as it could be and I’ve had some weird teachers but the good out weighs the bad. I’ve had some of the best times of my life in the halls of Bellport. Between chaotic basketball games and all the school spirit I’ve loved my time there', 'Bellport high school was personally a great experience. It’s community provides support and motivation  for each and every student.', "I would like to see more food lunch options,more class choices and a mentor to the students to talk to the students and parents about future plans, college goals, and help with setting up for college because i didn't have that. I would also like to see them offer free driving lessons to students.", 'High School was some of the best years of my life and I would not have wanted to experienced it anywhere else. Some things that could change is they need to update the school itself and the classrooms.']

With being in mostly Honors and AP classes I was able to steer clear and avoid the craziness in the halls and classrooms. Most teachers are lovely and willing to travle the extra mile for every student if asked.', 'I have attended Bellport Senior High School for all four years of my high school experience. I do not have many complaints to the school as a whole. I was consistently supplied with assistance from my own teachers, and even teachers whom I did not particularly have, but were always willing to help if I ever needed anything. The learning environment was always exactly how I specifically preferred it to be, friendly, yet serious when times were needed. I was never left behind when i had trouble with a topic, whether it was teachers or friends, I always had someone there to help me. I am now graduating as a National Honor Society Officer, ranking in the top 10% of my class with above a 3.8 GPA, and I would not have been able to achieve any of this without the solid foundation that my school supplied for me.', 'I have greatly enjoyed my experience at bellport. There is a huge art and music program. Excellent sports and great teachers and academics. One of bellport greatest strengths is its diversity. Here there are people from all sorts of backgrounds and walk of life and we greatly enhance one another.', "What I loved bout Bellport High School was that no matter what you are into, you will always find a way to express yourself. From the strong music program to the decorated sports program, there is nothing that you can't do at Bellport High School. The only thing I would change is the correction and legitimacy of some teachers due to some teachers being less helpful than others.", 'I went to Bellport all 4 years of hs and I wouldn’t want to go anywhere else! Sure it’s not as clean as it could be and I’ve had some weird teachers but the good out weighs the bad. I’ve had some of the best times of my life in the halls of Bellport. Between chaotic basketball games and all the school spirit I’ve loved my time there', 'Bellport high school was personally a great experience. It’s community provides support and motivation  for each and every student.', "I would like to see more food lunch options,more class choices and a mentor to the students to talk to the students and parents about future plans, college goals, and help with setting up for college because i didn't have that. I would also like to see them offer free driving lessons to students.", 'High School was some of the best years of my life and I would not have wanted to experienced it anywhere else. Some things that could change is they need to update the school itself and the classrooms.']
column6: ['My experience at bellwort high school was a good high school experience. The teachers are their to help the kids out, even with life related issues. The social workers are great They help anyone who comes to them. Even if you just need to release tensions and sit down they are there. The staff is friendly and makes you feel like home.', 'Absolutely horrific. Most teachers will turn a blind eye to the shenanigans and the violence is terrible.', 'The school administration is absolutely fantastic. The problem with this school comes from some deep-seeded problems with the student body and the relationship that many students share with the teachers. In my experience, there were a few teachers that were actually willing to interact with the students such as myself as more than just numbers that they have to teach. Another note is that the school has a phenomenal theater department.', "I personally loved going to Bellport High School. I graduated three years ago, and still remain connected to it. The people I met there were amazing, and the memories we will share forever are even better. The staff of the school genuinely cares about the students. I first realized this in tenth grade when my town suffered a major loss and the entire school came together to support one another. it was truly amazing, and something I'll remember for the rest of my life.", 'It has been a few years since I have graduated from this school but when I attended this school, I had moved during the school year.  I was badly mad fun of and looked for comfort in my teachers and found none. Looking back on it now, it has made into a stronger person, it still would have been nice to see a teacher actually do something to help me transition into the new school.', 'Bellport High School helped me achieve many of my goals academically. Many of my family members attended here and it was a great part in my life. If I had to change one thing about BHS it would be changing the outlook that teachers have on students with their personal lives and vice versa to extinguish certain issues between both students and teachers.', 'I am 18 year old female, that attends Bellport Senior high school. The school for the most part isn\'t too bad. I wouldn\'t say it\'s the best school but I definitely wouldn\'t say it\'s the worst. Something that stands out to me, is how much the teachers care about their students. It is said that when us students step into school the teachers are out "guardians" well here at Bellport they really are. Whether it be making sure we do our work so we graduate or making sure we\'re mentally okay at home & have what we need personally, Bellport high school has became like a second home in that way. I know I always have someone to turn to if I need. I would recommend any new parent to bring their child into this district. They would not only get a great education but nothing less than the care and kindness a student shall recieve. If not more considering how above and beyond our teachers will go for us.', 'Bellport High School is a school full of diverse races and cultures with people who all have the same care about each other.  Bellport High School stretches out to its neighboring communities to try to bring every one together... and honestly great job!', 'I had an amazing 4 years of a high school expirence being at Bellport Senior High School. The teachers will work with you to help you in any way possible, when they feel like your starting to fall off they are there to catch you and help you with everything. The school is very diverse and you meet many people from everywhere and it is a good atmosphere the guidance counselor is on top of everything trying to make sure they help in any way possible. One thing I would like to see change is to clean the bathrooms quickly when it smells or someone throws up or is very sick.', "I went to Bellport Senior High School for all four years of my high school journey. The faculty and staff have the students' best wishes at heart, wanting them to succeed in each course they teach. However there are a some instructors that, whether they realize it or not, still treat their students as children, as appose to young adults with complex lives. To remedy this I would like a sort of method for teachers to understand their students' lives.", "Bellport High School was a good experience for me meeting new people(teachers and students). I had a lot of fun in many of my classes from freshman year to my senior year. I enjoyed playing sports in this school too. Baseball is my main and only sport that I played and I had a lot of fun playing it. There were maybe two field trips which I have gone on about every year, but I wish I could go on more. There are many sports in this school that I could played, but not the ones I wanted. I kind of wish there was a swimming program in this school. Overall, my experience at this school was great! The most thing I'm going to miss from this school is all the friends I made and the experiences I had.", "I have attended Bellport Senior High School  for 4 years and every year it gets better. I love the way the teachers teach and try to make sure you get the concept of the lesson. They don't give up on you they take time out of their personal lives just to help he students. You can tell hat in this school they really care about the students lives and goals; they will do just abut anything they can to help you achieve the goals. The guidance counselors also make the  school great , you can tell that thy love helping us young adults find and achieve our goals. they dot just come to work for the paycheck they actually care.", 'depending on the course that was taken would determine the difficulty. for example an AP course was more challenging than a regular course. but not everyone took AP courses and the regular courses were the bare minimum.', 'the school is very diverse.', 'there are a wide range of clubs and activities for students to get involved in. however they are not taken that seriously past the club fair.', 'i personally only enjoyed the few teachers that went above and beyond and the arts programs and activities. other than that i did not want to be there ever.', 'there are some teachers that are exceptional and then there are some teacher that are mediocre at best. there is not i between.', "The school does its best to maintain the health and safety of the student body, however there are some areas that need work. I believe that the school is well equipped against external threats (i.e. non students and faculty) but, I also believe it is left vulnerable to any threats that are already in the school.( students and faculty) Additionally, I've noticed that some classroom are hardly ever cleaned and garbage and papers will be left lying around my desk for weeks. The school nurse may also be a problem, because its often very crowded with students who are both healthy and sick. And those sick students are not separated and could possibly be contagious and infect others.", "At my school there are plenty of clubs and extracurricular activities to be apart of. We have several clubs for minorities such as the Gay-Straight alliance, a World of Difference and the Women of Excellence club. We also have clubs focused on a student's academic future such as Math, Science and National Honor Societies as well as the Future Business Leaders and Teachers of America club. The majority  of these clubs are funded  mostly by its members which means that they get out however much they put in.(Fundraisers and competitions) And if students are not very motivated to raise money for their club, which is hardly ever the case, then they will not receive any significant funding and their club will accomplish nothing.", "The quality of teachers in my school is exceptional, most teachers are very approachable and I see many students going to them for advice on academic topics as well as personal dilemmas. Occasionally they get backed up with grading and students don't get their work back right away but they're always straight forward with us and treat us like the young adults were are supposed to be growing up to. This year our principal took time out of his busy schedule to read 130 letters from the Career and Financial Management class filled with suggestions on how to make the school better. He even came into several class and directly addressed any questions or suggestions we might have left out."]

column2: ["Throughout my four years in college I'd say my favorite part of it was getting to know new and different people. The best part of it was the diverse setting. Then comes the teachers. There are a lot of bad teachers, who don't understand the fundamentals, however there are a lot of teachers who go above and beyond their job description for their students. Some of those teachers have clubs after school to spend more time with the students and its always enjoyable and a stress reliever after a long day. Not every person in the school is the most appealing but the ones who are -- are really inspiring, extremely intelligent, and passionately involved in the betterment of others.", 'John dewey is a very good school, it is very welcoming always involving parents and students. It offers a variety of clubs and programs', 'The school lunch was a disaster. However, the school celebrates different cultures, which make students feel home, relax, and sweet.', "I enjoy my time here at Dewey. It might not be one of the top schools here, but it's adequate. There's a lot of talent within these walls. The staff makes sure that you're comfortable here in Dewey and a lot these teachers really do know what they're doing.", 'John Dewey is a family friendly environment. I have never felt so safe in a school before, the security is always on point incase of an uproar. The teachers care for their students so much and help. I enjoy myself at this school as it has been my best high school experience.', 'My experiences in John dewey has its positive and negative aspects. I managed to get along with most of the teachers that I had. Most of the teachers here knows how to carry on their subjection, and what I appreciate is the diversity in this school. Besides that, the environment does need to improve. John dewey needs to keep its school clean, including the kids that attend. It can get crowded, and overexcited in the hallways. In this school, I believe you would meet many that are inspiring, and smart.', "It was completely terrible, very poor conditions way of teaching and etc...  I wish i never went here was only there for a semseter and immediately transferred and i never regreted it ever after. I'm a college student now and john dewey just didn't do anything to help me ivolve and develop as a student or a person. Teachers were very low level and they didn't really care a lot just hated their jobs and were ready to fail you every single way they could. Administration was very unorganized and the saftey was annyoning. Due to recent accidents of school hisotry we had metal decector checks all the time and going in with open bottle was insdie you either had to go without a bev, or with a ndew unopened one. If you live in nyc you must know how hard it is to move around without a bev and eating bacon egg and cheese without it.", 'John Dewey isn’t a bad high school. I have learned so much and matured so much thanks to the workers & people in the school. It has improved a lot academically & it’s better than it used to be. It’s a great school to attend as there are many activities in the school to join such as sports, arts, robotics and much more. Not just that but everyone in school is safe, no one is ever put in danger and the faculty all try their best to keep it that way. The teachers are also great teachers, they all help us prepare for college because they all care.', 'I liked the amount of clubs and sports. I also liked my college readiness class. However I think the school should try and get more funding for sports because of athletes have great potential but dont have the resources.', "The school was beautifully diverse which was amazing. But sometimes, since the school is so lowly funded, we'd have certain drawbacks like , like less trips, and no worksheets for the day.", 'JOHN DEWEY HIGH SCHOOL HELPS STUDENTS ENDORSE IN THEIR INTEREST THROUGH THE FIVE DIFFERENT ACADEMIES THAT ARE OFFERED IN THE SCHOOL. THIS SCHOOL HELPS YOU EMBRACE WHO YOU ARE AND HELPS YOU INTERACT WITH MANY PEOPLE FROM DIFFERENT CULTURES . COLLEGE READINESS PROGRAMS HELP STUDENTS THROUGH A THREE YEAR PROGRAM TO HELP PREPARE FOR COLLEGE AND HELPS THEM THROUGH THE COLLEGE APPLICATION PROCESS.', 'John dewey is a good school sometimes, what I like the most is the different problems that helps u handle the stress of being a senior and getting you ready for college', 'I enjoy the experience at the school. I think that they offer lots of opportunities, and that they have a very nice set of teachers that are able to lead you through high school without a problem.', "I enjoyed my high school experience. I was very comfortable here most teachers were nice, the students are usually calm and there's a lot to do.", 'John Dewey High School is very diverse, the school offers a variety of extracurricular activities for students to choose from.', 'I love the connection that the teachers have with the students! They could easily recommend certain things related to what their student wants to do when they are out of school. For example I am an art student and my art teacher gave me lots of opportunities to do things outside of school related to art! It gave me lots of experience and that is something I thank my teacher for. I also made lots of close friends in the school too! One thing I would like to see changed is taking better care of the bathrooms and maybe add in a football team since lots of people are asking for it! Other than that I say the school is great! I don’t regret going there for 4 years now. I personally am having a nice time here so that’s what matters! The connections in the school are great!', 'I like the energy the students and the teachers have and I like how much enthusiasm teachers have when teaching and that they push you to better yourself academically.', "My experience in JDHS isn't bad.The school has 3 floors and people need to go through the scanning machine in order to get inside the building. The students are nice and so are the teachers. They will help anyone in need. There are 5 academies: Business, STEM, Arts, law and Pre-med. There is no school gym uniform, only sweatpant of any kind.Fights do happen but it's very rare.JDHS is a good school and plus, you can meet different people with different ethnicities.", 'Being in Dewey was fun and productive for the most part. When you have super great teachers, they teach well and they can help you a lot. There used to be a lot of choice for AP classes, but now they limited the amount of AP you can take and a lot of AP classes are no longer offered. Overall, majority of the experience were quite decent.', 'The school has a balance of good and bad within it. It’s really just your typical New York high school except that it’s on a nice campus. The students here are mostly nice but every now and then there are snakey passive aggressive people but if surround yourself with the things you’re interested in and tip your toes into some new things, you’ll be fine.']

column6: ['Very good experience there are some great people in this place and you will enjoy your 4 years here it’s very diverse and has many cultures for any group', 'john dewey is a really good school, its very diverse so you get to be around different race and become friends with them , everyone looks out for each other, the teachers are very caring and they really look out for you and your future, they want nothing but the best for all of their students', 'At John Dewey High School there is certainly diversity not only with the student body but within the school overall. The school offers a variety of different academics as well as offering different areas of studies for the students.  This school offers a great list of Advanced Placement course that students are able to choose and take. The school also includes a wide range of sports and student activities. John Dewey High School provides students with different resources for college readiness. The school offers students assistance with college applications, scholarship application, financial aid assistance, etc. The school could definitely improve on their schedule timing for classes.', 'John dewey derintely has a lot of pros yet they do have some cons. For one the people you could meet there can vary but mostly great, influential, and creative people. As far ss the students ans the teachers. The clubs and activities vary and theres slmething for eveeyone. Its a safe school, Although there has been many terrorist threats sent in the area. So the scanners arent fun. Also the faculty arent as available as id like due to the population.', 'Attending to John Dewey High School has been a roller coaster. I’ve met so many great people at this place and learned so much. I have grown and the people are so kind and caring. They influence you to learn and grow. It is a great school, lots of opportunities.', 'While attending John Dewey High School,  I have met people with a diverse heritage rather than just American. Through the people I have interacted and became friends with, I have been educated on international topics and was taught many different aspects of different cultures. You can see people from all different backgrounds at Dewey. Also, the staff here in the school is amazing. Everyone is friendly and helpful. Whenever I needed help, I could ask many people and they would not hesitate to help me or other students. The staff treat every student at Dewey respectfully and they are always happy to see students. The coaches for the teams also are amazing. They create a bond with each and every student on and off the court. However, some thing that I would like to see change in my school is the commitment that students have for the clubs. Some students are not committed to the club and that is a waste of time and unfair to the other students and staff.', 'I have enjoyed my time going to this school. The teachers are helpful and overall the school days are enjoyable.', 'I liked the inclusion and diversity of the school and how all teachers were very caring towards the students and were always willing to help', "My four years in John Dewey High School was pretty good. I usually did enjoy it because I meet a lot of friends and the teachers treat me with kindness. There are two things I like about this school are the way they help students to get prepare for college, and the clubs. In John Dewey High School some teachers are help students to get prepare for college when they are in Sophomore year, like me. In the Senior year, the college counselor help student to plan for their college, like financial stuff. Another thing that I like about is the clubs. John Dewey High School had a lot of clubs. One of the club I really like about is the video game club, because in the video game club, there was no pressure and relax.One thing I will encourage the school should improve is the food. The food does not taste good, and everyday seem's the same. There was no diversity on the food. Overall, this school is pretty good.", 'i was a student for 4 years, the only high school i ever attended so i have nothing to compare it with. however, they were some good and some bad. you can never know what is coming your way.', 'Dewey get a lot of excellent teacher and variety clubs/teams. Dewey also have five academy: STEM, Pre-medical, business, law, and art.', 'This school offers several advanced placement courses to students under its AP FOR ALL program and has a wide variety of sports and extracurricular activities.', 'It was pretty good experience for a high school. The staff and teachers were all friendly and helpful. The students themselves needed improvement which the school tried its best to assist in.', 'John Dewey Highschool is very diverse with many teachers you may make connections with that’ll last long. They do care about you but the school itself has many factors that aren’t good such as the facilities and bugs that are around the school the environment does not feel clean and honestly it looks and feels like a prison but the musical bell makes it more productive and fun and makes school a little more exciting.', "When I first started here it wasn't as bad . But as I moved on to the next grade and now that I'm a senior I see that the school doesn't help with college readiness as much meaning that they don't really do much to help prepare for college . The school does't promote historically black colleges as they should which isn't fair because the students don't know anything about them. When i wanted to take an A.P. course I was told that I should ask which was baffling because I should've automatically been put in one because of my grades. The schools cares little about African Americans and is setting us up for failure.", "It depends on the academy you get into during freshmen/sophmore year. I was in the STEM academy where the elective was either robotics or software engineering which was great. The teachers were kind of average. They waste a lot of paper to print. The girls bathroom's toilet paper and paper towels were empty by the time lunch came and they only restock after the day was over. There is a Dewey store where you are able to buy school merch, snacks, drinks and ice cream. There are also vending machines in the cafeteria and by the entrance of the school. In the library, you aren't allowed to eat or even drink water. The librarian is strict even if you aren't near books. She will kick you out immediately. The halls are overall clean.", 'Dewey is a great school, it has 5 academy’s to choose from. And great programs for college and test readiness. The school has tons of diversity, students from all over the world. The food may not be the best but they’re tons of outside restaurants to choose from and we’re also located near Coney Island and the beach which is pretty cool.', 'I am John Dewey high school’s class of 2019 graduate, I have to say it has been quite an 4 year experience . This school is very diverse in both student and teacher population, with variety choices of sports and clubs to choose. It is academically fit with numerous different AP courses and College Credited courses.', "People say it bad but when you start to go to this school tou started to get use to it. I wish they had swimming pool.I always liked swimming but they didn't have one so it sad.", 'John Dewey High School has had a bad reputation in the past through the grade scandal issue. However, it has since changed. Everything has improved especially safety concerns. Students are required to pass through metal detectors daily prior to entering the building. Teachers strive to make sure that students are well-prepared for exams and college.']
column8: ['Very good experience there are some great people in this place and you will enjoy your 4 years here it’s very diverse and has many cultures for any group', 'john dewey is a really good school, its very diverse so you get to be around different race and become friends with them , everyone looks out for each other, the teachers are very caring and they really look out for you and your future, they want nothing but the best for all of their students', 'At John Dewey High School there is certainly diversity not only with the student body but within the school overall. The school offers a variety of different academics as well as offering different areas of studies for the students.  This school offers a great list of Advanced Placement course that students are able to choose and take. The school also includes a wide range of sports and student activities. John Dewey High School provides students with different resources for college readiness. The school offers students assistance with college applications, scholarship application, financial aid assistance, etc. The school could definitely improve on their schedule timing for classes.', 'John dewey derintely has a lot of pros yet they do have some cons. For one the people you could meet there can vary but mostly great, influential, and creative people. As far ss the students ans the teachers. The clubs and activities vary and theres slmething for eveeyone. Its a safe school, Although there has been many terrorist threats sent in the area. So the scanners arent fun. Also the faculty arent as available as id like due to the population.', 'Attending to John Dewey High School has been a roller coaster. I’ve met so many great people at this place and learned so much. I have grown and the people are so kind and caring. They influence you to learn and grow. It is a great school, lots of opportunities.', 'While attending John Dewey High School,  I have met people with a diverse heritage rather than just American. Through the people I have interacted and became friends with, I have been educated on international topics and was taught many different aspects of different cultures. You can see people from all different backgrounds at Dewey. Also, the staff here in the school is amazing. Everyone is friendly and helpful. Whenever I needed help, I could ask many people and they would not hesitate to help me or other students. column2: ["The school is grand. You'll at least find 2 staff members who actually pay attention to a struggling student, will listen to them, and provide help for those who would obviously want and appreciate it. Sports, clubs and other afterschool activities are pretty abundant. Students need work, as all schools do, but that's an easy fix. Majority of staff are kind/polite and helpful.", "I currently attend Pelham Prep. Academy and it's a relatively good school. Right now there aren't as many club activities as their could be, but the academic opportunities that are offered there are great. The sports teams are very well balanced and the diversity is at a happy medium. The schools location is also really good since its near a lot of parks and food stores.", "I've been attending this school for 4 years and i haven't regretted it yet. I've felt at home ever since i was a freshman and i honestly believe i made a good choice.", 'My son transferred here mid-year during the 2017-2018 school year. It was the best decision I’ve made in a long time. The staff consists of dedicated, hardworking and caring people. Ms. Applebaum is an amazing counselor who always has the students best interest at heart. Love this school!', 'My experience at Pelham Preparatory Academy High School was great. Our motto was "High school with a college view". The staff always made sure that the students were on top of their work. The students that go into this school will leave ready for college.', 'The teachers are highly engaged in your development and personal well being. Pelham Preparatory demonstrates a culture of caring for all of its  students. Parent involvement is a key priority in our school culture to ensure we are doing right by the students, ensuring safety and topics of discussion often involve budgeting, community involvement, safety, other educational techniques so all students are connected with and have the opportunity to learn at their skill set. As a Junior, PPA has made college readiness a priority since I was a freshman. Now as a Junior entering my senior year  I am not feeling overwhelmed by the college process. My school has provided me and others with many opportunities to excel as individuals participating in clubs and outside school activities, partaking in college readiness courses at a participating college, SAT/ACT Prep, and academic programs suitable to an individuals needs. I am a proud Pelham Preparatory student.', 'My experience with my school Pelham Preparatory Academy has been the best. You would think high school would be hard and very difficult to get by but actually it\'s easy. Easy is meaning that this school works with each student as individuals and together to make each and everyone of them successful for their next journey, but as each individual we have to earn our hard work as well. Our school proves that when you leave you\'ll be a better student and a better person too. As well, our motto is "A high school with a college view" in meaning from the time you\'ve entered which is 9th grade until the end being 12th you\'ll be ready for college experiences and a new journey that will make you become independent in due to the staff and faculty members that includes the teachers with a nuturing but a very firm behavior in order for us to be prepare for the world that\'s ahead of us.', 'They are very college readiness type of high school. They have connection when it comes to private colleges such as Mt. Vernon College, which is  basically looking for diversity which the school has.', 'the teachers were excellent, the counselor helped with my college choices and scholarships, the principal was welcoming to new ideas.', 'I liked Pelham Prep because it was one of the great schools in the campus, which started out with 7 schools and went down to 5. I liked the close knit community because it allowed you to develop a relationship with the students and faculty which is essential when it comes to school. The school itself had a loving relationship and the teachers usually found time to help students who were struggling during their lunch time.', "As a last year student at Pelham Preparatory Academy, i could not have asked for a better high school to be honest. Most of my memories started here at this school and i would hate to lose them because it made me grow as a person, and developed me to become someone better than I was years before. So this school's guidance and academic structures are where they need to be and they care about your future, in which they are willing to help you get there. There is nothing that i would want to change.", 'Very good school overall. I would recommend Pelham Prep to other parents.  They have a trio program with Lehman College with stipends.  They have tutoring programs.  They also have Saturday Academy to better prepare students with regents and other exams.  They do alot of activities and trips including sports.  They have pot luck for seniors where each student brings in a dish of food from home.  There senior trip is wonderful.  The Guidance Counselor and Patent Coordinator is very helpful to the students.  The staff overall is wonderful and help the students along their journey towards completing High School onwards to college. I love this school and the staff work through mediation with student who have any issues. Thank you for being their for my daughter.', 'PPA is a pretty average school, there were some expectations most had when entering that weren’t meet. The need to work on clubs/ activities, teachers behavior, supporting they’re students and making sure students feel confident and not stressed', 'I liked the atmosphere. There are some really cool teachers, and staff members. Everybody is nice, respectful and want to see you succeed so the student can go to college.', 'The community that the students create in Pelham preparatory is one that you will most definitely like if you enjoy outgoing and social settings.', "One thing I liked about this school was the students and some faculty. In Pelham Prep, you were able to gain friends and have a close connection with the teachers. I feel that all freshman will have a hard time adapting to a new environment, there may be students that does not like you because of your appearance, belief or ability to do things better than another person. I find that Pelham Prep was a great location for students traveling on their own during the daytime, they provided many activities and sports for students. One thing I would like to see change is the school's budget to provide better resources for the students to learn, create more clubs and fun extra curricular activities. Another thing I would like to see is more programs available for students with lower GPA's, I believe programs besides College Now, should be created to build students knowledge.", "In Pelham preparatory academy you see the difference in your mind as you get to each grade level. There is always a teacher that will push you for you to do better. There's always a chance for you to become a better version of yourself and you can learn it here in this school.", 'I went to this school, the teachers are awesome and are very serious about the students. They teach things you should be learning in college, they challenge the kids too. Lots of sports for your child to play. School lunch is gross, I only looked forward to the mozzarella sticks lol.', "It's a really good school and the teachers are always trying to push students to try harder and do better.", 'Pelham Preparatory Academy is a great school. The environment is very welcoming. The teachers and principals there are all willing to help any student regardless of the problem. Most importantly, this is a school that strives to help you prepare to be ready for college. As well as pushes you to be on the right path to accomplish this goal.']

column6: ['This school is amazing! The teachers are very driven and the students always strive for excellence. I have had nothing but amazing memories at this school. I was able to challenge myself in honors and AP classes. I always felt cared for and comfortable.', 'This school allowed me to get the best education. This school helped me push myself and get ready for college. Pelham Prep is a school that helps shape you and ready you for college. There logo is "A high school with a college view" This allows one to know what the high school is about. The high school allows you to get to know yourself better, find the path you\'re going to be on. This high school is very diverse, which allows you to get to know other cultures and be comfortable.', 'My experience at Pelham Preparatory Academy was really excellent they are a four year high school that helps you get ready for college. This school has helped me get prepared for the real world and allowed me to get college credits as i signed up for programs to help me with college. I got tutoring from many teachers and as much hard work and effort i put into my grades i had fun as well.', "I love the friendly atmosphere that envelopes the school. I would like to see the school's organization get better.", "I had a great experience at Pelham Prep as I not only found a great and challenge curriculum thanks to my wonderful teachers that always pushed me to do better no matter how much I got on their nerves with my long essays  , but I also found my new family. I can truly call Pelham Prep my home away from home as I made so many great friends that I could close and loving, only adding to the comfort and coziness of the school as a whole. I will never forget my experience there as it helped me grow as a person so much so that I really don't think I would be here today if it weren't for those kind people, and I say that no matter how cliché that sounds. I will always love the teachers, students, and staff of Pelham Prep for as long as I shall live. Thank you.", 'Pelham Preparatory Academy definitely prepares students for college. Academically is a great school, being the top school in the Bronx. The people are nice, the teachers help the students to understand the work and overall it is a good school. There are not that many clubs or activities for the "talents", like music or dance. ', 'Thanks to this school i was offered a opportunity to excel at a great school. It really is a school with a college view!', 'The teachers love what they do and it proves through their efforts and teaching methods. They are dedicated and wonderful.', 'There was a lot of activity you can do so not everyone was left out or alone .', 'All the teachers had their own way of teaching and what goes on in their classroom. Very unquie I can say', 'Teachers are great. They try their best to teach in different ways so students understand.', "this year has been good but i feel the teachers really didn't motivate me as much as i wanted them to", 'The school is okay but could be better. Teachers should be more engaging', 'The after school activities are fun and give a chance for students to catch up on work and lessons that they are behind on.', 'As i approach graduation, I think about all the wonderful moments I had in the 3 years I spent in the school. I wish I could go back and start that school since freshman year. I know that if i would of gone to that school since freshman year, my opinion of it would be greater than what it is now.', 'When I need the teachers, they try and find time to help me. Most students are comfortable around the teachers.', 'There are a lot of clubs and extracurricular throughout the campus that students can join, even if they are not from the school that offers the club.', 'The teachers are great; they are very knowledgeable in what they teach and help the students a lot make sure they understand everything.', "There isn't much bullying aside for the occasional fights, but it is always broken up by those in charge  and those responsible are usually punished. There are good health programs.", "The school doesn't have many clubs, but because it shares the building with several other schools, students can always join a number of clubs at the other schools. Some clubs include art club, anime club, book club, health club, music club, etc.There are also opportunities to create a club of your own if you feel that what you enjoy can be enjoyed by other students as well. There are after school activities that students can join, and usually it is something that they would have to commit to for the year."]
