I wish I could go back and start that school since freshman year. I know that if i would of gone to that school since freshman year, my opinion of it would be greater than what it is now.', 'When I need the teachers, they try and find time to help me. Most students are comfortable around the teachers.', 'There are a lot of clubs and extracurricular throughout the campus that students can join, even if they are not from the school that offers the club.', 'The teachers are great; they are very knowledgeable in what they teach and help the students a lot make sure they understand everything.', "There isn't much bullying aside for the occasional fights, but it is always broken up by those in charge  and those responsible are usually punished. There are good health programs.", "The school doesn't have many clubs, but because it shares the building with several other schools, students can always join a number of clubs at the other schools. Some clubs include art club, anime club, book club, health club, music club, etc.There are also opportunities to create a club of your own if you feel that what you enjoy can be enjoyed by other students as well. There are after school activities that students can join, and usually it is something that they would have to commit to for the year."]

column1: Urban Assembly School for Criminal Justice
column2: ['I love this school and it is very nice and able to get the child going on and the teachers are really nice and they love us a lot and', "Great teachers: they're very nice, caring, helpful, and they are very intelligent.Great community: good  peer relationships, not a lot of bullying, etc.Good classes/subjects.Not enough clubs, technology is poor, not enough sat prep, too much hw stress instead of exam prep, too crowded, not enough rooms.", 'A decent school went there all throughout middle school and freshman, sophomore, junior and senior years.', 'My experience in Uascj has been amazing with all of the teachers pushing you to the doors of adulthood. College is a huge deal and all teachers help out the students to make the best decisions ever.', 'The school is very clean and the teachers are always there for you. They want you to pass and they try to teach you about what goes on outside of the classroom.', 'Urban Assembly School for Criminal Justice (UASCJ) is a relatively small school but has big potential. As a student there, I was truly challenged by every single one of my teachers. I had to struggle to keep up grades, and as a result, I always received a product of my effort. Socially, the students represent a huge, diverse body of cultures and ethnicities. You learn so much about people from Pakistan, Bangladesh, Yemen, Egypt, Sudan, China, Mexico, Ecuador, Russia, and every place you can imagine! The only down fall is that there aren’t many AP or advanced classes to take. Other than that, the school is generally good.', 'It is very good high in Avery views when you look at there . The teachers are excellent they will treat you in a very nice way . The diversity of this school are good you can find every culture in there . The respect each culture very well. They are many clubs that they do evey year and many students participate it . They give you many information and other things like internship that help you in college . And one most important thing that we have a lot of trips In this school and it so amazing we had a lot of fun in every trip. I really like this school.', 'urban assembly school for criminal justice is a very small school. That means teachers are more involved and always have a chance to meet with students to make sure they succeed and that makes it very helpful and unique from other schools.', "I just loved all the hard working and nice teachers. They actually teach you some valuable lessons versus teaches at other schools who don't even care to explain things more carefully to students. They match with our pace and genuinely care for us. It's a safe school in a good neighborhood, and very diverse, too.", 'The teachers made sure that every student knew that they could go to college! They prepared us since middle school on our options for college.', "I have been going to UASCJ for about seven years. I have my dislikes about the school but I don't see myself in any other school except this one", 'This is a good school. It develops habits that are useful in college. the teachers are super sweet. However the turnover rate is high. teachers are constantly leaving. However this dose not affect the overall education as someone is ready to fill in. there are minimum ap courses offered. the math department and science department need more work. However the small community culture at UASCJ is its biggest strength. your high school GPA will be higher as the small classrooms allow teachers to focus on students individually.', "this is the best high schools that I have ever attended. all the staff members are great and they are really helpful. if a student don't understand something they will always take their time to explain. This school is an all-girls school helps the student to concentrate on their studies more. and this school has a safe environment. Also after graduating this high school every girl is ready to enter college because from a sophmore year they are being preared for college.", "This is my first year here, at UASCJ, and I'm loving it so much. My goal throughout my life, is to become a devoted human being. This school taught me that. Not only do the staff help me achieve, they tell me to never give up. Schools that I attended prior, showed lack of support. The diversity and academics at this school is amazing. I'm looking forward to having a great time at this school. Overall, so far it's been a very great experience for me.", 'There are many things that I love about uascj. When I step inside  the building door ever morning, I know at that moment today is going to be a different day. I enjoy every second in my school. It’s not just because of education but also because of the students. Every one is generous and kind. We help each other out if some one is in trouble or in some sort of difficulty. Urban assembly school doesn’t contain that many students that other public schools might have but it’s still the best school. The most important thing about my school is safety. Our dean and principal try their to protect their students from any type of danger.  As I would walk pass the dean’s office I would see her in her always working. I would see her sort misunderstands out between students. It’s just not the dean but also the school teachers that I love the most. Though sometimes I would hate a class or two because of the amount of work I’m given but the teachers in my school are caring, . ,loving', 'My experience as a student inurban assembly school for criminal justice is amazing I learned a lot. I was an immigration and I never play any sports but here my involvement in sporty is amazing', 'Urban Assembly is a school where everyone feels at home! At this school i have learned many new things and gained many experiences. Since the class sizes aren’t typically too big, and teachers are always readily available for students, it is always very easily to find help if you ever need. The administration works hard to keep the school in order. There are rarely any fights, but always lots of love. I would recommend any young girl wishing for opportunity to attend this high school!', 'The Urban Assembly School for Criminal Justice provides  young, driven students a safe environment in order to nurture individual opinions in a fairly liberal atmosphere. There is a large emphasis on college preparation however, the cleanliness of facilities continues to remain an issue.', 'The friends you make here will last for a lifetime, and some of the teachers extremely helpful, but for the most part if you want to get a great education this is not the school for it, because at the end of the day there are a lot of things you just have to do on your own.', "the diversity is great. I've been in the school for almost 7 years and will be graduating next year. The teachers here prepare you and pump you up for college all the time."]

column6: ["Urban Assembly School For Criminal Justice is a school filled with diversity. The teachers are great, always willing to help you out before and after school. There's so many club and programs this school offers.", 'This school provides students with a lot of interships and programs to help them gain admission into selective colleges.', 'So far at UASCJ, my experience at the school has been absolutely amazing. The teachers are extremely nice and do the best they can to contribute to their students success. The teachers have extremely high expectations for us; they all want the students to get at least a 90 or above. All classes are extremely beneficial and the way that the lessons are taught help every student understand the class clearly. At the school they have a couple of teachers that deal with college readiness. They help the students go on college tours and help them with their college applications. The school has many college tours around the country, and some have trips to different countries. Our school has many different clubs differing from the news magazine and the muslim prayer club to a feminism and blog club. UASCJ is extremely diverse. We have Muslims, Hispanics, Blacks and White. All different colors and ethnicities. We are an extremely great school.', "I like how the school is and how we as girls are united in a way. The only thing I don't like is how we barely have a a lot of programs.", 'This is a great school in terms of getting students ready for college, as that is there main goal. However, they dont have high level college classes such as physics or many interesting clubs. Overall, they excel in academics.', "Before attending the Urban Assembly School for Criminal Justice, I was apprehensive and reluctant about going there, it's an all girls school in Brooklyn. I had only been to co ed schools before and this transition was different to say the least. Now that I'm a senior here I appreciate this school a lot, going to a school with only girls has given me a great experience, I've made amazing friends here and the teachers are amazing. The school is rigorous and has a high attention on college readiness. It has prepared me well for the next part of my education journey. The relationships I've made here are significant to me as well as the sisterhood created within.", "I know you're not supposed to judge a book by it's cover but the moment I looked at this school, I expected great things. And this school fulfilled just about all of them. I wanted  friendly environment that would allow me to be able to communicate with anyone while being t ease. One of the main reasons why I wanted to go to this school was because of how small it is. Big schools make the students invisible and don't recognize them. this doesn't give students the attention and opportunities they need, but UASCJ on the other hand, is a small school where everyone is recognized.", "For the most part, the teacher's are great at what they do. They really do set an example for us, the youth. However, the teacher's can sometimes be a little cranky which makes it harder for us to communicate with them. I understand that everyone has bad days but it really shows in their teaching styles. However, at the end of the day, they are our teachers and I thank them for what they have taught us.", "I think that this school is very safe mostly due to it's location.", 'There are a couple of clubs available but they were not anything that really caught my attention. The only club that I was really into was Good Will Club and I really liked it because it was meant to find ways to help our community. The most popular club this year is drama and we get to watch the students perform once in a while, which is something to look forward to.', 'There are many things about this school that I like. Like the fact that there are a few students so teachers are very involved in our college application process. However what hold me back from saying I would come to this school if I could do it over is the fact that sometimes activities are not possible due to our small graduating class. For instance when it comes to prom not that many girls want to go so it might become open to juniors and I do not agree with that.', 'The teachers at this school are great because they show us that they actually care that we get something out of their class instead of just teaching us for an upcoming exam.', 'We have some security guards and locked doors and can onky exit through the front doors, the side doors are closed off after a certain time', 'For a small school there are many clubs though for sports clubs we dont really do much but practice besides flag football where we actually got to play against another school', 'The most exciting part is spirit week and even though our school is small they try their best to make school fun and exciting by planning little events such as spirit week or winter movie night', 'Overall the teachers help the students and are always available. I know I can always go to any teach with help with any of my work, even if the work is not for thier class', 'I really enjoyed my experience at this school. This school really allowed me to do things I thought I wouldn\'t be able to do. The staff encourages me to do my very best and take on leadership skills. For an example, I was motivated to open two clubs and become the president of the student council! The teachers try to help me as much as I can when it comes to trying to enter programs outside the school. They are constantly emailing new programs and scholarships that I can apply to. The school also creates fun events such as Spirit week and "pie the teachers". The school also allows the students to go on multiple trips that are both educational and fun! The students at this school is very friendly and tries to help others as much as they can. Typically in schools, there are a lot of competition and drama can occur. However, the students provides a familial sense. Overall, the environment is a family like environment and I enjoyed this school very much.', "The teachers try their best to help students who are struggling, and they make sure that the students are constantly reviewing and studying. The teachers also tries to use various teaching styles to understand which way the students can learn the best. They also try to incorporate real life examples when they are teaching the lessons. Some of the teachers are good at replying their emails, and a few are open to help students outside of classrooms. The consistency in grading is very good, since the teachers grade the work as soon as possible, and give great feed back. However, some I've experienced and seen teachers losing the student's work or tests. Very few try to be involved in after school activities with students. However, their is a huge use of favoritism among the teachers. And if the teacher does not personally like an individual student, they do not try to help and tries gives a lot of attitude. Overall, the quality of the education is okay but some teachers need to learn to put their personality and impression of the student beside and teach the students.", 'Our school education is really well organized and helps us challenge our self to learn more.', 'Food is not that great, but they try their best giving us the healthy and good foods.']

column1: Math, Engineering & Science Charter High School
column2: ['I honestly enjoy the small community, inclusiveness, diversity, and overall the staff. They are always available for office hours.', "I thought it was a very good school since it helped me get to the college of my dreams. They take pride in their work and make every effort to ensure every student can strive no matter their background in education. The teachers give their support and work hard every day and leave late every night in office hours to ensure that children understand the content. It's a school based on college readiness and has done an amazing job doing so.", 'I am undergraduate student 4th year mechanical engineering student at wachemo university in Ethiopia so too interested in field of maths; engineering ,sport. I too hope to learn those.', "From my 9th grade year to now my senior year i have seen both my self and the school grow.This is a school that really wants all of its students to succeed. With office hours and dress code you're prepared both for college and job opportunities. In this school there is no way you can fail with reassessment opportunities which is when you can take a test as many times as you need until you succeed.", 'As a student of MESA I have, to be honest about what I truly think of the school and that is that I personally like the school. It is a school where one could be comfortable being who you truly are without anyone making fun of one because of that. In a sense, we are also like a family because we have what is called Advisory and we are in a classroom with other students and we talk about our day or play games. We stay with that group from 9th grade all the wy to 10th grand. In the school, bonding is really important that we even take bonding trips the second week of school. MESA and everyone in it is family to me. The only thing I would like there to be is more of a diversity. People from other races entering the school would be great.', 'The teachers at my school put all of their students before everything and make sure our road to a better future is smooth. They never give up on us no matter how much we struggle. One thing that is really special about them is that they always stay after school to help students who did not get the topics in class and they would stay for however long you want. Now that is perseverance.', 'The school makes it impossible to fail anything', 'All the teachers treat students as if they were their own child']

['In my freshmen year, the building was old fashioned and dirty most of the time. Teachers for the most part were nice but others were rude and critical. They would be too judgmental and unsympathetic towards the students and it made situations worse. This does not help students excel in the future and the school should take some time to properly interview teachers. Now that I am a senior, the school has changed physically with security which everyone appreciates. But should still focus on providing general academics to students before they graduate, like more discussions about college/universities/ scholarships, other job careers to partake in because school is not for everybody, secrets to success and how to properly use money to buy a house/car (dealerships)/ bills/taxes. Sometimes help is not always available for questions like these, teachers will tell you just look it up online.  That is not helpful and shows there is no partnership between teachers and students.', 'I do enjoy Dunellen High School. It has a small-town feel and so everyone knows everyone. Thanks to this, there was practically no-bullying my entire time there. It is obvious that the teachers care about their students, whether the kid is in any AP classes or not. It was very easy to build up personal relationships with my teachers and all of them were extremely respectable and kind. It was easy to get into sports which made it possible for everyone to gain enough skill to become a varsity player.', 'I would like to see the facilities upgraded because they seem out of date, although the community in Dunellen and within the high school is very tight-knit and family-esque.', 'Dunellen High School consists of well-educated teachers that do truly care about the students and provide extra help for any student. There is a good variety of courses to take and overall produces many successful students that will blossom. The clubs are limited and the funding is not provided equally, yet the Dunellen students always turn their clubs into something great with the materials they are given. Throughout my experience at Dunellen High School, I have met many people and participated in almost everything Dunellen High School offers. I have benefitted by seeing the diversity of people and it has given me the knowledge to further my education and my experiences. Although some experiences were challenging, there were teachers and peers around to boost my confidence and encourage me. My overall experience there provided astounding education. Plus all the hardships and problems that came to me during my four years have prepared me for adult life.', "Dunellen has limited resources which tends to give students a disadvantage when it comes time to apply for colleges. While it's great for developing relations with teachers and getting valuable recommendation letters, some teachers are not good which can all but rule out taking their classes.", 'Dunellen high school was alright, it’s a small town so everyone knows each other. I think it’s a place where you can really feel at home. Some changes I would like to see are some upgrades in the building.', 'Grade levels are small in size, making it easier to remember the names/faces of fellow students.  The small size of the student body allows for students from different grade levels to interact more.  Most teachers are willing to provide extra time before or after school for students seeking help in their classes.  The school has a decent variety of clubs and organizations that are open for any student to join.  A pressing safety concern is how people are routinely let into the school by students and faculty alike without definite identification.  Sports are a large part of student life, but the most widely attended to sports  are football and basketball, with other sports often being neglected despite their numerous achievements.  All students are provided with a chromebook to be used for academic purposes both in and out of the classroom.  The best addition of resources to the school is the state of the art computer lab, consisting of 20+ Mac computers, a 3D printer, and a VR.', 'The classes are small and the teachers are able to give you one on one help. The students are nice and respect others. Small town atmosphere is nice too.', 'I love how small my high school is which makes it easier to get involved with sports and clubs. This also makes it easier for more students to try new things since almost all the clubs and sports are willing to work with each other to allow students to do both so the students can get to enjoy as much after school life as possible.', "Dunellen Highschool is great because it's small and intimate. Which allows teachers to reach and teach their student better.", 'It was a small town school, thus not as many options for classes we’re offered.  However due to the small town nature it was easy to make connections with the teachers and participate in multiple after school activities while getting extra help form teachers if needed. The school did well for small town as well and offered multiple AP classes and provided chrome books for the students.', "Dunellen is a mile by mile town with a small downtown area. The main street is filled with family owned restaurants , a movie theater, grocery store, pharmacy,  and many other small businesses. The main street is a fun place to grab a movie, food or take a stroll.  I have attended Dunellen's schools since Kindergarten and although we are not a big district offering more subject and elective, the schools do offer a small classroom size and teachers who really care about each student. Our sports program is small, but every student has a chance to play on JV or Varsity.  We may be small, but we are huge in school spirit!!", 'Majority of Dunellen is based on favoritism. If you are part of the football team, you are basically pardoned when it comes to discipline and bad grades. Was basically a bubble. Everyone strived to look the same and act the same. Not diverse at all, I was called the  N word my first year. I was also seen as an " aggressive black woman" because I cared a lot about my grades and argued a lot about things I was passionate about like new clubs that brought together students of color and LGBTQ+( which were, by the way, all not approved. All in all, the only reason why I gave Dunellen two stars instead of one was because of the fact that it is a smaller school meaning more hands one education.', 'It is a small school so it’s great for connections with friends and extra help. However, it only has the main sports and clubs so if you’re looking for something specialized it is not the right place.', 'All 4 of our children graduated from Dunellen High School.  We have seen the extracurricular activities go downhill, especially the music and drama productions, over the years.  Good teachers are retiring, and young, inexperienced teachers are filling the void.  The good news is that there is a new Superintendent of Schools, and I expect him to create a more vibrant school culture, and share a real vision for improving the schools--the High School in particular.  All 4 of our children have gone on to very good colleges (3 of them were top 5 in their class), but more and more we hear that their classmates are dropping out of college, and I feel that college prep is NOT a strong suit at DHS.   It is a small district that has placed too much emphasis on sports and not enough on the kinds of activities that really help kids succeed and thrive in college and life.  Overall I rate DHS about average versus like sized High Schools in New Jersey.', "Dunellen Daycare at it's finest. Very fun times if you are buddies with the faculty and administration. You can do anything - literally anything- if you want to", 'We offer and do a lot for the community', "We don't seem to have any issues", 'we are a small school in a small town. Everyone really supports everyone.', 'I wish we had more clubs']
column4: ['In my freshmen year, the building was old fashioned and dirty most of the time. Teachers for the most part were nice but others were rude and critical. They would be too judgmental and unsympathetic towards the students and it made situations worse. This does not help students excel in the future and the school should take some time to properly interview teachers. Now that I am a senior, the school has changed physically with security which everyone appreciates. But should still focus on providing general academics to students before they graduate, like more discussions about college/universities/ scholarships, other job careers to partake in because school is not for everybody, secrets to success and how to properly use money to buy a house/car (dealerships)/ bills/taxes. Sometimes help is not always available for questions like these, teachers will tell you just look it up online.  That is not helpful and shows there is no partnership between teachers and students.', 'I do enjoy Dunellen High School. It has a small-town feel and so everyone knows everyone. Thanks to this, there was practically no-bullying my entire time there. It is obvious that the teachers care about their students, whether the kid is in any AP classes or not. It was very easy to build up personal relationships with my teachers and all of them were extremely respectable and kind. It was easy to get into sports which made it possible for everyone to gain enough skill to become a varsity player.', 'I would like to see the facilities upgraded because they seem out of date, although the community in Dunellen and within the high school is very tight-knit and family-esque.', 'Dunellen High School consists of well-educated teachers that do truly care about the students and provide extra help for any student. There is a good variety of courses to take and overall produces many successful students that will blossom. The clubs are limited and the funding is not provided equally, yet the Dunellen students always turn their clubs into something great with the materials they are given. Throughout my experience at Dunellen High School, I have met many people and participated in almost everything Dunellen High School offers. I have benefitted by seeing the diversity of people and it has given me the knowledge to further my education and my experiences. Although some experiences were challenging, there were teachers and peers around to boost my confidence and encourage me. My overall experience there provided astounding education. Plus all the hardships and problems that came to me during my four years have prepared me for adult life.', "Dunellen has limited resources which tends to give students a disadvantage when it comes time to apply for colleges. While it's great for developing relations with teachers and getting valuable recommendation letters, some teachers are not good which can all but rule out taking their classes.", 'Dunellen high school was alright, it’s a small town so everyone knows each other. I think it’s a place where you can really feel at home. Some changes I would like to see are some upgrades in the building.', 'Grade levels are small in size, making it easier to remember the names/faces of fellow students.  The small size of the student body allows for students from different grade levels to interact more.  Most teachers are willing to provide extra time before or after school for students seeking help in their classes.  The school has a decent variety of clubs and organizations that are open for any student to join.  A pressing safety concern is how people are routinely let into the school by students and faculty alike without definite identification.  Sports are a large part of student life, but the most widely attended to sports  are football and basketball, with other sports often being neglected despite their numerous achievements.  All students are provided with a chromebook to be used for academic purposes both in and out of the classroom.  The best addition of resources to the school is the state of the art computer lab, consisting of 20+ Mac computers, a 3D printer, and a VR.', 'The classes are small and the teachers are able to give you one on one help. The students are nice and respect others. Small town atmosphere is nice too.', 'I love how small my high school is which makes it easier to get involved with sports and clubs. This also makes it easier for more students to try new things since almost all the clubs and sports are willing to work with each other to allow students to do both so the students can get to enjoy as much after school life as possible.', "Dunellen Highschool is great because it's small and intimate. Which allows teachers to reach and teach their student better.", 'It was a small town school, thus not as many options for classes we’re offered.  However due to the small town nature it was easy to make connections with the teachers and participate in multiple after school activities while getting extra help form teachers if needed. The school did well for small town as well and offered multiple AP classes and provided chrome books for the students.', "Dunellen is a mile by mile town with a small downtown area. The main street is filled with family owned restaurants , a movie theater, grocery store, pharmacy,  and many other small businesses. The main street is a fun place to grab a movie, food or take a stroll. Our sports program is small, but every student has a chance to play on JV or Varsity.  We may be small, but we are huge in school spirit!!", 'Majority of Dunellen is based on favoritism. If you are part of the football team, you are basically pardoned when it comes to discipline and bad grades. Was basically a bubble. Everyone strived to look the same and act the same. I was also seen as an " aggressive black woman" because I cared a lot about my grades and argued a lot about things I was passionate about like new clubs that brought together students of color and LGBTQ+( which were, by the way, all not approved. All in all, the only reason why I gave Dunellen two stars instead of one was because of the fact that it is a smaller school meaning more hands one education.', 'It is a small school so it’s great for connections with friends and extra help. You can do anything - literally anything- if you want to", 'We offer and do a lot for the community', "We don't seem to have any issues", 'we are a small school in a small town. Everyone really supports everyone.', 'I wish we had more clubs']
column6: ['The best part of going to my high school was the mentors, the teachers that cared about you, not because you are an athlete or  honor roll students , but because you are not. Who appreciated  you as a student/person who loves art, wood shop and computers. They guided you because they knew you would succeed in high school because of your character and maturity..\r Going to a small school, enabled teacher to get to know you and lend a hand or just be a sounding board.', 'Average bully, dress code and attendance policies.\r Dress code not ready involved as per stated policy.\r Strong Principal  and Vice Principal present in hall throughout day, passing during passing time.\r Average Guidance Counselor involvement. \r Office staff very helpful and caring.\r Nurse is very caring and involved.', "I was fortunate to have many great teachers, although there were a few that were set in their ways, not open to the way students of the 21 st century think and learn.\r A small town school is more personable, you have a relationship with the teachers, many live in the town or grew up here, so they are supportive of  improving the school's academic program. The teaching style varies based on the age of the teacher and subject being taught.  Each teachers has thier own rubric for grading, teacher are approachable when it comes to asking about a grade.", 'Small schools do not have the student population or staff to support many clubs.\r My high school had the Drama Club, Biology Club, French and Spanish Clubs.\r A few students were involved in Choir and Pep- band, while others were athletes doing 2-3 sports per year.\r Although there were interested by students to start new clubs and sport teams, there was very little adminstrative support for after school activities or other fun entertaining events.', 'Early in my senior year, I was accepted at my first choice of colleges, which I am currently attending.\r Was I prepared for the real world... no  I was not!  After growing up in a small town, graduating with 84 students, you have known since kindergarten, some since preschool, I was not prepared socially or academically as students from larger districts. It was emotion struggle the first semester, making friends with the same values and upbringing. Academically I struggled with writing papers and study skills.\r I heard from many students in my graduation class I was not alone, they too were struggling.', 'This school was overall a good part of my life. I met a lot of wonderful people who have influenced my life, like the staff. Two of the teachers at this school are actually the reason why I figured out the which career path to go on. Once you get past how small the school is and get involved in something your time here will get 20 times better.', 'I personally enjoy the food here, but wish that we did have more options and a lengthened lunch time.', 'There are barely any issues in this school. The administration does very well.', "All the fields we use for the sports are of public use so the people who handle the parks and recreation keep things in order. In the weight room specifically at the football field and in the high school is in need of some new equipment, but the space is limited so the new objects probably wouldn't have a place. An addition of a pool would be wonderful, but once again there is limited space and money so I'm not very sure where it would go.", 'The teachers at this school are wonderful in what they do. Though I have personally struggled in a few subjects teachers made themselves available to help me whenever I asked them .', "The school is good I just wished that during my four years of attendance that there were more classes or clubs added. Specifically I would've greatly enjoyed a psychology or cooking class. \r This school is wonderful when it comes to getting extra help and you can easily get one on one time with the teachers. Everyone is very helpful and you get a family feeling at the school. I just wish we had more money so we would've been able to go on more trips and have more activities for the students to get involved in.", 'needs better, and more, guidance counselors', 'kids get a decent education but not exceptional', 'small school no excessive security', 'most policies are fine some are arbitrary and unnecessary', 'not much to choose from', 'Really challenging in a variety of ways', 'There is a lot that is offered here!', "The administration is very restrictive on what is permitted in my school. It's hard to start something new or get something approved by the BOE. The Superintendent, who is finally retiring this year, does not support the students nearly as much as he should. I hear many complaints about the BOE in school. ", "My high school has its issues, like a seemingly inactive Superintendent and teachers of mixed levels of skill. But overall, I really enjoy going to my school. My friends, teachers, and experiences have made the past four years of my life wonderful. It's small and not overwhelming. Even though we aren't the richest or highest in academics, there is still great enthusiasm for sports and other activities. "]

column2: ['It’s ok at the least. There’s one or two gangs and the teachers act like they’re oblivious. There are some teachers who are amazing though and as an honors student, if it wasn’t for them, I wouldn’t be able to go on to Ivy League', 'I hope within the coming years that the school culture with academic integrity betters. I wish for students to be more motivated to learn because the teachers there are absolutely phenomenal.', 'Brick Memorial High School is a fantastic academic school with plenty of clubs for all students. The teachers and administrators are extremely supportive and helpful for any circumstances. However, the one thing about the school that needs to change is the respect for and within the school. The students lack respect, leading to issues such as vaping in the halls and bathrooms. Overall, this school is spectacular for academics.', 'I am a recent graduate of Brick Memorial. Overall, I had a great experience here because of the student I was. I pushed myself to be out going and to challenge myself and therefore I took more preparatory classes. I was involved in many clubs and sports such as PALS, Key Club, softball, and soccer. I had teachers who cared tremendously about me, and not just about my grades. If I had the choice to attend any high school, I would definitely choose BMHS again.', 'I had a wonderful experience at Brick Memorial high-school.  I had some of the most wonderful teachers.  The faculty and administration truly cared about the students and their academic performance.  As a high level AP student I was well prepared for the rigors of academia on the college level.  One teacher that stands out to me is my AP Chemistry teacher at Brick Memorial High School.  She made science enjoyable and lead me in the direction of being physician assistant.  She also helped us present an AP chemistry show that showed the younger students in our district about the fun science has to offer.  Upon graduation fro Brick Memorial High School I enrolled at Temple University in Philadelphia, PA. Adjusting to city live has been challenging.  Adapting to a new life and carrying a difficult science curriculum has been invigorating.  I look forward to completing the balancing act and attending graduate school to pursue a career.in medicine as a physicians assistant.', "This school has many positive traits to its name. For example, it has a fantastic school spirit, inspirational teachers that always put the student first, material second, and also an immensely helpful guidance department. However, like all schools, this one has its negative traits as well. For example, college preparation. This has a lot of problems. For example, I am in a CP Calculus class this semester, and I compared my class to a college level Calc course, and we wouldn't even learn half of the stuff one would learn in a college level calc course. Also, the anti-bullying department. Say if one was falsely accused of something (as I was), that person would be considered guilty until proven innocent.", 'BTMHS was an okay school but there were not many opportunities for higher level classes. Most teachers were mediocre but some were passionate about their field and made class exciting, which was mostly science teachers. If I did not take AP courses during my time there, I would have felt unprepared for college. The guidance department was terrible and never helped me with college admissions. There were also not many clubs that interested me.', 'As a student, I have enjoyed my years here at Brick Memorial High School (BMHS). I came into this large public high school from a small private one and I found my groove right away. With all clubs and organizations offered, there is something for everyone whether it be golf or even Bible club and everything in between. The teachers truly reflect all that one would want them to... They are always there for their students no matter what. With a great range of many classes offered, students are really able to enroll in classes which interest them... Classes that will later her direct a direction for career.', 'A list of scholarship opportunities on Niche.com suggested writing a review of my school so that I could be entered to win $1,000. OCC wasn\'t available when I searched for it, so here we are. BM is your average public high school. People called things "beat" a lot when I was there and that was annoying. My experience was bad because I was mentally checked out about 1/3 of the way through my junior year; I honestly don\'t even remember most of it. I do recommend joining a sport or club or Spanish/French/Italian honor society because you\'ll probably make some friends and you might get to go on a trip to Florida or Canada or Europe.', 'Brick is a great place to go, the teachers are the best. The athletic environment is very encouraged. The studies are excellent. It is a very welcoming and friendly place. You can have so many connections with the school. Including relationships with friends, teachers, principles, coaches, almost anyone.', 'I enjoyed the teachers and how some of them taught here. The students in the school are various types and are very clique-y.', 'My experience at Brick Township Memorial has been far from normal, it has been amazing! From the staff and teachers going out of their way and beyond to help students with class work and personal situations, to most importantly teaching the students skills and lesson that are needed for future endeavors.', "Everyone was always so kind and willing to help with anything. I was involved in sports and clubs and met many new friends through them. I had trouble in math quite often and my teachers were always willing to help me get through it. Brick Memorial High School helped me prepare for college and now I can't wait to be a nurse one day.", 'I love Brick Memorial, so diverse and so many good memories. The academics here are pretty good and all the teachers are so involved to better our education. At Brick Memorial we have a lot of school pride.', 'Brick memorial has very good school spirt and teachers are always there to help you but the food sucks. The academics depend on what teacher and the level of class you are taking, honors and CP are very different. The classes can sometimes be hard but if you work hard the teachers recognize that and will be there to help you. Make sure to get involved in many clubs because we have great options that will really help you to meet new people and get involved in the community.', 'It is very fun and filled with much School spirit. The main events are usually football games and basketball games, we are always encouraged to support them. The teachers are very good at their jobs at teaching us.', 'It’s a good school, it does lack in some areas, but other than that, I’ve had a pretty good experience here.', 'Regarding my time in Brick Memorial, it was a typical high school experience. I engaged in many clubs through my four years and they were fun while they lasted. Student Government Association is the one club that still keeps in contact with its alumni. I joined many sports too and they offered many learning experiences. The AP courses in Brick Memorial High School allowed me to get a head start in college. The non-honors classes are a waste of time and energy and the elective  financial literacy did not help me with my every day life. Instead it took out a semester of my 4 years that I could have done something else.', "Around every corner you're sure to see a fight breaking out, someone vaping right in your face, or a group of people standing directly in the middle of the hallway and/or walking so slowly that you wonder how it's humanly possible for someone to walk so slowly. And somehow, people have the energy to scream at seven in the morning while some of us are still half asleep. However, we do have a great Arts program. Our marching band has won several competitions and is present at every football game. Our chorus and drama, while pretty unknown, consistently put on amazing performances. Overall, that has been the only memorable part of my high school experience.", "It's a great high school with an outstanding amount of school spirit and pride. The teachers are all happy to teach you and it's a very welcoming school. It really is a great day to be a Mustang!"]

And somehow, people have the energy to scream at seven in the morning while some of us are still half asleep. However, we do have a great Arts program. Our marching band has won several competitions and is present at every football game. Our chorus and drama, while pretty unknown, consistently put on amazing performances. Overall, that has been the only memorable part of my high school experience.", "It's a great high school with an outstanding amount of school spirit and pride. The teachers are all happy to teach you and it's a very welcoming school. It really is a great day to be a Mustang!"]
column6: ['I loved Brick Memorial because of the relationships I had with my teachers. They really put the time and effort into getting me academically prepared for college. I took honors and AP and i do not regret it. While it was difficult at times, it made me so much more ready to take on the assignments that I received in college.', 'Without hesitation, I can say that I had a great high school experience at Brick Memorial. Teachers were always there to help, along with other staff members. School spirit runs high in this school, creating a fun and uniting environment through sports and other school activities.', 'Brick Memorial has some very highly qualified teachers which really do know the content and how to teach. there are some areas in the school which need to be fixed, but overall there is not many complaints that i have about it.', 'My experience at Brick Memorial high school had its ups and downs. The teachers here are not really anything special unless you take honors or AP classes. One good thing I can say about this school how much fun the sports were and how many different people I met. I really did like it here though. I had a bunch of great memories with great people. The only problem with the sports was the coaches but other than that I had a great time. The administration was the worst part of this school. They made this school feel like a prison at times. They had so many unnecessary rules.', 'As a transfer student to the school I full have been able to develop solid opinions based upon other evidence of what I have been through. While generally problematic, the school had some pros still. Mainly, this was the teaching staff, many of the teachers whom I had were very nice and effective as teachers.', 'I liked the teachers that I had and the courses that were available. I feel it prepared me for college and beyond. However, the building needs some renovation.', 'I wish that Brick Memorial was more organized and had a better system of getting in contact with students and parents. I also wish that the students here behaved better, because it is honestly embarrassing to be known for being a student here because of the way my peers act.', 'Brick Memorial is a pretty good school and there are a wide range of classes you can take. In my experience it is an above average highschool.', 'My experience at my high school was very good. I have only been here two years and I have never been happier because my last school was not as great. I would like to see the students show more respect and some teachers to show respect.', 'I loved attending brick memorial high school. Most of the teachers really care about the students and will work with you to make sure you succeed. Overall the environment is relaxed and friendly.', 'Transitioning from middle school to high school was made fairly smooth with Brick Memorial. I had a good and memorable four years in the school. I had some good teachers and some other teachers who were not so good, but not every teacher is going to be perfect or your favorite. I met my best friends through this school. I also figured out which way I wanted to go career path wise through some of the courses I took throughout the years. Overall well experience going to the high school that helped shape me as a person.', 'I feel very well prepared for college because of our excellent guidance department and passionate teachers.', 'I was involved in the dance and softball team. I was a member of the key club and the peer counselor group. I took honors classes and college courses as a senior. I am a proud member of the Italian Honor Society.  I am a Mustang through and through and I support all of our school sports.', 'Brick Memorial were four of my most interesting years of my life. Over the course of my high school career, I have met some of my favorite teachers I have ever had. This school is dedicated to making students prepared for college, and they have great programs for getting students involved, such as school events or multiple extracurricular activities. While some of the administration were somewhat mediocre, the dedication and passion that all teachers at Brick Memorial had more than made up for it. Overall, it is a great school that helped shaped me into the person I am today.', "The school that I attend, Brick Memorial, is practically your average High School. My senior year has been going quite swell. My grades have been stellar, my teachers have been fantastic, and I have enjoyed most of my time at Brick Memorial. I have learned to study hard, never stop putting my best foot forward, and stop my procrastination; but I wish I was more prepared to take on the realm of College. Socially, most of my friends are graduated, however I have not found my clique. There are a plethora of cliques in my school, yet they aren't very welcoming. All in all, I am quite content with my experience at Brick Memorial High School.", 'Brick memorial is a place where the average student can flourish.  Although we have an award winning marching band (which I am a part of) and an amazing choral and drama department, the visual arts get significantly less funding than the sports who win significantly less.  Also, while they say they are intolerant of bully behavior, the teachers do not acknowledge the existence of bullies in the school, for I have been bullied on many occasions and have gone to teacher, for them to do absolutely nothing about it.  However, I have gotten a pretty good education here, and am excited to continue learning into college.', "The most memorable thing about Brick Memorial High School is by far the school spirit. As soon as the Friday night lights glow, the stands are packed, and the student section goes wild for the mustangs! It is such a part of our lives that in offseason, we get football game withdrawals! The coaches are teachers and do just as well on the sideline as they do in the classroom. There is no place I'd rather be!", 'Brick Memorial High School is a public high school in the township of Brick, New Jersey. My personal experience there is very average. The students, for the most part, have great spirit and energy, the teachers possess the tools to teach us the best they can and the facility help the students in any way they can. The one thing I would complain is our textbooks in nearly every class the front cover is ripped and there are drawings on every page.', 'Brick memorial is all about school pride and showing thoughout the town, especially when it comes down to our cross town rival sports games. Brick memorial is also indulged in the aspect of broadening our perspective on learning, as well as opening our minds to what to expect entering college. Going to brick memorial has impacted my life in a very positive way.', 'At Brick Memorial I was able to express myself in the things I love but alsp learn from the incredible teachers at Brick Memorial. The teachers really care about each student and want to help make them succeed. Being in chorus all 4 years also made school very enjoyable.']

column2: ['The school is alright, mix between motivated, good students and obnoxious students who have no interest in learning. Mediocre athletics, mediocre school spirit.', 'Overall I hate a good experience. I will say that in order to have a good experience you have to do some kind of club or sport here, just get involved some way.', 'A benefit of Bunnell is the care that teachers and administration provide for their students. It is a safe environment that allows students to feel comfortable and accepted throughout their teenage years. One negative is the lack of school spirit that students have. It would be better if more students want to get involved in clubs, sports, and other extracurricular activities.', 'I like how culturally diverse the school is as well as the opportunities available to explore different career options through courses.', "There were a lot of great teachers at Bunnell. However, I did not like the administration as much. They weren't very friendly. I didn't like the common core concept of teaching, it made things much more difficult than needed.", 'Bunnell is great in many aspects, but I feel that the best part of my high school experience is the diversity that Bunnell has to offer. It really prepares me and other students for what’s to come out in the real world.', "I studied at Bunnell HS all four years. Overall it was a good experience, however there are some changes that could be made. I wish there was more choices of AP classes that can prepare students for college. I also wish that we had classes that focused on SAT's and  I wish that the teachers focused more on the college readiness of students.", "Bunnell is a okay school. The kids are pretty nice  here but some act very rude at times. The academics are very good  and the teachers are nice. There's a lot of clubs and if there's not a club you like you can make your own.The sports are okay it can be better. A lot of other school are taking our best players. The school can do better with college readiness. I do feel safe in the school. The food is okay And administration is really great.", 'Bunnell high school was a horrible experience Staff is horrible,They do nothing about bullying.Its very unsafe. Horrible place i wouldnt reccomend,Homophobic People Everywhere. Bullying is terrible', 'My experience at Bunnell was a very good one. It was a great environment and the school really prepared me for college. The teachers are great and really care about their impact on the students. As an alum I wouldn’t trade my time there for anything. I am still part of the school community and go out and support at events whenever I get the chance.', 'The teachers were always there for you and really tried to help as much as possible. Every class was a great learning experience, only flaw was that everything was very strict such as walking in the halls for bathroom purposes, etc.', 'Education wise , the school was great but when it came to administration , the school struggled to maintain an inviting environment .', 'My high school for 4 years. I am a senior now, and I am very well prepared for college next year. There are so many AP classes for your talking. School can be a little bland at times, however looking back it was a great experience, and everyone else would enjoy it just as much as long as they put in the effort.', 'I think the teachers are great, they are very fun and know what they are talking about along with being engaging and keeping the class from being boring. I think Bunnell focuses a little to much on sports and sometimes tries small ideas that are not the most effective such as digital hall passes. I think that the diversity of people is a good mix of everyone and I would say that the school is very inclusive. I think Bunnell has decent resources, some areas are really good such as the engineering and more hands on stuff, while other areas due have a lack of tools to work with. I believe that Bunnell does a pretty good job on helping students prepare for college,  guidance counselors are helpful and willing to help people at all times and during any step of the way.', "I've attended Bunnell High School for four years. Coming in as a freshman I was extremely nervous but the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Every teacher I’ve had at Bunnell has gone out of there way to help me excel in their class. Teachers will stay after everyday just to help students. I've have participated in sports, clubs and activities at Bunell and they are always fun. Spots teams have such a good bond that even losing a game does not discourage them and they will always fight no matter the score.I've made so many friends throughout the years. Bunnell has culture week, spirit week, and positivity week. We also have pep rallies that include singing, lettuce eating contest, and tug of war and so much.I love my school and I am proud to be apart of it and a proud soon to be alumni. I would suggest that Bunnell should try to have more school spirit at sporting events, since I’ve seen a decrease over the years.", 'I think it’s a very good school that cares about the students and their educations. The teachers are invested and know how to work with the students.', 'The thing that will leave an impact on my memory of this school is the mass opportunities they have for their students. For example, they have several pathway programs for engineering, medical field, child education, etc for those who want a head start of knowing if that is the specific pathway they want in their lives, rather than making that decision in college. Their consistent thinking about the students, for example they recently created a breakfast kiosk on the go, making it easier for students to get breakfast. The things that I would like changed in this school would be the lunch they serve.  I want more well cooked meals.', "It's an alright school nothing really special. There's no AC downstairs at all so in the warmer months the school gets really warm and smelly. We have teachers that are really cool and fun. and then teachers that make everything horrible for everyone. The lunch at school is meh sometimes that have really good food and other times it's like gross. But hey it's school lunch so I don't really expect much.   The wifi is terrible and the school/board of ed is always constantly watching what sites students go on and the literally block everything. You can barely google something without it being blocked and youtube hardly works. They found out that students were using VPNs to browse sites that were normally blocked and now all of VPNs don't work in the school at all.", 'Bunnell High School is a diverse school which has a significant value in our lives. We get to see people from every economic and cultural background, use those differences for unification. We also have many career pathways that prepare us for the world and help us get a head start in the fields we want to be in. My only complaint is the lack of passion in our school administration. The connection between administration and the students is of low quality and disappointing.', 'I like the opportunities that were made possible by Bunnell High School, and impact those opportunities had on me. I was able to grow and achieve so many things throughout my four years. I would have never thought I would be able to accomplish so much in such a short amount of time.']

column6: ['I attended Bunnell High School for all 4 years of high!school, my experience was very enjoyable. The variety of clubs allowed me to enjoy my educational journey while participating in the things I love to do, like playing sports and singing in choir.', "It's because of Bunnell and their motivating staff why I'm pursuing the career I'm going for in CCSU.", 'I like the science teachers and some of administration because they do their job for the most part. However, they did poorly with defending the teachers when the superintendent proposed furlough days to help with the low budget.', 'Bunnell is an ok school. It can be pretty hard to wake up and go to it. Administration have favorites and dont really care about all students like they say they do, all together bunnell is regular annoying high school.', 'Overall Bunnell was an okay school, one thing that was great about the school was their sports team and there are a handful of teachers that actually want to see their students succeed.', "What i like about Bunnell High School is the environment because of how the teachers are helpful and the students/ classmates are friendly. The faculty at Bunnell is very helpful especially for seniors getting ready for college. The sports at Bunnell are very important to us because they make the whole school come together and put their differences aside. The safety is excellent because they're very cautious of who comes near the school. I personally don't think anything at Bunnell should change, everything seems to run fluently.", 'Some teachers made Bunnell feel like home, working to not only help you grow as a student but as a person. Many classes are fun and amazing where others are lacking in quality and an experienced teacher.', 'I believe the sports should combine with the the other town high school (Stratford High School).  Our teams are too small and not competitive enough to excel in our bracket. With the combined high schools, we would be able to have more skilled teams with more athletes.', 'I would love to see more tech availability, better college readiness, and food. Bunnell has a significant sports program, the teachers can vary in difficulty, some clubs are entertaining while others lack enthusiasm and organization, and administration has changed way too many times.I feel as if the facilities should be refined since some have broken toilets and sinks and there should be more facilities available.', "Honestly its an ok school. some of the teachers get it while others don't care. the food was not good. the cookies were. they need more classes that talk about the real world.", "its okay I would say they need more money but its a good school. I think the teach are eh they are more about the money and hate their job. the kid is nice and there's no bullying it just people doing their work im happy to go to Bunnell it a good school everybody should know that even thought it has it flaws it is a great school just need the right ppl to fix it", "Not bad for a school. Some of the rules can be a bit ridiculous. Though compared to other schools it is in the middle for quality. I have to say the vibe between students is usually always good and is not the type of school where you'd find students fighting at all.", "My experience at Bunnell has been the greatest. I'm thankful for everyone I've got to meet. I'm thankful for the lessons I've been taught.", "It is an overall good school, just the foundations aren't there. Some of my favorite teachers ever, however, teach at this school.", "My high school experience was wonderful. I couldn't say that I didn't get the full high school experience because everything a high school student could think about doing was available to them.", 'The things I enjoy about my school are the sports and activities that are available to me, how helpful and understanding my teachers are and the fact that there is always something for someone to become involved in.', "Over the past four years at Bunnell High School I have experienced the good and the bad. The proudest moment I had there was walking across the stage at graduation because there were hard times through the year that made me question if I would be able to do it. They have incredible teachers and counselors who kept me balanced through the years. Some people may say that the teachers don't care about you but from my own experience I know they want to see each and every student to succeed. I feel on a social level everyone finds their own place in Bunnell.", "I like all of the teacher in Bunnell High School. They all truly care about you passing and helping it get the best grade possible. I don't like the favoritism of the football team and the boys basketball team. Bunnell's principal is every school spirited and has a lot of enthusiasm but only acknowledges those two sports. As a girls soccer captain it annoys me to not get recognized since we did very well this season.", "This is not the best . I hope you take my review into consideration. Thank you so so much. It could be a lot better. Ya know the food is not the best. And they didn't take away finals for us. SO NOT FAIR !!!!", 'I have had good mentors in HOSA and I like the diversity of the school. I also enjoy the AP classes. I would like to get better advice concerning colleges and am not always happy with the administrative policies.']
