I personally don't think anything at Bunnell should change, everything seems to run fluently.", 'Some teachers made Bunnell feel like home, working to not only help you grow as a student but as a person. Many classes are fun and amazing where others are lacking in quality and an experienced teacher.', 'I believe the sports should combine with the the other town high school (Stratford High School).  Our teams are too small and not competitive enough to excel in our bracket. With the combined high schools, we would be able to have more skilled teams with more athletes.', 'I would love to see more tech availability, better college readiness, and food. Bunnell has a significant sports program, the teachers can vary in difficulty, some clubs are entertaining while others lack enthusiasm and organization, and administration has changed way too many times.I feel as if the facilities should be refined since some have broken toilets and sinks and there should be more facilities available.', "Honestly its an ok school. some of the teachers get it while others don't care. the food was not good. the cookies were. they need more classes that talk about the real world.", "its okay I would say they need more money but its a good school. I think the teach are eh they are more about the money and hate their job. the kid is nice and there's no bullying it just people doing their work im happy to go to Bunnell it a good school everybody should know that even thought it has it flaws it is a great school just need the right ppl to fix it", "Not bad for a school. Some of the rules can be a bit ridiculous. Though compared to other schools it is in the middle for quality. I have to say the vibe between students is usually always good and is not the type of school where you'd find students fighting at all.", "My experience at Bunnell has been the greatest. I'm thankful for everyone I've got to meet. I'm thankful for the lessons I've been taught.", "It is an overall good school, just the foundations aren't there. Some of my favorite teachers ever, however, teach at this school.", "My high school experience was wonderful. I couldn't say that I didn't get the full high school experience because everything a high school student could think about doing was available to them.", 'The things I enjoy about my school are the sports and activities that are available to me, how helpful and understanding my teachers are and the fact that there is always something for someone to become involved in.', "Over the past four years at Bunnell High School I have experienced the good and the bad. The proudest moment I had there was walking across the stage at graduation because there were hard times through the year that made me question if I would be able to do it. They have incredible teachers and counselors who kept me balanced through the years. Some people may say that the teachers don't care about you but from my own experience I know they want to see each and every student to succeed. I feel on a social level everyone finds their own place in Bunnell.", "I like all of the teacher in Bunnell High School. They all truly care about you passing and helping it get the best grade possible. I don't like the favoritism of the football team and the boys basketball team. Bunnell's principal is every school spirited and has a lot of enthusiasm but only acknowledges those two sports. As a girls soccer captain it annoys me to not get recognized since we did very well this season.", "This is not the best . I hope you take my review into consideration. Thank you so so much. It could be a lot better. Ya know the food is not the best. And they didn't take away finals for us. SO NOT FAIR !!!!", 'I have had good mentors in HOSA and I like the diversity of the school. I also enjoy the AP classes. I would like to get better advice concerning colleges and am not always happy with the administrative policies.']

column1: Coney Island Preparatory Public Charter School
column2: ["I transfer into Coney Island prep for my 10 grade year. They welcomed me with open arms. The community felt like a family the way that they treated all of their students. I wouldn't change anything about the school. They are concerned about the children well being at this school.", 'Dispite the fact that the starting of 2018 the school had a bomb threat and a possession of a gun and knife in the school we share the building with I feel really safe in the school building.', 'This is a school where you are prepared to go to college. This is stressed ever since I entered the school in fifth grade. Being in a small school will have some drawbacks in the future, but I have bonded with all of my peers. The teachers here focus on getting you the grades to get into the college that is desired.', 'I love the challenging classes that we have because we can push ourselves to solve new problems everyday. I would love to see the displenatary system change.', 'Going there prepared for the many challenges that I face now  in college. Going there has set me up for success.', 'I was able to push myself academically but the school was very strict on behavior. The clubs, when I was there, were freelanced and could be developed by a student with supervision. Some staff were supporting and some were... eh! The culture was family-orientated. The safety of the school is good. However, the food was and still is horrible.', "Coney Island Preparatory Public School is one of the best schools out there. The school really strives for their students. From the 5th grade our main focus was college. We've visited countless colleges and have countless opportunities. Every year, the school offers a select few students, in their Sophomore and Junior year, the ability to study abroad or participate in a precollege program. Personally, I have been to Johns Hopkins University(Engineering Innovation: an engineering precollege program that covered many types of engineering within a month) and the University of Michigan(ArcStart: an architecture program). The school even has a course called College and Career Readiness that teaches us about college and life and helps us apply to colleges and get everything we need in order.", 'Decent small-sized school, though there does seem to be a huge bias when it comes to politicization of work. (very left leaning)', "Coney Island Prep High School has given me the opportunity of college. Were it not for them, I wouldn't have thought of college being my number one priority, for I come from a low income family and only ever thought of going to work. However, the school does have its faults ranging from an awfully strict behavioural code to inexperienced teachers. Even so, they get the job done with getting students to college.", 'The curriculum at Coney Island Prep High School is very rigorous and all of the teachers make every minute count. The teachers go out of their way to make sure all of the students are understanding the curriculum and will stay after school, up to 8PM just to make sure the student understands everything they need in order to be successful.', "The school is not that diverse, as 50.1% of the are African American, and Islamophobia is a big problem here. The teachers who are biased towards other students are kept while great teachers that are fair usually get the boot. The only great thing about the school has to be the College Readiness. The school removed all clubs and activities in the 2015-16 school year. When it comes to the safety of the students, the teachers usually stand by unless it is a one sided fight, not to mention the school does not have a nurse. The school culture is good, seeing as the main focus here is to go to college. The sport teams are based off of the coach's bias instead of actual skill, and the school goes against the same school every game. The food is by far the worst aspect of the school, the food often comes destroyed or late, and grades 5-8 have to eat in their classrooms, instead of a cafeteria.", "At first, I absolutely hated the school. The hours were way too long for me and it was too strict. Many of my friends started to leave the school but within the next few months, they were right back where they started. There's no school like mine. Although the hours are long and it's strict, the teachers know what they're doing. The way we are taught is amazing and everyone has faith in each other. Being the first graduating class meant we had it the worst but we turned out to be great students growing into adults.", "Coney Island Prep has opened many doors for me. Doors that ordinary public schools in my district wouldn't have been able to. With opportunities to study abroad and attend a precollege program come high expectations. Coney Island Prep holds us to high standards, which sometimes causes a limitation on freedom. I wished that the student body had more of a say in our school policies. However CIP has seen us mature for the better and has prepared us for the future ahead, college.", 'A school that genuinely cares for its students.']

['My experience was amazing, they offer many extra curriculum programs that can be very challenging. They have the CTE academy where you can learn all about film production or about computer science. I am proud member of the CTE academy.', 'My experience at Info tech was really great. i liked everything and i would not want to change anything.', "The school is average, it has two great academies, Video Production and Web. Two of these different academies offer students hands on work to do, training them for the future.  The student council in the school is great, they reward students to with good grades, with breakfast, and include them in other traditions. Most of the staff are nice and help students after school and in school. The school has multiple programs for students to join after school. Lastly, the school tries to help students in some way, but if students don't want to help themselves the teachers won't be able to help them either.", "The teachers are really committed to helping you learn. Especially if you are in a CTE Academy, your teacher stays with you from sophomore through senior year so it feels like your peers are your second family and your teacher is your school parent. There are many sports such as basketball, baseball, volleyball, track and field, and even fencing. We also have many events and activites happen in the school like cook-offs, henna tattoos and gay pride day. One thing that could have used improvement were the cleanliness of the bathrooms but after the first two years of being in the school that issue had already been resolved. There really is not a boring day in this school and I'm always excited to come and see my friends and teachers.", 'There are alot of clubs and acitivities so you can get involved. Also, there are alot of helpful staff!', 'Information technology high school has one of the best teachers student could ask for. Teachers are there to help you get the best grades you could. all you have to do is put effort into it. Something I would like to see change in information technology high school is student encouragement. Meaning like students getting the help they need to start coming to class and not everywhere else besides being in class.', 'Very small school but the staff and the teachers are great. The teachers are very nice and always want to help you. The school also offers CTE classes along with many AP classes to choose from.', 'Information Technology High School is a good school to get ready for college, as you learn to become more independent and work more to better yourself to succeed in college.', 'It’s a very nice school. The teachers are nice, and it’s a very good environment. There is really nothing I would want to change about that school. I would like to see the school get more fundings to get better equippement for the students.', "As the name tells you. This high school provides IT programs. Currently we have two, Web design and Video production. There have been talks about adding new program like per-engineering but I'm not sure. Honestly, when I was in freshmen year, I thought the school was bad and was thinking about transferring. I don't know why I stayed but I'm glad I did. Over the three years the school changed significantly. Mind you the school is fairly new, like 10-11 years old. I kind of envy the coming freshmen as they have more things than I didn't have.", "Information technology has come a long way since I was a freshman, They have increased the number of AP classes and got some really good teachers. Overall I had a good experience however the school is not very clear to freshman with it's CTE program which I learned the hard way because my CTE program, Apple, was cut. This is and the national honor society are many of the cons of this school because the national honor society was really a big mess and very few people are graduating with NHS. The friends you make here however will be in everyone of your good memories when you look back through your time at this school so I do recommend you give it a chance.", 'A small school, but a very friendly environment. Although some few teachers are not that good at teaching and are really mean, most of them are very nice and caring. Some teachers really want the best for their students. The whole school is very diversed. Most students are very nice. I have not experience or seen any serious bullying or fighting for the last 4 years. The restrooms are very not clean.The CTE program is just amazing. Whether it is Web Design or Video Production, students have the oppotunity to learn skills that can get them a real job and the school actually help every student in this program to get paid internships. I am currently in my second internship already.', 'It is a pretty nice school with excellent teachers and some respectful students and staff. That would help you get in good colleges and prepare as well. The school has lots of clubs that you join for girls and boys. Also teachers are nice and respectful.', "Information Technology High School changed my entire high school career and outlook on life because all i needed was that change of surroundings and scenery. the students at that school awarded me with that; the students in my graduating class are not who i expected and i'm grateful that everyone there is different in their own way.", "Information technology high school is not the best school  in the city I will admit and there are many distractions such as drugs gangs and there influences but if you manage to avoid them and listen to your teacher and actually pay attention in class it's a great school most kids are tightly knit together and it's a school where if you want to go unnoticed you can but if you want to know every one you can this environment allows kids to thrive and gain knowledge that other kids may not have because in college the distractions and bad influences will only get stronger and at info tech you get steet smart as well as book smart", 'Excellent school. Wonderful teachers who encourage students to achieve their highest potential. Great technology program and video production here. Prepares students for college and careers in the video/ technology industry. Talented Band and lots of sports clubs at this school. Great staff and PTA who provide a safe environment for all kids.', "My experience in Information Technology High School wasn't the greatest and neither the worst. I've been attending this high school for three years now and to sum most it up is I'm comfortable here. I've made great friends, met amazing teachers who have pushed me to higher levels and learned yet more on subjects I expected less off. I have great relationships with faculty here and everyone is treated with upmost respect and equality. This is a small school that is yet developing, but based on the limitations this school has budget-wise, I know there can be so much more added here. I honestly enjoy being here, I feel at home with people who aren't crazy, fight-picking nor reckless. Maybe it's not a specialized high school or any top high school in the 30 district, but I really like how this school is growing and becoming better day by day. I feel the positive vibes in the atmosphere here. ", 'People in this school can sometimes be closed-minded. Otherwise, the student body is receptive to what is being taught', 'The student body is not that diverse. A heavy influx of certain races. Students are okay and student life can be a bit daunting at times but enjoyable overall', 'There should be more clubs. I belonged to a club (Tech Squad) and it was pretty alright. I enjoyed my time at the school but the extracurriculars were a bit lacking']

column6: ["the rules are based on the chancellors laws and regulations and safety is good and the rules of the school are reasonable and moderate towards today's laws and safety laws there no extreme cases where students go crazy over the rules cause its a school that has a lot of tolerance towards their students but are strict when the moment is right. the teachers are great they give us a tons of knowledge and tips towards not just school but life too.", 'I am a junior at this school and i am doing great. My teachers are amazing and my friends support me all the way. I am on the volleyball team and everyone is amazing. I also am involved in an art program and in National Honor Society. I know without a doubt that this school has helped me steer a clear path for my future.', 'I havent really seen anyone break the rules. Some students were taken outside of the classrom for disrespecting a teacher.', 'Sports is important in most of the schools and ITHS is no exception. Alot of students participate in sports.', 'I am pretty happy with the activities. I am in the soccer team and it is pretty fun. But I havent heard about any clubs or organizations.', 'The food is okay here. There arent many choices here but some meals are pretty delicious.', "Its been pretty good for me so far. I don't have many friends here but I do fine. Everyone treats each others with respect and kindness. I havent seen any cases of bullying or fighting.", "The school's administration is very strict but, not too strict to the point where students feel uncomfortable. The students need to be kept in order and that is what the administration does effectively. ", 'At ITHS, there is a Jacob Riis site. It helps academically and socially to improve. ', 'Many different types of classes are available to take.', 'There are many activities/sports available to each student ', 'This school prepared you for what it will be like in the future', 'Policies help make the school better', 'I had an amazing time there', 'Social scenes in any school is a big thing, everyone is always trying to fit in a crowed without being judge. This school is very accepting to ethnic/racial diversity and sexual orientation. Everyone is friends with everyone. There are some group of students that like to stay within there own race or their team but when it comes down to it everyone is friendly. ', 'The athletic and fitness opportunities at this school were good. A lot of students were involved in sports. School spirit was recognized with dances and peep rally. After school, the gym was open to whomever wanted to stay fit including weight training.', "There wasn't a big range of clubs and organizations but a lot of students volunteered together in marathons, breast cancer awareness walk, Autism walks. Sports were a big thing from football, bowling, softball and track. A lot of students took pride in their teams.", "The cafeteria food wasn't terrible but I would prefer to bring my own lunch or wait until school was over. There was good days when they served pasta, mozzarella sticks, Tuesday taco, etc. There wasn't many options of healthy food, students will snack up on the machines with junk food.", 'The academics were various which included AP classes. The schedule process was easy, guidance counselors were always on top of your academic. Tutoring was always available as well.', "Health and safety policies are well structured at this school. It's a safe environment, you don't have to worry about any bad threats or bullying. Safety polices are demonstrated frequently. You're allowed to be in your comfort zone. "]

column1: The Urban Assembly School for Emergency Management
column2: ['UASEM is an amazing school, it’s small so you receive the adequate amount of attention and help from both your peers and teachers. The staff is SO nice and always willing to help, all teachers have a great education and actually care for their students, students are constantly involved.', 'My child’s experience in this school has been totally  dismotivating . In all his school years have I ever wondered how a teacher got hired . Some are totally ghetto in their mentality . I truly made a bad choice of school for my child bringing him to this school .', 'At Urban Assembly school for Emergency Management my experience has been great. This school actually helped me bring my academic skills higher because administrators and teachers/students always pushed me to my full potential. The school has a lot of opportunities and I’m always signing up for internships and school activities, I always stay involved. No favoritism is shown everyone is equal here and everyone is driven and focused.', "What i like about Urban Assembly School For Emergency Management is that when someone has a problem they'll do peer mediation. But what i would like see change is that they have to put for activities.", "I didn't expect to develop any interest in the emergency management field however because of the classes given at this school and the way the classes are structured I have found something I am interested in. Not only are the classes rigorous the school has a very personal vibe where everybody knows everybody and every teacher cares about your progress and understanding of the content.", "It was an interesting four years. The teacher push students hard to think and do their best. The administration was too strict about the uniform policy, it is always cold in the basement, even during the winter. They did not have control of the heating. They would not allow us to wear sweaters, it had to be a cardigan which doesn't help much.", "One thing I like about Urban Assembly for Emergency Management is students actually learn a lot in their classes. Students invariably receive high scores in exams. The bad thing about this school is they lack extracurricular activities like sport, the student newspaper, or dance class. The school only provide classes needed to graduate which makes the school very dull. Additionally, students can't change their schedules. There's not that much diversity; mostly hispanics and few blacks and Asians The reason behind this is the school just opened the year I started freshman year.", "The teachers at my school are very helpful, intelligent and supportive. They will stay after school, or sometimes during lunch to help stuff what whatever they need help or just to hang with students. The workload is manageable most times. Our work is mainly done in class. There at times when the curriculum isn't as engaging or interesting enough to keep students focused or excited.", "My school doesn't really have any extracurricular activities. There's probably about 3 or 4 in our school specifically. If we wanted to join something else, we'd either have to go to the other schools in our building or an outside program.", "My overall experience at this school has been okay, only because it's very new and they're still finding ways to improve. I wish there were more extracurricular activities and clubs to choose from, and definitely more sports. However, my school is good in suggesting outside programs students might be interested in joining. The students are actually supportive of one another and always looking out for the next person.", "Overall, the teachers are very supportive and helpful to students. Whenever a student is struggling in class or needs help with a certain concept, they'll provide numerous resources or ways to be contacted so that they can offer any assistance needed.", 'i say its ok because some of the students in my school dont join in sports and dont take that seriously if they attend', 'its ok because they show you the right way to learn a certain material. This school is good for students who need a push in their education skills.', 'its great because even if the stidents in school dont struggle the teachers make sure that you arent stuck with anything that you may have missed in that one lesson.']

["Glen Cove High School gives many opportunities to pass and to succeed. The school is very diverse and doesn't only conclude to one race. Glen Cove High School is a safe environment and nobody should feel endangered by anyone or anything. Security is good and they are very nice people.  The school has many clubs and sports to get involved in.", "Glen Cove High School is a very diverse and welcoming school. The staff is amazing here, the teachers, principals, and security are very invested in the students safety and happiness. Every staff member in the school that I know is very determined to create a relationship with the students. From my freshman year to now, I have became so comfortable in the school, and the staff has definitely helped me with that. I have also became very involved in the school's extra curricular activities. I am in clubs and sports, and they have helped me make friendships that have lasted all throughout high school. Glen Cove High School isn't the nicest school, but the GCHS community is something you cant find anywhere else.", 'High School here I had a good time because i surrounded my self with good people and it was easy to get close with teachers and they helped me with a lot.', 'Glen Cove High School is actually quite enjoyable. Their teachers are actually quite good and often seem to go above and beyond for the students.', 'One of Glen Cove High School’s biggest issues is building safety. This year the auditorium stage lights (which were supposed to be secure) fell and nearly rushed students practicing for the school play. The library’s ceiling tiles collapsed and a light in the gym fell and started a fire, and the gym had to be renovated. The list goes on and on. Hopefully the school budget will be passed with much needed renovations soon.Despite all of this GCHS is still a great school in a variety of ways. Most of our teachers are very passionate about their jobs, especially our music teachers. Our select chorale is one of the best in New York. My favorite part of the high school is our unique TV Studio that other schools in the surrounding area lack. Students record and report for “GCTV Friday Morning News” and learn how to edit and create videos. The school is very supportive, diverse and inclusive to students of every background.', 'Overall, my experience at Glen Cove High School has been great. There are a diverse amount of clubs that are open to the students and I wish I had been able to join more. The teachers are great and make time for students to ensure we understand material and achieve the highest grade possible. The administrators care a great deal about us students, our opinions, and showing school pride anyway possible. In my senior year a bond was proposed to make various renovations in all the Glen Cove school districts to create a safer environment and make the schools better in general, including making the schools more accessible for handicapped students and features that would prevent more casualties in the case of a school shooter. These would have been fantastic and much needed changes, but unfortunately a majority of voters in Glen Cove opposed the bond but hopefully as time progresses and the school continues to push for it, the high school will get the renovations it needs.', "In the past four years, I had a pretty good time at Glen Cove High School. I liked most of my teachers, and I enjoyed the diversity at the school. My little sister is going to be at GCHS in a year, and I would really like to see some improvements. The facilities -- mainly science labs -- definitely need to be updated and improved. I think the academics and curriculum also need work. The classes need improvement; some classes didn't effectively prepare me for the end of the year regents or AP exams. The overall school culture needs to change, too. The schools looks so drab, and some liveliness and color could be added to boost students' atmosphere. Also, the graduation rate and vaping problems need to be fixed. I think gym class Sshould be  better run, and more like other schools' gym classes.", "Glen Cove High School is something I will never forget in my life. It's has matured me and made me a better person now. I love how you could talk to certain teacher's about problems outside or even inside of school and not get criticized; they would find ways to comfort you or give you advice. The teachers try to connect with us to make us enjoy school and class. I love how each year that add new extracurricular activates or clubs. I also heard next year they are going to do 9 periods again which is amazing for students who want extra classes or the kids who don't have lunch periods could now have lunch next year. What I don't enjoy is the school lunch and some of the prices for snack but hopefully they change it soon. Overall Glen Cove High School is amazing and I'll miss it.", 'I love the ability to have freedom and have a glimpse of what the real world has to offer. This district has taught me responsibility and how to be independent. I love being involved in many clubs, sports, and extra curricular activities. The teachers do whatever they can in order to help you and are very flexible to how youare as an individual. Everyone that comes here is always so impressed on how much the student body gets along. It is an overall positive environment!', "Glen Cove High School is a very diverse school and that's what I love about it. There are so many different clubs and after school activities that fit everyone's needs and wants. Even if there is not a club you can like its so easy to create one. The school is always open for ideas. We have a very family like environment. Everyone knows everyone and is never afraid to give a wave and a smile. I have loved growing up here in the Glen Cove School District. It has allowed me to meet so many amazing people including students, teachers and coaches. I am very sad that my time here is coming to an end.", 'Out of all the things Glen Cove High School has to offer, what I like most is the diversity. I feel that being a diverse school is very important. It brings different backgrounds, different cultures, and different stories to the table.', "I like the Glen Cove High School, the teachers are good and you see how much passion they have when teaching their students. They do give good advice too, as teachers they understand the struggle that us as teenagers have and try to relate with us so that we can feel comfortable with how were handling our emotions. It's so much more than just a High School, they treat us like were their own children which I think is a great environment to be in .", 'The teachers and staff in the school are very helpful and are friendly they always have a good attitude towards students and a good attitude over all. The staff is nice and they are  very kind towards students and others that enter the school. The school is a good environment and it is a very comfortable place to be .', 'As a senior at Glen Cove High School, I found the college process to have been very easy and worry-free for me, because the faculty helped me every step.', 'Glen Cove High School is a diverse school. I like this because our world is diverse. The diversity allows for students to get to know there cultures and environments. There is also a poverty level in Glen Cove which exposes to a real world problem early on, including a homeless population and a students living below the poverty line. This provides students with the opportunity to help each other. In the future I would like to see the way teachers speak to students change. Due to the lack of parental involvement there is sometimes a line that is crossed between both teachers and students. This creates an unhealthy environment for all. Although there is a strong administration it is difficult to keep up.', 'Generally happy with my experience at Glen Cove High School. The school does not necessarily stand out from other schools, but it mostly has good teachers. The students that I have interacted with are your typical high school students. However, my experiences as a whole has been limited to mainly AP classes and a few honors.', 'we are very school spirited and diverse. the school has a lot of activities clubs and sports. there are many resources for the students as well', 'I love the spirit at the Glen Cove High School. The only change  I would like to see is in the food and air conditioning.', 'Glen Cove High School was great for me, because of the amazing teachers and students. The school spirit is impeccable. Proud to be a knight!!', "Glen Cove high school is a great experience and taught me  a lot of the things that I know to this day. I've learned many things like hard work, motivation and of course the 50 states. This place has taught me friendships , great relationship with teachers as well as the rest of the faculty."]
column4: ["Glen Cove High School gives many opportunities to pass and to succeed. The school is very diverse and doesn't only conclude to one race. Glen Cove High School is a safe environment and nobody should feel endangered by anyone or anything. Security is good and they are very nice people.  The school has many clubs and sports to get involved in.", "Glen Cove High School is a very diverse and welcoming school. The staff is amazing here, the teachers, principals, and security are very invested in the students safety and happiness. Every staff member in the school that I know is very determined to create a relationship with the students. From my freshman year to now, I have became so comfortable in the school, and the staff has definitely helped me with that. I have also became very involved in the school's extra curricular activities. I am in clubs and sports, and they have helped me make friendships that have lasted all throughout high school. Glen Cove High School isn't the nicest school, but the GCHS community is something you cant find anywhere else.", 'High School here I had a good time because i surrounded my self with good people and it was easy to get close with teachers and they helped me with a lot.', 'Glen Cove High School is actually quite enjoyable. column6: ['The Glen Cove High School is the place to be. The teachers and staffs are friendly, respectful and willing to help. The students are also friendly and respectful. This school is very diverse, filled with different cultures and ethnicity. There is an enormous amount of school pride in our school. Many of us participate in spirit week by dressing up, following up with an eventful homecoming game. The sport teams and school clubs are very inclusive and are there to help. Check out the Glen Cove High School.', 'As my last year of being in high school, I really had a great time, just without the drama. I have mixed emotions towards this school. I am thankful for the amount of support the teachers give.', 'I was offered many more opportunities when I transferred here during my sophomore year of high school, and it has changed my life for the better.', 'Glen Cove High School in one word would definitely be home. Everyone at Glen Cove knows each other and the school spirit is amazing. Something the school needs to change would be to have A/C and proper heating in the school during the winter and hot spring.', 'I feel that Glen Cove High School is slowly progressing to become a more modern and technology based school. The school physically needs to be updated, we still have segregated cafeterias and a poorly nutritional lunch menu.', "These aren't accurate ratings because it really depends on the student and how they make their time at the HS. It was good for me bc I made the best of my high school experience. The people here are nice. A lot of kids are a little entitled and spoiled. But then again, you're going to find that anywhere. However, you can see this poor attitude in some of our sports teams. Some of my teammates complain during practice that the coach isnt doing her job to help us win the game. I understand it's not a competitive conference, but my teammates expect to win conference title w/o working for it. Academically, this school isn't competitive (if you compare it to nearby schools) Nevertheless, I got an adequate education and HS experience. We have a big campus with a nice outdoor track around the football field and big indoor gyms", 'As a senior graduating in 3 months, I would rate my overall experience at Glen Cove High School very well. My teachers were very engaging and extremely caring. My volleyball team has exceeded my expectations through my 4 years playing. I was proud to be everyones teammate. As I graduate, I would like to see a variety of classes to offer for students. Possibly more language choices, spiritual-leading courses, and more interests.', 'I like Glen Cove High school because it’s so   diverse. I would like to change how the school takes care of bullying. My sister is a victim of bullying all in high school and tried to give her life. The school didn’t try hard enough to help her or stop the people who did it to her.', "I've definitely had a wonderful experience at Glen Cove High School. There are many wonderful and professional teachers, all with the same goal: to see you succeed. No matter what path you decide to take in life, they will fully support you and only want the best for you. One thing I'd like to see change is the college preparation process. I believe there are many more things the district could offer to help students be prepared for college.", 'This school and my experience was definitely one of a kind. My experience shaped me into the person I am today and prepared me to go into the real world. For the most part, teachers do a sufficient job of preparing you for state tests and college and you are guaranteed to learn something from them. The school does a great job with extracurriculars and student involvement, especially the music program. Some areas still need work, but it is something that I believe will be solved in the years to come.', "Glen Cove High School is like many other schools -- you get out of it what you put into it. One of the beautiful aspects of this school, its diversity, is also often times used as a negative by some people. Well, the real world is diverse with different people of different races and different religions, and I'll tell you that Glen Cove High School not only introduces you to that, but prepares you for it. My graduating class sent students to Cornell, Johns Hopkins, Georgetown, NYU, Boston College and more. Sure, many students decide to go to SUNY schools, and there's nothing wrong with that either. The teachers are real people who care, not just about what grades you get and what college you end up at, but about the real, oftentimes difficult parts of their students lives as well. That's so refreshing and reassurring, and something you can't positively measure.", "The teachers are all very friendly and helpful. There is a strong sense of responsibility that the teachers have for their students as if they are their own children. The honor's program is great. There a cliques in school but once you find your niche, everything moves smoothly.", "My experience at Glen Cove High School couldn't have been better. After graduating from GCHS, I went on to Princeton University, and felt more prepared for rigorous courses than many of my peers from private and boarding schools. Glen Cove benefits from a small student to teacher ratio (12:1) and a small school overall (995 students) so students, whether they are at the top, middle, or bottom of the class, will never get lost. The ability to get involved and take on leadership positions is incomparable, as its extra-curricular list is extraordinary and teachers are really passionate about students excelling outside the classroom. I'm currently a private college admissions counselor and know exactly what colleges are looking for, and Glen Cove is an ideal school for students looking to go on to top colleges because its small size gives multiple students the ability to shine and stand out in their own unique ways.", 'I highly recommend attending this school if it is someones zone school. The education is splendid and because of the size it is quite intimate. The music program is spectacular as well as the sports program.  ', 'Glen Cove High school is an outstanding school for students to learn and encounter. A school that is a safe environment filled with many different activities.', 'I love the people, and how close everyone is. I would like to change how no one really participates in school events, so if we had more it would be more entertaining.', 'I truly enjoyed my years of High School. I was fortunate to have caring teachers and enjoyed my classes. I enjoyed that the school allowed me to do so many things such as sports and clubs. Our high school only offers AP as the highest course you can take, but i know many of us would greatly benefit in having IB courses offered as well. I am a particular student who likes to be involved in everything and i can say that Glen Cove High School did a good job in providing activities to do whether that being sports, to clubs, to activities helping the school, they had it all. ', 'Loud every where, kids get busted for weed all the time', 'They do ehat they have to do', "Study options are non existent. I don't even know how to study. They focus on the already intelligent students who don't need help. If you're a poor minority student with bad grades, you will be ignored not helped."]

column2: ['While attending East Orange STEM Academy I have enjoyed my time to met multiple different people and was able grasp the new knowledge I was being taught. I do wish the high school did have sports and gave multiple of different students an opportunity , but the STEM program is successful as well. The parent and student involvement could be better but overall the school is a good school to attend if you are only about academics.', 'I like how challenging the classes in stem are however the school needs many improvements. The building is not large enough for the amount of students attend and not all the teachers even have classes.', 'When my daughter first started we were promised great STEM academic programs however, after 6 years there has not been any real growth to the STEM curriculum which concerns me because there should be more corporate sponsorship from tech companies to help our kids compete in this ever growing tech world. Also, there has not been a consistent principle in place for more than a year', 'Friendly staff and Teachers. The lunch could be better. There were lots of fundraisers and it was kind of fun.', 'The teachers work very hard to assure that the kids get the full learning experience. Also, is a clean and surrounded with positivity and a principal that makes sure his students are doing well.', "The teachers don't break down the work well.They don't really have the students engaged properly. As well as they rush through every lesson they teach The lunch food isnt good at all and the nurse is barely every there. Some good things about the school is that the library is there when you need it. The kids that go there are friendly and welcoming. But other then that I wouldn't really recommened it; it's not even clean.", 'It is a little bit of a strict school. It offers many educational opportunities, the staff cares about the students and are there to guide them. The school could provide more courses, and it is combined with a middle school making the hallways ver crowded and hectic in-between bells. Other than that, the school is very good, education-wise', "I like the people that I've met here and the opportunities I've had. This school has taught me a lot about who I want to become. We could have more clear programs dedicated to actual career paths instead of just subjects.", 'In terms of academics you will be challenged as though you are enrolled in a 4 year institution. Variety of fields to learn at the school as well as an excellent staff.', "The teachers are very supportive and they actually care about the students. If you're struggling in a class and having trouble keeping your grades up, the majority of the teachers are willing to help you out every once and a while. They're not only educators but they're also people that most of the students are comfortable talking to. Rather it's a personal issue at home or a problem at school they're usually there for you to lean on.", "I'm a senior in East Orange Campus High School, I'll be graduating this month on the 25th. From my experience in the school, I like everything about it. The thing I don't like about it is when the students are fighting with each other; a lot.  But  it's a great school. It shows you how to be yourself. It doesn't matter where you came from, your color, your language. It shows you that you can be anything you want to be, you just have to believe in yourself.", "School spirit was high. The campus it self is awesome. The faculty is amazing. The location I wasn't to excited about, but I guess it is centralized for most of the students.", 'My fours at going to stem academy high school  was actually great. I made alot of friends and joined many of clubs. Some of the clubs are robotics, mock trial, and big brother big sister.  My grades werent as good as I would love them to be, but I had the best teachers who pushed me to a hard working student. Freshman to junior year  I saw alot of change in my grades i cant wait to see the change in my senior year. What I would like to change is to expand and renovate the school. We need better computers and textbooks to increase the knowledge of our students. And a better lunch program because I pay full lunch and i want to have a nice lunch, instead of making my stomach hurts or having a stomach virus.', "Theres a lot that is offered. It's up to the student to participate. I highly recommend students too because it opens doors for many great opportunities.", 'I was very involved and the administration appreciated my involvement. I truly loved the school.', 'Teachers display the qualities expected of them to teach at a urban school.', 'Well the students get their schedules in August before the school year starts. The students get a challenging work load for homework and projects. Classwork and participation in class room discussions are very encouraged.', "This school or school district does not condone bullying. The students are pretty well behaved so they don't have armed security", "My daughter didn't join any of the clubs and she cheered for the town so I am not sure about extracurricular activities", 'The teachers really are passionate into to getting the students to engage in class discussions and class projects. The name of the school has changed to STEM Academy.  So this is a Magnet school high expectations are set for the children that attend.']
column4: ['While attending East Orange STEM Academy I have enjoyed my time to met multiple different people and was able grasp the new knowledge I was being taught. I do wish the high school did have sports and gave multiple of different students an opportunity , but the STEM program is successful as well. The parent and student involvement could be better but overall the school is a good school to attend if you are only about academics.', 'I like how challenging the classes in stem are however the school needs many improvements. The building is not large enough for the amount of students attend and not all the teachers even have classes.', 'When my daughter first started we were promised great STEM academic programs however, after 6 years there has not been any real growth to the STEM curriculum which concerns me because there should be more corporate sponsorship from tech companies to help our kids compete in this ever growing tech world. Also, there has not been a consistent principle in place for more than a year', 'Friendly staff and Teachers. The lunch could be better. There were lots of fundraisers and it was kind of fun.', 'The teachers work very hard to assure that the kids get the full learning experience. Also, is a clean and surrounded with positivity and a principal that makes sure his students are doing well.', "The teachers don't break down the work well.They don't really have the students engaged properly. As well as they rush through every lesson they teach The lunch food isnt good at all and the nurse is barely every there. Some good things about the school is that the library is there when you need it. The kids that go there are friendly and welcoming. But other then that I wouldn't really recommened it; it's not even clean.", 'It is a little bit of a strict school. It offers many educational opportunities, the staff cares about the students and are there to guide them. The school could provide more courses, and it is combined with a middle school making the hallways ver crowded and hectic in-between bells. Other than that, the school is very good, education-wise', "I like the people that I've met here and the opportunities I've had. This school has taught me a lot about who I want to become. We could have more clear programs dedicated to actual career paths instead of just subjects.", 'In terms of academics you will be challenged as though you are enrolled in a 4 year institution. Variety of fields to learn at the school as well as an excellent staff.', "The teachers are very supportive and they actually care about the students. If you're struggling in a class and having trouble keeping your grades up, the majority of the teachers are willing to help you out every once and a while. They're not only educators but they're also people that most of the students are comfortable talking to. Rather it's a personal issue at home or a problem at school they're usually there for you to lean on.", "I'm a senior in East Orange Campus High School, I'll be graduating this month on the 25th. From my experience in the school, I like everything about it. The thing I don't like about it is when the students are fighting with each other; a lot.  But  it's a great school. It shows you how to be yourself. It doesn't matter where you came from, your color, your language. It shows you that you can be anything you want to be, you just have to believe in yourself.", "School spirit was high. The campus it self is awesome. The faculty is amazing. The location I wasn't to excited about, but I guess it is centralized for most of the students.", 'My fours at going to stem academy high school  was actually great. I made alot of friends and joined many of clubs. Some of the clubs are robotics, mock trial, and big brother big sister.  My grades werent as good as I would love them to be, but I had the best teachers who pushed me to a hard working student. Freshman to junior year  I saw alot of change in my grades i cant wait to see the change in my senior year. What I would like to change is to expand and renovate the school. We need better computers and textbooks to increase the knowledge of our students. And a better lunch program because I pay full lunch and i want to have a nice lunch, instead of making my stomach hurts or having a stomach virus.', "Theres a lot that is offered. It's up to the student to participate. I highly recommend students too because it opens doors for many great opportunities.", 'I was very involved and the administration appreciated my involvement. I truly loved the school.', 'Teachers display the qualities expected of them to teach at a urban school.', 'Well the students get their schedules in August before the school year starts. The students get a challenging work load for homework and projects. Classwork and participation in class room discussions are very encouraged.', "This school or school district does not condone bullying. The students are pretty well behaved so they don't have armed security", "My daughter didn't join any of the clubs and she cheered for the town so I am not sure about extracurricular activities", 'The teachers really are passionate into to getting the students to engage in class discussions and class projects. The name of the school has changed to STEM Academy.  So this is a Magnet school high expectations are set for the children that attend.']
column6: ['Book club, yearbook clubs and many more you can even start your own.', 'The teachers will do all they can to help you achieve your goals.', 'I would choose it because of the teachers and I would try to fix the mistakes I made before to be more involved.', 'My teachers take time out to make sure their students are doing what needs to be done. They put their all into teaching their students.', "We have a zero tolerance for bullying at my school. We have a number of security at each stair well standing guard. The school nurse is out right now, but when she's here she does everything she can to make sure we're okay and get the treatment we need.", "Our extracurricular opportunities are great. It ranges froma wide variety, so there's something for everyone. Like photography, gamers club, and robotics.", 'The teachers we have now for the senior class are cool. They work with students who are struggling. They all want us to succeed and go to college and do our best.', 'The school is fine the dress code is ridiculous and some of the staff are very annoying.', "I could have been awesome, but the fights are hurting the school's reputation.", 'My experience has been okay, I wish that there were more courses and a much more strict focus on the SAT.', 'Our teachers are some of the best teachers in the district. Our teachers work hard to ensure that their students are getting all the knowledge and understanding they need.', 'At STEM, there is not a lot of peer pressure and many of the students get along with each other. Our students work hard together to maintain a safe environment as well as the staff and security. We have guidance counselors who help each and every one of us through everything.', 'There are many extracurricular activities at our school. Being that we are a STEM school, we have many types of organizations pertaining to science, technology and math. Our clubs have won many awards and have participated in many trips and events. These extracurricular activities have been raising money to continue their trips and maintain the structure of the groups.', "The school's health issues aren't a major issue. Our janitor's and our school nurse and staff work very hard to keep both classrooms and facilities under control. The nurse stays on top of her job and is always prepared. The janitors work hard every single day making sure all major things are taken care of and cleaned up for the students' safety.", 'Honestly this school is ver challenging and the courses are very rigorous. You have regular classes, honors classes and AP classes and each of them are challenging classes and you have to stay on top of your game in every single class. Sports are also taken seriously next to academics. We are the true definition of student athletes. You would literally see students doing homework at track meets after they have finished running there race all because they know they will be too tired to do it when they get home. But with all this in consideration the students are great and so are the teachers. Cliques and popularity are not a part of our school because we are literally nerds hence it being a stem school.', 'The school takes sports very seriously second to academics. Sports like cheerleading, track and field,basketball and football are highly shun upon and its recommended that everybody goes to the games especially the basketball games they get Highly intense.', "The teachers are great. Some of them go above and beyond to help any student that needs help. Some come 20 minutes before classes start and Some stay extra hours after school just to help students that need tutoring or didn't understand the lesson. And they also provides us with resources like khan academy or kaptest, college board and others website they feel might help us if we are still struggling.", "The social scene at the school is very diverse. We have a mixture of different students that are from different backgrounds and that are in alot of the sports,extracurricular activities at school, and clubs. It's a variety of different types of students everywhere.", 'We have a variety of clubs and sports to join in and they are the best you cab from debate team, too robotics, too adventure club and too sports such as track and field, basketball,tennis and plenty more. The \r Coaches are great you have a sense of family with everyone on the team.', 'The school takes care of us very well. Monthly we have fire drills,lockdown drills, intruder alarm drills and more. The school prepare us for different situations and cares very much if our well being. And the nurse is every easy to talk to and she tries her best to help us in any situation we need help in . Personal or not she is there for us .']

column2: ['I love the one on one experience you have with teachers. You build a close relationship that you would not have if you attended a big high school.The students however are a whole different story. Have a positive mindset and attitude when coming to this school.', "This school didn't help me with my college decision and helping me apply to colleges and it really didn't prepared me for real life and college work.", "We love HCS!  Great community, teachers, individual attention and core values.  Academically challenging and diverse in its range - awesome specialized teachers.  Like a private school in it's attention to individuals and a public school in its rigor.", 'As a collective the school fails. The school offers little to no opportunity and lacks in discipline as well as having almost an entire new set of teachers each year. Although these things drag the school down, the staff (most of them) provides students with any and all help, academic and other wise.', 'Safe neighborhood and safe school. Some teachers went out of their way to help me when I needed assistance.', 'Not enough variety for student. No vegetarian option. just fruit available.', 'Some teachers do go beyond what is necessary for students.', 'Regular school academics. Some teachers do get involved beyond what is asked. Such as the Art, Math, and American History teacher.', 'I had a broken jaw and they told me I was fine.', 'Not many intermingled. I kept to myself.', 'I only learned economics at that school.', 'Once school was over that was it. There was only after school help with classes and that was rare as well.', "The students didn't care so why try to teach them when they are going to end up working minimum wage for the rest of their lives anyway.", 'Not hard enough where it needs to be, punishes the wrong students.']

['Eastport South Manor is a good school but some of the teachers specifically in the math department do not prepare and teach the student the skills required to be successful in the class.', 'I like how new the school is and how big it is. The art programs are also very nice, the plays are amazing. The staff has always been very nice through out my school career. I would change the knowledge to some of the staff. Some do not completely help with college applications, which is hard when you do not have older siblings.', 'The school environment is very friendly and safe. The teachers seem dedicated to teaching their students with emphasis on college readiness. I wish the school could be a bit more diverse culturally.', 'I am a 2016 graduate it is an amazing school that offers a lot of support and resources towards its students.', 'Administration is awful, horrible role models for children. Most AP teachers were marvelous. Very caring, knowledgable teachers who prepared you for college. Many research opportunities and connections within the science department. Clubs like Natural Helpers, Honors Societies, Concert Choir, etc.', 'Many of the teachers and other faculty members do not care much about the students. I have never really gotten close to any teachers due to them being rude or choosing favorites. The school is also falling apart for a VERY new school. They cut many electives and replaced them with a few STEM electives, sucks if you are not into anything STEM related. Fine otherwise ; got my work done, had friends, and went to college prepared.', 'Eastport Southmanor is a great School, i have had the best teachers and opportunities to advance.   the sports program is the best', 'Eastport south manor was a school I got to choose after graduating East Moriches because we didn’t receive a high school, I personally loved how welcoming everyone at the school was and how big it was it allowed you to meet lots of new people and their is a sport/elective/club for everyone no matter what you liked! The only thing I would change is some of the problems with the bathrooms not being open all the time or the leaks in the ceiling!', 'I loved ESM. I was a part of the music program and it was the best thing that ever happened to me. Teachers were not just teachers but mentors and friends. Also, Mrs. McAdams is the best.', 'It is my first year here and I believe that the academics of the school are amazing and the teachers really push you and support your dreams. With this being my first year I have made many friends that I am very close with and that is mostly because the teachers like to be social and get into our lives to help if we are having any struggles in life also the sports are amazing the only thing is that try outs and anything extracurricular is only announced once every school day.', 'There are so many problems and some may say this school is a joke but i love going here and everything about it. It’s home', 'I have had an awesome experience at ESM the teachers are great and the sports programs are top notch. I would like to see more coaches help each team, due to budget cuts coaches are limited.', 'Overall it is well balanced but definitely is in need of improvement from administration and budget plan', "For a new school, it shouldn't be falling apart as quickly as it is. Financial issues currently. Good teachers make up for it though. Really big with nice classrooms. All good sports teams.", 'Well i would like to see alot of things change at this school.  it is cold in the hallways dont feel like the heat is even on. we wear our jackets pipes are bursting in the hallways many times.  buckets to catch water falling line the hallways of the school by the  tech and music rooms.  pillars have cracks in them and the driveway to school  the pavement is overgrown with grass and cracked up and not care for even  lawn not mowed and lighting at night limited not all the lights are turned on during events.  roof needs desperate repair.  bathrooms there is constant fights in the bathrooms . They are not fixing. they are forced to go to other side of school where in the other bathrooms you see inappropriate  things going on if you accidentally open the stall of bathroom. kissing and inappropriate body touching going on in hallways and in library. No security monitoring being done right. school should be monitoring who and what genders are going into the bathrooms together.', "This school offers a good start for its students. However, that being said, does not mean that there will be much additional help to the students. The students constantly are overwhelmed with unnecessary stress, whether it be from homework or planning their future. This school has ridiculous policies. For instance, when 'vaping' was discovered to be occurring in the bathrooms, the bathrooms were locked between periods. This is especially frustrating for a AP and/or Honors student such as myself. When being present is a must to absorb all the necessary material, it is an extreme inconvenience when we are left with no choice but to remove ourselves from our important, and challenging classes just to rush and panic that we are missing material. This school district also happens to have atrocious budgeting skills, as of today, approximately 4.2 million dollars in debt. Countless staff member and activities have been cut or excessed. Dozens of classes and electives, gone.", 'I graduated from Eastport South Manor in 2017. I had a great experience and felt I was prepared for college.', 'For reference, most of my experience comes from honors/AP classes. Most teachers prepare you for the AP test and/or regents, of course some are said to not teach at all. There should be more emphasis on learning and education, as in some classes there is a vibe that “trying” is weird. Administration could be better/more efficient', 'Our administration doesn’t really know how to run a building. The teachers are really helpful though and make up for the lack of support from admin.', "My Eastport South Manor Jr. Sr. High School was definitely an up and down one. There were plenty of teachers and classes that I truly enjoyed and learned a lot. However, I had other teachers who lacked enthusiasm and a desire to see their students succeed. On top of that, the building is in need of repairs that likely won't come for a while due to the horrible budget deficit. I am glad this is my last year, because next year the extreme budget changes will lead to much fewer teachers, classes, and activities."]
