column6: ['I love my teachers and guidance counselor. They prepared me for tests. I run track and love the feeling of being part of a team. The food could be better and the HVAC needs improvement.', 'Less corruption, locks on the toilet stalls and bathroom monitoring, drug use in the school and buses is out of control. All buses should have videocams on the to prevent drug use and bullying.  Bullying should be  taken more seriously.  Best thing I like about the junior/senior high school is film programs run by Mr. Solomon and the Film Festival.', 'Eastport is a very friendly school, with very engaging staff members and lots of clubs and activities to get yourself involved in. The school provides a very safe and structured environment for the students.', "I like the teachers at the school, they teach very well and students' performances on exams is high.  I'd like to see the way students act change as well as maybe the variety of classes offered.", "I graduated in June 2017. The school board would cave to the loudest complaining parents. Sports programs were flooded with athletes that did not help the teams win, only because the parents complained when they were cut during try outs. Standards should NEVER be LOWERED, period. If you are not good enough to make it, work on you deficiencies, train hard and improve your skills for the next try out. Don't go crying to the school board for a spot on the team. The School board also eliminated the Honors programs for the Jr high. All students are now accelerated, putting students that never pass a test in with students that never fail. This only makes the lessor student feel more inferior, and holds back the would be honor student from reaching his/her potential . Students are NOT all the same", "Overall, I am very pleased with the high school, especially my guidance counselor Mrs. Sutton.  She has helped me to get ready for college and made the whole experience enjoyable.  The sports and clubs are endless and there is always something to do.  The theatre program is especially good.  I have never had a teacher I didn't like.", "Eastport South Manor Jr/Sr high school is a wonderful school and there isn't much to complain about in my opinion. The diversity of the high school is very low and the school lunches aren't that great but in terms of safety, academics and everyday experience, it is a great school to attend.", "ESM presents itself as a rich school ready to provide anyone the resources to learn. In reality, it's a mostly white school marked with Racism, Anti-LGBT sentiments, and blatant negativity among students.  ESM provides a wide catalogue of classes, clubs, and electives to choose from. Anything ranging from Psychology to a class centered around Genocides in history specifically.  Computersare available for student at most times.The teachers are great people, and they enjoy their job (Especially the science teachers) and are active in teaching students and engaging them in the classroom and passing regents/finals/etc.The school suffers from crumbling infrastructure, which has resulted in the requirement of buckets being all over to prevent the filthy ceiling fluid from spreading all over the floor. Ceiling tiles collapse and the school has yet to do anything about this issue.Minorities are a rare sight. Racial slurs and offensive terms are dropped by white students commonly.", "The school offers many elective as  well as AP and college credit courses. Most of the teachers are well prepared and care. With that said, it's extremely annoying to take a rigorous class and have the teacher be absent or at meetings a large portion of the time. ESPECIALLY because the subs don't know the curriculum, EVER.Hope you love black mold, there isn't a room in the building that doesn't have water stains that are either becoming or are black. It's about 35 degrees today, and the air conditioner is on. AND this is a beautiful, new building. (from the outside, anyway) I learned allot because I applied myself and have likeminded friends. Looking forward to graduating, ESM is NOT what it's cracked up to be", "High School was a good experience for me.  I was fortunate enough to take advantage of a few of it's many extra curricular activities.  Such as Student Government, Sports (tennis, girls lacrosse), Year-Book club, National Honor Society, Natural Helpers, and Newspaper club.  A good majority of the teachers were very helpful in ensuring that the students had all the help and resources to succeed.  My guidance counsler was great, she was very helpful with guiding me thru the college process.", "I loved the relationships between the students and faculty. They really go above and beyond to help their students achieve their goals. I found that many teachers didn't just teach to the test , but taught for clarity and understanding. Their passion is what inspires and motivates students daily. Although i have to say , the students are not always the best to be around - but maybe thats the same within every school. A lot  of students act entitled and it seems as if nothing is done to address this issue. Also at times, the school can allow for a cliquey environment with its huge emphasis on the athletics. Overall though, I have really enjoyed my high school experience and  can't imagine going anywhere else. High school is high school and at times it may suck , but i guess thats just life.", 'Teachers are helpful . Many faculty and staff live in the community which can be both good and bad.', 'Small tight knit community that carries over to the school. Everyone knows everyone. Parents are very involved.', 'Classes are manageable and the teachers make things easier for students, they are very helpful.', 'It has a lot of extracurricular activities', 'Football games are always fun, as are events such as film fest, prom, and other activities.', 'All teachers care about their students and go above and beyond to make sure they are learning all the material that is needed. The teachers make sure their students always feel safe, cared for and important.', "I can't say much about clubs and organizations as I was never really that involved in them, but the arts and theatre programs at this school made my high school experience worthwhile. I have heard whispers of budget cuts and possible budget cuts to these programs and hope for the sake of the children walking those halls that they are indeed just whispers. If anything, the arts, music, and theatre departments at ESM should be grown, not cut down.", "What made this school unique was its arts and theatre arts departments, for me. That's the only thing that would make me want to attend this school again if I could do it over again.", 'Unfortunately, the majority of the teachers I had throughout my high school experience were "just okay". With the exception of a select few that I still hold dear to my heart, most of them weren\'t anything special. There is an obvious difference between educators that have true passion for their profession and compassion for their students, and the ones that are just there for a paycheck and summers off. I didn\'t look forward to their classes and I certainly didn\'t feel like I left with anything substantial. As for the few that did have that spark, I hope they are still exuding their light into the students of ESM\'s dreary days.']
column8: ['My personal workload has always been extreme due to ap classes and other advanced classes but the work is still manageable.', 'I have never felt threatened in my school even through bomb threats and an intruder threat I felt safe within my school in the hands of the staffing.', 'There is a wide variety of after school programs from sports to government to language to community service.', "I love my high school. I simply don't like that most parents do their kids' work for them for better grades and there is a lot of cheating which brings very unintelligent students to be getting all A's and makes the students that do care to do well and learn on their own not look as good in comparison.", 'There is a wide range of abilities varying from teacher to teacher. I have only been in advanced classes therefore I have generally had teachers who are extremely knowledgable in their subject.', 'the majority just do what they have to', 'I have had an unforgettable experience at Eastport South Manor. The music and theatre departments have not only given me a place where I can be myself but, has also given me a second home throughout my high school career. My absolute favorite experiences include musicals, plays, choral competitions, and theatre trips. The school has such a unique arts department with such talented and dedicated staff that I would definitely choose attending this school again.', "I know it would be unfair to generalize all teachers at my school as low quality because, there are only a few teachers in the school who legitimately do not care. For the most part, teachers are extremely approachable and helpful. I really appreciate how my teachers go out of their way to get to know me, so I'm just not another face they see every day. Not only that, I have learned so many lessons from my teachers that never could be taught out of a textbook.", 'very careful over health issues', 'clubs start out with good attendance and then dwindle as the year goes on', 'Have met some really great teachers and some not so.', 'there are the teachers that love their subject and generate excitement in the class, the the other half that go right out of the text book without adding anything additional or personal to the lesson.', 'There are so many clubs. Extra help is always available.', 'Most of them are very nice and truly care about kids.', 'The school nurse is ineffective.  All they do is tell you to lie down and then go back to class.', 'The curriculum of most classes are easy except the hardest AP classes.', 'Most are very pleasant, fair, understanding, and fun.  Of course there are a few who do not care, or are not fair with their grades.', 'The bullying situation is not much of a problem.  I feel fairly safe.  I would be more useful as a school nurse than the present one.', 'This school is an amazing model for student and faculty security. The federal and local government help build our plans and use our system to teach other schools.', "There are a lot of great clubs and sporting events after school. There are many teachers willing to help you after school too, even if you aren't their student."]

column1: Knowledge & Power Prep Academy International High School
column2: ["I think this school is one of the best in the Bronx.  The teachers know a lot about what they're teaching and they care a lot about their students, and I think that's the most important.  The school also offers a lot of extracurricular and elective choices for the students and opportunities to try and create different ones.  The school isn't too big but also isn't very small.  There aren't many fights, if any at all, and the students here all help each other and stand up for each other.", "I personally liked how diverse the school was and how many opportunities we had to prepare ourselves for college. I had fun learning and spending time with all the people I met, including the teachers who basically become your best friends to the point that they will let you hangout with them in their classrooms during lunch. However, the school is crowded and understaffed so teachers have to teach multiple grades as well as classes. Also, we share a building with 5 other high schools and 1 middle school so we are constantly interrupted by students from Fordham Leadership. Because of this, our lunch period is at 10 am, so most of us don't eat lunch, but we are allowed to snack during class as long as we clean up after ourselves.", 'I love Kappa international high school. All the teachers are very supportive especially the math teachers. The teachers take their time to actually understand your learning style and give you that extra support. When you need to make up work or need extra help they will stay extra hours for you after school. The teachers have office hours. The afterschool programs are also amazing! Kappa has many sections. We have Catrock which is an outstanding program for anybody who likes to go on adventures and learn new things. We also have JROTC, which I personally enjoy. Then, we have a track, volleyball. baseball, cheerleading, soccer was added this year, robotics, CUP program, student government, etc. Kappa is such a wonderful place with nice options. Kappa also has IB classes which are more of a college class but you start that 11th grade. Kappa also has college now classes that take place in our campus 3;30 to 5;30.', 'This school is exceptional in terms of diversity and the community, teachers care about and respect students and often form close bonds. The principals are also very involved in school activities and classes and reward students for achievements. There are many opportunities for internships, programs and extracurricular activities. One improvement the school could make regards the courses offered and handling student requests.', "The teachers were very well-versed with teaching their specific subject and created unique class experiences that helped students remain engaged in lessons and learn a great deal of the material. However, I didn't like that on occasion teachers would leave from year-to-year for a multitude of reasons. Other than that I'd say KAPPA is a great school despite its size and general age as an institute and I am glad to have been apart of that community.", 'The school is a very good school and I would recommend It to anyone.The school has respect for Its students and staff.The teachers are very good and they make sure everyone understands what Is being thought.', 'What I like about KAPPA is the amount of opportunities they give you to involve yourself in both the school and in the community. They should be more involved in the college process though and give more chances to the kids who are struggling but overall, KAPPA has high hopes for their students and wants to see us succeed.', "There are many opportunities available. We offer International Baccalaureate courses like Biology, Literature, French,  Spanish, Theater and  Math. There is a variety of sports. There is diversity because it is an international school. Being diverse, allows others to build knowledge based on different ethnic groups and learn different peoples point of views. In addition, the story they bring with them. They're many trips that occur throughout the year because it is believed that students learn better in the classroom and outside. Trips allow students the chance to come out of there comfort zone and exploring new things. Students are able to engage with other people that they normally wouldn't talk to. The staff and teachers really care for the students and always stay after school if we need help. Its a great high school for those who want to be close to an area that is well-known, provides college classes, a variety of sports, diversity, and just a place to spend four years in.", 'Kappa is a very good school.The teachers are humble and they make sure every student understands what is thought.The students are also respectful to their peers and they work well with their peers.', "I absolutely love the family dynamic as well as the IB program. I love the level of diversity however it is mostly minorities which is not to blame the school for because that's simply the neighborhood.", "There isn't a lot to do, due to the lack of funds given to the school.", 'Though this school has a great principal and faculty, there is never enough money in the budget to hold events or activities that engage all students. I would not go to this school and do it all over again because a lot of the things that are important, especially for seniors, could not be done because there was never enough money to do anything.', 'All of the teachers seem to have great knowledge on the subject that they teach. Each teacher engages with students and is constantly working with students to better their education.', 'The softball team won the championship in 2015, the basketball team won the 2016 championship between the 5 other schools in the Theodore Roosevelt campus, the swim team and the volleyball team made it to playoffs in 2015 and 2016. \r The administration is very supportive, the Principal and her assistants know all the students, they are engaged in our studies and lives. It was hard for me to graduate because KAPPA was my second family and home. I will miss everyone there.', 'The school gives us the opportunity to be ourselves by giving us the chance to create our own clubs such as the LGBT, where students can express themselves. The school offers many clubs and sports and it also very good in academics as it provides the IB program, a program that challenges the students with college level courses to prepares us for college.', 'My teachers are committed to teaching. They dedicate their time to teach us, to help us improve, to push us to challenge ourselves and to get to know us beyond the teacher-student level to get to know us better.', "In kappa international the teachers are very involved when it comes to the students learning and safety. The professors makes sure if their are any problems or something they don't get in a subject they will make sure to find time out of their day to explain and help the student. In kappa international the scheduling gives the students different opinions to expand their leaning and have different opportunities do learn different things. In kappa the work overload is very fair the professors make sure the students feel challenged but not stressed when it comes to the assignments given.", "In kappa international the students and professors health and safety are taken seriously. Many of the students and professors take involvement in making sure our school is a safe learning environment. Many students make sure each one of their peers are emotionally and physically okay. In kapp if a student is being bullied the staff as in councilors or professors make sure the student is safe and will resolve the problem right away. The students make sure no one gets physically or mentally or verbally harmed in any way. In kappa international they are big in safety they make sure every morning students are not bringing in any harmful objects or weapons they make sure this doesn't occur by using metal detectors. Also kappa makes sure students are healthy and if they have any problem or emergency they have access to a school nurse. They also make sure students get information that would help them out when it comes to their health by having different health programs and resources available to them.", 'In kapp international the extra curricular activities and classes are very excellent when it comes to finding different ways in learning. Not only does kappa have a wide range of different clubs and activities but they also make sure every student has a club that they can distress and relax or just simply have fun in during school or after school hours. These clubs mostly get created/started by a student or professor ideas and gets supported by everyone.', "In kappa international they make sure if your in need of anything or have ideas that other students will enjoy the professors and staff will make sure to help as much as possible. In kappa international the students and professors and staff make the school like a home and a safe place to learn and grow as a person. I can honestly say kappa international is the best high school for any scholar to go to and become an amazing leader and expand their leaning. Through out the time I've been in kappa international I've made many memories and progress. One of the best memories I've had in kappa is being able to connect with different people around the world and experience/ learn in other places but a school campus. Kappa international gives you a chance to travel and experience being in different places around the world and make you comfortable in meeting and also learning how other people learn around the world and not many schools can offer you that in their school. Kappa international truly helped shape me as a person."]

column6: ['In Kappa international the professors are caring and respectful people who help students when in need they also take time out of their own time to help student and answer any questions they have.', "Because this school shares a building with five other school, the amount entries into the building is very limited. In the building there's about 5,000 and we all enter around the same time, but there's only two entries and three metal detectors. On the days one of the metal detectors break then it can cause a student to be 10-15  minutes late depending on the floor their school is on. Also there is a school nurse and it is located on the ground floor which is very inconvenient to those located on the  fourth and fifth floor. The security is located on the first floor always and they are rarely seen on the other floors. The metal detector do not really work, whereas only two of the three truly work. There are many health programs such as the cooking club and it teaches students how to cook nutritious and healthy meals and snacks. In this building i feel genuinely safe although one detector doesn't work. The schools personally have a faculty member that is able to calm students that are angry and upset. They are also able separate fights and loud arguments.", "This school offers many extracurricular opportunities that bring the most incompatible students together on an idea. In this school there's Robotics Club, ice skating club, Swimming Club, Key Club, Coding,  Student Council, Cooking Club, French Club, Media Club, Rock Band, Choir, Band, Gay-Straight Alliance, and Peer Tutoring.  Some clubs are only offered due to the season such as Ice Skating Club. Because this school is very open to new ideas, the school allows students to form new club as long as there's is ten or more people joining. I was able to join the Ice Skating Club and Student Council. The administration is very supportive and some join and lead the club to better inform the students. Depending on a certain club, the schedule is flexible and some days are mandatory because the teacher is leading it. The administration buys the materials for the students to use such as cameras, guitars (both acoustic, bass, and electric), drums, keyboards, camcorders, robotic pieces, and books for all students to use.", 'If I was in eighth grade, i would choose this school again. In comparison to many other schools, this school wants their students to succeed but to also not be stressed out and to enjoy themselves. Once a month, as a way to learn outside the classroom, the whole school goes on a trip such as museums, parks, and other learning programs in order to learn about one topic all day with exciting approaches. This school is promotes international relationships. Once a year, the school takes a group of students international to other countries where the students can learn about a new culture and help programs that try to promote education to the children who do not have the resources. In my three years here, i was able to go to India, Canada, and this year i will be able to go to Japan.This school also has a different grading system that allows the students know exactly what standard need improvement and which ones they excelled at. They use standard based grading and they also allow students to reassess any standard only if the student proves they have studied and applied themselves in the classroom which allows a greater overall involvement in both the classroom and independent work.', "In this school, the teachers genuinely respect the students and one another. Most of the students each have at least one teacher they can trust during times of need. This school provides faculty that can speak to parents that do not speak english. One thing that makes this school different is how engaged students are to making this school a better learning environment. During parent-teacher conferences, students volunteer to translate to parents for the teachers who can not speak the parents' native language.", "Personally, I believe that the staff working in the school building want to make sure everyone is in a safe environment without worrying about their surroundings. Sometimes students can get annoyed about the safety rules, however they realize that it's all done to keep safety and order.", 'There are many clubs to choose from at this high school., including dance, robotics, mini-meds, board game club, uno club, reading club, key clubs and etc. Everyone is allowed to participate in these and many students are actually really involved and devoted to the clubs.', 'This school provides different learning experiences. They like to make students involve and explore new things, by creating trips. Being able to explore the wild life and see the beauty of nature was such an incredible experience this school provided by going on camping trips and skiing trips. This school loves for students to learn about different cultures and religion, providing the opportunity to travel to another country to explore and to travel to study in another country for a few days. This school is unique because the staff members and professors make sure they are involved in the students life, where they attend sports game and show support for our school and where they participate in activities.', 'This is such a wonderful school, where both a safe and fun environment will surround you. Theres a lot of knowledge and the Professors will not just teach you, but also become someone who you can trust and talk to. This is the best school, where students are involved and many activities take place. This high school provides great guidance and leaders. It also offers wonderful opportunities, like being able to travel across the country to learn about other traditions and culture.', 'The food were good, except when it came to rice or tacos was not the same as home made food. Healthy food options were given depending how much you wanted to eat.Snacks were given sometimes, but it is fair in order to be healthy.', "It has help and prepared me in the real world to deal with rules I'll face in the workforce. It is a useful way to respect policies at any other place. The principal is the best for caring for each student and always coming to school with a smile and proves she loves what she do. She reached out to parents as well. The office staff would follow up to her planning. The uniform policy was strict, but I can't complain because It helped me save money to not worry what I will wear the next day. The principal is very explicit from the very start that she won't tolerate bullying or violence in the school or after school hours. Fights were rare in the school, it was not something students or parents would take in mind because the policies.", 'There is more than enough space provided for all students. It was great to choose which athletic facilities to participate in. The gymnasiums are very big which I love to play my different sports at. There is enough lockers in the locker room.', "All professors, overall were great on their teaching methods. Whenever a student had problems learning a topic, the professor made sure that student get after class or after school attention. All professors wee concerned about student's academic learning. There was a lot of patience which is important and enjoyed their job working with students. Their grading was fair and sometimes want the best for students that would give extra work in order to pass.", 'There were few club, organizations that were temporal.', 'I felt prepared, but not completely prepared for college because I was not informed with all the types of jobs including certificates and degrees as to which it would match my skills. The courses and school policy helped prepare me for the real world. I was able to take some advance classes that were offered to me and part of the criteria were demonstrated in my college course. The policy and the school principal care, helped me succeed and graduate school on time. Speeches were given whenever there was a problem that had to be solved in a well proper manner. It helped me be more effective and initiative when completing my projects and assignments in college.', 'They try to enforce policies', 'Most teachers are available after school and out side class rooms. They also pay attention to you while talking and respect your ideas.', 'This school do not offer a lot of after-school programs, clubs and organizations', 'Debate is one of the most influential clubs at my school. Students have the opportunity to engage in an amazing activity that is uplifting.', 'my school became like a family to me. I love going there and definitely coming back to visit every body.']
column8: ['in our school students  from all over the world comes. there is no specific group of people who stay together. every body is friendly to each other.', 'Our School offers International Baccalaureate program which is well know internationally as well as in the colleges. It is an great opportunity for the students to get the college experience and possible credits for colleges.', 'our main sports are swimming, basketball and volleyball and all of these won lots of games with other campuses.', 'We do lots of hands on work. For better interactions and communications we go to lots of trips related to the clubs curricular.', 'Our guidance counselor, teachers and all the faculty members are amazing at keeping us students the parents updated. Their communication and relationship with us is incredible.', 'every day pizza and other things', 'school administration very safe and helpful,dresscode is very strict, etc.', 'trips to movies, extra help when needed, and fresh out of college teachers', 'Softball, basketball ,swimming, Cardio etc.', 'IB: IB english, IB U.S History ,IB Biology, IB Spanish, IB music/Theater etc.', 'library with computer and a computer lab with mac desktops', 'my school is mixed and diversed in something', 'I have had my ups and downs in this school and i truly appreciate the person i am today because of this school.', 'In our school we have the opportunity to be one of the few schools in the city to have the IB program', 'Our principal really cares for all of her students and tries her best to keep and maintain a safe environment.', 'Security is really tight, school safety is extremely on top of security', 'Theres dance, The College Now program', 'There is not any racial problem. The nurse is efficient ', 'This school provides an excellent IB program which makes me very glad to be part of the school program.', "The extracurricular opportunities were okay in my freshman year of high school. There were art appreciation, chorus, journalism, writing about movies, and many more. In my junior year the only club I new about was the photography club. In my senior year there was photography club, Japanese club, spectrum (LGBT) club. They have band, debate, swimming, volleyball, baseball and softball, cheerleading, dance, and fencing. There is also a program called LIFTT an internship at the intrepid where people can join by an essay, recommendations, and an interview. We also do the AIDS walk and the Breast Cancer walk. If you don't want to join anything there is always helping the teachers out with grading, decorating or staff with picking up phone calls, or picking up their lunch for volunteer hours or because you wanted to help out and not go home. We also can volunteer by decorating, preparing, selling tickets, and collecting the money for dances to raise money for the school. The teachers, principle, and staff are always there to help with homework or any problems you have."]

column1: High School for Public Service: Heroes of Tomorrow
column2: ['I love the connection all the students have with each other. Also, the teachers are very easy to talk to', 'My Experience at the High school for Public Service was fabulous. At first I wanted to transfer and I have been trying to transfer since Freshman year but here I am now a Senior about to graduate from High school of Public Service . The staff at the school is phenomenal and are very helpful . Not only with our school work but they are very helpful with our personal life . At the high school for public service there isn’t one person that I don’t feel comfortable with . All the staff and students are like a family . I’m so glad that I stayed.', 'I transferred to HSPS my sophomore year and they welcomed me with open arms....never regret transferring there ,  the teachers work me and push me towards my highest potential.', 'My school is great. it has prepared me for college and im excited to graduate and use all the tools ive learned about here.', 'Some teachers are great but other aren’t, but teachers are so wealing to help you with your grades and if you need something. For example, most of them usually create a after school help class for their students, which is great if your behind in any of other classes. Has a variety of sports and activity for afterchool. For example boys and girls volleyball, basketball, track, girls soccer , boys baseball, and more.Polices are so rude but they make us feel safe The school is clean but most of the staffs are so annoying I’m having a great time there All you have to go is with an open mind, a great spirit and wealing to be respectful.', 'It is a school that teaches students the merit of community service, but, also, becoming involved with their community overall. As a college student right now, many of the fundamental lessons and skills I learned in HS have been carried with me now. I learned to study, plan, become involved, and become a social butterfly (as opposed to my introverted middle school self). In the way way future, even if my children get into some prestigious high school, I will send them here.', 'The thing I like about HSPS is that they help you get a head start for the future specifically providing information about the college of your choice and how it works, what it requires from you, and what it provides you to better your future.', 'They prepare you for real life. Also, they put you in programs that looks great on your resume. Freshman year, it was sort of overwhelming. As time went on, I began to understand the way that this school is. Coming in as a ninth grader, I thought why do they give so much work. Now I am a senior and I realize that all that hard work really paid off. They give us mastery work. It’s like major projects. When we put that we have completed so many major projects on our resume, jobs would want us even more. It Makes is stand out. How many people have you known that says that they have completed over 100 major projects? That’s rare right? If you send your child to HSPS, your child is garunteed to be prepared for not only college, but the real world.', "The teachers at this school are very involved in the students personal and academics problems. They are very understanding and they do everything they can to help you. Since I'm in my college year things have been hectic but.the 12th-grade teachers (especially Zanitsch) and the school counselor, Ms. Miller has been extremely helpful. However, I wonder how much better the school would be without some staff.", 'the teachers are great and very involved with the students since its a really small school. The teachers even play with the students in school wide competitions such as volleyball, basketball, ect (and win) We have many activities such as sports, clubs, and extracurricular. Many AP options to choose from. There are many outside programs you can reach out to advertised by the school and lots of community service.', 'I love how everyone is a family there and how the teachers push you to do better and exceed your limits.', "It's a small school but the teachers are very friendly. Overall environment is great. Each student gets personal attention from the teachers.", 'The school is good, it’s challenges you but it’s very diffult to get good grades because you’re under allot of stress and held up to a high expectation. also helps you network with allot of programs and non profits!', "What I liked about HSPS was that there were a lot of opportunities for me to volunteer in the community, and there were a lot of after-school clubs for me to participate in. What I'd like to see change is that seniors should have a lounge of their own. After lunchtime, the majority of the seniors have a free period but there's no room available to us during that time.", 'I liked how inclusive the school was and the variety of clubs and teachers. The teachers go above and beyond for students, and they tell you everything you need to know about college and career readiness.', 'An Excellent place to learn and grow as an individual. The teachers are amazing at what they do.  Everyone is very welcoming and helpful to each other.', "I like the fact that it a small school, so we all know each other. The teachers are absolutely wonderful, they are not just educators but also your close friends that you can talk to about everything. On the other hand our school needs funding that way we can get access to all the necessary things we need to succeed. For example, students on the sports team have to pay for their sport uniforms. This shouldn't be so. We should have access to the necessary things we need without having to pay for them. It's a public school education for a reason. We are obliviously at the school because we can not afford private schools, so asking us to pay for things like this when it should be funded by the government is not right.", 'I enjoyed my 3 years at HSPS as im enjoying my senior year. The teachers are good at their jobs and the chance to join clubs and activities are great. You also connect with the community through numerous opprtunities for community service. Programs like BuildOn, New Yorkers Against Gun Violence, etc speak to the bame that public service stands for. The biggest complaint is the spacing of the school. With three other schools in Wingate Campus, the High School for Public Service is confined to one hallway and a few rooms upstairs that creates crowding at times. Overall HSPS is a very good school to begin or continue your high school career.', 'This school was a great school. Definitely prepared me for college with the academics throughout the 4 years there.', 'As a junior, I have to say my experience here was nothing but great. I loved all my teachers and I have nothing but good things to say about the environment as a whole. It is very diverse in terms of race and sexuality. They have safe spaces for anyone in the LGBTQ community and offer tons of extracurricular activities. What I like most about the school is the amount of student led activities. Our own junior girls started the cheer leading team this year. Any fundraisers? We did them. Any parties? Its the student government. The school as a whole is great.']
column4: ['I love the connection all the students have with each other. Also, the teachers are very easy to talk to', 'My Experience at the High school for Public Service was fabulous. At first I wanted to transfer and I have been trying to transfer since Freshman year but here I am now a Senior about to graduate from High school of Public Service . The staff at the school is phenomenal and are very helpful . Not only with our school work but they are very helpful with our personal life . At the high school for public service there isn’t one person that I don’t feel comfortable with . All the staff and students are like a family . I’m so glad that I stayed.', 'I transferred to HSPS my sophomore year and they welcomed me with open arms....never regret transferring there ,  the teachers work me and push me towards my highest potential.', 'My school is great. it has prepared me for college and im excited to graduate and use all the tools ive learned about here.', 'Some teachers are great but other aren’t, but teachers are so wealing to help you with your grades and if you need something. For example, most of them usually create a after school help class for their students, which is great if your behind in any of other classes. Has a variety of sports and activity for afterchool. For example boys and girls volleyball, basketball, track, girls soccer , boys baseball, and more.Polices are so rude but they make us feel safe The school is clean but most of the staffs are so annoying I’m having a great time there All you have to go is with an open mind, a great spirit and wealing to be respectful.', 'It is a school that teaches students the merit of community service, but, also, becoming involved with their community overall. As a college student right now, many of the fundamental lessons and skills I learned in HS have been carried with me now. I learned to study, plan, become involved, and become a social butterfly (as opposed to my introverted middle school self). In the way way future, even if my children get into some prestigious high school, I will send them here.', 'The thing I like about HSPS is that they help you get a head start for the future specifically providing information about the college of your choice and how it works, what it requires from you, and what it provides you to better your future.', 'They prepare you for real life. Also, they put you in programs that looks great on your resume. Freshman year, it was sort of overwhelming. As time went on, I began to understand the way that this school is. Coming in as a ninth grader, I thought why do they give so much work. Now I am a senior and I realize that all that hard work really paid off. They give us mastery work. It’s like major projects. When we put that we have completed so many major projects on our resume, jobs would want us even more. It Makes is stand out. How many people have you known that says that they have completed over 100 major projects? That’s rare right? If you send your child to HSPS, your child is garunteed to be prepared for not only college, but the real world.', "The teachers at this school are very involved in the students personal and academics problems. They are very understanding and they do everything they can to help you. Since I'm in my college year things have been hectic but.the 12th-grade teachers (especially Zanitsch) and the school counselor, Ms. Miller has been extremely helpful. However, I wonder how much better the school would be without some staff.", 'the teachers are great and very involved with the students since its a really small school. The teachers even play with the students in school wide competitions such as volleyball, basketball, ect (and win) We have many activities such as sports, clubs, and extracurricular. Many AP options to choose from. There are many outside programs you can reach out to advertised by the school and lots of community service.', 'I love how everyone is a family there and how the teachers push you to do better and exceed your limits.', "It's a small school but the teachers are very friendly. What I'd like to see change is that seniors should have a lounge of their own. After lunchtime, the majority of the seniors have a free period but there's no room available to us during that time.", 'I liked how inclusive the school was and the variety of clubs and teachers. The teachers go above and beyond for students, and they tell you everything you need to know about college and career readiness.', 'An Excellent place to learn and grow as an individual. The teachers are amazing at what they do.  Everyone is very welcoming and helpful to each other.', "I like the fact that it a small school, so we all know each other. On the other hand our school needs funding that way we can get access to all the necessary things we need to succeed. For example, students on the sports team have to pay for their sport uniforms. This shouldn't be so. We should have access to the necessary things we need without having to pay for them. It's a public school education for a reason. We are obliviously at the school because we can not afford private schools, so asking us to pay for things like this when it should be funded by the government is not right.", 'I enjoyed my 3 years at HSPS as im enjoying my senior year. Overall HSPS is a very good school to begin or continue your high school career.', 'This school was a great school. Definitely prepared me for college with the academics throughout the 4 years there.', 'As a junior, I have to say my experience here was nothing but great. I loved all my teachers and I have nothing but good things to say about the environment as a whole. It is very diverse in terms of race and sexuality. They have safe spaces for anyone in the LGBTQ community and offer tons of extracurricular activities. What I like most about the school is the amount of student led activities. Our own junior girls started the cheer leading team this year. Any fundraisers? We did them. Any parties? Its the student government. The school as a whole is great.']

column8: ['Everything is okay with the health and safety policies.', 'Not too many arts that interest me to join something.', 'They have a step team which is entertaining to watch', 'The teachers do not care too much about the students and rarely give extra help.', 'The school administrators are concerned about the students emotional and academic well being. There is always at least one administrator you could talk to when you have any problem. Additionally, the teachers take the time to stay after school for a long period of time, in order for students to have the opportunity to use the computers and ask for help.', 'My overall experience at this school was good  there was things that I would change to make it better like more classroom non crowed hallways, no uniform and more sports. If I could go back to this school again I would because there was a lot of caring and loving people there that really cared about us.', 'I transferred to HSPS and feel that overall the school is okay. The school really helped me prepare for college unlike my other school.', 'Its alright. The school focuses on mastery work', "It's an excellent school. Pay attention at all times.", 'The high school for Public Service is an excellent school in which students can focus on their education, and at the same time enjoy many different activities. In this school all students are required to complete 200 hours of community service. At this school students are taught to become more active in their communities. Each year at the high school for public service, we have a global youth service day. On this day all students in their advisory, leave the classroom and head out into their community to volunteer. Last year my advisory went to an elementary school, to serve as teacher assistants and help the little ones. This was a great experience as I got spend the day helping kids, take a break from the regular lass routine, and volunteer in my community. If I had to choose again, my choice would remain the same because the atmosphere which this school has of being selfless and involved in the  community, has greatly influenced how I view the community I live in.', 'The food was okay but not great.', 'Sometimes they are harsh on the students.', 'The teachers were very much supportive of me .', 'The extracurricular opportunities were very good. There was a lot to choose from.', 'This school prepared me very much for college.', 'It is a great school, with caring teachers', 'Most of the time they give something great', 'The school is very tough but also understanding', 'The coaches are really caring', 'The community here is the most friendly and helpful.']

column2: ['I have attended this school for four years and it has been quite a journey! The staff, students, and admin make me feel LIKE FAMILY!', "Well, I've been in this school for seven years because since it's a middle school and highschool. I've been here since I was in sixth grade and yes every school has drama and every school has problems but one thing I could say is the staff at times could be like a family or those specific staff could be seen as family. A lot of the people at this school have friendly faces and wouldn't mind being a helping hand but of course just like at any school people will be there to cause problems but it's all about how you handle a situation and handle those people.", 'QSI gives Students an opportunity to take college classes. Starting off with college language classes as early as freshmen year to taking classes in Queens College in junior year.I don’t like the grading system.', 'I like how this school provides student with college classes at an early period of their academic career. I would like to see them incorporate more AP classes.', "My experience in QSI was great. Teachers were very helpful in so many ways. I would give it five stars if it wasn't for the students. Students in QSI lack discipline and manner. I think QSI needs stricter rules for the students to follow.", "Being in this school, it allows me to take college classes and get a headstart. You get to take some classes with your friend, so it's not that scary. The school is too small for a high school and a middle school to be on one floor. The teachers are there for you if you have a connection with them. One thing that I wished could change is the way the teacher approaches things.", 'The Queens School of Inquiry is a wonderful school for middle and high school. The curriculum is always evolving. The only down sides are that its in a building with two other schools, only occupies one floor, and has to share an auditorium, gym and cafeteria with the other two schools. College Readiness is beyond exceptional, especially with students taking college classes for dual enrollment.', 'I love this school! It has helped me a lot especially with college applications and knowing what to do. They give us a lot of opportunities !!', 'When I attended, the teachers and professors were excellent and knew what they were doing. Although now, some of the best high school teachers in the math and science departments left. But the professors are still amazingly smart and talented people. The early college program is amazing and helps a lot with exposure to the college environment. If one is able to do well in high school classes and get them over with, they will find themselves in a better environment taking college classes. There is decent counseling. Also, some students are good people while others are not. It is important to associate with those good people.  If you take advantage of the program, you will do well!', "Manager is useless. Quarter full on Thursday with at least a thirty minute wait since the kitchen was backed up. Was told that they needed a cook. Now the most grotesque thing imaginable! I had to take my niece to her last test of high school. And she could not stay for breakfast. I come back and pick up the others to find that my red potatoes were boxed up. I had not been there when they arrived. Bring them home to start eating them only to realize that this dish has no chicken but there it was staring at me. A LARGE CHUNK OF CHICKEN AND A PARTIALLY EATEN PIECE! This was not my side dish but someone's leftovers. Called corporate the woman was so concerned. Stated she was sending me a place to send the pictures to. As well as notifying the district person. Well, I never gat a call back.", 'I like the program in the school. They have great opportunities that save time and money (especially with college credits). Furthermore, the people in the school are nice and are always willing to help. I have learned a lot by following the teachers and the material. They are experienced and always are willing to help. One thing I do not like is the grading system. They follow standards based grading (1-4 scale). It is a little confusing to get used to. But overall, great school.', 'I attend Queens School of Inquiry, the school is an early college school and is connected with Queens College. which really help you get ready for college and understand the college workload. I would recommend this school to anyone that is looking to graduate high school with multiple college credits. the teacher are really committed to their students', "I like the chance the school gives in early college classes so I know what it's really like in the future and all the people who are always there to help me if I get stressed, need help, or even just upset.", 'The Queens School of Inquiry is a great high school to go to if you want an early start for college. This is an early college school which means that students have the opportunity to earn college credits with dual enrollment classes located at Queens College. It is a very small school which can be considered a positive and negative aspect of the school. Since it is a small school, everyone knows each other and becomes a small community within the school. However, the school has a limited amount of extracurricular activities for students to participate in.  If you are very into sports, there are only a handful of athetic teams to join (although they are trying to expand over the years).', "I enjoyed the programs that they offered in regards to getting college credits while in high school. However some of the teacher there don't seem to take their students seriously when they need help. I had an experience with a math teacher where I was in the hospital for a month and she offered to help me catch up before my classes however when I went to her office hours all she did was give me worksheets but didn't actually help me. I wish that they would offer students more help so that their academics aren't affected when they enter college.", "The Queens School of Inquiry (QSI) offers a unique opportunity for students to earn college credit for free by partnering with Queens College. Students can earn up to 60 college credits and being able to be on campus at Queens College really gets you prepared for college. You get the full experience by taking classes with other college students. The one thing I would change about QSI is the amount of space the high school has. It's very small and we don't have many extracurriculars.", 'The Queens School of Inquiry is a diverse school and the teachers really amazing. One thing I would like it change is create more clubs and get more resources.', "There are some select few amazing and brilliant teachers and staff, however everyone else is horrible in both teaching, or personality. I'm not always enjoying myself there because of this.", 'QSI is an excellent school in terms of college readiness. Miss Sequiera does a really excellent job in getting us prepared and confident for our future. She\'s also probably the only faculty member who understand mental health and doesn\'t dismiss it. QSI can really, and should, improve their mental health resources and should start letting parents know when their child is depressed instead of just sending them to a counselor who sees depression as just something you can "not think about".', 'I have experienced 7 years at the Queens School of Inquiry and it has shaped me in the hard working, dedicated and open minded woman I am today, and I am grateful for all the teachers and staff who helped do that.']

column6: ["The Queens School of Inquiry is an early college school that aims to prepare students as early as 7th grade for college. Once in highschool you will be given the chance to attend college classes at Queens College and earn college credits. The teachers strive to help you think outside of the box and have as many tools to your advantage academically and socially. They spend hours preparing lessons that are fitted for each student, whether they need visual learning or more hands on. We take pride in the small but strong clubs and sports teams available. Softball, soccer, and basketball are among the most exciting teams that students look forward to watching and even joining on the team. Clubs and after school activities include GSA, Student Council, S!NG, Cheerleading etc. Because of the small environment, we are a tight knit school where everyone knows each other, developing strong friendships through sports teams especially. It's an amazing school that will prepare you for anything.", 'Being a part of this school since the 6th grade has become a second home. Our graduating class of 2018 is 67 and all of us are connected and have known each other for about half of our lives. The relationships made at this school impact largely whether it be with staff or the students. It is a safe place and I am thankful to have been a part of the growth of the school. When I came there was only a basketball team mainly and now we are growing in number for sports teams and clubs. I am proud to have contributed.', 'The Queens School of inquiry is a school that prepares students for college. College classes are offered to some student who show high academic achievement. The school could improve by creating more resources for students that would be helpful when it comes to race, sexuality, etc.', "My experience at QSI has been a pretty good one. I've attended this school for over 6 years and I have gotten to know all the teachers and staff. The one thing I would want to have changed in QSI is the amount of activities and extracurriculars that are offered.", "My school is decent because it prepares you for college. Within its name and all the inquiries, the students have we broaden our spectrum of knowledge. You get the opportunity to take college classes on an actual college campus which can be beneficial. It gives high school students a glimpse of what they're soon to experience. Some of the high school teachers are very caring and try to create student-led lessons. I do wish that my school was more diverse. More clubs, sports, and volunteers are needed to better at my school.", "I think that there was maybe one class that I enjoyed here. The teachers had no faith in me because I was a transfer student (essentially booted out for inadequate grades). I remained my poise because it was my 2nd chance to graduate from High school. The school is underfunded, has barely extracurricular activities, and the students are pretty unmotivated. I graduated a year early and continued to pursue higher education. I guess what I'm grateful for was the fact that I had so much unused potential that I could've utilized better had I been more motivated my first semester at Bard. There are exceptions to this rant about ~5% of the school isn't terrible. However, if you are looking for a college preparatory high school,  QSI will probably prepare you to ace at a high community college level, maybe. STEM (science technology and engineering) is awful here, so there's no way you're prepared for that. Humanities is mediocre too. Work needs to be done, sorry QSI.", "There is a lot of diversity at the school, but there are also a lot of extremely annoying students. This school accepts everyone who applies, so there are students that distract the class and prevent everyone else from learning, but teachers and administration lack the authority to do anything in response to this... Or they just don't flex their authority as much as is necessary to push forward discipline and a safer, better learning environment. In addition to this, QSI has by far the worst grading system I have EVER SEEN. Sometimes they look at your averages, sometimes they look at your latest exam, its complete garbage.And, the school has very little funding. They are barely able to provide trips to students, most of the school building lacks working air conditioners, and they had to cancel tutoring classes for students because they could not afford to pay the teachers!If not for teachers like Mrs.F, Mrs.Omega, Mr.Guisto, and Mrs.McCory; I would give this school 1/5 stars.", 'Small school, but they have a early college program with a college so you get college credits. Teachers are mostly good, and there is a lot of diversity.  The whole school is like a big family because of how small it is. Not too many clubs, though.', 'Although a small school not too many facilities but this school has early College program with Queens College. Start from 10th grades students have opportunity to earn credit to attend the college class which is a very good experience and able to transfer earned credits for all CUNY and most of the SUNY.', "I went to this school for middle school and high school. It is a pretty small school, but the cool part is you're able to take classes at a college campus. I believe there were 3-4 sports teams and a couple of clubs available. ", 'This is a early college school which give students good opportunities to earn credit and get ready for college.', 'It is safe and feel secure at this school, no worries', 'If school can have more funding that could provide more after school facilities for students to join.', 'Its a safe school and very friendly', 'Most of the teachers are helpful and provide good advice to students and parents', "School nurse used to be of 0 help but I think they hired a new one and she seems okay. Safety measures taken seem to work and I've never felt like I was in immediate danger of being harmed.", "There should be and hopefully will be many more extracurriculars, but money's tight. Students complain but commitment levels aren't stupendous. I'd say the most popular organizations are student council and NHS because they're monitored the most and get the most administrative help.", "Granted, the school's the accumalitive size of three city blocks. However, it's because of this that all students know each other. This may not seem important, but there are no cliques here. Sure, there are kids that link up and are closer to each other than other people, but I can personally say there is no exclusiveness. There are a lot of opportunities at hand here thanks to the partnership with a local college. There aren't many events which we all complain about, but once events are planned kids are still lacking in spirit anyway but the school still tries. It may be small but I think the community really makes up for it.", 'A good amount of teachers are really able to have their lessons stick with you. A good amount of teachers are insanely close to their students and form really admirable bonds. There are a good handful of teachers that really treat us students like people and not inferiors. There are a few teachers that are very "teach yourself and ask for help" which I don\'t necessarily enjoy, but most of the teachers do the whole traditional speak-and-walk-around-the-room-and-ask-students-questions thing which although it is traditional, it still manages to stay engaging. 99% of the teachers are excellent communicators and are very understanding but not pushover-esque about grading. There are a handful that are so at the top of their game that I personally would vouch for promotions for them. Really great staff at my school. I learn a lot. Not only learn, but retain information concerning academics and life.', "Not really much to offer because of the budget. If their is a new club it's hard to get practice time since the building is shared with 3 other schools. And to get money is never really possible since it's being spent on other things."]
column8: ["The only thing to benefit from this school is the college credits. Other than that not so much. You don't get the high school expirence when going to this school. The prom the graduation. Any event that is supposed to be a big deal in high school gets made into QSI size. There isn't a homecoming or big sports team. Yeah all the teachers get to know your name but does it really matter when you look back and realize you were in a hallway for high school.", 'Studying abroad is a great extracurricular activity because you get college credits for doing it.', 'The teachers ae both friendly and relatable. They are also good leaders.', 'Honestly a really bad school. Spent the last 7 years of my life here and regret it more than anything. Unprofessional, not organized, and just not a good atmosphere. Horrible horrible school.', 'I feel like the only good thing is probably the college class that they offer.', "Doesn't offer too much, but have good quality education. Yet there's barely any clubs or things that this school can offer besides college classes.", 'The area is a safe region to go to school, so according to that this school has good Health and Safety accommodations.', "I've only been in this school for three years, but they were the best three years in high school. I transferred to Kenmore East and nothing can compare to how much I love QSI. You feel at home when your at QSI, because the school trusts their students and treats them as adults.", "The teachers truly give their all for you any time after school, and some are willing to go out of their way to stay beyond the time they're supposed. They treat you like equals, so there is never a feeling of uncomfort or hesitation to ask for help. Due to the fact the teachers treat their students that way they get the respect of many students in the school. The teachers all have different ways of teaching their subject in a fun and entertaining way, so student actually enjoy what they are being taught. It's very close-knit and you will just love having a close relationship with your teacher at QSI, for sure.", 'There is a decent amount of clubs in my school, but I wish we had more.', 'Even though the school is new, we still have a lot of great programs in the school.', 'The teachers in my school are amazing. They go above and beyond to make sure that we pass their class.', "QSI is an early college high school, meaning students begin taking college classes, along with their required high school subjects, in the 9th grade. In 11 grade, that is when waiver classes are available and we have travel to the college we are partnered with to take the classes. I'd say the class almost everyone likes is Chemistry simply because of the teacher. She is absolutely the best teacher in the world.", "Heath and safety are two things that are great in my school, there is a great nurse who cares for you. There are several security cameras in the hallways and the security members truly care and are amazing people. In order to enter the school, students must show the security their Ids and if they don't possess one, they must provide their schedule to show that they go to the school. Faculty and staff are always around the hallways to make sure no issues are happening. As for personal safety, I have never felt unsafe in QSI. We have never been on lock down besides practice. All exits are elctronically locked and if a student opens it, an extremely loud siren goes off. All students must leave through the main entrance unless the side door is available and an officer is on duty to check IDs.", 'There are a whole bunch of different clubs and organizations. There is a student council where the students really take part on the community. National Honor Society is also another organization that is available and does a lot for the community- I am currently finishing up my application for NHS. As for clubs there are several such as Math club, Robotics, Book club. We are currently adding new clubs such as knitting. Everyone has a part in the clubs and no on is ever left out. We are very supporting of each other, and it is a great way to spend time with your friends and express yourself.', "The majority of the teachers are amazing! The English and Math teachers are fantastic, so are the art and drama professors. The chemistry, who also happens to be the forensics teacher as well, is the best teacher in the world. They all care about you and want you to better yourself. My only issues are with the Physics, Living Environment, and Health teachers. The health teacher is pathetic, every single student would listen to music during class and use them for quizzes and exams. The  funny thing is that he doesn't care; students take out their devices like they are in lunch. The living environment teacher is decent, but goes way too fast and seems to have short-term memory loss. She said that we would watch a video the next day, and then she would give an exam. The physics teacher is the teacher nobody takes seriously. He is a great person but can't teach. Everyone fails the Physics regents with 40s and 50s. Other than those three teachers, everyone else is absolutely amazing!", "Queens School of Inquiry is an amazing school. It has provided so many opportunities for me. Because of this school, I am able to graduate with over 20 CUNY college credits, go to Coastal Studies for Girls, a semester school in Maine, for a full semester and have the chance to study abroad in Italy, during the Summer. This school focuses around college readiness and prepares you for the real world. The staff is incredible and is able to help you in every way possible. I can't imagine going to another school. There are so many clubs including the game club, ping pong club, and so much more. QSI is also really big on volunteer work; for example, we do a lot of fundraising for Autism Awareness and Breast Cancer Awareness. It is a school that others should model.", 'This school is great   the teachers really care about the students', 'Qsi is an amazing school! I was given the opportunity to take classes at Queens College and receive college credits. The teachers are friendly and are always willing to help me. One of my favorite experiences was attending a fun raiser for my school, so we can raise money to have more clubs. This was my favorite experience because it brought all the students and teachers together and I had a great time! I have attended this school for six years and I would recommend it to anyone.', 'Its a fine school, but its budget is not so good.']

column1: Urban Assembly School for Law & Justice
column2: ['The school’s College and Career office does amazing work in helping students be better prepared for college. The classes offered are relevant and interesting. One thing I would change is the grading system.', 'Urban Assembly is a school that has good academic but the planning for academics is unorganized , teachers dont work together to plan things stuff is mostly pilled on top of eachother due to poor planning. Girls Bathrooms are disgusting everyday and also the cafeteria where kids eat , we understand that it is a shared school but some changes need to be made to make sure that kids are comfortable. Fights do happen at this school but that is with all schools so it is expected but i feel that the staff need to be more involved with the students because some of them dont even know my name ( Aka : The principle )', 'I currently attended the school and I love how SLJ offers a lot academic programs. The teachers work really close with students they never gave up on students', 'At Urban Assemblt School for Law and Justice I was taught most of the skills that I will use for the rest of my life. The college and carrer office was awesome and they helped me through every step of going to a great college to be exactly what I want to be. The students are different in terms background and attitudes you will meet a little bit of everywhere. The school makes it comfortable for students to express themselves even though there is uniform we are told not to supress our creativity by dress down days and spirit weeks.', "One of the best school's in New York City.... Full of loving teachers determined to create bright futures for their students and full of students from all over New York that are absolutely amazing and soaking in potential!!!!!!!!!!", 'The Urban Assembly School For Law And Justice  is very diverse school full of children from multiple nationalities. It has great sports programs and after school programs and is accepting of kids from any background. I highly recommend this school.', 'This school is filled with teachers who genuinely care about their students. This school also prepared me for college better than my friends who went to other schools.', 'The teachers are committed to ensuring that students can be as successful as possible! Lots of opportunities are provided from the increasing amount of Advanced Placement classes to the enrichment programs students choose to be in.', 'The school does a excellent job with preparing its students for college . There is a college lab that is dedicated to guiding students through the college process step by step . Students leave the school well prepared for college and can always come back and use the school as a resource .', 'I am a current ninth grader at this school and amazed with every aspect of this is school and this opportunities it has to offer for its students. Although it doest provide many AP courses it does provide many off-campus programs that students can easily apply for and discover after making a trip to the enrichment office. The school is working on it AP course count, and produces about 1 0r two more classes each year. It small but dedicated community.', 'I love the diversity of the subjects they have. Every subject has a law based curriculum.  English deals with different types of law and Justices. It makes learning so much fun. The relationships with the teachers are great. You will feel you can talk to any teacher you want to about anything.', 'Loved my entire High School Experience.  They supported me throughout the entire college process and for that I am eternally grateful. The teacher are very supported and dedicated and will do anything they can to help you.', 'My overall experience at SLJ has been good. The academic part is amazing so far. I really enjoy learning. But as for some of the students who attend, I really and honestly feel unsafe in the SLJ environment. But luckily, because SLJ has fantastic extracurricular activities to choose from I participate in a lot to keep away from them and also better myself and my development. ', "The extracurricular's my school offers are really helpful, beneficial,fun and etc That is one of the highlights my school excels in.", "I like my school very much. But I don't totally love it.", 'The teachers at my school show that they really care about their students. Most teachers are available after school hours and they really care about the quality of our work.', 'My high school was the best because it prepared me for college and it had so many programs that helped shape who I am today. I love the way the staff knew all the students and was very involved in our success. I just simply loved the SLJ community.', 'There is a great variety of extracurricular programs from dance to music to cheerleading.', 'The school gives us the opportunity to be apart of so many different enrichment programs both on site and off site.', 'The teachers are dedicated to their students to see them do well throughout classes. They are always available for tutoring or any questions or concerns we may have about the work being taught.']

They are always available for tutoring or any questions or concerns we may have about the work being taught.']
column6: ["the school is great overall. however, i didn't like wearing uniform but it gave a us a sense of discipline and unity", "This school has it flaws, but it's the children that gives this school a bad name. Instead, of uplifting one another they spend their energy on bringing each other down. This got me upset because it caused many unnecessary confrontations and took up other people learning time. The teachers and staffs are well and their teaching techniques is very challenging.", 'it has its ups and downs', 'They only have a limit of sports you can play, which sucks.', 'They are very interactive and gets you mentally and physically active in your school work.', 'my daughter has excelled at this school the teachers were there when u needed them the principal had a open door policy with the students and the parents the workload for the students pushed them to excel in their studies', 'the school does have a baseball and basketball team but sports do not really play a big factor. When there are basketball games many students do have school spirit and attend almost all games played in the school.', "the school's administration did get strict from my freshmen year all the way up until my senior year. The school enforced many rules to prevent bullying and other aspects in that nature.", 'My overall high school experience was one of the best things I experienced in my life because my school was connected with so much in the outside world that gave me and other students a chance to explore new things for free.', "The school was always able to provide for each student's need. Faculty knew each student by their name and it created an atmosphere where the students felt comfortable coming to school and being able to trust the adults that worked with them.", "The rules don't do much to stop kids from breaking them. Almost any punishment or denied privilege can be remedied.", 'There are a nice variety of clubs to join at this school. There is a lot of freedom to create a club if a student can find a teacher willing to sacrifice the time to conduct the club.', 'The school nurse is pretty good. If there is a real emergency of course 911 will be called but she can handle headaches, swollen fingers etc. Overall she does a decent job', 'There is a lot of support and acceptance in my school. People are most times friendly to each other and look out for each.', 'The food that students are served in my school can be of much better quality and much better variety.', 'The teachers at my school care for the success of their students, although they give challenging work they believe that the students can step up to the plate and get the job done.', "With an All Females Security Staff, I can say I feel safe in my school because they make sure situations don't escalate to a point of worry.", 'The Office Staff such as the two Deans I have in my school are pretty strict on enforcing disciplinary actions for those who bully, gives detention to students who arrive late and/ or out of uniform. They enforced these policies to keep the school functionally running and want it to be a safe learning environment.', 'My school had enough sporting opportunities to keep most students happy, however they lack the funding many schools have to upgrade their facilities to proper compete with others.', 'Although my school does not have the funding as other schools to start up big clubs that most students would like, I can say they do a good job with the resources they have to give the students an experience worth having.']
