column2: ['Overall, my experience at the Academy was good. My peers were fantastic, and the subject matter always allowed for lively debates. I only wish the teachers were more consistent and the material different year to year.', 'The reason this school is so unique is due to the fact that everything is expected of you as if you where at the college level.  You really move on with your life and taking a big leap into your future career goals and everyone here worked hard to get in making everyone hungry for knowledge. During my time at this school I met really great people who are gunna do great things in this world some day and made friends who really want to achieve educational goals. Also there are many opportunities given from attending this school and our law teacher is absolutely excellent.', 'Our guidance counselors are always there for you through think and thin no matter what. Throughout high school, we get taken out of classes to learn more about college and different resources that are readily available for us at the times we need them, In addition to that, our national honor society has morning tutoring for anyone who thinks they need help. And if a student believes they need help, they can talk to their guidance counselor and their counselor will arrange for a student to come in and help them in that subject. Teachers also make time for you as long as you ask. They are available before school and after school to help students. Although our school is not fully equip ed with the newest technology we do have computer labs and a library where the librarian is always there to help. She has the most updated books and also has the computer updated with technology as well. In the classrooms, we have one computer which is used regularly. Notes and books are still used, but it depends on the teacher and the class. Each class set up is different. It just depends on the teacher.', "In middle school, I was that shy girl. My school got me to be outgoing and not afraid of what is to come. I absolutely love my school, I met some of my best friends in this school. Even though my best friend graduated last year me and her keep in contact every single day. I have made friends and have the best group that i will be friends with forever. Even though many of them graduated any minute we find we will be with each other. In addition, I have had some of the best teachers who taught me that its okay to ask questions and come for help. It doesn't hurt you it really helps you. I was apart of two teams and felt welcome readily. I would defiantly chose to go here again.", 'My school is in a very small area. Many of us have gone to school with each other since we were all very little. The academy and the high school in general tries hard to help each other in every little way possible. Their is absolutely no ethnicity or racial boundary. Everyone gets along with each other. Their are the typical high school popular kids groups but most of the time if you leave them alone they leave you alone. In our school, sexual orientation is not an issue either. Our school has a peace alliance group where bisexuals, gays, and lesbians raise awareness and get through the challenges many of them go through. In addition, we have a peer group that helps lower grades through their classes to better succeed as well. Our school is based prominently on helping each other rather than fighting. We are a school that sticks together to help each other no matter what grade it is.']

['I really love Bronx prep because it prepares students for college. It is academically rigorous and strict. The main reason I came to Bronx prep was for the international trips. This trips help students become globally minded citizens. The work is stressful but it prepares you for what college will be like.', 'I like how administration always tried to provide students and the college readiness team were always there to help', "I've been here for the past 7 years. Truthfully the school was much better when it was independent but has benefitted from the Democracy Prep involvement. There is high standards and a great school culture along with helpful resources for college readiness and students with IEPs. In addition this school focuses on the arts and speech and debate, in which it has many awards. Other highlights of the school are: Korean Language studies, Softball and Basketball teams, Carrera program, and various clubs.", 'Bronx Preparatory Charter School is a very challenging school and the main motive is to get their students ready for college. I think that the safety of the school is very excellent and well organized, however, I feel like the clubs in the school lacks.  They are barely any clubs and I would like that to improve because the students work very hard and stress would ease if clubs were involved.', 'I loved Bronx Preparatory Charter School is not something you would hear often as students struggle with coursework and homework. Bronx Prep has benefited me so much and with the help of the amazing teachers and the high level of preparation offered I know I can accomplish anything.', "Since I first entered the school back when we used to have a 5th grade, school used to be so fun. I wouldn't wake up and think about going to school. School was where I wanted to be everyday. As we got older, our school rating began to decline and they had to call in Democracy Prep to help the school not be in jeopardy of shutting down. Since then, school has been very hard to keep up with. Many students are doing better, however we are supposed to fit standards that are not realistic for every student, thus making it difficult for many of the students to do well in school.", 'The school has a very rigorous curriculum for students and the high expectations have proven to be too much at times. However, the school does provide students with certain privileges and rewards for their hard work: international trips, award ceremonies, and local trips.', 'As a senior in Bronx Preparatory Charter School, the teachers are a lot more helpful due to the college admission process. They are very hard on us to apply to FAFSA and common app and just making sure we do everything possible to make this process a whole lot easier. We have an amazing college readiness team who reassures you that you will make it into college regardless of grades, behavior, etc.', 'Bronx prep or Bphs or the famous nickname Bp is not a bad school at first when I walked in I thought the school was horrible and I not going to be  feeling the school but the more I kept going to school the more I grew to like it. Is like everyday I end up being in that school. The people in the school make up the good parts about it. It’s like a family. You walk in and it’s like you get  recognized people wouldn’t forget who you are cause each of everyone of us in that school have an impact on each other. The school is also the “plug “ which I would say we start college readiness the day we enter the build freshman year. I been put on to so many programs well I have attended the school.  And I love the school spirit it’s also that helps us connect with each other. We are like a family.', "Well I'm an old student but, being at BP was an extremely great experience. We got many opportunities to speak to representatives from college, they had good art programs and the teachers and staff were great. They made sure that you got the help you needed no matter what they had to do.", 'The teachers and faculty were really supportive and some were even willing to host study sessions afterschool or on the weekend.', "I loved the atmosphere and constant push towards academic prosperity. I've been there since 5th grade and I am now a graduating senior, the environment in which that school has turned into has become extremely strict but at the end of the day its for the better,  and the students will appreciate it.", 'I like how they get us prepared for college and the environment is very welcoming and nice. Bronx prep teaches us how to be responsible adults with priorities and goals. The teachers make sure that every student is represented equally and they make sure that we all understand our work. They prepared us for the Sat by getting us A list prep, we also get a lot of prep for the regents. We have a good culture at bronx prep because everyone is connected and it is a very friendly environment. Students are bright here and love learning', "What I like about my Bronx Prep is that once you step into Senior year they help you apply to colleges and start the process. Once everything is done they make a big celebration and it's the most exciting part you can experience.", 'My experience at Bronx Prep Charter School was pretty cool. The teachers were very friendly to the students at the school. There is good one on one help for the  students that need help. School has lots of supplies. Also you feel like a community, in this school and everyone literally knows each other. Food is not as bad, its regular food. It has a great library with lots of interesting books.', 'My school is located in the middle of the south Bronx, an area enriched with violence and poverty. A lot of our students derive from low income families, and depend on the faculty and staff to help provide us with the motivation we need in order to graduate. Our school is big on implementing the idea that the youth hold the biggest voice as a group, and create a voice that has the most power to cause change. It is also big on motivating the students to believe that college is not something that is out of our reach. Being apart of Bronx Prep is truly an experience I could never regret. The relationships I\'ve built with my classmates and even my teachers are un-breakable. The emotional connections you build with everyone around you are genuine and delightful. "BP love" could never be replaced. We work together to see not only ourselves, but others succeed.  I can truly say that if it weren\'t for Bronx Prep\'s empowering environment and staff, my mindset would not be how it is currently.', 'What I, in my opinion, like about Bronx Prep Charter High School is its willingness to stay after office hours and make the extra effort to help its students with tasks and intense homework content. I would rate the college readiness at this school a 9 out of 10 because the college counselors actually go the extra mile and help the students decide which college would be the best fit for them, along with answering their questions and confronting their doubts about life after High School. However, something I think the school overall should work on is allowing for more extra advanced placement classes to be formed such as AP Physics and other challenging classes. That way more options would be available to the students.', 'This Is A College Readiness School. It Gives us  work as if we are in college right now. They Even teach us Korean. Instead of Spanish or French like other schools, it’s exclusive. This school is strict and really hard on the students so that we succeed in life.', 'Bronx Prep is a school that I have mixed feelings about. I am extremely grateful for all the opportunities they have provided with my college readiness class, that helped me apply for college and applying for financial aid. They also have the Carrera program here that helps students apply for scholarships and jobs in summer youth. The teachers push the students to their limits here with lengthy assignments and difficult curriculum. There is one side of me that is thankful that I have grown accustomed to difficulty, and another that dislikes the school for the massive workload they don\'t hesitate to give us. The only thing negative I can say about the school is that the environment is not the best, however it is not really the fault of the school since it is mainly the students that make it this way. The school has no control over how students behave, and threatening them with detentions or its "Deductions" system is not very beneficial.', "The school goes above and beyond by taking their students on international trips to the other side of the world and helps students succeed as far as helping them applying and getting accepted into college. I just hoped that they weren't so strict as to their dress code."]
column4: ['I really love Bronx prep because it prepares students for college. It is academically rigorous and strict. The main reason I came to Bronx prep was for the international trips. This trips help students become globally minded citizens. The work is stressful but it prepares you for what college will be like.', 'I like how administration always tried to provide students and the college readiness team were always there to help', "I've been here for the past 7 years. Truthfully the school was much better when it was independent but has benefitted from the Democracy Prep involvement. There is high standards and a great school culture along with helpful resources for college readiness and students with IEPs. In addition this school focuses on the arts and speech and debate, in which it has many awards. Other highlights of the school are: Korean Language studies, Softball and Basketball teams, Carrera program, and various clubs.", 'Bronx Preparatory Charter School is a very challenging school and the main motive is to get their students ready for college. I think that the safety of the school is very excellent and well organized, however, I feel like the clubs in the school lacks.  They are barely any clubs and I would like that to improve because the students work very hard and stress would ease if clubs were involved.', 'I loved Bronx Preparatory Charter School is not something you would hear often as students struggle with coursework and homework. Bronx Prep has benefited me so much and with the help of the amazing teachers and the high level of preparation offered I know I can accomplish anything.', "Since I first entered the school back when we used to have a 5th grade, school used to be so fun. I wouldn't wake up and think about going to school. School was where I wanted to be everyday. As we got older, our school rating began to decline and they had to call in Democracy Prep to help the school not be in jeopardy of shutting down. Since then, school has been very hard to keep up with. Many students are doing better, however we are supposed to fit standards that are not realistic for every student, thus making it difficult for many of the students to do well in school.", 'The school has a very rigorous curriculum for students and the high expectations have proven to be too much at times. However, the school does provide students with certain privileges and rewards for their hard work: international trips, award ceremonies, and local trips.', 'As a senior in Bronx Preparatory Charter School, the teachers are a lot more helpful due to the college admission process. They are very hard on us to apply to FAFSA and common app and just making sure we do everything possible to make this process a whole lot easier. We have an amazing college readiness team who reassures you that you will make it into college regardless of grades, behavior, etc.', 'Bronx prep or Bphs or the famous nickname Bp is not a bad school at first when I walked in I thought the school was horrible and I not going to be  feeling the school but the more I kept going to school the more I grew to like it. Is like everyday I end up being in that school. The people in the school make up the good parts about it. It’s like a family. You walk in and it’s like you get  recognized people wouldn’t forget who you are cause each of everyone of us in that school have an impact on each other. The school is also the “plug “ which I would say we start college readiness the day we enter the build freshman year. I been put on to so many programs well I have attended the school. column6: ["I was a transfer student who at first was upset because I did not want to leave my other high school. I was challenged academically and intellectually more than I ever was before. My teachers treated me as their peers and actually listened to my ideas and theories as we debated about them instead of shutting me down right away. In hindsight, Bronx Prep was the perfect environment for me. I not only got to travel on humanitarian missions with my classmates, but I was encouraged and empowered to be a part of my school community. Bronx prep prepared me for the next phase of my life. I don't think I would be as prepared as I am today without my school.", "I have been in Bronx Prep since there was actually a 5th grade and now I'm in 9th grade. The school has high standards for every scholar there and also knows how to make it exciting and fun to make the scholar want to come to school and actually learn.", "My experience in Bronx Preparatory Charter School has been very good since I transferred here sophmore year. It feels very different from other schools, because you're actually learning way more and the learning environment is really calm.", "Bronx Preparatory charter school for me is a family. One of my favorite things  about this school is that it isn't just a high school most students, like myself, have attended this school since fifth grade. Not everyone gets the chance to be with the same group of students for 8 years. This contributes to the amazing school culture and school pride that all the students share. Bronx Preparatory Charter School has a club or activity for almost everyone, you will never be bored, the hardest job of administration is trying to get all of the students out of school after hours. A couple years ago another school took over administration and came in with all new rules and tried to change our culture. While the rules changed the relationship and sense of unity among students did not, and thats what I love about my school.", 'Bronx prep is a really good school I have been here since 5 grade. They have really good trips, good connection with staffs and teachers. Good academics,preparing seniors for college and having a really good diversity and relationship with other people.', 'My experience at Bronx Prep was not the worst however it was not the best. I had my ups and downs while attending the school but that did not stop me from obtaining the knowledge I need in order for me to become successful in the long run. I found some of my closet friends in this school, which is a true blessing with that just being a plus on my end.', 'What I liked about Bronx Preparatory Charter School was their academics. I liked how it used to be a good learning experience. Everything changed when Democracy Prep took over. They care more about the uniform more then the actual education.', 'Bronx preparatory public school is a place where knowledge start for everyone. it changes ones life through learning and makes you to be professional for future.', 'I attended Bronx Preparatory Charter School since the 5th grade until the 12th grade. I made friends that will last a lifetime and enjoyed my time while I was there.', "My personal experience at Bronx Prep was an overall amazing experience. I was able to not only grow academically but as a person as well. I was afforded many opportunites such as being able to travel to multiple counties with the school. The staff is very friendly and warming. The teachers are able to establish an amazing relationship with the students and help them succeed. The reason why the school did not get 5 stars is because i feel they didn't help me learn the fundamentals of being an adult.", 'One thing i love about Bronx Prep is the college readiness programs. The staff work hard to help you be as ready for college as possible.', 'Bronx Preparatory Charter School is a school that challanges their students to meet their full potential and prepare them for a future outside of school.', "On of the Bronx's finest schools! Teaches their kids to reach for the stars and once they get there aim higher. Priding its self on DREAM BIG values, of (discipline, respect, accountability) just to name a few . Its a very big school in a urban setting defying the odds. Minority students being recognized from different parts of the United States for there achievements in Speech &Debate.  Bronx Preparatory gives off  a homely vibe and the sense of enjoyment. The students are eager to learn and the teachers are eager to teach. The amount of recognition and praise the students get from extracurricular's make learning effortless.", "I've been in this school since 5th grade. Many changes have taken place for the better and for the worse. BP has many opportunities for people you just have to find them. The only bad part is how most of the teachers are strict and don't really understand the students.", 'Bronx Preparatory Charter School has influenced my life with the support of the Teachers, Enrichment Teachers/Instructors, Staff, and the Administrative staff life would have been different. Being part of the first 5th-grade class in 2000, Preparation + Focus=Success has been my goal throughout my endures. Along the way, I still see Bronx Prep "Beacon of Light" showing their scholars the way to their success. Thank You, Bronx Prep for giving me the tools to conquer my opportunities.', 'Bronx Prep is a great school it well prepares scholars to do well when they get to college. We go a ton of college trips and receive copious amount of challenging work so that later on in college we can knock out the easier work. I wish to change the school hours; family time would be nice.', 'This school is dedicated to ensuring college readiness for young students. One thing I loved is how much the teachers and staff care about the students and how much of a resource they are for any problem. One thing that I would like to change is the amount of discipline the school has. I feel like the administration pays more attention to making sure students follow the rules than how much they actually learn. I believe that education should be the main priority rather that a simple uniform violation.', "My experience in Bronx Prep academic wise has been great teachers are almost always available to help students. Also within the students there are bonds that are formed that create a great environment for the school. One thing that can be improved is the way in which teachers speak to the students because it can often be seen as disrespectful or condescending. Another thing that could be improved is communication between administration because sometimes higher ups don't accurately communicate with the student therefore it causes a lot of miscommunication. Overall Bronx Prep is a great place to be for academics.", 'I like how the school gave me the opportunity to get the knowledge and that knowledge will take to college.', 'What I like about Bronx Preparatory Charter School is the amount of diversity that is inside the school. Every person that I have met, from students to faculty, has a story that has led them to be in the building, and every story interests me. It lets me know what kind of person they truly are.']

column1: Lower East Side Preparatory High School
column2: ['Something I like about LESP are the diversity of students that are coming from different places around the world and the teachers right there are very nice in many different ways, such as my ESL teacher, he always helps me with anything If I ever need his help in any moment.', 'What I liked most about my school was how helpful my principal was. He was always there for us, giving us what we needed and wanted, giving us the benefit of the doubt, he was great to us. He was so great to us that it allowed all the staffs to have a visual of how they should treat us, and so that is what they did. They treated us with the same respect and care as my principal leaving us to behave in the same manner. I transferred to this school from Grand Street and I can genuinely say that I’ve made the best choice by doing so. I was so happy in this school. The staff even helped me graduate earlier than I was originally supposed to, making me the first out of my family to graduate.', 'First, I like this school because it provides all kinds of clubs that most of students can find their favorite one to fit in. Second, this school encourages students to enroll in some AP Courses to help them be more familiar to college levels. If students feel pressured and ask for helps, there’s always a group of social workers here for them to offer assistance. Third, teachers often take care students and make sure them whether in a good mood in classes. And the last, I feel safe in the school because there always have securities working around the school inside and outside to make sure everything goes normally. That’s why I give excellent for this school because it gives me all kinds of activities that I can find the most fit one, it leads me get involved in college life by studying AP Courses, it makes me feel relaxed and comfortable by having social workers hearing from my minds, and it provides a great environment for me to study without fearing anything else.', 'A wonderful school that highly helpful for immigrant students!!! Teachers are always kind and nice; you can adapt the US through 1 or 2 year(s) in this school. Small campus might be the only one disadvantage of school. The first day I walked in school with full of worried and afraid because all the knowledge of English I knew were 26 letters and a few vocabulary; I still remember I could not spell the word "baseball" during the entrance examination. But now I feel comfortable to go to college. Thank you LESP!!!', 'I love lower east side prep for the simple fact that it’s so diverse I’ve gotten the pleasure of meeting people from all over the world i even made friends with them we share stories and it’s so fun and on top of that the teachers are very caring and respectful .', 'My experience at LESP has been amazing. Transferring here was the best decision I have ever made. I made so many new friends that are so mature and who really look put for you. The teachers are great, they really care about everyone and know most of the students names. They try to make everyone feel involved and are always think of new ways to make the school more fun. The entire school is really supportive and everyone is pretty nice. LESP Has forever changed my life for the better.', 'This is my first year there (senior year), the school is a small nice school, teachers are all amazing and make the learning experince easier. This school needs more clubs/programs and better technology.', 'Though I personally could not continue my attendance at LESP due to personal issues, I can attest to the fact that the school does try its best to provide and care for its students. LESP is a transfer school, meant for students who are older, have children or are struggling in general with completing high school. However LESP does everything in its power to maintain a normal high school experience for its students.', 'This was my best experience of high school. I used to be in a targeted in school where I would receive no attention whatsoever but this school is the opposite of that. This place makes you feel like you belong and the more you interact, the more it feels like family. They treat us like adults, in other words, our actions and opinion matters no matter the age. We interact with the teachers and the principal himself. There is always activities to engage in or that one can create. The library and auditorium is spacious and in great/new conditions. You will see things such as camp ,talent shows, bbq in nyc parks, parties, cooking, video games meetings, chess team, soccer team, accesible gym, movie night, prom, students selling food, knitting, jop postings, so much college help, and so on.', 'This school is the best high school I have ever met. The most desirable thing in this school is its warmth. It makes me feel like home when I go to school. It doesn\'t have the highest prestige nor the best facilities, but I love it because all the teachers here are extremely patient and profound. I remember the time when President Donald Trump came to power and so many rumors about the immigration policy came from outside. Our principal immediately stood out and reassured everybody. He said " No matter what, LESP and I always stand behind you." This short announcement truly touched my heart and also made me fall in love with this school. However, the only thing I am not very satisfied with is the school lunch meal. I hope it can be tastier, even though it is very nutritious.', 'At Lower East Side Preparatory High School, students have the opportunity to learn a huge amount of different cultures. Teachers are very friendly and helpful to every student. They are offered many clubs to students to participate.', 'Very diverse school filled with teachers and staff that push you to strive. Lower East Side prep is a school where no student is left behind or forgotten. Everyone counts!', 'If the students need  to change the class schedule, they need to met their counselors.', 'This school has racial diversity. For example, Chinese, Spanish, African-American etc.', 'This school is very safety and has many resources for students.', 'This school has many different after school program/ activities. And these programs are very helpful.', "I would choose this school again because the teachers are friendly and respect students' ideas.", 'It is a great high school for new immigrants who is under 21 years old.', 'I have never seen bullying occurred in the school. Students treat each other nicely. School safety is all around the school. They are nice too. The school nurse is available to us when we need help. We also have health lessons which guest speakers are invited to teach us about health. I think the school is safe. Safer than other high schools.', 'There are many extracurricular activities in the school. I joined Student Government which I have learnt a lot from it. Also, I joined sports club and english class. Students have a lot of fun during those activities.']
column4: ['I love this school even though the school is small. I think since the school is small, students can group together easily. The environment of the school is good. The AC and heat is so great. Many events are held so that students can enjoy their school life! I would definitely choose this school again!', 'Professors are really helpful to assist me on my study. They are available in school and outside the school. I can easily contact them through emails and phones. And they are willing to answer my questions and solve my problems with me. Not only on study, but also my life in America', 'best school I had ever attend', 'Extracurricular activities provided by lower east side preparatory schools are not only educational an immersive but interesting', 'This school gives each student the same opportunity to participate in athletic curriculum', "My whole life I have been to four different Highschool's, this school being the fifth and out of my whole experience of being in five different high-schools , to me this is the best school I have been too.", 'Wide variety of programs available', 'Lower East Side Prep has a great facilities and many resources are available to all students.', "Lower East Side is the best school my child has attended and has impacted her life very positively. The school is very diverse and my child is exposed to multiple cultures. My child is now looking forward to college thanks to all the supportive teachers. If I had a chance I would've loved to attend this school.", "Lower East Side Prep's basketball team has won 19 games out of 20, they also have a fantastic fan support from most of the students in the school. Lower East Side Prep also has a great ping pong team and girls volleyball team.", 'They are a variety of afterschool programs offered at this school and are very interesting and helpful to my child.', 'The teachers at this school are very helpful and give my child all the attention she needs to get good grades in her classes; they also offer afterschool help and also tutoring during lunch time.', "My child is very safe at school and is very comfortable in the school's environment.", 'Lower East Side Prep High School is one of the best schools my daughter has been to, she has attended other high schools in the area and this school has really help her achieve her potential. The teachers are very helpful and offer afterschool help, which they also get credit for! My child has fallen behind in school and Lower East Side Prep has brought her back up to speed, she is now back to where she needs to be thanks to this wonderful school.', 'Even though the school can not provide advanced facilities and satisfied food and snack, some are the teachers are very good and we have 2 excellent college adviser to assist us applying the college. Also, the majorities are immigrants in this school, our teacher are using special way to inspire us and help us to learn to live in the U.S.', 'No menus, no variety, no options and undersupply.', 'It is really bad that only few teachers will tell us things worth to learn. I think it is a point that teachers might think the students are not interesting in learning. However, they just not like to learning boring and useless stuff.', 'There are too many students in one club sometimes and the teachers can not handle that.', 'The fitness room close after school, or just open for people have class on most of time.', 'Some of the guidance counselors get stuff messy. They are totally wasting students time. We have to take a lot of unnecessary class. Expecially in Grade 10 and Grade 12.']
column6: ['I love this school even though the school is small. I think since the school is small, students can group together easily. The environment of the school is good. The AC and heat is so great. Many events are held so that students can enjoy their school life! I would definitely choose this school again!', 'Professors are really helpful to assist me on my study. They are available in school and outside the school. I can easily contact them through emails and phones. And they are willing to answer my questions and solve my problems with me. Not only on study, but also my life in America', 'best school I had ever attend', 'Extracurricular activities provided by lower east side preparatory schools are not only educational an immersive but interesting', 'This school gives each student the same opportunity to participate in athletic curriculum', "My whole life I have been to four different Highschool's, this school being the fifth and out of my whole experience of being in five different high-schools , to me this is the best school I have been too.", 'Wide variety of programs available', 'Lower East Side Prep has a great facilities and many resources are available to all students.', "Lower East Side is the best school my child has attended and has impacted her life very positively. column1: The International High School at LaGuardia Community College
column2: ['LaGuardia is an extremely diverse schools, the most diverse that I have ever attended. The professors are dedicated to their students learning.', 'IHS is a wonderful school, that makes you feel like a part of a family. It makes immigrants feel welcomed. The teachers are very open minded and extremely helpful. They help you with educational stuff and also personal issues. The education can be quite easy at times, but there is college class for you to challenge yourself', "International High School at LAGCC id good for college courses. It gives you a lot of opportunities to learn English and get used tot his culture. Overall, it's good.", "I have been attending The International High School since my freshman year and now I'm almost graduating. The environment of this school is very welcoming to different cultures.  This kind of environment gave me the feeling of an exciting high school life where you will be eager to learn from the teachers who you know love what they are doing as helpers for your learnings. Other than that I would love to see more students taking initiatives to improve the community we have through making clubs. By doing this, not only we are strengthening our community but we are also helping one another to find each individuals interests and passion. All in all, the sense of community will not leave you even after graduating as I have seen from those who graduated from The International High School at LaGuardia Community College but still keeping in touch with everybody they know and not miss a visit.", "The college is well rounded but lacks safety, the security guards do not check id's as often as they should. Some of the ladies working in the cafeteria rather talk and chit chat with their fellow workers than assist me with a purchase. We student have to get to class on time and sometimes dont have the luxury of time. This problem should not even exist but it does and here we are speaking about cafeteria staff not doing their job.", 'This is an excellent school for newcomers. The school is very diverse, thus you can fit in easily. The teachers are very helpful. They offer opportunities to take college classes to help you prepare for college.', 'My experience at LaGuardia Community College really shapes my idea of a school that I wanted to attend for my Bachelors. I liked the diversity of LaGuardia and how much each professor cared about you and what you did. I know that, this kind of experience will not be available in a four year school because it consists of more students and professors have little time to pay attention to each and every student.', 'This college has a lot to offer. It has scholarships which allows some to go to college without worrying about debt. The academics are great. I love that the teachers don’t give second chances and that give you experience in life. In life there is no second chances because if you don’t show up to work you will get fire. This college offer plenty resources for students to use. It offers printers to print your homework. There is a writing center which is unique to help you better your writing. This college has even a daycare for mothers who want to go to college. This is the best college to attend.', 'In my perception, The International High School (IHS) at LaGuardia Community College is one of the safest schools in Queens, New York because the students here are kind and helpful. It offers varieties of clubs or any other extracurricular activities after school. This school is very diverse which is also good because we can learn new languages from different parts of the world. The distinction between this high school compares to the other high school is we students are able to take free college classes from LaGuardia Community College to help us prepare for college and improve our English skills.', 'Fantastic opportunities for international students. Also is a good start in the salvage NYC where you can leard basic skills.', 'The high school at LaGuardia Community College is a safe environment. You can always feel safe once you are there. Students are surrounded by a college which have a positive effect  on them by viewing a college environment. They start to feel part of the environment and some even end up attending the community college because they already feel comfortable with the environment around them.', 'My experienced in IHS at LaGuardia C.C. is absolutely amazing. We have great teachers and fellow classmates who are very rich in diversity so do our perspective towards different gifts is huge. I am very thankful to have spend my four years of high school in IHS because the school do their best to help students in need with starting their new language English and helping seniors to find the right college for them.', 'amazing school for newcomers, awesome opportunities, early college program and all classes teach English vocabulary', 'We have batminton,ping pong and other activities', "Mostly all the parents are concern about their children's progress", 'I love all the opportunities we have', 'The international high school is honestly the best, the teachers and the staff are amazing! The students are not crazy! I can stay here all day saying good things about this school. This school is my second home, it is so safe. Also, the help you can get from the teachers and the students is incredible.', "The experiences I been having in IHS are incredible, I have one year left and I can't believe time could past this fast. If I were to compare IHS with any other school it woulb be difficult since IHS is very unique. In the school there is a big variety of people from different cultures, when you meet someone you feel the need to learn about their country and learn more about it. Moreover, the school offers variety of activities like food festival where you eat delicious food from different countries, talent shows where you se amazing acts, family night where you spend a fun night between teachers and family, and more activities.", "I mostly love the extracurricular activities offered in my school. The teachers are great people, and most of the time they are also great at teaching. Since it is across the street from college, we get to use their facilities, which can be really beneficial for a small school like ours. The fact that we can take college classes and get some real college experience is also great. \r Some things I do not like include the fact that teachers generally don't regard us as strong students due to the fact that english is not our first language. As a result of those set expectations the SAT scores and overall performance is very low compare to other schools. The only way to challenge yourself in this school is take a lots of college classes.", 'They were always helpful in the best possible ways.']

column2: ["Hawthorne High School is a school with many great resources and excellent safety protocol. There are some teachers who certain students dislike, but a lot of them are just tough on the students because they actually want to see them succeed. Many teachers do their best to prepare students for college. Hawthorne High makes good use of Google Classroom, because students usually submit most of their work, and might take a couple of quizzes or tests through it. And just like in any walk of life, you may come across some people who aren't super friendly, but Hawthorne High School has a wealth of nice kids who are searching for their identity, just like everyone else. Attending Hawthorne High School overall will have its highs and lows, like any school. But in the mix, you can find some friendly students and staff, as well as some academic challenges that help you grow into the best version of yourself.", 'The high school lacked diversity, both in the student body and it the courses offered. It needed more classes that focused on the humanities and not just STEM. There was only two languages offered; Spanish and Italian. HHS also needed more diverse clubs.', 'I have a wonderful time going there everyday! The students and staff are very welcoming and all have positive attitudes.', "The atmosphere of Hawthorne High School always felt very laid back and a bit like a second home to me. The activities that go on from Carnavale to Poetry Day are some of the things that make me actually enjoy coming to school. There's always going to be some sort of fun event coming up. Most of the teachers are really great and genuinely care for the students. My experience in Hawthorne High School's Spanish classes, and under the teaching of Rocio Martinez, showed me a love for Spanish and everything Hispanic that I never knew I had. Because of this experience I hope to minor in Spanish in college. This town is so tight-knit and small, making the school feel even smaller, which I think I really appreciate. I pretty much know everyone I go to school with, and I love it. I feel like I have a family away from home.", 'Hawthorne High School came together and always united as a family. The community is super close and will stand up for each individual when needed. The teachers were always helpful and very understanding with school work and homework. They all tried their best to give their all to the students and pushed them for the better. Although the teachers executed their work, the curriculum needs to improve to better prepare students for college life.', 'There is an opportunity to further review current practices, policies and procedures in regards to students that require reasonable accommodations due to health-related conditions. Need to enhance staff knowledge, improve communication among the staff,  promote a culture of sensitivity and safety for future students that require such accommodations.', 'You could tell that a lot of the teachers were very passionate about their jobs and they wanted to do whatever they could to help their students grow. However, the school could benefit from putting more money into the salaries of teachers as well as more money into learning resources. Recently, they redid the paving for the outdoor track, but I do not believe this was a high priority issue that needed to be fixed. They could do with an updating of the technology in some classrooms, especially the outdated Promethean Boards. They  should also invest in better air conditioning, because some rooms get extremely hot during the spring because they lack the proper ventilation. Aside from these problems, it is a good school mostly because of the staff that work hard to make the best out of what they have.', 'The students and staff have feel nothing. The school focuses more on the popular kids than kids with mental illnesses. The staff doesn’t care about your feelings and will push you to your breaking point. This school has ruined my mental health. The students, staff, and administrators do not do their job correctly. Nobody helps you. You’re alone. God forbid someone does try to help you, it’s extremely half assed.', 'They focus on the popular students whose parents went to that school. Also, their curriculum is not rigorous.', 'I learned much more in Hawthorne than many do at expensive private schools because of the classes I have been enrolled in and the way in which I applied myself. However, I wish that this experience was paralleled in classes that are not higher level. The honors and AP students are generally always challenged and content with their academia, but the lower level kids are rather complacent and stagnant in their academic growth and progress.', 'I absolutely loved my high school. We had so much love and respect for the school, the town, and most importantly, for each other. So much love and pride was shown by everyone all throughout the school year. I honestly wish I could go back!', 'I like the fact that there are several clubs that anyone can join with ease. Food is excellent. Staff and faculty are friendly.', "Many of the teachers are very dedicated to their job in making sure students are properly taught and cared for. However, many teachers are the complete opposite. Some of them are just there for the money and couldn't care less about teaching us.", "I liked all the different genres of classes offered. However I was told I could take animal studies sophomore year and then the class was cut, and the same thing happened to marine biology. I also didn't like how the school fired teachers who actually knew how to do their job and teach. Other then those two issues I had a great time at HHS and will miss it.", 'Hawthorne High School is a similar to a large extended family.  Even though everyone has their differences, whether it be cultural, religious, or financial, we all come together to help someone in need or celebrate our small town.  The one thing that I would like to see change in the future is the variety of languages offered in our schools.  Having only two language options is very limiting when there are so many to be explored.', 'Hawthorne High has great teachers, academics, and sports programs.  The school gives lots of opportunities for students to excel.', 'I greatly enjoyed my 4 years attending Hawthorne High School. Lots of great people including the teachers.', "my experience at Hawthorne High was pretty good for the fact that i was part of many sports and clubs that the school provided. what i liked about the school was that the teachers were really helpful and cared for their students. what i did nit like was the lack of communication that the school's administration and counselors had with the students.", "You have to be your own biggest self-advocate here more than anywhere else; leaving many kids' (many of whom stem from disadvantaged homes) potential largely untapped.", 'As an Honors/AP student, I had a good experience at Hawthorne High School, but I have seen many average students fall through the cracks.']

column6: ['A lot of parents just care mostly about there children and not the students.', 'The teaching staff is very diverse', "There's everything from the forensic science club to the art club. Italian club, Spanish club, and fitness club are some examples. Peer leaders is also a huge organization at Hawthorne High. Each club and organization has amazing administration support, having about 2-3 faculty members run each club. Each week the clubs would meet either in the morning before school, or in the afternoon after school. Everyone is pretty committed to the clubs, again because of the great relationship of teachers and students. It's truly fun spending time with the teachers before or after school in a different setting than in the classroom.", "I would absolutely do high school all over again. While it was a tough time with friends and peers (bullying, cliques, drama, etc.), the teachers at Hawthorne High School really helped me out during these times. I was never hesitant to go to my guidance counselor or other teachers that I trusted with issues in my life. They were 100% open to my problems and gave me such great advice. I admire every teacher I had in high school. Sometimes I trusted them more than my family, but that's normal. In addition to the amazing relationships I had with my teachers, I was a cheerleader and at EVERY football and basketball game (as well as other sports), the parent and teacher turnout was unbelievable! Parents were completely involved in their children' sports and supported them at every sporting event. It was truly a fun time going to sports games because there would be so many people supporting and having fun at these events. The parents would make signs and cheer on the team. The parents AND teachers were very involved with these sporting events and we were all a huge family. I'd love to experience those times again if I could!", 'Every teacher I have had truly cared about their students. They went above and beyond to make sure each student understood the material, felt comfortable moving on to the next topic, and were ready for the next step. The teachers were very knowledgable about their classes and always kept us in the loop about everything that needed to be done. The teachers cared about the students and made sure they communicated with them effectively and carefully. The grading was very consistent and fair. Each student was treated equally and fairly and the grades that were distributed were always the same way and nothing way every strange or unfair.', 'great teacher and very helpful', 'teacher at Hawthorne HS the are great and very helpful to the student.', 'Hawthorne High School is a medium sized school and I am currently a senior. Every grade is like a family, aside from cliques and gossip, but there is a positive vibe through out the hallways. The teachers have a great 1:1 relationship with the students to help them if they have any trouble in that subject. I have enjoyed it very much and hope to have a great rest of my senior year.', 'The teachers and students are always welcoming. Its a small school, so you get to know everyone. There is always an activity at least 3 times a week. Theirs great variety in clubs and after school activities', 'People of all different races, religion, sexual orientation are apparent and accepted.', "The athletic trainer does more for kids than our new nurse. Security guards always there, most are nice. I've never felt unsafe, but you also have to know whats good for you and whats not. Self control is a necessity and some people don't have it", "I've had some really great teachers, also some really bad ones. I love supporting the bears at games. I hate how everyone knows each other's business because we are a small school. I wish more of the school would be involved, it seems like it's always the same people at games or clubs and events. Most of the time kids only do things because it will look nice for colleges, not because they want to.", "the lines are bad especially since they changed everyone's lunch period to the same time. the cafeterias are nice but if you don't want to wait on the long lines you'll either have to run there or wait till it settles down and there are less options left. they try to keep everything healthy by changing everything to whole wheat (even the cookies) but still sell fried food almost every day. I've seen some cafeteria ladies put vegies on kid's trays without them asking for them because kids never take them otherwise. every once and a while you'll find something that doesn't look edible.", 'They care more about dress code than they should. They give someone defending themself in a fight 5 days out-of-school suspension. They give kids in-school suspensions like it\'s candy, to the point where kids refuse to go to them and ask for out-of-school suspensions because it\'s like "vacation". The administration never looks out for the kids\' best interests, the guidance counselors and class advisors are the ones that genuinely care for the kids.', "There is always a turnout to games, but it depends on what sport it is whether you'll get a big crowd or not. It seems like its always the same kids that go to support games (usually kids that play another sport themselves). The athletes support the athletes. Football and basketball games get the biggest turnout, while baseball gets a good size for the small bleachers we have by the baseball field. We just got a lacrosse so there is hardly anyone ever there.The people that do go to games have lots of school spirit. Our facilities are pretty average, our coaches aren't the greatest however. We're usually the underdog when it comes to sports. We have a good fitness club.", "Every teacher has a different teaching style. Some are affective, some aren't. Some teachers put in a lot of work into their lessons and others don't seem to care. It all depends on who you get.", "We have a minimum amount of clubs. I'd say we have the basics, not much more. Some people put a lot of work into the clubs, while others don't even know they exist. Funding is also an issue.", 'great wraps otherwise not so much', 'A lot of redundant policies but some very effective', 'Very exciting teams that can make it to the top']
column8: ['A lot of parents just care mostly about there children and not the students.', 'The teaching staff is very diverse', "There's everything from the forensic science club to the art club. Italian club, Spanish club, and fitness club are some examples. Peer leaders is also a huge organization at Hawthorne High. Each club and organization has amazing administration support, having about 2-3 faculty members run each club. Each week the clubs would meet either in the morning before school, or in the afternoon after school. Everyone is pretty committed to the clubs, again because of the great relationship of teachers and students. It's truly fun spending time with the teachers before or after school in a different setting than in the classroom.", "I would absolutely do high school all over again. column1: New Visions Charter High School - Advanced Math & Science
column2: ["My experience with the school is that they have a lot of clubs and activities you can engage in and their education system i decent because the teacher do what they can to help students and if thee student doesn't understand anything he can go to office hours which is like an extra class where student go to get help from teachers, so it is a good school they help student in every way possible.", 'Very rewarding experience. The campus is pretty large and friendly. the walk down the strip to get to the entrance is something that can be improved.', 'The teachers allow the students to run amok without any semblance of discipline or responsibility. The counselors barely do their jobs, and even ignore students in dire need of assistance. Overall, the school is terrible, and I am so glad that this is my final year a the school. Despite this, I believed I learned valuable lessons about personal responsibility and accountability.', "As a Senior transfer student, coming to AMS made me feel very welcome being that I am new. They staff and facilitators take their job serious, and ensure to provide as much resources to students when we need help. So far, the counselors been a big help to my college process and applications. It has been very overwhelming, and they've comforted me as much to keep calm.", 'My experience with AMS is that they are very involved. I love how they keep parents "in the know". There is a sense of family when there. my son loves it and we are sad its his last year there, but look forward to many new opportunities.', 'Currently a senior in this school. The teachers in the school are very prepared. Almost all have a masters and are very helpful in student development. This school offers good college and career readiness that help you with the college process.', 'New visions Charter high school is an average school. Good classes, great AP courses as well as opportunities.', 'The school makes you feel at home. We are one big family. It is filled with incredibly smart students who are super advanced.', "After attending New Visions Charter High School for Advanced Math and Science I can say that one of the main pros is that It's a relatively small school meaning teachers, and staff in general, are more available to help students with whatever problems they are having. There are many opportunities to join clubs, be involved in sports, or boost your grades. There are many events throughout the school year to keep school spirit high like volleyball games, festivals, and of course, spirit week.While there are some school rules regarding uniforms and cell phones they aren't excessively enforced.Most teachers are fun and engaging so You'll look forward to some classes. Relatively small classes makes it so that you can get extra help with your work.Pros: Minimal schedule during senior yearGreat college counseling Great teachersQuality Campus-wide libraryOffice hours available", 'I am a junior at this school & I feel like it could be improved in a number of ways. Some of teaching staff could be trained better but overall they are on task when it comes to making starting college easier. A lot of the staff are easy to talk to and very attentive to your needs.', 'The counselors are very supportive and everyone looks out for each other. The deans are at every corner so if you have a problem they are there to help and they know everything that goes on in the school. The principle is very interested in how all students are doing and is amazing.', 'At first I was not too excited about the idea of attending this school, but I am proud to say that I do not regret my choice. This school gave me many opportunities and helped me so much. I made many great relationships with teachers and my classmates.', 'The student teacher relation between students and teachers is one of the pros of the school. Teachers format lessons to not just inform but to also engage students. The goal that they have for students is to not simply just pass tests and move on to college but to also formulate skills that students learn about in school and apply later in life. Skills such as learning to listening with empathy, communicate with clarity, and other skills. I wish to see more from the school academically to offer honors classes.', "I like my school because of the opportunities they offer, and the classes they have. I've made many friends, and I like my teachers. I would like to change the fact that I have to wear uniform. The staff makes us tuck in our shirts, even the girls. I like that we have dress-down day on Fridays and spirit week. The commute is long from where I live, however, its a good school.", 'The teachers are absolutely amazing at  New Visions Charter High School - Advanced Math & Science, and the curriculum is exactly what I feel that I need in my next 4 years as a high school student to prepare me for college. Keep up the good work!', "AMS is of one those high schools, where you don't no what to expect. At first it might get intimidating adjusting to the workload. Overtime you get used to it and cherish your teachers who are there every step of the way to assist you.", "This school is okay, but I feel like I wasn't challenged enough. They do not really give a lot of homework.", 'Interesting environmental change for a slightly different experience in the process of college preparation', 'The school is really good and mostly the teacher. Because whenever I need help they help me and if I miss any work they try to inform me as soon as possible. I like the powerschool too.', 'New Visions Charter school is great because it gives students a chance to be active. The teachers are always there to help you and most of them like to indulge in what students are doing in order to create a better environment.']

column1: Information Technology & Software Engineering at the Fairchild Wheeler Campus
column2: ["This school made me an excellent student. It helped me be diligent, and helped me focus on my work. I've flourished and prospered because of the school I came from, and I love it!", 'What I liked about the Information Technology Interdistrict Multi-Magnet School is that it has a big variety of classes that us students can take, including multiple of the ECE courses. We also have great teachers who take their time to help us out with what we need help on and help us out with things outside of that classroom.', 'This school offers a lot of things. There are so many clubs and extracuriculars that you can always find what you want. There are so many options in you respective field if study. In the IT school you can study technology from taking robotics, to practicing media production, to programming! We have so much oppourtunity to explore that we even offer classes from the other schools if you wanna experience other fields unrelated to your school. The one and only thing I would change is the non existance of sports. We have no sports here so we miss out on a lot of highschool experiences. We dont have homecomings or sporting games/events and I sometimes envy other schools. What we dont offer in sports we offer in academic teams like cyber surcurity but not too many students get to crazy about those things.', 'My experience at the Information Technology school at Fairchild Wheeler Interdistrict Magnet High School, was interesting. I made a lot of good friends the three years I have been there. I learned a lot about technology and computer software that it landed me a job at the IT department at my college.', "It is a very welcoming school and it provides us with a clean and safe environment. There are plenty of things to learn and here we have okay lunch and the classes are like a college and we go by semesters which isn't bad. The school is big and there are good teachers.", "What I like about Fairchild wheeler is that is really different academically to the other schools in Bridgeport. They have it set up so the students can really be engaged and creative in their classes. Unfortunately what I would like to see change in Fairchild is some of the teachers attitudes towards the students you can tell the teachers who really care and the ones that just want their money's worth.", 'I have attended Fairchild Wheeler for my four years of High School. The curriculum can be challenging but, rewarding. I was exposed to many topics about engineering that I would not have been exposed to in other schools.', "I absolutely love how hands-on the classes are! Teachers are constantly changing their delivery of the content to keep up with the current technology. They also always have the students' interest in mind when constructing their lessons. This school has always valued and praised students who are reach and go above the expectations. The only thing to say would be that", "I overall like Fairchild wheeler. You are able to chose a field you are interested in and experience it before the college process to see whether you like it or not. The school has alot of resources but not all students have access to them. Junior year is when you start getting permission to take specialty course classes. The first two years are like any other school. Fairchild does not have any sports or and real sense of school spirit. There is no attachment or pride that comes with attendance. However it is a very diverse campus with a healthy variety of people. Teachers at Fairchild are relatively young. This makes classes exciting and it's easy to relate with the teachers. Unfortunately cost of living in Connecticut is high and bridgeport edu salaries are low so most of the teachers leave after 1 - 2 years of teaching.", "My experience was really bad in the beginning. This of course was because the resources provided to other Connecticut district schools were not set in place for a newly built school. The library wasn't available, the gym wasn't being used, along with academic advising and students having to take buses after school to play sports for other established high schools in the area. As an incoming freshman my high school experience wasn't that good yet as the years progressed the academic advising and resources became more available for the incoming freshman. Honestly, the academic strength of this school was very well pushed and the strive to be challenged was thrilling. I appreciate the effort many teachers made to push the students along with myself, to seek help and adjust to challenging elective based school.", 'The teachers were pretty good and so were the classes themselves. My classmates were good people, but the administration behind the school needs to be worked on', 'This School is very good. This campus prepares students for the whole college experience by introducing challenging courses from the start of high school.', "This is probably one of the best High School campuses I have/will ever see. However, in terms of the specialized classes that the school promises, I was disappointed. Most of those classes are taught by teachers who are not familiar with that field, thus providing somewhat shoddy day-to-day lessons. They explain that the classes are geared more towards self-motivated exploration, but that provides little reason to ever be in the classroom.General classes tend to be much better; this school has a plethora of kind and bubbly teachers who all try their best to eke out the best you, not just in terms of their classwork. Some teachers may be harder on you than others, but it is always in their students' best interests. The school has a gargantuan amount of resources and most aren't really made aware to students. However, if you go search for help, almost everything you could ask for as a student is there for you.", 'An excellent school that provides rigorous coursework. The academic drive is mainly focused on stem subjects. The building is beautiful and teachers very dedicated. This school has made me a better person.', 'It is fine but there should be less focus on dress code and more on academics. The teachers are fine and there is a ton of diversity. The school is also very safe thanks to the security guards and metal detectors.', 'It is a fine school I had a great experience with the teachers who all helped me with my grades and preparing for college.', "I loved attending Fairchild, obviously there are some things that need to be changed. However, it is still a new school and some things just haven't fallen into place yet. I believe that this is a great school for those that take the opportunity's they are given.", 'The Information Technology & Software Engineering at the Fairchild Wheeler Campus was a great school. It provided me with ample opportunities to take courses for college credit, in order to lower the workload in college. Given that this was my primary focus in High School, it\'s easy to see why I would like the school as much as I did. As with everything, however, there are drawbacks. "Normal" level courses are incredibly easy, as there is such a diverse crowd of students coming from all different towns in the state. This creates an almost immediate imbalance of learning, where the students who already passed the learning cirriclium in their prior schools were expected to wait until others caught up.', 'The campus has a lot of good technology. Teachers are great and work well with the students. There are a lot of good opportunities to get college credits and be prepared for college.', 'At Fairchild Wheeler, I had an average experience during my 4 years of attendance. Although I benefitted from the academics, I always felt that I could learn more from the faculty. I felt that our school lacked in culture and team spirit due to the fact that we did not participate in athletics or sporting events. Even though our NHS team would host events throughout the school year, I  never felt that our school had a community within. hope to see more events in NHS or sports involvement within our school in the future. By these improvements, I believe we can make a strong community within the Fairchild Wheeler campus.']
