The academic drive is mainly focused on stem subjects. The building is beautiful and teachers very dedicated. This school has made me a better person.', 'It is fine but there should be less focus on dress code and more on academics. The teachers are fine and there is a ton of diversity. The school is also very safe thanks to the security guards and metal detectors.', 'It is a fine school I had a great experience with the teachers who all helped me with my grades and preparing for college.', "I loved attending Fairchild, obviously there are some things that need to be changed. However, it is still a new school and some things just haven't fallen into place yet. I believe that this is a great school for those that take the opportunity's they are given.", 'The Information Technology & Software Engineering at the Fairchild Wheeler Campus was a great school. It provided me with ample opportunities to take courses for college credit, in order to lower the workload in college. Given that this was my primary focus in High School, it\'s easy to see why I would like the school as much as I did. As with everything, however, there are drawbacks. "Normal" level courses are incredibly easy, as there is such a diverse crowd of students coming from all different towns in the state. This creates an almost immediate imbalance of learning, where the students who already passed the learning cirriclium in their prior schools were expected to wait until others caught up.', 'The campus has a lot of good technology. Teachers are great and work well with the students. There are a lot of good opportunities to get college credits and be prepared for college.', 'At Fairchild Wheeler, I had an average experience during my 4 years of attendance. Although I benefitted from the academics, I always felt that I could learn more from the faculty. I felt that our school lacked in culture and team spirit due to the fact that we did not participate in athletics or sporting events. Even though our NHS team would host events throughout the school year, I  never felt that our school had a community within. hope to see more events in NHS or sports involvement within our school in the future. By these improvements, I believe we can make a strong community within the Fairchild Wheeler campus.']
column6: ["This school made me an excellent student. It helped me be diligent, and helped me focus on my work. I've flourished and prospered because of the school I came from, and I love it!", 'What I liked about the Information Technology Interdistrict Multi-Magnet School is that it has a big variety of classes that us students can take, including multiple of the ECE courses. We also have great teachers who take their time to help us out with what we need help on and help us out with things outside of that classroom.', 'This school offers a lot of things. There are so many clubs and extracuriculars that you can always find what you want. There are so many options in you respective field if study. In the IT school you can study technology from taking robotics, to practicing media production, to programming! We have so much oppourtunity to explore that we even offer classes from the other schools if you wanna experience other fields unrelated to your school. The one and only thing I would change is the non existance of sports. We have no sports here so we miss out on a lot of highschool experiences. We dont have homecomings or sporting games/events and I sometimes envy other schools. What we dont offer in sports we offer in academic teams like cyber surcurity but not too many students get to crazy about those things.', 'My experience at the Information Technology school at Fairchild Wheeler Interdistrict Magnet High School, was interesting. I made a lot of good friends the three years I have been there. I learned a lot about technology and computer software that it landed me a job at the IT department at my college.', "It is a very welcoming school and it provides us with a clean and safe environment. There are plenty of things to learn and here we have okay lunch and the classes are like a college and we go by semesters which isn't bad. The school is big and there are good teachers.", "What I like about Fairchild wheeler is that is really different academically to the other schools in Bridgeport. They have it set up so the students can really be engaged and creative in their classes. Unfortunately what I would like to see change in Fairchild is some of the teachers attitudes towards the students you can tell the teachers who really care and the ones that just want their money's worth.", 'I have attended Fairchild Wheeler for my four years of High School. The curriculum can be challenging but, rewarding. I was exposed to many topics about engineering that I would not have been exposed to in other schools.', "I absolutely love how hands-on the classes are! Teachers are constantly changing their delivery of the content to keep up with the current technology. They also always have the students' interest in mind when constructing their lessons. This school has always valued and praised students who are reach and go above the expectations. The only thing to say would be that", "I overall like Fairchild wheeler. You are able to chose a field you are interested in and experience it before the college process to see whether you like it or not. The school has alot of resources but not all students have access to them. Junior year is when you start getting permission to take specialty course classes. The first two years are like any other school. Fairchild does not have any sports or and real sense of school spirit. There is no attachment or pride that comes with attendance. However it is a very diverse campus with a healthy variety of people. Teachers at Fairchild are relatively young. This makes classes exciting and it's easy to relate with the teachers. Unfortunately cost of living in Connecticut is high and bridgeport edu salaries are low so most of the teachers leave after 1 - 2 years of teaching.", "My experience was really bad in the beginning. This of course was because the resources provided to other Connecticut district schools were not set in place for a newly built school. The library wasn't available, the gym wasn't being used, along with academic advising and students having to take buses after school to play sports for other established high schools in the area. As an incoming freshman my high school experience wasn't that good yet as the years progressed the academic advising and resources became more available for the incoming freshman. Honestly, the academic strength of this school was very well pushed and the strive to be challenged was thrilling. I appreciate the effort many teachers made to push the students along with myself, to seek help and adjust to challenging elective based school.", 'The teachers were pretty good and so were the classes themselves. My classmates were good people, but the administration behind the school needs to be worked on', 'This School is very good. This campus prepares students for the whole college experience by introducing challenging courses from the start of high school.', "This is probably one of the best High School campuses I have/will ever see. However, in terms of the specialized classes that the school promises, I was disappointed. Most of those classes are taught by teachers who are not familiar with that field, thus providing somewhat shoddy day-to-day lessons. They explain that the classes are geared more towards self-motivated exploration, but that provides little reason to ever be in the classroom.General classes tend to be much better; this school has a plethora of kind and bubbly teachers who all try their best to eke out the best you, not just in terms of their classwork. Some teachers may be harder on you than others, but it is always in their students' best interests. The school has a gargantuan amount of resources and most aren't really made aware to students. However, if you go search for help, almost everything you could ask for as a student is there for you.", 'An excellent school that provides rigorous coursework. The academic drive is mainly focused on stem subjects. The building is beautiful and teachers very dedicated. This school has made me a better person.', 'It is fine but there should be less focus on dress code and more on academics. The teachers are fine and there is a ton of diversity. The school is also very safe thanks to the security guards and metal detectors.', 'It is a fine school I had a great experience with the teachers who all helped me with my grades and preparing for college.', "I loved attending Fairchild, obviously there are some things that need to be changed. However, it is still a new school and some things just haven't fallen into place yet. I believe that this is a great school for those that take the opportunity's they are given.", 'The Information Technology & Software Engineering at the Fairchild Wheeler Campus was a great school. It provided me with ample opportunities to take courses for college credit, in order to lower the workload in college. Given that this was my primary focus in High School, it\'s easy to see why I would like the school as much as I did. As with everything, however, there are drawbacks. "Normal" level courses are incredibly easy, as there is such a diverse crowd of students coming from all different towns in the state. This creates an almost immediate imbalance of learning, where the students who already passed the learning cirriclium in their prior schools were expected to wait until others caught up.', 'The campus has a lot of good technology. Teachers are great and work well with the students. There are a lot of good opportunities to get college credits and be prepared for college.', 'At Fairchild Wheeler, I had an average experience during my 4 years of attendance. Although I benefitted from the academics, I always felt that I could learn more from the faculty. I felt that our school lacked in culture and team spirit due to the fact that we did not participate in athletics or sporting events. Even though our NHS team would host events throughout the school year, I  never felt that our school had a community within. hope to see more events in NHS or sports involvement within our school in the future. By these improvements, I believe we can make a strong community within the Fairchild Wheeler campus.']

column2: ["I've spent all four years of my high school experience at Origins and to sum it up it's been great. Right from the start, it's a very welcoming place and that's from both the students and teachers. It's a very diverse environment that I've learned a lot about different cultures. The only thing I would complain about is like two of the teachers but other than them all the teachers there are amazing people.", "My experience here will be a part of me for the rest of my life, I've been through and seen a lot. What I like about being here is that most of the time if you need help, want to see something change, or want to propose an idea the resources are always there, and the schools always improving. What I'd like to see change is rules of the school when it comes to students, and their own technology.", 'I’ve been at OHS for 2 years, and I’ll be graduating this year. My time at OHS has been great. The school environment is amazing. They have very good teachers which never get tired of helping you with your work. The Diversity is stupendous. My classmates were from different parts of the world and I got to learn a little bit about their culture. During my school years at OHS, I was in many extracurricular activities. Such as the Music Club, Soccer Team, National Honor Society. This just shows how much diversity there is in the clubs and activities as well. There are many clubs you can choose from. There’s even a SPACE Club. My time at OHS has just been exceptional.', "Origins High School isn't a very good school. The people around the school make the school a better place but the school could be better.", 'What I love most about the school is the teachers. You can tell that they really care for the students and want to see them succeed. However, some things that definitely need to be improved is the cleanliness of he bathrooms, school lunch, and student involvement in clubs.', 'My overall experience in Origins High School was very satisfying. I always received assistance with everything I asked for. Furthermore, the teachers and the staff were very approachable and prioritized the students.', 'Origins High School is a great school for students of different personalities, backgrounds, and habits. Being a student that was very outgoing yet lacking some motivation for my education, the school definitely taught me that if I work for what I want, nothing should hamper me from acquiring it.', 'I really appreciate how devoted to the students success each of the teachers were. I was also able to be myself and engage in activities that were aligned with my interests.', "I felt Origins High School was a bittersweet school. Some of the staff was very kind and understanding and some weren't welcoming at all. I felt thenschool treated us like kids and didn't allow student who have met all criteria to leave school early. The security guards are very disrespectful and are not welcoming to the students. the teachers have good lesson plans. They need to improve and the friendliness and attitude of the staff.", 'The school is a small new school and is still growing. The school is sharing the campus with other three schools. Things are changing every year in order to create a better environment for students. The college readiness is great yet can still be improved.', 'I love this school. I am new at this school and I love the way the teachers are, the studies, the staff. overall everything', 'My experience of this high school was really good. The school offers very challenging courses that help students learn how college life will be like. They help us prepare for future job interviews and also helping us apply for colleges.  Even if the school food is not that good, they offer an out to lunch pass for students with 3.0 GPA or higher which is really good.', 'Unfortunately, there weren\'t many challenging classes. There are only two "AP" classes, AP Literature seems more legit than AP Lang, which doesn\'t offer challenging workload, just a bonus after. Plus, some AP students were placed with Sp\'ed kids, which are careless and disruptive to those who want to learn. Additionally, while bringing this up to the principle, he called the students "whiners and complainers". The principle likes to shut down the ambitious  students suggestions and ignore them and only cares about the kids who don\'t care. Phones are not allowed in the school even though the NYC DOE allowed them for all the schools, phones are to be collected after school. On the positive note, all the teachers are young and ambitious and actually do care for the students. As said this school won\'t prepare kids for college, you have to be motivated and surrounded by good people, and the teachers will also motivate you.', "My experience is origins was pretty great. A first in frshaman year it was a bit scary since I was new to it all but, the school was really welcoming. Origins high school is like my second home now because it lets me be who I really am and act like who I am. At home I'm a box I can't really stretch out and do what I want, but when at school I get to be free and be me. Origins let me expand my thinking and made me academically smart. "]

['Alexander Hamilton is one of the best high schools in the state of New Jersey. As a student for the past four years I have seen the great example they set for us. I admire my school so much. For the past four years, there hasn’t been one fight at the school. I love how they enforce the rules.', 'Mathematics is by far the greatest challenge for students at this school, it is not because they are incompetent, nor unwilling to learn. A large majority of students in my 2020 graduating class truly do desire to do good, roughly 60-70% know when the times comes, we all want great grades. However, the math field in this High School fails in part to foreign teachers, teaching oddly and in a way that a majority of students cannot, I repeat “CANNOT” learn. There is only one great Math teacher I’ve had so far at AHPA, math should never causes anxiety, yet all but one teacher seems to know the idea. The issue of math learning here needs to be changed, with a new generation of aspiring and vibrant teachers, ready to instill skills of the 21st generation. Not grumpy, ridged, or foreign teachers-not as an insult- giving lessons from their own lifetime that is not part of the curriculum. A good High School with good intentions, but it has a long road of improvement.', 'I love Alexander Hamilton Preparatory Academy because it has gotten me ready for college and pushed me to complete my FASFA on the first day it was released. It made me complete my college essay my Junior year of high school. I honestly appreciate everything my school has done for me. One thing they could improve is the food but besides that everything helped me and encouraged me to go to college.', 'It was an alright experience some of the teachers were great and helpful. The students were alright.', 'Overall, the atmosphere is very nice, and the students are well behaved and honest. I am glad this high-school taught me a lot of cool, innovative things that I could use in my future life.', "I have been here for +2 years, and I must say that it is a pretty decent school. Not great, but not bad either. It is generally a stricter place than others, which has its ups and downs of course. Sometimes the work can be lacking though, same for the cafeteria food. The quality of the teachers tend to vary but there are indeed some duds here and there. My biggest complain would have to go to the bathrooms, since most if not all of the boy's bathroom stalls have been broken for over a year now and the toilets tend to be dirty too. Everything else is fine at least!", 'This school got me ready for college pretty well. I was able to take the SAT for free and I learned so much I didn’t learn before. I am very proud to be a student here.', 'I believe the faculty should listen to the voice of students instead of ignoring it. There should be more opportunities to experience different colleges. But overall these past 4 years have been great with my friends', 'I like the fact that they are adding more AP courses. Opportunities for students to prosper in these classes should be one of their priorities as they are time worthy and do a lot for future use. Knowing that the school has implemented these type of courses says a lot for how much effort and time they are putting in for their students.', 'I liked that at Hamilton, I got to experience a caring environment but still with the feel of reality. Teachers were not lenient on late work teaching us skills for the real work, but I did not like that it was not always easy to get in touch with teachers.', "I've been attending A. Hamilton since the start of my high school career. I can honestly say that going to this school, I realized that they are very determined in steering each student into the right path. As a preparatory school, we specialize in college readiness as they help students get accepted into 4 year colleges. The teachers and administrators are very supportive and are impeccable when it comes to delivering lessons. I can vouch for their persistence and determination as they helped in cultivating my own ideas and opinions. They ultimately taught me how to be myself along with teaching me important academic lessons. I know have the structure I need to survive in college which I am grateful for. If I could change something, it would be the environment of the school. This regards to the building its self and its many features. They could use some improvement.", "Well at Hamilton they is pretty easy but you have to be consistent with your work. The thing that I don't like is how they give dominoes pizza almost everyday. Also I don't like how the math teacher don't elaborate on their explaining and teaching.", "I wouldn't wish to go to any other high school if I could have done high school over. Mr.Meade, Mrs.Loftus, Mrs.Parker, Mrs.King, Mr.Liquori, Mr.Kelada, and Mrs.Kelada are my favorite teachers. I really enjoyed their classes. Math isn't my best subject, but because of Mr.Kelada and his wife, I did well.", 'The school is somewhat reasonably strict about there policies. They want the best for the students.', 'There are variety of extracurricular activities for students to join during and after school.', 'Great teachers. Always there for my child.', 'are shelters in place are very succsessful . Students think its a joke when at random . dont take it serously as they should', 'There a little clubs through out the school year and no one really particaptes', 'At atleast all the football games the seats are filled.', 'Some teachers , not all , have a negative attitude tward students. One teachers I had showed favoritisim. The grading from one student another reflected that . I had the same wrong as another student . they recived a better grade then I did.']

column6: ['Extracurricular opportunities at my school are things you can try out, but require talent such as the art club or drama club. Some clubs little to none show up. Many students do not partake in these activities as they go home to do nothing after school, or make excuses to not join any club at all.', "My school is located in an area where there is some violence, and that violence or violent mindset can linger into my school. Therefore many students want to be rebellious and it can affect the study of others who do not seek trouble at all and just want to succeed. What makes my school unique is the amount of the black and hispanic population changing some curriculums in all schools in my area not just ours. However, if I were given the chance, I think I would do it over again because I have made some mistakes I know I could have avoided, unfortunately I chose a different path. Thus, lowering my GPA, but now Junior and Senior year I am making a change, I tried Junior year and I'm going to try harder my Senior year.", 'Some teachers in my area are only in it for the higher pay check they receive than another teacher in other counties in my state. Some try very hard to watch us graduate and achieve at the end of our senior year, their teaching styles have affected some students, and some teachers are very open and are willing to help us out more than they need to.', 'Some of the students get involved in sports and clubs. However, they are not involved in ethnic/racial diversity and/or sexual orientation. There is no peer pressure or challenges regarding these things. Moreover, students do have acceptance to ethnic/racial diversity and/or sexual orientation.', 'The teachers are always willing to help you if you ask for extra help. They follow the curriculum thoroughly. Moreover, the scheduling process is somewhat easy. The workload is fair due to the fact that this high school is among the best in the state. However, sometimes there are many work that is due at a same day and that can cause stress. If you are a student that always does their work and always pays attention, then the workload will be no problem for you. This school offers tutoring to those students who needs help in a specific subject.', 'Security guards and teachers go out of their way to protect students, from random sweeps and checks, to drills, and talks.', 'National Honor Society, Key Club, AVID leadership, Senior class committe, Shakespearence, Student government. Many more', 'Great school, with great teachers and faculty. Everyone is helpful and aware of your needs.', 'The teachers are friendly, they care about their students and go out of their way to help them strive for the best. After school tutoring by teachers and the top 10% students in school.', 'They could get in a better variety of clubs and activities, but its understandable that there needs to be funds for it.', 'Parents are sometimes busy at work or home, and sometimes they are not reliable when it comes to school.', 'Teachers are always helpful and willing to lend a hand after school to catch up on work', 'The school is good, but it could use some work.', 'Some teachers could be better.', 'So the experience at the school has been a positive one', 'The teachers on my school are kind and understanding  but sometimes can be a alitte ride', 'Every teacher i have encountered has made it possible for students to interact while learning.', 'The school spirit here is great and everyone learns to have fun and be friends with everyone. Extra curricular activities in this school bring great spirit towards the kids.', 'Teachers here are very knowledgeable but some do struggle at taking control over their students. Not all teachers help struggling kids and give up their own time to help them but you will find some that do.', 'The academic offered at school is that teachers are pretty nice, understanding, and smart. The scheduling process is a little weird, slow or impatient. The workload can get really bad and unmanageable at times.']

column2: ["My experience with Newark Tech is growing and growing day by day, Newark Tech's Faculty isn't the best but all you have to do is be respect them and listen to them. They have a wide variety team of sports and clubs that you can even make one of your own. There school lunch is not that great but they do have a food place in the cafeteria where you can buy food from there if you don't want to eat lunch, they also give out lunch applications so you don't have to pay for school lunch. Newark Tech also gives out Bus tickets to the students that live more than a certain mile of radius from within the school. There dress code policy is pretty strict you  have to have all of your uniform on you including your ID and  sneakers or shoes must be all black and if not consequences will be given out. In conclusion Newark Tech is an above average school that can help you get to a good College if you focus.", 'I have recently graduated from Newark Tech. After spending four years in the school, in the end, I’m glad that I attended. From the beginning, teachers and staff work to make sure that the students are actually learning informative lessons. One really creative way that I enjoyed was when they used Kahoot. Not only did it make the lecture less of a drag, but it pushed me to actually want to get the answers correct just so I could see my name on the leaderboard. Newark Tech also has a program that allows students to gain college credits, and I was fortunate enough to partake that program. It mimics college in a way, giving us assignments that can be due in months, but teaches us that it’s better to work on it as soon as you can. One thing that the school needs is more extracurricular activities that aren’t just about science and math. It would take the mind off of the subjects that we always see when we’re in school.', 'What I loved about this school is that everyone gets along great. We have  enough students that everyone knows one another and it feels like family after a while. maybe not everyone will get along but soon you will be able to find where you belong once you come to this school. Diversity is one thing I dislike about this school its does not stand out when it comes to the students of this school.', "Newark Tech its a very small school with not many kids. It is easy for everyone to know everyone, but they're not much drama or much fighting. The staff is often very kind and very caring but that is only some. Some can be very rude and very stressful, some people just do not know how to deal with children and should be looked over. Besides that, they offer good opportunities, when it comes to things such as CTE's some of those classes kids actually have to work and others it is just easy A's. But besides that, the school is very average.", 'Newark Tech offers career based classes such as robotics that train students for their careers early on. I love that I was able to attend the school and learn a lot about engineering during my years at the school. They have a range of AP and honors classes as well. With the high end academics and accredited sports programs at the school, students are able to enjoy themselves and be prepared for college early on. Simply this school is an excellent choice for incoming freshman in the Essex County area of New Jersey. Our school is also recognized nationally and we earned the blue ribbon award in 2015. I have no regrets attending this school or bias towards it. I recommend it to any parents able to send their kids their or teachers searching for a good place to teach. In my perspective we are a family at school and work hard to progress unto graduation.', 'As a whole I believe that this school has shaped me into an amazing woman, it’s giving me skills that I don’t think any other school would have ever given me. It’s prepared me for actual real challenges in adulthood, and has brought great knowledge upon me.', 'I am currently having a great time studying at Newark Tech. The teachers at this institution put in a great amount of time to provide us the students with a great education. They are patient with the student and they genuinely care for us. The school offers the students a lot of resources because I recall during my freshman year they distributed desktops to students who had none at home.  The school has a plethora of clubs and sport, so it is easy to get involved. There is bare any bullying at this school, so it is a safe environment for all.', "Newark Technical School is not like any other vocational school. With different career workshops, you likely to get a head start in your future. As a sophomoreI've been exposed to a great academic curriculum that prepares us on a college based level. Although the school does a great job academically, there could be some changes environmental wise. The students are not as encouraged because of the diversity and that is very important. If there were more outreach programs to help us come together and break the cliques and status quo then the school would be better.", "Like everyone in my senior class would say that our freshman year was the best. We feel welcome but the upper classmates and our principal made it easy for us by setting the rules from the begin and always keeping his word. They say freshman year is the one of the hardest years but it didn't feel like it to me. I came in the United states in February 2015 but never feel so welcome by school until i got into Newark tech. I found people who look like me and when through similar situations, people from different country and ethnicity who are also we looking for better lives and we became more than friends, we became family, one that support each other through the learning of a new school system and language and i will never forget that I never feel judge but the teacher for my differences they accept me as who i am. They help me grow so much during this years and even brought back the pleasure of learning that i thought i lost we i came here. I love those 3 years past at Newark Tech.", 'I love how Newark technical school give you a big variety of career choices to choose from and how they really better you for the real world.', 'Newark technical school is such a wonderful school repleted with diversity. The administrators and staff help students prepare for the real world. Not only are there programs in which you can get certified in, but they also provide a program to take college courses during senior year. That program is called ‘TEAL’. Newark Tech also assists students to prepare for college all throughout the four years, especially during junior and senior year. The school makes sure that the students register on time for the SAT and ACT testing, as well as applying for scholarships ahead of time, which is a tremendous help. Anyone who is looking for a high school that is blue ribbon, state championships in sports, exceeds in academics, trades in which a student can be certified in, and so much more, consider Newark Technical Highschool.', "I really enjoy going to this school, and it really prepares you for the future through its CTE program. I've met a lot of friends and made a lot of connections with people here at this school.  It can be a stressful environment at times but they really care about your success.", "Being a senior at Newark Tech High School has brung a great change to my life. It is diverse and includes many different selections of culture. Everybody get along and help each other out when needed. Looking back when I was a freshmen, everything was easier because it was almost like repeating the eighth grade, now I'm in my Senior year where everything matters. Colleges look at all the academic aspects and Newark Tech has definitely given it to me. The students  here communicate well, the teachers make a great effort to help you on the side if you need it, and the guidance counselors are always willing to help you get for college or any specific problems you are having. I would have not picked any better high school than Newark Tech. This is my home that I am leaving in June.", 'What I liked the most was that we were allowed to experiment in different fields of study. It ranged from business, carpentry, welding, automotive, robotics, and more. Not only does the school focus on your cte class, but also education. I also liked that we are allowed to graduate with a certificate in your field. This opens up more opportunities for college or if we decide to work right after highschool.', "This school was very Diverse. The academics and teachers were amazing. This school community continues to demonstrate unconditional support of our students and our school. This school's teaching staff is devoted to implementing best practices in order to reach every student.Because of this all students while I attended this school put their best foot forward and taking ownership of their educational goals.", "My time at ECVT Newark Tech High School has been one of many ups and downs. Wins and loses that has helped me find myself and help shaped the person I have become. It's a environment that forces one to either sink or swim, all schools has their problems, bad ways of educating, low parent involvement. Not nearly enough club activities or stress revealing, leadership programs, or community involvement. But there is always a silver lining if you look for it, thanks to programs like TNT I gained a place to share my ideas, and find real friends. Thanks scholarship opportunities like Cooperman Scholars and the TEAL 12 program I feel ready for college. Prior to my late junior year and senior year, Newark Tech was just a place I went to barely getting by, hoping to graduate eventually. But it has now become a place I can say I grew a lot, learned a lot, experienced a lot and was exposed to many life changing opportunists. And for that I must say Thank You.", "Over the pass 4 years at Newark Tech has been wonderful. I've grown a lot as a person  and make great long time friends. All the staff  in the building is always there to help when ever you need it. There is always someone you can talk too. Most of the students get along pretty well and we all come together as a school when needed.  One thing that I love is we have a lot of diversity and culture. Every student has a chance to show there culture , weather its at a pep-rally , dances or even our yearly international day, which is a day where students come together in the guy and bring home made foods from there country and share it with the staff and other students. I would really recommend other students to come to this school .", "I've bee attending Newark Tech since  Freshman year and my over all experience has been great. I feel in a safe environment and have great students so their isn't to many problems. The teachers are always there to help you in anything you need and are willing to stay after school if you need extra help.", 'What I like about Newark Technical School is the overall motivation to Strive to Achieve Excellence. As the motto is "The Pursuit of Excellence", the teachers push you to be your best, although it is your responsibility to do the work. I wish they can change the college readiness because I should have been more prepared to go to college.', 'Newark Tech is a great fundamental school for students who want to pursue their career at an early start. The school has many shop classes for students to take up with whatever career they would like. My overall experience has been pretty good. I am currently in the Nursing program and I am certified already in CPR and First Aid.']
column4: ["My experience with Newark Tech is growing and growing day by day, Newark Tech's Faculty isn't the best but all you have to do is be respect them and listen to them. They have a wide variety team of sports and clubs that you can even make one of your own. There school lunch is not that great but they do have a food place in the cafeteria where you can buy food from there if you don't want to eat lunch, they also give out lunch applications so you don't have to pay for school lunch. Newark Tech also gives out Bus tickets to the students that live more than a certain mile of radius from within the school. There dress code policy is pretty strict you  have to have all of your uniform on you including your ID and  sneakers or shoes must be all black and if not consequences will be given out. In conclusion Newark Tech is an above average school that can help you get to a good College if you focus.", 'I have recently graduated from Newark Tech. column6: ['The high school is a great school to be in. All the staff there are kind and helpful to their students. The staff and faculty are always supporting their students and pushing them to do great things. The high school offers a lot of AP classes which helps the well educated students get a chance to fully grasp the feeling of being in college.', 'Great school. There are many sports and activities, and amazing people. Awesome community, but very competitive.', 'It great very hands on with learning experience  I am glad that I am a senior currently and be able to share the greatness that I have learned so you can become great yourself', 'During my 4 years in Newark Tech high school, I have being through a lot of good experience. Here, was where all my jourbey start. I made giod friends, excellent people with other cultures. I enjoy my clases and show them the best of my skills.  The only thing that I would like to change is the food, because I think they shoukd provide us with healthier food.', "As a senior currently enrolled in Newark Tech, I could say that my experience couldn't have been more satisfactory for the time being. I'm not just saying this because I'm a student and I should respect my school, but it's because I genuinely love my school. I love the fact that their are resources provided to those that may not have it at home. Or perhaps the wonderful staff that you grow a strong connection even after high school as it reflects with the alumni . One thing that should change is the variety of clubs/activities. There is not really much besides ones that involve technology and sports like basketball,soccer and volleyball. That's the only main concern that I have with the school because I am aware that some students would like to have the arts involved.", "What I would like to see change in my school is that there has to be more communication between the teachers and the students. Students have to accept the work that they are being given and they have be role models for the lower grades. There has to be more clubs, so the school as a whole can participate in fun and educational activities. Personally, I would like the district to fix computers and give laptops to students who have don't have any access to a computer or do not have any internet. Other than all of this, my school is the best and I am do nor regret coming here.", 'wanted students to succeed both in and out of the classroom', 'The school is mainly clean and the cleaning staff is actually always around keeping the hallways and the cafe clean throughout the day. You barely ever see the place a mess unless you make the mess, but the school also has a strict policy on cleanliness and respect.', "No one really helps each other and you barely see parents at basketball games, and mainly at national honors society meetings and ceremonies. It's a very diverse community but everyone acts as if no one exists.", "Most of the teachers don't care whether or not you pass or fail and in some instances they will fail you just because they don't feel like grading your work. They barely help you when you need it and a lot of the teachers are absent most of the time.", 'extracurricular activities are okay but theres always a problem with the budget', 'The school cared about sports more than academics', "I wish I could have been more involved. I enjoyed middle school more than high school, i was an honors student and still feel like high school hasn't prepared me for college.", 'There is everything for everybody.', 'If your are in a sport the school will be amazing. When you find your group you will have a ball. I would not go back because I can not stay with my peers any longer. I want to meet new people.', "Some of the teachers are great, they will help us when we need it but others they don't care and they just do a poorly job with the grades.", "My school is a school that focuses on our education. They do whatever it takes to make sure our test scores and grades stay high. I am now going into my senior year I have enjoyed Newark tech and all of the things they have had to offer.I have gone through many new experiences and struggles but that's what high school is about. My favorite experiences at Newark tech are the pep rally's that we host during the school year. They're a really good way for students to come together and just have fun. I would choose this school again only because they have so much to offer. Newark tech has several clubs that you can join many sports teams and also we have shop/trade classes which we can choose and they help prepare us for the type of job we may want in the future.", "I applied to this school since it's magnet school in my eight grade year, but was not accepted. I applied again in ninth grade, and was accepted into the medical sciences department. I have to say, the medical sciences department was more challenging that I thought. They have the top notch physicians, and nurses that teach the courses. In 10th grade I rotated between dental and medical assisting, and introduction to health careers. I ended up choosing intro to health careers as my focus for eleventh grade. I had a medical terminology and anatomy and physiology course. It was very challenging, but the teacher, Dr. Mazri was very helpful. He helped me study, and gave me tips on how to memorize med terms. He's an awesome teacher. I also took Ap english, which was the most challenging class I ever took. They prepare you for the SAT and Ap test. I love that school, but I was moving to florida, so I transferred. if you have an interest, definitely check out the courses that they have to offer!", "The boys' basketball team is a consecutive three time state champ and my whole school acts as a family once the season starts.", "My school sports are very competitive especially the boys basketball team who were state champs 3 years in a roll. As for school spirit if you don't have any then you will feel like an outsider everyone comes to all the school games. Everyone rocks the purple and white because we are the best and we know it."]
column8: ['The food was delicious they gave you a variety of food and cultures. Lunch was never a basic thing their was always a new special or like Friday was pizza day. We even had our own food counsel ran by students where we discussed inputting the student opinions of their choice of lunch.', 'I loveee Newark Tech this school helped me to break out of my shell. The teachers push you t pass your limits and support along the way.They have the best academic structure and curriculum around they teach you how do your work both old fashion and modern. Also Newark Tech ensures that all their students stay up to date with technologies involving school. Our motto for our school is " Knowledge is Power" it a phrase that they repeat in the morning and afternoon announce and for some students its a big motivation. I\'m proud to say I came from Newark because it has help me to blossom into a bright young lady. "Go TERRIERS"', 'In Newark Tech their is always something to do that fits you best . For me i was the volleyball manager for 2 1/2 years I managed until I graduated. Newark Tech clubs are like little families away from family both students and administration think with an open mind. The extracurricular activities share one major thing that I love which is diversity their was never a group just based off of one race everyone worked together.', 'I am glad I came here.', 'The school lunch is okay', 'This school is truly the best', 'I believe my school is truly one of the safest places to go to school at.', 'Sports teams are pretty good.', "I've experienced a lot in these past 3 years and I regret nothing. I gained relationships with both faculty members and students that will last a lifetime.", 'The administration is cool and the policies are pretty strict.', "It's not the best but I'm pretty satisfied with the courses offered.", 'My teachers are absolutely great. They make it so I feel that I can come to them for anything. Help in the classroom or anything I may be dealing with.', 'There are a good number of things to do after school, including both sports and clubs.', "The nurse is not caring at all. The environment is safe, however. Security guards are actual security guards. Bullying isn't really heard of in my school.", 'I dislike the cafeteria food at my school. It is bland and so repetitive with its choices.', 'The school administration is great, the principal is involved in everything, staff is well respected and bullying and dress code are issues that are looked at everyday.  Students canwork well in this environment.', 'I like the teachers in my school.  They do their best to make sure the student gets their education. They also give their students equal attention.', "Academics are great as well as the teachers, but some students don't take advantage of th opportunity.", 'My school is very safe because it is across the street from the county courthouse.  The surrounding areas are not safe though.  Crime happens alot in the city of Newark.', 'My school building looks great and an expansion was just completed.  The technology is up to date and I like that.  The guidance counselors are ok for the most part and they offer alot of information on colleges and tutoring, and host PTA meetings.']

column2: ['I have been a student at Summit Academy Charter School for about six years. This will be my senior and Summit Academy has given me an extreme amount of opportunities from being able to travel to another country to showing me how students have the ability to get an education and use it for a better life.', 'I enjoyed going to this school because of the friendliness of all the teachers and administrators. I would like to see Summit improve the building it’s in.', 'Summit Academy was a great school. Although it is a small school, everyone knows each other so there was a lot of support. They prepared me for college my entire high school time. They helped me with the college process and helped me try to spend as less money as I could. The teachers are always there to help and friendly so you can always go up to them and ask them for anything without feeling a way. The teachers only want the best for you, so they push you past your limit because they know you can do it. Everyone is like a family so they all want to see you succeed.', 'Summit Academy is  a great place to send a child to prepare for college. I only want Summit to grow even bigger and prosper.', 'Summit Academy helps prepare students to be ready for the open world ahead to fulfill your dreams. My experience in this school was great. Now I’m a senior at the school preparing to go to college.', "I'm a junior in summit Academy. The staff really goes out of its way to support you & help you get to what your trying to achieve.", "Summit Academy is the best school ever. I've never met anot Amazing selection of Administration that cared so much for a student education. The academic is strict but also amazing. Us as students know what we need to do to succeed and graduate high school. We strive for excellence. We go out of our comfort zone to get those grades we want.Not does this school prepare you for college but for life. They give you life lessons everyday that you do carry with you and I thank Summit Academy for that.", 'Summit Academy is school that is a work in progress. I like that the teachers take their time teaching and making sure you are understanding the material. I would like to see them change the classes that are offered to us and the extra-curriculum activities that they have.  ', 'As a scholar since 2010 at Summit Academy Charter School my experience has been life Changing . In our school community classes are small , scholars are short in number thus allowing for teachers to spend more time with students . I would Like to see a change in the amount of after school activities our school provides . In other words more clubs. I want students to join together and do something they are truly passionate about . ', 'The academic support is grate and the teachers really have their best interest in the scholars, also the communication between the teachers and parents is good. But this school needs more sports teams. ', 'Summit could offer more clubs and organizations', "The best thing was senior night for boy's varsity basketball. The gym was full of teachers, parents, students and other staff members. The vibe was very supportive and that was my favorite experience.", 'The teachers are friendly and approachable. There is a mixture of both hands-on activities and textbook, visual work. The class sizes are about 15 to 20 students and the teachers engage with all the struggling students.', "We usually run out of band aids, the nurse doesn't provide us with much, she usually tells us to drink water.", "We don't have much options in my school were tiny and don't have enough space for much", 'My teachers are educated and love to represent their colleges in which they attended. They encourage and have high expectations of all the scholars that attend SACS.', 'The teachers are great. They interact with the students in order to have that student teacher bond. Make it much easier for them to communicate with one another. Help those who are struggling and are available to students if they need help.']

['The staff at "WRJRSRHS" does not care about your success. The school is run in a draconian manner reminiscent of the 1950s. There needs to be a systematic change from the top down. It would be absolutely hellish to go here if not for a special cadre of teachers that actually care.', 'The school was small and had many opportunities for me. This school also has great teachers. I believe that school has helped me grow as a person because of the people in this school. Wood-Ridge Junior Senior High School is located in a safe environment.', "Wood-Ridge High School was a place that felt like a second home if you put in effort to get involved. I was greatly involved in the school such as Soccer, Track, National Honors Society, Italian Club, Lunch Choir, and more. What was great, was there was a club for everyone and sports offered of most kind. What I would like to change is the school's community and culture. Instead of grades being so distant, coming together as a community cheering on all sports teams instead of primarily boys or the football team.", 'The school is average. This year we got new guidance counselors which are amazing. They have made the college process for the students much better. quite a few clubs are offered. There are teachers who are amazing and very dedicated and some who are not, there is a mix.', 'Overall, my experience at WRHS was not great but it was not horrible. I had to quit basketball my senior year because my coach would belittle me. Also during my senior year while playing soccer, my coach never played me. The teachers in the school are all pretty much really good and give fair grades. We have a few clubs but not that many to chose from. I was president of the Italian Honor Society.', "I believe this wasn't my best high school experience I could have had, but it wasn't too bad. The academics aren't too good, but it's what you put into it that matters. The teachers are very nice, and I got close with a select few of them!!", 'My experience at Wood-Ridge High School was similar to a roller coaster. It was filled with ups and downs. Ups definitely includes the fall season. I love volleyball and going to football games. Downs included typical high school drama and there were times I felt academically lost.', "My experience in Wood-Ridge High School was average, it was a regular school that had its benefits and also had its downs. The school was predominant in their clubs and teachers; new clubs were being created and teachers were always trying to help improve student's educations. However, most of the resources there were dilapidated such as textbooks, and computers.", 'Wood-Ridge High School is located in a quaint and diverse town. Overall, the friendly faculty and staff, as well as the rigorous but exciting courses offered, are what makes this high school such an unparalleled and wonderful experience.', 'Most students are involved with something after school.', "The school is not the best, but it's not the worst.", "The overall quality of teachers is not the best because some lack knowledge on what they are saying.  Teaching skills do not benefit the students because they are boring.  Knowledge is okay but no the best.  Not all the teachers are interested in the students.  The communication skills are fair.  Some are really slow graders while others don't grade at all.", 'Personally this school gave me an environment to find myself and truly thrive and grow with the people I love.', 'Some teacher genuinely care about the students but at the same time a lot could care less.', 'I enjoy my teachers and classmates, just administration changes so often that the rules change a lot', 'Most teachers are great, I have been very fortunate to have had many of them. However, a few teachers are rude and are not very approachable; some are easily frustrated and reluctant to help. Otherwise, I am happy with my teachers.', 'Only a select amount of teachers would really engage the class during the duration of the class time, or provide an adequate amount of extra help for their students. I found that I taught and pushed myself more then the teachers pushed me.', "It's just ok regarding all the possible referenced topics. The school nurse in the HS gives ea. student a bandaid for all issues & sends them on their way ususally. Health programs and resources are usually directed to the middle and elementary school, because the older kids can voice their concerns to their parents & their private family insurance programs. Over the 2015 summer break, the Board of Ed found it necessary to install security cameras in all hallway points and public areas, to try to get a hand on drug and other safety issues in the school. All Wood-Ridge District schools have HIBA policies in place, but the teaching staff and administration have not always previously followed through on some things. I know of one special needs child, was not identified and the parents directed accordingly, which in turn was then labeled as a behavioral issue. That kid was bullied by peers, teachers & administration, and then he reacted badly. His mother was bullied by the administration and has since resulted in the parents having to pay beyond their means to place him in another private school, where he would be protected and accomodated better. It was reported that he is doing better, flourishing and getting splendid grades now, compared to here at Wood-Ridge. I am happy now that Wood-Ridge is joining SPAN, where our younger student families will be able to be helped as necessary going forward. We also now have the Wood-Ridge Public Education Foundation to help in areas where the Board of Ed and the PTA are lacking. On numerous occasions over the years, teachers had difficulties teaching for lack of funding for appropriate work and/or text books for each student, because grants were found and funneled to our football and cheerleader sports instead.  The foundation has publicly reported that just over its first 3 years of existence, 53,000 dollars have been raised to support teachers' and students' educational needs in our high, middle, & elementary schools.", "Outwardly, a very friendly town, but cliquish. Student social culture is stilted due to clicks and social group biases. A majority of of the current seniors are the last vestiges of decent, respectful, behaved and decent speaking young people in our school. Each subsequent generation is worse than the one before. Even the teachers will tell you that and it is reflected in their interactions with the students. The fault lies with the parents, either non-involvement or nepotistic manner in most activities or sports. Generally though, we do have many caring members of the community and it's usually the same people you always see, leading to bring betterment for our students all around. If not for financial reasons and hesitation of taking the kids away from their friends, we would move, but what place is better. Also, if the students who are our shining stars in our small town were recognized, by sports organizations, sports programs and colleges and the media, on the same division levels and academically as other schools in NJ, maybe community spirit would be different. I also blame the economy on distracting inept parents from their responsibilities of supporting their students and schools. \r On a positive note...Since the STEM initiative, our district has been working to develop a STEM program here in all our schools. Three years ago, a select group of parents started the Wood Ridge Public Education Foundation to support and enhance our school district, with no hindrance by the Board of Education and Parent Teachers Association who have missed things. Also, concerned parents started working in 2015 to bring SPAN, the Statewide Parent Advocacy Network, to our district to help families with special needs. With more parental involvement,  more work, and time, Wood-Ridge will be a place to live and raise shining scholars and future leaders, that it once was in years and generations past.", 'It is not a school focused on technology at 100%, but it gives students the necessary support in all areas according to require it.']
column4: ['The staff at "WRJRSRHS" does not care about your success. The school is run in a draconian manner reminiscent of the 1950s. There needs to be a systematic change from the top down. It would be absolutely hellish to go here if not for a special cadre of teachers that actually care.', 'The school was small and had many opportunities for me. This school also has great teachers. I believe that school has helped me grow as a person because of the people in this school. Wood-Ridge Junior Senior High School is located in a safe environment.', "Wood-Ridge High School was a place that felt like a second home if you put in effort to get involved. I was greatly involved in the school such as Soccer, Track, National Honors Society, Italian Club, Lunch Choir, and more. What was great, was there was a club for everyone and sports offered of most kind. What I would like to change is the school's community and culture. Instead of grades being so distant, coming together as a community cheering on all sports teams instead of primarily boys or the football team.", 'The school is average. This year we got new guidance counselors which are amazing. They have made the college process for the students much better. quite a few clubs are offered. There are teachers who are amazing and very dedicated and some who are not, there is a mix.', 'Overall, my experience at WRHS was not great but it was not horrible. column2: ["The 4 years spent at this school were wasted years. The only reason I don't regret any of it is because I have made some very good friends that I will likely keep for life. However, the lack of quality teaching is what really stands out about this school. Even students with 4.0 GPAs and higher constantly complain about the lack of effort and care put in by teachers. Additionally, there aren't many resources available to make up for this.", 'Lodi High School is very diverse and fun. There are a lot of opportunities to help with your career path and just help become a better student overall.', 'I had the opportunity to see my potential through the participation of different activities, programs, and clubs such as the PreMed Club, Interact Club, and Greentech', 'It is a good school, teachers and counselors are always willing to help you. It is a good environment with caring people programs and several different cultures that attend the school so no one is left out. There are several cameras in the building and security officers to make sure the right people get in the school. The school requires you to wear uniforms as well instead of having to wear your own clothes instead of being judged by others.', "There are many opportunities to be involved in this school; there's something for everyone, even if you're the type who doesn't get too involved much.  As long as you take advantage of your time here; you'll make them a great 4 years.", "I'm currently a student of Lodi High School, for all these years, and I was able to see all efforts this high school is and has done to improve in creating an environment that make me feel as a student comfortable,  safe. I'm glad that I was able to be part of this school and make some beautiful memories with me that will last forever .", 'My experience at Lodi high school was one that I’ll never forget. Most teachers are kind and helpful. School was kept as clean as possible. And the lunch was really good.', 'Personally, I had a pretty good and eventful experience with Lodi high. I was involved in sports and extracurricular activities so it made my experience more memorable. Most of the staff is very helpful and kind, some not so much.', 'The teachers and staff at Lodi High School are always willing to go above and beyond their "job description" to make students not only excel in their classes but feel comfortable in the school as well.', 'Lodi High School is a decent school. The faculty caters to the students and make many opportunities that students can take advantage of inside and outside of school.', "I have been at Lodi High School since freshman year 2015 and in my opinion it is a great school, the teachers are great and supportive of their students, the administration always makes sure that everything in the school is going the way it's suppose to and there is always security in the school for the protection of the students.  Being a senior at Lodi High School is a blast and it is safe to say that my time and experiences at Lodi High School are unforgettable.", 'After being in Lodi Highschool for a third year now I can safely say there are many opportunities for students to be involved. The school offers numerous kinds of clubs and sports. I definitely think there is something for everyone to take part in no matter who you are. Although this is true, there is a lack of encouragement for students to be more involved, thus, having students complain about it being boring. Nonetheless, if you take advantage of the opportunities you’ll have an amazing 4 years. As for academics, I haven’t had a teacher that is horrendous. They’re either average or outstanding. There is a felician academy program that is incredible for students to get a free college experience. The sports are ok but the people make it exciting and fun. Basically, the experience there is what you make of it.', 'They encouraged us to try harder and to never give up. The teachers are more than willing to stay after and guarantee we know and fully comprehend the information.', 'This is one of the best high school in New Jersey, Lodi High School offers one of the best academics as well as sports and it’s easy to get involved in many clubs and activities', "After attending this school, I believe there is both a lot to work on, and a lot of good things being offered already.  For instance, many of the teachers in this school are fair, and will reach out to help you when you are a freshmen or sophomore.  However, once you're a junior and above, teachers expect you to act responsible and won't reach out to you.  Instead, you have to contact them for assistance if necessary.  One thing that should be worked on in this school is increasing the amounts of sports that are offered.  For example, during the spring season, the school only offers track tennis and softball/baseball.  It would be nice to have a swimming team considering there is a community pool located at the Boys & Girls Club of Lodi.  Besides that, what you make out of your high school comes down to what you do during high school, and I believe this high school offers a good community to both build friends and prepare you for college.", 'I would change how many teachers interact with students. Meaning the way they speak and teach us. Many children need to taught hands on or a little different then others. With that aside there are lots of teachers who understand this and take full action.', 'Sports are great! The academics need some improvement. The teachers are good but some of them act more like they are trying to fit in as your friend instead of your teachers. Some of the AP courses can definitely prepare you for college. Overall, good school.', 'There are amazing teachers in this school. Students rely on there faculty to show them the way to continue their education. There are a select few teachers that go above and beyond to make sure that students have the tools to continue on and succeed in anything that we do.', 'I like to see the more safety in building and also changes in food and sports and other activities and they have to be aware what is going on in the building  and all the things need to change', 'The school academically is good but for sports they do not promote and some of the coaches do not motivate. I have never been to a basketball ball game where the coaches sits there and not motivate the players running on the side of the court be in the game I would understand if physically you can’t but the coach is an important part. They need to make changes with staff and put the name of the school out there are some good players but not being recognized and being motivated.']
