column6: ['Lhs was a good experience because of the people I have met. The teachers there are a good help. My Friends that I have met I would not forget them. This place is a place where you met and also lose friendships....', 'I liked attending LHS but it needs to improve on college readiness and expand its resources. LHS has great diversity and inclusivity. The teachers mean well and all, but some seem under qualified or need further training or reinstatement.', "my short time I have been there has been fun but at the same times stressful hard and very busy. not enough fund raising for students trips, clubs.  some teachers do care and take the time to help students, be involved in clubs, activities, and fund raising. and then there teachers who don't care. also think lack of communication with parents as far as monthly activities, every day things that our children deal with at school on daily basis", 'Overall Lodi High School is very welcoming. Teachers are very nice. So many clubs to join and you meet great people throughout your years as an LHS student. Lodi High School is filled with generations of people that used to go there and now teach there. So many opportunities given to us each day. I love that we have uniforms. One thing I wish to see change is the cafeteria food.', 'I am enjoying my time being a student in Lodi. The teachers are highly encouraging and care. In turn they offer assistance to anyone who may have questions or require assistance. When confronted with a question they insure we have all the information necessary in order to make informed educated decisions. Due to their support I feel as though I am able to make decisions based more upon logic and understanding with incorporating my emotions. I also encourage everyone to join a club because our time as children is very short compared to the time we will spend being adults.', 'The one change I would like to see is implementing a mid-term and final in all courses. This is the only way to get students ready for college.', 'It was my zone school and therefore I attended all four years.  I made lasting friendships and connected with dedicated teachers.  I will not forget my experience and look forward to the next environment.', 'Lodi High School was a fun school to attend. It is a small high school, therefore many of your classes are with the same students. It is fairly easy to form friends. The academics and facilities at this school are fair, but can be overlooked when combined with the overall experience.', 'The first thing I like about Lodi High School is that it has many extracurricular activities and many high level classes to offer. I also like how teachers are very helpful at any time through email or in person.', "High School may seem scary at first. But not in Lodi High School. When you walk through the doors at Lodi High School, you are welcomed with smiles. The teachers are very understanding and you could go to them for whatever. If you are having trouble understanding a course, the teachers wont give you a quiz or a test until they know you are ready. The students here may be a bit handful, but in  general, they are all nice to you if you are nice you them. If you feel like you don't fit in with the crowd, there are many clubs you can do. You can make friends in the Anime Club, Diverse Culture Club, Debate Club, LGBT Club, and even Pre-Med Club.  Like to do community service? There's a Key Club for that too! If you like to show off your clothes or your interested in the Modeling Career, we have a fashion Show every year. Your never alone f your in Lodi High School.", "The school has potential to be great, but they don't prepare us enough for college. Also, guidance counselors should be more involved.", 'Lodi High School is constructed by a wide variety of diverse students and teachers which are the fundamental basis of the success of the school! Through many clubs and programs, the students are privileged to be a part of such an obliging school.', "My experience as a student in Lodi High School was rather interesting. The teacher try their best to engage the students in the material with the limited resources. Administration, however, is a disgrace. There is a high level of favoritism and unprofessional air to the school. As a freshman you are separated based on academic ability. This implants the idea that once you are at the bottom there is little to no room for improvement. Aside from supervisors who are a bit racist and misogynist, the place isn't so bad. The food and facilities are decent. Overall, it is a typical public school but if you have the option of going elsewhere, PLEASE do. ", "I had a very enjoyable High school experience. It was a place where everyone knew everyone and school spirit was a big thing. It made school event fun and something to look forward too. On the other side because it was so small I feel like the school work load wasn't not as challenging or diverse.", 'I keep myself busy and out of trouble by playing basketball and running track', 'Teachers try their best to make sure each student is successful', "The teachers are very involved in the extracurricular activities and a lot of students don't get involved. Though their aren't that many clubs, the most important ones are all their and do a lot of things.", 'This school has a lot of pride and school spirit. They are always working on making improvements. Their is a good amount of extracurricular activities for students to get involved in.  I would choose this school again because it is very accepting. There are many different kinds of people and you will get accepted no matter what.', 'The teachers are very approachable and use new methods to teach include use of technology. The teachers are very knowledge and are very dedicated to the school. They help out a lot in clubs and organizations. Most of the teachers have a lot of experience and have been working at Lodi High School for many years. Their is a effective way to grade papers and give results back quickly. They use a website to organize the grades for every assignment so the students can see the grades for every assignment. Teachers offer extra help for people who need it.', 'The teachers here are very friendly and very approachable and genuinely care about your education that you will be receiving. I have been to various schools and have never experienced a school that cared like this one. This school made my high school experience one I will never forget and will always appreciate.']
column8: ['The teachers that I have had are great with me. They are always there with a helping hand and devote their time for the better of the students.', "What makes the school unique is it's administration. Being an average town doesn't make for great funding. But, with the help of teachers (that don't get paid nearly as much as they should), students sometimes find themselves fitting into places that they though they never would. I could personally say that without excellent mentors in the arts programs, that the students wouldn't move on with their lives the same.", 'Not great people, but amazing staff', "I wouldn't choice to go to this school again because there was a lot of drama. We didn't have many dress down days and also with the sports there was a lot of favoritism.", 'The teachers at this school may be biased and the rules are sometimes not enforced properly. The heating and cooling system in the school is terrible. The food is just as bad. Although the school may not be the best, it is average for a public school.', 'Great environment, teachers, and education! Sports are fun too!', "It's okay for a public high school,but more could be done to improve the overall environment of the school. there is no unity.", 'Although the teaching staff is great. Some of the students reflect negatively among the school. The building itself is quite small and cramped and it would be better if the two upper wings were connected. Heat is also a huge problem in the school. It is unbearable and makes it extremely hard to concentrate on work and tests. However, the school has a beautiful new gymnasium floor as well as a gorgeous and renovated football field.', 'There is always protection around including off duty teachers watching the doors and hallways. I believe the school is very safe when it comes to protection of students because there are many cameras inside and out of the school as well as police officers and well trained staff members.', 'Mostly the same food everyday, but different hot lunches. The lines can cut down your lunch period time to very short.', 'Administration is always helping out with students needs and making sure that everyone is passing their classes throughout the year. There is a uniform, cell phone, and respect policy.', 'Every student involved in a sport shows their dedication and heart out on the field. No matter what the teammates always bring each other up and work together to win as a team and even lose as a team. The sports run all year around, like softball for example where we have the regular season, summer ball, fall ball, and we go to Myrtle Beach for the preseason training.', 'Dress code were primarily the reason many students got disciplinary action through detention or in school suspension. It was a group effort of the faculty to enforce the rules of dress code.', 'School spirit was very important at Lodi, If a person was not involved in sports they still knew or attended games to support the school. The facilities were updated and safety of equipment were very important to the school.', 'The quality of teaching was excellent at the time I was in high school. Each teacher was available to help you before and after classes. Teachers will be there to talk to about future plans and overall goals in life and will help students get onto the right path in life.', 'After high school I was 75% prepared for the real world. Through the my schooling at Lodi I had the skills needed to go through college but not with the best of my ability. High school in general seems to easy to pass and once in college your left without any help other than yourself, so being spoon fed throughout high school does not help.', 'More college-prep courses are required.', 'Again, it definitely could have been better.', "It could've been a little better.", 'A lot of students are involved after school.']

column2: ['This school has great opportunities for the students with college readiness and homework help but this staff could be improved with more care about the students besides education.', 'Great experience.  It’s simple a school you have to strive to survive. A lot of competition but in the end, it’s all worth it.', "It's a friendly environment where you will feel cared for like a second home, fine just the way it is.", 'My time spent in this school have really impacted my life in the best way possible. The teachers are all equally eager to help students improve overall. I must say, I am truly grateful that I was a part of this school.', "I especially loved the way the teachers interacted with the students. The school may be small but it's like a tight knit family. Every teacher watches out for the students and really wants the best for each student.", 'My experience at Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts was one that teachers have a holistic approach when it comes to the students. The principal and staff are supportive from beginning to end.', "Small school, small environment. You know all the teachers and students faces. I would recommend it to any upcoming freshmen that is uncomfortable with big environments because it is almost impossible to get lost in BILA.(Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts). My favorite thing about the school is that within 9th and 10th grade we take all our high school regents. By the time we're juniors and seniors all we have left to do is finish our required high school classes. Juniors and seniors are given the opportunity to college classes for college credit. My school is partnered with LIU and Brooklyn College. One thing I dislike about my school is that the amount of hard work is put on us to complete difficult regents or classes in short amount of time.", 'Brooklyn institute for liberal arts is the perfect school for kids, who have trouble learning in large classrooms. The teachers give each kid individual attention to make sure no one is left behind. The advisors care for the students, as if they were their own. The principal has a deep live for the school and the students in it.', "Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts is a great school with amazing teachers and small classes so everyone is able to get help from the teachers and be comfortable in a learning environment. We are given an advisor from the day we enter the school to the day we leave, these advisor are there for you academically and emotionally basically whenever you need them. I've learn many things from that school and I am thankful for the experiences I've had there.", 'I love how welcoming Brooklyn institute for liberal arts is. They have the newest resources, the staff are super friendly and funny. they make it feel that you can talk to them about anything', 'Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts is an amazing school. The faculty there is amazing and very kind and supportive, they only want the best for their students. The principal and vice principals work very hard to ensure that each student has what they need to get a great learning experience and to help them succeed.', 'When I was first enrolled in Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts, I was always introduced to new information in all my classes and was given very challenging work and was always expected to first attempt to solve the problem, then ask questions. I personally never knew why at first, and quite frankly I hated the idea because I liked the idea of being taught a problem first, rather than making many attempts to solve the problem on my own first. I would complain to my teachers about their teaching methods and they would stress to me about wanting us to be "College and Career Ready". Now as a senior who will be making my next step I can honestly say that Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts which have become a second family for me has prepared me to be successful not only in college but all my future endeavours. If I was asked what I liked and disliked about my high school experience, I would say I wouldn\'t change a thing.', 'When I first got there I fell in love with the school.I love that they make push you to do your work.They also make you take college courses at colleges.', 'They 100% help us with college . They make sur that the kids are taking college classes.', "The teachers at this school are very nice and they know what their teaching to us. They make sure that we're learning what is being taught.They are respectful as we are to them. The school is really great and you would enjoy it here.", 'Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts is great in way that it is able to protect their students and maintain a safe school environment. With the help of three guidance counselors, students rarely get into fights or encounter bullying. Students feel safe knowing that they always have someone they trust to talk to whenever they need to.', 'Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts provides student with a variety of after school activities and clubs to keep each student engaged in school. Whether it may be tutoring/homework help, the step or dance team, or gardening. Each student is able to partake in at least on the activities or clubs offered at this school.', 'This school is unique because it is diverse. There are student from different countries. And the principals, teachers, and students are all so welcoming and willing to learn about a new culture. Brooklyn Institute for Liberal Arts is unique in a way that The principals and all teachers genially care about the each students success in and out of high school and beyond. This school provides each students with either a mentor or mentee. This not only build and create relationships with the students, It also helps the school grow and succeed.', 'The teachers at Brooklyn institute for Liberal Arts are very friendly, their classroom doors are always open to help their students excel. They also effectively incorporate in their lesson plans things that their students can relate to as a means to not only better know and understand their students, but to help the students learn the best and effective way possible.', "During my freshman through junior year, I've completed enough credits to graduate the first semester of my junior year, I think the school is being run very well, and I really appreciate the teachers, and the staff members for helping me through the way."]

column1: The Brooklyn School for Math and Research
column2: ["It's actually a very good school. Due to the fact it has about 300 students per year, many students have an opportunity to interact with the staff and have a friendly relationship as which they can easily communicate with one another. My only wish is that students would have more opportunities to choose the classes they wish to take each year.", "You will be supported in anything you'd like to do, anywhere you aspire to go. Guidance counselors will find and inform you about programs events and opportunities in regards to your interests. Teachers will address and help you if they notice a change in your grades. Effort is heavily rewarded and encouraged. Students enjoy studying together as well as hanging out. All staff do their best to  ensure students reach their goals so long as they express that desire to do great.", 'My experience was great because I made it so. The teachers and staff are very friendly and willing to help. There needs to be more access to opportunities along a wider array of field interests.', 'This school was very advanced in terms of academics and language. Although this school is overall new, and there was not many resources for preparation of college, this school still had a very strong drive to help students.', 'The diversity between students foment a most dynamic  environment. From the teachers and all the personal works daily to emphasize that everything compromises all together in order to reach that maximum level of excellence.', 'Being that this school is very new and fresh, Class of 1014 being their first graduating class, this school is very good. Very small yet diverse.', "This school is an overall good school. This school has prepped me for college and I'm glad that I was accepted into school. The only thing I want to see change is more scholarships opportunities become more available to students.", "The Brooklyn School for Math and Research is unique because it started off as a small school with about 30 students (The graduating class was about 25) and throughout the years it has grown significantly. Not only has more students joined the program but more staff was added and the curriculum has grown immensely. They offer so many math classes and at the end of the year all of the seniors get to complete a research project for their Capstone classes. The research project is very unique because we, the students, get to conduct our own research on a topic of our liking and at the end of the year we present our findings in a book. That's pretty unique to me.", "Teachers at Brooklyn School for Math and Research (aka Bsmart) are always here to assist students. They are very approachable and they allow students to come to their classrooms or offices at any given point or time if they need help, advice, or just someone to talk to. The teachers at my school care about their students and they do what it takes to offer them the best education they can possibly get. Although the homework may be a lot, I've realized that they're just preparing us for college.", 'Parents are not always coming to the school because their children are doing what they have to do for the most part.', "There is mutual respect inside of they classroom between the students and the teachers. The teachers can always e reached in nd out of school, and they would help you no matter how busy they are through out the day, they'll find time.", "My three years at my school have been very weird and not what I expected coming to high school. They offered advanced classes your freshman year and it's your choice whether or not you will do what you have to do from that point on. They set up a no-fail curriculum where you are earning more 15 credits a year instead of 11. As much as this school may not seem as interesting as others say their school is I feel academic wise they offer a great variety of courses, I would not change my school if I could in the future because I have grown, changed and been introduced to several opportunities within this school so I am truly grateful."]

['Saddle Brook High School has a great staff. Teachers, police officers, aids, any sort of staff they make you feel like family. They want to see you smile in school and want to see you succeed in anything you do. I always feel so safe in my school. The education at saddle brook is exceptional. There could be more effort put in the education than in other events or money being spent.', 'Speaking as an alumni in college I can definitely says that looking back I was not prepared at all for college. My first year at college was a struggle because I was never challenged before. Graduating Saddle Brook with good grades was easy because I never had to study. Now it’s hard to maintain a good GPA because I never learned how to study.', 'Speaking as a junior it is safe to say our community has made Saddle Brook Middle/High School a welcoming place. Growing up in our school system I have always felt apart of something, almost like one big family. The teachers and other staff members make it a priority to connect with the students and to make sure students are able to achieve their goals. Students are pushed to their limits so that they may succeed and continue to progress in all subjects. Not to forget that there is something for everyone at Saddle Brook, whether it is a sports team, after school club, or even elective course. To be leaving our high school in less than two years is saddening but I hope nothing but the best to all upcoming middle school students and high school students and hope they enjoy their experience at Saddle Brook Middle/High School as much as I do.', 'Saddle Brook HS is run like a prison except you would learn more in a prison.  The teachers are burned out and apathetic and the administration is more worried about uniforms than anything else.', 'Saddle Broo HS is a great school. This school has the best art/fine art classes you can take. All of the teachers help you when needed and there are plenty of clubs and sports for you to join. The core classes such as math, science, history and English classes are taught by teachers who really care about the subject and students. The administration is a caring body who tries to make the schools as safe and comfortable as they possibly can.', 'Handful of great teachers along with some not-so-great teachers. Great unity found within the school and everyone is very helpful.', 'I like that SB offers AP and honor classes for those who like to challenge themselves. I however dislike the fact that faculty is more interested in who is wearing the right uniform color or pants rather than making sure the students actually learn the information.', 'As an alumni of Saddle Brook High School, I would like to start off my saying my time there was that of a pleasant one. I spent most of my time involved in extracurricular activities pertaining to that of the preforming arts. I was also involved in the many clubs offered at SBHS. As for education, I would say that if students wanted to learn, they had to work for it. General Education classes where extremely watered down. Those who wanted more from their education took honors and/or AP classes. Saddle Brook did very poorly in preparing students for College. The guidance department has of little to no help in providing students with resources that help students to determine a major. SBHS is a very sports oriented school, so much so that at times it took away from other departments such as the music/arts department. Safety is never an issue at SBHS, for they have a very strict anti-bullying policy.', 'i would love to see more improvements in the student-teacher interactment. the school has an excellent math and history department but i believe the school needs to prepare students more in the english department for college', 'There are many oppourtunities for extracurriculars.', 'I feel I attend a great school because the staff really caters towards all students. Our Principal and Vice Principal make sure that everything in our school runs smoothly and efficiently, leaving all problems aside. Due to our low population, the staff really gets to know the students which I believe is a huge benefactor in the success of our students.', "This school is good because of its developing programs established around a student's future goals.", 'Its amazing but there could be many changes they could do.', "My overall experience was wonderful and I wouldn't change a thing.", 'There are many options for clubs, sports, and extracurricular activities at this school. Once you join, everyone is very involved and take things seriously instead of joking around and hanging out. They take pride in what they do.', 'The faculty is very helpful and effective when it comes to bullying and the school dress code. Although many students violate the dress code, majority of the faculty take action in addressing it.', 'This school is extremely involved with sports, especially football. So many students, families, and faculty go out and support the teams. The school spirit is amazing.', "Although the school promotes to NOT use drugs and alcohol, it's still pretty noticeable that many students take part in it. The school nurse is extremely nice and helpful. I've gone to her many times throughout middle/high school and she helped me every time. Overall, I felt pretty safe at this school.", "My English was great in the classroom. I had him for 3 out of the 4 years of my high school experience and I wouldn't ask for any other teacher. Of all the teachers I had, he taught and prepared me the most for my following years of education. He loved his students and loved teaching and that really showed in his teaching techniques.", 'I feel that a few of my teachers did a great job in preparing me for college. Majority of what they said about college was true and made me feel better about going.']

column6: ['I would say that uniform policies was a big deal to our principal at times because there were periods of time where he would inforce the rules more than others. I felt that at times it was more important what we were wearing then our education at the times. I really disliked the fact that it felt like a lot of fun school events were taken away becomes of the problems they had with graduating class before ours. We were taken away our spirit week, pep rally and other usual school events. I felt that the guidance counselors did help at times but it mostly depened who you had and who the student was. The office staff was not the friendliest. Very rarely would they be kind to students about what they needed. They seemed to usually be bothered. The guidence office staff was so swet and always helpful.', 'I feel that after graduating I left pretty prepared for college as I could be leaving highschool. I also only that way because of the AP and honors classes I took. I feel that without those classes throught my four years I would not be as prepared as I am now. In the higher eduacation classes they pushed us harder and did not baby us as mich as the regular classes. They always challenge our minds while still supporting is and teaching us and I loved it. I believe that it was this eduaction that has gotten me this far and prepared me just a little bit more.', "There are many options when it comes to athletics in the school. I personally felt that there was support for the more popular sports such as basketball, football, or soccer versus the tennis matches or track meets. Even though not many people came to support they always had encouraging words and always wished the best of luck to players even when students didn't know other students. There was always that support from other students not on the team or on another team from a different sport. Every falcon support the other falcons like a family.", 'Overall, everything is kept in check and solid', 'Overall, sports and spirit are important', 'The schools very average when it comes to these topics.', 'There are teachers who do not teach which upsets me especially in classes that I actually want to learn in like chemistry and geometry', "There's all the common sports like track basketball football baseball wrestling and soccer but that's about it", "There's some dedicated teachers that truly care about our education however there's some teachers that could care less and we literally watch finding memo everyday although it's a chemistry class", "It's a slightly diverse school however there's some racist students", "There's a lot of clubs and sports for students to get involved in", 'My school is pretty safe however bullying does take place', "I believe that the guidance counselors and teaching staff are all very helpful. The problem is the higher up administrators. These administrator have taken away the students freedom within the past 2 school years. They have taken away the privilege of a pep rally, and have taken away students rights to petition. When given a petition with over three-hundred names signed on it, the administrator threw it in the trash in front of the student who presented it to him. I believe that this is extremely unfair that the school did not even take into consideration the opinions of students on a subject that does not jeopardize anyone's safety.", 'They provide the best facilities for student to maximize their comfort.', "Fitness groups are available for everyone whether it's through sports, athletics or yoga... the school activities are beyond great!", 'I love the clubs in the school and the after-school activities. There is always multiple methods to learn and the teacher devote themselves entirely.', 'There is a large variety of AP and honors classes.  Also there is a huge variety of academic clubs and teachers are always ready to help each student, individually.', 'There is many bullying prevention policies and excellent health classes courses that teach about contraception, abuses and rape. Also, there is always posters in the hallways and the teachers are always ready to help us when it comes to security measures.', 'The Cafeteria food is good and there are many options. Our cafeteria has a morning program which serves breakfast to students. ', 'Saddle Brook High School has a lot of technology, there is at least one computer in each classroom. We have two computer labs and a media center which have about 20 computers in each.']

column2: ["I came to South River High School my junior year of high school after attending Jackson Liberty High School. They have fewer academic courses and clubs in South River, but they have more school spirit. The teachers are dedicated and help their students achieve in their class. The only downside to attending South River High School, is that they don't have more AP's and honor courses for some classes.", 'I enjoyed my time at South River High School. The classes are small and so you have the ability to socialize and end up knowing almost everyone. I also enjoyed that you could make an impact on the school with a new club or idea. The principal and vice principal are always willing to work with everyone. I would have wished that the department of schools paid more attention to the music program. I believe the program should be funded a lot more and the only teacher for the program is not given enough credit.', "South River is a small town in Middlesex County. Everybody knows everybody. That's what I like about it. We all take care of each other in ways I can not image bigger schools doing. The staff cares so deeply for every student they come in contact with and they know us all by name. Our traditions are unlike any other high school and I hold them so close to my heart. We have so many different ways to get involved with the school and with our community. You walk around town and you see familiar faces everywhere you turn. In my past three years, I can proudly say that I am a South River Ram.", "The education there could be good at times while sometimes it could be very bad. There's some classes that are challenging while some of them are a joke.", 'There’s not enough programs dedicated towards the STEAM field, and most students end up dropping out or going to county college. I’ve got to admit though, the staff can be pretty out of this world sometimes. There’s always someone I can go to when I need help, and everyone knows everyone, so we’re all very close.', "The staff is always willing to help students excel; many staff members are extremely knowledgeable and experienced. The guidance counselors are really good at what they do, and help set the students up for success. There is a wide arrange of clubs and teams students can join. The school has many traditions that they've followed for years, such as spirit week, float building week, and the annual homecoming parade, making it a really cozy and fun school to attend. One thing the school does lack though is a large choice of classes many other schools offer like CAD and other engineering/advanced classes like Calculus II. Not the best school Academically, but if you're a bright student, you can shine in South River in ways you couldn't in some other towns.", 'I been going to the South River schools since kindergarten. The sports are very competitive and are vey fun.', 'I like the small class sizes and the personal attention from the teachers. The students can develop a real get to know your  classmates and faculty.  There is great School spirit and support for all our athletic teams .', 'I’m in my freshman year of high school and I haven’t had that much experience in my school but so far it’s going by smoothly.I like that the teachers are engaging and are willing to help students. But I feel like students at my school should be talked to because most of them are at the age where we rebel. But, the rebelling is getting in the way of school and I think the staff should have a meeting to stop the problem. Besides that my experience in South River High School is great and I would love to see how my high school journey goes here.', "I've been attending south rivers public schools since I was a little girl and by the time I got to high school, there have been bonds made to last the rest of my life since it's such a small school. School spirit is out the roof and teachers are involved and always looking out for their students.", 'My favorite thing about SRHS was the diversity. Along with that, you really can have a one on one connection with teachers because the school is so small.', 'I am very active in school activities, sports, clubs.  I am an assistant to the althletic trainer, play varsity tennis and softball.  In several national honor societies.I would like to see more students getting involved in my school.', 'South River High School is a small school and everyone knows each other. We have less bullying than other schools. The teachers are usually very good, but not all classes are available because of the small size. I love my high school!', 'There are so many things that I like about South River High School by us being a small school there are so many opportunities. We have spirit games, homecoming games with floats that we build, fun days and so much more!! The one thing I would like to see change is teacher involvement there many teachers in the school who have school spirit but it would be nice to have more teachers involved in different activities.', "I had a great experience in south river high school. What I like about south river high school is the people and the fact that the school is small allows you to make a lot of friends and know each other very well just like a family.  What I'd change about south river high school is the technology. The technology that the school currently has is not the best there are many computers that don't work. So I think if they fix that the students would have a better experience.", 'This school was SO BAD! The only thing that made it tolerable were friends and certain teachers that made it a little bit better. All the art teachers are phenomenal! Wish there was a better way to get rid of all the bullying here too.', 'The South River high school community as a whole was a wonderful experience due to the massive amount of diversity and traditions. Unfortunately the school is lacking in other aspects, especially extracurricular activities. There is not enough clubs which limits the capability of some students to pursue their interests in a school environment.', "South River Highschool has been a great experience so far. Coming up as a freshman, I felt ready for the tasks at hand. The whole class was oriented in order to be prepared. Besides that, choosing our classes was a breeze. My counselor made it easy and she was very proficient. All my experiences with teachers have been good. They all do their job very well and try their best to prepare the students for their respective futures. Up to now, this year has been the most challenging. The teacher's would tell me that Junior year would be the most chaotic,but they're there to help. There really isn't much negative to say about SRHS. I would only say the administration. If our whole administration board was different, with another view, then our school would be better than now.", 'My experience at South River High School has been excellent thus far. On my first day of school I had other students come up to me and introduce themselves. I quickly became friends with many great people. My teachers have been extremely encouraging when they see me having trouble with my school work. They are understanding and caring. My teachers look out for me. They want me to succeed in life at everything I do, and them make sure I know that everyday. My teachers leave me feeling 100% ready to go off into the real world and become successful.', 'My overall experience at SR HS is good.  I would like to see more school spirit when it comes to sports, but  there are many activities to get involved in.  Our new school principal is the best!  He makes all of the difference in the environment of the school.  Every teacher that I have had has been great.  If you are a student that wants to succeed, then they will take the time to help you do just that.']
column4: ["I came to South River High School my junior year of high school after attending Jackson Liberty High School. They have fewer academic courses and clubs in South River, but they have more school spirit. The teachers are dedicated and help their students achieve in their class. The only downside to attending South River High School, is that they don't have more AP's and honor courses for some classes.", 'I enjoyed my time at South River High School. The classes are small and so you have the ability to socialize and end up knowing almost everyone. I also enjoyed that you could make an impact on the school with a new club or idea. The principal and vice principal are always willing to work with everyone. I would have wished that the department of schools paid more attention to the music program. I believe the program should be funded a lot more and the only teacher for the program is not given enough credit.', "South River is a small town in Middlesex County. Everybody knows everybody. That's what I like about it. We all take care of each other in ways I can not image bigger schools doing. The staff cares so deeply for every student they come in contact with and they know us all by name. Our traditions are unlike any other high school and I hold them so close to my heart. We have so many different ways to get involved with the school and with our community. You walk around town and you see familiar faces everywhere you turn. In my past three years, I can proudly say that I am a South River Ram.", "The education there could be good at times while sometimes it could be very bad. There's some classes that are challenging while some of them are a joke.", 'There’s not enough programs dedicated towards the STEAM field, and most students end up dropping out or going to county college. I’ve got to admit though, the staff can be pretty out of this world sometimes. There’s always someone I can go to when I need help, and everyone knows everyone, so we’re all very close.', "The staff is always willing to help students excel; many staff members are extremely knowledgeable and experienced. The guidance counselors are really good at what they do, and help set the students up for success. There is a wide arrange of clubs and teams students can join. The school has many traditions that they've followed for years, such as spirit week, float building week, and the annual homecoming parade, making it a really cozy and fun school to attend. One thing the school does lack though is a large choice of classes many other schools offer like CAD and other engineering/advanced classes like Calculus II. Not the best school Academically, but if you're a bright student, you can shine in South River in ways you couldn't in some other towns.", 'I been going to the South River schools since kindergarten. The sports are very competitive and are vey fun.', 'I like the small class sizes and the personal attention from the teachers. The students can develop a real get to know your  classmates and faculty.  There is great School spirit and support for all our athletic teams .', 'I’m in my freshman year of high school and I haven’t had that much experience in my school but so far it’s going by smoothly.I like that the teachers are engaging and are willing to help students. But I feel like students at my school should be talked to because most of them are at the age where we rebel. But, the rebelling is getting in the way of school and I think the staff should have a meeting to stop the problem. Besides that my experience in South River High School is great and I would love to see how my high school journey goes here.', "I've been attending south rivers public schools since I was a little girl and by the time I got to high school, there have been bonds made to last the rest of my life since it's such a small school. School spirit is out the roof and teachers are involved and always looking out for their students.", 'My favorite thing about SRHS was the diversity. Along with that, you really can have a one on one connection with teachers because the school is so small.', 'I am very active in school activities, sports, clubs.  I am an assistant to the althletic trainer, play varsity tennis and softball.  In several national honor societies.I would like to see more students getting involved in my school.', 'South River High School is a small school and everyone knows each other. We have less bullying than other schools. The teachers are usually very good, but not all classes are available because of the small size. I love my high school!', 'There are so many things that I like about South River High School by us being a small school there are so many opportunities. We have spirit games, homecoming games with floats that we build, fun days and so much more!! The one thing I would like to see change is teacher involvement there many teachers in the school who have school spirit but it would be nice to have more teachers involved in different activities.', "I had a great experience in south river high school. What I like about south river high school is the people and the fact that the school is small allows you to make a lot of friends and know each other very well just like a family. So I think if they fix that the students would have a better experience.", 'This school was SO BAD! The only thing that made it tolerable were friends and certain teachers that made it a little bit better. All the art teachers are phenomenal! He makes all of the difference in the environment of the school.  Every teacher that I have had has been great.  If you are a student that wants to succeed, then they will take the time to help you do just that.']
column6: ["South River High School doesn't have the best  education system. They also don't have the best school lunches. But what they are the best at is accepting diversity. The diversity in the school is fascinating. You have students from Ukraine, Africa, Germany, Mexico,...all over the world!", 'Pretty good small school but need more resources, better computers, and better resources.  Like the small school community but resources for this school are lacking', 'What I enjoyed at South River High School was the teachers. They seemed interested to help students understand in what they are learning about to become successful later in life.', "Relationships built with teachers are ones that'll last. The faculty truly cares about students and their education. The funding for classes and the teacher pay is extremely lacking though, which is the only downside to this high school.", 'I like how small the school is. I also enjoy playing sports with my friends. Everyone knows eachother in our school so it makes communication easier', 'The traditions are something I would never give up even if I could go to the best possible school. The only thing I would change are some of the substitutes hired and the school lunches that are mad.', 'the school is very small but the people and the teachers here is great. when i first came here  everyone had open arms for me', 'Not bad, but the administration should be more open', "The experience was one I don't regret.", 'A majority of the teachers are open and engaging.', 'Our school is not highly guarded but I feel safe and secure in the building.', 'I am personally not involved in anything besides Band but, Most of the different cliques in our school have a club or after school activity that they are able to get into.', "South River High School is a school where when we have prep rallys we get together and sing 'Hoorah! Hoorah!' for our dear SR High. Altought not many of us will ever get to know each other, we are a very tight knit school. No one slaps each other around and there isn't much bullying going on. In the case that there is it is handled quickly by administration and guidance. But, I don't have any attachments to this school so I wouldnt mind moving away and not going to this school.", 'Coming to South River High School I always felt welcomed into school. The principal smiling and waving in the front of the buliding is the first thing I saw coming into school. Followed by the vide principal trying to dismiss all the kids posted in their lockers to get to class. I\'ve never had any serious problems with many teacher. But one thing is for sure they are all human. I personally have never had any difficulty with a teacher when it comes to me learning the curriculum I need. Though, Not many of my friends can say the same. But then again they are all human.\r    The teaching styles are not the same at all. Whether you\'ve got a teacher who\'s prized possesion is the Smart board or if it\'s covering the entire erase board with notes. I personally prefer the power points and the music that goes along with the events in american history in US 2. The teachers in this building try their earnest to give the students what they need and even more. Reaching out and trying to be more than the adult is the teachers job. At the end of the day I go home with new knowledge everyday though my "doing homework" skills are not the best, My teachers still try their best.', "Due to the size of the school we don't offer a massive amount of clubs. Although the ones we offer are fun to be apart of. They all require a commitment and have their traditions.  The administration supports the clubs. They hold fun fundraisers that everyone can enjoy and allow the club to acquire the fund needed to host more fun events.", "Going into high school I hadn't had the best school life. That all changed after freshman year. A new fresh group of friends. Involvement in new activities and sports. Also a better more enjoyable classroom environment.  Since I'm graduatingsoon I'm beginning to miss my life at South River High School. The great memories with friends, clubs and sports will be with me always.", "Throughout my high school career I have had many different teachers.  Most which I have enjoyed having their class and enjoy having an intellectual conversation with. They were approachable and kept me engaged in class most of the time.  Some teachers though we're a bit stubborn and didn't really allow me as a student to express my feelings and opinions towards the subject and it had to be their way. Some have a hard time controlling some of the more rowdy students. Most teachers though allow me to voice my opinions and keep me involved and engaged in the class. They also control the class and keep the lesson going at a good pace. Although the staff at South River High School isn't perfect it has its shinning qualities and works with the best that they've got", "We need more security in our school. We don't know how to handle serious situations they take most things as a joke. We need to have more support!", 'I absolutely love all the competitiveness we have and how everyone is committed to the sport they play! I love the sports I play and our sports system is very outgoin .. The administration is very outstanding and they know how to solve tough situations quick.', "This school has its good points and bad points. But I'm glad I'm graduating this year I can't stay here any longer."]

column2: ['i hate this school this school does not give any help they do not cooperate well they do not come through with requests. the kids are really bad and do not know how to be controlled. i have been having the worst experience here. i do not recommend this school.', 'The only thing I really look forward for the school was it’s art courses. However, the educational system and the care of teachers should be considered as a change.', 'HALA is school that isn’t very well known. But once you come here you’re given a wide variety of options to help you succeed and get ready for college. All of the teachers and staff are very friendly and helpful. HALA isn’t a perfect school but it has some of the best learning experiences. You feel welcome and you can talk to almost anybody.', 'I really enjoyed my school, and the at- home feeling it supplied overtime I walked into the building.', 'Its an amazing supportive school. The teachers and students are very friendly, understanding and talented. Best 4 years of my life so far.', 'Honestly, before I started this highschool I was unsure about it. After I started I realized how amazing this school is. The staffs truly cares about it.', 'I think that this is an underrated school and that it has a lot to offer. I was opened to a new interface of an environment going to H.A.L.A. The community was basically a small family, it was hard to not know anybody. The teachers are in a close knit community and the students pretty much have bonds with teachers. There is also many different types of children from different parts of the world and not one of them has been bullied. Everyone there is friendly and the school is trying to grow into something that it has potential being.', "I think HALA is a great school, consider it's size. It's located within a building that consists of 4 other schools. It's a fun and open schools where teachers are very welcoming and caring for students. They offer many AP classes, which many students consider for their senior year.", "Considering that I came to Hillside Arts and Letters in my 11th grade year this school has been an amazing experience. This school is very diverse and the teachers are amazing. They truly care about you as a student, and they have your best interest at heart. There are so many different activities to do at school many times the students don't want to go home.", 'My experience in Hillside Arts and Letters Academy has been..interesting. Not as exciting as they made the school appear to be at the open-house. What Hillside Arts and Letters Academy can do to make the school a better place is, focus more on college readiness, more clubs and activities. The only thing that’s excting about Hillside Arts and Letters Academy is Multicultural Day, it’s exciting and great way to spread diversity, learn about different cultures and see different cultures. Otherwise from that the school is dreary:( .', 'The teachers were always there to support you and encourage you. They would always pressure you to do better and they dont let anyone just fail, they try to make them do their work and lead them to graduate', 'HALA is a very diverse school, that has an abundance of resources. There is also a ton of individual help if a student appears to be struggling in a course. Students have the option to express themselves in the class of their choice whether music, art, dance, etc. If anyone is interested in a school that allows for them to explore their creative options then HALA is A + choice.', "It offered great classes that prepared me to get good grades on my regents exams . There  were also a.p. classes that's I took. However, I felt that some teachers did not know the material as well as they should.", 'Hillside Arts and Letters Academy (HALA) is a highschool filled with diversity. There are many different races within this school and allows for others to share their culture.', 'It was a pretty good school. It found a way to incorporate arts into the curriculum. I would like to see the school better prepare the students for standardized testing.', 'The school is amazing.  The  teachers are very friendly and yet serious at the same time. You have desire to actually show up to classes because the teachers make learning very enjoyable. The staff and teachers are always there to help and give advices. Even though I have already graduated they would still give advices when I email them. The negative part would be the school building is shared with other 4 schools which limits the club activities it provides. However,  since the school is building is shared it can also gives advantages of joining many clubs that are provided by other schools.', "It's an amazing school . Small and welcoming , it's also very artistic , with the music and art electives that it have . I wouldn't say i want much things to change in that school", 'The teachers help every student to achieve their goals. Small school so it is easy to find your place. ', 'It was a pretty good school lit. I spent my full four years of High school here. I came here for art, and that was my favorite part of this school . I what I ask for out of their art class and more. It was a great experience for me, personally. ', 'I personally attended the debate team after school, we discuss a lot of life changing topics from political campaigns to terrorist groups like ISIS. To me this is the best club.']

column6: ["I've learned a lot attending HALA both educational and personal. Here you are free to express yourself and open up to new things.", "The teachers of HALA try their best to come up with new innovative lessons. They make it a priority to help those who seek it and even those who don't", "Though this school is a decent school and provides a comfortable environment for the students, I'm not too sure if I would want to relive my experience at this school. My experience at this school was not terrible, but it is not the greatest either. This school is unique because the teachers actually share close bonds with the students, they develop friendships that I haven't seen in my elementary or middle school. The staff in this school work extremely hard to make sure that their students are excelling and doing whatever is necessary. The care that they have for the students is very genuine.", "Teachers that work in Hillside Arts & Letters Academy are very friendly with the students, giving us a more comfortable environment to do our work in. They consistently check up on us and keep us updated on our grades. If any of the students are struggling, they make sure to break it down in a way that will help the student understand better. Though some teachers aren't as great, they still make an effort to cooperate with the students.", 'The after school programs are known to be very engaging and fun for students.', 'My overall experience in this school was okay. I learned many lessons and experienced great trips within this school.', 'The teachers are great in this school they are always willing to give up their time to help students.', "The best aspect of my school is how small it is  which as a result can be very beneficial for students.Teachers give students so much individual attention. Everyone is tightly knitted and friends feel like family. If I were able to do over again I wouldn't change a thing because If I would have never attended Hillside Arts & Letters Academy I would not be the person I am now.", 'Home like environment. Diverse student population.', 'This is one of the best school in my life. All teachers are really helpfull.', 'everything is great, guidance counselors cares very much  about students.', 'this school teachers, administrations, and principle are very caring and supportive.  my favorite experience is the multicultural day event where you get to enjoy your high school life to the fullest with everyone.', 'there a variety of opportunities but the space are limited. For example: too many students have gym at the same time.', 'in the school almost every students are involve in some club activities. there are no ethnic or racial problems at all.', 'the teachers are very knowledgeable, friendly, encouraging and supportive. they try the best of their ability to bring out the most of their students.', 'this school does not have many extracurricular opportunities because of the school size. it shares gyms and fields with other school. there are very less opportunities for students to open their own clubs.', 'the school provides all the possible health safety as needed. there are no bulling allowed at all. there are security cameras all the area which is check everyday frequently.', "I mostly stick to myself and I don't really socialize with a lot of people. I have a very small circle of intellectual beings, but I observe a lot and I see that most of the cliques in the school are based off of materialistic items or unloyal friendships and a lot of the friendships that I do see are filled with peer pressure and a lot of kids haven't realized that they need to accept themselves instead of relying on others to do so. The school is very diverse and the kids stick to people who share similar or the same culture and backgrounds.", "All teachers do their best to help their students to excel. They push students as much as they can in order to better themselves. The lessons aren't as interesting as they try to make them but we still learn. The teachers have a unique way of helping us understand all curriculum. They understand a lot of students and observe is very closely.", "There arent a lot of clubs in the school. I feel this is because many kids in the school don't have time to focus on these things and they'd rather just focus on schoolwork and try to graduate as soon as possible"]
column8: ["I've learned a lot attending HALA both educational and personal. Here you are free to express yourself and open up to new things.", "The teachers of HALA try their best to come up with new innovative lessons. They make it a priority to help those who seek it and even those who don't", "Though this school is a decent school and provides a comfortable environment for the students, I'm not too sure if I would want to relive my experience at this school. My experience at this school was not terrible, but it is not the greatest either. This school is unique because the teachers actually share close bonds with the students, they develop friendships that I haven't seen in my elementary or middle school. The staff in this school work extremely hard to make sure that their students are excelling and doing whatever is necessary. The care that they have for the students is very genuine.", "Teachers that work in Hillside Arts & Letters Academy are very friendly with the students, giving us a more comfortable environment to do our work in. They consistently check up on us and keep us updated on our grades. If any of the students are struggling, they make sure to break it down in a way that will help the student understand better. Though some teachers aren't as great, they still make an effort to cooperate with the students.", 'The after school programs are known to be very engaging and fun for students.', 'My overall experience in this school was okay. I learned many lessons and experienced great trips within this school.', 'The teachers are great in this school they are always willing to give up their time to help students.', "The best aspect of my school is how small it is  which as a result can be very beneficial for students.Teachers give students so much individual attention. Everyone is tightly knitted and friends feel like family. If I were able to do over again I wouldn't change a thing because If I would have never attended Hillside Arts & Letters Academy I would not be the person I am now.", 'Home like environment. Diverse student population.', 'This is one of the best school in my life. All teachers are really helpfull.', 'everything is great, guidance counselors cares very much  about students.', 'this school teachers, administrations, and principle are very caring and supportive.  my favorite experience is the multicultural day event where you get to enjoy your high school life to the fullest with everyone.', 'there a variety of opportunities but the space are limited. For example: too many students have gym at the same time.', 'in the school almost every students are involve in some club activities. there are no ethnic or racial problems at all.', 'the teachers are very knowledgeable, friendly, encouraging and supportive. they try the best of their ability to bring out the most of their students.', 'this school does not have many extracurricular opportunities because of the school size. it shares gyms and fields with other school. there are very less opportunities for students to open their own clubs.', 'the school provides all the possible health safety as needed. there are no bulling allowed at all. there are security cameras all the area which is check everyday frequently.', "I mostly stick to myself and I don't really socialize with a lot of people. I have a very small circle of intellectual beings, but I observe a lot and I see that most of the cliques in the school are based off of materialistic items or unloyal friendships and a lot of the friendships that I do see are filled with peer pressure and a lot of kids haven't realized that they need to accept themselves instead of relying on others to do so. The school is very diverse and the kids stick to people who share similar or the same culture and backgrounds.", "All teachers do their best to help their students to excel. They push students as much as they can in order to better themselves. The lessons aren't as interesting as they try to make them but we still learn. The teachers have a unique way of helping us understand all curriculum. They understand a lot of students and observe is very closely.", "There arent a lot of clubs in the school. I feel this is because many kids in the school don't have time to focus on these things and they'd rather just focus on schoolwork and try to graduate as soon as possible"]

column1: Young Women's Leadership School of Queens
column2: ["I like the Young Women's Leadership school of Queens because it focuses on getting all of their students college ready. The teachers are very helpful and always support the students and most students are on track for an advanced regents diploma. The teachers and staff are very fun and comfortable to talk to.", "Worst school ever. I so far only spent 2 years at this school and already hate it with a passion. There's alot of physical fights in the school and instead of dealing with the fights, the school just tries to hide it so the ranking stays high. The staff plays favorites and has favorites walls in their office. There's bed bugs and roaches in the school also and the staff and students can be racist at times. Don't recommend this school. Please don't come here.", "What I like about my school is the support system that I have within the school so if I encounter a problem I know that there are people here that will help me make the best decision because they have my best interest at heart. What I would like to see change is the workload because I believe the workload is preparing us for college but it becomes too much to manage to quickly which doesn't give students the time to juggle all there classes.", "The Young Women's Leadership School of Queens is a place like no other. They have taught me that anyone is capable of fulfilling their dreams with just a little hard work and motivation. They have also taught me to keep my head held high through the difficult times because where there is bad, good is never to far behind.", "Young Women's Leadership is a good school for young women who wants to learn how to get out of their comfort zone and learn about leadership. It shows good pride, diversity, and college readiness. There are a variety of clubs amd classes for it's students.", "Overall experience is interesting. If it were not for my friends, it would've been rated poorly.  Academics are great but hospitality and physical environment is not welcoming.", "I love the community and the relationships created here. Although I would've like to see more resources available to students, I believe tpmy experience here has truly prepped me for not only college, but for real life.", 'This school prepared me to stand up for myself amongst others in the real world who would try to bring me down because I was a female. Not only that, but since it’s not necessarily a big school, the teachers gave you so much attention and focus for us to do our best. Literally everyone is friendly, even the strict teachers and you can always ask for help from anyone, the teachers, the staff, etc.. Unlike many other high schools in NYC, we went on many college trips beginning our freshman year to start getting ready for college and during the process of applying to colleges, we were provided with many resources of help like a essay/resume review session or just help from our amazing college counselor. Overall, it’s a great school to enroll young women in and be prepared for the real world. It’s an opportunity that you shouldn’t pass by.', "At the Young Women's Leadership School of Queens there was a variety of resources available for students in regards to anything they wanted to do. Administration is very supportive and willing to help students and even give them a little push when they feel like giving up. If there is something you feel is missing from the school or you have a concern you can bring it to the principal or guidance counselor and they will do their best to do something about it.", 'Be prepared for change and a unique experience if you intend to come here but they give way more individual benefits than any other school and highschool.', 'It is a great school for healthy competition and creating sisterhood. Although it might be flawed with delicacy in handling certain situations, TYWLS of Queens is a great school to put your daughter in from the sixth grade enabling her to be college ready.', 'Really great. Prepares you for college straight from middle school. Teachers and the college counselor really help you in getting ready for your next step in life whatever that may be.', 'I love that my school prepares everyone for college. We have an amazing college counselor who helps us any way she can. We have a 96% graduation rate and 100% college acceptance rate. These accomplishments make me feel proud to be a part of my school.', 'This school is amazing with the college support. There is not one person in there who doesnt want you to succeed. Every teacher, and other faculty members, have no issue talking to you, giving advice, writing recommendation letters, and setting you up with opportunities. The Young Women’s Leadership School will definitely set you on the right path academically, and help you get into a good college.', "I have attended this institution for 4 years and am proud to be graduating as a TYWLS student. In 9th grade, I had the opportunity to switch schools to a larger institution with much more rigor and courses. However, this other school lacked a decent teacher to student ratio and also did not put much emphasis on college readiness. TYWLS's connection with CBI is very helpful to the students; CBI stands for College Bound Initiative and this organization provides a dedicated college counselor to schools like TYWLS. There definitely are teachers who confuse students through their approach to lessons. However, these are not the majority of teachers. Teachers also encourage female empowerment. Small classroom setting encourages females to not feel shy or embarrassed. The food and lack of parent involvement could definitely change for the better.", "This institution revolves around leadership and sisterhood. TYWLS of Queens has an amazing environment due to all the students valuing their education. As I leave TYWLS, I look back and realize all the wonderful opportunities it has given me. It's a sisterhood like no other sisterhood.", 'My experience at TYWLS of Queens has been very good since I’ve been here. I’ve been going since 6th grade and I feel ever since then I’ve been getting preparation for college. Now that the time is here I feel better than ever. There’s so many college resources and this school has so many connections through CBI or YWLN. Although the one thing that bothers me about this school is that it’s small which limits the amount of sports and clubs available. But, if that doesn’t bother you then come here because it definitely feels like a community.', "I've been at TYWLS of Queens for about 6 - 7 years . The staff is really great . We changed Principals a couple of years ago , and ever since then our school been fantastic . Ms. Mala Panday , has been giving us girls , great opportunities to get ready for college , and we really appreciate her for it . I love this School ! ❤️ BM in 11th grade .", 'Overall, my high school experience at the Young Women Leadership School of Queens was ok. Although, the school offered many students networking opportunities, I still believe it did not fully prepare all students for college.', 'The extracurricular opportunities at school are very fun and helpful. They allow students to peruse their hobbies and even allows them to get opportunities outside of school.']

column6: ['Being that I\'ve been in this school for six years I would say that it\'s been an interesting experience. Coming to this school in 6th grade was strange. It was an all girls school where we were able to call the staff by their first names! It was unique and comforting because there was this sense of community and not so much as a barrier between the students and staff. It made having conversations much easier. However with the addition of a new principal, this changed. Has she made improvements throughout the school? Of course, however an "improvement" she made was removing the policy of addressing teachers by their first name. If i had to do it all over again, yeah, sure,. I mean it wasn\'t bad it was great! But I can\'t shake the feeling of what if? What if I went to Stuyvesant?  Would I be different?', 'I believe that the teachers at my school are regularly available to communicate outside of the classroom. However it is sometimes noticed that some emails may go unnoticed or not very helpful in solving a problem. Yet this is very rare.', "The experience I've had at this school has been quite okay , it could have been better . Hopefully the school is still working progress. some cons of this school would include the school cafeteria is not always clean , as well as the bathrooms , only a little parents attend the pta meetings and we don't have many clubs.", "The teachers at this school are very helpful and are very beneficial in encouraging you to be successful and to get high grades . When they find that one student is struggling they help them by offering tutoring services after school or during there lunch period and not only that but for example the trigonometry teacher offers tutoring during lunch and she always recommends us to use this website , KhanAcademy . The teachers have very great interest in students way of teaching due to the fact that they encourage the students ideas as much as possible in helping them learn the best way they can . The reason I didn't rate this school a 5 is because it's not always clean , there could be more teachers , we don't have physics , we could have so much other clubs , we don't have a track and there's always drama .", "Being at this school for about 5 years I can honestly say that my school isn't too bad but you have to be your self to get through a lot of the things you go through here. Sometime it becomes a challenge to keep your mind focused on work because a lot of the girls here have the worst attitudes in the world. It can also be hard if u don't know how to handle attitude when it's given to you. Sometime it comes from the most unexpected people like teachers and etc. But if you always stay true to yourself and have enough self control then nothing you go through here will effect you and impact you in a negative way.", "The classes aren't hard but they do deserve a good bit of your time. The scheduling can be challenging at times but for the most part you get your necessary classes.", 'Teachers here care about you and your future. They want you to succeed and grow as a person.', 'Not all teachers in my school use technology. Few teachers are not organized and lose students work. They all try their best to engage students and make them run the class. Their consistency in grading is adequate.', 'All clubs are shown commitment but some more than others. Track and field is the most important team in our school along with cheerleading. Those are the only teams. The rest are clubs. The clubs are volleyball, anime, debate, math, step up, and rock band. The whole school gets involved in the most activities as possible and to prove that, we had a volleyball tournament recently which was very interactive. It took a lot of planning but it was a great success so my school is planning another one in the spring.', 'The sports and clubs are so much . just wish we had more money to fund them more often.', 'I love all the positive energy the clubs bring to my day', 'Everyone is always willing to help you in any way they can.', 'Some teachers have really bad attitudes, they do not have patience what so ever. They are willing to help you only when it is convenient to them.', "Some of the policies are stupid and get too much attention while bigger issues get no attention at all. For example, they care so much about you wearing your white sneakers mean while some of the teachers are terrible at their jobs and don't get fired.", 'There are a few clubs and after-school activities and thankful they are adding more every year.', "We don't really have a variety of sports like in other high schools. We only really have track and field therefore the school spirit is there but not really noticeable unless the track team does well at a meet. The equipment and space for them to practice and train is not the best either.", 'The students at my school learn what is significant in life, most of the topics in our textbooks and a great amount of what we need to know. We graduate with a mindful of knowledge and expertise in certain areas.', "There are multiple tools to help further college and scholarships searches. However, these activities are mostly done inside of the college counselor's office which is only big enough to hold about 20-30 people and seat about 15 people. The library computers aren't open access to students who need to use them any tie of the day. There is no longer a computer lab and laptops usually don't work.", "I would have to say that 99% of the time, there aren't any issues such as, bullying and gang violence prevalent in the school building. However, there are some occasional fights and heated arguments.", 'The teachers at my school are usually understanding and are open to handing down the control in the classroom as long as the students respect the rules.']
