column1: The New Visions Charter High School for the Humanities
column2: ['I lasted for three weeks "teaching" Spanish at this school.  Non-native, Heritage, and Native Speakers-many of which had IEP\'s- were all thrown into the same Spanish I class, and most did not know they were taking Spanish until the first day of school.    The administrators had  no teaching experience, as they pretended to engage in "restorative practices".   Students\' behavior was deplorable.   The ambitious plan of having three trimesters so kids can earn more credits (up to 20 they say) is a farce.  The third trimester is really a make- up period for failing students.      Administrators genuflect to students instead of disciplining them as they are fearful they  will simply move to a different floor of the old Kennedy High School, which houses 6 or 7 charter schools.  In this school, stroking students is paramount to educating them.', 'It was a great experience. The school had so much to offer so there was so much to do. They gave each child some amazing experiences and opportunities. Overall the school made every child ready for not only college but life after college.', 'The faculty there was extremely helpful - if you make it known that you need help. Once you feel comfortable enough to speak to somebody, it can really make a difference.', 'New visions charter school for the humanities is a really great school. I am as of right now a senior in new visions and I love the school. I love the school because the teachers give 110%  to make sure their students succeed and make it to college.', 'I love how involved the staff are in students academic achievement  and there are numerous activities for a student to part-take in. Teachers are constantly ready to spend extra time outside of class to help with school and outside school related work. I love how comfortable and safe I am when speaking to my teachers, deans and counselors.', "I like new vision charter school I attended 4 years at this school. The principal is very nice and strict she does not play around that's why I love this school. The teachers are very nice and you can learn from them they teach pretty good they have office hours for kids who need help. The kids are very friendly every one get along with each other that's what good about the school. I am on the Track and Field Team and also on the Volleyball Team. The sports are ok they need some more kids to take it seriously like I do but I am doing great at both sports.", 'New Visions Charter High School for the Humanities is a good school. There may be negative aspects to this school, but I’d like to believe that the positives outweigh the drawbacks. I had lots connections with my teachers and staff, and they were all very helpful in helping me strive to be the best I can be.', 'New Visions Charter High School for the Humanities is a great school, counselors push you forward to take new courses/classes to gain more knowledge. The student faculty ratio is usually 15:1 and they would place office hours if you are in need of help with anything so you wont stay behind with class work.', "I love the teachers and the academics here. The faculty really do try to do right by the students and give them the best education possible but you need to apply yourself as a student. Many kids don't succeed because they value  social standing more than there grades. If you apply yourself you can really thrive here", 'This school is amazing when it comes to opportunities and teacher student relationships. The teachers become almost like youre parents, beatfriends. The one thing I dislike is how the school. Treats the students as if they were still in middle school not conditioning us to how college life will be like. They baby us and eventually we become dependent on the constant nagging and "if you get late to school were taking your phones" or "you didn\'t hand it in on time its just minus a small amount of points" this of course is something we will not get in college. Besides this major flaw I love the school teachers, students and of course the Humanities Kennedy Pride. GO KNIGHTS', 'In this school I feel safe and I like how the school is finding better way to help its  students succeed after they graduate high school. For example, this year they introduced a program where students can graduate high school with some college credits.', "What I like most about the school is the staff's involvement in the student's lives. The staff cares about whether you pass or fail and you're able to voice your opinion with out consequences.", 'During the years at this high school, theres been ups and downs. I would sometimes find myself in difficult classes but teachers would notice and help me or my counselor would change me to another teacher. Therefore I would say that my experience at this school was okay. Something I would change would  be that i would provide more activities and make the school more fun.', 'We have an excellent teaching staff who truly care about their students. We have tons of opportunities for internships and college credits. The rate in which the students graduate is in the 90s overall a great school.', "I attended The New Visions Charter High School for Humanities from September 2011 - June 2015. My experience was okay, but it could have been better. When I attended the school the school was not very diverse, the staff was inconsistent, I had a new principal my senior year. It was a uniform school, that aspect wasn't bad and the school day was very long, I am talking about 8am -4:30pm Monday - Friday, but my schedule changed during my senior year. During my senior year had a shorter.  There also wasn't a variety of courses, but the school was college and career-bound. For instance, students were given the opportunity to take college classes on college campuses and students were able to participate in internship opportunities in offices on school grounds, Montefiore hospitals, City officials offices, etc. Those aspects really helped my resume and my college application process. "]

["I like how the school provides many resources and has many clubs for students to partake in. The building is nice and the technology is good for a school. What I didn't like is that some teachers do not teach very well and somehow still have a job.", "I would like the food to get better and I wish the football team can win against our rival school Jackson Memorial High School. We failed to beat them back two weeks ago but hopefully next year we'll beat them.", 'I am Junior in Jackson Liberty High School. I think some teachers in the school is very nice and helpful but some teachers are not. In Some classes there are 2 teachers in the classroom but sometime the other teacher just sit there doing nothing, no purpose of him/she being there.', 'The guidance department it lacking. There were at least 3 suicides every 2 years between the two high schools. This needs to be looked into. I know of people who were being bullied/harassed and the only thing the guidance department did was move their lockers. This caused the student to graduate high school early so that they could get away from the toxic learning environment. There are about 15-20 teachers/staff in this school that truly care about the students and their well-being which is sad.', 'The education and class offered are pretty great, I was able to get college credit before starting college. Is it the best high school experience? No.', 'They really offer a lot. We have STEM and music and business academies are fortunate enough to do so much through our school.', 'Jackson Liberty offers many clubs and activities to help students become involved. The school offers Academies to remain competitive with other schools. The guidance department is the most helpful.', 'It was alright. Good teachers! I liked my English teachers the best overall. Good at helping students, clean and nice school.', 'I loved my connection with my teachers and how they have helped me and prepared me for college. The guidance department has done an okay job helping me but it is more my teachers who did so good. It is alittle to diverse for my liking.', 'Jackson Liberty High School is an overall good school, the teachers and all staff does well when it comes to caring and teaching the students. When I first moved to New Jersey before freshman year, it was a struggle to make friends and do outgoing things, but eventually the school helped me make friends and have one of the best experiences of my life.', 'The school that I had recently graduated from had an outstanding math curriculum with a variety of math programs consisting of accelerated levels for the more advanced math oriented students. The many different teachers being able to meet all personality and learning types was beyond incredible. This is what made the schools math programs amazing.', 'It felt like a very normal high school experience, even being in STEM I felt like a part of the school. The faculty cares a lot about the students too which helps many of the kids there.', 'Throughout my four years at Jackson Liberty, I grew as an individual, but lacked the proper preparation for college courses.  I was heavily involved in Honor Societies and community service, all of which inspired me to continue to be involved in similar clubs in college.  However, as a freshman in college, I have been able to note some of the downfalls of my education at Liberty.  There was very little expectations from teachers as deadlines were often extended-something that is abstract in college.  I also found that many teachers appeared to be more concerned about their personal class reputation rather than focusing on fair academic standards; I often found that students who did not work nor study ended with the same grade as myself due to extended late policies and extra credit.  Overall, I set personal expectations that I believe helped me to succeed and build upon during my first semester of college, despite my lack of academic preparation in high school.', 'Fairly new school. Obviously has some areas that need to be developed more, but overall a decent school with adequate teachers and faculty members as well as students who regularly attend. One negative side is the lack of school spirit and pride, which should be changed to create a better and more fun high school experience.', 'This is a great school for students who are active in school activities their is practically something for everyone. As far as classes go I feel as though their is a huge divide on the quality of each one.', 'Very nice school. Has a lot to over and has an overall great atmosphere. I would recommend to anyone.', "I liked the school events, wish the school was a bit more unique. It's kind of average all throughout.", 'I really like how  an abundance of resources are available to all students for a variety of subjects.', "My experience at Jackson liberty was educational for sure. the staff is great, the sports were awesome although the coaches weren't the best. Especially with soccer. But overall I wouldn't have wanted to experience high school anywhere else but here.", 'It’s more than a school. It’s a home. This place is genuinely amazing, the staff are all such great individuals and you feel like you’re apart of a big family. You have a sense of belonging at Liberty. 10/10 recommend attending Jackson Liberty.']
column4: ["I like how the school provides many resources and has many clubs for students to partake in. The building is nice and the technology is good for a school. What I didn't like is that some teachers do not teach very well and somehow still have a job.", "I would like the food to get better and I wish the football team can win against our rival school Jackson Memorial High School. We failed to beat them back two weeks ago but hopefully next year we'll beat them.", 'I am Junior in Jackson Liberty High School. I think some teachers in the school is very nice and helpful but some teachers are not. In Some classes there are 2 teachers in the classroom but sometime the other teacher just sit there doing nothing, no purpose of him/she being there.', 'The guidance department it lacking. This place is genuinely amazing, the staff are all such great individuals and you feel like you’re apart of a big family. You have a sense of belonging at Liberty. 10/10 recommend attending Jackson Liberty.']
column6: ["The academics were okay. I felt ready for college when I graduated. The administration was terrible and they put too much emphasis on what didn't matter and not on the students themselves. Personally i would not send my child to that particular school because the diversity was not there and as a black woman, i would not want my child to feel excluded from certain policies (which I did) or singled out because of their race. While racism wasn't obvious, the biases of the faculty and parents were evident", 'The staff was always friendly and helpful. Each teacher was willing to help in any way possible from educational assistance to emotional troubles or worries and more. It was always a friendly atmosphere and the students were friendly too.', 'For the most part, Jlib provided a neutral environment that allowed me to work on my own goals in my own time. Scheduling classes was very easy and they worked around my own schedule. Overall, the academics were amazing, take into account that I have only been taking Honors and AP classes, and I feel like I could happily leave next year with the level of learning that I revieved.', 'My high school experience at Jackson Liberty had abig impact on choosing my college. I wanted to continue my education in a place that felt like home and where people knew each other and liked being together. I especially feel the Adventure Bound course I was able to attend the overnight canoe trip in which I learned alittle more about life and made friendships to last a lifetime.My Guidance counselor at Liberty was key in making my college placement successful. He went above and beyond assisting me with any of my worries. Jackson Liberty has a truly special place in my heart and is place I call home.', 'I hate it here people are mean and rude no one cares for each other the admiration sucks and has no care for the darker and just lie to our faces teachers are kinda racist and it sucks the student of color are targeted for their differences and standing up for themselves', "Jackson Liberty High School provides various level of coursework for students and has different activities to suit various students' interests. While I enjoyed my time at Liberty, the school itself was run very strictly and certain policies made it difficult for students to enjoy after school activities and to find places to study after school. Overall the teachers are what really make up the heart of Liberty. They provide guidance and aid whenever needed if you are lucky enough to study with the right ones and really take advantage of all that they have to offer you.", "What I loved about Jackson Liberty High School the most was the accepting environment. Our principal Ms. Maureen Butler made it her priority to see that every student's sexual orientation, race, religion, etc. were accepted and those who did not were taught the importance of acceptance and kindness. We have so many clubs that embrace the differences of the students. Clubs that include the multicultural club and the Fellow Christian Athletes. Some things I would change about this school would be how it does not properly prepare you for the real world. In this school, everyone's a winner. And sadly the real world, you don't always win. Though it helps with grades and overall GPA, the teachers here are very lenient and “pass” you if they feel you should, meaning they can minipulate your grade to their descretion. This hurts college readiness skills.", 'The principal is highly sexist, and will go as far as to side with female bullies when the victim is male. This is verified not only by the stance she takes, but by the side she chooses to listen to as well. If you’re male, you will be punished before your side of the story is told. It seems she fails to realize that the most common strategy of female bullying against men, is “technical” accusations of “misconduct” regardless of the merit they hold. The easiest being “ I feel threatened”. Keep in mind, a threat does not have to be made, in order for that line to be used, and reciprocated with harsh discipline against the accused. This can make a fairly well behaved young man, feel like a outcasted monster, because his emotions will not be taken seriously. This of course, does not pertain to every circumstance - but it happens often enough for the vice principal to share the same sentiment.Other than that, the other staff are excellent.', 'I liked my high school experience. Most teachers there are super cool and are willing to help you. I would start high school over again if I could.', 'I was new to Jackson my freshman year of highschool. I love how welcoming all the teachers and other staff were. I felt at home, not like I was stranded someone out of my comfort zone. The one thing I would say I dislike is the way some parts of the curriculum are set up, I feel I could get way more out of a class if it was 40 minutes all year rather than 80 minutes half the year.', "I was very fond of the academics at Jackson Liberty.  I felt that there were many options of courses to choose from, and they prepared me very well for college.  Most of the teachers I had were excellent, but there were also several teachers I had who were horrible.  These teachers openly explained that they hated the class subject and that they were forced to teach it by the principal, and therefore they didn't teach the subjects well at all.  Aside from academics, there were many activities so be involved in.  I liked how Jackson Liberty makes it easy for students to be well-rounded because all of the clubs coordinate to ensure that their meetings aren't at the same time.  We also had  a considerably large amount of school spirit.", 'Great teaching staff and administration.  I have learned a great deal through academics as well as being a part of sports teams.', 'At Jackson Liberty High School, I have had an excellent experience. The teachers and staff are very professional and help create an enjoyable and safe educational environment. They help equip students for success in the future.', 'Jackson Liberty High School has offered many opportunities for me, those of which I thought I would never have been involved in.  I know I had to work hard academically from day one but joining the marching band was something not on my list.  I have enjoyed all I have experienced in this band program and Mr. Katona, our band director has been most influential throughout my high school career.  He has given me many memories which will never be forgotten.....Disney Parade, Washington  Memorial Parade and Thanksgiving Day Parade in Philadelphia...just to name a few.   I believed and  have become more confident in myself as a student and as a leader.    I have maintained  a good GPA and can state with confidence that I have set out and achieved many personal and valuable goals for myself to carry on with me throughout my college years.  Looking back I am very happy and grateful with all that I have accomplished.', "The campus is beautiful and our principal is always trying to make our highschool experience better. The teachers are cool and there's always something fun happening after school.", 'I am very much involve in Liberty.  I participate in several clubs, as well as sports.  Great school spirit, the classes are challenging and prepare me for college.', 'There is so much to do here. Every week we have different after school or even in school activities going on such as Battle of the Classes, Grim Reaper Project, Spirit week, assemblies, etc. You will never go a week being bored.', 'Awesome school....i have had a great experience with my teachers and especially the guidance dept.  My senior guidance counselor has really helped me with my college interests.', "I like how well-kept the school is, and how pleasant and comforting the teachers are that we as students are able to confide in them without feel intimidated or worried.  However, the students' lack of common sense (not all, but some) and the way the staff may handle those students is not the most appropriate way of doing so, which can cause disgruntled students and parents.", "Best thing about JLib was that I got to go to Brick vocational school and work closer to my career. Also I didn't have to wear a uniform."]

column1: Business Technology Early College High School
column2: ["Business Technology Early College High School is a great place for those who want to major in business or technology. This school that is sponsored by SAP,  pays for its students to receive their Associate in Applied Science Degree in year 6. Instead of it being 9-12th grade, this school is 9-14th grade. In the 10th grade students will start taking college classes at Queensborough Community College.  Coming out of this school, you'll be able to find a job with great pay and also be college ready. Students who attend this school have no problem functioning as an undergraduate in another school since they have been taught college readiness skills and also have been transformed since their 10th grade year to a college student.", 'The school is very different compared to other schools. This school offers a dual enrollment program, which starts in the 10th grade and continues into 14th grade if you decide to stay there. Overall there’s a lot of great opportunities at the school and the teachers are very helpful they will not give up on you ever .', 'B-TECH is overall a fairly new school. However, day after day, they continue to grow. Constant changes are being made to help improve the overall quality of the school, which seems to be showing improvement. They have a steady growth rate & continue to help make changes for the benefit of the school environment.', "This is a brand new school and it's heading towards a better direction with the new principal in place. All the teachers are understanding and they care about the students as well as staff. Bullying isn't a problem at this school. It prepares you for college as an early college high school.", "I really liked how active teachers and faculty are in helping their students succeed. The teachers are very genuine and caring. You're almost always given mulitple chances and the school environmemt is like a family. The students aren't perfect but they're kept in check almost always. The students are allowed to advocate for themselves and be heard. That's what I really liked about Btech, my voice was always heard.", 'Everything about BTECH is great, my only complaint is that we don’t have our own building, which causes slight problems with the internet connection. Besides that, our lunch could be more diverse, and I’d like to see a more efficient system for clubs and extra curricular activities within the school.', 'Its a decent school that gives students an advantage at starting college early. The good thing about this school is that there are many supportive teachers. You also get to start college at Queensborough Community College in 10th grade. The only bad thing about this school is that it shares campus with Martin Van Buren High School which is a bad school. Some students at Business Technology Early College High School are Lazy.']

['I recently graduated from Dover High School and will say that firstly, it is not as bad as surrounding neighborhoods or schools may portray. I am now in college and firmly believe that the school is adequate in that it depends on the students for if they want to succeed and not always just the teachers or lack of resources. However, what I do wish would change is that the school would have more availability for AP classes and resources for its existing ones as I remember that being a pretty major issue. Overall, the school is fine, needs some more resources, will prepare your student about as well as any public school for college (meaning not that well) but what I remember most about it were the amazing teachers.', "I had 3 children go through the district schools, my youngest is a senior in the high school.  My older children received scholarships to college and I suspect so will my youngest.  There are tremendous opportunities to learn.  The teachers my children have had are engaged and interested in advancing student education.  I have never feared for my children's safety and I truly believe there is very little, if any, bullying, none that I or my children have witnessed.  I am present in the school for events and volunteer for the sports in which my children participated.", 'I enjoyed the fact that my school was very diverse in faculty, staff, and students. However, the many teachers did not put forward much effort into properly teaching us. Also, the school did not have much to offer athletically which made the experience less pleasurable.', "I loved the atmosphere and the fact that there were no clicks and tight friend groups but that a lot of people interacted with each other. The education and teaching doesn't prepare student for college as well as neighboring schools though.", 'I had a great high school experience! The teachers helped me and gave me amazing advice whenever I needed it. The school is open to many different personalities and cheacrters, no one feels out of place. Mostly everyone is accepting of who you are.', 'My four year experience in Dover High School was very memorable! It’s a one floor building that was easy to get around. Although I may have come across a few teachers who may not have had the best performance in teaching, there were also many teachers who have guided me through High School learning not only the subject at hand, but also many things about life. The students at Dover High School for the most part get along very well, we can be in the hallway and yell “yer” and someone across the hall can “yer” back. Things I would like to see change are things like being able to go out to eat during lunch time, students being able to use their phone with wifi connection for educational purposes, and adding more interesting elections because many were taken away that I would of like to learn about, like auto shop. Therefore, I would say Dover High School isnt too bad of a school, but theres always room for improvement.', 'Dover High School is filled with great students and teachers. There are however some students and some staff who take away from a good high school experience. I think if rules are enforced equally the school could improved into a place in which everyone could have a good experience.', 'I’ve lived in Dover my whole life. Been to the elementary, middle, and highschool. As a student who has been part of advanced classes they’ve done a good job. They have provided the resources necessary. I’m not complaining about the education. The AP courses here are challenging but they’ve given us the teachers that are fit for the part. Things that should be improved are the rules. The dress code is really unnecessary. Having better consequences for tardies or absences; not just give a million detentions to the students. But overall I don’t complain much about the school.', 'Dover High School is in its upcoming time right now. The school always has tried to recover from all the stereotype and negative comments people have on not only the school but the town. Currently there is a vice principal adding to the guidelines to make it easier for the teachers and students. Administrators are now sitting down with a select few of students about every month to address issues that us as students should be looked on. Funding is getting back up there..  all AP students are finally receiving all the technology that is needed.', 'Dover High School was my second home for 4 years. I made new friends, learned so much, and also became college ready. The diversity is one of the biggest factors that this high school has. Overall, this school is great and it keeps getting better and better.', 'I liked that at Dover High they have several opportunities to advance in certain subjects by offering several AP Courses as well as just Honors.', 'Dover High School is a great place with tons of diversity and certain students that wish to prosper. Teachers are great students are rude at times but it’s a good place ! A welcoming community', 'Dover High School is a school located in a small town in Dover New Jersey. Although the town is made up of mostly Hispanics the school itself is known for being diverse. This in fact is one of the things I love the most about this school. As well as the fact that the teachers are extremely supportive and always willing to share their knowledge. If I had to change something it would be having a larger amount of clubs being offered. This would be beneficial for students in order to expand their interests.', 'DHS is a School with very nice teachers but the majority of students being extremely rude to staff. Fellow peers are very hostile to authority and becomes quite irritating due to a large mob mentality and poor attitude. The collective thinking many of us students have ,with exceptions, is the expectations of Dover students is lower than that of schools around us due to our reputation.', 'While I am taking AP and honors classes I feel the support of the teachers and the other students in my classes feel like family.', 'I liked the library and all of the resources. I wish they offered more courses and more options when it comes to the curriculum', 'What I would like to see change is more consistency in dealing with kids who have learning disabilities. I would love to have a greater variety of electives and classes to better ready us for college.', 'The teachers are really nice, I really enjoy my time participate at Dover High School as an transfer student from foreign country. I can really catch up with the school work and find myself familiar with the environment without experiencing any shock in culture differences', 'Good resources and programs but never optimized. A lot of wasted opportunities, because the school did not let students know what was available', 'The culture at Dover High is unlike any in surrounding schools, however there should be more opportunities for students than there are.']

Also, the school did not have much to offer athletically which made the experience less pleasurable.', "I loved the atmosphere and the fact that there were no clicks and tight friend groups but that a lot of people interacted with each other. The education and teaching doesn't prepare student for college as well as neighboring schools though.", 'I had a great high school experience! The teachers helped me and gave me amazing advice whenever I needed it. The school is open to many different personalities and cheacrters, no one feels out of place. Mostly everyone is accepting of who you are.', 'My four year experience in Dover High School was very memorable! It’s a one floor building that was easy to get around. Although I may have come across a few teachers who may not have had the best performance in teaching, there were also many teachers who have guided me through High School learning not only the subject at hand, but also many things about life. The students at Dover High School for the most part get along very well, we can be in the hallway and yell “yer” and someone across the hall can “yer” back. Things I would like to see change are things like being able to go out to eat during lunch time, students being able to use their phone with wifi connection for educational purposes, and adding more interesting elections because many were taken away that I would of like to learn about, like auto shop. Therefore, I would say Dover High School isnt too bad of a school, but theres always room for improvement.', 'Dover High School is filled with great students and teachers. There are however some students and some staff who take away from a good high school experience. I think if rules are enforced equally the school could improved into a place in which everyone could have a good experience.', 'I’ve lived in Dover my whole life. Been to the elementary, middle, and highschool. As a student who has been part of advanced classes they’ve done a good job. They have provided the resources necessary. I’m not complaining about the education. The AP courses here are challenging but they’ve given us the teachers that are fit for the part. Things that should be improved are the rules. The dress code is really unnecessary. Having better consequences for tardies or absences; not just give a million detentions to the students. But overall I don’t complain much about the school.', 'Dover High School is in its upcoming time right now. The school always has tried to recover from all the stereotype and negative comments people have on not only the school but the town. Currently there is a vice principal adding to the guidelines to make it easier for the teachers and students. Administrators are now sitting down with a select few of students about every month to address issues that us as students should be looked on. Funding is getting back up there..  all AP students are finally receiving all the technology that is needed.', 'Dover High School was my second home for 4 years. I made new friends, learned so much, and also became college ready. The diversity is one of the biggest factors that this high school has. Overall, this school is great and it keeps getting better and better.', 'I liked that at Dover High they have several opportunities to advance in certain subjects by offering several AP Courses as well as just Honors.', 'Dover High School is a great place with tons of diversity and certain students that wish to prosper. Teachers are great students are rude at times but it’s a good place ! A welcoming community', 'Dover High School is a school located in a small town in Dover New Jersey. Although the town is made up of mostly Hispanics the school itself is known for being diverse. This in fact is one of the things I love the most about this school. As well as the fact that the teachers are extremely supportive and always willing to share their knowledge. If I had to change something it would be having a larger amount of clubs being offered. This would be beneficial for students in order to expand their interests.', 'DHS is a School with very nice teachers but the majority of students being extremely rude to staff. Fellow peers are very hostile to authority and becomes quite irritating due to a large mob mentality and poor attitude. The collective thinking many of us students have ,with exceptions, is the expectations of Dover students is lower than that of schools around us due to our reputation.', 'While I am taking AP and honors classes I feel the support of the teachers and the other students in my classes feel like family.', 'I liked the library and all of the resources. I wish they offered more courses and more options when it comes to the curriculum', 'What I would like to see change is more consistency in dealing with kids who have learning disabilities. I would love to have a greater variety of electives and classes to better ready us for college.', 'The teachers are really nice, I really enjoy my time participate at Dover High School as an transfer student from foreign country. I can really catch up with the school work and find myself familiar with the environment without experiencing any shock in culture differences', 'Good resources and programs but never optimized. A lot of wasted opportunities, because the school did not let students know what was available', 'The culture at Dover High is unlike any in surrounding schools, however there should be more opportunities for students than there are.']
column6: ['There was no cliques in this school. Everyone was diverse and everyone got along. There was a lot of respect among the students and with the teachers.', 'The hs has come a long way since i graduated.  The kids have much more oppurtunities and its great to see that.', 'I love to be part of Dover Hig school is a great school. All teachers are always for you all and you will always have a support for any of the staff. What I would like to change is the food , I do not like the food in the school', "I loved double gym and my iPad. The teachers were also very helpful in my case. I've had the same teacher for 4 years and he's always there for my needs.", "I have grown up a town over from Dover for my entire life and I have never had a serious problem with the school district except for class placements. When I transferred back to the high school I wasn't placed in all the honors classes I should have been because they were maxed out.", "I really liked dover high school it made me feel right at home and I'm glad I could consider myself a Dover tiger. The administration is always glad to help as long as you truly show them that you have a passion for what you are preaching. I have gained a lot of respect through out the school because I put myself out there as a student who fights for his education and someone who made his 4 years the best they could be.", 'Dover High School is a friendly school that allows everyone to have an opportunity and a possibility of overcoming themselves no matter who they are and where they come from. Despite the negative outlook on the school, it is a caring place where one can feel safe and express themeselves.', 'Dover High School was a great place for me to get my high school education. The teachers were very friendly always staying after school for any help needed. Security could have been better, but otherwise I really enjoyed my 4 years here.', 'The school is fine, although I do wish there was more clubs. They took out some courses I was looking forward to like CCM biology. I know a lot of students who want that class back. A lot of ap/honor students I know are going into the medical field including myself, so it is frustrating. The teachers are good at what they do and care for the students. ', "It's a relatively small school. So few athletic choices, few well known clubs. However, many students are stepping up and making new clubs.", 'I\'m currently a senior here. My first two years at this school were great. However, the past two weren\'t so fun. These past two years they have removed classes many students were excited to take. Lots of unnecessary rules were created like "No water bottles in the class room". After all these changes (and many more that I have not mentioned), I\'m just way too excited to graduate and get out of here.', 'They make sure students are engaged and understanding the information. Sometimes they struggle keeping students from talking to each other.', 'It can be stressful but it gives the student the opportunity to better themselves', 'No one feels like they are discriminated at this school.', 'The school has diverse clubs and tries to include all students in clubs', 'This school is multicultural and has many different types of people and everyone works together.', 'The Teachers truly care about each student and work tediously to make sure each student understands the lesson.', 'I have loved almost all of my teachers in high school they really made a difference.', 'It did well enough to prepare me for furthering my education.', 'The school is so accepting and their really is no clique problem. Everyone is diverse and respects each other.']

column2: ['This school gives everyone a great opportunity to earn an Associates Degree and learn how to manage with college classes and highschool classes at the same time. It’s a great learning environment, the staff and teachers are so great and help you to the fullest. The early college program is worth it.', 'I really like this school, this school is good and the acedemics are amazing. The teachers are all nice too. I recommend this school to other people. You can get an associates degree at 12th grade easily.', "Its my first semester there so far and I kind of like it because of how I don't know anybody there. I also like how it's like a new beginning for me here. Another chance I get with people to introduce a better/realer part of  myself.", "It is a really great chance to earn up to 60 credits and graduate with an associates degree. The college classes aren't too stressful at all and it is totally worth going to.", 'I truthfully enjoyed every moment that I spent in this school. It may not be the most perfect school, but it’s opportunities and programs made my experience that much better.', 'My experience has been has been ok but when it come to financial aid or tuition problems. I think without common knowledge the staff are just as confused as you are. This issue definitely needs to be attended to.', "Overall i've had a good experience while being in Kingsborough. It's a very helpful place, especially if you are working hard to reach your goals.", 'The one thing I truly loved about Kingsborough was the sense of family that every individual felt when attending the school. Peers were always willing to help one another and teachers were always willing to go the extra step to ensure that students understood the topic of discussion.', 'KECSS is a great school. While taking high school classes the kids get an opportunity to take college courses at Kingsborough college campus. They get a chance to earn an associates degree and a high school diploma at the same time. An amazing opportunity to teach kids.', 'I actually transferred for senior year and i love it so far because the students are amazing, everyone knows each other, and the faculty has been amazing with answering all my questions, guiding me, and helping me with the college process. In addition, the college classes i got to take as a high school student helped me a lot and encourages me to have higher standards. It also gave me a head star.', 'This is a middle/high school that gives early college preparations. It has a high standard curriculum and makes sure every college is prepared and knows what is expected in college. It gives you full experience with on campus classes at Kingsborough Community College. College counselor helps every student with every step and also when done and graduated from this school on how to go on to another Cuny college.', "I am about to graduate and this school has changed the course of my life. To have the opportunity to graduate with my Associate's Degree gives me a jump start in my life to start pursuing my career early. It also helps my family save money for further education. Overall, it's worth the stay.", 'I liked how it prepared us as students for college. By taking the offered college course really helped us get our foot in the door and what to expect enrolling into college. Faculty really pushed us to keep up our grades and push through what ever difficulties we had.', "The early college program is well developed and well maintained, to fully help in advancing student's future. Students are determined to continue their future and want to have a successful career. The early college program is well developed and excellent.", "Kingsborough is a diverst school with very interesting teachers. They treat you like family after you leave their class. They help you with your problems and try to find a way for you to feel welcome your first day. However, there are some flaws to this school. This school is not as clean as it could be there are inesects crawling around. Another thing is that the food is horrible and they should get options for kids who don't eat school lunch.", 'I did not want to write a review about this!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It was ok. !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!', "Overall Experience of my high middle and high school is great.They have an early college program which gives us two years of associate degree.This is a really good program for those who actually care and have a desire in pursuing their dream.Those who actually look forward to continuing their education and doing alot with their high school diploma and associates degree, it's for them.What i specifically believe about this school and I recommend it for those who actually want to go to college. ", 'Its pretty good when it comes to different clubs and activities', 'I personally feel like being in this school since the 6th grade you begin to feel as it its your second home. I love the benefits that I get out of this school HOWEVER, the only bad part would be not being more social with different people since Ive been in the school for so long.', "I think the teacher are pretty good but after a while lose interest once they realize the students aren't interested. SO it makes it hard to teach something your no longer interested in."]

column6: ['Its great and helpful and staff is available to help at all times.', 'School is safe..never heard of anything or seen anything that has endangered the safety of me or any other student or staff. security is always on their feet.and alarms are always checked regularly to remain functional.', 'The extracurricular opportunites at the school are very helpful and engaging. These activites help students reach life goals and gain new experience in great leadership and cooraporating well with others and gaining great friendships. The activites dont only take place in the school but also doing outings to promote the school and giving students a different field of learning and also fundraising.Students receive outstanding support from administraters and staff as well. students show great commitment because they benifit from the program and get extra assistance.', 'I truly love this because english became my favorite topic, i finally passed with an incredible grade. I got an A ..i was so proud of myself..other schools i have been to, the professors were not as helpful to assist me or provide quality time to meet the criteria requried to get a good grade. When i transferd to this school my perspective changed and all my needs were met..and life was more positive since then and it was a great experience . The teaching makes it all unique and the unlimted assistance i received ..i would definatly chose this school again and do it all over again. Truly thankful for the oppurtunity.', 'Professors here provide great knowledgable and organized teaching skills and presents info systematically. They have high expectations for all ambitious students. Also provide quality to each student need of extra credit work for better grades n provide one on one tutoring if in need of better understanding of assignments. Grading is fair and consistant so the child is aware of where improvements need to be made. Communication is very clear and understanding. Teachers here are intrested to see what the future holds for the student and are willing to help each student to reach their goals.', "I don't like that the teachers and some parents are not involved in school sports. I like the fact that we are able to receive our associates degree.", 'The extracurricular activities available at the school are abundant. They are a variety of sports teams a person can join, however, these positions are demanding. Balancing school responsibilities and those for the team are hard to manage. It can be rather draining on your school life and social life.', 'All the teachers at the school are relatively young and very knowledgable. They are relatable and nice to be around, they make school less of a hassle than it already is. Most of them are attentive to the needs of the students are sincerely care for the well being and success of the student body. They strive to do their upmost and teach to the best of their ability.', 'Like every other school on the plant there is bound to be a certain degree of cliques. However, everyone for the most part get along well with one another. I believe at this school there is a drastic difference of the prominence of cliques themselves than in other schools.', "The overall enforcement of consequences for breaking certain rules at my school are average. They are not always executed to the fullest of their capability and at times the policies are rather lenient but, the policies are for the most part enforced. I can't complain.", 'The health and safety at are school is well monitored. We have a sufficient amount of resources to ensure the welfare of everyone.', 'The overall condition of the building that I go to school in is average, nothing more and nothing less.', "I like this school, because it's small. Not many people know about this school, it's a relatively small environment. It can be compared to a small town, everyone knows each other and are friendly. As a result of that, you get to form stronger bonds with those around you whether it's a classmate or a teacher. Everybody wants each other succeed. This type of structure I feel is the best because it generates the atmosphere you need to grow as a student and as a person. It's something that you can't get at your average high school.", "There are not a variety of academics at this school, due to the school's setup itself. We take both high school and college courses, it doesn't leave us with a whole lot of time for other classes, like music or wood shop.", 'There are many different profundities to play a sport in my school. They have basketball, football, soccer, bowling, swimming, baseball, softball, you name it, we have it.', "It's okay, just like most school food. Nothing absolutely spectacular, average. Most of the food is bland though, there are only a few select foods that are palatable.", 'Great variety, extreme passion in every actvity', 'i do not eat because nothing is kosher', 'Sports teams active and on fire', 'Great teachers and even better supplies']

column2: ['It’s an amazing diverse school with several activities to be a part of. Definitely one of my favorite', 'It’s a big school, lots of people, the classes are good overall and the selection you get to choose from.', 'Brentwood High School has a very multicultural environment and I enjoyed my high school years here. Teachers are great and the administrators care for their students education and safety.', 'Brentwood High School, is very different from regular high school because everything is not gonna be the same as in middle school or elementary school. They are supposed to be different for you to challenge yourself and do what you need to do in order to succeed in school and in life.', "No, just no. If I had the chance to do highschool allnover again and rectify all my mistakes I wouldn't just to save myself from the trauma of attending this school.", "Brentwood High School was a very good experience for me but due to the surrounding neighborhoods, there are students of low to middle-class brackets who don't all necessarily have access to certain resources or knowledge which also lead to violence. I would like Brentwood High School to bring more awareness to issues such as bullying, fighting, self-esteem boosting programs, suicide, how to manage your finances and prepare for college, banking and instead of suspension, provide healing/therapeutic mechanisms.", 'As a Senior from Brentwood High School, I have learned so many things from so many people and was given a unique experience that I am able to carry on after high school.', 'BHS is a very diverse school. The teachers are extremely informative and will be willing to assist you with whatever you need. When I think of Brentwood High School, I think of “home.” I’m proud to be a Brentwood student and I wouldn’t want to attend any other high school. We have many after school activities including sports, arts, and music progarms.', 'The School is very welcoming as the people don’t care for what status you are as a human, but just for your personality and how friendly you can be!', 'Being a student at Brentwood Highschool from my sophmore year to my senior year has been a great highschool exprience. All the students at BHS have so much school spirit. For example, sports. If there any sport events going on, guarateed the stands will be filled up with students, parents and alumnis. I have been on the varsity soccer team since ninth grade and I loved every sinlge year. Playing for my school is the best experience I had throughout my highschool years. We also have great relationships with our teachers, deans and principals. Most of us even have our teaches as mentors. The clubs and activities we have contribute to our school in so many ways. All the students are commited to the clubs they are in and enjoy it. Despite all the things that have happened in our community we stay strong and build off of those things. As a senior now, I have to say I will miss Brentwood Highschool.', "The teachers and mentors I've had the honor of meeting here have forever changed my life and I will never forget my experience as a student.", "Amazing teachers! Brentwood gets a bad rep for all of the bad things that happen there, but my experience couldn't have been better.", "Overall Brentwood high school is unique and special in their own way. We have a variety of students from different countries which allows us to interact and meet new people. We as students learn the different cultures and how each one of us as students have something that define us. The students accept each other and give us the chance to speak our mind without being judged. Something the school can change is the amount of students the schools holds. At times the hallways are crowed and we don't have enough time to get to the following class. If the number of students enroll can decrease by 100, it might make a change.", 'Many people believe the brentwood high school is a bad school. When in reality, it’s filled with teachers who care about each student and help you in any way to pass the class. You will meet many new friends with the great diversity the school brings. Everybody in brentwood specializes in school spirit and always has events going on. I have created countless memories at this school and it will always be a special place for me.', 'Amazing high school! The teachers and school officials were always helpful to me and are willing to help everyone succeed in life. Security could be an issue but we are getting better with the installation of ScholarChip!', 'I would like to see more funding towards after school clubs as well as after school sports to allow them to have a more fair chance against other schools. I would also like to see more preparations/assistance in the college rediness of the students attending the school.', 'I enjoy my high school years it’s not as bad as people mention towards others. The teachers are extremely nice and helpful, but I would like to see a change in the bathrooms it’s inhuman how people can use it when it has  that much filth on the toilet seats and they should change the way they discipline the kids because they get away with the bad things they do to fast.', "It's a great school with some amazing teachers! I've learned so much at my time here and it's all thanks to them.", "It's not a safe school too much voilence,drugs, kids not attending. So out of control. People who dropped out or wasn't from the school or graduated already be let back in the school lunch rooms classrooms, it wasn't a secured place, teachers curse at the students, or let them do what ever, not stay on topic.", "In the duration of my experience in this high school, the guidance counslors don't really prep you up for college or it's upcoming obsticles. The lunch of bland and at times even a bit off."]
column4: ['It’s an amazing diverse school with several activities to be a part of. Definitely one of my favorite', 'It’s a big school, lots of people, the classes are good overall and the selection you get to choose from.', 'Brentwood High School has a very multicultural environment and I enjoyed my high school years here. Teachers are great and the administrators care for their students education and safety.', 'Brentwood High School, is very different from regular high school because everything is not gonna be the same as in middle school or elementary school. They are supposed to be different for you to challenge yourself and do what you need to do in order to succeed in school and in life.', "No, just no. If I had the chance to do highschool allnover again and rectify all my mistakes I wouldn't just to save myself from the trauma of attending this school.", "Brentwood High School was a very good experience for me but due to the surrounding neighborhoods, there are students of low to middle-class brackets who don't all necessarily have access to certain resources or knowledge which also lead to violence. I would like Brentwood High School to bring more awareness to issues such as bullying, fighting, self-esteem boosting programs, suicide, how to manage your finances and prepare for college, banking and instead of suspension, provide healing/therapeutic mechanisms.", 'As a Senior from Brentwood High School, I have learned so many things from so many people and was given a unique experience that I am able to carry on after high school.', 'BHS is a very diverse school. The teachers are extremely informative and will be willing to assist you with whatever you need. When I think of Brentwood High School, I think of “home.” I’m proud to be a Brentwood student and I wouldn’t want to attend any other high school. We have many after school activities including sports, arts, and music progarms.', 'The School is very welcoming as the people don’t care for what status you are as a human, but just for your personality and how friendly you can be!', 'Being a student at Brentwood Highschool from my sophmore year to my senior year has been a great highschool exprience. All the students at BHS have so much school spirit. For example, sports. If there any sport events going on, guarateed the stands will be filled up with students, parents and alumnis. I have been on the varsity soccer team since ninth grade and I loved every sinlge year. Playing for my school is the best experience I had throughout my highschool years. We also have great relationships with our teachers, deans and principals. Most of us even have our teaches as mentors. The clubs and activities we have contribute to our school in so many ways. All the students are commited to the clubs they are in and enjoy it. Despite all the things that have happened in our community we stay strong and build off of those things. As a senior now, I have to say I will miss Brentwood Highschool.', "The teachers and mentors I've had the honor of meeting here have forever changed my life and I will never forget my experience as a student.", "Amazing teachers! Brentwood gets a bad rep for all of the bad things that happen there, but my experience couldn't have been better.", "Overall Brentwood high school is unique and special in their own way. We have a variety of students from different countries which allows us to interact and meet new people. We as students learn the different cultures and how each one of us as students have something that define us. The students accept each other and give us the chance to speak our mind without being judged. Something the school can change is the amount of students the schools holds. At times the hallways are crowed and we don't have enough time to get to the following class. If the number of students enroll can decrease by 100, it might make a change.", 'Many people believe the brentwood high school is a bad school. The lunch of bland and at times even a bit off."]
column6: ["What I liked about Brentwood High School was the variety of people that were in the school. This is something that I hope to see where I attend college because I won't just learn in the school but I will also learn outside of it through different interactions with the people that also attend.", 'Brentwood High School is a Very Packed School yes what school is not annoying but with over 1400 you work on your socilazation skills and with teachers and counselors that set you up for a great future you couldnt ask for a better school district', "Being a student at Brentwood High School was full of fun experiences. I can't see any other school having as much school spirit and how close we are as a student body community from spirit week to pep rally no one compares to the fun and energetic students here at  Brentwood. As for education goes all of the teachers that I have had always wants us to succeed and will go out of there way to help us whether it would be staying after school for extra help or just the comfort of being able to ask questions they all create a comfortable and safe learning environment.", 'I like the diversity that the school has and it’s a friendly environment. I just wish it offered more programs and school activities.', 'Brentwood High School is what you make of it. I definitely did not feel prepared for college, my guidance counselor Jimenez barely reviewed everything. I did not know how to fill out FAFSA forms, how to apply to college or anything of the sort. He would always give me/ everyone else an attitude when we came to him about anything. Horrible.', 'I graduated from Brentwood high school in 1985 and even though it was very different from what it is now it still has the diverse cultures which makes this school so unique and the teachers still are very caring and are super involved with their students. All teachers, staff and students take super pride in our school district and I agree with what one student said in their own review that I wish that Brentwood High School would get the recognition they deserve', 'Overall, the experience in this school is around average. Some teachers are amazing, but some feel like they don\'t even try at all. Compared to other schools, this school doesn\'t have enough money to provide for the large population in it, so the technology isn\'t that great, and the food isn\'t really good. The school is very safe compared to other school districts, but this is only the result of administration enforcing rules very strictly. It may seem like the "better safe than sorry route", but it starts to feel a little ridiculous when a student has to endure a disciplinary action such as detention, or In-School-Suspension just because they were wearing a hat, or had earbuds on.', "Brentwood high school has a large student body. I would say I had a good experience attending this school. For the most part I had the resources I needed. Could there be improvement - of course. There are amazing teachers who are always there to help you and there are others who don't care at all. The food is ok, nothing to rave about. I believe there should be more room to create more clubs. I especially believe there should be a way for students to find opportunities or be informed of ways to participate and volunteer in the community and not just after school clubs.", 'Brentwood High School is home. You go through stuff and come to school where you can have an outlet of teachers counselors and even the deans and principal to talk to. It is a school that offers a tremendous amount of after school activities such as sports like track, basketball, baseball, volleyball, soccer and more. Our principal Mr. Richard Loeschner was named best principal in the state. Through my high school career he has been more than a principal he has been a lifeline, a bestfriend, a counselor, and a father figure. He knows just about everyone’s name in the school and makes sure his “children” are okay and are getting the right resources and attention they need. Our school is probably the most diverse on the island. After school they hold college readiness programs every other week. Our security guards are not only friendly towards the students but assertive when they have to be. They are the ones that make sure we feel safe to walk the hallways.', 'Brentwood High school is a diverse school filled with all students who have dreams to become doctors, lawyers, teachers, engineers, and etc. Curriculum is tough on students to prepare them for college. Brentwood high school is always being involved with the community. Allowing students to help the community and school. I would only like to change one thing... have Brentwood High School receive more recognition!', "What I liked about Brentwood High School is the unity and how we're all connected in this community. The school spirit is amazing and everyone is proud to be a Brentwood Indian. No matter how long ago a person may have graduated from the school they always seem to gravitate back to it. There's always alumni's visiting, showing support, and giving back. The school is also very diverse and you find yourself coming into contact with people from various backgrounds. Though it is very crowded it is a nice environment. The teachers are excellent at their jobs and make learning fun by developing good relationships with their students. Some thing's I would like to be changed are the computers in the computer labs that tend to break down frequently, the printers in the library that sometimes don't print in color, the cafeteria food, and for there to be additional lockers.", 'So far it\'s great. The teachers are great, they are friendly and they help you when you need it, the students are also kinda nice.  The building is nice. There is a lot of diversity and many activities & club you can do  or it be a part of. The food is not bad but i think it just needs a little "spiciness". The parents are involve, the teachers call them when something is wrong.', 'Currently I’m a senior at Brentwood. So far my experience has been pleasant, only thing that bothers me are the crowded hallways, considering we have over 4,000 students. Otherwise Brentwood is a great school, it’s full of diversity and they do their best to keep us safe and have some of the best teachers :).', 'Brentwood High School was my second home. Like any other student there its agreeable that the diversity there is one of the most incredible things it has to offer. Its truly a place filled with a variety of cultures, traditions, and races which makes it incredible.', 'Brentwood High school provides various clubs and classes a student can take. Brentwood in itself is very much looked as a poor and "ghetto" area however our high school is filled with respect and energy. Although brentwood is looked down upon as students and faculty we come together as one to stand against the bad reputation. Id love to see Brentwood get renovated however. for such an amazing school in certain points it does seemingly look old.', "All of my classmates were very friendly but many of the teachers weren't. Many were rude to their students. Id like to see a change in that and a change to all of the gang violence.", 'Overall, I am happy with the school.    Teachers go out of their way to offer extra help to students on a consistent basis.', 'There are so many things to love about Brentwood High school. There is so much diversity and teachers that actually care about your well being as a student but also as a person with feelings. If I could change some things about Brentwood High school it would be the food. Sometimes Its not very appetizing and as a student you constantly have to eat to keep your energy high for learning.', "I really like this school because there is a lot of diversity and people are mature. It is said by many that this school has way more diversity than the school that they themselves attend. I have gone to events wwre others schools come to the events to also witness it and people actually say this. For example at my school which is  brentwood high school we don't care if someone is gay simply because it is none of our business. what a person likes is on them and basically no one is going to ask nor is any one going to judge for something like. Fight don't occur that much here because the security squad knows what they are doing. I don't know if it is true but I had heard that the security guards are all retired cops so you should take that into consideration if you are conserned about your own safety.", "The people are supportive and there is a lot of diversity. The school spirit is tremendous, beyond anything I've ever seen before. The reputation of the school and the people in it could improve, it is not as bad as a place that people make it seem. The faculty is amazing and interactive with the students, they genuinely care about the mental and physical health of everyone."]

column2: ['Going to Bloomfield Tech was an amazing experience for me. I attended Bloomfield Tech for two years my Freshman and sophomore year. But during these two years, I was able to learn how to 3-d print and design, I was able to learn how to use power tools and able to design and build my own project. Many may say Bloomfield Tech is old but it makes it up for having the best equipment and teachers who knows how to push the student to do their best. I was personally able to take carpentry, electric, AutoCAD, mechanical engineering, sustainable energy, and plumbing as part of my exploratory CTE. Although I only took most of these class for one quarter I took mechanical engineering and robotics for my next three year as my CTE class.', "I loved that if offered different CTEs. Also, it was very strict compared to other schools around the area. It was also more selective than other schools around the area. Even so, I did not like the behavior of some of the students that were admitted into the school. All considered, I had a good 2 years of high school at Bloomfield Tech, and although they could've been better, Bloomfield Tech was the best public school I could have found within my area.", 'My experience at the school was very fast past and very interactive. With all of the career concentration course options such as business, building trades and the arts, learning became more enjoyable and excitimg.', 'The students and some of the faculty are racist and lazy, they are always mad or depressed. There’s not a lot of clubs, the students never like to participate in any of the activities and others get affected by that.', 'I learned a lot from this school. Some teachers teaches very well and there are AP College courses involved in their curriculum. I believe the school can change more better when we move to the new building ( now called Payne Tech) with better resources, hands-on experiences, and more!', 'Good high school to enroll in. Has a huge diversity and is welcoming to new students. Nonetheless, any student can engage in any clubs, sports, and other activities that are academic as well', 'I like how involved the school is with your life and family. There very nice and caring. It’s a nice, strict, comfortable environment and they work to benefit you and your future. They provide a lot of extra curriculars to do as well', 'While I do wish the facilities of the school were better while I was attending, I cannot deny that I greatly enjoyed attending the school, and I was especially happy that, due to being a technical school, the administration placed a great deal of focus on careers outside of the prototypical STEM fields.', 'Bloomfield Tech is a diverse school along with great classes. The school helps the students get ready for college and the teachers also helping the students in any way possible.', 'I would like to see a more student and teacher interaction where the teachers hear the students out more when it comes to learning in class. I enjoyed how the guidance department stepped it up this year with helping students out who want to go to college.', "Bloomfield Tech is one of those schools that's small enough that you get to know everyone. OVer the past few years it was a very welcoming school. It had its ups and down but that's life but i couldn't say i would want to go anywhere else.", "Being enrolled into Bloomfield Tech High school for 4 years was honestly the best experience I've ever had. Being able to interact with different type of people and learn new skills at the same time can be a blessing in life.", "At Bloomfield Tech I met a large variety of people. Even the teachers know more than the subject they're teaching and have come anf sacrificed to teach. For instance Mr.Shallcross who gave up working on wallstreet, a place where made a large surge of money, and instead came to teach english. Our teachers there are loving, caring, and devoted to education. As an alumni member I can say that they have always do a job well done.  In terms of change I just wish that the building would stay Bloomfield Tech and not become the new West Caldwell Tech in the next 2 years.", "I like the teacher's way of teaching , I would like to see some change in sports. The school lunch should also be improved.", 'My overall experience at BT was amazing. I met a lot of new and exciting people and had so much fun.', "I definitely like the fact that Bloomfield Tech is a small school. You don't get lost at a school like this one. You also get to meet so many different people that eventually become like family to you. I would like the school to upgrade a bit and re-do the structure of the building.", 'Business CTE aided me in learning about the world of business. The school helps with college things but only if you are on them about it.', "I've been at Bloomfield Technical Vocational High School for 4 years now. I'll be graduating in 2 months and I must say I did have quite an experience here at this high school. I learned many academics and fundamentals, and I feel like I'm very close to having college readiness. I'm very proud to be apart of a Blue Ribbon School, which was awarded to us twice. I give my overall experience a 4 out of 5 stars!", 'The teachers actually care, though sometimes the classroom might not necessarily reflect enlightening discourse. The school, as all schools, presents you with the information, but it is up to the student to independently learn and expand on their own. Curiosity is infinitely important.', 'It was a good school. I Liked my experience being here. I wish the school would have offered more activities.']
