column6: ["I loved attending Bloomfield Tech, specially when it came to playing baseball and being involved with the community. My shop class was called green energy and we look at ways to make are our school environment friendly. For example we was able to build a solar panel and get part of the school to run off of the Suns energy. Sadly we couldn't get the whole school to run off that Energy but we made strides and making the school better. Our one classroom was focus on preserving energy so our next big project was to build small turbines and we powered little things off of those too.", 'Its average not the best but not the worst. I think this school could actually do a lot better hopefully in the future they will.', "The diversity in this school is very high but i like the fact that no one cares and we're all accepting.", 'I sometimes wished the school could have more extracurricular activities or more clubs.', "If i could do it all over again I don't really think picking the school isn't what I would worry about. I would improve my working habits.", "The teachers aren't bad but they aren't great either.", "I love this school especially because it gave me a chance to prepare for a line of work that I am actually considering. I'm am looking to pursue a career in graphic design and printing. At this school I've been able to develop skills and gain some experience.", 'A lot of the teachers here are easy to approach and ask for help. Even the busiest teachers will give you extra help if you need it', 'The school was a old school so obviously some things will look old but other than that the school environment was safe and clean, plus our security guard was like a body builder so no one really tried anything.', 'The other activities are pretty good because a lot people join them. However, sometimes the times can be a bit difficult due to how small  the school is but everything usually works out well.', 'The teachers I experienced in my four year period, there was a lot of ups and downs with a few teachers but I can say that every teacher tried their best to help every student succeed in every way possible. I kind of miss it a little bit because they are much more understanding than my college professors. This school was a great four years.', 'The overall personality of the school isn\'t that great, to be blunt. It is a hard environment to "be yourself" and there is honestly a lot of negativity around. Not many people enjoy being "active" and tend to sit around and judge others. However, if you find the right people and surround yourself with the right people then you\'re sure to have a good time here. The only thing is finding those people. There aren\'t many events, so it is up to you to take initiative and create/produce your own events and that can be really fun depending on what type of person you are. At first, it isn\'t that great, but as you develop your personality and learn to become a person who does not give a heck about what others say, then this school becomes good practice for the type of people you may encounter in the future!', 'A lot of the teachers make it so everything is on you. I suppose that it would be to "help prepare for college" but honestly it does not necessarily seem that way. I can only name about 3 teachers out of the school that actually care and take the time out of their schedule to help other students. Teachers tend to have favorites and it\'s hard for some who aren\'t those favorites to get some of the same opportunities. On the other hand, there are some teachers who are really cool outside of class and they tend to be the ones that run some of the clubs so that is also good. There is also an amazing guidance counselor!', 'The security is strict somewhat. We are constantly wearing IDs and the Principal does random checks to make sure students are following rules.', "The school offers many clubs. Each day of the school week has two-three clubs going on in one day. I'm in 4 of the clubs that my school offers I enjoy all of them.", "I've had my ups and downs at BT but I'm glad that I went to this school. I found my love for Web Design and discovered my creative abilities. I made many new friends these past years and some I hope to be friends with in the long run. BT is a great school and I wouldn't want to be anywhere else.", 'A lot of the teachers try their best to make sure students pass their class. Some of them are very understanding and allow extra credit. The classes I take are tough at times but most of the time the teachers try their hardest to make sure you understand the lesson.', 'With Bloomfeid tech, unarmed secirity takes safety measures to keep everyone safe but incidents do occur and they are their to fix it.', 'Most of the after school programs offered at Bollomfeild tech are bot funded by the school except for the Deca organization and student council. Those two groups are to clubs that are the most highly recognized and respected at the school.', "Their isn't much of anything I can say about the parents because I do not personally know the parents and to say anything about them would be untrue on my behalf."]
column8: ["I loved attending Bloomfield Tech, specially when it came to playing baseball and being involved with the community. My shop class was called green energy and we look at ways to make are our school environment friendly. For example we was able to build a solar panel and get part of the school to run off of the Suns energy. Sadly we couldn't get the whole school to run off that Energy but we made strides and making the school better. Our one classroom was focus on preserving energy so our next big project was to build small turbines and we powered little things off of those too.", 'Its average not the best but not the worst. I think this school could actually do a lot better hopefully in the future they will.', "The diversity in this school is very high but i like the fact that no one cares and we're all accepting.", 'I sometimes wished the school could have more extracurricular activities or more clubs.', "If i could do it all over again I don't really think picking the school isn't what I would worry about. I would improve my working habits.", "The teachers aren't bad but they aren't great either.", "I love this school especially because it gave me a chance to prepare for a line of work that I am actually considering. I'm am looking to pursue a career in graphic design and printing. At this school I've been able to develop skills and gain some experience.", 'A lot of the teachers here are easy to approach and ask for help. Even the busiest teachers will give you extra help if you need it', 'The school was a old school so obviously some things will look old but other than that the school environment was safe and clean, plus our security guard was like a body builder so no one really tried anything.', 'The other activities are pretty good because a lot people join them. However, sometimes the times can be a bit difficult due to how small  the school is but everything usually works out well.', 'The teachers I experienced in my four year period, there was a lot of ups and downs with a few teachers but I can say that every teacher tried their best to help every student succeed in every way possible. I kind of miss it a little bit because they are much more understanding than my college professors. This school was a great four years.', 'The overall personality of the school isn\'t that great, to be blunt. Those two groups are to clubs that are the most highly recognized and respected at the school.', "Their isn't much of anything I can say about the parents because I do not personally know the parents and to say anything about them would be untrue on my behalf."]

column2: ['I love the staff and the honors programs. There is a lot of different activities at my school that I enjoy getting involved in. I also enjoy the selection of food at lunch and breakfast. My school is completely renovated and has brand new facilities.', 'Stratford high, while a public school, offers so much to the students. From hardworking atletics to an amazing music department, the environment is warm and welcoming. The diversity of cultures among students and faculty is amazing. The staff pushes you to be the best version of yourself constantly.', 'My experience at Stratford High School has been very good so far. The school has offered me many opportunities to further my knowledge on career options. They have career pathways such as culinary where kids get to bake goods and learn the skills required to be in the field. The school also has a very good environment where you can trust the faculty and everyone for the most part has a positive attitude.', 'I transferred as a Junior coming from a different Stratford public school, and the acceptance and energy, especially from the administration and teachers was absolutely amazing. I felt like I could really be myself.', 'My experience at Stratford high has been great. The atmosphere is really warm, the teachers, staff and students are very welcoming. I was  transferred into Stratford in my junior year and i can honestly say that I was taught a lot and I love it there. Now as a senior I truly loved the experience because I learned a lot of life lesson and how to deal with real-world issues.', "I've enjoyed (and am currently enjoying) my years at Stratford High School very much. Having previously attended a private school, I went into SHS knowing practically no one. However on my first day, teachers and students were immediately welcoming and made me feel comfortable. I've made fantastic friends that have been by my side since the day I met them and have established personal relationships with nearly all of my teachers to which we still greet each other in passing even if I haven't had them since my freshman year. I have always found the coursework adequately challenging, although I have mostly only taken honors and AP classes, which are offered for most subjects. Although some could argue against my perspective, I've noticed that my experience is so positive because of the people I surrounded myself with and the challenges I pushed myself to overcome.", 'Stratford High School is full of passionate teachers willing to spend extra time with each individual student. You will not only see teachers there during school hours and office time, but also as coaches for extra curricular sports, theater play directors or just cheering in the stands at a basketball game. They devote extra energy and personal time into their students. Located in a town outside of Bridgeport you will find poverty among many students in this school district. I would love to see an outreach program that provides life skills, extra after school meals and mentoring programs outside of the normal school classes.', 'I loved being able to take advanced classes and be actively involved in multiple sports seasons. The teachers were supportive in the class room and at games. My Latin class was an ultimate favorite and I was crushed when it didn’t fit in my senior schedule. The building left something to be desired but they are almost done re building it. My brother is about to be a senior and likes the boast that he will be graduating from a brand new and beautiful school. The classrooms now resemble those I that I have at UConn. There are ofcourse some more difficult teachers and boring classes but all in all it was a great experience in class and on the court', 'Stratford High School is an excellent place to learn. With the new school building, there are more resources for the students to succeed with. There are of course things that need to be changed, but the administration tries their hardest to keep the school a safe and fun learning environment.', 'I had a good 4 years at this school. But like a lot of things, it has its positives and negatives. Food sucks. The music programs are great. Most of the teachers and students are alright, I guess.', "Academically, I think it's up to the standards we expect for our children.  It's very diverse and accepting of all of our young adults.  Foodwise, it could probably offer more healthy choices.  Since it always seems rushed, grabbing the healthiest alternative doesn't always seem like a viable option.", 'My experience at SHS was very good! I got the opportunity to meet new people and learn in different environments and in different styles.', 'Great School with a ton of opportunities to learn and grow. Building a whole new campus, full of new technology.', 'Well, we have an amazing new building that we have moved into. The teachers at the school really care about their students and take the time to learn about each and every one of us.', "Stratford high is newly renovated, but the kids don't seem to care for maintaining the quality of the buildings. The acedemics is what you make of it at Stratford High, if you are a dedicated student you will prosper, if you do not put in the effort, well then you won't get much out of it. I wish the school had more funding for its electives and activities (clubs/sports).", 'Stratford High School can either make or break you as a person. The teachers there drive you to find your passions and won’t spell things out for you. They will push you and they will challenge you to be the best version of yourself they know is achievable. Students there are typically your friends from elementary school and if you are new, you feel as though you have known these people your whole life too. It is a small-town school where you will know everybody. This could potentially finally be a bad thing however, that is determined on how you live your life. Overall, this is collectively great aspect. The reason I only gave this experience 4 stars is due to the fact that in my path at Stradtford High, I could’ve taken advantage of the academics more than I did to achieve more scholarship opportunities. Nevertheless, I would not trade in my high school experience because Stratford High School made me posses an abundance of great qualities that others may not have.', 'I liked the warming feeling some of the sports provided and the family comfort most of the teachers gave', 'I loved the teachers I had and the rigor of the honors curriculum. The building itself is falling apart but it houses many great memories for me.', "I graduated in 2017. There were many things I loved such as the friends I made, the school spirit, the culture of diversity and inclusion. Something I didn't like so much was the actual structure of the school and the cleanliness. It was often very dirty and the teachers and administration weren't as great as they could've been.", "Stratford high school is decent educational although wish they would push kids harder. I think guidance shouldn't only inform the honor student's of scholarships everyone should be able to know."]

column8: ["I wouldn't say I feel completely safe, I don't walk the halls thinking I might get stabbed.", 'The few clubs that are available are underfunded and have a lack of structure', 'The unleveled classes are usually hectic however some teachers have a strict vibe and are able to get some real work done', 'The academics are good depending on what level classes you are taking. I am in honors classes and I think they give me a good challenge but they are never overwhelming.', 'There are a varuety of extracurricular activities at SHS and many students like to get involved.', 'Most of the teachers at SHS are good, I just wish they were more diverse.  The teachers are mainly male and Italian and I think the teachers should be a representation of the student body.', "I have been in AP classes since junior year and honors classes since I began high school. Through out my years at Stratford High, I've noticed that the teachers in higher level classes try a lot harder to help students and tend to care more for them. But in the level 1 classes if been in, teachers seem to be more  worried about disciplining students  for superficial things rather than working with them and helping them  and those students end up resenting the teachers and learn nothing.", "I am in the strange position where I am judging parents. Now that I think about it though, they're horrible.", 'Mixed bag. Some are good, others not so good. Depends what level of class you are in.', 'Some sports are taken seriously while a few are a complete joke. Band and drama are taken seriously.', 'For higher level classes, the ones I am in, the experience is good we do actually learn unlike other level 1 and level 2 classes that are a joke. They are this way because of some of the teachers and the students.', 'Some of the teachers are overall very knowledgeable and helpful while others do the bare minimum to get by without being fired.', 'Health and safety is average', 'There are various extracurricular programs and so far they are great', 'Administrators and Directives are willing to work with parents and students', 'There are some teachers that are willing to go the extra mile to help students', 'Stratford High has a variety of extracurricular opportunities available to the students. Football, soccer, basketball, tennis, cross country, track, lacross, swimming, theater, music, art, chorus, cooking, aces (engineering), aqua (marine science), and the honor society are the more prominent activities, plus a host of volunteer opportunities for students who are more interested in giving back and paying it forward. I truly believe that Stratford High provide a solid education for the kids, they just have to part take in whatever interest them.', 'I am always amazed at the dedication to the students that the teachers at Stratford exhibit toward the students. They are on the ball through a phone call or email when the need for parent intervention arises. They invite parents to become a part of the learning process of their children. Parents are encouraged to chaperone trips that are planned at the schools. The principal works hard at knowing the kids name which really impress me. I love Stratford High.', "Stratford High has some good people in administration; however, they are draconian in the policies they implement to punish the few that don't follow the rules. They have an awesome music program, and dedicated teachers and plenty of opportunities available for various activities. The lack of resources to fully finance some programs are limited.", 'Teachers are always available before and after school for extra help and they really care about the students learning.']

column2: ['As an upcoming senior at urban I would say that it’s a school that really has changed my life and opened me up as a person. We have great art and photography classes as well as unique academic classes that we get to choose on our own. They don’t automatically throw us straight into our schedules at the beginning of the year and let new and current really get comfortable with each other. There are opportunities to get internships and I’m currently enrolled to take college classes. If you prefer a small environment Urban is a perfect school for you.', 'Transferring to this school was the best decision of my life. The atmosphere was very homelike and caring. This school provides a sense of individuality but also never lets you feel alone. The teachers are very caring and your success is their priority.', "Great environment that welcomes people of all backgrounds and cultures. However, lack of tests and regents lead to unpreparedness in college. Not great academically as it doesn't challenge students and doesn't require them to get out of their comfort zone. Very helpful in the college applications but leads to difficult adjustment to college level classes.", 'Urban Academy is a great school for certain people. The teachers care about their students deeply. I think the admistration could be stricter with who it allows in and the behavior they allow in certain circumstances.', "Urban was a great school in terms of academics. The teachers really cared about the students, and classes were engaging. The student population was on the whole a little unmotivated, and it was hard to succeed in that environment where your classmates don't seem to care.", 'I like that we had to do a lot of work at once which prepared me for college work.', 'The main office is a complete chaos, it is just an office with clutter of papers. The teachers tend to not prioritize students work and take a very long time to get back to the students.', 'There is no variety of sports, there is only soccer. The coaches are the teachers in the school. It is horrible.', 'There are not that many, however the few that they offer are good. There are tons of activities to do outside of school though.', "School is fun. Im excited to attend everyday and look forward to learning. The teachers are great and so are done if the students. It's a pretty awesome school.", 'Most of the school is very accepting, everyone is different and people appreciate that about one another. There are your occasional jerks and dushbags but its high school, and for a high school its one of the most accepting schools in the city.', 'The teachers are amazing. They will do wonders for you and help you out a lot. The teaching staff is also very diverse.', "My school didn't have a cafeteria, we are one floor and use the hallway as our café. Most people just go our for lunch. Its okay though there are tons of options close by, but things can get pricy.", 'There is a no tolerance rule for bullying and fighting. If you are reported doing it, or caught, you are expelled. Students can pretty much wear what they please to.', "We really don't have that much sports teams. Only basketball and volleyball really. Our pool is being renovated so thats good. I would like more sports though.", "UALHS is a very open safe community where everyone is accepted for who they are. The faculty members try their hardest to make to a safe zone for everyone. We have tons of oppourtunities and resources provided to us from our teachers and principle. I couldn't ask for more. Its amazing.", 'The school challenges us in every class. We have different types of classes our social studies classes can range from "India" to "Jim Crow Laws". ', "We've had very good as a community . When ever bullying  occurs the school gets together and gets against the bullier", 'In my school we are allowed to wear anything we want. Our school is very liberal . ', 'The teachers at Urban Academy are very friendly but also very much motivating. If I am having problems at home I can go to a specific teacher and maintain a relationship with them outside of school. They notice when your down or when your not fulfilling your full ability in school. We are also challenged to use our minds are resources and have an opinion.']
column4: ['As an upcoming senior at urban I would say that it’s a school that really has changed my life and opened me up as a person. We have great art and photography classes as well as unique academic classes that we get to choose on our own. They don’t automatically throw us straight into our schedules at the beginning of the year and let new and current really get comfortable with each other. There are opportunities to get internships and I’m currently enrolled to take college classes. If you prefer a small environment Urban is a perfect school for you.', 'Transferring to this school was the best decision of my life. The atmosphere was very homelike and caring. This school provides a sense of individuality but also never lets you feel alone. The teachers are very caring and your success is their priority.', "Great environment that welcomes people of all backgrounds and cultures. However, lack of tests and regents lead to unpreparedness in college. Not great academically as it doesn't challenge students and doesn't require them to get out of their comfort zone. Very helpful in the college applications but leads to difficult adjustment to college level classes.", 'Urban Academy is a great school for certain people. The teachers care about their students deeply. I think the admistration could be stricter with who it allows in and the behavior they allow in certain circumstances.', "Urban was a great school in terms of academics. The teachers really cared about the students, and classes were engaging. The student population was on the whole a little unmotivated, and it was hard to succeed in that environment where your classmates don't seem to care.", 'I like that we had to do a lot of work at once which prepared me for college work.', 'The main office is a complete chaos, it is just an office with clutter of papers. The teachers tend to not prioritize students work and take a very long time to get back to the students.', 'There is no variety of sports, there is only soccer. The coaches are the teachers in the school. It is horrible.', 'There are not that many, however the few that they offer are good. There are tons of activities to do outside of school though.', "School is fun. Im excited to attend everyday and look forward to learning. The teachers are great and so are done if the students. It's a pretty awesome school.", 'Most of the school is very accepting, everyone is different and people appreciate that about one another. There are your occasional jerks and dushbags but its high school, and for a high school its one of the most accepting schools in the city.', 'The teachers are amazing. They will do wonders for you and help you out a lot. The teaching staff is also very diverse.', "My school didn't have a cafeteria, we are one floor and use the hallway as our café. Most people just go our for lunch. Its okay though there are tons of options close by, but things can get pricy.", 'There is a no tolerance rule for bullying and fighting. If you are reported doing it, or caught, you are expelled. Students can pretty much wear what they please to.', "We really don't have that much sports teams. Only basketball and volleyball really. Our pool is being renovated so thats good. I would like more sports though.", "UALHS is a very open safe community where everyone is accepted for who they are. The faculty members try their hardest to make to a safe zone for everyone. We have tons of oppourtunities and resources provided to us from our teachers and principle. I couldn't ask for more. Its amazing.", 'The school challenges us in every class. We have different types of classes our social studies classes can range from "India" to "Jim Crow Laws". ', "We've had very good as a community . When ever bullying  occurs the school gets together and gets against the bullier", 'In my school we are allowed to wear anything we want. Our school is very liberal . ', 'The teachers at Urban Academy are very friendly but also very much motivating. If I am having problems at home I can go to a specific teacher and maintain a relationship with them outside of school. They notice when your down or when your not fulfilling your full ability in school. We are also challenged to use our minds are resources and have an opinion.']

column2: ['I came from a small catholic grammar school , when I made the move to a public high school I was a bit intimidated .  Fortunately I loved it !  The faculty really cares about the students .  I actually ended up on the honor roll for the first time in my life .', "I'm  a senior here and I love this school. Teachers go out of there way to help. There are after-school tutoring sessions if needed and teachers will actually stay late to help if asked. There are so many after school events and the  sports teams are the best I'm  going to miss this school when I graduate.", 'I enjoy the activities that Raritan High School has to offer. There’s something for everyone, and they’re always coming up with new clubs if a student can’t find an interest. We recently added a Performing Arts program to our school, which has been very beneficial. I wish that it was added a few years ago, because I unfortunately can not be a part of it since I am now a senior. It’s really great for students like me who want to major in Performing Arts.', 'My experience here is supportive, all the teachers  and the counselors are all willing to help you in achieving a goal', 'Raritan High School is overall a good school. Sure people complain about it, but it is over the small things. The teachers at Raritan are very friendly and most are helpful. There are few legitimate complaints. However, the math department seems to have more negative reviews from my peers. Some of the rules may seem a little strict,but overall it is a good school.', "Throughout my experience, at Raritan, I've been surrounded by wonderful people.  To enjoy your high school experience, you need to take a risk and join clubs. Make sure you're pushing yourself to get out of your comfort zone. You need to keep an open mind about talking to new people and realizing that people can change.  People need to utilize all the clubs that are offered throughout Raritan and talk to people to make the most out of high school. Another note that there is some incredible teacher that you just need to find. It's only up to you to decide what you make the most out of school.", 'The teachers at Raritan High School really care about the students, however there are things being focused on more than the students at times. Where the school cold be finding more for the students they are actually funding to do things such as paint. The students at Raritan high school painting amazing murals all over the school that took these students months and just within a month of the new principle the murals were painted over. what was once comfortable warm learning environment has transformed into a cold place.', 'The teachers are great but the administration is belittling and makes  the high school seem overbearing.', "The teachers are okay but most students are failing at least one or two of their classes. There isn't a lot to get you ready for college or the SAT/ACT.  The high school graduation requirements are changing every year making it hard to know what classes I need to take to graduate. Overall its a slightly below average public high school.", "If I am being completely honest Raritan High School has been a very poor school. To be completely honest, the teachers are nice people, but when in a classroom they become completely different people. They teach and expect their students to learn the material in one sitting. If they don't then it's up to the students to come after school for more help. This may be a problem for some children because of after-school activities. Besides that Raritan can be a very nice school too, in fact, most of the teachers are very caring. They are fun and treat their students with respect. They value our ideas, thoughts, and opinions.", 'Raritan is a good environment, and surrounded by nice kids. However, the administration abuses there power. They like to control, and lie to students to get themselves out of trouble. I am beyond excited to be leaving and moving onto the real world.', 'Raritan high school is a great public school in the Monmouth county area. The teachers and rest of the staff are determined to help each student. Every teacher is professional and knows how to approach each of their students. You can even see the staff work well together and treat each other equally. The academics are very good and will prepare you for your future.', 'I believe that the overall district could be run better in terms of budget use and student resources. Specifically pertaining to Raritan however, many of the things the school purchases are not used or even noticed. For instance there has been a waterfall added to one of the courtyards, of which there are three, however no students are allowed to utilize two of the courtyards rendering the waterfall useless and a waste of money. Raritan buys a lot of things that make it a nice looking school but most of those things serve no valuable purpose to the students.', 'As long as you get involved and work hard Raritan is a great place to go to school. High school is what you make of it, and Raritan gives students many opportunities to make their high school experience great!', "Raritan High School is a very great and safe place that one can feel very at home with. The lunches they serve are delicious and the classes are very educational.  I really liked the interaction between teachers and students, since the teachers really do care about their students. I don't think there is really anything to change for this school at any point in time.", "Raritan High School was a great experience for me overall. It is the type of school where there is much offered, but if you don't take advantage of the opportunities yourself, you may not reach your maximum potential. I found myself constantly challenged in the variety of AP classes offered and was able to opt out of many of my general education classes in college because Raritan pays for students' AP tests. Most of the teachers are always willing to help a student in need and do what they can to help their students succeed.", "It was okay. The academics weren't challenging enough. The teachers and administrators cared only for sports, not the rest of their students.", 'I really liked how well the teachers worked with the students. I felt like they were always there to help you and wanted you to do the  best you could.', 'The teachers who really cared made all the difference. Other than that it is rather mediocre. Offers good opportunities for students interested in math and science as well as student athletes. However, the arts are often pushed to the side.', 'Raritan is a school that made me feel loved. Over the course of my four years there, I made so any close relationships with faculty, staff, and classmates. It truly was my home away from home and I am so grateful I had the chance to get my education there.']

column6: ['There are many opportunities at Raritan. Although, there are a lot of fights and drama. Many kids take honors despite them not putting in effort, so I believe there should be recommendations or some type of system to limit this problem. I enjoy all my AP classes.', 'I liked that Raritan High School had a great culture and teachers who really cared. One thing I would like to see change is more higher level academic courses offered.', "Raritan is a great school with amazing teachers. The communications department is flawless as well as the english department. The only flaw is that many coach's put sports above academics.", 'The education here is really good but it all depends on what teachers you get. A lot of the teachers are lazy and really hard on students. Great up and coming sports teams.', "Rarity High School has a terrific staff who wants to go above and beyond to care for the student's individual needs.", "Raritan has many opportunities if you take advantage of them. The problem is a lot of them are only open if you're in the upper twenty percent of the class and are very pushy to make them happen. If you want to merely do fine and get into an alright college or job after school, it is a perfectly fine school.", "Both of my siblings attended Raritan High School in Hazlet.  We all graduated with a three year time frame.  I do not feel that Raritan prepared me for the rigors of college (neither do my brother or sister, and my brother was given a scholarship to attend the college of his choice!).  Raritan's teachers may be good, but what they are teaching or how they are teaching it isn't the best.  I watched more movies in class than I ever saw at any movie theater.", "It was an average school but wasn't heavy in academics and the arts. If you like sports this is the school for you, otherwise it's just like any other school.", 'I enjoyed my extra curricular activities. I felt like there was more potential for opportunities given to students, but it was not achieved.', "It's a pretty average school. It's by no means great, but we're not sitting on the floor. The teachers are either awful or amazing (a few). The administration is terrible except for Mr. Generelli now that our principal left. ", 'I was heavily involved int he extracurricular activities Raritan High School had to offer, which definitely helped me with being organized and involved. I joined so many groups, that it not only opened my eyes up to causes and variances of things, but it also helped me realize how important it is to have strong time management skills. I was able to enjoy my time in high school because of the wonderful extracurricular activities in my high school.', 'My overall experience with this school was amazing. When I went to college, the first topic my friends and I bonded over was high school. From there on out, I realized how wonderful my high school experience really was and everything that was offered to me in order to allow me to succeed.', 'The teachers at Raritan High School are both academically & personally intelligent. This strong quality allowed me to open up to my teachers in a way that was so unique to the school. I consider myself to be blessed with the teachers I had throughout my time in high school, because they were the ones that pushed my to my full potential and have allowed me to succeed in more than ever imagined.', "We're pretty good with acceptance, but there's not a whole lot of diversity. We're all white, straight, Italian kids from Brooklyn and Staten Island.", "Teachers don't know what they are doing half the time or just don't teach us at all. Going into senior year I still don't have my graduation requirements though I've been trying to take them since freshman year. I've learned nothing in most of my classes throughout high school.", 'Our security guards are the best! Not so much our administrators, but with the security, I feel safe.', "The staff and administration is what really kills this school. I could probably tolerate the dirt and fluctuating temperature if I was actually being educated. We have one great administrator and a bunch of tyrants who care more about asserting their authority than our well-being. Our administration spends money on chrome books, programs for the chrome books to see what tabs we have open, and software to access the webcams of the chrome books while we fry in the summer and freeze in the winter. If you can't figure out how to navigate the college process, you're screwed, because our guidance department doesn't know how to or won't help. Many of the teachers don't even like their jobs and more of the good teachers retire every year. At least we have nice security guards...", "I've had some great teachers (mostly junior and senior year) and some really awful ones. I've had teachers who didn't know how to teach, didn't know how to do what they were teaching, didn't feel like teaching, and didn't like kids! If you're lucky, you get some of the few good teachers. Most of the time though, you'll be teaching yourself and figuring out ways to cheat your way through classes.", 'The safety at this school is good but it could be better.  Fights are still common in the cafeteria', 'The students are very involved in extracurricular activities, and they are major part of the high school experience']

column1: Ralph R. McKee Career & Technical High School
column2: ['The teachers are great or well at least the ones i have had.There are CTE shops in the school that are all for the most part very good with teachers that are willing to teach you and help you make a career out of the trades provided you are willing to put in the effort. There are very few clubs in the school and you will find the school very empty after classes end.', 'Ralph R. McKee CTE High School sets students for their career path. The school wishes for the best of its students helping them find out what occupation or college they wish to go to after high school. McKee strives to serve as a building block for every student, inspiring them to try and fail rather then to not try at all. I for say had an amazing time at this school meeting with many different people from diverse backgrounds as well as exploring new cultures. Other then the already dozens of clubs ,McKee offers organizations and social groups that they promote to students such as myself. However, there is one thing I would change about my school, I would change the quality of the school lunch, (not to say everyone likes school lunch). I feel as though it in itself could be better and tastier while still being available to students for free. I would recommend Ralph R McKee to anyone for it is one of the most outstanding high schools that I have attended.', 'My experience at Ralph Mckee high school was very good and different. Each year was a different stepping stone.', 'During the time I spent at Mckee it was probably the best time of my life having my teachers, friends and family supporting me through school.  The best thing about Mckee was the time I spent in my shop class learning the most I can in Automotive.', "McKee is a very good school to go into since it prepares you for life after high school with the college readiness and college fairs which helps you get involved with college and also if you don't want to go to college they have programs that will help you gain a skill in the work force, from construction to graphic design there are multiple programs that you will benefit from by attending Ralph R McKee Technical Hogh School.", 'This  school did a good job at preparing students with the tools and education needed to succeed in college.', "I loved my time at McKee High School ! People always said that high school is what you make it and thats only partially correct. It all depends on the school community and staff. All the teachers, classmates & staff I've ever interacted with made me love my time there. I have pride in being a Seagull !", "I like how diverse McKee is and how much McKee prepares students for college. The teachers and the facility are good. The CTE courses are great and really prepares students for the CTE field of work they want to do. However, there aren't many AP classes provided for the students.", 'Ralph r mckee is the best school as it reaches to you not teaches and helps you towards college career ready', 'Best part of McKee is the amount of opportunities given here. To truly be successful in McKee is not only to get the grades or the certifications from your shop class (CTE Course) but to take part in everything they offer.', "im a senior in high school and my 4 years here have been good, all my classes and friends have been good and i've made a lot of memories with my teachers also, it's a good school.", 'I am currently the valedictorian for my graduating class, and I am content with my time at McKee high school. There are a multitude of programs to participate in, and I am always pushed to try my hardest at what I do. One such program pushing me to do more is the software engineering program, a class oriented around computer science and computer programming. In this program, I learn more and more about what computers do and how to control them, developing different applications to utilize their power. In addition to this, McKee offers other shops, including graphic design and automotive, the largest of our school. In graphic design, we utilize state of the art equipment to create our own designs, ranging from websites to advertisements. Overall, McKee ensures each student is ready to enter the workforce, or move on to college to pursue an important career. ', 'This is a highly diverse set of people and you learn a lot about other cultures here.', "We have one AP course which isn't bad, I wish we had more. We have honors classes and avid. We have collegeNow as well.", 'The school nurse makes sure to be on top of us.', 'My overall experience at his school so far is okay , I wish I could start over because I would do so much better', 'The teachers At McKee makes us As students use Cornell notes , which is a lot easier to read your notes to study', 'There is CollegeNOW, SkillsUSA, HAI, National Honor Society, National Technical Honor Society, and Key Club. Many different programs where you can partake in many different events and learn new things in these programs. The commitment level of the clubs are somewhat high. Key Club it is twice a week, and for SkillsUSA while yes there are several different hours of community service you are able to obtain, you do have a meeting twice a month if not more, and a citywide meeting once a month. For HAI its also twice a week.', 'The school has been amazing. SkillsUSA, Key Club, Hai and all the other clubs in this school are amazing. You do not find any other school that has such a tight friendly community. I would choose this school again.', 'The teachers in the school are all friendly, and genuinely fun people. The styles they use aid us for the future in our careers and life. They try to get to know their student so that they can be more engaging in the classroom. The CTE courses that are in the school are amazing. Overall, a awesome school.']

I would recommend Ralph R McKee to anyone for it is one of the most outstanding high schools that I have attended.', 'My experience at Ralph Mckee high school was very good and different. The best thing about Mckee was the time I spent in my shop class learning the most I can in Automotive.', "McKee is a very good school to go into since it prepares you for life after high school with the college readiness and college fairs which helps you get involved with college and also if you don't want to go to college they have programs that will help you gain a skill in the work force, from construction to graphic design there are multiple programs that you will benefit from by attending Ralph R McKee Technical Hogh School.", 'This  school did a good job at preparing students with the tools and education needed to succeed in college.', "I loved my time at McKee High School ! People always said that high school is what you make it and thats only partially correct. It all depends on the school community and staff. All the teachers, classmates & staff I've ever interacted with made me love my time there. I have pride in being a Seagull !", "I like how diverse McKee is and how much McKee prepares students for college. The teachers and the facility are good. The CTE courses are great and really prepares students for the CTE field of work they want to do. However, there aren't many AP classes provided for the students.", 'Ralph r mckee is the best school as it reaches to you not teaches and helps you towards college career ready', 'Best part of McKee is the amount of opportunities given here. To truly be successful in McKee is not only to get the grades or the certifications from your shop class (CTE Course) but to take part in everything they offer.', "im a senior in high school and my 4 years here have been good, all my classes and friends have been good and i've made a lot of memories with my teachers also, it's a good school.", 'I am currently the valedictorian for my graduating class, and I am content with my time at McKee high school. There are a multitude of programs to participate in, and I am always pushed to try my hardest at what I do. One such program pushing me to do more is the software engineering program, a class oriented around computer science and computer programming. In this program, I learn more and more about what computers do and how to control them, developing different applications to utilize their power. In addition to this, McKee offers other shops, including graphic design and automotive, the largest of our school. In graphic design, we utilize state of the art equipment to create our own designs, ranging from websites to advertisements. Overall, McKee ensures each student is ready to enter the workforce, or move on to college to pursue an important career. ', 'This is a highly diverse set of people and you learn a lot about other cultures here.', "We have one AP course which isn't bad, I wish we had more. We have honors classes and avid. We have collegeNow as well.", 'The school nurse makes sure to be on top of us.', 'My overall experience at his school so far is okay , I wish I could start over because I would do so much better', 'The teachers At McKee makes us As students use Cornell notes , which is a lot easier to read your notes to study', 'There is CollegeNOW, SkillsUSA, HAI, National Honor Society, National Technical Honor Society, and Key Club. Many different programs where you can partake in many different events and learn new things in these programs. The commitment level of the clubs are somewhat high. Key Club it is twice a week, and for SkillsUSA while yes there are several different hours of community service you are able to obtain, you do have a meeting twice a month if not more, and a citywide meeting once a month. For HAI its also twice a week.', 'The school has been amazing. SkillsUSA, Key Club, Hai and all the other clubs in this school are amazing. You do not find any other school that has such a tight friendly community. I would choose this school again.', 'The teachers in the school are all friendly, and genuinely fun people. The styles they use aid us for the future in our careers and life. They try to get to know their student so that they can be more engaging in the classroom. The CTE courses that are in the school are amazing. Overall, a awesome school.']
column6: ["I love my school. Although it is small its in a way a good thing its like a close knit family. Everyone knows everyone and there's rarely ever a situation that doesn't get smoothed over. What makes my school unique is not only are we a cte school we have an amazing variety of options whether its internship programs, college courses, and even after school clubs. If I could chose my school overall again I wouldn't do anything different. My school is a second home and my fellow students are like my second family.", 'The safety in the school is great. The security is very friendly and they will be your best friends', "The School's Policies are based of the requirements of the DOE", "They are just amazing! You can't never go wrong in the school", 'The College really encourages all of their graduates to either attend College or starts working at a union base job.', "The extracurricular activities are honestly some of the best programs I've ever seen in my life", "The Athletics in the school is not bad, it can always improve. The school shares it's sports teams with Staten Island Technical High School. But over all their Facilities are great. Staten Island Tech is currently upgrading it's field so it will be a lot better and more up to date", 'Guidance counselors are nice and extraordinarily helpful. Administration is mediocre, rules are not strictly enforced yet at the same time the school is not chaotic. For the most part, it is a nice environment. The principal seems to care about the students (especially the seniors) and the assistant principals are professional and make sure to keep order in the halls.', 'Teachers are the best, patient, caring and positive', 'everything is really great at my HS', 'My school has placed me in the direction for my future with all the necessary tools both in the classroom and within myself', "It's either you bring your own lunch or you deal with that they give to you.", 'There are many after school programs in the school that helps keep the students off the streets', "I had my ups and downs but I know I learned something, especially in my shop class which is Graphic Design. Till today I still go back to visit my Graphic Design teacher because that's how great he was. He wasn't just a teacher, he was also a mentor and he always did what he could to help us.", 'I think the security in the school is pretty strict and the Nurses do all they can to take care of the students', 'I think the school is very diverse', 'My school is smaller in size, there is more student teacher communication, its a technical school with a wide range of career possibilities, athletic department is great and engaging.', 'Great food, environment, selection at my school', 'It has started me on my Architecture career', 'athletics are great all around']

column1: Williamsburg High School for Architecture & Design
column2: ['Personally, my WHSAD experience thus far has been great. It’s a small school community where everyone knows everyone. There’s many opportunities so long as you’re willing to pursue them.', 'What I like about Williamsburg High school For Architecture and Design is the teachers are dedicated to the students in making sure we are striving for greatness throughout our four years here. The school offers us many different internship programs like Ace Mentor ship program where we work at an Architecture firm in Manhattan called Gensler.  The school offers many different clubs and sports we have the opportunity to compete. We have sports like volleyball, track, flag football, bat mitten, we have clubs like Art club, dance, architecture club. The students and teachers are very involved in terms of having school spirits and student teacher activities.', "Williamburg high school is a mediocre public school that puts no time and effort into developing students into college ready students. the work is so easy that its designed for even a middle schoolers to pass yet somehow they still have students that fail every year. the clubs and activities suck is super low budgeted and the school cant afford to send the students on any trips. honestly don't even waste your time there.", 'I would say that the school is overall a 4.5 since the school offers a lot of opportunities to its students but the school only has one fatal flaw that is bringing it down.  the school offers so much for the students to do but it becomes suffocating. you start helping out at high school fairs then teachers notice you then suddenly they have you working for them and start to fall behind in classes.', 'Williamsburg High School for Architecture and Design is an okay school, but one thing it teaches is Architecture classes, which not many schools have. Its a great way to learn these software and we even get a certificate for finishing an AutoCAD test which is great for our resume and getting into an Architecture major.', "Williamsburg High School is a decent school. If you are interested in Architecture and Design, you should be fine here. The architecture teachers here are qualified and know what they are teaching. There are plenty of opportunities. Right now, I am currently doing an internship at the Empire State Building. It's not a bad school.", 'The school is great and help to raise money to what the students want to do for their last year come', 'The teachers and students have a good impact on me & compared to my middle school; this school wins.', "It's an okay school, i felt like there was only stuff that was geared towards certain students and there wasn't much choice. Take for example sports there are only 2 varsity teams for boys, baseball and basketball. Most of the students don't care about their education. If you have a teacher named baldwin run the other way switch your schedule do something he's terrible", "I like how the teachers are really there for you and are willing to help you when you struggle. The staff wants what's best for the student. I wish they offered more classes like anatomy and more ap courses.", 'I like that this school teaches students an architectural field for all four years of your high school tenure. They have many diverse clubs and give opportunities to receive college credits. If you are having trouble with something a teacher will go out their way to help you succeed. The teachers are very caring. The environment is just great.', 'Its a great college for those that want to pursue a architecture career for their future. I would not recommend those who are not interested to go in this high school. I would also say that their standards set low but they want you to go as high as possible.', 'The Williamsburg High School for Architecture and Design was a great school that prepared me for the next stag elf my life. The teachers always saw potential in each and every student and helped all the students. With many after school activities such as an Architecture club, Skills USA, sports teams, there was always something to do. Going to WHSAD was the best decision I ever made because i was able to learn Auto CAD which has given me an advantage in my studies at college.', 'I liked how the school was based mostly on Architecture, and how the school is very diverse. The teachers are always there to help you, and they treat you with respect. I definitely would like for the school to have more resources to help you achieve your goal.', 'I didnt do any clubs but i did College Now and Co-op Technical education while in WHSAD', 'The math teachers are always there to help', 'I love the teachers and how you can talk to them like they are your friends.', 'There are a few teachers that will be there for you if you are having a tough time but you must show that you want their help.', 'They need a good set of people to start a club.', "The programs are good but we don't get that much support."]

column1: A. Philip Randolph Campus High School
column2: ['My experience has been good in this school but I wish the teachers were more considerate towards students and I wish the school was cleaner', "I couldn't imagine being a student at any other school. The staff is built by some of the most supportive people and provide the most opportunities possible.", 'A. Philip Randolph students possess immense school spirit that is contagious throughout the school. Not only do students have a positive attitude, teachers are concerned about their academic and personal life as well. Family is almost always present within the school community and lends a helping hand here and there. A Philip Randolph is a school that provides a vast amount of opportunity from college readiness to academic support by tutoring by peers or teachers.', 'There is a series of collge level courses available to gain college credit. The majority of the teachers are committed and great at their job. However, there is not many clubs.', 'The school offers a wide range of sports activities and programs all year round. The academics are increasingly becoming much more rigorous. The school also has a solid foundation on post secondary success with the creation of an entire office for college preparation.', "It's a big school with a lot of people in it. If you don't mind walking up 7 flights of stairs then you will be fine.", 'Throughout my years at this high school, I did not really like the way my school was formed. There were too many people in the halls,  there was only one bathroom for the girls and the boys bathroom is open on every floor.', 'I believe that if you do not follow the crowd, try to fit in or force yourself into certain groups you will do fine. Put yourself and your education first, use the resources in that school. There are plenty just look around.', 'Joining the College and Career Preparatory Institute  with Mr. Thompson was the best thing that I could have done. This program prepares you for the SATs, self- confidence in preforming on stage and in life, interview and resume skills, the college search process and college visits. He teaches inner-city high school students about liberal arts colleges, scholarships and just an overall idea as to what to expect during the transition from a public high school to a university or private college.', 'As a rising sophomore I can finally say I am satisfied of my freshman year at Randolph because gained support from everyone then I expected which is a good thing and so I’m looking forward to be a source of help to others as well.  Randolph Is a great school full of opportunities for all.', 'A Philip Randolph is a very diverse school. A lot of kids from many different diversity attend this school. We have very good guidance counselor and they help us no matter. They will tell us what we need to do to be on track to graduate on time. We have a alot clubs that students join. The teachers want to see us students succeed in life.', 'It’s a very diverse school in clubs and sports many good teachers nice college ready classes and has a variety of programs', 'My experience at A Philip Randolph throughout my whole high school year was amazing. There was a lot of clubs that I was able to participate in. The staff is amazing and the school has everything for the students to be successful.', 'This is school is less than average. The students are not very diverse, the facilities are in need of an upgrade, and the education is just barely high school level in my grade. The culture of the school is toxic, and at times it is less than safe . However, most of the teachers genuinely care about the well being of their students, both academically and in general. There are many programs available to prepare and inform students about and for college. There are also a wide range of clubs to join, and I have made great number of friends from doing so myself.', 'My Experience at A. Phillip Randolph Has been great for the most parents very welcoming from most students and staff, Has lots of things to do to keep you occupied. Staff helps and actually wants to help you succeed. But there are some necessities that are missing and the students that are not welcoming and helpful can definitely be a problem', "My experience going to this school was memorble and I will not forget what I experienced there. My first day started with my best friend and I at the time and I remember walking up all of these steps that resided in front of the school, we both looked at it as if we couldn't handle it, but, we did it anyway. There was going to be 4 years of that we said to ourselves that we mind as well start getting used to it now. That was our first impression of the school. From my first day at the school, well into my last time was a great experience. My teachers were passionate, loving, and caring individuals. I had great prosocial relationships with all of my friends. School saftey personell were pretty awesome too.", "This school is a great choice! It's full of extracurricular activities and helps us get ready for the future. In this school, many of the teachers care about you. For example, my Chemistry teacher, Ms. Zapana, always paid attention to us by helping us during or even after school on the subject! This school will help us be the kids of the future!", "I experence I would say it normal,like any other high school.It petty good it has a few ruff patches but what school doesn't.", 'My school has shown me how many people can come into one academic environment and form a great bond no matter the race , gender choice , or ethnicity. It have also shown me how to make the best of any situation. While attending this school I was evicted out of my home,I began living with my grandmother and everyday I attended school the energy was just positive and it held me up through the tuffest time in my life.The community can have a negative impact but the teachers and students helped me too the ended and helped me better myself as a person', 'A. Philip Randolph Campus High School is a great choice to make if you are pursing anything medical related. There is a plethora of must-take opportunities for the medical academy that makes Randolph shines. If they were to show some light towards the humanities and engineering academies, that would push Randolph even further.']

There is a plethora of must-take opportunities for the medical academy that makes Randolph shines. If they were to show some light towards the humanities and engineering academies, that would push Randolph even further.']
column6: ["The school was excellent in the teacher's departments but I believed it needed to upgrade their conduct policies for student.", 'My experience at A. Philip Randolph Campus so far has been a very eye opening and unique experience. Although it is a fairly big school, many teachers and other staff find it necessary to engage in one on one relationships with students to ensure that all needs are taken care of, which I admire greatly. I have met a variety of representatives from different institutions while attending Randolph as well as given multiple opportunities to broaden my options beyond high school. Networking has been a major encouragement in my school.', 'Great school , great teachers , will make you feel at home . Will really help you develop. Came into A Phillip Randolph campus as a lonely kid scared of what the world was going to bring me . However , the faculties always make me feel safe and always are ready to listen to whatever I have to say which really boosted my confident and self esteem', "It's a great school and faculty members will try to help you to achieve your goals. Very diverse school. The school offers lots of future related knowledge.", "If you stay motivated and focus on what you need to get done, you'll do very well. There are a lot of opportunities that are offered to you.", 'My experience was good. The teachers that i had, tried their best to help me and other students. After spending four years there, the school and teachers became like family to me. One thing i would like to see change is the management of the students. I would like to see an increase in security.', "It's a decent school, for people who don't wait for things to come to them. To be successful at a school of this size, you have to be a go getter. You have to be motivated and surround yourself with like minded people rather than negative influencers. The school exposes students to many programs, students leaving this school often have a lot of extracurriculars.", 'The teachers care for the students and the sport teams are like family. I attended all AP classes when I attended and my experience was great.', 'I love how the school is so involved when its time to search for colleges. The programs here help you from the start of your freshman year to senior year decide what is it that you want to pursue and do.', "The teachers care about getting the students to graduate. Although most students don't behave, if you are focused on you and paying attention to your education you, should be just fine.", "This school is a good school. Everything needed is offered, so passing classes shouldn't be a problem if you attend all your classes. Personally, I liked that I had the opportunity to take AP classes, this provided an extra challenge and really tested your knowledge on the subject.", 'The after school program was great. CCPI was a great way to get the students involved in after school activities.', 'School offered a lot. Staff and and facilities are pretty good and very helpful. Only thing Idont like about the school are some of the type of people that attend Randolph some act like they have no home training but they just need guidance and Randolph helps them .', "The teachers are very friendly and very encouraging. I always feel as if they want me too pass my classes, not only as their job but also because it really does feel like they want too see me succeed. I can't say the same for the students. They tend to be very lazy and rude.", "My experience at A Phillip Randolph was not the best,I mean the activities were amazing,but the teaching methods sucked. Every day I smelled weed in the halls,constant fights. It just was a horrible experience for me. I wanted to feel safe,but I didn't", "It's a very good school with a lot of choices. There's a lot of program like gateway,AP classes and National Honor Society", "A school with diligent and ardent teachers. They are eager to teach and many love to brighten student's day with a warm smile. Although the students are not necessarily the best student ; however , I can say for sure that the teachers gave me one of the best high school experience I can ask for.", 'Overall I had a great experience attending this school for the past three years. If I had to do it again I would go back because I made friends and really liked most of my teachers. We had lots of fun expecially for senior year because we got to on senior trip and lots of fun activities and prim which was overall a good time. One the reason I deceided to attend this school because it is vey diverse. It has a lot of different ethnic students so you get to interact with differ t people and learn from othe people.', 'The teachers at A.Philip Randolph School are very friendly and intelligible. They care about the the student well being. For an example when I wand feeling well in class the teacher allowed me to go to nurse and make up the class work when I felt better. The teachers are also want to see their student succed in their school work. If you fail a test he teacher allows you to retake the test and choice the higher score.Overall I am very comfortable with my past high school teachers.', "You'll never talk about sex unless you are talking to your friends about it."]

column2: ['I liked the diversity and the student to faculty ratio. Teachers staff are able to connect and understand their students due to a small school size.', 'I just graduated this year, and know I will miss this school sooo much. Teachers give advices, helps students adopt to activities, subject, etc with a smile on their faces. Also the administration office is in a very good touch with parents of students in order to keep them on track for everything. Technology is used in mostly everything. Parents and students can view Report cards online as well as they are emailed to their homes. If you would like to place your child in a safe school that would feel like a family, choose Khalil Gibran!!!!!!!', 'The teachers are incredible. It is a safe environment for anyone of any Race, sexuality and religion.', "Khalil Gibran International Academy is a very diverse and divergent division. I have to say my parents made a good choice choosing this school for me. I am learning so much about myself; I don't think i would have experienced anywhere else. Academic and College Ready wise, staff members and students are always there to help each other out. My many school offers so many resources, which encourage me more to be apart of  the department. Students don't realize how much they have nowadays. All they have to do is try.", "This school is moderate. I love the academics and how teachers instruct the students. My grades are excellent, however we have do have a lot of homework. I am in the International Baccalaureate Programme, it is a 2 year Diploma Program. I'm doing very well so far.  However, there's not much activity or extracurricular activities, I would like more of that and add clubs to my school. ", 'The academic is great, the school offers alot!', 'The extracurricular opportunities are non-profit organization which I plan on being apart of next school year. The level of commitment for different clubs is a 1. After school activities: N/A', "Well, my overall experience is okay. I love all my academic and social classes. What makes this school unique is that it's the only school that as 85% population of Arabic students. It's really rare in New York City, so it's pretty interesting. If I could do it all, I wouldn't choose my school again. The reason is that the school environment doesn't necessarily fit me as a person. I feel as if I would belong in a more artistic school than ever.", 'The teachers in my school have shown the greatest amount of initiative by far. They stay after school & guide you through everything you need and more. I am appreciative, thanks to my Chemistry teacher I passed the regents.', 'Non IB  students have an easier work load than IB students. Lots of IB student feel stressed.', 'I feel safe at this school. Very small so not many bad things happened.', 'all of the tachers genuinleuty care about their students and try there best the make work understandable.', 'Not many class options, but great teachers!', 'I always feel safe in my school.', 'Not many options, but great!', 'Teachers were great. There were not many clubs.', "Always had support and feel as though I'm cared for."]

["Newark Collegiate Academy is a school I would recommend for students attending 9th because of how they care for there students. I'm currently a senior and my time at the school has been nothing but amazing. I've adapted to being independent but at the same time having some dependency. They've have helped me in many ways that no other school would have. I speak highly not because I attend the school but because of the many opportunities I received just by going to the school.", 'Team Academy offers many experiences throughout the years. A school network that ranges from Kindergarten to 12th grade, Team fosters the ability of students their entire life. It also offers after high school support for college students as well as vocations.', "I went to the high school, Newark Collegiate Academy. I love and miss the school. There seemed to be teachers and leaders that actually cared for the students and their education. There were amazing benefits for students who did well and I think the school offered great opportunities that most public schools didn't. However, the rules were way too strict. Students were almost never allowed to do anything and the uniform rules were outrageous. I think once they refine their rules, their school system would be great.", 'The relationships between the student and staff were great. The school stays in contact with students even after they graduate.', 'Team Academy Charter Schools have multiple facilities. The high school, Newark Collegiate Academy, provides a lot of support for its students. The KIPP network provides councilors who help seniors get to and through colleges. I would recommend anyone to attend here.', 'At TEAM Academy, I liked the fact that you had advisors to help you plan out your grades for the month. The only thing I disliked about my experience there is that having to not work with my friends so I can focus.', 'I enjoy how much the teachers build a connection with the students and how much effort and time they dedicate all year long.', 'They help through colleges. They focus on the Act a lot. The 9 and 10 grades are asked to take the practice test to help us with the ACT. I enjoy this school a lot. It keeps me focused and helped me maintain a 4.0.', "I like that the teachers care greatly about your academic readiness,and they help you prepare for the outside world.TEAM Academy helps you learn street smarts,and school smarts,rather than just academics,because in life,you will come across other challenges,and most schools,don't teach you these things.", 'The work load is fair, its not to much just the right amount for students to handle.', 'Cameras and security everywhere in the school.', 'There are many different clubs that students can be apart of from all of there years at NCA', 'It was the best high school experince, mainly my senior year because i went to France with the french class', 'Teaching styles are getting better, the teachers are making the lessons more fun which makes the students like myself engage in class at all times', 'My school is a school that make sure that all students are safe.', "There are a lot of different clubs and activities here at my school but many students are shy to be apart of it. Students aren't really pushed to do the different clubs and activities here.", 'This school has set me up to be successful in the future. This school has allowed be to me without  judging me. The school ensure safety.', 'The teachers here go above and beyond. They make sure all students are set up to be successful in the future.', 'Overall my experience at Newark Collegiate Academy was okay. Like I said, there are some things I wish they did differently, but this is a good school to prepare you for college. Not only preparing you for college, but helping you go to college. They are also good at making sure you start and finish college and start a career in what you are passionate about.', 'Team Academy is a KIPP Charter School that push its students to their full potential. The teachers within the school do not tolerate disrespect nor dishonesty. They are on top of the littlest things that one might find childish, but in reality the school is set up to correct bad habits. The work load at Team Academy is a lot as well and you are in school for 9 hours, so majority of your time is spent doing work.']
