The work load at Team Academy is a lot as well and you are in school for 9 hours, so majority of your time is spent doing work.']
column6: ['Team Academy was a new great experience for me.', 'Ive never noticed anything extreme like some of the options. I generally felt pretty safe', "There weren't many options to choose from and a lot of the time the food looked weird", 'I loved it and I still love it. The whole vibe of it being a family is what kept me going back.', 'The school treats everyone the same and it is very organized. All of the faculty are like family and they treat us all as their kids it seems all they want to do is watch us succeed.', 'They are always willing to help and it almost feels like they dedicate their lives to you. Even after you graduate they make sure you are okay whether it academics related or personal', 'There 8is always something to do. There is a club or activity for every kind of person.', "We don't have that many facilities so its hard to judge. But there are always many opportunities for things to do. You are even allowed to make your own clubs and things of that sort.", 'I was prepared for the work load but not necessarily the freedom', "I can honestly say that teachers and other staff members are on it when it comes to discipline for students. Students can pretty much get disciplined for just about anything. The bench was a form of discipline when students didn't follow the classroom and school wide rules. The bench is when a student misbehaves and is isolated from the rest of the student population. Students can be on the bench from 1 day to many many days depending on their circumstance. During this time student would wear a yellow jersey that would stand out to let other students know that they are in trouble and cant be spoken to. During lunch there is a designated table for people on the bench and not only that for the duration of the bench time students have to attend detention every day after school for up to an hour. Students also owe a letter to the detention teacher if they still misbehaved during the day while they were on the bench. Now the number of letter depended on what the student did and how often they did it. Regardless if the student misbehaved or not they still owe a letter at the end of the detention. The letter was to ones self explaining what they did and why, apologizing, and assuring that it wont happen again. To top things off a person cannot get off the bench unless all of their letters are handed in. I've seen many students be benched and get into trouble during their time. Despite that one good day that would determine whether or not the student getting off of the bench it wouldn't matter because their letter isn't handed in. I've seen students benched months at a time because they just didn't know how to act. I've seen students have to write a total of 50 letters just for them to be released from the bench, and even then they still were continuously benched because they just didn't know how to act. Overall discipline is present and the school is the best at making sure students are accountable for their actions.", 'Teachers at TEAM always went above and beyond for their students. Being that they had such high expectations they made sure that every lesson taught whether students liked them or not, would help them be successful in the long run. Even on days that they were tired, teachers made themselves available for students whenever help was needed. In the end I appreciate all of my teachers for sticking with me to the end, encouraging me to keep moving when I felt like I was going to give up, and just being an extra ear when I needed someone to talk to.', "Overall, my experience at TEAM Academy was okay. I enjoyed my days there majority of the time. Some days not so much due to lunch, or the constant misbehavior in my fellow peers. What makes this school unique is that it is very different from other schools, and the school that I had previously went to (New Horizons Community Charter School). All the teachers have such high expectations for students, and expect so much from us. We were given, and were able to experience many opportunities, that for I myself can say I never knew who would experience. I wouldn't choose this school again if I could do it over because I did everything I had to do when I was there. I know many of my peers who were with me, would most likely do it over again because they messed up and really didn't take advantage of the given opportunities. But I, took advantage of every opportunity given to me, and enjoyed every experience that I had.", 'There is a mix of food options. Both cold and hot lunches are provided for students. The cafeteria is a decent size and it allows students to eat lunch comfortably. There are healthy food and snack options majority of the time. The menu is pretty much the same. There may be certain weeks or maybe even a handful of days where the menu may change, but for the most part students know what to expect for lunch.', 'No one at this school take part in drugs or alcohol. Students and staff feel fairly safe in the area of the school, and the school itself is very secure.', 'At this school they only offered the minimum sports, unlike other school there are only a few, and facilities were shared because this school didnt have their own.', 'For the most part, a good amount of people participated in after school activities. The activities were made to have fun and keep yourself occupied, however the activties built a foundation for family and friends.', "didn't have many activities for students", "Everyone here is free to be themselves, there's no ethnic/racial/ sexual bigotry. There is some peer pressure but its up to you to abstain from it.", "I've had a great 4 years at this school. I struggled some in my freshman year trying to adjust to the independence but i caught on and took advantage of every opportunity my school had to offer.", 'The teachers at my school are well versed in their respective subjects.Some teach as if in a college lecture hall but they are not boring. Others are more hands one interacting with each and every student. The grading for most classes is consistent across the board. And they all show a deep interest for their students.']

column1: Roosevelt High School Early College Studies
column2: ["Now being a senior here at Roosevelt there are pros and cons. I feel like I love how im able to get free college credits but I don't like about the four lateness rule.", 'I would like to see a better staff and faculty at Roosevelt and more diverse classes and more options for electives and more activities and better budgeting of money', 'This school helped me to learn about myself, while helping me to succeed in my education. The student body is diverse, and the teachers only want you to thrive.', 'This school is great. As a senior, I do wish there were more classes to be a part of. The teachers are extremely helpful and everyone in the school only wishes for your success. The staff is very loving and the clubs there are a good way to meet really great people.', 'I like the fact that we can earn college credits while still in high school. I like the fact that we are being prepared for High school and the real world/ work force while in high school because it’s a necessity to know these characteristics in life.', 'Roosevelt High School Early College Studies has many opportunities for their students. They push their students to strive for better and prepare them for life after high school. Roosevelt allows the students to obtain college credits with certain classes. the learning environment in Roosevelt is very positive and allows their students not only to have freedom to choose their own paths but also to push themselves to want better. The students in Roosevelt are very nice and welcoming to one another no matter the background or image portrayed. There is not a single student that is the same and Roosevelt gives their students a chance to be who they want to be. I have had one of the best experiences attending Roosevelt and I have made memories that I will never forget.', 'Roosevelt had been listed as top worst schools but that was so wrong . Rhs is actually really amazing , we came a longgg way ; attendance and graduating rate increased a lot . A lot of sophomores already have the 5 regents they need to graduate . Roosevelt is one of the best schools in Yonkers and many can agree.', 'The best thing that I got out of Roosevelt was college readiness. My college adviser not only helped me but pushed me to apply for that scholarship, that college, that internship. Without her, I know that me, and hundreds of other High Schoolers would have never made their way to college.', 'As a fourth-year student at Roosevelt High School, I could say many great things about my experience here. Since my freshman year, all teachers and staff will assist you with anything you may be having trouble with. They take pride in making sure every student has equal opportunity in being successful and follow a strict precedent of doing so. The learning environment at Roosevelt is great because of all the diverse teaching styles to fit each student. Roosevelt High School staff knows that every student is different and teaches them accordingly. Their advanced placement and college level courses do a great job at preparing me and peers for the next level. Overall, Roosevelt High School has given me an amazing experience due to its family-friendliness, school culture and community involvement and I am more than happy to say this is my school.', 'Teachers are super caring and are usually flexible. Every graduating class of Roosevelt becomes a family.', 'People say Roosevelt high school was bad, but when I attend this school it was on of the best decision I made. Teachers are willing to help you succeed. Because of this high school I was able to get into my dream College. Best High School in Yonkers.', 'Great school :) so many credits and for free 😌 I’m getting so much out of this school and the teachers are great and the environment is wonderful. Lunch sucks here but that’s just New York public schools in general', 'Very helpful resources, great for college readiness and for saving lots of money. I am now a junior at roosevelt and so far I am loving the experience. There are lots of school activities. I also love doing the community service they offer at roosevelt.', "The teachers are friendly and attentive to students learning. You have to meet them half way with effort or the won't help you. You have to take the responsibility for your learning, no one will be there to hold your hand.", 'This school is great when it comes to college readiness and allows students to earn college credits for free.', 'Roosevelt high school has become a great school. The staff and students there are excellent! The learning there is great, Roosevelt is a great choice to put as a school you have many opportunities to gain college credits and learn everything for free! You would love it !', 'Roosevelt has a been a great experience. I was ahead by taking advanced classes and making one year doubled( Global 9 and 10 and english 9 and 10  in one year). Roosevelt provided collge classes that gave actual college credits if you receive a 75 on that class or higher.', 'I really like this website it allows people to sign up for scholorships and help for someones future. I like websites like this because it can help me when i go to college and it can help others too ', 'Roosevelt High School Early College Studies provides u so many good opportunities in life, teachers are very supportive and u get to earn college credits in school for free', "As soon as I walked in this school my freshman year, I saw it's potential. There was still a lot of things that needed fixing, that needed this school out of the receivership status. Four years later I see this school has improved, so much. It's currently in good standing, and we are progressing so quickly, it's all amazing! There's still much to be done."]

My college adviser not only helped me but pushed me to apply for that scholarship, that college, that internship. Without her, I know that me, and hundreds of other High Schoolers would have never made their way to college.', 'As a fourth-year student at Roosevelt High School, I could say many great things about my experience here. Since my freshman year, all teachers and staff will assist you with anything you may be having trouble with. They take pride in making sure every student has equal opportunity in being successful and follow a strict precedent of doing so. The learning environment at Roosevelt is great because of all the diverse teaching styles to fit each student. Roosevelt High School staff knows that every student is different and teaches them accordingly. Their advanced placement and college level courses do a great job at preparing me and peers for the next level. Overall, Roosevelt High School has given me an amazing experience due to its family-friendliness, school culture and community involvement and I am more than happy to say this is my school.', 'Teachers are super caring and are usually flexible. Every graduating class of Roosevelt becomes a family.', 'People say Roosevelt high school was bad, but when I attend this school it was on of the best decision I made. Teachers are willing to help you succeed. Because of this high school I was able to get into my dream College. Best High School in Yonkers.', 'Great school :) so many credits and for free 😌 I’m getting so much out of this school and the teachers are great and the environment is wonderful. Lunch sucks here but that’s just New York public schools in general', 'Very helpful resources, great for college readiness and for saving lots of money. I am now a junior at roosevelt and so far I am loving the experience. There are lots of school activities. I also love doing the community service they offer at roosevelt.', "The teachers are friendly and attentive to students learning. You have to meet them half way with effort or the won't help you. You have to take the responsibility for your learning, no one will be there to hold your hand.", 'This school is great when it comes to college readiness and allows students to earn college credits for free.', 'Roosevelt high school has become a great school. The staff and students there are excellent! The learning there is great, Roosevelt is a great choice to put as a school you have many opportunities to gain college credits and learn everything for free! You would love it !', 'Roosevelt has a been a great experience. I was ahead by taking advanced classes and making one year doubled( Global 9 and 10 and english 9 and 10  in one year). Roosevelt provided collge classes that gave actual college credits if you receive a 75 on that class or higher.', 'I really like this website it allows people to sign up for scholorships and help for someones future. I like websites like this because it can help me when i go to college and it can help others too ', 'Roosevelt High School Early College Studies provides u so many good opportunities in life, teachers are very supportive and u get to earn college credits in school for free', "As soon as I walked in this school my freshman year, I saw it's potential. There was still a lot of things that needed fixing, that needed this school out of the receivership status. Four years later I see this school has improved, so much. It's currently in good standing, and we are progressing so quickly, it's all amazing! There's still much to be done."]
column6: ["The extra curricular activities are great. Most students who have acceptable grades can join them. Whichever kids are on teams they have to maintain certain grades to play. The teachers put forth a lot of effort staying after school with the students everyday for various activities. Recently Roosevelt joined a program called junior achievement where students get to go to a different school as teachers, to teach younger children. This is a learning experience for a Roosevelt student it teaches them what teachers face on the daily. We also have a multi cultural club, Japanese club, year book club, choir,acting,gateway, which offered different types of clubs after school. It's fun for students to join these clubs because they feel accepted and similar and feel like they have someone they can relate to at the end of the day.", "The school has improved a lot since I've came here in September 2012. I would love to redo my 4 years of highschool over if I could. I would've done so much better and wouldn't of fooled around too much in my freshman year. My overall experience was good. I enjoyed most classes that I had. I learned things I'll defiantly need in the future. Roosevelt has taught me to always move forward and to never look back and to always move forward. Roosevelt us unique because it's not like any other high school. They have different ways of getting stuff done, and many different activities for people to join, be apart of and be comfortable with. I loved my experience here and I'm happy this was my high school by choice.", "Throughout my highschool life I've had only a handful of good knowledgable teachers who could actually teach me something. The math department in Roosevelt highschool is very weak and needs to be fixed. I'm happy I can write a review and finally have a voice in this issue. The teachers who actually care for you and your education are constantly pushing you to do your best, and always give hard and big amounts of work to get you prepared for college. They teach at a good pace and make sure that the whole class is caught up and understands the lessons. But not every teacher in that building is like this. Just a couple are, from what I've experienced.", "Things could be better, the school rarely has any fun events going on to keep students interested in school. The kids get bored on a bell to bell schedule everyday. There hasn't been any talent shows, concerts or any other chances for kids to have fun & come together as a school.", 'Not much available, but they are fun.', 'I believe the school is really safe.', 'Roosevelt High school has various extracurricular activities such dance, video game clubs, math clubs, orchestra clubs and more. Many students have come up with the idea of these clubs on their own. Roosevelt gives their students the opportunity to express their ideas and expose them to the entire student body.', "I've had an life changing experience at Roosevelt High school. My teachers and the schools programs have shaped me out to be the responsible, organized, and intelligent young woman that I am today. I'm become very experienced for a high school student in my major of interest, which is Criminal Justice. My school has given me the opportunity to take college courses within my major of interest and, have exposed me to the college campus life. I've also collected a lot of community service and was able to not only give back to my school but to the community, my community of Yonkers. I've learned so much in such little time it seems and I'm excited to go to college and be able to come back to my community and continue to help give back to my school and community.", 'In  Roosevelt High School we are able to take College level classes. We also get to take 9th and 10th grade courses in the 9th grade. Allowing students that take advantage of it(like me) graduate early.', 'My overall experience at the Roosevelt high school is such an opportunity and privileged so far. My favorite experience was getting use to the educational system. Such as passing my regents, SAT and ACT. Something so special about my school is that the motivation for students to pass ever grade and national exam is so high. The teachers give you all the attention and assistance, the school provide college link classes, provide special needs to the disability and give more than enough information. I will deffinately choose Roosevelt high school again if I could do it all over.', 'The discipline in this school, from what i heard is on point. The students are very mature in the school because of it.', 'This school is amazing. If i could do it all over again i would', 'The lunch food is okay. I dont eat the lunch in the school', 'The teachers work really hard to help those who are struggling. They focus on the main issues instead of going on to something less important.', "The clubs and organizations aim to help the non social kids become socially open. It's really fun. Everyone's friendly.", 'This School Is One Of the Good Schools In Yonkers. It Provides College Education Giving The Students From The Start Of Freshman Year To Senior Year A Feel Of That College Life. It Gives College Credits. Its pretty good. I like it', "Overall, I really enjoyed my four years of high school. I was heavily involved, I received good grades, I built great long- lasting bonds, and many long-term friendships. Every school has their ups and downs but I wouldn't change where I went for anything.", "The food was alright. Chicken nuggets were my favorite and I can't really remember what I disliked. I did enjoy the snacks that were available for purchase though.", "A lot of students came out to support games so I would say that the school spirit was pretty good. Some sports received more love than others but I think that's pretty normal for high schools.", 'Overall, I had a great relationship with most, if not all of the teachers I had in high school. They had good teaching styles and I had a few favorites during my time.']

column2: ['I like that Arthur L Johnson High School is an amazing community consisted of amazing teachers, faculty and staff.  Arthur L Johnson always takes in consideration the students needs to make us have the best high school experience.', 'Arthur L. Johnson is a place that feels like home.  Everyday I would wake up and be excited to go see all my teachers. It’s like a family.', 'Arthur L Johnson is a very small school, there are about 730 kids total. The Highschool is from grades 9-12. Because the school is tiny there is a lot of drama, but the best thing about Arthur L Johnson is when support is needed everyone is there to help. The teachers are kind and there is always one teacher you can reach out to for help. Our school needs more work to unite but our vice principal is working to make the school a better place. The academics are average. We have many of AP classes and we have three languages, with one of the best ASL classes in Union County. The diversity in Arthur L Johnson is horrible. The school is not diverse at all. Guidance Counselors do not prepare the students for college well. The Students have to find their own scholarships and they must do all college stuff on their own. There are many of clubs that the students can join. There is a club for everyone. All the clubs are inclusive. The school overall is not terrible, but work could be done.', "This high school has prepared me much for college and focus on improving the students education. They work with the student's and give challenging work. It can be difficult to earn a higher grade or GPA.  More diversity could be present though.", 'I feel that my experience at Arthur L. Johnson has been exceptional so far. Although it is a small environment, it is full of friendly students and staff that are eager to help each other grow. Being surrounded by individuals with different personalities, talents, and desires has inspired me to work harder in not only my academics but in other activities too. Something that I feel should change is the heating and cooling arrangements in the school. Some classrooms may be air-conditioned, while others are brutally hot. This heat distracts the students and makes it difficult for them to pay attention to the teachers. Overall, Arthur L. Johnson is a place where life long friends and memories are made and the school will forever hold a special place in my heart.', 'The teachers really care about the students and want to see them succeed. Sports are good but there is a lot of fundraising as only a select few are paid for.', 'ALJ was an okay school, but they lacked diversity and any college prep for such a wealthy community.', "It is just like any other high school. It can be cliquey at times but once the kids become juniors or seniors everyone starts to get along really well. There are some teachers that shouldn't be working there but it is all about who they know. Clubs and activities are fun and students tend to become very involved in them.", "I like that it is a small town but I would like to see better electives for kids who aren't on the college track.", 'What I liked about Arthur L. Johnson High School was that it was a very close town and everybody knew everybody. This meant that you did not struggle to make friends and it created a good environment. Something I disliked about Arthur L. Johnson High School was that there seemed to be a lot of wasted space and money at the school. For example, they had three to four computer rooms that not many teachers used in the first place. The reason teacher did not use these rooms was because the computers in them were outdated. Then the administration brought computer carts so teachers did not need to use the computer rooms but they kept the old computers in the computer rooms and left that space untouched. As a student it seemed to be a waste of resources and space.', 'The teachers are fabulous, and easy to bond with. They really care about you, and do whatever they can to help you personally and academically.', "I have had an incredible experience at Arthur L. Johnson. The teachers and staff are extremely welcoming and truly seem like they want to make a difference in the student's academic achievement. The classes I have taken were challenging but extremely rewarding since I learned a lot from them and it has prepared me for college. There are a wide variety of classes, sports, clubs, and activities that a student can become involved in that personally benefit their knowledge and developing skills that can be used outside of school. There are endless opportunities that the students can take to better themselves and ready themselves for college at Arthur L. Johnson. The school has a positive learning environment that I have benefited immensely from.", 'It is a good school, and the teachers are very nice. I have had a few teachers who go above and beyond to make sure that I have all the information needed to get great grades in school and set up my future for college.', 'There were many positive aspects about my high school.  My high school was a great size, 800 or so. This allowed teachers to know the students and students to know each other. It also allowed for a smaller teacher to student ratio which in turn led to more understanding of the course material.On the down side, our school did not have diversity. I would have liked to meet more students/friends from diverse backgrounds. It did not allow for real life diverse interactions.', 'I had a poor experience with Arthur L. Johnson for many reasons. However, I didn’t put one star because I at least made friends, even in strange places. I was a good kid with good values and I tried my best to stay out of trouble. But I realized that it was no way to live, to fade into the background. I came out a year ago to a lot of hate and backlash. And there was zero support for me or my friends. My friends would get pushed around, go to guidance, and hit a wall there. And so overall, I was happy to leave. I’d never go back.', 'Arthur L. Johnson is am excellent school to ready you for post-secondary education. They push you to challenge yourself so that you are ready to apply to any college you wish to!', 'I liked the classes that we were able to take that helped us better decide what we wanted to do when we graduated.  However, I think the guidance department could do a better job with helping students make sure they are on task and on time with their graduation requirements in order to move on and go to college and become successful.', 'There is a class for everyone. No one is left behind.  The school is welcoming to all students.  It is a positive learning environment.', 'I love how many friends I made. I made some of my closest friends in this school. I learned life skills and some college lessons. Some things that I can change is that there are more bathrooms. Some days it takes like 10 minutes on line just to go to the bathroom and then it gets really crowded.', "Our high school is 100% good education wise but everybody has their problems during the years. As a African American girl people start with the racist jokes and the name calling. I don't let it bother me though. Honestly I take it as a joke myself. But the main problem is they keep switching principals and they laid off some of my favorite teachers. The principal we have right now is really strict about everything, like as a senior I feel like we should have more freedom and more privileges."]

column6: ['Arthur L. Johnson is a great school, everyone there is kind and always encouraging others. The teachers are always willing to give students extra help. But the only thing the school should change is increasing the amount of electives to choose from.', "I'm telling you this school is garbage don't come here this school is filled with drug addicts no extra courses too many young teacher have have terrible teaching skills and diveristy is a joke there's like 10 Hispanic and 3 black kids in the whole grade. Not enough interesting electives to take after sophomore year unless you want to take stupid puppetry and art the rest of your years here. I'm begging my mom to move me to scotch plains to continue my education in engineering and technology", "Good supportive teachers, although one on one office hours are hard to obtain. Some teachers rush subjects and teach what they feel neccisarry just to pass a student. Clubs are not very active and athletics are decent with dedicated coaches. The guidance staff are very helpful and will develop a relationship with each and every student, they're possibly the best asset to the school. The students display rude behavior and racist attitude toward students of other race, making a school day possibly intimidating. Otherwise a good school dedicated to preparing a student for the future and a good teacher/student ratio.", 'Great place to find friends, great teachers who truly care about you and strive to help you achieve greatness.', 'I enjoyed being a student at Johnson was a good experience. I feel that we had a large option of classes with a lot of great teachers. There are also many different sports options available and clubs as well.', 'My overall experiences at Arthur L. Johnson were good. I will have fond memories to take with me. What I liked most about my school was the various clubs that it offered and being in the music program. I love and will dearly miss my music instructor and her staff that assists in marching band. We became one big, happy family. If I could change anything, it would be my experience in physical education. I feel like the staff could participate a little more rather than bark out orders!!!!', "The school is an overall welcoming environment, and is a safe place to be due to the installment of new security guards.  Diversity is low but that is only due to the school's location.", 'When I came to ALJ a couple years ago, the community welcomed me with open arms and I immediately felt like I belonged here. The students are overall pretty open-minded but like every school, there is always those couple closed-minded individuals as well. Most of the teachers are overall excellent and care about their students. The sports are decent overall, but unfortunately, there is some favoritism with certain teams and people. There is an ample amount of clubs and activities at this school, but I wish there was a little bit more clubs. The school is not exactly diverse either,  but people are accepting of the few minorities here. The school definitely prepares you for college, and they really push that on the students, and sometimes it is a bit too much (especially with certain subjects). Even though there is some flaws with this school, I would definitely come back here again in a heartbeat.', 'It was a great place to learn and grow but there was no cultural diversity so students dont get enough exposure to the different ways people live and think.', 'Arthur L Johnson high school has changed my life for the better. My courses were challenging, but never too difficult and my teachers were always more than willing to help me succeed. I truly felt that my teachers were genuinely concerned about my well-being and wished great success on all their students. The guidance department is extremely knowledgeable and hardworking. Everything I could have possibly needed or wanted from a guidance counselor, I was able to find in mine. My teachers helped me shape my future goals and allowed me the opportunities I needed to make those dreams come true. If I had to do high school over again, I would choose to go back to ALJ without hesitation.', 'They are good.  Everything you want, ALJ has in terms of clubs and extracurricular activities.', "I'm happy with my outcome.  I have the classes I need for college,  ALJ offers everything I need heher or not I use it.", "The teachers are good.  In the mainstream classes, some students are disruptive in class and that prevents the teacher from completing his task.   It's hard for teachers to teach when even only a few students ruin it for everyone.", 'Bullying is not a common occurrence in ALJ, and despite the fact that many students loathe ALJ, they generally feels safe within its walls.', 'The school offers many extracurricular activities that a lot of students fail to take advantage of. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience with the softball and tennis teams, and have countless great memories from participating in both sports.', 'There are a few teachers at ALJ that are very well-qualified, passionate about what they teach, and who teach effectively. However, most of these teachers teach honors/AP classes, so moat of the student body is not exposed to such greatness. Unfortunately, there is a large gap of the quality of teaching between these honors/AP teachers and the "average" level teachers.', 'They do a fantastic job with keeping a healthy and balanced menu everyday to keep everyone happy.', 'I love it so much', 'I love most of the teachers here at ALJ', "Its not the greatest school but it certainly isn't in the bottom"]

Not enough interesting electives to take after sophomore year unless you want to take stupid puppetry and art the rest of your years here. I'm begging my mom to move me to scotch plains to continue my education in engineering and technology", "Good supportive teachers, although one on one office hours are hard to obtain. Some teachers rush subjects and teach what they feel neccisarry just to pass a student. Clubs are not very active and athletics are decent with dedicated coaches. The guidance staff are very helpful and will develop a relationship with each and every student, they're possibly the best asset to the school. The students display rude behavior and racist attitude toward students of other race, making a school day possibly intimidating. Otherwise a good school dedicated to preparing a student for the future and a good teacher/student ratio.", 'Great place to find friends, great teachers who truly care about you and strive to help you achieve greatness.', 'I enjoyed being a student at Johnson was a good experience. I feel that we had a large option of classes with a lot of great teachers. There are also many different sports options available and clubs as well.', 'My overall experiences at Arthur L. Johnson were good. I will have fond memories to take with me. What I liked most about my school was the various clubs that it offered and being in the music program. I love and will dearly miss my music instructor and her staff that assists in marching band. We became one big, happy family. If I could change anything, it would be my experience in physical education. I feel like the staff could participate a little more rather than bark out orders!!!!', "The school is an overall welcoming environment, and is a safe place to be due to the installment of new security guards.  Diversity is low but that is only due to the school's location.", 'When I came to ALJ a couple years ago, the community welcomed me with open arms and I immediately felt like I belonged here. The students are overall pretty open-minded but like every school, there is always those couple closed-minded individuals as well. Most of the teachers are overall excellent and care about their students. The sports are decent overall, but unfortunately, there is some favoritism with certain teams and people. There is an ample amount of clubs and activities at this school, but I wish there was a little bit more clubs. The school is not exactly diverse either,  but people are accepting of the few minorities here. The school definitely prepares you for college, and they really push that on the students, and sometimes it is a bit too much (especially with certain subjects). Even though there is some flaws with this school, I would definitely come back here again in a heartbeat.', 'It was a great place to learn and grow but there was no cultural diversity so students dont get enough exposure to the different ways people live and think.', 'Arthur L Johnson high school has changed my life for the better. My courses were challenging, but never too difficult and my teachers were always more than willing to help me succeed. I truly felt that my teachers were genuinely concerned about my well-being and wished great success on all their students. The guidance department is extremely knowledgeable and hardworking. Everything I could have possibly needed or wanted from a guidance counselor, I was able to find in mine. My teachers helped me shape my future goals and allowed me the opportunities I needed to make those dreams come true. If I had to do high school over again, I would choose to go back to ALJ without hesitation.', 'They are good.  Everything you want, ALJ has in terms of clubs and extracurricular activities.', "I'm happy with my outcome.  I have the classes I need for college,  ALJ offers everything I need heher or not I use it.", "The teachers are good.  In the mainstream classes, some students are disruptive in class and that prevents the teacher from completing his task.   It's hard for teachers to teach when even only a few students ruin it for everyone.", 'Bullying is not a common occurrence in ALJ, and despite the fact that many students loathe ALJ, they generally feels safe within its walls.', 'The school offers many extracurricular activities that a lot of students fail to take advantage of. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience with the softball and tennis teams, and have countless great memories from participating in both sports.', 'There are a few teachers at ALJ that are very well-qualified, passionate about what they teach, and who teach effectively. However, most of these teachers teach honors/AP classes, so moat of the student body is not exposed to such greatness. Unfortunately, there is a large gap of the quality of teaching between these honors/AP teachers and the "average" level teachers.', 'They do a fantastic job with keeping a healthy and balanced menu everyday to keep everyone happy.', 'I love it so much', 'I love most of the teachers here at ALJ', "Its not the greatest school but it certainly isn't in the bottom"]

column2: ['I love everything about this school but most importantly my child loves it! Staff are very friendly and are always available if you have any questions. There is so much support regarding homework help or study groups for kids. There are so many opportunities for kids overall and the principal, Mark is truly outstanding! I would highly recommend this school.', "East Side Community High School is a brilliant school to develop young minds. A largely unique inner urban school experience, the school requires students to learn how to present their ideas and thoughts to adults and peers. Led in the classroom by passionate teachers students can connect and rely on their teachers to help them develop the characteristics of an upstanding citizen and individual; an important aspect of every young persons education.A school located in New York's rich LES, the most notable features of the school that have stuck with me throughout my 6 years of education there have been the teachers and the emphasis on communication within a group while maintaining ones individual personality.", 'I absolutely love East Side! Mark the principal is beyond amazing! Every single teacher, staff member and afterschool staff are outstanding. There’s so much opportunity for kids here. There’s always communication and much parent involvement which is key to a great education.', "I'm happy I came to East Side because this school taught me a lot about equality. Not only, this school also taught me the importance of being positive and expressing yourself on how you feel. Everybody will feel included coming here because it's a small school and everybody cares for you. East Side has been one of the most diverse schools I've been to. The teacher's and staff are extremely caring for their students and students are able to have close bonds with teachers as well. Though teacher to students relationships is good, I wouldn't say this school preps you for college. The school does not offer you a lot of AP classes nor do I think the classes are college leveled. You won't be prepared for college coming here, but you'll definitely feel safe.", 'Attending east side was a good growing experience but I feel as though teachers and staff treat different students with favoritism. Kids there can be catty as well. In terms of education it’s a good school that prepares kids for the next stages in life.', 'The greatest thing about East Side is having access to so many resources whether it be staff or acedemic resources there’s always availability. The college readiness/awareness is also a big focus for the curriculum, knowing what are school’s aspects and where does the student fit amongst that campus when making the decision to apply. The environment is very safe to the point where school security actually know the students and greet them at the door. Another plus at East Side is social awareness on the terms of addressing current events that do have an affect on the majority of students since majority of the students are of color. Knowing that people around you are aware to the struggles you face gives a lot of understanding of what the students needs are. East Side is a fantastic school and an even greater community.', 'The teachers go up and beyond for students. They truly want every student to succeed and approach situations with reasoning and sympathy when it comes to personal life.', "I like that this school owns up to its name: it's a community school. Everyone in my school is familiar with one another and we all feel very comfortable with the staff, administrators and other students. The classes are very engaging and interactive. We learn how to think- we don't simply regurgitate facts to prepare for state exams. The only downside to this school is the building. It's a building shared by my school and a private school. Additionally, I wish this school would offer more traditional programs, such as a football team, cheerleading team or a theatre program.", 'The teachers are very involved and supportive. The teaching style is wonderful and the curriculum is not just focused on testing. Roundtables is a wonderful alternative to state testing and  provides a better display of the students knowledge.', 'East Side is a wonderful high school.It encourages students to think and express their own opinion. Its use of portfolios and end of the semester oral reports to evaluate the students encourages the students to develop their own style of learning.The art gallery is another strong point of the school.I find teachers are well prepared and interested in each student progress.The only area that I see a need for improvement is their foreign languageprogram.', "I like how everything on Niche is organized, easy, and understandable. It's a great website for students to use, especially students like me, who are applying to colleges.", 'I wish there were more', 'The teachers are amazing in the school', 'The teachers at East Side really care about you. The curriculum covers depth over breadth. All the teachers know their subjects well and push you and themselves to question and know more.', 'Tom has always enforced the school to have clubs that students want. He is always around the corner waiting to tell you to join rock climbing or the Possibility Project.', "With advisory, students are faced with health and safety issues. We learn about STDs and mental health and bullying. The faculty enforce this, yet the student body doesn't always necessarily care or listen.", "In my school, there isn't a lot of drama, it's more of a learning environment and everyone strives to do well. Everyone in our school is recognized as intelligent in their own way. No one is looked at as though they are incompetent. There are times when we take learning experiences and apply it to each and every subject. Applying each and every subject to one another allows the mind set of a student to work harder in each subject equally. Where one students weakness could actually become a strength with due time.", "In East Side Community High School, each teacher I=engages in every students grades, thoughts and helps each and every student when the truly need it. The teachers actually care for you and request for students to come to early morning breakfast or afterschool to get extra help. Teachers also open up their lunches for students to get extra help. In the AP English class, our teacher makes us have seminars and open discussions on books while we analyze them with a Psychoanalytical, Marxist, Feminist and bell hooks kind of mindset. The teachers in my school actually make us think and its a great thing that our school curriculum is not based on common core, but it's based on social events and deeper thinking on historical aspects.", "East Side provides a comforting home to all varieties of students. No matter who you are or where you come from, respect and opportunities are the same. You are given many chances to learn and get support outside of school too and is up to the individual to decide whether they're willing to take them or not", 'I love this high school. Without East Side, I would not have had such an successful career. I was helped with everything I needed. I was helped to apply to SEO, Sponsors of Educational Opportunity. They have helped me struggle through challenges and find the better outcomes to situations. Even though we do not have a proper gym, East Side has provided us with a gym outside of the school. They have allowed us to travel for tournaments. For example, the basketball team (including me) has traveled to Canada. East Side is very open and cares for students. When students, like myself, organized a protest in favor of Eric Garner, East Side Staff only encouraged us and never punished us.']

column2: ["Insanely disrespectful staff and administrators, they always talked down not only on the students, but to their parents as well. Insensitive to student's needs, I even witnessed a staff member talk down on a student with fibromyalgia for missing school so often. It's honestly a disgrace.", 'Clifton is a big school, if you are looking to meet new people this is the place and I hope the fighting and drama that occurs at Clifton High School stops', "My experience in Clifton high school was okay for the most part. They have many sport,clubs,programs you can apply to. I applied for 2. They were MCJROTC and  peer tutoring. MCJROTC is a great program I recommend it for people who are shy and are trying to come out of their comfort zone, People who want to  strengthen their character or people who want to  become leaders. MCJROTC has enrolled those trait  in me. But what I didn't like about it was the running. Yes it is healthy and all but its hard, Running for 1 mile is not as easy as it sounds. I get exhausted,my stomach hurts and I feel weak. What I like about Clifton high school is that their is no bullying. Its very strict and orderly. What I would change is the 4 minute rule . You only have 4 minutes to get to class the problem is Clifton High is a big school. and depending on where your classes are and the traffic in the hallway you don't really make it in time all of my friends struggle to make it to class on time.", 'My experience at Clifton High School has been a lot I cannot express it in one word. It was stressful, eventful, emotional, and life-changing. I’ve met a lot of my best friends at CHS, and I’ve made some pretty strong bonds . Yes, I did also lose friendships but that’s what high school is about right? The amount of times I’ve cried about something that happened at CHS are endless but I know it made me the person I am today. High School has made me grow up, especially when you go to a school with 3,000 other kids.  I can’t say CHS has given me everything I’m going to need in the future. There weren’t any classes that  met my intended major, which is upsetting but I worked around it and got to take some classes with some amazing teachers. I’m grateful for this experience even though it wasn’t the easiest. i’m grateful for Clifton High School.', "Clifton high is one of those schools that most parents try to avoid. I'm not sure why. As long as you're dedicated to learning, CHS provides you with the tools and resources you need to succeed. I was put into honors classes because of my commitment to my learning, where I learned a great deal that I carry with me today. Additionally, joining teams, in my case the track team, is so incredibly rewarding and gives you a home away from home. This is a good, safe place to establish relationships and learn not only education-wise, but life-wise.", 'I liked the diversity. Every country in the world was represented by at least one student in the school. I would like the summer conditions to change, building is old and hot.', 'Clifton High School is a very large diverse school. It seems overly populated with crowded hallways and large classes but there are many opportunities to get a hold of.', "This is my first and last year at Clifton High School, and I absolutely ADORE coming to this school. It's extremely diverse and everyone here is welcoming and helpful. The teachers are helpful and excited to teach the materials. However I didn't give 5 stars because of one problem, and that being that the school is overcrowded with students.", 'I was concern about sending my son to Clifton High School, he was in small Blue Ribbon Charter School. However I must say that he adopted pretty well. He is involved in sports, he grades are pretty good., He has received academic achievement last two years.  I feel the school is pretty good, very diverse and they offer students a variety of programs.', "Clifton High School is a great school in my opinion. No school is perfect, but this comes really close. I've been to many schools, and as a senior at this school, it's been my favorite. The teachers are active and energetic, classmates are participating, and the environment is also supportive. If I were to change something, it'd most certainly be the college readiness. This school does indeed give challenging classes and hard courses, but as far as getting me ready for college, I'm not sure. Such as SATs and standardized tests, you are on your own. I would highly recommend this school for your child though. Amazing experience!", 'WOW, this school is wonderful! The teachers & counselors are amazing, they truly help you & care for you!', "So far, it has been amazing, couldn't ask for a better school to go to! The teachers love teaching and they have more clubs than I can count! Also, the diversity is just one of the best things about this school, I walk down the halls seeing various student from different backgrounds, I LOVE IT HERE!", "It's litty in all aspects!! There are teachers at CHS that you wouldn't be able to find any where else. They make you look forward to their class everyday because of how enjoyable and fulfilling it it. Our school diversity is something to behold. Since we are such a large school, the sheer differences in cultures and ethnic backgrounds would be very enlightening to any student who attends CHS. (just to name a few...)", "I've had many ups and downs during my 4 years at Clifton High but I can say that the teachers and my peers have helped me go through the good and the bad. I can always rely on my teachers for assistance and guidance with almost anything. I would love to see a little more involvement in the college applying process though they do help in more ways the one.", "Graduated on 2019, while I was there I saw a lot of fights, although there are some really good teachers many of them just do not care about the course and didn't give the grade the student deserved.", 'I personally liked how it’s a diverse school, no one was ever left out. You felt welcomed, all the teacher and counselors tried to help out as much as possible.', "Absolutely wonderful. I feel welcomed here and the atmosphere is great. My teachers are interactive and help each student reach their full potential. Where else can you find a teacher who lets you throw paper balls at him to represent trench warfare during WWI? The school has led me to meet phenomenal people, from musical prodigies to advanced computer programmers. There's a place for everyone and I'm proud to be a part of this community.", "I loved being a part of the Clifton Mustang Marching Band and being a rank sergeant,  I have the responsibility to make sure that everyone is performing at their best. One thing I'd change would be the handling of student traffic in the hallways.", 'Great high school, faculty cares about our future and try their best to encourage us and support us.', 'The diversity is amazing, don’t get me wrong. Most of the teachers are as well, typically the honors and AP ones. However you do have those teachers who don’t care about what they’re teaching and the administration can be aggravating to work with because they tend to ignore things when you try to question their authority and decisions.']

column6: ['Clifton High School had a diverse environment and many activities for students to be involved in. The school also offered a wide variety of classes, core and creative classes for students to take. Though, I heard students complain about some unfair teachers. Teachers who either did not care about the students or were horrible at teaching or grading a subject.', "It's a small school but every teacher has big hearts! I do not want these 4 years to go by too fast. Seeing these teachers and staff always make my day no matter what class! Everyone gets along very well and there are plenty of extra curricular clubs to get involved with! Our sports teams are dedicated and timely! We win as a team and celebrate as a family! We may be small, but we are all a big family!", 'Clifton High School has changed me for the better as both a person and a student. While the administration and board of education can be stuck in their ways or slightly out of touch at times, there are plenty of teachers who truly care about their students. The students that care about their education and future have many resources that they can utilize. However, it is true that there are many students that organize for power and accomplish great things. Although the state of New Jersey underfunds this wonderful school, the students and parents work diligently to change that.', "Clifton High School is like no other. You see a diverse amount of different faces everyday. We are one of the most diverse high schools in New Jersey and the country. Making friends comes easy here at Clifton High. You can easily fit in a friend group through sports, classes, clubs, and extra curricular activities! For instance, I participate in MCJROTC and I absolutely love it! I have formed a family there and I have an incredible leadership position. It's always something new at CHS and I love creating endless memories with my friends!! Friendships like theirs, I know I will carry with me even after high school.", 'The student body is ery diverse and the teachers are amazing. Teachers at clifton high school help students with their every need and put everything into their jobs.', 'Clifton High School has been a wonderful place. Teachers are very supportive and attentive. School staff are always respectful and professional.', 'They did not offer enough electives. I had wood shop in middle school and fell in love with it, and in high school that was not offered which is very disappointing. I played softball all four years, and the took the one softball field out of the stadium which was extremely disappointing. They favor sports which is unfair. Clifton high school should also offer more after school clubs like an archery club, gamers club etc.', 'Some of the people are cool but others are not. You just have to find the right crowd and the right people to be with. I would advise to just keep to yourself and you’ll get through high school just fine.', 'The diversity in my high school was absolutely incredible. There is a great learning atmosphere and there is a club for just about anything you can think of. The marching band is also a force to be reckoned with.', "I loved the diversity and the history department staff along with a few other teachers who are fully committed to their students and their education.  I do wish to see a less corrupt Board of Education who puts the students' needs before their own benefits and economical purposes.", 'CLIFTON WAS A VERY  STRUCTURAL . THE TEACHERS WERE HELPFUL IN EVERYTHING. TAUGHT ME THAT COLLEGE WILL THE RIGHT CHOICE.', 'High school was way too crowded, granted it was not terrible it was okay  as in the classes were alright and teachers were average.  In my years there, a lot of sex scandals  with teachers-student relationships and rape claims occurred.', "Clifton High School was a memorable place for me. The diversity in this school is something you won't experience at most. I made so many friends and had a huge impact from some of the teachers I was blessed to have. You will meet people with many different tastes in music, food, style, etc. The food is like any other school lunch, not terrible but not amazing. There are plenty of sports to choose from. I was part of the lacrosse and swim team. Many of the different sports always had parents and other family members supporting the high schoolers. Two police officers are assigned to the school and have an office there. Children are welcome to go in to the police officers' office any time. The school is next to the city hall and police station in Clifton. It is also near the Boys and Girls club which is convenient for some families. I had a great time at this school and made imazing memories.", "Throughout all my four years in Clifton High School, my education has been the best I could receive. The teachers are also great and want to help you. I would change the testing situation involving quarterly's. For them to be a separate grade and not a part of your average.", "It was okay. There's a lot of good teachers and some ok teachers. Sucks that you can't go outside ever. I wish they spoke more about college and prepared me more when it comes to things like financial aid and such.", 'Clifton high school is an amazing school for sports and diversity. The teachers try to help you as much as they can but they do not have the materials or teaching abilities to help you learn. Usually the school is a little ghetto so fights and stealing are very common. Nobody but sport stars and the really smart kids do anything after highscool', "I have great friends and a lot of cool teachers. There are some teachers that can be mean and don't give someone a chance. I'd like to see that change.", 'What I love about Clifton High school is its diversity, although not necessarily in race. Yes it is true the student body and faculty is diverse with people from Black to White to Hispanic to Arabic, it is not what is special about Clifton High school. CHS is also diverse in character. Within the student body alone you have the advanced placement student activists who are surely running towards acceptance in the Ivy league schools. You have a few sport jocks extremely proud and popular. Lastly you have the General Ed. students who are ordinary and practical, trying to get through every day alive and well and survive the asphalt jungle that is Northern New Jersey. This diversity in personality is what counts. I believe that in our modern age, we surround ourselves too much with like-minded persons which keeps us detached and elitist. If we allow ourselves to listen with patience to all people we will find out that the world is much more complex than we originally thought.', "Teachers suck, Food there sucked, they don't teach anything useful, over flood us with school work and then complain about how much or how long it takes them to grade all of it as if its my fault. rules are not enforced well enough as they should be", 'Clifton High School was a great experience for me and taught me how to navigate situations and deal with teachers and other students alike. Overall, your experience is what you make out of it, and I had a great experience.']
column8: ['Clifton High School had a diverse environment and many activities for students to be involved in. The school also offered a wide variety of classes, core and creative classes for students to take. Though, I heard students complain about some unfair teachers. Teachers who either did not care about the students or were horrible at teaching or grading a subject.', "It's a small school but every teacher has big hearts! I do not want these 4 years to go by too fast. Seeing these teachers and staff always make my day no matter what class! Everyone gets along very well and there are plenty of extra curricular clubs to get involved with! Our sports teams are dedicated and timely! We win as a team and celebrate as a family! We may be small, but we are all a big family!", 'Clifton High School has changed me for the better as both a person and a student. While the administration and board of education can be stuck in their ways or slightly out of touch at times, there are plenty of teachers who truly care about their students. The students that care about their education and future have many resources that they can utilize. However, it is true that there are many students that organize for power and accomplish great things. Although the state of New Jersey underfunds this wonderful school, the students and parents work diligently to change that.', "Clifton High School is like no other. You see a diverse amount of different faces everyday. We are one of the most diverse high schools in New Jersey and the country. Making friends comes easy here at Clifton High. You can easily fit in a friend group through sports, classes, clubs, and extra curricular activities! For instance, I participate in MCJROTC and I absolutely love it! I have formed a family there and I have an incredible leadership position. It's always something new at CHS and I love creating endless memories with my friends!! Friendships like theirs, I know I will carry with me even after high school.", 'The student body is ery diverse and the teachers are amazing. Teachers at clifton high school help students with their every need and put everything into their jobs.', 'Clifton High School has been a wonderful place. Teachers are very supportive and attentive. I wish they spoke more about college and prepared me more when it comes to things like financial aid and such.", 'Clifton high school is an amazing school for sports and diversity. Overall, your experience is what you make out of it, and I had a great experience.']

column2: ["The students are problematic but the school is very safe and the teachers are supportive. Been here all four years and I've had a pretty good experience. Despite it's downs it's better than majority of the high schools in the Bronx. We share the building with mott haven which sucks but you barely ever see them so its okay.", 'The school is very welcoming towards people of all different backgrounds. The school celebrates diversity with different events that welcome students and parents. This high school challenges you through early college classes and AP classes. This school only requires you to take one regents and take other performance based assessments test.', "I would like the organization of the school in general to change. Schedules at the beginning of the year are always messed up and stay that way till the end of the year. A lot of teachers are lazy and don't put grades up until its too late. I like hat the school has a lot of clubs and opportunities for its students but sometimes the stress can get overwhelming.", 'As a university heights scholar, I was given the necessary resources to aid in my success. I learned both academic and real-world information to guide my future endeavors.', 'One pro that I would like to mention is that the school offers freedom for it\'s students, making the term "the high school that feels like a college", more believable. This pro can also be a con sometimes, giving if the student isn\'t mature enough to handle these college related freedoms regrading academics, and they fail to earn the expected number of credits, then they\'ll be transferred to a credit recovery school. This hardly happens since the teachers here are one of best I\'ve encountered since my first year in middle school. The school setting can make you lazy when it comes to academics, making a simple essay seem like a 12 page report. Besides that, the work load is pretty manageable, and the classes aren\'t hard to pass. If you\'re an athlete I wouldn\'t recommend you to attend this school, the teams aren\'t that good. The school has PBAT\'s instead of regents exams. Overall, this is a good school to go to, just don\'t get your expectations too high.', "My experience is good so far. We have a expanded amount of partnerships which allows the students to have access to applying for jobs and programs. I'd like the teachers to be more helpful and provide help on PBATS.", 'University Heights is realkt just an okay type of school. Walking in as a freshman, you’ll be pulled in multiple directions with having such a wide variety of sports, clubs and programs. The experience starting off is fun but as time goes by and you become a senior the college process just becomes harder and there seems to be no one willing to help.', 'There are a lot of people here that care about you and how you are doing here. If you are vocal about needing help, some one is available to give it to you.', 'The school is good place to grow,  but you must be to put in a lot of work to getvyour desired result.', "What I like about University Heights is the teachers, they are people you are able to talk to and seemed very down to earth. The teachers  and consulars are people who understand that we as teenagers will have problems and they help us figure out what we can do to solve it and how to both be a good student and also solve our own personal problems. The school is safe and there isn't much fighting in the area, all students respect each other and the teachers. It is with that respect we learn through them. As I got older I realize that the teacher we hated or dislike help us grow as an person, because of that I am very grateful for the help they give us. The consulars that talk to us and ask us how we are feeling can help us.", "I'll make this short and sweet. UHeights is a gem of the South Bronx. It isn't the best school nor the worst, but each year my school continually strives to provide more than adequate education. In the Bronx, success for children may seem like a dream for the average minority student, but my school convinced me that I am more than just the color of my skin. At University Heights I was shown that in a sea of predominantly white colleges, I am just as, smart, talented, and skilled to succeed. One of its unique features is the number of programs that we have. I was able to travel abroad in my sophomore year because of the surplus of programs I partook in. Simply put, I old have wanted to spend my high school career anywhere else.", 'Unfortunately, my issues with this school comes from the many restrictions placed on students. Students are not allowed to wear the color red. As well that students are not even allowed to wear the sweater of their choice. They are only allowed to wear University Heights branded sweaters. Some students spend day and night in the school and should have the right to wear comfortable clothing, and express themselves.', "Overall this school is a very good school. We have a lot of activities and great teachers that came from Ivy League institutions giving students help they need. Most teachers care about what students learn and try their best but some don't. But those who do outshine everyone else make a big impact on the students intellectually and personally. They have taught us not only to change the world but to be cool and positive people. The faculty workers at the school are very kind and try their best to make sure students have the best experience. Lacks AP classes but make up for it with a lot of College Readiness classes that can get you almost a whole semester ahead from professors a Bronx Community College and BMCC. The racial diversity here is >90%. The clubs and activities offered in freshmen year change my life for the better. This school may not be the best but offers very unique opportunities for those who are disadvantaged low income public high school students.", 'University Heights , is very academically challenging .It gave me the opportunity to put my best foot forward.The staff are very caring ,they are willing to help with any situation .The high school also offers support through mentors / having other opportunities such as extracurricular activities or sports .They have a wide  selection for student to join after school programs and they certainly keep you busy.I have to say my during my time in University Heights is enjoyable.', 'University Heights High School is one of the best schools in New York and the South Bronx. Though it is a small school, it is very diverse and very accepting and open minded. Bullying is something that is not seen in the school and regardless of race, gender and sexual orientation or religious beliefs you are assured to be accepted and loved. I know this through my own personal experience with the school.', 'I loved my experience at this school mostly because of the atmosphere. It is a very welcoming environment and feels like home. There was always someone I could go to with my issues, academic or personal. However, they could improve their efforts in college readiness (e.g. SAT/ACT prep). The faculty is small, which can be a pro and a con. The pro is that the administration gets to know the student body very well. However, it is often hard to balance the student-to-faculty ratio.', 'The best school I have ever stepped foot in. I am sad I graduated but the time came and we have to leave. Here at school we take high school and college level classes. With college classes we receive college credits. In this school we learned to love, care, respect one another. I will truly miss everyone there.', 'The experience in University Heights is to guide you through success and to treat you as if you were in college. The work you get is high level work and it allows you to adapt to challenging papers or math problems.', 'Even though University Heights High School was not my first choice, I am thankful that I was ultimately placed there. The school community is amazing. Even though we are all competitive by nature, there are few students who are not willing to lend a helpful hand. The classes are very challenging and led by experienced teachers. We have all kinds of AP and College NOW courses, something that has helped me get into the college mindset early. The only thing I can complain about is the clubs and organizations. There are not too many to choose from, and I really, really wish my school focused on the arts a little more.', "I love this school I finished this year, this school gives you a lot of opportunities and it's the best !! Take advantage of everything to the teachers give you it's worth it"]
