column6: ["I'm currently in University Heights, and what I love about this school is that the school helps you get ready and prepared for college and challenges the way you are use to thinking so you can become smarter than you already are.", 'love this school I have never felt so much at home. Reliable in resources and programs to consider being part of. Being able to have college credits coming out of high school is an amazing opportunity I was able to take advantage of. It is my second home and I feel safe and comfortable with the staff, teachers, principal and students there.', "University heights high school was a great place to be at overall. They are really big on getting students ready for college and expanding their horizons. Teachers are dependable and shoulders to lean on. I just wish their was more diversity between the races of students in the school. Teachers automatically assume every kid that comes in is spanish and starts speaking spanish to them which is a little unfair to the student's culture.", 'This school is a great school. It provides students with a variety of extracurricular activities in order to get everyone involved in the school. They offer music club, science club, double-dutch, stunt, rugby, track, basketball, tennis, volleyball and etc. Also it challenges the students academically by offering them the opportunity of earning college credits early by taking college courses for free through their CollegeNow program. The only thing I would like to see change is having a bigger variety of college courses offered.', "The school provides a friendly environment. My relationship with my teachers was very close they treat all of us like family. It's really a home out of home.", "It's a great learning environment. Everyone is like a family who is helping each other out in the betterment of future. We are considered a school that feels like a college. Thus, our schedules and work we get are very critical. However, we have great programs and teachers to provide help for us.", "If you dont care about your education they won't either.", 'The health and safety polices at this school is really good. The school nurse is always available during school hours. Our school have one health program, which is available of all students to join.', "My experience in this school so far is okay. I've met a lot of new people that are interested in the same things that I am. Also, the activities that are provided for the students are really good. One of my favorite experiences so far, was having a field day with the whole school at the end of the year. This school is unique is many different ways. One of the things that makes this school unique is that we only take one regents, which is English, because we're mostly a PBAT school. I would choose this school again if I could do it all over because this school gives students a lot of opportunities, unlike some schools. Also, everyone in this school treats each other kindness.", 'Most of the the teachers and staff are easy to talk to at times. However, teaching styles could improve. When the teachers are teaching a topic in class, they show great interest, which encourages me to learn more about that topic. If I have a problem with something in their class, I feel completely comfortable confronting them about it. Lastly, when it comes to grading, they are fair.', 'It offers a variety of after school programs that are fun and teaches students about Team work', "There are a few extra curriculars like Gentlemen's club and Leadership group but most students generally do not participate. The after school activities are little to non-existent but this is probably due to the schools location and not the school itself.", 'Something that I really liked about my school was the ability to take college level courses. They were a lot more intensive than the regular courses and gave me an idea of how college may be. Something that would make me choose a different school if I could do it all over again is the lack of non sports related interest groups or clubs.', "The teachers at my school try their best to provide students with the knowledge and experience they need to thrive later in life, but with little funding there isn't much they can do despite their best intentions. Most of my classes, with teachers trying to make us think, even during the process of learning new concepts.The teachers are also very knowledgeable on their respective topics and appear to be genuinely interested in students. Many of the courses however, feel very introductory and lack depth, this may not be the teachers fault, it could also be due to the lack of passion for learning in the majority of students. Teachers relate complicated topics to simpler ones and their grading styles focus in on effort rather than only the end achievements.", 'Nothing much really happens in this school, barely any bullying, health is a subject in the school and is also an event (health fair), and the safety and security is the reason why nothing happens there. In my opinion, a student would be more afraid of the consequences if and when their actions go against the policies and safety of the place.', "The teachers in U.H.H.S are really easy to interact and get close to, they're not cheesy but they're friendly and relate to the students as much as they can, all while creating a versatile and engaging learning environment inside the classrooms. If any of the teachers are having a bad day, you would definitely know, and during my time in the high school they were great educators. Some of them were even friends that I can go to and speak with as well, a couple of my friends and I even had fun while doing some work since we were free to be ourselves. Some teachers do the same as well and actually give life lessons along the way for us to know about college and after graduation.", 'This school provided me with a lot of different experinces.', 'Great teachers that really care about their students.', 'We have a medical center in my school that is connected to montefiore hospital. You have no.need to feel afraid while at University Heights.', "At my school we go by a first name basis so we have a better connection with our teachers. Also there are some teachers who are more one on one. And then there are teachers who like to do group work. Since we are a small school everyone knows everyone even if you never had that teachers class. They don't let us fall through the cracks they help create a plan with us so we stay on track. The teachers at University Heights High School are more than teachers there mentors and family."]
column8: ["The health and safety policies at this school are overall great. This school cares about the safety of students and make sure everyone's in the right place. The officers walk around the school and check if everything's safe. I have so far not seen any bullying that have occurred in my school. We have cameras and so everything's seen around hallways and stairways.", "As I have been participating actively in sports, clubs, academic programs, and doing community service at my school, I have gained so many perspectives. Every teachers and coach believes that school must come first before any extracurricular activities. Furthermore, teachers strongly encourage their students to be a part of programs as they too can not only assist in advancing in academics, but as well will help with college applications and any work. Each teacher's passion for taking care of every students and making sure they feel loved and welcomed in this school is what makes this school unique. The fact that students call faculties with their first name, it strengthens our social engagement and gives that sense of trust. I would choose this school all over again because it has opportunities from AP classes, honors program, college classes, and a variety of extracurricular offered.", 'The teachers at this school are very passionate. They care about the students and believe that anyone can go further in life. Many teachers make sure every students understand the lesson, and they make sure our research are right.', "For some classes the work load isn't a lot. For example art class the work isn't much unlike a class like English or math. We have different levels of subjects. For math there is trigonometry, algebra, pre-calculus, and calculus. For English there is American Literature, world literature, philosophy, senior seminar. A popular class would be tinkering class because students are hands on creating new inventions.", "We have tennis, flag football, volleyball, basketball, soccer, track, baseball and softball. There's clubs like Aiming High that prepares you for job interviews and community service. Also teen battle chef that teaches the student how to live a healthy lifestyle and healthy meals to prepare. We have student government and yearbook committee. Some of the teachers are the coaches so they have an understanding to that student. The most fun activity in school would be talent show because students get to show off their talents to the whole school.", "It wasn't the first school I applied for, but I'm grateful of the experience I had at this school. The professor actually cares about their students and they actually go out there way to wanting to help you out. I definitely recommend the school for students who are academically driven and wants to go to College, this school will help you get there.", "University Heights High School is a good school. The teachers won't let you fail or see you struggle they will help you every step of the way. The staff is very friendly and kind. The food is nasty and I wish there was lockers to keep my books instead of carrying them to every class. Also if there was more elevators that would be great. However the school is a good place to go. I would definitely apply to this school again if I could.", 'The teachers are the best and care about the well being of their students. They are also very motivated to help you in achieving  your dreams and getting you ready for college. University Heights High School is a school that feels like a college and I would recommend it to anyone looking  to ensure a successful future.', 'This is a college ready school, which means I have learned a lot about college. University heights high school has offered various programs to me that will help me with my college process. They also expect you to be on top of your game for college. They offer a lot of help, such as parent and student meetings, town hall meetings etc. The offer summer assignments for 12th graders based on college stuff. The teachers and staff push you to graduate high school and get prepared for college.', "Lots of trips and events are organized for students if they can't follow rules then privileges can be taken away.", 'Over 5 sports are offered both JV and Varsity and both girl and boy teams available.', 'Always have tutoring days for those who need the extra help.', 'There is always something to do.', 'The school is great and it was my number one choice', 'The gym teacher enjoys making up activities for us to do. These activities actually does get us involve.', 'The teachers are like our parents, they all want the best for us', 'The extracurriculars are great it gives studenta the opportunity to join new things and make new friends. I remember when I was a freshmen I did not know anyone, but I wanted to join a program and I ended up joining the girls basketball team and I ended making great friends and we all get to joke around and have fun.', 'The security guards are not up to par most of the time, they seem tough, but really are not.', 'I love the environment and i LOVE THE TEACHERS.They really motivate you and the school has a lot of programs that they offer you and they want you excel .', 'I seen a rat and a cockroach. I do not blame the school though.']

column2: ['This school makes me wonder sometimesDoes this school actually try or do they say there doing something and never do it,some teachers really do care and so do some guidance counselors,but the rest treat the kids like garbage', "I look forward to attending this school everyday, Freeport High School known as the Red Devils, has definitely had a positive impact in my life and I've had the best high school experience here. The teachers and counselors are amazing and very helpful. The environment of this school is really good as well; It's like everyone is one big family. School Spirit all the time! Everyone that attends FHS most likely has at least one item of clothing that says Freeport on it.  We all have Freeport Pride and we show it. The sports here are also extremely good such as the DI Varsity Football Players and Varsity Cheerleaders. The music and theater programs at Freeport High School are very talented; the performances at the seasonal concerts are phenomenal. Over the years I've met so many different people and teachers who have had a big impact in my life. Freeport High School is unique and unforgettable to me and I am so fortunate to have attended this High School. Once a devil always a devil.", 'I love being on the Honor Roll at Freeport High school and all the teachers. I played Softball as a Catcher for the team', "Freeport High School allowed me as a student to challenge myself and broaden my horizons when it came to exploring subjects I'd never be interested in.", 'I would like to see favoritism within teachers stop as well as their care level raised. This is not to speak for all the teachers but too many of them only care about their paycheck and nothing more. Some are very unprofessional and bias and make their opinion be known when it is unnecessary and inappropriate.', 'my experience was great in words I cant describeit prepares you for college so wellthere is no bullying or fights what so everI honestly recommend it', 'A good safe place for all of me and my classmates , no bullying . I love it , made so many great friends and great memories, my teachers cared about me and I felt like I was important', 'Freeport is a very diverse high school, with good courses to take, as well as a fantastic wide selection of extracurricular activities to join in on. Freeport is the place where I’ve grown the most as a person overall. There’s a lot to love about Freeport.', "Freeport high school was like your average high school in a town where the economy was not the very best. Although we did not have the money to afford new books and technology the teachers, at least the ones I've had, did everything possible to teach you with the best of their ability with the little resource we had. I've heard stories about teachers not doing their best or working to their best abilities but i also feel like you will encounter people like that in every field or situation you find yourself after high school, at work and college. One thing i learned regarding that issue is that , the inabilities of others not loving or  being the best that they could be should never discourage me from being the best that i could one day be.", "I always loved Freeport high school. I have good friends,  played sports, and was in clubs. I was in Odessy of the Mind, I played lacrosse thorughout my years in high school. Being a part of a team in this school is like having a second family. My school won the LIC for Football twice while I was there and the spirit we have is amazing.  I'll never forget my time in Freeport and I will always remember all the memories I made.", 'I love my high school. Being surrounded by many different people allows me to connect to various cultures, religions, and traditions. I enjoy the diverse amounts of opportunities my school offers in programs. Every thing my school does, is to improve the experience of students and faculty members.', 'I think Freeport High School is a pretty good school. It is culturally diverse, very educationally motivated, has very nice & educated facility and, provides productive and safe environment for us to learn. Of course there’s some things that could be improved but, doesn’t every school? But all in all, I’ve enjoyed my time at FHS and wouldn’t have wished to be anywhere else.', "Personally, I don't find any wrong with the school. I believe they have helped me achieve a lot for a sophomore.", 'I learnt a lot at Freeport High School, made a lot of friends and created unforgivable memories! It is a great place to learn and try new things!', "Freeport High School isn't like other schools, Freeport cares about there kids educations and they take education very seriously. I want to be a doctor as my career and freeport has helped me by sending me to Boces and helping me take more classes with relating to my career and there teachers really do care!!", 'I loved growing up in Freeport. The schools are very big on the arts, so the music program as well as the arts classes were spectacular. The school district really cares to see all students succeed. There are many sports, everyone loves coming to the high school football games. It’s a very family oriented district. The academics could be a little better, however I have heard that things Khaleel changed since I’ve graduated. Freeport is very diverse, which is what I loved most.', "Overall, high school did it's job; it made me grow up and show me how real life works and helped me figure out who I am and what my values are. The thing I liked most about Freeport high school is the diversity; it's almost like being in the city. Everyone is a different person and character. Something about Freeport that I would change is probably the parking system. there isnt enough space for teachers and students who drive. But over all, my experience at Freeport High School was an unforgettable one.", 'My experience at this high school was fun and exciting and has taught me many lessons. Something about this high school that I will always love is the diversity and the community of the students. It is like going to a city and seeing so many different kinds of people and characters; everyone is unique. If I were to change something about the school, it would be more life skills classes and making them mandatory for students. My overall experience at Freeport High School is definitely unforgettable.', 'I would change the privileges and let the school be an open campus for everyone not just seniors. I would also like if school started a little later. But I do love the diversity and teachers diversity.', 'It was alright. It has a bunch of Advanced Placement courses which helped lessen my load in college.']
